nothinge dewtie magiſtrates whiche abyde godes cruell anſwere word ought thus puniſhed lantzgraue replied proued scripture howe god hath commaunded magiſtrate honoured obeyed reproued lantzgraue howe hath forbidden ſedition lawfull anye chriſtian reuenge owne wronge wherunto aunſwered nothing beynge examined vpon racke cried oute paine duke ſaid vnto thou art nowe muncer payne remembre againe loſſe ſo many men beyng wickedly abuſed thys day haue bene diſtroied greate laughter ſaide would haue ſo vnreaſonable laughter muncer afterwardes led helderunge towne coūtie māſſeldes vpon pymebanke appeached many companion confederats conſpiracie beheaded mulhuſe amonges others phifer mentioned ſhould executed hable receite belefe henry duke brūſwicke ſaide ſhoulde die acknowledged houre death repenteth offence error beynge inuironed ſoldiours exhorted prince would ſhewe mercy poore men reade ouer diligently bokes scripture written kynges ſouer ſpokē thus ſword neck exāple head ſet vp pole middes feldes time baniſhed saxonie ſaide wanderyng place place laſt reported purpoſed come mulhuſe luther hearing thereof wrote letter senate admoniſhyng caſe receiue muncer ſedicious parſon imagined nothing murther miſchiefe ſignifiyng thinges attempted alſtet place moreouer doctrine fonde pernicious whereof wylled beware ſhortly would craft knowen frendly wordes ſaide contempted fell miſery ſhold without blame ſo diligently warned ſhould repente late likewiſe anye tumolt germany yet thynges lyke come ſuche paſſe luther ſet forth boke wherein warned men abſtayne lut diſwadeth thē ſedition ſedition declaryng ſame way refourme tyrrany clergie ſhall fall confounded force men ſpirite god commyng sauior chriſt appere daniell ſainct paule grounde hys ii theſſ ii opinion right well aſſured ſeke redres thinge force armes ſhall trauaile vayne yet ſo muche ſome great tumult daunger hāgeth ouer cleargie thing requireth counſell wyll franckly declare opinion fyrſt magiſtrates dewtie foreſee people dewtie good magiſtrate ſuſteine hinderaunce fault others trew religion defaced falſe doctrine theyr propre office vſe theyr power giuen glory god welth people muche contrary let one ſome alſo mainteine falſe doctrine ſhall eſcape vnpuniſhed neuer purpoſe papiſtes ſhould oppreſſed wt magiſtrate ſhold deale wyth papiſtes force armes ciuill maieſtrate ſhoulde compell theyr dewtie herin extende theyr right aucthoritie neyther theyr lenitie yet diſſimulation ſhould confyrme boldenes lewde doynges touchyng cō mon people muſte earneſtly admoniſhed ſtyrre except magiſtrate commaunde way labore al together vayne god wil auenge thing ſome greuous puniſhment wheras magiſtrates worke ſo ſlowely herin beare ſuffer ſo many vnworthy thing god wrath ſlowe yet ſore moued ſo manifeſt iniuries mockery cleargie done throughe god permiſſion alone myghte auenge matter powre indignation vpon caſe matter ſhould come tumult god could content ſo light puniſhment yet maner procedyng onely diſcommendable alſo vnprofitable ſeditiō reaſon moſt part chaunceth thinnocent parſons plaged ſoner others moreouer man thauthors rebellion wythout excuſe ſtirreth vp rebellion yt excuſed matter neuer ſo iuſte great cōmotiō people good wt bad honeſt wicked neceſſitie muſt periſhe together wherfore let haue eye magiſtrate ſo long ſtyrreth let priuate attempt ſedition againſt cōmaundement god cōmaundeth controuerſies priuate men ſhouldebe lawfully decided iudge conſyderinge yt rebellion nothyng thing rebellion el priuate reuengement man nede doubt ye god diſaloweth abhorreth ſame ſedition like coine reiſed deuill hym ſelfe enemye mankynde abyde lyght treweth ſtyrreth vp tumultes men profeſſe goſpell might bringe cōtēpt hatred trew doctrine hath bene god benefite theſe former yeres reſtored though proceded god ſemeth geue occaſion ſo many euils aduerſaries goſpell already bragge theyr iudgementes cō temned vtterly diſpiſeth herin hathe neuer written ſpoken thing might kindle ſedition vnto ſuch queſtion obiect ſhall howe longe ſhall ſuffer theyr enormity ſeyng magiſtrate winketh therat wicked dominion ſhaken anſwer yt ought folow order fyrſt let acknowledge theyr faultes wherwith god beyng offēded hath ſuffered tyrrany clergie continew ſo long ſtretche ſo farre doeth wicked cruell gouernement reward offence wyll deliuered oughte fyrſte reconcile ſelues vnto god thamendement life wt earneſt prayer deſyre god aide againſt popiſh knigdome example beſt way ouer threw pope authoritie king dauid praied god many time breake ye power prid wicked finally doctrine goſpel preached ſet forth iuggelinges papiſtes made manifeſt world theyr error beyng detected trueth knowē men may eſteme lightly clerely contemne ſo euer ſhall procede redieſt way ouerthrow theyr authoritie ſtrength forſe armes ye preuaile nothinge commonly chaunceth throughe warre made ſtronger caſe cōpare chriſt wt pope goſpel wt doctrine ſhall openly appere difference betwixt lighte ſunne mere darkenes howe great benefite god lu yt word thā cold haue bene force armes way vnto knowledge made open al lettes takē away thā ſlideth faleth downe force eſtimation thing may appere example hath afflicted popiſhe kingdome force armes could haue done therfore rebellion wiſhed preachyng goſpell raiſed vp chriſte ſelfe mightie ſharpe ynough ouerthrow papiſtrie hereupon let fixe theyr eye mindes alſo loke meane furthermore owne matter wherin ſo muche occupied ſo great weight exceadeth ſtrength capacitie mās witte loked yt matter brought ſo farre forth therfore putteth doubt hath laide foundation worke hath gyuen increaſe ſame bringe alſo concluſion ende maugre head aduerſaries ſaieth howe deuill knew longe great alteration went let certein appereth prophecy briget others men prophecied theſe tymes intent might driue men farre holſome doctrine ſeeth attempte vaine ſeeketh newe waye ſtyrreth vp men rebellion let ſhould reuolting biſhoppes kyngdome yet ſhall faile purpoſe preachinge pure doctrine kingdome ſhall confounded true doctrine muſt ſtyll perſeuer declaring howe men decree helpe nothinge vnto ſaluation moreouer howe men muſt warned ſuffre ſelues bounden monkiſh vowes ſuche intangled already forſake ſame furthermore giue money vaine fooliſh vſes church taper belle tabels ueſſels armes workes ornamentes ſuche like thinges lyfe chriſtian conſiſteth theſe thinges faith charitie thus people taught doubt aucthoritie kyngdome biſhoppe adherentes fal fewe yeares caſe doctrine taught therrours plucked oute men myndes papiſtrie ſhal continew though neuer ſo many conſpiracies made againſt let nowe conſyder pōder litel time brought paſſe doctrine aduerſaries teſtifie wanted wonted commodity wherby may eaſely perceiued would haue come therof caſe doctrine might haue free courſe two yeres longer wherfore deuill ſmelleth matter doeth nowe beſtyrre goeth let enterpriſe ſedition practiſe deuill muſt worcke wiſely commēde benefite god high prayſes hath ſet vp light knowledge eies iuggling papiſtes bewraied theyr ignoraunce briberie tyrrany theyr fylthynes wher haue ſo longe diſceaued world nowe diſcloſed whiche heretofore haue bene feared men nowe broughte exigente nowe appeare theyr likenes beholden naked eies men vncleanes haue hid hertofore popiſhe kingdō maie long indure nowe driuen force armes ſtate ſhould longe endure chaunce part theyr power remaine doctrine ghoſpell ſhall infringe ſhall aboliſhed commyng chriſt muſt therfore applye manfully procede ſame courſe yet muſte done order ſome farre frame furniſhed learnyng haue heard two three sermōs take muche vpon callyng ſelues lutherianes reproue bitterly ſome yet knowe nothing wherin much offende ſo ought requireth man vſurpe hys name rather indeuour ſeing profeſſe name chriſt may rightly chalenge ourſelues may ſurnamed chriſtians teacheth hath nede wel ware preacher ought circumſpect dealeth ſome obſtinate froward wyl contemne ſounde doctrine alſo bring others errour ſuch muſt quite eſchew precept chriſt caſt pearels hogges wheras cōtented eyther theyr ignoraunce obſtinacie ſeke ſeduce others bringe frō crew doctrine thā muſt ſharpely withſtande theyr owne ſakes ſame multitude might leaſt ſaued agayne therebe others obſtynate ſymple without knowledge muſt deale gently haſtely raſhely ſhewyng order wherein ſaluation men conſiſſeth accordyng theyr ſmalle capacitie applye theyr ſpeache tyll lytle lytle increaſe confyrmed laſt boke ſhewed bowres yt vp sweuelande muncer came forth felde theſe people handled matter attempraunce begynning declaringe article written thinges would haue reformed theyr prince magiſtrates caſe abuſed thing would ſtyfe wilfull promiſed folowe better coū ſell theyr requeſtes theſe fyrſt might chuſe ſuche miniſters ſhould preache theyr demaundes god worde ſincerely without mixture men tradition secondarely herafter would pay tithe corne onely ſame diſtributed diſcretion good men partly miniſters church partly vpon pore partly aboute commen affaire thyrdly haue bene hitherto vnworthelye kept bondes conſydering howe made free bloude chriſt refuſe haue magiſtrate knowyng ordeyned god wyll obey honeſt thinges abyde longer bounde vnleſſe ſhewed reaſonable teſtimonies scripture againe ſtandeth equitie forbidden huntinge haukyng fiſhyng prohibited hunte hauke fiſhe many place may ſuffered chaſe wilde beaſtes corne seynge beginnyng world god hath gyuen man right rule ouer kinde beaſtes deſyre ſome equalitie herein maye rather commoditie multitude fewe mighte conſydered moreouer wodes men handes great diſcommoditie people wherfore theyr minde haue ſuche common fewel alſo building priuate man inheritāce woddes frendly vſed owner furthermore ſore burthened diuerſe way dayly wherfore deſyre prince moderate ſame rule goſpell charge time paſt hath bene accuſtomed would alſo ſuch haue good landes poſſeſſions benefite graunte prince magiſtrates charged couenaunted beginninge lykewiſe ſome pay rent yerely theyr fermes worth wherfore reaſon lordes remit ſome part therof intente ye tyll grounde may reape ſome fruite trauaile liue extreme pouertie brieflye paimentes money woulde require equitie dayly diuiſed new lawes meanes get money amendement oftentimes thing hādled fauour diſpleaſure ſome one pertialtie wherfore require affection ſet part thing vſed hence forth maner firſt preſcribed finally ſome haue taken lā de meddowes common redreſſe vnles agreed withall laſt al wheras goodmā houſe departeth wife child wont paye ſome whiche becauſe vnreaſonable would magiſtrates ſhoulde vtterly take away unto theſe article beyng publiſhed anſwereth luter vnto lut anſwer bowres referred matter framing ſtile vnto thē trew ſayeth graunt ſuche prince admit preaching goſpell oppreſſe people diuerſlye worthy god ſhould thruſt gouernement haue none excuſe albeit trew yet muſt take heede bring hither pure vnſpotted conſcience el ſhall ſuffer loſſe bothe body ſoule neyther ought conſyder power howe much aduerſaries blamed howe iuſt quarel defende take diligent hede therfore beleue preachinges men sathan hathe tyme vnder pretence goſpell ſtyred vp many ſediciouſe bloudy doctours wyll counſell ryghtly truely bō den ſhall parte geue eare mynde heare nether ſhal moue one whitte though many ſhal reporte euyll rayle vppon ſhall ſuffice leſt wyſe may delyuer ſome goddes vengeaunce reſt paſſe contempne ſo ſhall feare purpoſe take bours vſe godlye title ſelues holy name call ſelue chriſtian felloweſhyp bragge wyll followe thinges lawe preſcribed god know certenly name god may taken vayne vntrewlye god threateneth punyſhemente gen 7 gene 19 whiche remayneth dewe vnto alſo handle buſines ryghtly drowned whole worlde flud ſwallowed vp sodome fyrie ſhoure ſame eaſely deſtroye alſo power ſomeuer haue proued eaſely take name god doinges falſely wherfore harde coniecture ende diſceaueth ſayed ſhoulde dye ſworde math 26 whiche toke vnto ſelues ſworde boldnes vſurped aucthritie correctyng others paule withſtanding commaundeth men generally rom 13 tobey magiſtrate reuerence feare wyl aunſwere vnto whiche ſeme followe preſcript god lawe yet laye holde ſworde reſiſte magiſtrate whome god hathe ordeyned take name god vayne wyll ſaye magiſtrate ſuche vntollerable take v doctrine goſpell thinges oppreſſe v vnreaſonably admitte ſo yet maye therfore ſtyre vp commotion ſeditions euery man pacte puniſhe malefactours appertayneth vnto whome geuen right power ſworde scripture planely teacheth againe onely lawes wrytten alſo lawe nature printed mennes myndes ſheweth man ought iudge owne cauſe faulty blinded loue oure ſelues neither denied tumult ſedition priuate reuengement take vpō determination matter iniuries thinke done vnto ſeke reuēge aucthoriti ſame againſt god lawe lawe nature finally againſt equitie iuſtice ſeing ſo meanes able defend fact haue commaundemēt god concerning doinges ſame neceſſitie muſt declared ſome notable myracle taketh place chriſte ſpake ſee manifeſtly rebuked others conſider wyekednes owne cauſe magiſtrate doeth naught doe muche worſe whiche blind cauſe contempnyng god commaundement doe entre man iuriſdiction whiche leaue vnto magiſtrate nothing remayneth whan haue taken waye power authoritie hygher power take goodes poſſeſſions doe wrong take away iuriſdiction whiche thynge conſiſteth ſtate magiſtrate wherin cō ſiſteth ſtate body goodes nowe whether wicked taketh ſome parte goodes ſpareth lyfe taketh lyfe goodes alſo waye well ſayde ſhalbe founde wicked deſyre lyfe goodes wyll ſaye let hym beleue lyſt wyl ſo taketh awaye chiefeſt thyng wyll afrayde take reſt alſo whiche dependeth vpon ſame let ſaye let enioye goodes lyfe ſafitie whiche haue done already exceadeth meaſure whan takyng authoritie wyll lordes ruler ſelues waye youre ſelues beſeche caſe enterpryſe magiſtrate neceſſary ſeune worlde ſhould commended take place ſhould place iudgement magiſtrate eche man myght vſe thought good wold followe therof robbyng murtherynge one ſo ſone one ſhall thynke hym ſelfe haue receyued wrong another wyll couet reuenge hym ſelfe pleaſure whiche amyſſe ſuffered man muche leſſe ſhould permytted vnlawfull aſſemblye maye ſuffered alſo borne others ſay aſſemblye cauſe ſhould requyre euery man woulde pryuatlye auenge owne cauſe tell woulde doe doubtleſſe ſhould conſtrayned ſtand publique iudgement appoynted thyng doth excuſe contempne lawes iudgementes reiecte magiſtrate god hym ſelfe hath appoynted ouer lawe wherof ſpeake nowe impryuted men harte law nature aloweth magiſtrate obſerued alſo moſte barbarous people el ſhould ther wonderfull confuſion thynges whiche lawe beit obſerue neuer ſo dilygently yet ſhoulde nothynge better turkes ſuche lyke people knowe religion ruled lawe magiſtrates maketh man good chriſtian neceſſitie byndeth maugre heades wherfore ſeing breake lawe whiche ingryft mynde common men ye great deale worſe heathen people farre vnworthy name chriſtians whiche tytle becauſe doe vſurpe ſelues doe iniury goddes name beynge worthy deede called turkes breakyng lawe nature howe ſhall ſtande face chriſte tyme ſhal iudge v al ſee therfore agayne agayne maner men preacher feare leſt ſome blouddy butcher crept amonges whiche perſwade sermon intēt may ayde beare rule reigne carcleſſe ſaluation god cōmaundeth vengeaunce lefte vnto ſcripture teacheth v obeye magiſtrate though frowarde ought therfore obedient otherwyſe ſhall reyſe cōmotion dede ſame ſhall lyght owne neckes god wil permytte youre lycencious outrage vnpunyſhed whyleſt ſeke lybertie ſhall procure ſelfe loſſe lyfe goodes ſoule alſo wrath god kyndled agaynſt deuyll ennemye almens ſaluations hath ſent felloweſhyp falſe teacher followyng therfore counſell beware amende tyme nowe wyll ſpeake chriſtian lawe lawe goſpell chriſtiā lawe muche chalenge ſelues ſurname mete ſhold tryed knowen lawe behalf firſt chriſt cōmaundeth v reſiſt harme ſtryken one cheke offer alſo hym taketh awaye coote byddeth delyuer alſo cloke commaundeth v praye doe enemyes math 5 ſame ſenſe alſo many place scripture nowe conſyder howe enterpryſe agreeth chriſtes commaundement ſee howe farre youre doctours haue lead aſtraye parte chriſtians ſuffer beare croſſe reſyſte reuenge ſtryke ſworde lyke thyng appeareth profeſſion chriſtian man exceadynge harde verye chriſtē profeſſion harde fewe doe perfourme deede whiche bounden make thyng playne ſhal bring example ſame lawe peter defende lorde maiſter ſtroke byſhoppes ſeruaunt iuſte cauſe ſeynge dyd onlye ſeke lyfe chriſte take waye alſo diſſciples doctryne goſpell wherin conſiſted ſaluation ſuche lyke cruell iniury hath yet touched ſayde chriſte commaunded peter ceaſe frō defence geuing ſore ſentence againſt ſtryke ſworde ſaye whiche concempning magiſtrate auenge owne cauſe dyd nayled croſſe prohibyted execute office committed vnto hym god father uerely toke nature veritie paciently committyng whole matter god father vnto whome maketh interceſſion perſecutors theſe ſteppes muſt folowed el muſt leaue laye aſyde goodlye name tytle chriſtianytie caſe woulde followe example chriſt power god would appeare moſte vnworthie death onlye ſonne ſet forth goſpel farre nere againſt wyll aduerſaries ſo would vndoubtedly loke vpon alſo ſend holſome doctrine aboundantly conſydering matter attempted force armes ſhall neyther obtayne purpoſe eſcape daye battell wyl ſpeake ſūwhat myſelf alſo whole worlde againſt force myght yet greater theyr violence better ſucceſſe doctryne ſo vſed force ſtyred vp commotion deſyrous vengeaunce obeyed ciuyle magiſtrate reuerēce wrote commendation ſet hym forth muche lay whiche pryncipall committyng cauſe goddes handes reſted wholy protection thus haue bene preſerued vnto daye though byſhop rome al reſte ſtampe ſtare haue decayed kyngdome force armes could haue done doctryne ſpread ouer ſondrye nation ruſhe forth headlong vnaduiſedly whyleſt thynke thynge conſyder howe muche hynder ſame wherfore quarell muſt ſet aparte name tytle chriſtiās though neuer ſo iuſte yet ſo muche chriſten man maye fyght reſiſte iniury maye wyſe graunte tytle ſurname yet ſpeake defende pourge magiſtrates confeſſe doe many thynges vniuſtly notwithſtandyng doynges farre profeſſion chriſtianitie ſo muche caſe wyll obſtinatly kepe ſtyll name colour ſhaddowe euell cauſe proteſt ennemie becauſe vnder pretence goſpel ye doe clean contrary chriſtes doctrine therfor wyll pray vnto god wyll mercyfully loke vpon ſubuerte enterpryſe perceyne euydently deuill goeth aſmuche coulde hytherto oppreſſe byſhop rome deſtroye bloudy preacher wherfore wyll praye notwithſtandyng craftes deuill oppreſſe goſpel leuer would ſo demeane youre ſelues ſhould nede make prayer againſt al ſynner yet hauing ſo iuſt cauſe pray doubt praier ſhalbe heard god wyll haue name ſanctified ſo hath commaunded alſo ſhould praye wherfore exhorte beſeche deſpiſe prayer others leſt ye fele vtter vndoing bryng paſſe haue prayer ſuche lyke faythe affiaunce scripture gylty conſcience doe declare proceadynges prophane vngodly praye howe many haue prayed vnto god cauſe ſuppoſe one put whole truſte affiaunce great armie aſſure ſelfe muche ſo doe youre atattemptes laſt wyll tourne owne deſtruction nowe concernyng demaundes eaſely anſwered aunſwere demaundes bower whiche though grounded vpon equitie agreable lawe nature yet touchyng theyr pryncipall parte ſtande vpryghte becauſe wyll extorte vyolence hygher power whyche agaynſt lawe equitie agayne deuyſed good man place scripture whiche alledgeth incenſe brynge daunger reciteth wholy truly loke better vpon make nothing againſt al brauery mā may kept goſpell goſpell taken reſtrained one place may repare wher frely preached place maye kepte force muſt forſake flee another chriſte hym ſelfe hathe taught v firſte demaunde ordeynyng miniſters amyſſe ſo done dewe order landes poſſeſſions fynde myniſter geuen magiſtrates lawefull people gyue whome lyſt firſt muſte magiſtrate howe miniſters ſhoulde ordayned required place one whiche refuſe ſhal people chuſe one maintaine charge magiſtrate wil ſuffer let miniſter choſen people flee ſo lyſt done otherwyſe wt wrong miſchief tenthes moſt vnreaſonable tithe muſt payde thing thā take away al rule power muſt liberal man nowe ye vſe matter al authoritie hādes wherby eaſely perceiued intent purpoſe wold haue chriſtianitie taketh away bōdage men free abrahā holy mē bondman reade paul ſhall inſtructe touchynge bondemen wherfore requeſt full violence robberye ſtriueth goſpell seruaunt may neuertheleſſe deuoute vſe bondage let chriſten libertie chriſtian lybertie well ſycke kepte pryſon ſhoote al marke haue equalle one ſtate condition whiche fonde abſurde ciuile lyfe gouernment publyque wealth endure vnleſſe difference perſones theremaye ſome free ſome bounde ſome rule ſome obeye reſt concerning wylde beates wooddes water paſtures paymentes money ſuche lyke leaue diſputed lawyer touche dutie whiche inſtructe myndes men godlyneſſe nowe ye men brother mynde counſell luters office whiche deſyred knowe nowe ſhall partes muche ſaye ye wyll obeye teſtimonies scrypture hearken vnto ſame ſo ſoone ſhall comme handes make outcrye though flattered magiſtrates taught ryghtly ponder whole matter waye reaſons dylygentlye certenly cauſe owne aboue althinges ware thoſe preacher pricke forwarde knowe ſorte men ryght well leade head longe daungers myght get preferment ryches peryll cauſe luther doeth ſo muche caſte tethe falſe falſe title bower tytle bragged lettres wrote prouoke allure others felloweſhyppe made boaſte toke armure vppon god commaundement certen loue zeale common wealth intent doctrine goſpell myght ſet forth augmented mayntayned truthe equitie honeſt lyuyng myght reingne floryſhe myght ſo prouyde thē hereafter oppreſſed violence whan thei thus fewe woordes declared cauſe enterpryſe woulde commaunde neighbour put armure come vnto immediatly helpe would threaten come vpon withall power tyme luter thus aunſwered commotioners admonyſhyng alſo prince nobilitie wrytynge ſayeth vnto trouble buſynes daye altogether longe chieflye beareth tytle churche whiche ceaſe yet daye preachynge perſecute doctrine goſpel conſcience ſecondarely prynces cyuyl magiſtrates beyng wholly addicted exacte gather vp money care meanes ſo poore people longer hable beare burthen al mainteyne ryot pryde voluptuouſnes wherfore hangeth aſſuredly wounderfull daunger ouer ſworde dependynge ouer neckes twhyne threde yet meane tyme ſo careleſſe though man hable diſplace ſecuritie wyll doubtles hurte one daye god powreth ſome tyme indignation vpon prynces read pſalmes haue oftentymes admonyſhed beware therof warning wyll ſerue wherfore god whrath wil fall upō head pſal 107 vnleſſe amende lyues ſignes wounders ſeene place doe pretende good maye eaſely coniecture god anger boyleth againſt v permitteth falſe doctours ſo muche eſtemed amongſt v intent beinge lead errours darkenes myght plaged worthely moreouer rebellion people whiche wyll vtterlly deſtroye germany vnleſſe god moued wt prayer ſend ſome remedy gouernment daye ſuche ſorte men neyther wyl nother ought dede ſuffer longer muſt cleane altered gyue place vnto goddes worde people bryng paſſe tyme others ſhal ſuccede albeit kyl vp theſe yet god wil reiſe new worketh warreth againſt ſeketh plage wickednes dyuers haue made boaſte would ſpende al goodes lādes haue vpon condicion luther doctrine myght cleane taken away thing brought effect god forbydde ſhould ieſte theſe weyghty matter iewes tymes paſte ſayde kyng laſt ſtate common wealth came vnto paſſe want kyng euer many content former faultes woorke newe iniury goſpell affirmyng hurly burlye fruicte ſpryngeth doctrine well go rayle ſtyll hardely wyll knowe doctrine vnderſtand voyce goſpell goſpel ſclaſidered rebelliō whiche ſigne obſtinate malicious minde haue euer beginnyng taught quietly haue abhorred ſedicion haue earneſtly exhorteth people obediēt hygher power nay rather haue admonyſhed thē beare tyranny wicked gouernment hereof ſelues beare witnes therfore hath ſedition proceaded thoſe raſers tumultes bloudy prophetes leſſe ennemies haue brought miſchief ſeducing people haue ben thre yeares man hath reſiſted ſo muche alone god hath ſynne permitted ſathā thoſe bluddy prophet ſtyrre vp rage fury people againſt ſhall lye let appeaſe ſtorme ſay pray faulte layde goſpell whan doctrine whiche profeſſe hath borne crueltie hitherto alſo prayed vnto god hath commended authoritie ſtate people maynteined ſame high commendacion coueted nowe auenge iniuries haue done myght laughe ſlyue loker cruel tragedy aſſiſt furious people common ſaiyng increaſe flamme oyle ſharpe nayle ſore wherfore noble prince require earneſtly deſpyſe myne admonition ſet lyght ſame ſediton feare left ſhoulde able deſtroye would ſhould dreade ire god ſhould fearfull vnto intede plage worthely whiche thynge feare ſhall eſcape daunger although power ennemies neuer ſo ſmall therfore place yet remayne counſell pray gyue place vnto fury appeaſe matter wittely ſo much end vncerten part wyſe man god wyll vnknowen ſhall mete firſte trie alwayes take hede ſuch flamme kyndled ſhall ſet germany fyre certainly offence wherewith haue ſtyrred god wrath agaiſt v ſo manifeſt ought afrayde euery lyttle ſturre muche whan ſo great number ennemies aſſembled offer battell lenytie gentlenes tourne loſſe ſhould yet wyll reſtore ſame aduauntage go force ſhal peraduenture great haſarde may preuayle meanes wyll venter ſo great daunger requeſtes twelue wherof ſome ſo agreable reaſon equitie maye haue good cauſe aſhamed demaūde firſt miniſter churche may ordeyned lawfully ſuche preache god worde albeit haue reſpect herein owne priuate commoditie aſmuche would pay hym ſtipende men tythes yet againſt reaſon ſhold denied lawefull magiſtrate keepe people doctrine goſpell others concerne ſeruices droictes ſuch lyke thinges grounded alſo vpon reaſon parte dutie magiſt magiſtrate vexe orpille people rather maynteine preſerue wealth ſubſtaunce ende pillage howe ſhould continue certainly ye ought leaue exaction refraine prodigalitie riot poore maye haue ſome thyng releue great myſery thus admonyſhed eyther parte ſeuerally wryteth epiſtle common ſo muche eyther partie maynteyneth euyll quarel aduyſeth laye downe weapon put arbitrement declaryng vnto magiſtrates howe cruell euer howe bloudy ende tyrauntes hath ben agayne people vnfortunate myſerable hath bene ſucceſſe wyndyng vp ende tyranny commotioners whiche haue taken armure ſtanden defence hyghe power one thynge lamenteth exceadyng ſeing warre eyther ſyde euyll conſcience prince eſtablyſhe tyranny others ſediciouſly accomplyſhe wycked deſyre ſhould loſe owne ſoules ſo many peryſhe warre bewaileth ſtate germany ciuile warre ſhould vtterly deſtroyed begyn warre eaſy matter ſo wel ende ſame wolde admonyſheth therfore abſteyne leaue poſte ritie ſtate common wealth ſo full trouble bloudſhed force armes nothing done continewe amendemēt lyfe much exhorteth committe whole matter hearyng determening certayn good mē choſen ſame purpoſe prince would remitte ſomewhat ryght people againe ſhould followe good coūſell leaue ſome demaundes aduiſe counſell whiche vnleſſe woulde folowe would gyue lokyng eyther ſyde vnlawfull ſeyng people moue warre agaynſt prynces oppreſſours wealth ryches prince agayne people theues murtherers alſo iniury vnto name chriſt ther obſtinate fiercenes wyll praye vnto god eyther would ſhewe ſome waye accorde el ſubuerte counſell enterpryſes howe theſe wonder feareth wrath god ſhall mitigated tyme declared ieremy wrath diſpleaſure ſhould aſwaged inſtaunt prayer moſte holy men woulde plage iewyſhe nation wherefore would wyſhe nothyng would amende ſerue god feare tremblyng daniel • ob leſt wyſe plage hangyng ouer v myghte differred aſwaged whyleſt endeuoured thus appeaſe tumulte yt franckony indiuers place marchynge forewarde ſodainly warred againſt papiſtes againſt nobilitie luther bloweth trō pet againſt boures alſo muche miſchief ſhe wed luther wrytyng exhorteth men would come deſtroye theſe wycked theues paracides lyke caſe woulde come quenche commen fyre haue moſte ſhamefully broken fayth prince taken men goodes force cloke al abomination wickednes couer chriſtianitie vyleſt moſte vnworthieſt thing imagined hath confuted reaſons reherſed byddeth prince doubte feare ſet vpon deſtroye ſeditious ther nothig worſe ſediciō rabble apertayneth chiefly dutie alſo euery pryuate mā may kylle ſeditious perſone meanes peſtilent thyng publique wealth ſedition ſo long proteſted obſtinate reformed teſtimonies scrypture coulde inſtructe better thynges durſt bolde condempne nowe ſythe thinge ſelfe declareth dyd nothyng diſſemble muſt alſo chaunge ſtyle therfore ryngeth larme admonyſheth men ſet vpon thē deſtroye ſo many wylde beaſtes booke dyd many diſcommende place earneſt lut vehement cruell aunſwereth defence therof maintaining opiniō none ought pardoned whiche cō ſtrayned others haue done thynge ſediciouſly ſauynge thoſe whiche beyng one admonyſhed content rendre yelde ſelues tolde howe emperour letter thēperors letter prince germany ſent spayne inhibite aſſemblye empyre ſhoulde haue bene laſte yeare nouembre spyres nowe hearyng trouble ſome ſtate germany great preparation turke made inuade hongary ſent letter agayne toleto appoynting counſell whole empire auſpurge begynne firſt daye october cauſes aboue aſſemble called auf mentioned chiefly ayde agaynſt great turke ſygnifyinge caſe preſent hym ſelf wyll appoint others ſupplye place whiche letter beyng wrytten xxiiij may delyuered germany tyll xiij auguſt wherfore aduyſe ferdinando others differred tyl ſaint martyns daye xj nouembre ſuche dwelt farre might prepare ſelues come dew reaſon caroloſtadius diſſenting frō luther therfore departing wittenberge mentioned kept familiaritie thoſe ſecrete teacher fayned themſelues ſee viſions haue talke god whiche cauſes duke saxony banyſhed hym countrey ſet forth bookes againſt luther fellowes callyng caroloſtadius writeth againſt lu newe flatterer romyſhe byſhop ſuche taught amyſſe concernyng maſſe confeſſion ſynnes image thinges thoſe wordes chriſt body interpreted thus ſytteth body rayleth duke exylyng hym layde blame luther whereunto luther aunſwered large defendyng opinion affirmed cauſe iuſt wherfore prince banyſhed ſedition opreſſed army commoner diſcōfited many executed dayly al place caroloſtadius beyng afrayde parte cōpyleth booke wherin pourgeth ſelfe ryght dilygentlye affirmynge caroloſtadius maketh porgatiō doe vnto hym great iniurye reporte hym one author ſeditiō writīg letter luther deſyreth hym earneſtly ſet forth ſame booke defende innocenſie vniuſtly condempned neuer come aunſwere luther wryting epiſtle diſſented much hym yet aſmuche diſtreſſe fleeth vnto hym ſucour ſayeth would diſceyue expectacion herein conſidering chiefly dewtye chriſtenman wherfore deſyreth magiſtrates others generall ſo muche vtterlye denyeth thyng layde charge refuſeth come anſwere lawful iudge ſame might graū ted whiche ſtandeth equitie iuſtice caroloſtadius ſendeth luther boke wherin proteſteth ſuche thinges wrote lordes ſupper defyne determine thing way diſputatiō ſearche truth luther admitteth excuſe warneth al men beware opinion ſo much doubtful ſelfe el thei doubt lyke caſe ſuſpende iudgement tyl ſuch tyme certenly knowē beleue therin thynges muſt beleue ought doubte wauer ſo certen rather faith ought vauer forſake opinion ſhould refuſe dye thouſand tymes thoſe dayes luther maried nunne wherby gaue occaſion aduerſaries ſpeake euyll hym ſayd playnly luther maried nūne madde became ſeruaunt deuill tyme zwynglius miniſter congregation zurick agreing luther thynges diſſented touching lordes ſupper thoſe wordes chriſt body luther vnderſtode barely ſymply texte letter admitting none interpretation affirming bodye bloude chriſte verely bread wyne ſo receyued mouthe alſo zuinglius taketh trope fygure many others mo found scripture expoūdeth wordes thus ſignifieth body wherunto ſubſcribed oecolampadius preacher baſill interpretyng thus ſigne body matter hādled eyther ſyde much contention wryting saxōs held ye opiniō luther zwicers zwynglius followed others expoūd otherwiſe agreed opinion body blud chriſt receiued ſpiritnally corporally ye mouth wt hart cōtention endured ſpace iii year laſt meanes lantgraue luther zwynglius met marpurge came cōmunication marburg hereafter ſhal alſo coūſel thempire appointed litle auſpurg becauſe came thither reaſon tumultes germany proroged firſt may next yeare folowyng time ferdinando put thē hope emperour would ſelf place appointed spyres neuertheleſſe decreed yt meane tyme preacher ſhould expound ſcriptures people mindes doctours whiche churche receiued teache ſediciouſly ſo god name may gloryfied quietnes maintained whileſt fraunces french kyng priſoner spayne ale mother gouernment kepe byſhop rome ſignified vnto letter meſſagers zeale affection ſhe bare towardes churche rome wherupon elemēt ſeuenth writing court parliament pope letter thē paris paris ſignifieth vnderſtode certen hereſies began ſpring vp fraunce againſt auncient faith religion haue wittely forſeing thing choſen certen men puniſhe ſuch offendours whiche thing confirmeth alſo authoritie wyllyng diligent herein god glory alſo welth realme many faire wordes exhortation perſeuer ſo letter dated rome xx day may deliuered senate paris xvij daye iune moreouer kinges abſence diuines paris ſo faber driuē paris euill entreated iames faber stapulles hathe written dyuers workes philoſophie diuinitie droue hym fraunce wherof kyng certified lettres ſiſter margaret loued faber vertue writeth senate paris behalfe geuyng godlye teſtimony learnyng vertue much eſtimation amonges italian spanyardes wherfore wileth ſurceaſe let action falle till retourne pleaſure knowen beyng aſſured euyl wyll commenced againſt hym doctours serbone matter heard commyng home theſe letter dated madricea town spayn kynges letter faber xij nouembre delyuered paris xxviij ſame moneth thyng geuen deuines tymes paſte rayle vpon learned men cauſe ſawe ignoraunce diſpiſed yeare ſtate common wealth altered lande pruſe vttermoſt prouince germany bordering ſhall repete matter beginninge empyre henry ſyxth ſonne frederick barbaroſſe tyme chriſtians warred recouer hieruſalem inſtituted order knyghtes germany whiche becauſe fought religiō weare whyte croſſe garmēts badge profeſſion yeare lorde c foure ſcore ſtory pruſe ten firſt maiſter order choſen reported campe cytie ptolomais wardes dyd ſubdue pruſe lande frederick ſecond emperour kept warres long tyme kynges polande beyng vanquyſhed battell became ſubiect geuyng fidelitie othe caſunire kyng pole father sigiſmund firſt maiſter marque albert brandēburg thritty thre albert choſen yeare lorde mdxi kept great warres two yeares together sigiſmunde kyng polle yeare mdxxi trewce takē iiij yeares tyme albert ſued oft emperour ſtates empyre ayde commyng councell nurrenberg wherof haue ofte tymes ſpoken place amonges prynce empyre cauſe warre wold ſworue kyng tyme emperour empeched frenche warres turke inuaded hongary germany ſo tourmoyled ſedition communaltie ayde looked thence tyme trewce expyred maketh peace kyng pole geuyng hym faythe ſuprome magiſtrate receyue doctrine goſpell alteryng order taketh pruſe maiſter kynges aſſente called duke pruſe ſhortly maried dorothe daughter frederick kyng denmarke foundeth vniuerſitie conningſberge called kynges mount wherby diſpleaſure order al kept countrey ſupported kyng pole yet common aſſent choſen rowme walther cronberge ſhold repreſent aunciēt name dignitie aſſemblies complayned vpon hym greuouſly againe defended cauſe wrytyng declaryng howe dryuen extreme neceſſitie beinge vtterly forſaken empyre ſubmytte hym ſelfe vnto kyng epiſtle leo tenth sigiſmunde alberte exhorting vnto concord eyther committe matter legate whiche wold ſende counſell laterane moſte conuenient cōtrouerſies prince ſhold decided determined generall counſelles ✚ ſyxthe booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale empire charles fyfte ❧ argument ſyxth booke luther wrote kyng england duke george thei reiected ſame chriſterne kyng dēmarke moued luther ſo ſycknes frenche king duryng impryſonment haſted treaty madrice king deliuered two sonnes geuen pledge whyleſt eſtates aſſembled spyres aboute matter religion turke entreth hongarry diſputation hoïoen baden swycherlande pope element frenche kynge make league emperour kyng complayne ſore one rome ſacked duke burbon frenche kyng ſendeth lawtrecke italy ſecte anabaptiſtes beginneth diſputation kept berne reformation contention betwyxt ferdinando uayuode paccius beheaded andwarpe emperour frenche kyng offer ſelues combat maſſe aboliſhed straſburge trouble baſyll relygion cā • ous papiſtes make league ferdinando aſſembly holden spyres name proteſtauntes hath begynning ciuile warre emonges swychers treate peace cambray uienna beſeged turke ſweatyng ſycknes proteſtantes make league haue heard heretofore howe kynge englande wrote agaynſt luther luther lut letter ſubmiſſiō kynge england agaynſt hym hearde certen thynges ſounded muche kynges cō mendation delighted reporte writeth hym great ſubmiſſion doubting ſore offended hyghnes ſetting forth booke neuertheleſſe dyd ſo muche accorde inſtigation others ſo bolde trouble hym hys letter preſent proceadeth prynclyke humanitie whiche hyghly commended manye moreouer vnderſtandeth howe bookes ſet forthe agaynſt hym hys owne doynge wrytten certen sophiſters whiche full craftely tooke occaſion ſpeakynge occaſion cardinall yorke calleth hym plage englande heareth moreouer great comforte howe grace miſlyketh naughtye ſorte men gyueth mynde knowledge truthe wherfore beſecheth hym pardon hym one facte woulde pleaſe hym remembre ſyns man mortall ought beare ennemytie immortall ſhal commaunde wyl confeſſe faulte openly commende pryncelike vertues worke exhorteth maieſtie gyue eare ſklaunderous tale reporte heretyke chief point doctrine al chief point lu doctrine muſt ſaued fayth chriſt whiche bare punyſhement ſynnes necke ſhoulders al body dyed v roſe agayne reigneth father euer doctrine prophetes apoſtles foundatiō one layde teacheth dewty charitie one ought howe muſt obey magiſtrate applye whole lyfe profeſſion goſpel anye errour wyckednes doctrine aduerſaries ſhewe hym condēpne banyſhe beyng neyther examined conuicted writeth againſt byſhop rome adherentes doeth teache contrary chriſt apoſtles owne ende papiſtes doctrine gayne lucre intent may cōmaunde men lyue lyke glutton voluptuouſnes vnto ende tende deniſes doinges whiche thing ſo well tryed knowen ſelues deny caſe wold amende liues leade idle beaſtly lyfe loſſe iniury manye ſtryfe myght ſone quieted diuers prynces city germany haue embraced doctrine acknowledging reuerently god benefite woulde gladlye wyſhe myght alſo accōpted nombre emperour certen others attempte thynges agaynſthym newes dauid hathe prophecied longe ſynce kynges people ſhould conſpire imagine many thynges agaynſt lorde annoynted reiectyng lawes commaundementes conſidereth ſuche place scripture maruayleth anye prynce ſhould fauour doctrine goſpell fynally requyreth hym may receyue gentle aunſwere longe wryteth alſo george duke saxony ſignifyinge howe god hath accuſtomed beginning chaſtiſe mē ſeuerely ſharpely luth letter george dake saxon gētly louīgly embrace ſame aterrour feare iewes whā gaue thē law moſes preachig goſpel ſhewed thē great ioye gladnes hath followeth ſame maner hādling ſome ouer roughly euen one yet ſince hath writtē thingesful fruite cō ſolatiō wherby eaſy ſe yt taketh al payn profit others euil zeale beareth truth duke george hateth goſpel heareth yt relenteth nothing diſpleaſure beareth hym increaſeth malice againſt daily cauſe whye nowe wryteth vnto hym deſyryng ſurceaſe perſecute doctrine whiche conſonaunt writinges prophetes apoſtles admonyſheth alſo haue reſpect baſenes perſone matter god almighty al men ſhould fret fume therat yet ſhall doctrine continue euer therfore greueth ſo muche offended ſame may wiſe forſake yet ſeketh gratiſie deſyreth forgeuen hath ſpoken thing ſharpely againſt wil agayne craue pardon god hath perſecuted goſpel doubteth ſhal obtein ſo leaue time ſeke extin gwiſhe great lyght goſpel appereth nowe vnto al worlde ſo procede pray god helpe againſt doubteth prayer ſhalbe heard whiche taketh ſtrō ger craftes deuyll alwayes refuge moſte aſſured defence whan kyng englande receiued luther letter made ſharpe aunſwer defendeth boke whiche ſayeth well accepted diuers good well learned men hathe rayled reuerend father cardynall yorke marueyleth nothing therat abſtayne frō contumely men ſainctes ſayth cardinall neceſſarye inſtrument hym whole realme hath loued hym dearelye well nowe wyll ſet hym ten tymes conſyderyng myſlyketh hym amōges thinges doeth forſee great dylygence none leproſye contagion hereſye infecte parte realme caſteth teeth inceſtuouſe marryage whiche thomas wulley cardinal butcher ſonne vyce moſte deteſtable cardinalles name thomas wulſey buchers ſonne ipſwyche hyghe authoritie wyth hys prynce lykewyſe duke george made luther ſuche aunſwere man myght well perceyue mortall hatred bare hym ambaſſadours fraunce whiche ſent spayne peace amonges whome margaret frenche kynges ſyſter wydowe could brynge nothyng paſſe ale mother whiche gouernaunce ayde defence founde meanes bryng league amitie henry kynge englande whiche done moneth auguſte league betwene englād fraūce fyrſt chiefeſt poynt league violens turkes peſtiferous ſecte luther ſhould dryuen kept leſſe daungerous turkes cardinal england whiche might al ye tyme thought haue perſwaded ye king vnto league bare ye emperour great good wil yt toke haue bene thonly let yt choſē biſhop rome death adriā dede certē thēperours haue expreſſed writinges whan luther red kyng englandes aunſwere printe ſawe aſcribeth vnconſtancie though chaunged opinion conſidering concerne owne priuate iniurie profeſſiō goſpel toke matter heuely gratifie frendes made ſo humble ſubmiſſion lyke maner intreated gētly word writing chriſterne kyng denmarck wold receiue pure doctrine truſting haue preuayled gentlenes nowe perceiued farre abuſe lyke thinge happened vnto cardinal caietane george duke saxonie eraſmus roterdame vnto whome hath written frendly requeſt others hath obtayned therby nothynge el made fierce cruell fondely done thinke coulde haue foūde godlines courtes prince ſought chriſt wher godlines ſought court ſathan ruleth loketh john baptiſt amonges thē clothed purple wherfore ſeing preuaile gentle frēdly kinde writing wil take order frō henceforth frenche kyng treaty peace toke place great thought penſiuenes fel ſyck comforted gentle talke emperour bad ſhould good chere began ſomewhat better emperour alſo waying hym ſelfe pray ſhould loſe thyng chaunced vnto wiſe wel inclyned mynde peace daylye wherfore xiiii daye january concluded thynges madrice whiche wryting emonges thynges recited peace madrice emperour kyng haue reſpect chiefly ennemies chriſtian religion hereſies luther ſecte ſhould extyrped peace concluded ſhall ſet ordre common welth moue warre againſt turkes heretikes communion churche verye nedefull byſhop rome hath often warned bene hande applye thing diligently wherfore rather ſatiſſye requeſt determyned entreate hym would appoynte certaine daye ſome place conuenient ambaſſadours prynces aſſemble hauyng ful power authoritie agree vpon ſuche thynges ſhalbe good requiſite well turky ſhe warres alſo wedyng heretikes peace makyng elenor ye emperours ſyſter lady elenor bene maryed emanuell kyng portugall beyng eſpouſed frenche kynge emperour promyſeth gyue hym dowery two thouſand ducates certen landes high burgundy controuerſie kynge ſhall within two monethes retourned home reſtore emperour duckdome burgundy whiche kynges fraunce haue kepte poſſeſſion ſyns death charles duke burgundye ſpace fyftie yeares moreouer ſhall renounce naples millan gene aſte flaunders ſhall gyue ayde henry kyng nauarre charles duke gelders ulryche duke wirtēberg robert erle marche ſhall attempte ſecrete deuiſes counſels italy emperour wyll go italy sea ſhall aſſiſte nauie ſixtene galleis vitayled fournyſhed thynges ſauing ſoldiours alſo two hūdreth thouſand crownes arme yerely penſion emperour bounden paye kynge englande ſhall frenche kynge paye kynge englande ſhall reſtore charles duke burbon fellowes ryght landes goodes permittyng vſe ſame dwellyng lyſte ſuche action title duke burbon hath prouince marſeilles kyng ſhall abyde ordre lawe tyme gyuen emperour fayth obſerue theſe condition ſet lybertie retourne home departyng border spayn leaueth behind two ſonnes fraūces kynges ſonnes pledge henry verey yonge pledge agreed vpō vnleſſe obſerue couenauntes promyſeth yelde hym ſelf pryſoner agayn prince germany aſſemble spire told laſt boke appointed emonges whome duke counſell spyres iohn electour saxony philip lantgrane heſſe emperour deputes ferdinando brother barnarde byſhop ttent caſimire marque brandenburge philip marque baden william duke bauarre ericus duke brunſwyck begunne counſell xxv daye june declared cauſes aſſemblye added moreouer emperour aboue thynges wylled commaunded ſtates empyre ſhoulde common aſſent take order howe chriſtian religion auncient cuſtome church lōg tyme obſerued might ſtill reteyned former eſtimation al men punyſhed attempt contrary alſo reſiſted make force matter intent ceſars decre made wormes publyſhed fyue yeres ſyns decre aſſembly alſo may obſerued al men put execution certen choſen degree treate theſe matter emonges alſo lantgraue iames sturmius straiſborourgh creſſus norinberge emperours deputes call aſſembly ſtates iii daye auguſt ſaye vnderſtande haue choſen certayne nombre conferre theſe matter propounded ſuppoſe wyll firſt conſulte religion intent emperours pleaſure may accomplyſhed intreate nothing determine loſſe time lette hynderaunce matter therfore wyll let vnderſtande emperours commaundement behalf read emperours letter dated hiſpale xxiii marche wherof ſome howe intended emperours letter go rome inueſted alſo treate byſhop generall counſell meane tyme wylleth commaundeth ſtates aſſemblye decree nothynge ſhall anye wyſe agaynſt olde cuſtome lawes ceremony church theri dommions eſtablyſhe thinges according decre made wormes common aſſentes take well worth delay tyll haue deuiſed hyghe byſhop concernyng generall counſell whiche ſhalbe ſhortly ſuch priuate aſſemblies good done alſo errours licenciouſe lybertie people cōfirmed turke inuadeth hū gary tyme emperour turkes ſettyng foreward armie frō belgrade whē paſſed ouer riuers danubie saue marched ryght way hongary wherfore king lewys ſendyng agayne ambaſſadours spyres requyreth ayde league betwene venetian pope frē che kyng italy came certen newes clement byſhop rome venetian hadde made legue frenche kyng lately retourned home spayne warre vpon emperour ſhall heare afterwarde whan emperours letter mentioned read aſſemblie cyties moſte parte namely hygh germany put vp aduiſe writing declaring deſyred meanes obey gratifies emperour nowithſtanding controuerſie religion encreaſeth dayly eſpecially touchyng ceremony men tradition hitherto decre wormes could well obſerued feare ſedition vprores nowe daunger muche laſte aſſemblye legate rome alſo wel declared ſo much emperour ſelfe preſent infourmed ſtate thinges could iudge none otherwyſe maketh promyſe letter counſell tyme wrytten byſhop frendes nowe farre otherwyſe ſeynge byſhop hath altered mynde leuied armie againſt hym wherfore ſynke heades trouble ſome tyme ſhould haue generall counſell wherfore thynke beſte ſende ambaſſadours emperour whiche maye informe hym whole matter ſtate germany howe daungerous matter alſo delay cauſe relygion longer leſſe perilous put vre decree wormes therfore entreate hym auoydynge inconueniencie would permitte holde counſell prouinciall germany treate matter controuerſie whiche thyng agreed vpon norenberg place appoynted ſame citie many ſtates made preparation ſame agayne defeated emperours countremaundemēt opened waye rebellion ſedition ciuile warres al thinges myght eaſelye haue bene eſchewed caſe ſame tyme cauſe relygion bene heard indifferently wyll allowe counſell germany entreate differre execution decree wormes vntyll generall councell otherwyſe wyll come paſſe wounde newly healed wyll waxe rawe agayne another ſhalbe worſe breake furthermore diſcorde ſo long euery man carefull owne eſtate wylbe harde paynefull collecte money ayde others beſydes wrytinge exhibited prynces fourthe daye auguſt put vp alſo wherin pouertie cōplayned city townes ouermuche burthened wyth beggyng freres whiche ſhould helpe vnto ſuſteyn againſt falſe freers life preuēted caught vp often tymes alſo came handes throughe flattrye great landes legacy loſſe hynderaunce many wherfore deuyſe ſhould ſuffered make anye moo freres theſe dead permytte wyll take kynde lyfe vpon thē depart cloyſter ſome annuall ſtypende reſt geuen poore men boxe moreouer thynke reaſon clergie ſhould frelye exempted al charge paymētes priuilege graū ted tymes paſt lyberalitie kynges prynces yet ſuch tyme fewe nombre ſmall lyuynges nowe ſo many growen ſuch welth conſyderation cauſe inunitie beyng taken away benefite alſo employed taketh place longer enioye benefytes commodity muche nōber holy day men whiche tribute cuſtome mony payde agayne haue ouermany holye dayes whiche hynder people ſore wherunto bounden vnder great penaltie leaue neceſſary workes vndone alſo thoſe idle day offende god diuerſe wayes thynke alſo mete aboliſh lawe made choyſe meates leaue vnto men owne ceremony tyll counſell wyſe ſtoppe courſe euāgelical doctrine byſhoppes vnderſtode emperours pleaſure woulde proceade matter religion thought great diſſention bet wyxte byſhop hym deferre thynge tyll ſome better oportunitie ſerued aroſe great ſtryfe among men choſen whiche contrary relygion duke saxon lantgraue conſultation layde aſyde ment go home commaunded company make ready take iournaye ſeyng ferdinando archebyſhop treers others conſyderynge daunger ſo peryllous tyme yf ſhoulde thus breakynge diſpleaſure conclude vppon nothynge departe wyth grudge malyce founde meane salue wounde wherof commotion yere diſſention ſo euer nowe germany ſprange vp altogether controuerſye relygion thoughte good remedye thynge tyme wherfore appeaſe certen men myndes laſte made decree religion decre eſtablyſhynge religion mayntenaunce common peace tranquilitie neceſſarye haue lawfull counſell eyther prouinciall generall begyn within yeare furtheſt entent ſhall let delaye ſame ſende ambaſſadours emperour entreate hym woulde conſyder myſerable troubleſome ſtate empyre repayre ſhortly germany holde counſell touchyng decree made wormes thei contented untyll counſell begonne men ſhoulde ſo demeane ſelues prouinces woulde yelde accompte theyr doynges bothe god emperour decree made duke saxon lantgraue enter talke ambaſſadours strauſborough norenberge auſpurge begynninge proteſtātes league whiche ſawe fauoured goſpell concernynge league muche knewe byſhoppes theyr adherententes intended fortuned anye ſtande daunger relygion one myght helpe muche good opinion frankeforth ulmes woulde refuſe breake wyth alſo matter ambaſſadours make aunſwere commiſſion touchynge anye ſuche matter neuertheleſſe would wryte home ryght diligently duke saxon preacher george spalatine iohn iſlebie lantgraue alſo reſidewe prince requeſted might preache feare ſturre vayne fardinando alſo calling ambaſſadours city accomting vnto benefites aunceſters houſe auſtriche exhorted obediēt emperour caried away counſell perſwaſion others decreed alſo ſende ayde kynge hungary tyme aſſemblye finiſhed ende kynge hungary ſlayne auguſt turke entred hungarye vanquyſhed kynge lewis battell alſo ſlayne chaſe aſſemblye prynces electours ſauinge onlye marque brandenburg emperour ſommer maried iſabell emperour maried wyfe daughter emanuell kyng portugall ſyſter iohn whiche ſucceded father tyme aſſemblye spyres thetwelue townes neluetians swycers kept diſputatiō badene thether came chiefeſt diuines byſhop rome diſputatiō baden ſyde faber eckius murmer byſhop conſtance baſill courtes loſanna ſent thither ambaſſadours theames ſet vp whiche eckius defendeth ryght boldely body bloud chriſte preſent lordes ſupper trewe oblation quicke dead vyrgin mary ſaynctes muſt prayde vnto interceſſours image ought taken downe lyfe fire purgatory oecolampadius others impugne thē zwynglius abſent letter heluetians declared cauſe abſence confuted opinion eckius writing zwynglius dred bad meaſure ſuſpecting bothe men place concluded thus men ſhould perſeuer ſame religion haue obſerued hytherto receyue newe doctryne followe authoritie counſell byſhop conſtaunce prieſt burnt litle cauſed one iohn huglie prieſt brent merſpurge woulde allowe byſhops rome doctrine thinges lewys king hongary thus myſerably ſlayne ferdinando contended kyngdome diſcorde hongary dewe vnto hym certen compoſition aduerſarye iohn sepuſe vayuode tranſſyluania whiche diſſentiō nobilitie ſtates deuided aroſe warre right noyſome hurtfull germanes nation dwelled nere afterwardes emperour turkes receyuing uayuode fayth protection eſtabliſhed hym kyng tributarye client buda delyuered vp handes frenche kyng whiche retourned home leauing child frēche league agaiſt emper pledge spayne ſayde conditiōs peace vnreaſonable wherfore ſendyng ambaſſadours fro byſhop rome uenetians enter league hym effect wherof defence quietnes italy ſhall fynde armye xxx thouſand fotemen men armes lyghthorſe men ſyxe thouſande ſhall alſo prouide nauie two thirtye galley shippes bourthen tyme ſhall haue vanquyſhed enemy lumbardye italye ſhall muade kingdome nayles ſea lande beyng one wōne remayne power churche rome yet ſo lxxv thouſande duckates payde yerely frenche kyng claymeth tytle dignitie houſe medicees maynteyned citie florence frenche kyng leaueth duckdome myllan fraunces sfortia whome emperours men beſegyng caſtell millan conſtrayned rendre promiſeth owne ayde swycers helpe hym alſo wyfe fraunce bloud royall yet vpon condition ſhal paye vnto therfore yeare fyfty thouſande crownes fynde brother maximilian whiche pryſoner fraunce byſhop rome pope benefites emper wrytyng letter emperour recyteth benofites towards hym goodly offer refuſed frenche kynges handes ſake howe kynge taken gaue hondreth thouſande duckates captaynes vpon certayne conditiōs hath vttered vnto hym oftentymes coūſels enemy time men dyd beſege france sfortia caſtel millan certen men great power moued hym ioyne league againſt hym would heare whiche thynges full euyll recompenſed ſouldiours haue wrought ſuche iniuries ſhame myſery hym churche rome hathe bene hearde moreouer neyther condicions fulfylled money reſtored appeareth good wyll beareth hym whiche woulde make hym prinie vpon condition concluded frenche kynge vtterly reiected ſuite interceſſion made sfortia howe ſent duke burbon frō ſiege marſeilles reyſe vp newe kynde warre italye whiche cauſes neceſſitie conſtrayned make league ſuche loue quiet wealth italy wherfore wyl alſo content embrace peace well good ſhal wāt force power defende italy common wealth rome league compryſed kyng england great promyſes deſyred protectour therof unto epyſtle ceſar aunſweryng granato xviii september reaccompteth emperours āſwer deſertes benefites done vnto hym howe ſute meanes made byſhop rome howe tyme gaue hym yerely penſion ten thouſande duckates reuenewes archebyſhop toledo legate byſhop leo notwithſtandyng conſpyred againſt hym albert prince carpes haue diſpoſſeſſed hym naples sicily frenche men dryuen italy conducte bourbon could deny myght warre fraūce el recouer frenche kyng owne graunteth kyngdome naples holden hym withſtandynge kyngdō naples caſe ſayeth ſhould make warre ſhoulde thereby loſe right tytle euen ſame cauſes cliente loſeth benefite graunted ſelfe ſame alſo doth patrone point yt lawe loſe prerogatiue kyng taken entreated peace intent might haue inioyed dukedome millan therfore uenetians florentine withdrewe ayde motion captaynes againſt league frenche kyng confeſſeth openly howe throughe prouocation entred newe league went spayne knowe certayne reporte haue diſpenſed othe wherby bounden furthermore haue moued warre letter wherein proclaymed vnto deliuered ſeking dryue italy alſo depoſe dignitie empyre able proue letter ferdinando daualle marque piſtare whome would haue entyſed league promiſing hym kyngdome naples haue tytle millan mo wayes one yet quiet italye ſuffered sfortia enioye whan greuouſly ſyck would haue placed ſteade duke bourbon ſawe pleaſed well dyuers others italy cauſe sfortia beſieged caſtel millan committed treaſon againſt ioynyng league wherof beyng detected would delyuer captaynes caſtelles cremone millan neyther make pourgation come talke matter requeſt ſhould forgyue hym altogether whiche neyther coulde deede ought doe leſt euyll example ſhoulde gyue occaſiō vnto clientes offende againſt patrones touchyng peace concluded frenche kyng kept nothing ſecret ambaſſadours condicions ſuche would haue concealed tende publique peace reſiſtaūce chriſtes ennemies ſe vnworthines yt thing ther commeth money yearely rome realmes prouinces doth nation proued requeſtes prynces germany tyme complaynyng greuouſly court rome deſyred reformation whoſe cōplaint rome treaſure houſe yt whole worlde tyme neglected zeale bare churche rome whiche thynge conſidered muche haue geuen none occaſion offence inſtantly requyre lay army wyll doe lykewyſe ſeynge bothe appoynted god two great lyghtes let v endeuour ſelues ſo pope emper two gret lyghtes whole worlde maye lyghtened v reaſon diſſention ſhould aryſe eclypſe let v regarde publique weale attempt dryue turkes quenche ſecte errours luther appertayneth vnto god glorye hereof ought begynne debate controuerſies ſhall haue ready vnto theſe thynges obtaine wil nedes perſeuer play man warre pope warrier proteſte appeale general counſell ſame maye griefes decyded requyre ſame maye called ſo ſhortlye may ſpeaketh two lightes followeth herein wordes innocentius thyrd applieth two great lyghtes god created one guyde day ye nyght byſhops princelyke dignitie whiche miniſtreth godly thinges muche excellent gouerneth polytike matter loke different betwyxte ſonne mone ſo great diuerſitie betwyxt office high byſhop kinges office whan ceſar made aunſwere clemēt wryteth alſo coledge cardinalles ſixt day october ſignifiyng little ſory heare byſhop clement confederated french kyng reneweth warre agaīſt afreſhe biſhop hath ſent letter defiance ſuppoſeth writtē cōmon aſſent wherat marueleth little conſidering kyng yt beareth loue affection churche rome witnes parma placence whiche city empyre plucked late hath withſtanding reſtored churche ryght bounde ſo prince ſtates germanye cōplayned vnto wormes ſondry iniuries done courte rome required recompence ſingular loue naturall inclination towardes churche rome paſſed ouer requeſtes deaf eares great ſedition trouble enſued therupon germanye prince appointed another counſel indemnitie biſhop church rome countremaunded ſame vnder great penaltie appeaſe counſell promyſed myndes put hope general counſell holden hande wherfore byſhop hathe done hym great iniury whiche hath done ſo muche ſake hath ſame meanes loſt good wylles prince empire deſyreth therfore admonyſhe byſhop duty appointe counſell perſwade hym incline mynde peace rather warre whiche refuſe wyll differre counſell would call chriſtian cōmon wealth ſuſteyne loſſe dammage eyther want counſell long delaye ſame ought hereafter imputed newes came hongary great ouerthrowe prynces ſet forward ambaſſade appointed spire emperour great ſpede expedition intreate frēche kyng graunt ſaufeconduicte paſſe spayne fraunce whiche graunted preſcribing certen tyme paſſe toke occaſion hereby wryte vnto vj octobre frenche kyngs leters prynces germany loſſe hongary death lewis kynge daunger approched germany conceiued inwarde ſorowe minde nothyng leſſe lamented yt publique wealth alſo peryſhed ciuile warres ſurely lōg chriſtome quiet emperours faulte refuſeth al honeſte reaſonable condition peace ſo much neither moued cōmon loſſe deſtruction moſte vnworthy death brother lawe king lewis yet miſerable eſtate owne ſiſter wydowe cōſidereth daunger ſtandeth auſtriche ſhal wel according dutie exhorte perſwade vnto peace kepe loue amitie kinges dwell nere hym refrayne vnmeaſurable couetouſnes ſhould honorable hym ſtyll endeuour get men landes poſſeſſe ſelfe alone progenitours kynges fraunce haue often time fought many battelles ennemies chriſtentie ſame myght nowe done power ioyned one emperour ſo mynded wherfore caſe deuiſe bring thing paſſe wyll beſtowe turkyſhe warre al force ſelfe alſo man blame hym aſſaye recouer force armes ſuche thynges good wyll ſtādeth vpon rather ſeke peace nerer turkes daunger thā whan ceſar aduertyſed theſe letter xxix nouē bre empe confuteth letter writeth prince firſt rehearſeth howe mercyfully gently vſed frenche kynge pryſoner howe ſet hym lybertie howe gaue hym marriage eldeſt ſyſter hym degree ſucceſſion ſeconde thynges beyng quyeted ſuppoſed takynge iourney italye entent myghte bende hys whole force agaynſte perpetuall ennemyes chriſtiane religion breakynge fidelitie makynge league wyth byſhop clement certen others deuydynge emonges kyngdome naples whiche alreadye hope conceyued theyr owne renewed mortall warre meanes whereof coulde delyuer countrey hongary violent fury turkes forced defende owne limites pretendeth lament death kyng lewis deſtruction hongary playne diſſimulatiō intent myght ſome meane put ſilence ſuch founde letter conſtantly affirme turke attēpted warre inſtigation spayne ſynce retourne home alſo confirmed letter obſeruation conue nauntes muche hath kingdome liyng middes europe careleſſe ſeketh warres contention therby make profite beſides wrytinge mentioned came forth french kinges name apologie defence declaring apologie frēch kyng cauſes ſtādeth peace madrice wherunto anſwere made emperours behalf large muche turke buda great parte hongary oppreſſed people miſerably great terrour germany certē prince empire conſulted eſlyng write ſpedely emperour prince letter emperour intreating repaire germany ſhortly might conſideration great daunger hanged ouer empire theſe letter written xix decēbre make mentiō ambaſſade determined haue ſent vnto hym becauſe ſhould haue trauailed fraunce kynge wold graunt ſaufe conduict iiij monethes wherof one paſt ambaſſadours ſhould mete together time wold much ſhortned therfore auoyd daunger haue determined differ ſame vntil next aſſemblie empyre whiche haue appointed regenſburg firſt day april next folowyng treate turkyſh warre truſting ye either yt time aſſemble regenſburg ſhal haue ſome better occaſiō ſende yt ſhal haue ſome intelligence thing ye meane time al ceſar wrote thus byſhop rome cardinal yet wold preuaile nothing cōfederatours ſending vnto ambaſſadours agreed vpō require depart frō army reſtore sfortia duke millan receiue money raunſome ſend home kyngs ſonnes whome deteineth pledge repay money borowed kyng england hereunto anſwered emperour ualolete xij february cā diſmiſſe army ſhort time notwithſtāding wil refuſe take truce thre yeres ſēd army partes agaīſt turke cōmon ennemie ye meane time treate peace sfortia holdeth landes empire accuſed treaſon therfore reſtored matter examyned wherfore let hym anſwere lawe accuſers wyll appoynt hym indifferent iudges reſtore kynges chyldren vpon receipte money ſame agaynſte kynges promeſſe othe fidelitie require repaie kinge england money marueleth litle conſydering haue cō maundement matter kyng ſuch frendes mony matter breake frendſhyp wherfore ſeinge requeſtes vnſitting willeth bryng forth others part wyl nothyng obſtinatly ſhalbe content beare many thinges cōmon wealthes ſake wherfore ambaſſadours thus departing without thing concluded renewe warres againe wt force power thoſe day iohn frederick ſonne heire prince electour saxony married sibille iohn fridmarrieth sibille cleue daughter duke iohn cleaue lady catharine yt emperours yongeſt ſiſter promyſed writinges made ſame alteratiō religion chaūced saxony ſwarued frō couenauntes hawnart emperours ambaſſadour germany ſayd plainly promiſe kept heretikes following herein ſuppoſe fote ſtepes coūſel conſtance dede duke saxony reciteth certen writing emōges others themperours captaines charles duke bourbon going certen power naples way toke citie rome ſacked next daye rome ſacked arriued ſixt day may clemēt byſhop cardinal prelate fleing caſtell aungell beſeged certen tyme trenched euery ſyde whiche endured ſiege ſeuen monethes laſte deliuered emperours commaundement harde expreſſe wordes great crueltie oultrage germanes spanyardes rome beſydes cruell ſlaughters deſtruction ſpoyling raueſhynge woman left kynde contumelious reproches mockinges biſhop cardinalles emperour excuſed facte diligently affirmyng done commaūdement chiefly wrote therof king england albeit ſuppoſeth thyng haue happened vnto hym iuſt iudgement god auenged wronge iniurie done vnto hym yet ſayeth wil ſo vſe matter ſame calamitie ſhalbe beginning occaſion helth common wealth whan newes brought spayn ſackīg rome ceſar immediatly cōmaū ded ceaſe frō playing pageantes interlude whiche thē ſet forth ioy ſon philip newly borne king englād anſwe king englande red nothīg themperours letter biſhop rome captiue vnto bare great zeale reuerence themperours power increaſing daily fixed mind vpō warre ſending ye cardinal yorke ambaſſadour fraunce coūſel regēſburg came prynces ſent ambaſſadours wherfore nothing cōcluded ſauyng ſent letter emperour xviij day may ſignifiyng diuers cauſes preſence requyſite nedefull tyme ſprange vp newe kynde doctryne ſuche called anabaptiſtes condempne baptiſme infantes baptyſed agayne ſelues teachyng begynning anabaptiſtes thynges ſhould common againſt theſe wrote luther zwynglius diuers others magiſtrates puniſhed euery place boaſte viſions dreames sangal town swycerlande one cut brother head preſence father mother whome perſwaded god cōmaunded hym ſo apprehended magiſtrate ſuffered lyke punyſhment muche increaſed cō motion ſtyred vp germany hereafter ſhalbe declared yeare senate straſborough decreed none ſhoulde henceforth buried within citie appointed certen place buriall dead without citie frenche kynge heard rome taken makyng league kyng englande ſent great armie italy conduicte lautrech frēche armye gaſcon reſcewe byſhop comming lumbardy ayded uenetians taketh firſt alexādria pauie partly force partly compoſition ſouldiours rage fury king taken woūderful ſlaughter townes men ſpoyled citie xxvij day iuly charles duke burbon lately ſtayne aſſaulte rome condempned duke baurbon conoempned paris paris court parliamēt treaſon name memoriall accurſed armes plucked downe landes goodes confiſcated anthony prate chauncelour gaue ſentence duke bare mortall hatred kynge tyme went beſege marſeilles mentioned fourth boke becauſe ſame tyme kynge englande toke emperours parte wrote cardinall yorke emonges thinges would ſpare paynes peryll kyng henry might helpe recouer ryght tytle hath fraunce englyſhe men doe clayme fraunce theires two hundreth englande hath title fraunce yeares ſince aboue eſpeciallye normandye gaſcoyne gwyne theſe letter therfore bourbon prouoke kynge clayme chalenge ryght whiche letter frenche kyng afterwardes chauncing vppon conceyued muche hatred againſt leonarde ceſar hym dukedome bauarie one leonarde ceſar profeſſour goſpel apprehended cōmaundemēt byſhop paſſauie defendeth theſe opinion faythe onlye doth iuſtifie two sacramentes baptiſme lordes ſupper maſſe ſacrifice profite quicke dead confeſſion syns depende counſell commaundement chriſte hath made ſatiſfaction ſynnes vowe chaſtitie byndeth ſcripture maketh mention purgatory difference dayes dead interceſſours v diuine thinges mā hath free wyll examined woulde haue declared theſe thynges people large coulde ſuffered emonges eckius reaſoned altogether latin people ſhould vnderſtand anſwered vulgare tongue neither yet coulde cauſe doe lyke fyne condempned byſhops owne mouthe heretyke burnt xvj auguſt commaundement william duke bauar vnto whoſe iuriſdiction cōmitted condempnation byſhop leſt ſhoulde deede defile hopocriſy byſhops ſacred thynges become prophane irregular gyueth ſentence lyfe death tyme ferdinando emperours depute germany death kyng lewis created kyng boheme contended uaynode tranſiluania kyngdome hongary philip baden ſubſtituted place appointed counſell empyre ceſars name cōmaunding regēſburg beginning marche yeare followyng conſulte religion turkyſhe warre ſenate people berne whiche moſte fame power emōges swycers cō ſydering power berne howe diſſention religion encreaſed daily miniſters churche one doctrine doe aſſigne diſputation within citie xvij decembre ſettyng forth wryting called vnto ſame byſhops nere byſhoppes conſtance baſyll sedune loſanna warnyng come ſelues brynge diuines el loſe poſſeſſions haue precincte lymites nombre clergie iuriſdiction appoyntyng scripture onely olde newe teſtament ſhoulde force authoritie wyll come thether graunt ſaufe conduicte make lawe lawes diſputacion thynge done quietlye wythout chydynge brawlynge euery man ſhoulde ſpeake mynde frelye pronounce ſuche ſorte euerye man ſayinges myght written ſo euer ſhold agreed vpō ſame ſhold ratified obſerued al domions thintent men myght know thynges ſhoulde decided comme thether prepared propounded ten concluſiōs miniſters church fraunces colbe bertholde haller dyd profeſſe ſayde would proue scripture whiche theſe trewe churche wherof chriſte head procedeth god word perſeuereth ſame heareth none man voyce ſelf theames concluſions ſame church maketh lawes without god worde therfore otherwyſe bounden men tradition bearyng name churche muche conſonant god worde chriſte hath made ſatiſfactiō ſynnes whole worlde therfore man ſay waye ſaluation meane put away ſynne ſame dothe denye chriſte howe proued teſtimonie scripture body bloud chriſt really corporally receiued vſe maſſe wherin chriſt preſented offered heauenly father quicke dead againſt scripture contumelie ſacrifice chriſt offered vp v chriſt called vpō mediatour aduocate mankynde god father ſhould place lyfe wherin ſoules ſhould pourged founde scripture wherfore thoſe prayer ceremony yearely diriges obites whiche beſtowed prayer dead ſuperfluous vpon dead alſo lampes taper ſuche thynges profite nothyng image lykenes ſhould ſet vp worſhypped againſt holy scripture therfore errected church intent ought taken downe matrimony kynde men prohybited auoyde fornication commaunded permitted vnto men holy wrytte euery whoremonger euen teſtimony scripture ſequeſtred communiō churche ſyngle life vnchaſt fylthy moſte vnſemely order prieſthode tyme men berne wrytten letter concernynge theſe matter vnto heluetians exhortyng ſende learned men ſuffer others paſſe ſaufelye countreis lucernates uranites unterualdians engianes glareōs soloturnians friburg exhorte long letter leaue enterpryſe ſayinge lawfull nation prouince alter ſtate religion ſame belonge generall counſell wherfore deſyre wold attempte ſuche wycked acte contine religion whiche parentes elder haue obſerued fynally ſaye neyther wyll ſende ſuffer men come graunt ſaufecōduit others paſſe countrey ſtandyng men berneſſe procede matter daye preſcribed whiche vij ianuary begynne diſputation came none byſhops named baſyll zuricke abbecell alſo shafuſiās sangallians mulluſiās neighbour rhetia ſent moreouer thei strauſborough ulmes auſpurg lindaue conſtance iſne dyd lykewyſe doctours ſame citie named began diſputation concluſions defended zwynglius oecolampadius bucer capito blanrer diuers others impugned emonges others conrade treger auſten freer great fame laſte tyme ſought helpe beſydes scripture maiſters diſputation would permitte hym ſo doe forbydden lawe departed place diſputation ended xxvj ianuary forſayde concluſions approued common aſſente moſte parte ratified obſerued berne alſo proclaimed magiſtrates religion reformed ſondry place aboutes maſſes aultars image abolyſhed place conſtance chaunged certen thynges made lawe againſt whoredome adultrye diſhoneſt ſuſpected company theſe called cannon departed prebids departe thence great diſpleaſure ambroſe blaurer preacher ther gentleman borne profeſſed ſelfe monke abbey alperſpacke dukedome wyrtinberge whyche ambroſe blaures readyng luther workes chaunged mynde cote together returnyng home agayne frendes abbot woulde haue hym agayne wroote earneſtlye senate conſtance wherfore blanrer expreſſeth whole matter writyng propoundeth certen condition vpon contēt retourne ſuche abbot refuſyng remayneth ſtyll conſtance diſputation berne image aultares maſſe ceremony vtterly abolyſhed lykewyſe geneua remouinge image ceremony dyd religion reformed geneua imitate berne wherfore byſhop clergie forſoke citie anger religion thus altered berne renoū ced league made frenche kynge prohibitynge hyred warfare zuricke done contented yearely penſion kyng payeth kepe peace wrote victory goſpel daye yeare wherein forſoke popyſhe religion vpon apyllour golden letter myght euerlaſtyng memory poſteritie ſhewed cardynal yorke ſent fraunce agred vpon matter kinges kinges fraūce englād amballade ye emperour ſent ambaſſadours emperour frenche king requireth take raunſome delyuer ſonnes pledge kyng englande agayne debte payde threfolde firſt thre hondreth thouſande crownes lent hym ſecondarely fyue hundreth thouſande obſeruing contracte matrimonie thirdly foure yeares penſion whiche emperoure promyſed hym third boke declared emperour hereunto aunſwered myndes kynge englande alſo ſent hym defiaunce herault armes ſame tyme conſultynge howe myght deuorced catherine emperours haunt marry whiche afterwardes ſhalbe recyted place emperoure letter kynges accuſed frenche kyng moſte greuouſly kept fayth promyſe ofte tymes ſayd ſo muche frenche ambaſſadours vpon kynge letter wrytten paris xxviij marche ſent herault talke ſayth whiche thou haſt ſome myne perceiue thou braggeſt certen thinges founde diſhonour frēche king inuectiue againſt emper though eſcaped thy handes againſt fidelitie nowe al whiche compacte made hath put pledge hym ſelfe quytte bonde ſo hereby ſufficiently excuſed yet neuertheleſſe defence honour thought wryte briefly vnto therfore thou blame facte mine departure ſayeſt euer thyng contrary dutie noble prynce tell playnly thou lieſt determined maynteyne myne honour eſtimatiō whyleſt haue day lyue nede many wordes therfore thou wylt ought thou ſhalt nede hereafter wryte appointe place may fyght hande hande thou dareſt mete meane tyme ceaſeſt ſpeake euyll proteſt offereth emper combat ſhame therof belongeth vnto combat ſtryfe ſhall parted tolde contention betwene kynge ferdinando uayuode tranſiluania whan ſame burſt cruell warre ferdinando greater power uayuode moneth apryll wryting letter ſtates empyre lamentable death kyng lewis ſayeth letter iohn uaiuode ſtates empyre common aſſent noble choſen crowned kinge hongary except three whome pouertie hatred hope better fortune ſeduced forgettyng wealth countrey ſubſcribed ferdinando kyng boheme tyme wholy addicted ſuccour countrey recouer loſt ſame meanes procure quiet beholde inuadeth realme violence taketh certen townes thoſe whiche faction created kyng poſonye marueled lytle greued alſo exceadingly nation ſhould moleſted hym whiche ought moſte ſuccour releue miſery ſame bene harde tyme haue gyuen hym repulſe would haſarde raſhely remnant power lefte ſo manye ſhypwrakes loſſes realme hath late complayned vnto clement ſeuenth fraū ce frenche kyng henry kyng england sigiſmūde kyng pole dede kynge pole ſendynge ambaſſadour without knowledge entreated wold daungerous tyme make away ciuile diſcorde let foreyne enemy whiche neyther yet ſhould able kepe would kepe peace ioyne power myne reſiſte common ennemye ferdinando anſwered would attempt nothing againſt ryght equitie agreed vpon certen daye fytte men ſhould ſent debate matter controuerſie content ſendyng alſo ambaſſadours vnto ſubmytting ſelfe vnto arbytriment made requeſt woulde gyue none ayde myne aduerſarie tyme came ferdinando countrey beyng taken deteyned pryſoners againſt lawe natiōs ambaſſadours takē could declare commiſſion ſhoulde haue gone emperour al ſame extreme wronge iniury neuertheleſſe daye appoynted kyng pole ſent certen others deſyrous peace themſelues alſo commaundemēt notwithſtanding fardinando men propounded thinges ſo farre reaſon ther could nothyng concluded whyleſt theſe thinges workyng certen nobilitie entyſed crafte polycie ferdinādo breake fidelite gyuen ſomuche waye layde neyther come ſende vnto thought good declare vnto letter howe vniuſte warre attempteth peraduenture intending recouer ſame auncetours frederick maximilian emperours haue loſt fore one triumphyng thought hym ſelfe ſure kyngdome hongary myne vncle emeryck expulſed whole countrey father stephen sepuſe matthie kyng diſconfite ſuche ſorte adioyned uienna hongary ſelfe beyng yonge gaue repulſe maximilian whan moued warre againſt v wold haue done lyke enemy alſo contendeth rather craft ſubtyltie doth power manhood hytherto haue borne iniury might thinke ſelues moſte noble prynces howe greuous thynge caſt downe hygheſt degree power dignitie ſtate priuate man ſuppoſe none found ſo mylde patient ſufferyng ſo many iniuries woulde loke hym euery ſyde ayde myght get wherfore ſeyng tyme ſynce receyued gouernment commō wealth haue refuſed condition reaſonable wyll yet doe rather doe thyng ſtyre vp cyuyle warre myne aduerſarye proceadeth obſtinately doe proteſte ought layde charge blame worthy myne owne defence ſeek beſt meanes caſe common wealth doe ſuſteyne thereby dommage maye aſcribed vnto hath ſoughte wayes haue peace myne ennemie whiche inuadeth man realme great iniury hathe layde dylygent wayte wayes paſſages nothynge conueyed vnto notwithſtandynge ſuppoſe haue hearde howe forſoke kyng ferdinādo forſoke kyng lewis brother lawe kyng lewys vnto whome beyng ofte earneſtly requyred ſent neyther men munition ayde agaynſt violence ennemie loked death kyng moreouer common ayde empyry appoynted hongary ſent brother diſquiet italy ſent kynge lewys ſame tyme brother three thouſande men myne owne coſtes charge woulde haue bene battell ſelfe bene commaunded kyng remayne tranſiluania brother dyed battel ryght valeantlye ferdinando promyſed othe vnleſſe dyd fyrſte recouer belgrade certen caſtelles turkes wold take vpon gouernment fayth fayled herein turkes haue inuaded deſtroyed ſpoyled coūtrey haue wonne caſtell iaice chiefeſt fortreſſe boſna whiche caſtel kyng matthias great loſſe men recouered time paſt turkes mine vncle emerick defēded ſame afterwards induring long ſege kinges haue fortified ſynce time exceading great charge loſt valeaūt captaine yt made ſo many goodly promiſes thinke lōg wil neceſſite cal vpon ayde though ſtode daū ger defence germany mynde waye intendeth warre vpō turke vnto cōtent pay tribute yearely hath ſent ambaſſadours thither ſame purpoſe myndeth men money helpe brother italye deſtroye brynge realme hongarye bondage ſeyng matter thus moſt earneſtly beſeche forſee priuate iniurye donne vnto turne great hynderaunce common wealth whyle wrote alſo emperour muche lyke effecte exhortinge ferdinādos title hongary appeaſe brother thus much ye defēce caſe ferdinādo grounded ſelf vpō cōpoſition whiche themperour maximilian made wt hongarians king ladiſlaus yeare iiij c xci whiche prouided ladiſlaus died without heire male maximilian heyres deſcending right line ſhold poſſeſſe kingdome wherfore whan lewys ſonne ladiſlaus dead without iſſue tolde ferdinando nephewe maximilian ſonne philip archeduke auſtriche moreouer hauīg maried ſyſter kyng lewys affirmed kyngdome good right ſelfe ſame tyme lantgraue heſſe prince electour saxony muſtering mē prepared thē ſelues vnto warre cauſe therof one otto paccius lawer gentle man borne one chiefeſt
