councellours george duke saxony occaſion talke admonyſhed lantgraue loke owne thynges nowe late ferdinand marque brandenburge cardinall mentz saliſburge george duke saxon william lewis duke bauer certen byſhops bamberge wirciburge made league deſtroye duke saxon electour luther religion credit thing ſhewed copie confederacie duke saxon lantgraue prepare thē warre promyſing hym alſo principall whyleſt leuie army make preparation warres men marueled muche wherfore would come ſome ſayde one thynge ſome ſuche caſes accuſtomed whan thynges redynes ſendyng abroade letter meſſengers partes thei publiſhed copie cōfederacie brought vnto wrote alſo vnto whiche thought haue made league ſent ambaſſadours knowe intent al pourged ſelues euery man ſeueral ſending abrode letter affirme forged matter proued duke george ye lantgraues father law vrged chiefly bryng forth partie tolde hym whiche wyll thynke none wyſe deuyſe ſtyre vp ſtryfe diſturbe quietnes german ye fyrſt attempt ſhoulde haue bene haue ſet vppon byſhoppes next therfore toke vp waged men many could get vpon ſuche ſoden paccius coulde ſhewe dede ſelfe according promyſe lantgraue begaune waxe colde buſynes laſte mediation countie palatine richarde archebiſhop treer dimyſed army vpon condicion byſhoppes ſhoulde paye vnto lātgraue charge warre hūdreth thouſand ducates archebyſhop mentz fortie thouſande wirciburge muche bamberge twenty thouſande afterwardes tyme ambaſſadours prynces mete day preſcribed dede accuſation touche paccius whome lantgraue preſented conuicted falſihode yet meanes put lybertie whan wandered ſtraunge countreis certen yeares laſt beheaded andwerpe matter thus paccen beheaded pacified prynces confederated sweuicall league accuſed lantgraue done wrong iniury felowes new ſturre lyke haue growen vpon ſame matter fine quieted wormes ende decembre interceſſion palſgraue ſome thinke altogether nothyng ſpoken conſpyracie aſſemblie certen prince regenſburg foure yeares encreaſed ſame ſuſpicion wherfore ſuppoſed ſome ſuche thing conceaued brought perfection fully determined whiche thyng doe affirme certentie leaue vnto euery man owne iudgement aſſemblie empire ſhewed ſhold haue bene beginning ſpring tyme regenſburg warlyke preparation emperours deputie ſending worde ſhould come frenche kynges letter wrytten later end marche emperour receiued ſeuenth daye iune afterwardes ſendyng aunſwer herault armes xxiiij day iune frō moū tiſon emperours aunſwer frēch king blame ſayeth accuſe departing home ſame done leaue permiſſion thou diddeſt returne againe cuſtody captiue thou diddeſt promyſe thy fayth thou wouldeſt vnleſſe thou fulfilleſt condition peace lyke dede proued wryting ſubſcrybed thyne owne hande dede thou haddeſt done thou haddeſt played parte iuſte man worthye prynce nowe ſo muche thou haſt herein broken thy faith affirme without lye thou haſt done ſhamefully wyckedlye thou deſireſt haue place appointed cōbate content aſſigne place ryuer runneth beſyde fount arabie andey whiche thou oughteſt caſe refuſe thou diddeſt credit thine owne lyfe thy chyldrens two yeres paſt tyme ſet libertie retourne home thou gaueſt pledge thou mayeſt aſwel alſo committe thy ſelfe ſame aſſuredly intent differred long delay let noble men ſent thether party ſkilfull ſuche matter whiche ſhall eſpye place conuenient agree vpon kynde weapon appoynte certen daye caſe receyue none aunſwere within fourty dayes receipt letter thy mynde herein fault delaye ſhame ſhall remayne towarde cryme falſifying thy fayth ſhall added alſo theſe letter emperour delyuered vnto herault goyng fraunce ſhould reade kynge openly refuſe heare cō maundeth deliuer kyng reade herault came lengthe kynge ſyttyng paris themper heraulde came paris hearyng ſermon noble hym demaunded hym brought maner combat ſayde ſomwhat ſaye beſydes howe commaundement reade hym el delyuer owne handes whiche beſought hym myght doe kynge vnderſtandyng ryght well emperours requeſt herein lothe haue thyng read openly fallyng woordes herault arroſe would neyther heare hym ſpeake receyue anye letter hym deede emperours men affyrme theyr wrytinges firſte auguſt emperour wryting letter ualolete calleth counſell empyre spyres againſt aſſemble spire beginning february treate religion turkyſh warre excuſeth hym ſelfe certen affayres meanes whereof preſent appoyntyng deputes brother ferdinando friderike palatyne william bauer byſhop trent hyldeſſeme lantrechus lieutenaunt frenche kynges armie taken pauie alexandria haue hearde wyntered armie bononie begynning ſpryngtyme went forewarde beſeged naples whiche kept lantrech ſegeth naples defended alphonſus daualus ugo moncada ferdiando alarco philibert prynce orenge ferdinando gonzago moneth iuly ſore peſtilence conſumed great part armie lantreth hym ſelfe alſo moneth auguſte hym mounſour uaundemont brother vnto anthony duke lorayne whiche ſerued kyng hope attayne kingdome naples houſe gaunte whereof houſe lorayn hath alſo ofſprynge affirme ryght diſputation berne religion altered ſondrye place wherupon preacher strauſborongh emonges contention maſſe errours biſhop rome doctrine taught chiefly maſſe wicked great blaſphemy god holy name wherfore ought abrogated right vſe lordes ſupper inſtituted vnleſſe could proue theſe thinges teſtimonies holy ſcripture wyll refuſe kinde puniſhment againe byſhops miniſters taught otherwyſe bred ſmal contention afterwardes ſenate bycauſe refuſed diſpute conferre wt papiſts forboden preache others cōmaunded ſylence byſhop letter ſenate exhorted perſeuer auncient religiō elder senate deſyreth hym agayne done oftentymes ſuche thinges myght ſet forth appertayned trew ſeruice glory god reſidue taken away abolyſhed ſame belongeth office notwithſtandinge would ſome tyme appoynte metynge daye ſuche matter would nothyng ded put feare letter wherin oftentimes mingled intreatinges threateninges ſhould alter nothyng almoſte diſpayre thynge intreateth senate empyre whiche tyme spyres ambaſſadour chamber imperiall strauſbor authoritie ſet foote matter ſendynge ambaſſadours ſolemnely later ende decembre requyre put downe maſſe neyther power emperour ſtates chaunge auncient religion theyr forefather eyther generall el prouinciall counſell whiche ſuppoſed farre ouer long would differre leſte vntyl next aſſemblye empire put vp requeſtes doubted ſhoulde receyue reaſonable aunſwere forboden lawes priuate magiſtrate may vndo ſuch thinges agreed vpon common conſent whole worlde wherfore reaſon ſhould obtayne handes ſhould obſtinatly procede enterpryſe worke force violence emperour theyr hyghe magiſtrate kynge ferdynando alſo depute throughout empyre would take matter right greuouſly lykewyſe accordyng ther office dutie muſt bothe informe emperour therof letter alſo ſee ſuche redreſſe thyng apperteyneth whiche would loth vnwilling wherfore deſire aduyſedly waye matter followe good counſel ſame ſhalbe emperour moſt acceptable thē ſelues moſte profitable ſenate made anſwere ambaſſadours purpoſe departed ſhortly byſhop hildeſſeme came vnto thē themperours biſhops letter name like exhortation furthermore biſhop strauſborough writeth letter diuers ſenatours gentleman helde landes hym muche bounden vnto othe fidelitie ſhould much thē lieth holde wt maſſe ſuffer aboliſhed ye meane time ſenate whā thing bene aboue two yeres cōtrouerſie preacher called vpō thē ſermōs daily citezēs alſo ſuters callig whole nūbre ccc matter weight difficultie ther accuſtomed doth declare yt caſe ſhuld aboliſhe maſſe daūger themperour howe muche god would offended wherfore graunt thē leaſure conſider require conſulte together ſo next aſſemblie common wyll conſent matter may determyned wherfore daye came ſentence againſt maſſe preuayled vpon decree made xx february maſſe ought ſuſpended layde downe vntyll ſuche tyme aduerſaries could proue ſeruice acceptable god decree take place aſwel within maſſe put stanſbor citie without place ſo farre iuriſdiction ſtretcheth afterwarde letter certifie byſhop ſame newes hym heauy leade wrote agayne hym ſelfe next letter alſo great diſſention relygion certen yeares baſill fyne ſenate decred ſhould diſſentid baſil religion one vniforme doctrine whole citie touchyng maſſe whiche yet ſayde fewe place open diſputatiō ſhould determined voyces done therewith papiſtes defende maſſe touthe nayle parſons rayled agaynſt others vnpunyſhed burgeſes choſe certen put senate remēbraūce promiſe requyre thoſe senatours let thynge myght diſplaced coulde obtayned citezens flocke together mete gray freres church firſt without armure weapon keepe gate towres baſill take armure ſtrong place citie watche warde senate glad graunte certen requeſtes apeaſe furye referryng cauſe iudgement firſt ſent vnto meane tyme certen thoſe appoynted make prouiſion cytie reſte chaunced comme chiefe churche one ſtaffe thruſte image ſaincte ſo muche fell downe brake upon whiche occaſion ſerued mo lyke caſe prieſtes came thether whiche much offended doynges becauſe woulde paſſe commiſſion departed without bable worde hereof brought cytizens market place reporte made fellowes ſtoode daunger image put downe lyues three hondred armed men ſent heade churche helpe whan came thether others gone leſte ſhoulde appeere haue commen thyther nothyng breake downe idol image coulde fynde thence goe church doe lyke certen senatours ranne foorth appeaſe tumulte cytezens ſayde vnto haue bene conſulted theſe thre yeres ſame ſhall diſpatche one houre intent ſhall haue contention image thus senate condeſcende al requeſtes twelue senatours diſplaced emonges others henry meltinger tyme boroumaiſter lucius ziegler captayne bourgeſes decree alſo made well within citie without lyberties maſſe maner image ſhould abolyſhed maſſe put downe senate henceforth ſhould admitte two hondreth thre ſcore burgeſes conſulte matter cō cerning god glory common wealth theſe decree made citezens retourne home ioyfull anger wreaked vpon image thyrde daye whiche aſſhe wedneſdaye image diſtributed poore burne want fewell tyme fell partyng matter came woordes vnto hande ſtrypes agreed ſhoulde brent wherfore nyne ſtakes heapes made image brēt • ſh wedneſday head churche ſet fyre burnt ſo fortuned ſame daye wherein byſhoppes miniſters wont marke men foreheades aſſhes intent ſhould remembre ſelues earth aſſhes vnto whole citie conſuming idolles aſſhes mery ioyfull men zurick berne solodure hearyng tumulte ſent ambaſſadours meanes betwene thē tofore came thether matter appeaſed tolde lyttle aſſemblie spir aſſembly spyres whiche emperour appointed cō mence beginning february began tyll ides marche thither came many prince ſtates prynce electour saxony brought hym melanchton fyrſt treated religion muche deciſion decree made ſhall tell hereafter byſhoppes complices dyd coulde ſequeſtre duke saxon prynces city ſhould take counſell agree one whiche hoped well brynge paſſe muche dyffered opinion touchynge lordes supper ferdinande college callyng ambaſſadours certen city charged ſore contrary emperours decree altered many thynges fynally exhorted confourmable myndes others leſt diſſention aſſemblye papiſts ī swicerlād make leage kynge ferdinando quite diſſolued make aunſwere alteration iniurious emperour deſyrous concorde woulde doe anye thynge emperours ſake refuſynge ſtande iudgement lawfull counſell two moſte floryſhynge cyties swycers zuricke berne agreed one religion lucernaites urites swites unternaldians engians whiche abhorred moſte doctrine make league kyng ferdinando clement byſhop rome xiij day aprill ſendeth iohn thomaſe mirandula exhorte prynces warre againſt turke al hath ſuſteyned great loſſes late yeares yet promyſeth aſſiſte ayde doe endeuoure emperour frenche king accorded counſell may begynne immediatly intent germanye may embrace ſame religion countreis aſſemblye senate empire woulde permitte daniel miege ambaſſadour citie straſborough ſitte counſel amb • srauſborough excluded cauſe maſſe abrogated counſell imperiall withſtanding intreated contrary wherfore iames sturmius ambaſſadour ſame citie ſayed vnto caſe thus diſplaced contrary lawe cuſtome empire let loke henceforth wyll beare part charge might preuayl ferdinando hym ſelf aunſwering interceſſours bad citie obſerued emperours decree ſhould ſubſtituted place longe diſpute religion fourmer actes spire repeted new decree made wyſe haue hitherto obſerued emperours decree let thē obſerue ſame ſtyl vntyll generall counſell bynde people lykewyſe decres spire ſuche haue altered religion nowe departe ſame feare ſedition let ſtaye henceforth alter nothynge beſydes vntyll tyme counſell furthermore doctrine whiche teache otherwyſe lordes supper churche doth receyued maſſe abolyſhed ſuche place newe kynde doctryne anye man letted go maſſe wyll anabaptiſtes alſo ſuch defende opinion obſtinately ſhall ſuffer death miniſters churche commaunded teache according interpretaciō receiued church referring al diſputable queſtions coū ſell decided moreouer ſtates kepe common peace none hurte cauſe religion neither one take defence others ſubiecte ſhall otherwyſe accompted numbre outlawes decree reſiſted prince electour saxony george marque brandenborge erneſt france certen prince reſiſt ſame duke lunenborough lātgraue counte anhald ye xix april recite openly wryting cauſes doe conſent thereunto firſte doe repete decree former aſſemblie whereby euery man hathe religion permitted frely vntyll counſell maye departe infrynge thoſe thynges whiche great delyberation common quiet eſtablyſhed ſygnetes othes alſo confirmed woulde deede glad example progenitours thynge myght content emperour goodes lyues alſo wyll ſpende wyllinglye hyghnes ſeruice preſent cauſe coucerneth euerlaſtyng ſaluation men wherfore deſire offended thei herein diſſente like former decree made common aſſent ſo ſame broken conſentes wyll againſt ſhall countrey eſtablyſh religion ſhal ſeme good vnto beſeching god illuminate harte men light knowledge truthe hath bene diſſention controuerſie religion certen yeares declared counſel norinberge haue bene authours cauſers therof well author diſſention confeſſion byſhop rome hym ſelf alſo requeſtes prynces ſtates empyre delyuered byſhoppes legate numbre foure ſcore wherof notwithſtanding yet redreſſe made al conſultations hath euer bene ende debating controuerſies refourmyng vice nothyng better generall counſell ſame left parte haue nowe decreed ſuche haue chaunged religion nowe without muche trouble forſake ſame ſhal alter nothyng henceforth neither cōmende allowe vnleſſe ſhould diſcredite doctrine whiche haue profeſſed hitherto true godly graunt moreouer ought leaue ſame thei might tumulte vprores thynges el thā denye god worde whiche taught purely ſyncerely whiche moſte heynous offence coulde committed muſt confeſſe wordes deede alſo moreouer hynderaunce abnegation would howe muche preiudiciall fauourers goſpell eaſy coniecture cōcernyng maſſe ryght well knowen howe ſtrong inuincible teſtimonies holy scripture preacher within dominiōs haue confuted popiſhe maſſe ſteade therof inſtituted lordes ſupper according inſtitution chriſte maner apoſtles obſerued wherfore neither admitte part decree neyther permitte ſubiectes heare maſſe whiche abolyſhed though byſhop rome maſſe neuer ſo good godly yet ſhould haue church two cōtrary maſſes al mē may wel perceiue grudge diſſentiō would vpon enſewe moreouer preſcribe ſhal commaunde owne ſubiectes lawes ſhall make owne dominion lytle maruell conſyderynge ſelues would ſuffer man doe lyke furthermore thyng taught church touchyng preſence body bloud chriſte ſo euydent men nedeth declaratiō notwithſtandyng haue ſayde oftentymes ſo thynke good alſo yet make decree againſt thē teache otherwiſe emperours commiſſiōs teach latin beneth maketh mentiō therof agayne muche maynteners doctrine nother called hearde whiche ſo weyghty matter muche conſidered nothyng determyned tyme hearde ſpeake whome matter doth chiefly concerne howe ſcripture ſhoulde expoūded ſaye goſpell muſt taught interpretation approued churche well ſtryfe trewe church ſeyng doctrine certen god worde beſydes nothyng ought taught ſuch place scripture appeare ſome obſcure better expoūded manifeſt place ſame scripture therfore wyll dwell herein endeuourynge bookes olde newe teſtament may taught ſyncerely playnly onely meane waye euermore certayne ſure men tradicions grounded weake foundation decree laſt aſſemblie enacted peace concorde caſe decree ſhould take effecte would opē waye muche trouble diſpleaſure euen nowe decree wormes ſuſpended doe ſome prince ſeke make ſome ſubiectes forfyte goodes obſeruyng decree decre wormes men may eaſely cōiecture wyll inſewe ſame decree ſhal nowe take place agayne ſome wyl vſe force cō pelle men ſuche thinges done ſaufe conſcience well ſpokē fourmer decree penned ſuche wordes many abuſe ſame thyng tyl counſell called myght doe lyſte bruted chieflye whiche lytle afrayde laſt iudgement whan thynges ſhal come lyght partes wyll refuſe aunſwer indiferent iudges ſuche wyll ſaye haue anye poynte broken ſame decree whiche thynges ſtandyng thus conſent decree howe wyll aunſwere matter openly men alſo emperour hym ſelfe meane tyme tyll eyther generall el prouinciall counſell germany ſhalbe called wyll nothyng ſhall deſerue iuſte reproufe unto proteſtation prynces certen chief city laying heades together ſubſcribe strauſborough norē berge ulmes conſtance rutelinge winſſeme meminge lindane campedune hailbrune iſne wyſſeburge norling sangall thorigicall proteſtantes dede ye firſt original name proteſtaūtes germany alſo emonges foreyn nation nowe cō mon famous ferdinando departed aſſemblie prince thei proteſted notwithſtanding duke saxon felowes required tary litle proteſtantes deuiſe certen appellation wherein doe appeale decree made spire vnto emperour next lawful general prouinciall counſell germany iudges ſuſpected determined alſo ſende ambaſſadours empeperour long men zurick berne ſent forth army againſt ennemies fiue townes made league ciuil warre emong swicers ferdinando declaryng ſo wryting emonges ſondry cauſes iniuries whiche recite one yt tyme certen citezens came money dewe vnto snites whypped naked unterualdiās deſpyte hanged vp armes alſo armes city baſil strauſborough vpon gallous howe haue ioynctely made league wyth kynge ferdinādo oppreſſe religion roote coūtrey wherby haue onlye infringed lawe nature alſo broken bondes betwene conſpiring moſte vtter mortall ennemie whome ſubdue haue long many yeares euen frō firſt beginning league one aſſent ioyned together al force power army ready ioyne battel mediation neyghbours strauſborough matter taken vp ferdinādo ſent thē ayde came farre rhine emōges thinges agreed vpō ſhould haue warre religion henceforth ſhould abſteyne opprobriouſe wordes vnder great penaltie frenche kynge conſyderynge ſtate chyldren miſhappes frēche kyng whiche lefte pledge spayne euyll ſucceſſe warres italye hauynge loſte bothe armie alſo chieftayne latrechus ouer androwe de aure gene captaine sea moſte ſkylfull ſame tyme lantrech coronell dyed reuolted frenche kyng emperour reſtoryng countrey vnto lybertie inclined hys mynde peace wherfore cambrey cytie artoys mette ladye margaret emperoures aunte ale kynges peace canbrey mother many noble emonges others erarde marchiane cardinall byſhop liege whyche concluded peace moneth auguſte wherein recite decree made thre yeare spayne agaynſte lutherians whiche newely ratified condition partely altered emperour permitteth frenche kyng inioye bourgundy caſe haue ſonne ſiſter kyng paieth vnto emperour delyuery ſonnes twēty hōdreth thouſand crownes accompting herein debte dewe kyng englande lōg emperoure imbarked hym ſelfe spayne arryued gene time alſo soliman emperour turkes prouocation iohn uaynode made ambaſſadour hierome laſke hongarian man excellent wytte marcheth armie innumerable hōgary auſtrice moneth septembre layeth ſege uienna chief citie countrey aſſayed vndermyne ouerthrowen turke beſegeth uienna walles gyueth aſſaulte deſperatly ſeynge souldioues garnyſon whiche germaines whoſe chief captaine philip palſgrane defendyng breache moſte valiauntly ſpace one moneth eight day octobre raiſed ſiege departed without purpoſe many thouſandes mē retourne partely ſlayne partly lead away myſerable vyle captiuitie departure created uayuode kynge buda ſweating ſicknes yeare alſo germany ſore afflicted newe kynde diſeaſe called sweathing ſicknes men ſodainly takē peſtilent ſweate within foure twenty howres eyther died amended remedye knowen many thouſandes peryſhed began ocean ſea ſmall tyme ſpred ouer germany vnſpeakeable ſpede lyke fyre con •• med thynges farre nere called germany engliſh ſickenes firſt yeare henry ſeuenth kyng england whiche yeare lorde cccc lxxxvj ſame death began ilande becauſe new diſeaſe remedy knowen made wounderful deſtruction moreouer yere ſmall plenty wyne corne wherfore thoſe thynges whiche god diſpleaſure wonte caſte vpon vnthankefull people ſedition warre ſycknes penurie powred vpon germany sondry plage ſame tyme one ſame tyme collen peter fliſted adolphe clarebacke two learned men impryſoned touchyng lordes ſupper opinion beleued otherwyſe two clerk brenct collon papiſtes senate citie hath authoritie leade pryſon ſuche offendours archebyſhop hath power lyfe death maye whome senate hath condempned archebyſhoppes officer may acquite ſet lybertie theſe men deteyned pryſon halfe yere nowe laſte condempned partes brent great lamentation compaſſion many layde blame therof diuines preacher whiche cried daily god wrath muſt appeaſed deathes theſe wicked mē whō plaged v newe kynde diſeaſe adolphe well fauoured mā learned eloquent lead fire declared maner beleue comforted one another teſtimonies ſcripture ſuche ſorte men eye mindes fixed vpon ſhewed luther zwinglius luther zwinglius diſpuie marpurg differed opinion touching lordes ſupper bycauſe muche contention lantgraue found meanes learned men party ſhould mete certen daye marpurge conferre vpon matter frendlye saxony came luther melancthon ionas swycers oecol • padius zwynglius strauſborough bucer hedio rinberge oſiander beſydes theſe many graue well learned men luther zwynlius reaſon matter forſayd diſeaſe comen thether brake diſputation commaundement lantgraue concludinge thus muche conſented chiefeſt pointes maner agrement doctryne agreed frō henceforth ſhould abſtaine contention beſechyng god woulde ſhewe foorth hys lyght alſo controuerſie ſet concorde thus departed frendly beginning octobre haue hearde howe duke saxon lantgraue league three yeare ſynce spire nowe decree made intended ſame earneſtly wherof draught drawē norenberge debated place becauſe one opinion touching lordes ſupper long accorded wherfore apoynted another aſſemblye smalcalde eyght day decembre eraſmus boke againſte goſpelers tyme ceſar arryued italye eraſmus roterdame alteration religion auoyde ſuſpition gone baſyll frybourg towne kyng ferdinandos moneth nouembre ſet forth booke intituled againſt falſly boaſt ſelues goſpelers toucheth dede whole nū bre emonges many thinges ſayeth knewe one thē whiche appeared made worſe aunſwered deuines strauſborough whome concerned moſt baſill chiefly bucer emperour comme bononie fraunces sfortia whiche fraunces sfortia league byſhop rome frenche kyng pleaded cauſe hym interceſſion clement vij reſtored dukedome myllan vpon condition pay hym nyne hondreth thouſande crownes one half ſame yeare reſydue within ten yeares emperour pledge reſerueth hym ſelfe come caſtell millan vntyll payment firſt yeare made ✚ ſeuenth booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale empire charles fyfte ❧ argument ſeuenth booke ambaſſadours proteſtantes ſent emperour appeale anſwere made placence ſtayed wherof aduertyſed proteſtantes aſſemble smalcade stauſborough entreth league thre cyties cautons emperour returnyng coronation commeth auſpurge proteſtantes offer doctrine whiche aduerſaries go confute meane whyle certen nominated accorde emperour perſwadeth prince proteſtantes notwithſtanding threatnynges euyll wordes replication made ſcaunders wherwith charged perſiſted ſayde confeſſion hauyng geuen laſt aunſwere departe home eckius faber forgyng confutation againſt straſborough townes lyberally rewarded compacte pruſelande made fruſtrate notable decree aſſemblie auſpurge red ryuer tibre ouerfloweth rome melanchthon heauy decree comforted luther come nere vnto auſpurge bucer went agree hym zwynglius commaundement came make ferdinando kyng romaynes whiche electour saxony prynces reſiſte saide howe proteſtantes ſent ambaſſadours emperour thoſe ambaſſadours ye proteſtants emp iohn khinger alex framentrute michaell cadene norynbergh goyng far gene vnderſtode emperours commyng spayne afterwardes nynthe septembre placence make theyr waye meane mercurine cattunarie made cardynall daye henry earle naſſow alexander schweiſſie alphouſe ualdeſe spanyarde emperour appointed heare xii septembre withſtanding warned compryſe requeſtes writing vſe long circumſtance becauſe ſondrye moſte weighty affayres whan came theyr day admoniſhed eftſones interpretour knit vp matter fewe wordes lyke caſe commaundement repete ordre decree empyre made thre yeares paſt newlye taken awaye decree whiche ſhoulde force great trouble would come therof wherfor prince electour saxony fellowes city alſo ioynynge dyd proteſte openly would conſent decree requeſt would take thyng diſpleaſauntly euyl parte wyll nothyng vntyll ſuche tyme ſhall counſell whiche truſte ſhal allowed god hym alſo offeryng ſelues meane tyme example aunceſters doe thynge wealth dignitie hym empyre eyther ſerue warres agaynſt turke charge ſhall put moreouer beſeche hym caſe ſhall reported hym otherwyſe would gyue credit therunto truſt vnto information conceaue diſpleaſure agaynſt thē vnleſſe firſt heard make purgatiō eſpecially ſeyng make alwayes offer maye ryght inſtructed ſcriptures wil nothyng obſtinatly againſt dewty wherfore deſyre hym accepte thē defence protection ſhortly may aunſwer mercyfully louyngly wrytyng becauſe whole matter declared mouthe hath alſo commaunded therfore haue comprehended wrytyng thynge ſo euer nedefull knowledge matter whiche delyuer vnto emperour aunſwereth interpretour emperours aunſwere hath heard ſute lyketh well alſo obſequiens ſeruyce offer theyr prynces behalfe wherfore whan hath talked counſell wyll make aunſwer reaſonable fynally twelth octobre gaue aunſwere writing requeſt vnderſtode kyng ferdinādo brother reſidue commiſſion hym decree made spyres thei came howe ryght ſory diſſention amongeſt muche dewtie forſee ſuche thynges happen leſte whan chanced ſee refourmed therfore longe delyberation priuie counſell whole matter findeth howe ſame decree made intent nothyng hereafter ſhould altered ſhould place newe ſecte henceforth many al ready euyll fauoured enough peace concorde myght throughout empyre therfore duke saxon fellowes ought ryght haue conſented al theſe thinges prynces ſet muche healthe theyr ſoules tranquillitie conſciences doe parte leſſe deſyreth generall counſell ſtaye common wealth whiche withſtandyng together ſo nedefull lawes decres woormes others whiche made comon aſſente ſtates myght obſerued ſelues wyll graunte ſuche decree oughte fyrme ſtable whiche thynge conſidered ſeyng vſe cuſtome loke parte ſtates empyre decree ſame may diſolued fewe perſones therfore hath letter duke fellowes commaunded doe accepte decree ratiſfied attempte nothyng againſt obeye ſame vpon theyr allegeaunce owe vnto hym empyre wyll come paſſe aucthoritie example ſake muſt punyſhe extremely ſuppoſeth letter already delyuered vnto wylbe ſhortelye wyll obey cōmaundemēt wherof wold ryght glad eſpecialy tyme wherin credibly infourmed howe great turke common ennemy chriſtendom preſent marchynge hongarye power germanye daunger turke wherfore requyſite haue domeſtical concorde intēt myghty cruell ennemy myght repulſed againſt whome intendeth ſo ſone ſhal haue ſtayed thynges italy bende force power wherfore truſteth conſyderyng well daunger wyll doe whiche bounden dutie tyme ambaſſadours red aunſwere ambaſſadours appeale delyuered appellation whiche ready made alexander schneiſſie callyng wytnes thyng maner fyrſt would receyue fyne content take caried emperoure ſame daye none retourneth hauyng ended talke ſayeth howe emperour commaundeth ſtyre one foote inue wryte nothing home ſende men til bring newes payne fayting life goodes ſhould wyſe left charge geuen fortuned yt michaell cadene within lodging hereof immediatlye certified ſeruant wryteth whole matter senate norinberge diſpatcheth awaye letter great expedition bounde vpon fidelitie fellowes length laſt daye ſauyng one octobre parma whether cōmaūded folowe nicolais granuellane executed office cardinall mercurine lieng ſicke ſhe weth grāunulane emperour taketh euyll parte appellation ſent hym yet doth neuertheleſſe permytte retourne home countrey commaundeth michaell cadene remayne ſtyll vnder payne death diſobeye cauſe wherof lantgraue came forth geuen hym booke fayre garnyſhed whiche conteyned briefly ſomme chriſtiane doctryne intent ſhould delyuer emperour vpon occaſion ceſar went maſſe preſent emperour boke preſented emperour agayne delyuered certen spanyſhe byſhop vnderſtande fortuned lyght ſame place chriſt warneth diſciples deſyre ſoueraignitie ſame theyr profeſſion kynges gentyls doe vſurpe vnto ſuch authoritie place authour emōges thing expounded declaryng dutie ſuche miniſters church lokyng vpon ſuperficially emperour aſked hym honeſte byſhoy made aunſwere though booke toke away authoritie ſworde chriſtian magiſtrate permitteted gentyls vſe whiche farre chriſtian religion cauſe ſtayed granuellan ſayde moreouer howe emperoures pleaſure ſhoulde delyuer lyke booke byſhop rome ſought excuſe doynges receyued pleaſaunt aunſwer perceyuyng wordes granuclane dannger tooke horſe priuely roode farrare poſte thence goyng uenyſe retourned home senate norenbergh receyued cadenes letter mentioned immediatly certified duke saxon lantgraue theyr fellowes therof xxiiij octobre matter debated agreed mete smalcaldia ende nouēbre thyther came duke saxon aſſemble smalcald iohn frederick ſonne erneſte france brother duke lunenburgh philip lantgraue certen counſellers george markes brandenburgh moreouer theſe city strauſborough norinberge heilprune rutelynge conſtance menynge campodune ulmes lindaue mentioned prynces certen theſe city differed opinion touchynge lordes ſupper wherfore strauſborough already made league zuricke berne baſyll whiche league thē stranſborough zuricke berne nerer vnto accorded better religion intent myght tymes able defende ſelues iniurye condicions ſhoulde attempted force armes religion ſake thoſe city ſhould ſende ayde men many ſhalbe requiſite yet ſo strauſborough ſhall gyne vnto euery thouſand fote men two thouſād crownes moneth parte recompence agayne chaunce firſt aſſauted citie strauſborough ſhal ayde mē thre thouſand crownes euerye moneth whyleſt warre ſhall endure moreouer ennemies founde part others dominion eſcape free ſuffer accordinge lawe armes ſhall warred vpon one euerye cytie beare theyr owne charge strauſborough ſhall tyme peace ſende vnto zuricke may conuenientlye ten thouſande poundes gunne powder many raſers wheate vnto baſyll wherof ſhall nothyng ſpent tyme warre delyuer townes men vpon reaſonable price ſhall come ayde strauſborough maye ſpende powder ſo muche ſhall nedefull warre common paye one halfe ſame league made fyfteneyeares fyft daye ianuary knowen fridericke palatyne preſydent chambre wryteth strauſh counſell imperiall addreſſed letter vnto aboute ende ſame moneth ſignifiyng howe commonly reported haue made league certen townes swycerlande whereat marueyleth lyttle whiche bounden empyre ſhould enter league others without conſent emperour ſtates empyre moſte men affirme trewe yet wyll credite thynge ſhal vnderſtande ſelues wherfore requyreth declare playnely wryting vnto hym whiche repreſenteth place emperour league condition agreed vpon proteſtauntes appoynted aſſemblye norinberge proteſtantes aſſē ble norinberge whyther came ambaſſadours certen prynces cyties ſo muche thought howe emperour would call counſell ſhortly agreed vpon meane tyme ſhould conſulte propounde ſame euerye moneth aduertyſe duke saxon thynges thought mete reſte myght vnderſtande hym thus departed fourth ides ianuarye meane whyle emperour whiche come bononye fyfte daye nouembre one twentye daye ianuarye diſpatchynge aſſemble auſpurg letter germanye ſommoned parliament ſtates auſpurge eyght daye apryll chyefiy cauſe religion emperours coronatiō bonony turky ſhe warre foure twenty daye februarye wtithout great pompe ſolempnitie inueſted byſhop rome whan fyrſt taken othe cōtinuall defendour byſhoppes dignitie came bononye ſhould enter within lymites byſhoppes iuriſdiction three cardinalles ſent byſhop rome demaunde take fidelitie ſhould neuer iniury libertie yt churche aunſwered ſuch ſorte declared would loſe part right ſignifiyng ſecretly parme placence belonging dukedome millan whiche townes churche rome poſſeſſed ſame tyme departing bononie created fridericke duke mantua tymes paſt mantua free citie empyre afterwardes ſore afflicted vprores ciuile tumultes choſe lewys gonzaga gouernour expulſyng tyraunt called paſſeryne yeare lorde ccc xxvii whoſe nephewes ſonne iohn france emperoure sigiſmunde created marque yeare mccccxxxiiij ſeconde daye septembre remayneth ſame eſtate vntil time firſt came auſpurge duke saxony ſonne iohn fridericke trayne came behynde philip melaucthō ihon iſelbe agricola iuſtus ionas george spalatine cytie ulmes ſent mete welcome emperour diuines yt proteſt longe myght ſuffered come ſpeche fine requyred renounce proteſtation yeare promeſſe obedient henceforth men auſpurge muſtered eyght hondreth footemen kepe towne whan emperour hearde commaunded diſcharged appoynteth ſweareth others theyr ſteade requyred one gat cytie delyuered vnto hym certen dayes came thether cattinarie newly made cardinall dyed tyme iſprouke granuellane rowme lady eleuour commeth fraunce tyme alſo ladye elenor kynges two ſonnes fraunces henry whiche bene pledge father spayne foure yeares came nowe home fraunce whyle byſhop inueſted themperour ſent vnto king ferdinādo peter paulle uerger legate great authoritie unto whome gaue cō maundemēt eſpecially deuiſe ferdinando ſhuld endeuour uergerius yt pope ambaſſadour let hinder yt prouincial coūſel germany yt wyſe ſhould holden handleth cōmiſſiō right diligently ſeketh al meanes poſſible hynder lutherians extended lyberalitie towardes iohn faber eckius chocleus nanſeas ſhould play men made eckius cannon ratiſbonne biſhops legate whoſe preſence right election ceaſſeth emperour came auſpurg ides iune company cardinall campegius byſhoppes full authoritie emperour purpoſed haue rydē citie middes ther ferdinando cardinall becauſe againſt maner empyre archebyſhop mentz collen rode hym hym ferdinando campegius nexte day corpus chriſti day emperour therfore wēt deuoutly churche cardinall mentz ſayde maſſe prynces preſent except duke saxon lantgraue two duke lunenboroug george brandenburge countie anholde prince woulde heare maſſe emperour dede wylled put preacher ſilence thei neither came ſelues yet impoſed ſilence preacher ſayd could muche ſame aſſemblie appointed intent al mē might ſpeake conſciences two dayes proclamation made preacher ſydes ſhould kepe ſilence til cauſe religion decided notwithſtanding howe emperour meane time ſhould appointe certen ſhould preache without reproche mā proclaimed herault vnder great penaltie twenty iune parliament began emperour goyng heare maſſe maner cōmaundeth duke saxon beare ſworde office duke saxon fice houſe saxon ſuch solēnities aſked aduiſe yt preacher ſaid might preſent muche called forth office wēt heare maſſe god ſeruice execute office accōpanied wt george marque brandenburg none reſt came maſſe came court parliamēt frederick coūte palatin excuſeth long abſēce themperour repeteth cauſes calling aſſēblie recited lōg oration writtē maner wherī aſwel declared cauſe themperours departure germany spayne lōg abode alſo returne callīg aſſēblie inſtituted chiefly two cauſes thone eſtabliſhing religiō ſins depature hath heard great griefe tumultes commotion haue bene germany turkyſhe warre cōſidering turmoyle late turkes haue made hongary taken beigrade turk victorye hongary many fortes caſtels ſlayne kynge lewis wonne towres fortreſſes betwixt riuers saue draue ſpoyled brent whole countrey ſlayne mē ful many thouſād ſins alſo haue inuaded slauonie lieng aboue goulfe ueniſe whence doue exceadynge muche miſchiefe ſlaughter burnyng ſpoylyng deſtroying rauyſhynge led awaye xxx thouſande moſte myſerable captiuitie howe laſte yeare made incurſion auſtriche armye innumerable beſeged chiefe citie uienna deſtroyed countrey farre nere tyll came almoſte lincie workyng crueltie coulde imagined cuttinge ſondre myddes yonge infantes deffouring rauyſhing yong maiden wyues driuing awaye lyke ſorte beaſtes whiche tyme fully determyned haue cōmen whole turk crueltie power againſt ſo wrote brother ferdinando prynces captaynes beſeged uienna ſhoulde defende valeauntly loke certenly commyng hearyng turke leuid ſege chaunged purpoſe ſuppoſyng moſte requiſite ſette thynges quiet italy conferre byſhop clement eſtablyſhyng religion germany intent yt peace cōcorde one vniformitie religion place turke may better reſyſted handes ſtronger army ſent againſt hym haue bene al toke uienna preſent caried armie back agayne yet lefte behynde hym border garyſons captaines vexe hongary auſtriche alſo stiria place nere ſeyng hath limites extended vnto doubte next occaſiō wyll retourne greater power vtter deſtruction eſpecially germanye wherfore neful requiſite cōſulte nowe houge cruell ennemy whiche ſeketh brynge men vnder ſubiection yea bannyſhe quyte bondes nature may reſiſted repulſed diſcomfited alſo ſubdued vāquiſhed dryuen europe wherunto haue nede contributaries greater ayde men mony highe byſhop hath promyſed parte largely liberally although hathe bene charge coronation bononie ſelfe alone whiche hath coſt hym great quantitie treaſure yet ſo holye neceſſary buſineſſe wyll doe whiche ſhall become eſtate lykewyſe brother kyng ferdinando whiche nowe ſet forth ſtrong bulwarke chriſtendom chiefly germany flāke turkyſhe rage alſo kynges prynces wil faile helpe v wherin hath wrytten ſome alreadye wyll hande reſte hath bene diſſention religiō euer ſynce firſt begynnyng empyre great diſcomforte according office dutie intendyng prepare remedy tyme made decree wormes common aſſentes whiche bene obſerued germany bene theſe yeares paſt ſo ſore afflicted ſedicion commonaltie wycked ſecte anabaptiſtes ſondry aſſemblies touchyng ſame nothynge coulde concluded hytherto thinkyng preſens ſhoulde auayleable herein hath called aſſemblie intent euery man may herein propounde wil writing matter may ſo muche ſoner eaſely vnderſtāde determined wyll cauſes empyre thynge ſhall concerne office dewtie loue beareth common wealth countrey requyreth others would bryng hyther lyke mind affection euery man parte prynces deliberatiō taken iudged mete firſt treate relygion fourth daye conſiſtory emperour prynces cardinall oration cardinall campega campege made oration latin exhorting whole numbre preſent matter religion would folowe obey emperour commending vertue deuotiō wil name high byſhop endeuoure maye profeſſe one ſame fayth mindes reconciled might moue warre againſt turke done ambaſſadours auſtriche cōplaiſ ambaſſadour auſtriche come declare ouerthro haue turke deſyre ayde marque george electour saxony duke lunenburge lantgraue intreate emperour would heare confeſſion doctrine compryſed wrytinge commaundeth writing exhibited confeſſion proteſtantes layde downe agayne thei muche ſame thing concerneth eſtimatiō lyfe landes goodes alſo euerlaſting ſaluation becauſe happely thyng hathe bene wyſe reported vnto hym dede requyre hym inſtantlye heard emperour commaundeth come home houſe next daye wryting deliuered hym nowe agayne vrge hym beſeche hym earneſtlye could deuiſe ſaying howe thought ful little ſhould haue bene denyed ſeing content heare others inferiours muche matter leſſe importaunce would alter nothyng purpoſe requyre leaue boke tyll ſuche tyme hath bene read opēly graunted came next daye audience prynces ſtates emperour hym ſelfe preſent recite ouer afterwardes delyuer vnto hym wrytten bothe latin dutche ſhall doubte thyng offer declaration caſe matter determined preſent refuſe abyde counſeell ſo often tymes promyſed looked emperour whiche layne wynter nouembretyl march bononie ſame place biſhop rome endeuoured muche myght appeaſe controuerſie religion without counſel meanes knewe ſhould pleaſe clement beſt whoſe intent caſe matter could quieted gē tle meanes ſhuld oppreſſed force armes therfore xxvj june calleth owne hous ambaſſadours al city declareth vnto frederick palſgraue howe aſſemblye spire decree made wherunto moſte parte conſent right glad certen others contemned ſame ſory wherfore requyred thē ſwarue away reſt orels ſhewe reaſon ſhould obey hereunto aunſwered ambaſſadours city proteſtauntes done nothing contrary dutie haue leſſe deſyre elder haue perfourme fayth obedience woulde knowe cauſe dyd admytte decre deſyre ſome tyme make aunſwer ſeuenth iuly put vp aunſwere wrytyng effecte lyke vnto whiche ſent yeare ambaſſadours italy two dayes emperour cauſeth one demaunde duke saxō felowes whether wyll exhibite thynge ſaye nothing el brief ſomme ſame confeſſion whiche haue delyuered already commaundeth ambaſſadours city ſaye conſcience ſake kepe decree spyres ſhould drawe article briefly thynges founde ſelues greued delyuereth confeſſiō saxonie reſydue prynces ſkanned agayne diuines amonges whome faber eckius pryucipall conſultation proteſtātes doctryne wrote confutation againſt whiche prynces heard red many iudged much extreme thought mete certen ſhould choſen reade ouer wrytynges qualyfie opinion preuayled whiche ſayde ſhoulde thus exhibyted emperour whole matter referred vnto hym meane tyme strauſborough conſtance memming lindaue preſent emperour confeſſion confeſſion zwinglians doctryne touchyng lordes ſupper beleued otherwyſe duke saxon fellowes emperour debatyng matter byſhoppes legate framed aunſwer doctrine saxon ſheweth vnto prynces fyrſte daye auguſt wyndyng vp vehement harde cō maunding obſerue vnder paine outlawing coūſel ye prynces thing mitigated wherfore third daye auguſte ſendeth al ſtates declareth frederick palſgraue hath long much conſulted vpon cō feſſion saxon doctryne hath alſo commaundeth certen honeſt well learned men examyne iudge godly therin againſt conſent churche whiche haue done accordingly haue declared myndes wrytynge whiche alſo alloweth confutation confeſſion rehearſed ordre deuided saxon bookes two partes firſt part conteined xxj chapter doctrine theſe ſome receiued ſome reiected certen thinges partely admitted partly refuſed alledginge manye teſtimonies father counſell forſoke theſe good thinges refuſed workes deſerue nothing iuſtification aſcribed faith vnto workes alſo churche congregatiō godly make ſatiſfaction ſinnes ſainctes interceſſours v thinges admitte ſorte ceremony matter receiued moreouer true body bloud chriſte ſacrament ſo chriſt ſhould vnder kyndes wyne bread cleane chaunged allowed article confeſſion ſo people bound confeſſe euery yere eaſter tellyng ſynnes diligently receiue lordes ſupper beleue ſeuen ſacramentes church prouided alwayes man appointed inſtructe people byſhoppes leaue conſent moreouer lawes decree churche ſhould obſerued ſuche place abolyſhed reſtored ſeconde parte comprehendeth fyue thynges chiefly communion lordes ſupper vnder bothe kyndes terme reiected emperour deſyred herein would followe conſent cuſtome chriſtendome marriage prieſtes ſayeth hym maruell wyll requyre ſyns neuer vſed apoſtles tyme vnto day wherfore may wyſe graunted maſſe admitted ſo maſſe ſacrifice conſonant vſe romane churche caſe altered reiected alſo affirmed maſſe ſacryfice quicke dead neyther priuate maſſe oughte abolyſhed daniell prophecied long antichriſte ſhoulde come dayly offeryng ſhoulde ceaſe whiche thyng fayre expoſition daniel yet come paſſe ſaue ſuch place maſſe layd downe aulters deſtroyed image brent whyche church nothyng ſonge read lyghtes burne longer deede ſaying prophet repreſented verified wherfore men muſt take dilygent hede geue none occaſion comyng antichriſte monaſticall vowes grounded aſwell vpon authoritie newe teſtament olde wherfore deſerue punyſhement whiche contrary profeſſion haue forſaken ordre biſhop haue authoritie teache alſo gouerne common wealth therfore ought abridged ryght priuilege whiche haue obteyned liberalitie elder abſtayne fleſhe dayes forboden faſte lent ceaſon cōfeſſe good ghoſtly father ſynnes obſtinate frowardnes chriſtian lybertie theſe beyng recyted confeſſed howe many thynges woulde refourmed emperour promyſeth doe endeuour theſe thynges maye redreſſed ſtate churche alſo refourmed ſayeth howe truſteth ſurely muche agreed vpon dyuerſe thynges proteſtantes wyl retourne boſome churche ſubmitte ſelues vnto hym whiche doe nothynge maye bolde craue loke hande muſt nedes becometh protectour defendour churche wherunto prynce saxony aunſwered ſelfe fellowes muche promiſed fyrſt went reconſiliation religion woulde doe ſo euer myghte ſaufe conſcience moreouer errour coulde founde doctrine proued teſtimonies scripture would ſtande furthermore requyred declaration ſhould geuen nowe ſeynge doctryne ſome article admytted ſome refuſed requiſite ſhoulde confyrme theyr thynges playne manifeſt reaſons wherfore deſyre haue copie confutation two dayes emperour taken long delyberation ſayde ſhoulde haue copie vnder condition ſhould put forth part therof prynte alſo wyll haue diſputation matter requyryng ordered hym ſhewe hym howe receyue vppon condition next daye whiche ſyxt auguſt lantgraue departed lantgraue departeth auſpurg thence ſmall company leauing deputes emperour toke diſpleaſauntly commaunded senate ſhoulde ſuffer none departe citie poſternes nyght ceaſon nexte daye ſendyng duke saxon fellowes diſſembled diſpleaſure requyryng tary tyll later ende wyll make cōcord excuſe lantgraue wyues ſycknes ſhewe hym howe hath lefte deputes ſaye wyll departe notwithſtandynge maruell ſee gate kept watche warde hath ben thus accuſtomed aſſemblye empyre ceſar excuſeth matter done ſor murther committed diſſention betwene germaynes spanyardes lyke trouble chaunce hereafter wyl nothing therein without makyng hym fyrſt priuie whiche high marſchall empyre duke anſwereth thyng happen wherin duty requyred wyll ready commeth hym duke saxon marſchall empyre ſo warder remoued gate ſame daye tyme ended warre florence wherof ſhal ſomewhat declare waye tyme rome ſacked ſayd byſhop taken florentine expulſed houſe medices ayded frenchemen ſege naples byſhop reſtored intent myght reuenge kynſfolkes warre florence ſending ambaſſadours spayne made league emperour promyſing emonges thinges crowne hym caſe wyll punyſhe florentynes demerites emperour pope made league ye emperour content ſhortly arriueth gene thyther came ambaſſadours florence craue pardon unto whome ceſar ſore blamed made aunſwere albeit deſerued great punyſhement yet might fact pardoned caſe would receiue againe byſhop rome way none haue peace come home anſwere matter longe muche debated opinion one two preuayled whiche ſayde would defende lybertie vttermoſte power inferred byſhop alſo emperour hym ſelfe long warres muche impoueryſhed wanted money notwithſtāding whan emperour come bonony thei ſent ambaſſadours thei byſhoppes counſel would receiued wherfore beſeged army biſhop rome emperour whan prolonged warres almoſte ſpace one yere moneth florence rendred auguſt fell compoſition ferdinando gonzago emperours general armie afterwardes emperour addreſſing moſte effectuall letter appointed alexander medices vnto whome promyſed margaret baſtarde daughter marriage prince ruler builded maruelous ſtrong caſtell begynning ſeruitude bondage florence loſeth libertie towne one rendred byſhop rome clement chopped heades certen senatours ſet new ordre commune wealth aſſured alexander ſhould gouernour according emperours promiſe purpoſe agayne muche debatinge ides auguſt ſeuen choſen eche ſyde frame matter concorde chatholyke ſyde theſe byſhop auſpurg henry duke brunſwike certen choſen accord religion two lawayers thre deuines wimpine eckius cocleus proteſtātes george marque brādenburg iohn friderick saxon two lawyer thre diuines melancthon brentius schnepſius theſe agreed vpon diuerſe thinges chief controuerſie maſſe marriage prieſtes lordes ſupper monaſticall vowes iuriſdiction byſhoppes eſpecially maſſe uotaries herein woulde catholikes nothyng relent matter though dyd myſlyke yet ſayde myght ſuffered vntyll counſell permitted alſo prieſtes haue wyues ſuche maried already others auoyding trouble touchyng power iuriſdiction byſhoppes saxony graūted lantgraues men duke lunenburgh norinberge would allowe toke leſſe numbre eyther ſide thre melancthon two ciuiliās eckius many fyne could agree whyleſt conſulting together emperour doth ſolicite george marque brandenburge byſhop mentz others ſame familie proteſtantes laboured duke saxon friderick palſgraue erle naſſo george truckeſſe thei ſhould leaue enterpriſe ſought drawe awaye duke saxon reſte pryncipal deſyred inueſted duckdome cuſtome empyre denied vnleſſe would firſt reconcile ſelf churche rome tolde playnely vnleſſe wold obeye would take wardſhyp nephewe albert ſonne brother caſimire went perſwade lantgraue caſe would agree vnto emperour ulriche duke wyrtemberge ſhould reſtored agrement myght emperours meanes betwene hym erle naſſoe rule chattes aſſemblie byſhop rome graunted kyng ferdinando maner plate ornamentes golde ſyluer church germany turkyſhe warre alſo take ſubſydie clergie prince woulde ſuffer ſollicityng emperour make yt decree fruſtrate xviij auguſt eraſmus roterdame wryteth cardinall campegius friburge howe emperours eraſmus writeth campegius power dede great men doe acknowledge name germanes ſo acknowledge rule rather thē obey luther doctryne ſowen abroade throughout germany farre neare ſo muche chayne miſchiefe reacheth ocean ſea vnto vttermoſte border swycerlande nowe emperour ſhall attempt accomplyſhe byſhop rome deſyre thynges feared leſt ſhall haue fewe commende doinges moreouer great daunger turke ſtande whoſe power force europe ſkant able reſyſte power turk thynge fyght vnwyllyng ſouldiours manyfeſt mo example one emperour doubtleſſe nature inclyned peace neuertheleſſe certen deſteny haled inforced warres fraunce italy haue bene ſore afflicted wyth warre nowe many yeares warre wyll doe harme reſte well forſeen men commonly perſwaded theſe thynges done inſtigation counſell hyghe byſhop feare leſt great parte peril redounde emperour ſelfe thei loue ſectes dede worthy punyſhement yet ought rather reſpecte preſeruation common wealth ſtate churche tymes paſt full miſerable whan arrians pagan donatiſtes manycheis ſowed abroade opinion alſo barbarous nation made warre notwithſtandyng waded theſe daungers length verely tyme ſelfe wyl laſte bring remedy alſo vnto moſt daungerous diſeaſes bohemers bohemers borne al though acknowledge byſhop rome ſame alſo permitted lutheriās amiſſe conceipt verye muche yet great deale leſſe euyll warre ſeuent daye septembre emperour ſendeth home houſe pryntes ſtates catholicke none two houres duke saxōs fellowes commaunding others aſyde ſauyng brother ferdinando byſhoppes conſtance hiſpalia granuellan truckeſſe ſpeaketh fredericke palſgraue wyſe empeoracion ye proteſtātes truſted aſſuredly beyng ſo frendly gently warned confeſſion exhibited would haue taken parte hope vaine yet requeſt prince content certen ſhould choſen eyther partie conferre make agrement thus brought agayne newe hope concorde nowe vnderſtandeth great grief diſſente others chiefeſt opinion whiche cleane contrary expectation wold neuer haue thought beyng ſo fewe numbre wold haue induced ſuche newe fanglednes againſt auncient ſacred cuſtome whole vniuerſal churche chouſe vnto ſelues ſeuerall religion ſo farre differinge frō biſhops rome religion king ferdinandos al prince ſtates empire yea kinges prince whole worlde much deſire haue generall counſel haue quiet decree made whiche chiefly coueteth quietnes wyll deuiſe byſhop rome chriſtiā prynces haue one called ſo ſoone agree vppon place wyll vndertake brynge paſſe yet vnder condition meane tyme ſhall obſerue ſame religion prynces doe procure counſell ſuffer gere hange waueringe prohibite newe fanglednes euery man ſayeth plainely howe ſore preiudiciall woulde hym others make delyberate aunſwere neyther aunſwere emperour haue brought vp newe ſecte ſwarued frō chriſtian churche refuſed counſell gyue hym great thankes deſyryng hym ſo ſhortely poſſible maye germany lawfull free counſell laſte former aſſemblye spyres agreed vpon receiue ceremony romyſhe churche one aboliſhed good conſcience emperour long conſultation aunſwereth agayne truckeſſe hath red ouer diligently diſceptation fyndeth ſwarue muche chriſtian churche marueylyng alſo lyghtnes parte would graunte ſo muche agayne ſtyffenes would take theyr offer craue counſell decree empyre take place refuſed laſt decree proteſted againſt appealed whiche appellatiō notwithſtanding maketh none accompte reaſon woulde leſſe parte ſhould comfourmable howe ſmall handfull compared great byſhop hym reſt chriſtian prynces wherfore deſyreth knowe whether wyl maynteyne talke diſcourſe matter wyll ſpare payne trauayle brynge attonement whiche ſhall refuſe doe yet perſeuer theyr purpoſe muſte doe becommeth protectour churche becauſe nere night gyueth leaue take aduiſement tyll morrowe next daye whan state aſſembled howre appoynted pontane ciuilian ſet aunſwere duke companion emperoure dede doe vnderſtande whole matter wyll geue credite fyrſte tale doubt theyr doctryne ſhall adiudged teſtimonie godly free counſell agreable god worde wherfore leſſe marueyled dyd receyue ſuche thynges late offered graunted appellation neceſſitie obiected againſte parte decree made agaynſte doctryne goſpell maner primatiue churche reſte doe obeye agayne counſell promyſed begynnyng aſſemblie longe decree made onelye alſo aſſemblies empyre thys euer opinion men wherfore ſeyng haue appealed vnto hym alſo free counſell truſte wyll diſanulle thynge tyll ſentence lawfully geuen whether leſſe parte controuerſie ought gyue place diſcuſſed place appellation whiche done neceſſitie wyll make aunſwere counſell therfore fourmer aſſemblies haue determined vpon counſell beſeche hym woulde breake thoſe decree gyue cō ſent herein good wylles deſyre ſtates alſo offereth paynes haue matter debated rendre great thankes manifeſt done already much ſubmitte ſelues laſte marueleth byſhoppes ſyde woulde graunte ſo many thynges eaſy coniecture therby iudgement therfore vayne treate therof much ſhould let hynderaunce matter wyll agaynſt deuyſe howe peace maye kepte throughout empyre offered begynnynge meane tyme wyll doe nothyng whiche truſte wyll allowed god lawfull counſell beyng commaunded ſyde laſt called agayne much matter weyghty emperour ſayd woulde take good aduiſement therein deſyred duke saxon whiche chiefeſt woulde depart deede georde truckeſſe uehus doctour ciuile decree made deuyſed reconcilement touchyng maſſe uowes vayne wherfore emperour chouſeth certen romyſh relygion make decree effecte wherof duke saxon fellowes exhibited confeſſion doctryne whiche afterwardes confuted teſtymonies holy scripture howe great paynes trauel ſtates matter brought concluſion receyued certen opinion churche certen refuſe wherfore declare ſelfe howe deſyrous peace howe coueteth doe nothyng vpon wyll ſingular humanitie gentlenes graunteth ſpace take aduiſement vntyll xv april intent maye meane whyle waye determyne themſelues whether content article profeſſe ſame byſhop rome doe reſt chriſtendome meane tyme wylleth men kepe peace throughout empyre neither duke saxō fellowes ſuffer meane time new thynge prynted concerning religion within dominiōs alſo alter nothing el neyther allure compelle man vnto religion let ſubiestes would followe olde religion moreouer diſturbe religiouſe perſones may ſaye ſeruice heare confeſſion miniſter lordes ſupper wonted facion ſhall conſulte ſtates punyſhe anabaptiſtes sacramentaries fynally becauſe hath bene counſell longe tyme manye thynges refourmed wel laitie clergie therfore wyll labour ſollicite byſhop prynces within halfe yeare one ſhall counſell promyſed ſommoned begynne yeare duke saxon fellowes conſultation ſet pontane make aunſwere decree mentioneth theyr doctryne confuted scripture cō feſſe graunte thynke thus ſo grounded vpon scripture nothynge founde vngodly would haue proued manyfeſtly obteined copie conſutation notwithſtāding leſt ſhould paſſed ouer scripture touche ſtone doctryne ſilence haue made aunſwere ſone hearde red ſo muche could beare memorye whiche al dyd aunſwere euery partycular want copie yet doubte would pleaſe emperour peruſe ſhoulde fynde theyr doctrine yet fyrme ſtable neyther pearſed ſhaken theyr aduerſaries weapon whē thus farre proceded delyuereth apologie emperour whiche fridericke palſgraue receiued apologie deliuered receiued emperours beckenynge whome ferdinando whyſpered eare delyuer agayne pontane proceadeth decreed ſhoulde alter publyſhe anye thynge prynte haue laſt aſſemblye touchyng thyng made ſuch aunſwere thought ſufficiēt yet ſame mynd wyll doe nothynge may iuſtly reproued moreouer haue nothynge doe ſectes although doctrine trewe whiche profeſſe yet dyd neuer brynge man compulſion wyll hereafter touchyng anabaptiſtes ſuch doe contempne ſacrament altar neuer ſuffered ſuche kynde men within theyr lymites theyr diuines haue preached agaynſt anabaptiſtes haue alſo bene punyſhed ſuche ſorte ſuche ſectes take roote remayne emonges thē fynally muche matter moſt weyghty importāce whiche verely concerneth eyther euer laſtyng ſaluation damnation loſſe ſoules becauſe ambaſſadours fellowes whiche abſent haue nede aduertyſe thē thinges doe earneſtly beſeche hym graunte copie decree intent may conſider condeſcende vpon aunſwere agaynſte daye next daye emperour ſent worde emp ye proteſt prynce electour brandenburge ſo ſtoutelye affyrme theyr doctryne trewe godly maruell enough conſyderynge howe onlye confuted nowe euen authoritie ſcripture alſo condempned former counſelles longe ſyns marueyleth ſo muche doe aſcrybe vnto hym reſydue prynces errour falſe religion ſhoulde trewe ſaye ſhoulde bothe duke saxon progenitours alſo whiche haue kepte maynteyned ſame religion accompted heretikes wherfore perſwaded graunte theyr doctryne ſhould eſtablyſhed teſtimonye goddes worde ſyngular clemencie loue peace hathe wylled decree thus deuyſed herein hathe abaſed hym ſelfe ouer muche therfore requyreth wyll admytte ſame lyke caſe prynces doe conſyder ſelues vnleſſe ſo doe great occaſion ſhall gyue muche michief whiche ſhal rendre ſtrayght accompte god one daye moreouer howe neuer ſet forth wryting prayer mixt threatnings ſhould lawfull ſpoyle men afterwardes excuſe thus though hath ſuſtayned loſſe ſhoulde make reſtitution concernynge apologie wrytten againſt confutation ſhewed would admytte diſputation relygion muche maye nother part office cauſe hath refuſed vnleſſe wyll allowe confirme decree wyll doe ſhall ſee cauſe thynge whiche ſhall come eſtate office marque ſayde moreouer howe knewe trauell paynes reſte prynces ſtates taken controuerſie myght ended quietly nowe beſought way ſelues howe muche bothe priuate profyte alſo common wealthes obey emperour admitte decree whiche vnleſſe wyll doubtleſſe al ſtates wyl herein ſoeuer themperour ſhal cōmaunde thē haue conſpiracie papiſtes againſte proteſtātes promyſed hym already vpon fidelititie wil quarell ſpende al ſubſtaunce bloud life alſo fyniſhe vp matter hath promyſed theim againe bende hytherwardes force power departe limites empire haue brought paſſe commaunded ſaye muche prynces ſtates agayne proteſtauntes maynteyne theyr doctryne agreable god worde whiche gate hell notable reſiſt ſame declared wryting lately preſēte decree made alowe ſaufe conſcience wherfore thei deſyre haue copie therof intent good deliberation maye frame determinate aunſwere whiche ſhall conformable god worde ſhall permitted al cauſes wyll ſticke ſpende lyfe goodes ſake heare prince ſtates haue bounden ſelues emperour ſuche ſorte little maruell conſyderynge haue giuen none occaſion ſo nothing whiche ready example aunceſters emperour nede requyreth wyll laſt ſayed man ought ſpoyled goodes proteſt ſpoyle mā doe confeſſe ſame alſo herein nothynge culpable touchynge religious houſes haue oftentymes proteſted ſo vſe matter vntyll counſell maye certenly ſene perceyued ſeeke owne priuate lucre commoditie muche deliberation emperour aunſwered agayne marque brandenburge wyl confeſſe graunt baoſte religiō hath alſo regard conſcience ſoules health well wyll cleaue auncient religion olde father decree made nothyng chaunged wyll allowe well good hath occaſion gyuen hym deuyſe reſt decree made wherby theſe newe ſpronge vp ſectes maye plucked vp rote germany ſet vp quietnes aunciēt religion churche fayth cerimonies eſtimation whiche thing belongeth chiefly office dutie except wyll ordered wyll declare hyghe byſhop kynges vſe counſell ayde herein unto ſaie haue gyuen none occaſion offence much obiected preacher great occaſion cōmotion ruſticall warre wherin almoſte hondreth thouſande ſlayne proteſt accuſed ſedition many thinges haue bene done dominion open reproche contempt mockery byſhop rome hym ſtates alſo therfore ſo clere without blame would make moreouer prynces ſtates haue priuate affection according duty offered aſſiſtaunce eſpecially ſeynge howe wyll admitte waye vnitie concorde fynally wylleth cōmaundeth reſtore theyr drone bee deſyre reſtored hyue former eſtate abbottes moūkes eccleſiaſtical perſons whiche haue expulſed heareth dayly complayntes troubled almoſte continuallye reſtitution lytle reſpyte proteſtantes replie thus muche obtayne copie decree tyme conſulte whole matter foly make diſcourſynge thereof wherfore committe whole cauſe vnto god thei repoſe chiefe hope ſaluation charged ſedition common thei vtterly clere matter ſame tyme howe ſpared neither coſt peryll paynes manifeſtly knowen men cauſe originall ſedition declared alſo foure yeares ſynce aſſembly spyres wherfore well done lay thyng charge therein ſuffer iniurie man wyll trye lawe matter refuſe abyde iudgement wherfore beſeche hym woulde conceaue hainous diſpleaſure againſt incenſed wt hatred malice cōſidering al haue well commaundemēt thyng el ſtates thus ſayde axed leaue departed leauing certayne coūſellers deputes went archebyſhoppes mentz excuſe ſome ye proteſtātee trier alſo palſgraue ſent declare vnto ſame electour brandenburg ſpake gening ayde aſſiſtaunce defence religion done without commaundement whiche thynge alſo hyd emperour ſhewyng howe none occaſion ennemitie diſpleaſur againſt wherfore caſe conceaued euyll opinion againſt deſyred leaue prince saxony content purgation bad againe loke al good wyll frendſhyp hande next day gone emperour calleth hym ſtates firſt commaūdeth ambaſſadours city truckeſſe ſhuld departe end aſſemblie declareth bene done duke saxon fellowes becauſe city strauſborough conſtance memmyng lyndaue exhibited ſeuerall byll ſelues ſheweth howe wyll treate lyke caſe debated matter deluge rome selande empyre chiefly turkyſhe warre tyme rome ryuer tiber ouerflowed exceadingly great terrour citie reaſon wynde blewe ſore againſt ſtreame droue backe courſe water ſea wherfore much hurte lyke deluge cruell hollande zelande sea brake ouer walles made kepe thoſe party drowned al countrey farre nere finally xiiij daye octobre whan al ſtates beſydes proteſtauntes called aſſembled courte decree red ambaſſadours city requyryng copye ſayde naye repeted one twyſe al moſte parte allowed auſpurge ulmes hale franckeforth deſyred delyberation eight day deputes duke saxon fellowes declare vnto archebiſhop mentz whiche chief emonge prynces maye haue religion quiet vntill counſell alſo contented become cōtributaries money ayde towardes turkyſhe warre wherfore next daye beyng called courte red certen tenure peace wherin compriſed whiche conſented vnto decree made roſe contention ambaſſadours affirming concerned nothynge howe ought vttered playner wordes take awaye ambiguitie ſaid would moue emperour two dayes emperour ſent home houſe thē strauſborough fellowes ſtates commaundeth cōfutatiō zwilius doctrine confutation doctryne red openly wrytyng long tedious alſo touched lordes ſupper ful bytter ſower author therof john faber eckius becauſe argument odiouſe left kind excuſation wherby kyndle emperour prynces agaynſt ende muche religion profeſſed opinion contrary al reſte allowed moſte heynous errour sacramēt alſo caſt image church abolyſhed maſſe plucked downe college builded tymes paſt lyberalitie kynges emperours maynteyned ſondry ſectes diſperſed bookes wrytten ſuche matter throughout germany therfore requyreth eftſones come amendement receyue agayne auncient religion otherwiſe wyll fayle thing office requireth aunwer long confutation charged many thinges vntrue ther city nothyng aunſwer ſame done ordre ſame extremely punyſhed wherfore ſeing thei clere cōſcience cauſe weightie cōfutation ouerlong aunſwered make certificat home city deſyre fyrſt therfore haue copie ſecondarely credite geuen accuſation ſuche tyme pourgation heard examined matter wyll thyng ſake emperour ſayeth wyll take aduiſement fyſt daye ſhe weth marque brandēburge haue copie weightie cauſes denied ye duke saxony diſputatiō fayth nowe prohibited deſyre reconciled retourne agayne churche content ſhall heare confutation red agayne one twyſe chargeth profeſſe ſame kynde doctrine al prynces ſtates gyue ayde againſt turke vnleſſe forſake theyr ſtubburnes wyll worke counſell byſhop rome kynges ſhal become hym make ſute obtayne copie ſame graunted haue peace quietnes religion tyll begynnynge counſell therin haue cauſe decided wyl meane time geue theyr ayde againſt turke ſo farforth power wyll extende el could graunte nothing maques promyſed petitioner emperour noone red vnto graunt peace wherein conteyned ſuche receiued decree rehearſed deputes duke saxon fellowes wherunto aunſwered lyke caſe ſame touched nothyng deſyred knowe emperours pleaſure herein meane whyle ulmes auſpurge franckeforth halle forſaken decree made concerning religion vrged ſore haue couſel faber eckius craue great rewarde prince makyng confutation promyſe hēceforth beſtowe theyr trauayle defence romyſhe religion dyuerſe others ſought preferment meanes luther dede faber afterwardes kyng ferdinando made byſhop uienne wherupon eraſinus roterdame wont ſay poore luther maketh many men ryche merely howe poore luther made many ryche meane ceaſon saxon fellowes put vp ſupplication emperour intreating hym eſtablyſhe peace throughout empyre man put trouble daunger religiō coulde obtayned wryte epiſtle ſtates makyng brief rehearſall thinge hath bene done deſyryng name prynces put later ende decree emonges reſte muche haue ſued peace vayne ſaye howe graunte none ayde turkyſhe warre ouer prouided decree ſhall haue place iudgement counſell chamber whiche allowe decree made requyre ſame may chaunged amended el beare parte charge whiche chambre requyreth tyme thus denounced departed next daye beyng xij nouembre ſhewed fyft booke howe marque albert brandenburge kyng pole made duke pruſelande emperour beyng ſued vnto walter cronberge diſallowed treatie cōpacte made dammage empyre xiiij daye nouembre pronounceth none effecte fyft daye emperours preſence decree recited ſtates long diſcourſe decree auſpurg handlyng matter emperour decreeth ſhuld longer ſuffered teache otherwyſe lordes ſupper hath bene obſerued hytherto maſſe eyther common priuate nothyng altered chyldren confyrmed chreſme ſycke folkes annoynted oyle conſecrated image remoued taken awaye reſtored opiniō denye man haue fre wyll receyued beaſtly alſo contumeliouſe againſt god nothyng taughte agaynſt authoritie magiſtrate opynion fayth iuſtifieth take place sacramentes church numbre place accuſtomed ceremony churche rite obſequies dead ſuche obſerued benefice vacant imployed vpon mete perſones ſuche prieſtes men clergie whiche haue maried tyme depriued benefice whiche immediatly aſſembly ſhal geuen others ſuche forſakyng theyr wyues wyll retourne olde profeſſion abſolued byſhop may reſtore conſent byſhop rome legate others haue refuge place banyſhed extremely punyſhed prieſtes honeſt conuerſation apparell decent commonly auoyde ſclaunder preacher exhorte people heare maſſe praye virgyn mary ſainctes kepe holy dayes faſting dayes abſtayne meates forbodene releue poore tell monkes howe may forſake theyr profeſſion ordre briefly nothyng altered religion ſhall otherwyſe loſe bodye goodes abbey pulled downe reedified ſoeuer hath bene taken awaye clergie reſtored wonted ceremony rite may accomplyſhed ſuche follower olde religion dwellyng within lymites cōtrary parte allowe decree ſhall receyued protectiō empire ſhall flitte whether lyſte without hynderaunce byſhop rome ſhalbe called vpon apoynte counſell ſome place conuenient within ſyxe monethes afterwarde ſame may begynne ſhortly may furtheſt within yeares ſpace theſe thynges ratified eſtablyſhed al exception appellation made contrary voyde none effect intent decree may take place obſerued cōcerning religion force power god hath geuē ſhalbe wholy applied hereunto lyfe bloude alſo ſpent ſame quarell duryng parliament luther commaundement prynce coburge border frankony intent myght nerer auſpurge caſe matter requyred aduyſe counſell though abſent yet intent myght ſome luth wrote booke ye byſhoppes commō benefit wrote booke byſhoppes prelate aſſemblye wherein ſheweth ſtate churche hath bene vnder byſhop rome wicked doctrine ſhamefull errours moſte weightye wordes admoniſheth thē dutie chargeth cruell bloudy mindes agayne exhorteth let ſlippe occaſion nowe redreſſe euyll ſheweth howe doctrine agreable bookes prophetes apoſtles proueth vaine ſoeuer conſulte imagine againſt god malyce threatheninge emperour byſhops melancthon diſcouraged careful mynde owne cauſe poſterities ſake gaue hym ſelfe wholy penſiuenes wepynge mournynge luther knewe therof comforteth hym luther comforteth melancton ſondrye letter muche mennes matter cauſe almyghtie ggd admonyſhed hym layinge al thought care parte caſte whole burthen vpon hym ſayeth doeſt thou thus afflicte tourment thy ſelfe god hath geuen ſonne v tremble feare doe ſyghe lamente sath ſtronger wil hath geuen v ſo great benefite forſake v lyghter matter whye ſhoulde feare worlde whiche chriſte hath vanquyſhed defende euyll matter doe chaunge pourpoſe cauſe iuſt godlye truſte god promyſes certenly deuyll take v lyfe chriſt liueth reigneth euer whoſe protection conſiſteth veritie wyll ceaſe v vnto worldes ende wyth v beſeche ſhall founde churche doe thynke byſhop rome aduerſaries ſynners dede dynerſe wayes yet chriſte lyer whoſe cauſe haue hande let kynges nation fret fume muche euer lyſte dwelleth heauen ſhall laughe ſkorne god hathe gouerned maynteined cauſe hetherto without counſell ſame ſhall alſo henceforth bryng ende wyſhed luther opinion mistraditions touchyng lawes tradition men wryte aunſwere harde fyrſt cōmaundement al prophetes alſo doe cōdempne ſuche maner workes may bodely exercyſe come one worſhyppyng idolatry agremēt vayne loked neyther depoſe byſhop rome neyther true doctrine ſafetie ſo longe popery ſhall endure wyll haue lordes ſupper communicated wholy geue place aduerſaries whiche holde indifferent doe well arbitremēt decree ſuffer thynge vſed churche whiche hathe god worde beare crye condempne whole churche ſaye churche violently taken oppreſſed tyrannye communion deuided middes therfore holden excuſed whole synagoge excuſed captiuitie babylon kepte lawe church oppreſſed wt tyranny excuſed moſes ceremony beyng force prohibited coulde doe take hede wyſe graunt byſhops ouer muche iuriſdiction leſt trouble enſue hereafter treaty concorde doctryne cleane agaynſt mynde labour ſpent vayne vnleſſe byſhop rome woulde abolyſhe kyngdome condempne doctryne whye ſeeke vniformitie allowe mainteyne olde errours condemyne openly wherfore diſſimulation falſhode whatſoeuer go labour ſore appereth ceremony let fyrſt reſtore doctryne fayth workes let ſuffer churche haue miniſters wyll doe dutie requyre monkes maye ſet agayne papiſts accuſed rerages poſſeſſion let reſtore v agayne ſo manye innocent godly men haue murthered let reſtore ſo many ſoules deſtroied wicked doctrine let thē reſtore thoſe great rycheſſe gotten fraude diſceiptfully let thē reſtore god glory ſo many contumely diſhonored whan ſhall haue made ſatiſfactiō theſe thynges ſhall talke vnto whome poſſeſſion bucer laboreth cō corde belongeth luther certen others differed opinion touching lordes ſupper whiche catholykes reioyſed reſt muche lamented bucer duke saxon procurement went auſpurge luther agrement receyued ſuche aunſwere miſlyked ſo much went thēce zwynglius zwycers intent might ioyned nerer mynde opinion ſtate thynges ſtoode thus full diſpleaſure lantgraue maketh league ſyxe yeares city zuricke baſill strauſborough lantgraue made league wt strauſbotough zurick baſyn attempted force religion ſhoulde ayde one concluded nouembre ſame tyme emperour addreſſeth letter duke saxon commaunding collon xxi decembre certen weightie affayres common wealth whiche receiued ſame xxviii nouembre ſame daye came meſſenger letter archebiſhop mentz wherein wrytten emperour required hym cal aſſemblie prince electours create kyng romaynes wherfore cited appeare collon xxix decembre appertaineth byſhops office hath bene declared whiche thinge one knowen duke saxon diſpatchyng letter lantgraue prynces city proteſtantes prayeth exhorteth mete smalcalde xxii decembre neuertheleſſe meane tyme ſendeth ſpedely collon iohn frederick ſonne hym certen priuie counſell daye appoynted emperour whome declareth citation archebiſhop mentz rightly orderly done creation king romaine right libertie empyre infrynged alſo lawe charles fourth broken wherfore wyl allowe ratifie enterpriſe aſſembled smalcalde deuiſe league offenſiuely league proteſtantes smalcalde defenſiuely unto ſubſcribed immediatly prince moreouer albert gebart erles manſſteld maidenborough bremen strauſborough ulmes cōſtance lindaue mē ming cāpedowne heilbrune ruteling biberack iſne receiue ſuch ſorte firſt infourme city therof within ſyx wekes make directe anſwere wil herein furthermore decreed follicite ambaſſadours king denmarke duke pomerane megelbourg city embeck northēme franckfourth brunſwick gotinge minda hannobria hildeſſeme lubecke stetine hauon townes byſhop rome vnderſtode yt end aſſemblie auſpurg cōplait pope kynge poole wrote letter kyng pole others truſted aſſuredly authoritie preſence emperour ſhould either haue quenched quieted luther hereſie vpō hope cauſe chiefly came mete emperour bononie intent might encourage forward notwithſtanding owne accorde wel willing thing ben brought paſſe religiō bene ſtaied many men ſoules ſaued hereſie nowe daūger might remedy haue ben foūd againſt turkiſh fury vnderſtādeth al well thēperours alſo letter legate wiſe reformed waxed alſo obdurate yt wyll god gouerneth ſhyp peter time ſo tēpeſtuouſe ſuſteyneth greateſt part whole care ſame conſultinge wt pope ſayler cardinal cāfinde better remedy thā predeceſſours haue vſed yt general coūſel wherfore doth admoniſh hym ſynce matter brought iſſue either hym ſelfe preſentlye el hys deputes woulde ſo holye cauſe entendeth ſo ſhortly may appoynte one italy ſome place conuenient theſe letter dated firſt daye december xxiiii daye decembre prynces confederated smalcalde proteſtauntes letter againſt ferdinando wryte vnto emperour howe heare commonly bruted pourpoſeth create brother ferdinando kynge romaynes maketh great ſute ſame authoritie ryght prince electours haue herein lawe charles fourth howe emperour dead choſen name whole empyre knowen men notwithſtandinge alyue helth ſuche chaunce happened howe archebyſhop hath cited collon againſt preſcripte lawe agaynſt cuſtome empyre heare moreouer howe reſidue electours wyll come thyther requeſte accomplyſhe ſute ferdinando conuenaunt promyſe report ſpread farre neare wherfore haue thought good admoniſhe hym certen thynges al leuer abſtayne ſuche kynde talke yet muche loue hym theyr conntrey eſpeciallye lybertie therof haue receyued aunceſters agayne becauſe later ende worlde many thinges done captiouſly craſtely otherwyſe doe fyrſt therfore knoweth ryght well circumſpectly howe depely wordes bondes bounde hym ſelfe empyre gaue fayth othe woulde obſerue lawe carolyne whereupon lybertie empyre chiefly dependeth howe promyſed cōfirmeth othe yt would neither ſelf thing againſt ſuffer certenly theſe conuenauntes may infrynged broken chaunged without conſent aduyſe ſtates nowe caſe lyfe proſperitie kyng romanes ſhuld choſen naturall brother makynge ſuite labour ſeeth hym ſelfe howe directly againſte lawe againſte ryght lybertie empyre agaynſte promyſe conuenaunt fayth oweth common wealth confyrmed ſolemne othe moreouer howe incommodiouſe alſo hym howe chargeable whole empyre haue two ruler one tyme whome muſt obeye becauſe woulde ſory ſuche thynge ſhoulde layde charge breakynge fidelytie alſo vnto ſloughtſulnes defending cō mon wealth therfore erneſtly beſeche impute writing loue coūtrey world would call remembraunce thynges paſt office aucthoritie prohibite creation new kinge woulde conſyder well wyth hym ſelfe many euils miſchiefes thinge wyll hereafter geue occaſion vnleſſe forſeen ſignifyeng howe wryte alſo touching ſame matter reſydue electours truſting wyll worke profit cō mon wealth endeuour diuiſion made amonges ſtates empyre reſt doe muche ſake habilitie power wyl extende afterwardes duke saxon writeth ſeuerall letter prynces hys college muche ſomoned collon arche duke saxon letter prince byſhop mentz therfore hath ſent thither ſonne certen coūſayle ſhal name ſhalbe requiſite requireth leaue enterpriſe waye ſelues preiudice diſcommoditie wilbe vnto thē al theyr poſteritie breake right libertie honour empyre deſyreth alſo ſuche thinges ſonne counſellours haue treate woulde ſo vſe ſelues may appeare perceiued loue common wealth countrey duke lunēburge lantgraue counte anhald erles manſfelde wrote vnto electours ſame time long letter ſame effect admoniſhing righte erneſtlye doe ſuche open wronge lawes countrey ſayeng howe reported matter handled brybes promeſſes whiche alſo openly agaynſt lawe caroline laſte decembre well prince city named cōmon aſſent wryte letter emperour wherin recite treatie religion auſpurge long ſued peace aunſwer made alſo maner decree made afterwarde al ſelfe mitigate wordes electour brandēburge affirming made compact reſt prince owne defence offende others yet authoritie committed chambre imperiall decree purporteth whome doubtful ſame thinge apperteyneth force violēce ſeyng aūceſters haue ſhewed many teſtimonies great good wyll progenitours beſeche muche hath mitigated ſaying electour brandenburge woulde alſo qualifie deede take away terrour confiſcation intent may aſſured vntyll ende godlye free counſell ſhall nede feare violence cauſes emperour alledged create king romains firſt cōmunication wt prince collō theſe firſt becauſe cauſes creating kyng romaine ye rule ſondry realmes nation could always germany agayne yt ſtate chriſtendom troubleſome namely germany reaſon diſſention religion violent power turkes late ſedition rurall warre diſobedience within empyre wherfore thought neceſſary profit common wealth ſhould kyng romaynes choſen vnder hym head empyre abſence ſhould wyttie cyrcumſpect induſtrious great power loued peace concorde ſkilfull matter empyre euery poynte ſuche one myght repoſe whole truſte
