confidēce knoweth none mete charge brother ferdinando king boheme hongary realmes dominion defence vnto germany againſt turkyſhe oultrage prince electours delyberation intreate emperour woulde forſake germany ſette plante himſelfe perſiſteth ſtiffe opinion conferrynge counſels together fyft daye ianuary proclayme ferdinando kynge romaynes duke saxon muche laye hym ſonne proteſted election faultie ſhewed cauſes coulde allowe longe departed auſpurge brute ferdinando ſhould obtayne dignitie afterwardes went collon aquon ferdinādo crowned kyng xvj day ianuary ferdinando proclaimed kyng romaine ſtreightwayes letter diſpatched al partes germany ſignifie ſame ceſar alſo commaundeth letter patentes men ſhall acknowledge kyng romaine therof ſent ſeueral letter proteſtantes done aquon emperour wēt bruſſel brabant ✚ eyght booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument eyght booke proteſtauntes smalcalde ſent letter kinges fraunce englande agaynſt ſondry falſe reportes ſollicite kyng denmarcke city ſea coaſte entre league league swycers admitted kyng fraunce deſcended almaines aunſwereth letter ſo doeth alſo kynge englande ſtrife creation kyng ferdinando aſſemble holden franckforth alſo debated controuerſic betwixt byſhop bamberge george marque brandenburge emperour appointeth metyng spyre whether duke saxon moued come excuſeth hym ſelfe condition put wryting whiche graunted proteſtauntes offer ſelues fyue canton geue battell ʒ uricke wherein ʒ wynglius ſlayne shortly dieth ecolampadius peace graunted proteſtauntes vntyll counſell chriſtierne kyng denmarke committed pryſon turke inuadeth auſtryche thence repulſed pope ambaſſadour ſent duke iohn fredericke lately ſuccedeth father condition counſell duke aſſociates deliberation make hym 〈◊〉 full aunſwere wryting firſt aſſembly smalcalde emōges thynges agreed vppon muche aduerſaries aggrauate cauſe profeſſion goſpell manye ſclaunders broughte euerye great hatred ſhoulde wryte pryncipally kynges fraunce englande would credite perſwaded herin proteſt letter kynges fraunce englande wherfore xvj daye february proteſtauntes wryte ſeuerall letter one effecte knowe vndoubtedly olde complaint hath bene long tyme concernyng vice faultes clergie whiche many notable men late memory fraunce iohn gerſon englande gerſon collet iohn colet haue ſore noted reprehended ſame thing hath happened late yeares germany certen freers wēt indulgence pardōs whiche ſo highly cōmended great contumelie chriſte leſſe daunger men ſaluation yt got ſhameful vnreaſonable gayne therby gētly admonyſhed certen good wel learned men thei ſhould ſo abſtayne ſuche vſage alſo cruelly condempned heretykes whiche gaue good counſell ſo muche conſtrayned ſtande defence trewthe vpon whyche occaſion many thynges eſpyed reprehē ded aduerſaries whiche impudent marchādiſe gaue occaſion offence woulde neuer quiet tyll doctryne whiche reuealyng crafty iuglyng without dewe examination condempned wycked intent might wholy oppreſſe haue brought great hatred emperour kynges neuertheſſe truthe breakyng lyke ſonne beames diſcouered faultes moſte manifeſtly whiche euyl cuſtomes prepoſterous iudgementes crepte churche ſo muche could denied byſhop rome hym ſelfe whē bene exhibyted emperour ſtates empyre aſſemblie wormes bene treated aſſemblies empyre men iudging certentie reformation therof waye better free lawfull counſell wherewith emperour alſo content commyng spayne germany italy addicted wholy auſpurge quiet matter without counſel ſo thei diſcourſe whole treaty auſpurge hath bene reherſed howe ſore decree made compelled appeale free godly coūſell leſt ſhould haue hurt theyr conſcience offended god moſte greuouſly afterwardes thei confute appelation falſe opinion ſclaunders theyr aduerſaries aſcribe vnto bryng hatred men chieſlye doctrine whiche profeſſe againſt authoritie magiſtrates dignity lawes confeſſion exhibited auſpurge doth fully aunſwere matter wheren office ſtate magiſtrate theyr doctrine declared god ordinaūce agayne people taught owe due obedience magiſtrate god cōmaundement cōſcience ſake ſo may truly ſayde learned men tyme doctrine haue hyghly commēded dignitie lawes magiſtrates former age hath done el ſeing alſo appointed god haue rule gouernment others madnes thē permitte doctrine whiche ſhould geue licencious lybertie take awaye obedience ſtyre vp people againſt wherfore dyuers thynges ſaye howe ſo much theſe ſclaunders reported howe forceth much cōmon wealth chriſtendome beyng kynges ſuch wyſdome authoritie ſhould ryghtly infourmed matter therfore haue thought good owne purgatiō wryte much vnto earneſtly deſyring geue credit vnto ſclaū ders conceaue ſiniſtre opinion keepe theyr iudgement ſuſpence tyll may come place make theyr purgation openly whiche thing chiefly deſyre beſeche alſo exhorte emperour weyghty importaunce matter profit whole churche would call godly free counſell germany ſo ſhortly myght woulde worke extremitie againſt vntyll ſuche tyme cauſe may lawfully decided determyned hitherto haue alwayes done duty common wealth empyre nowe profeſſe doctrine brought daunger ſelfe wyll obſtinacie god worde glory whereby haue better hope alſo wyll graunte theyr requeſtes herein hyghe prayſe worthy coulde throughe theyr aucthoritie mediation bryng paſſe theſe controuerſies decided force armes vpryght iudgement abuſes maye remoued church reconciled force violence done vnto men conſciences finally maye vnderſtande letter theyr good wylles towardes ſhall theyr great cōforte february duke saxon ſummoneth fellowes smalcade xxix marche cō ſulte howe reſiſte force ennemies thynge attēpted againſte thoſe prynces city mentioned duke diſcraſed ſent thether ſonne iohn frederick former meting agreed ſollicite fredericke kyng deumarke city ſea coaſte saxonie touchynge league nowe met agayne reherſall made bene done meane tyme aunſwere euery one made kyng dede ſaide howe fauoured doctrine goſpel realme ſo many biſhoppes great biſhops dēmarke reſute goſpell power aucthoritie reaſon rycheſſe clientes noble kyndred coulde enter league kyng concernyng countreis lieng within empyre contēt henry duke megelburge excuſed matter deputes ſubſcribed decree auſpurge notwithſtandinge would ennemy berninus prince pomerane againſt elder brother yet maner yt whole gouernment lubecke refuſed muche bene great charge warres deſyred ſame myght conſydered fortuned chriſterne kyng dē marke whome thei holpe dryue realme ſhould warre againſt deſyred knowe ayde ſhould looke agayne theyr handes citie lunenbourge ſayde loke theyr duke erneſt would doe ſo woulde alſo afterwarde conſulted geuyng theyr voice ſodayne ayde leuieng money continuall ayde chouſyng captaines receiuing thoſe would ſame league appointed theyr attourneis aduocates aunſwere lawe emperour ſhould attempte ſute againſt parte defence adioyned ſelues george marque brandē burge norinberge campedowne heilprune league refuſed decreed moreouer open crymes ſhould puniſhed eche man dominion league made toke aduyſe counſell lawyer alſo diuines luther taught alwayes myght reſiſte magiſtrate ſet forth boke ſame matter lawyer conſultation dyd affyrme howe lawes permitte lawes permitte yt inferiour magiſtrate maye ſom caſes reſiſt yt ſuperiour ſome caſes reſiſte howe nowe come ſame point lawes made mencion luther confeſſed playnlye knewe lawfull becauſe goſpell doeth impugne abolyſhe polityke lawes hathe alwayes taught agayne muche doubtful daūgerous tyme many thynges may happen ſo lawe ſelfe alſo force conſcience neceſſitie may dryue v take weapon ſayeth howe make league owne defence whether emperour hym ſelfe name ſhoulde moue warre againſt booke alſo ſet forth declareth firſte howe obſtinate romiſhe ſyde conuocation auſpurge ſecondly warneth men generall obeye magiſtrate commaunding take hande ſuche warre reciteth manye moſte deteſtable errours romyſhe doctryne whiche ſayth mainteined warre thoſe campes wherein ſayeth great wickednes ſheweth alſo howe greatly men myndes lyghtened knowledge goſpell warnyng men tempre ſelues entryng wycked warres appoyted metynge frankefurte fourth daye iune wherein ſhould determyne whether zurick berne baſyll ſhoulde receyued league without exception opinion doctrine city make determinate anſwer touchyng preparation defence alſo aunſwer framed meane tyme duke saxon emperours letter wylling take ferdinādo kyng romanes thynge wil graunte whyleſt yet smalcalde receyued letter emperoure pourportinge howe newes yt turkes cō myng great turke comyng exceading great armie inuade germany wherfore charged without exception prepare ayde reſiſte make aunſwere howe wyll thenſample progenitours refuſe charge dutie owe cōmon wealth knoweth threatning wordes marque brandenburge ſpake vnto auſpurge name reſt prynces thynges decreed againſt howe haue ſynce ſewed vnto hym peace get graunte anſwere wherfore ſende ayde agaynſt turke whan obtayne peace home dryuen loke dayly outlawyng violence vnarme ſelues cut owne ſenewes howe wyll graunte peace quietnes frō lawe ciuile warre religion vntyll tyme counſell wyll doe agayne theyr partes turkyſhe warre alſo affayres concerne common wealth thynge whiche ſhall dutie requeſting ſignifie vnto ſame ambaſſadours mynde pourpoſe herein moneth marche rychard archebyſhop treers departed lyfe archebyſhop treers departeth without ſuſpicion poyſon one houſe racked ſame conſtance ſtoutenes eſcaped daaunger byſhop great authorite emonges electours experience frankenes ſpeakyng whan ulmes aſked leaue senate strauſborough bucer went thether bucer ſet order yt church uimes ſet ordre church preſcrybing forme religion aduyſe counſell oecolampadius ambroſe blanrer tyme lady mary emperours ſyſter maried lewys kyng hongary came flaunders emperour made regent baſe countreis place hys quene hungary made regēt flaūders aunte margaret lately departed clement ſeuenth ſute alphonſe duke farrare city rhegio mutina length makyng compromiſſe put emperours arbitrement ſame tyme brabant gaue ſentence duke farrare frenche kyng aunſwereth letter prince city proteſtauntes xxi aprill deſyreth aunſwere frēch kyng proteſtauntes nothing concorde europe right glad alſo bende ſame waye couet haue counſel ſame appeareth vnto hym profitable alſo ryght neceſſary ſo ofte chaunceth talke refourming cō mon wealth iudgeth alwayes thatthere ſurer foundation holy ſpyrit vtterer truthe myght caſe preſident whereunto others would geue lyke conſent place myght aſſigned counſell voyde daunger ſuſpicion euery man myght ſpeake minde frely nothyng chief geuen affection dede good hope ſhould well carefull leſt ſhould beare leſſe good wyll reaſons ſclaunders aduerſaries nede afrayde wont credit thynges lightlye reported ennemies ſeing ſo great ſo auncient frendſhyp betwene kynges fraunce prynces empyre vngentylnes ally frendes cō ceaue amitie fraunce germa ſiniſtrall opinion eſpeciall harde muche ſetteth olde amitie hereby well perceyued tyme hath warre emperour yet haue germaynes citezens empyre free acceſſe fraunce libertie paſſe thence againe whan marchaundiſe buſines done muche owne pleaſure home ſo muche fraunce may well called manſion place prynces citezens germany al theſe thynges cōmonly knowen yet ſo great occaſiō ſhall ſerue wyl muche caſe profeſſe ſhall refuſe decree free godly counſell haue controuerſie decided waye diſputation rather yt ſworde lyke theyr requeſte ſo ſemeth vnto alſo honeſte profitable common wealth whiche ſhall ſuffer great miſfortune caſe matter come handſtripes ſpeaketh familiaritie alliaunce betwyxt fraunce germanye thus ſtory yt kyng fraunce germanes franconie bordering vpon swaues time paſt makyng inuaſiō gawles ſubdued people treers gelderlande cleauelande ſo terwen tourney vanquyſhed amiens beanuois soiſſons ſetlinge ſelues laſt parte gawles yet called fraunce vnto day chief citie wherof paris many kynges reigned enlarged dominiō laſt gouernemēt cam vnto pipine alſo ſonne charles worthy actes called charlemaigne people ſaluted hym charles great tytle emperour auguſte poſſeſſed germany italy fraunce afterwarde ſonne lewis ofſpryng kinges fraunce wherunto kyng fraunces doth aſcribe originall ſayeth howe lineally deſcended ſtocke frankons ſame perſwaſions vſed alſo tyme death emperour maximilian ſeke dignitie empyre knowyng aūcient lawe ſtraūger myght attayne crown imperiall went alſo proue hym ſelfe germayne dede laſte kynge fraunce heyremales charlemaigne lewys fifte died without iſſhewe yeare grace nyne hōdreth foure ſcore eyght whan poſſeſſion kingdome lewys fyfte remained ſame familie two hondreth eight thyrty yeares death ſucceſſion deſcended ryght charles duke lorayne vncle kyng lewys hughe capet hugh capet erle paris reporte whoſe mother fetched petygrewe great charles diſcomfiting takynge duke lorayne pryſoner vſurped kyngdom left ſonne robert whoſe heyres male continued afterwardes vntill kyng fraunces ſaye howe hughe capet lowe baſe hyrth moſte parte wryters frenche cronicles recite originall haue ſayde heretofore henry eight kyng england writeth agayne thyrde day maye hath anſwer kynge england red letter great cōtentation muche inclined bent true religion remayning ſtyll ſaufe peace conſerued faultes abuſes churche clergie maye refourmed ſuche thynges redreſſed haue bene eyther wyckednes ignoraunce men corrupted depraued moreouer howe toke great diſpleaſure reade ouer whole diſcourſe procead inge reporte dede went good though ſhould maynteine certen franticke perſonnes whiche ſought diſturbé tourmoyle thynges vpſyde downe gaue therunto credite firſt becauſe chriſtiā charitie doth ſo requyre ſecondly knowyng certentie ſuche kynde ſclaunder take place mē ſuche dignitie nobilitie wyſdome would neuer haue beleued anye ſuche reporte certenly tried knowen true yet muche haue thus pourged ſelues glad thys cauſe diſceaued opinion iudgement deſyre refourmation doe agree mynde opinion good men ſtate worldly thynges ſuche ſorte lyke man body ſo alſo cō mune wealth publique adminiſtration nede continual remedy wherfore deſerue great prayſe lay ſuch medicine commō wealth hath nede many remedy wyll ſo heale cure diſeaſe doe brynge outrage matter doubteth endeuoure tendeth ſame ende notwithſtanding howe nede take diligent care ſorte men ſeke alteration woulde haue men lyke brynge magiſtrate contempt hath certen ſecte within realme whiche came thether germany becauſe letter mētioned obedience vnto magiſtrates therfore thought good admoniſhe fewe wordes geue man ouermuche lybertie beware ſeke reformation ſhall doubtles doe hygh ſeruice vnto common wealth howe alſo deſyreth chiefly generall counſell beſechyng god ſtyre vp harte prynces vnto deſyre hath ſo good hope thynges nothyng wyll glad doe ſakes wyll peticioner emperour meanes peace concorde may founde wyll worke ſo herein ſelues ſhall tyme tyme thinke beſt theyr purpoſe daye came aſſemblie franckefourth ambaſſadours city agreed vppon declare thought touchyng creation kyng romanes long conſultation founde expedient title ſtyle king opinſō city kynge romains ferdinando enter ſute trouble ſo long emperour lyueth within lymites empyre whole power abſence commeth dede ferdinando depute lieutenaunt emperour haue ſondry tymes promyſed ſo euer laye power nowe caſe ſhould reſiſte creation kynge many woulde iudge promeſſe vayne therfore would beare thē leſſe good wyll woulde alſo worke againſt whiche el woulde haue done nothyng al againſt cauſe religion alſo feared leſt ſuche would haue ioyned ſelues vnto league wyll affcayde nowe withdrawe ſelues yt cauſe may againſt election kyng ferdinando holde indifferent ferdinando ſhall commaūde thyng cō trary god worde wyll obeye attēpte force wyll worke preſcripte league defend vttermoſte power prynces wrote vnto emperour ferdinando could allowe thing done againſt cuſtome lybertie empyre attrybute vnto hym tytle kyng romaynes duke saxon letter emperour added moreouer matter duke saxon doubte yt swycers might lawfully vſed would vnlyke aunceſtours concernyng swycers whome citie would gladly haue receyued league duke saxon anſwered ambaſſadours muche contrary opinion touchyng lordes ſupper myght haue fellowſhyp howe muche eſtemed ſtrengthe power ignoraunt myght haue reſpect vnto leſt ſhoulde come euyll ende scripture witneſſeth haue chaunced vnto thoſe whiche defence haue cared ayde haue ſought durynge aſſemblie letter brought duke lantgraue ambaſſadours prince city pourportyng howe archebiſhop mentz lewys palſgraue yt archbyſhop mentz interceſſonrs palſgraue leaue emperour treate peace requeſted letter graunte alſo ſame woulde appoynte tyme mete deliberation ambaſſadours aunſwere contended wherfore duke lantgraue made reporte agayne howe miſliked ſo proceſſe lawe myght ceaſe meane tyme hauing firſt obteyned emperour appointed daye laſt ſauing one moneth auguſte wigande byſhop bamberge controuerſy byſhop bā berge marque brandenburg certen yeares complayned fellowes sweuicall league george marque brandenburge certen wrōges iniuries whiche done vnto hym hynderynge eccleſiaſticall iuriſdiction lyuing compellinge prieſtes thys falſe kynde doctrine refuſed erpulſynge imployinge churche goodes prophane vſes muche contrary equitie iuſtice againſt decree biſhop rome emperour requyreth according league would ayde aſſiſte hym herein wherfore yeare moneth iulye daye appoynted norlinge hearynge matter whether came requeſt marque ambaſſadours proteſtantes byſhops ſide byſhops auſpurge wircinburg aeſter coadiutours counſellours plantife propounded charged iniuries requiring iudges procede gyue ſentence preſcripte league defendaunt thinges cō cerning religion iuriſdiction eccleſiaſticall put appellation appellation marque wherein appealed decree iudgement generall counſell iudges ſayde howe would admitte theyr ſentence geuen cauſe concerne marque george alſo nephewe albert whiche worde meane tyme emperour calleth counſell imperiall spyres ides septembre appeaſyng controuerſie religion eleuenth kalendes septembre came vnto duke saxon erles naſſowe nuenar men great authoritie nobilitie vertue emperours priuitie moue reconciliation erles naſſowe neuenar treate hym fyue thynges lordes supper cerimonies churche churche goodes ayde nedeful againſt turke election king ferdinādo appered wordes emperour perſwaded allowed doctrine zwinglius opinion anabaptiſtes aunſwereth kynde doctrine miniſters doe preache teache ryght well knowen confeſſiō exhibited auſpurg pourpoſeth god grace remayne duryng lyfe neuer anabaptiſtes greatly zwinglians deſired thē pourge herein emperour ſayd knew ſo neuertheleſſe woulde declare ſo emperour doubt would glad ioyfull heare reſte theyr demaundes agreed ſhould differred vntyl next aſſemblie empyre whether deſyre hym eyther come ſelfe ſende ſonne ſayeth howe woulde glad gratifie emperour thynges aged vnhable trauayle beſydes certen weyghtie cauſes whiche neyther come hym ſelfe ſende ſonne vnleſſe emperour wyll graunte ſaufe conduicte hym trayne upon condition duks saxon wyll come aſſemble agayne ſo euer ſhall become want preaching god worde haue preſcribed hym certen kinde meate furthermore diſputation ſhall touchyng religion requyſite bryng hym luther others whiche muſte alſo haue ſaufecouduicte fynally howe hathe oftentymes made ſuite emperour inueſted owne dukedome cuſtome empyre thynges whiche coulde neuer obtayn made many fayre promyſes nowe laſte aſſemblie auſpurge fridericke palſgraue interceſſours proteſtant aunſwered ſo name eaſely appeare emperour ſore offended hym vpon whiche conſyderations come vnleſſe maye mediation obtayne emperours ſaufe conduicte dewe ſeaſon wyll come without fayle later ende auguſte ambaſſadours archebyſhop mentz palſgraue mette ambaſſadours proteſtauntes smalcalde ſpeakynge muche loue zeale theyr prince bare theyr countrey ſeynge coulde agree auſpurge conſyderynge great daunger myght enſue diſſention would neuer reſte tyll emperour graunted leaue treate peace wherfore thought good call agayne queſtion ſuche thynges coulde agreed vpon auſpurge begynne lefte others ſaye agayne howe proteſtauntes knewe thynges ſhould propounded therfore gaue certen commiſſion determyne thyng wylled ſende home wrytinge ſealed whiche ſhoulde propounded ſo muſt none otherwyſe whan much altercation wordes could otherwyſe cōclude laſt agreed ſhould mete spyres daye whiche interceſſours ſhould aſſigne pleaſure duke lantgraue herein knowen ought dede ſo ſhortly myght name ſelues fellowes ſignifie mynde therin letter yt duke lantgraue interceſſours decreed ſeconde daye septembre beginnyng octobre duke lantgraue wrote archbyſhop palſgraue repetinge treaty ambaſſadours ſayde declare howe coulde good done therein without diuines howe continewe iin ſame religion ſtyll whiche profeſſed auſpurge aſſemblies emperour abſent nowe alſo late preſent counſell promyſed whiche ſhoulde forthwith called commenced truſted emperour would ſhortly procure one germany wherein fellowes open doctrine large meane tyme beſeche meanes emperour extremitie wrought within empyre ſuche nowe hereafter ſhall profeſſe goſpell may lyue quiet vntyll ſuche tyme decree authoritie lawfull counſell may determine matter ſhall thynke good treate howe conclude peace appointe daye wyll ſende theyr ambaſſadours thither theyr doctrine exhibited auſpurg man ſhall thynke fynde errour wyll ſhewe cannot proue ſtande teſtimony scripture would fellowes glad ſhall pleaſe emperour aſſigne daye spire graunting ſaufe conduicte fellowes luther whome intende bryng amonges miniſters churche wyll permitte haue free open preachinges god worde vſe lordes supper according vnto chriſtes inſtitution preſcribyng difference choyce meates wyll either come themſelues el ſende theyr deputes large commiſſion make declaration doctryne vnto men ſame metyng theyr doctryne scripture confuted truſte emperoure wyll moleſte may ſtyll perſeuer ſame religion muche haue appealed lawfull general counſell yet nothyng founde theyr doctrine agaynſt god worde alſo order lawe equitie duryng appellation extremitie ought ſhewed vnto partie appealleto truſt emperour wyll rather theyr requeſtes ſuffor germany haue peace quietnes ſhewed aſſemblye ſhould haue bene septembre spyres emperour aduertiſed ſondry letter meſſengers turkyſhe preparation prorogeth ſame moneth ianuary followynge appoyntynge place regenſpurge myghte ſo muche nearer auſtriche perceyued warre woulde ſhewed ſyrt booke howe warre whiche zurycke berne would warres swycerlāce haue made vppon fyue townes pacifyed interceſſion city yeare sore brake agayne thoſe two city ſteppynge ſtreightes paſſages woulde permitte victuall brought vnto dayes longeſt great trouble lyke enſue therof condicions peace frenche kyng certen cyties suyſſes laboured take vp matter drewe certen condition peace vaine zuricke berne declare wryting great wronges iniuries cōſtreyned ſtop victualles muche refuſe cōdicions peace whiche interceſſours haue deuiſed propounded declare malicious harte againſt howe haue brokē fourmer conuenauntes made betwene wherfore lawefull cut • theyr victualles hurte come therof ought aſcribed vnto whiche ſeeke nothyng elles diſſention nynth daye septembre tyme theſe fyue townes great want penury nynth octobre armed ſelues ſecretly marched forwarde man ware come vnto border zurick laye garriſon thouſand men ſent diuerſe meſſengers citie warne men come ſpede ennemies approched ſo faſte coulde hardely come reſkewe come toppe hylle whereby muſt nedes paſſe ſawe theyr men great daūger next valley exhorting incouraginge one ranne downe hyll myght go foremoſte nature hylle ſuche coulde one go downe one whiche cauſe coulde marche ordre battell greater multitude vanquyſhed put flyghte eleuent daye octobre amonges nombre thei zarick diſconfited ſlayne zwynglius maner zuricke go forth warfaye chief miniſter theyr churche goeth zwynglius alſo hym ſelfe beynge man ſtoute bolde courage conſyderyng ſhoulde rary home death zwyng ſhoulde go worſe diſpleaſare ſhould ſuſteyne one sermon woulde encourage others hym ſelfe faynte whan daunger would nedes take ſuch •• te ſhewed great crueltie vpon dead corp hatred towardes ſo muche theyr malice ſatiſfied beaſtlye cruelite death fourty foure yeares olde foure yeares yonger luther ſame moneth auguſt ſeen blaſyng starre ſame tyme died lewys frenche kynges mother ſyſter vnto charles duke sauvy citie berne hearyng ouerthrowe comforted zuricke promyſing ſende ayde come whole power auenge ennemies whan commen together whiche aboute eight daye battell berne whiche deſyred take matter hande alone nothyng haſty citie zuricke whiche ayde ſent schaffuſians mulluſians alſo sangall baſill whole numbre choſe certen enſeignes whiche ſettynge foorth nyghte laye hylle beſydes mencinge pourpoſynge whan moue roſe take towne tugie thereby vpon ſodayne theyr ennemies whiche encamped ſelues farre thence knowynge eſpeiall went thether ſpedely ſet vpon beynge ſlepe xxiiij daye october put greater feare made wonderfull clamourous outcrye many ſlayne ſlaughter partes fyue townes vpperhande yet woulde zuricke nothyng relent religion laſt mediation peace concluded whereunto added zuricke berne baſill ſhould forſake league whiche latelye made cytie strauſborough lantgraue lykewyſe ſhoulde fyue townes breake league kyng ferdinando hereof obligation made ſealed later ende nouember oecolampadius departed preſente lyfe ſuppoſed inwarde ſorowe death oecolampadius thought conceaued death swynglius whome loued intierly wanted one yeare fifty workes written vpon certen prophetes whiche learned men muche commended xxix daye december ambaſſadours proteſtauntes mete agayne frankeforte finiſhe vp reſt concernyng preparation defence aſſemblie city goſlarie embecke receiued league litle fore alſo eſlyng george marque brandenburgh citie norinberg campedown hailbrune abſent profeſſe ſame religion yet league emperour begynning ianuary toke iourney bruſelles go regenſpurge aſſemblie mentioned waye came mentz begynnynge aſſemble regē ſpurge february archebyſhop palſgraue intreate hym agayne peace whiche emperour grauntinge vnto aduertyſe duke saxon lantgraue wyllynge doe lyke wherfore theyr letter ſent fro appoynte mete schwinfurte towne imperiall ryuer moene begynning apryll dyd begynne treate peace whiche ſhoulde continue vnto generall counſell prynces interceſſours preſent ordre geuen emperour propounde theſe condition beſydes writyng exhibited auſpurge touching religion ſhould alter nothing teache nothyng publyſhe thing condition peace betwene emperour proteſt remayne thoſe boundes vntyll tyme counſell ſo haue nothyng doe zwynglianes annabaptiſtes neither occaſion religion allure vnto thē prynces ſubiectes permitte miniſters preache owne countrey abſtayne wordes reproche diſturbe iuriſdiction rytes ceremony churche geue ayde agaynſt turke obey decree empyre whiche concerne common wealthe politike gouernaunce obedient emperour kynge romaynes haue made league againſte emperour kyng ſtates contrary religion abolyſhe ſame wyl thus truſte emperour king wyll leaue forget diſpleaſure paſte duke ſent thether ſonne iohn fridericke ſelfe ſore ſicke alſo fraunces duke lunenburg counte anhalde agayn ambaſſadours prynces city whereunto came alſo nortuſians halbeſtans swelande muche debatyng interceſſours aduertiſe letter emperour whole matter aſſemblie ratiſbonne knowe pleaſure matter unto demaunde whiche duke saxon fellowes ſhould obey kyng romains wryte aunſwere emperour lacke fynde woulde requyre hym doe therein deliuered ſame ſealed interceſſours xvij daye apryll effect wherof ferdinando ſhould take vpon hym kyng romaine caſe emperour nede coadiutour aduyſe counſell prynces electours ſhould ſo interprete lawe caroline makyng acte therof euer ye myght done lawefully ſorte longe emperour lyueth condition creatinge kynge romaynes ſhould neuer hereafter choſen kynge romaine vnleſſe ſeuen prince electours ſixe prynces empyre ioyned iudge ſo mete done tyme ſhall appeare profite common wealth archebyſhop mentz ſhall appointe reſt electours ſyxe prynces mete place conuenient conſultation therin whan ſhall haue conſidered whole matter diligently prynces electours kyng boheme ſhall haue authoritie electe kyng romaynes ſo long emperour lyueth ſhall gouerne cōmon wealth emperours name onlye otherwyſe take vppon hym none aucthoritie gouernment prince ſtates empyre bound fidelitie othe except emperours death whan newe kynge ſhall created ſworne order lawe carolyne electours power alter ye ſame ſhalbe proued haue done contrary othe el great ſuſpicion therof maketh purgation ſhalbe depriued ryght electourſhyp euer moreouer choſen three kynges ſucceſſiuelye one houſe prynces none choſen kyng romaynes except ſome houſe prince germany suche thynges eſtablyſhed lawe caroline concernyng kynges election neyther emperour kynge romaynes maye chaunge whan ſhal ſeme good electours create king romaine ſhall nede ſignifie ſame emperour neither ſhalbe lawfull emperour caſe commaūde archebyſhop mētz aſſemble prince electours tyme ſhall appeare iuſt cauſe electe kynge romaynes duryng lyfe emperour archebyſhop certen daye call company franckfurth lie authoritie appointe aſſemblye el vnleſſe collegues doe vpon weyghtie conſiderations permitte hym archebyſhop mentz ſhall demaunde crowne scepter ornamentes empire norinberge conſent peres neyther diminiſhe anye parte thre monethes ſommoned graūted prynces haue cō ference together may daungerous empyre cōmon wealth one two comyng tyme ſhould abſent whileſt electours conſulte frankeforth others ſhut thoſe matter infrynged thē electours bonde eyther repare thether remaine ſoeuer done voyde none effect neyther emperour king roman italy fraūce place permitte harmes prince electours borne hym office executed electours ſelues deputes kyng romaynes ſolemnyſe laſte coronation vnleſſe eyther electours deputes preſent neyther emperour kyng romaynes let ambaſſadours foreine kynges prince wherby may come counſelles empyre propounde matter apperteyneth lawe nature alſo thyng full humanitie ciuile dutie neither emperour kyng romaynes caſes prynces empyre take vpon authoritie determining ſuffer ſame lawfully decided place ought ſuche thinges ſhal apperteine honour welth preſeruation prince empyre ſuche emperour hath promyſed vpon fidelitie obſerue doe maynteyne caſe thynge otherwyſe done refourme bynde kynge romaynes lawe obſerue ſame emperour woulde ſorte expounde confyrme lawe charles fourth duke saxon woulde faile doe dutie ſo euer common wealth ſhould requyre ſuche conſultation caſe interceſſours coulde obtayne theſe thynges emperour woulde refuſe lawfull hearyng matter yet ſo meane tyme king ferdinando ſhould neyther take vpon vſurpe gouernement matter empyre authoritie namely ouer thē ouer williā lewys brother duke bauier wyl graū ted emperour would heare thē openly coū ſayle prince ſtates wyll declare vpon weightie iuſte cauſes diſalowe election ſo muche refuſall ſame perceyue incurre emperour alſo foreine kinges natiōs ſuſpicion rebellion deſyre muche emperoure would take diſpleaſaūtly ſhould make theyr purgatiō well within germany alſo without lymites empyre muſt neceſſitie amonges thynges ſayde electours ſhould ſweare ordre preſcribed caroline thus ſtandeth tyme comen franckeforth maſſe done go vp aultar lay othe theelectoars handes vpon holy boke call certen wordes beynge ſpoken take ſolempne othe fayth owe god empyre wyll choſe newe hyghe magiſtrate ſuche one ſhall thynke moſte worthy mete neceſſary office ſo farreforth thei coniecture wytte iudgement without compacte bribe rewarde promyſe accompte duke bauier numbre conſideration alſo miſliked election kyng ferdinando takynge counſell herein entred league duke saxon lantgraue frenche kynge defende lybertie germanie indede kyng fraunce delyuered cucuſtody two brother duke bauer hondreth thouſande duke bauer miſliked election ferdinādo crownes alwayes readines nede requyred prynces interceſſours make aunſwere hereunto xx day april howe treate theſe matter concorde neyther thoughte woulde haue propounded theſe thynges haue choſen kynge romaynes emperour yet lyuyng haue moſte weightie cauſes whiche ſame tyme declared iohn fredericke father deputie nede requyre may yet playnely expounded ſynce matter cō cerneth emperour alſo kyng reſidue fellowe prynces wyll make many wordes therof leaue alone intent may come eaſelye reconciliation reſt neuertheleſſe conſtrayned make aunſwere doinge wyll refuſe iudgement herein doubt approue doynges ſuche ſorte nothinge iuſtly layde charge caſe theſe thynges ſhould reported emperour feare muche ſhould take place alſo let hynder whole treatie peace wherfore truce may taken reconcilement may wel religion election neyther ſeparated yt erneſtly beſeche bothe father ſonne duke saxon would conſyder thyng forſake opiniō ſo doubte emperour king woul put good aſſuraunce election ſhoulde hurtfull heyres woulde ſhewe beſydes pleaſure coulde well matter religion otherwyſe religion ſhoulde haue peace graunted matter election remayne vndertermined feare muche coulde obtayned thus verely doe frendly counſell requyre take parte ſo vſe thē ſelues may perceyue aduiſe regarded diligence well imployed hereunto aunſwereth duke iohn fridericke fourth daye aunſwer duke iterceſſours loked ſuche aunſwere ſayed lately amonges thinges kyng romaine elected welth dignitie empyre oughte neceſſitie aunſwere poinct ſatiſfiynge well father fellowes perſwaded electiō good profitable empyre ſuſteyne perſones interceſſours thought certenly woulde neuer haue defended matter haue left ſame doubtful vndetermined ſuch thinges haue ſpoken concerne interceſſours ought referre dvnto time whā theſe thing ſhall come comon conſultation dede collon tyme emperour deſyred ioyne hym brother ferdinando fellowſhip empyre adledged certen cauſes ought ſo thoſe ſemed ſo great therfore lawe caroline ryght libertie empyre ought infringed tyme father ambaſſadours aunſwere ought ſo done wherfore thynge ſpoken laſt place nowe repete agayne alſo caſe emperour wyll admitte theyr requeſtes matter determined lawfull iudgement reaſons theyr refuſall may heard ſeyng treate equitie ſuppoſed wold alſo caſe haue founde ſome way honeſt meane profitable empyre muche ſo done cō trouerſie wyll moleſte herein vndoubtedlye father fellowes wyll declare yet iniury man howe lawe libertie empyre meane infringed truſteth alſo ſo much theſe thynges concerne honour preſeruation common wealth emperour wyl take diſpleaſauntly reſte theyr demaundes ſame craft papiſtes firſt poinct whiche touching zwynglians ment prynces myght ſequeſtred moſte parte city treaty interceſſours ſo expounde zwynglians would acknowledge theyr errour forſake myght alſo compryſed peace refuſed neyther ayde cancorde enter league laſt yeare smalcalde proteſtantes accorded time thei strauſborough certen city sweuia playnly expounded opinion propounded auſpurge concerning lordes supper declaration excepted saxon therfore one mynde aunſwere one ſame thynge eueryry requeſte length propounde theſe condition peace auſpurge exhibite confeſſion theyr doctrine apologie ſame ſuche hereafter ſhall receiue ſame doctrine conſiſte within theſe lymites renewe nothynge furthermore vntyll counſell ſo often tymes promyſed poynted vpon ioyne concernyng theyr doctryne whiche teache otherwyſe lordes supper baptiſme ſpecified wryting exhibited auſpurg thei neyther allure vnto maynteyne man subiecte occaſion religion howe ſhall lawfull men eyther lawe condition go whether wyll whan ſhal haue firſt declared ſame lordes magiſtrates may flitte remoue wyll receiued ſende forth preacher without owne limites preache vnleſſe eyther magiſtrate place deſyre permitte hym ſo doe whan aſſembly ſhall happen refuſe ſhalbe lawfull doe home ſhalbe eyther counſelles empyre ſende power agaynſte turke let ſuche tymes vſe theyr owne preacher alſo lordes supper accordyng chriſtes cōmaundement let abſteyne reproches withſtanding let miniſters churche according dutie reprehende errours vice modeſtie ſhewe thynge ryght ſuch religion ſecluded chamber imperiall eccleſiaſticall iuriſdiction remayne place nowe ſhall lawfull byſhoppes moleſte brynge trouble man profeſſyng doctrine ſentences geuen concernynge religion iuriſdiction ceremony churche goodes whiche yet put execution differed tyll generall counſell let vſe churche goodes whiche remayne thoſe place wherunto thoſe gooodes properly appertayne neyther let thyng violentlye taken man yerely reuenewes brought ſame place haue bene olde tyme accuſtomed tyll counſell ſhall otherwyſe determine al ciuile matter let euery man office dutie let men tende common wealth ſhewe mutuall faith beneuolence matter brought vnto poynt woulde come nerer interceſſours continue ſtyll theyr purpoſe intent thynges myght reported emperour ſpedely appointe metynge norynberge thyrde daye iune laſte albeit ful emperour neceſſitie graunteth peace germany agrement yet muche turke inuading auſtriche neceſſitie requyred make power againſte hym myght gathered emperour doth eſtablyſhe vniuerſall peace throughout germany decreeth man moleſted religion vntyll tyme generall counſell none vntyll ſtates empyre ſhall fynde meane redreſſe controuerſte vnto ſuch ſhal otherwyſe appoynteth great punyſhement ſayeth wyll endeuoure may called within half yeare begynne within yeare obteined matter ſhalbe diſcuſſed counſell empyre wherfore chargeth commaundeth ſuytes proces lawe commenced religion ſhal meane tyme let falle ſuſpended thyng otherwyſe done againſt proteſtauntes commaūdeth voyde none effect agayne proteſtauntes ſeuen prince xxiiij city offer vnto hym obedience ſeruice promyſe ayde againſt turke peace concluded •• ibre proteſt interceſſours xxiij iuly emperour aduyſed letter meſſengers confirmed ſeconde auguſt cauſed proclaymed openly commaunding counſell empyre iudges obey ſame decreed counſell auſpurge iudgement counſelles chamber ſhould refourmed wherunto emperour appointed two name moreouer choſe archebyſhop mentz palſgraue prynces electours alſo byſhop spyres strauſborough philip marque brandenbourgh euery one theſe ſent depute spyres begynnynge marche made certen lawes whiche concerned partly iudges pattly aduocates partly ſuters exhibited emperour aſſemblie regenſpurge lyked reformation well added fewe thynges ſame laſte booke aſſemble regēſpurge haue hearde howe emperour vnded conuenantes betwene alberte duke pruſe sigiſmunde king pole albert perſeuered purpoſe outlawed tyme iudges emperiall chambre ſute walter cronberge whiche thynge whan kynge pole vnderſtoode ſent ambaſſadour aſſemblie declare howe lande pruſe hath olde tyme bene vnder defence tuition realme wherfore deſyreth ſentence outlawerye maye reuerſed cronberge long oration thyrde daye iune proueth vnder iuriſdiction empyre belong nothing al kynges pole al predeceſſours vanquyſhed battell conſtrained geue fidelitie caſmire father vnto sigiſmunde yet ſame cleane contrary conuenauntes made tyme whiche thynge able proue teſtimony albert ſelfe cōfeſſed ſame eight yeares ſynce aſſemblie norinberge therfore requyreth requeſte kynge pole ſet parte ſentence geuen agaynſt alberte may put execution yeare chriſtierne kynge chriſtierne kyng denmarck taken denmarke bene ten yeares banyſhed man prouyded nauie intendyng recouer kyngdome taken ſea committed warde ſame tyme died hauing towarde young man ſonnne broughte vp emperour vncle chiefeſt conſultation aſſemblie turkyſhe warre whan newes came daylye letter meſſengers turck inuaded auſtriche howe turke ſent great bandes horſmen ryuer danubius alſo ambaſſadours auſtriche countreys nere declared daunger werein decreed geue ayde ſo al ſtates empyre ſhuld ayde mony ſoldiours wherfore xxvj daye iuly ended aſſembly al men prepared warre ides auguſte duke saxon prynce electour ended lyfe iohn fridericke ſonne ſuccede whan solyman death duke saxon emperour turkes come belgrade taketh waye left hande attempteth towne caſtell giunte vayne manfully defended nichas iurixe ſent forth captaine caſon fiftene thouſande horſemen ſpoyle countrey inuaded countrey far lintzie aboue uienne deſtroying farre nere leaueth kynde crueltie vnpractiſed retourne fel lappes horſemen made kepe hym ſpoyle ſo beyng fought ſlaughter yt turkyſh warre ſondry place vtter deſtruction lengthe hym ſelfe ſlayne solyman tournyng left hande marcheth vnto gratin towne stiria whiche thynge one knowen emperour beyng lintze taketh aduiſement beſte done laſt determied ſhould encampe whole armie uienna abydyng ennemie thus fyne solimā retyreth without notable exploict done emperour intreated frenche kyng ayde made aunſwere emperour tyme reported germanye able enough reſyſte turke alone kyng englande alſo wrote agayne ſomewhat doubtfullye byſhop rome clement ſent hym ayde conduicte hipolitus cardinall houſe medices swycers beyng requeſted emperour would ſtyre one fote yeare ſene blaſyng starre septembre octobre blaſyng starre ſonne riſing turke retyred armie emperour miſlykyng aduyſe thought good purſue ennemye diſchargeth armie wynter hande uienne toke iourney italy mantua appointeth letter wrytten ſtates empyre empe goeth italy brother kyng romaine ſhall gouerne cōmon welth abſence weightie cauſes gone italy woulde treate byſhop rome concerning counſell decreed ratiſbone wylleth menne therfore maynteyne peace whiche late proclaymed obedient brother would ſelfe departyng thence bononie entred talke clement ſeuenth deuyſynge amonges thynges religion generall counſel maketh alſo legue hym reſydue prynces italy wordes mayntayne peace quiet italy verye deede kepe frenche men embaſſadours frenche kyng ſore againſt byſhop admoniſhed ſo erneſt priuely ſignifiyng ſhould long endure emperour brought hym great nombre spanyardes byſhop wold fayne haue diſpatched italy cauſe made league obſer 〈…〉 g pope ſerueth tyme occaſion tyme emperour ſhortly ſayled spayne moneth marche longe byſhop rome ſendeth legate germanye hughe rangon byſhop rhegio whan came duke saxō accompanied emperous ambaſſadour made long oration effect wherof muche long conference betwene byſhop oratiō pope ambaſſad duke saron emperour controuerſie religion fyne concluded remedy therof waye better thā generall counſell wherof perceiued prynces germany alſo deſyrous cauſe meſſage euen declare vnto hym prynces byſhop emperour determined haue counſell free common men ſuche olde father accuſtomed haue tymes pope policie paſt whoſe myndes vndoubtedly gouerned holye ghoſte prouided alwayes ſuche ſhall repare thyther make faythfull promeſſe obſerue decree therof el ſhould labour ſpent vayne ſhould make lawes whiche none woulde obſerue kepe concerning place holſome ayre plentye victuall commodious byſhop thinketh either placence bononie vnmete purpoſe el mantua whiche citie empyre nere vnto germany goodly ſituatiō plentiful thynges neceſſary whiche thre ſhall lawfull choſe one whereunto kinge romaine prynces germany woulde make ſome reaſonable aunſwere byſhop conſulting alſo kynges would cal ſame within halfe yeare begynne within one yeare intent ſuche dwel farre may prepare thē ſelues take iorney whan hadde ſpoken deliuereth certen article compryſed wryting prynce electour byſhop rome afterwardes emperours ambaſſadour ſpeaketh wyſe muche al former aſſemblies recōciliation religion oratiō emperours amb hath bene hetherto attēpted vayne ſuppoſed coū ſel matter might pacified therfore hath emperour late obtayned ſame byſhop rome ſay holdē ſame maner time place ambaſſadour hath declared therfore ſent emperour beare witneſſe byſhop rome content haue counſell becauſe ambaſſadour hath ſpoken ſufficientlye whole matter nedeth ſaye deſyre hym credite tale make hym frendly aunſwere duke saxon ſayeth becauſe matter weightie wyll take delyberation weymer fewe dayes duke aunſwereth emperour byſhop haue agreed vppon counſell exceadinge glad duke saxon aunſwere ſtate common wealth doth chiefly requyre ſuch one oftētimes emperour hath promiſed germanes wherin ye cauſe may duely examined according preſcripte god worde whiche might would nothing doubte thinges ſhould go wel wil pray vnto god graunt alſo admoniſhe people vnder iuriſdiction lyke applie whole ſtudie hereūto moue fellowes alſo carefull ſame would glad moreouer make preſent aunſwer many others ſame religion father duke iohn profeſſed ſame doctrine aſſemblie auſpurge emperour ſo aunſwere ſelfe alone without making priuie neither expedient cauſe ſo doe better ſame done comon aſſent much emperour byſhop laſt wynter letter wrytten ſtates empire bononie put hope counſell therfore fellowes appoint day xxiiij iune mete smalcalde conſult whole matter wherfore deſireth thē offended differment time ſo ſone fellowes mete day preſcribed ſhal haue anſwer either ambaſſadours letter ſhortly wold god grace ſo demeane ſelf preſent age alſo time come ſhold perceiue right wel wyſhed nothing thā pure religion doctrine peace germany whole comon wealth chriſtendom might alſo floriche emperour chiefe ſouereigne might haue due honour dignitie afterwarde whan fellowes come good deliberation prote aunſwere pope emperour framed anſwere commō aſſent letter laſt iune howe gaue great thankes emperour whiche god glory preſeruation cōmon wealth taken ſo muche paynes good zeale doubted therfore pray god ſo confirme direct mynde yt ende truthe may ſet forth embraced falſe doctrine wicked worſhipinge rite abolyſhed errours cleane weded men myndes god true ſeruice godly vertues may agayne take place chiefly deſire counſel wherin matter controuerſie may duely orderly decided suche counſell alſo emperour hath promyſed long ſynce aſſemblies empyre great deberation hath bene decreed kepte germanye wherof ſprang diſſention religion diſſention ſprange vp fyrſte welle certen impudent perſones ouermuche extolled indulgence pardon whiche tyme alſo errours perceyued detected byſhop leo condempned doctryne whiche brought thoſe errours lyghte yet haue hetherto impugned condempnatiō teſtimonies prophetes apoſtles therfore hath counſell ben alwaye thought moſte nedefull well prynces ſtates wherin cauſe myght examined openly tryed true falſe ſawe howe many thynges crept religion whiche refourmed therfore aſſemblies empyre decreed ſhould free chriſtian counſell eyther nation el prouince germany thoſe eſpeciall wordes leſt eyther ſentēce byſhop force power man ſhould preiudiciall cauſe agayne cauſe iudgement ſhould geuen byſhoppes decree opinion scholemen accordyng vnto holy scripture yf man power ſhould force scripture due examination doubteth ſhoulde contende againſte byſhop ſhoulde loſe labour ſtryue agaynſte ſtreame wherfore without great conſiderations hath decreed counſell ſhould holden germany emperour alſo content ſhoulde ſo nowe theſe requeſtes byſſhop vtterly againſt decree empyre confyrmed ſeales emperour prynces ſpeaketh free councel yet doubtles intendeth thynge whā free counſel vnderſtād goeth haue kynges prynces bounden hym caſe woulde haue free ſhoulde obligation nede nowe ſeyng wholy bent waye certenly purpoſe vnder name counſell maye maynteyne power aucthoritie man ſhall reprehende faultes errours doe atttempte ſhall eſcape vnpunyſhed knowe men wyll doe ſurelye demaunde wrytten ſuche ſorte rather maketh afrayde counſell prouoketh woulde bynde hym ſelfe ſorte eſpecially beynge yet knowen ſhall ordre counſell fourme maner whether byſhop wyll haue adherentes beare moſte aucthoritie whether controuerſies ſhall determined accordyng holy scripture tradition lawes men grounded vpon scripture lybertie counſell alſo reſtrayned wyll haue kept olde accuſtomed maner doe refuſe former counſelles conſonant scryptures ſuche haue bene tyme lyttle coūſels ſwarued old puritie whiche haue attributed reaſon wold byſhop rome decree men farre differing auncient counſelles therfore ſayeth ſhall olde accuſtomed maner crafte policie ſhall lybertye ſpeache geuinge ſentences deſyre alſo cauſe requireth iudgement ſhall geuen accordynge vnto lawes vſurped power whiche taketh vppon hym certen laſt coūſelles manifeſt vſage hadling matter neither church pacified troubled conſcience quieted brought darkenes bondage wherfore ſeing biſhop hath yet ſatiſfied requeſtes emperour ſtates empyre erneſtly deſyre ceſar conſidering empe part 〈…〉 religion weightines cauſe whiche concerneth vniuerſall cōmon wealth nation would ſee matter might handled indifferently office dutie may doe lawes dede byſhop impugneth truthe forſeen prouided plaintife defendaūt alſo iudge cauſe nation haue great hope counſell doe pope plentife defendaūt iudge wyſhe pray laſte men conſciences troubled ſore afflicted doubtfull diſſentiō may made free ſet libertie taught way ſaluatiō theſe many hondreth yeares hath bene ſo muche contention ſo weighty matter thys preſent ſtryfe aryſeth ſondry errours vice whiche haue ſpronge longe tyme men diſceaued theyr expectation ſhall haue ſuche councell hathe bene promyſed ſorowe grief thynge wyll men harte eaſy coniecture agayne byſhop ſhall refuſe dewe examination triall matter feared leſt cōmon welth ſtate churche ſhall tourmoyled ſorer tempeſtes thā hath bene hitherto ſtates empyre haue theyr aſſemblies cōdeſcended vpon vpright counſel diſtruſt perſeuer alſo ſame vtterly refuſing ſnares pope ſnares bondes wherwith biſhop intendeth craftly catche thē truſting kynges prince wyl like bonde goeth full craft deceitfulnes neyther true iudgement vnleſſe myndes men franke free ſo procede thus hold counſel owne pleaſure wyll cō mitte whole matter vnto god whiche doubtles defende owne cauſe doctrine howe caſe matter ſhould ſo come paſſe byſhop ſhould permitted ſo wold take aduiſement thā nedeful done perchaunce ſhalbe ſūmoneth ſe ſhalbe able thing glory god holy name wil come thither ſaufe cōduict whā made wel aſſured ſend ambaſſadours propounde ſoeuer neceſſitie cauſe ſhall requyre neuertheleſſe vnder condition wyll wyſe admytte thoſe requeſtes byſhop acconſente counſell contrarye decree empire ſee howe interpriſe byſhop make contynuall peace churche common wealth neyther alſo ſemelye hym ſo doe caſe would execute office true paſtour whiche haue care men feede true doctrine chriſt whiche biſhops office thynges ſtanding thus deſyre cary theyr aunſwere emperour biſhops emperour thei reuerently acknowledge chief ſouereigne appointed god take ſame euyll parte woulde fynde meanes counſell myght according decree empyre whole controueſie may decided vertuous men nothyng ſuſpected certenly appertayneth cō mendation vertue employe al power aucthoritie aduauncement true doctrine eſtablyſhynge theyr crueltie whiche nowe theſe many yeares haue perſecuted innocent perſones profeſſion goſpell holſome doctryne reſidue committe euer haue vnto emperour neyther thyng whiche wyll glad doe ſake ſame tyme kyng ferdinando byſhoppes ambaſſadour peter paule uerger whome ſpoke uergerius former booke becauſe byſhop rhezo aged man ſickly clement commaunded uerger caſe impedimēt happened vnto ſhould ſupplie rowme geueth hym eſpeciall charge beare alwayes memory mynd wyll touchyng counſell let hym loke therfore wyſe doe paſſe boundes commiſſion one fynger breadth dryue hym ſuche exigent muſt neceſſitie kepe counſel though king ferdinādo would neuer ſo fayne haue ſo vrged pope ſleeth coū ſell hym ſtreightly therunto ✚ nynth booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument nynth booke george duke saxon marketh ſuche fauoured goſpel accuſeth luther electour saxony coſyn pope element meting frenche kyng marſeilles geueth niece marriage henry duke orleaunce dake wirtenberge dryuen countrey henry eight kyng englande putteth away quene katherine wyfe forſaketh pope pageaunt ſpirite graye freers orleaunce recited lantgraue recouereth duke dome wittemberge agrement betwene kyng ferdinando duke saxon article peace betwixt ferdinando 〈…〉 ich duke wirtemberge reherſed clement dieth paule houſe ferneſe ſuccedeth perſecutiō paris reaſon certen placardes kyng pourgeth ſelfe germaynes therfore emperour taketh citie tunnes moore byſhop rocheſter beheaded pope paule legate uergerius ſommoneth counſell mantua wherfore proteſtauntes metyng smalcalde ſende aduyſe wrytinge lorde langey ſent thether kyng fraunce ſolliciteth league debated diuers matter wher vnto proteſtauntes made aunſwere kyng englande alſo ſent thether declare woulde ende attende ſuche counſell league smalcalde renewed whiche newly admitted ſondry prynces city whan made aunſwer appoynted diuines lawyer delyberate vpon action counſell come determined ſet forth byſhops aunſwere prynte communicate ſame forein kynges nation alſo ſende ambaſſadours iudges chamber contrary emperours proclamatiō graunted proces againſt certen cauſes religion whoſe iudgement vnles ſurceaſed would refuſe moreouer ſende ambaſſade archebyſhop mentz palſgraue interceſſours laſt reporte vnto emperour whole matter wryting haue tolde oftener one howe duke george saxony bare malice luther priuely hated doctrine craft duke george fynde lutherians openly vnderſtode diuers ſubiectes holde opinion ought receyue lordes ſupper commaundemēt chriſte charged miniſters church geue vnto ſuche olde cuſtome eaſter confeſſed ſynnes receiue sacrament byſhop rome lawe certen token whiche ſhould afterwardes deliuer vnto senate intent myght knowē romyſhe luther opinion founde lipſia whiche head towne countrey numbre luther coū ſell lxx without token conſulted luther nedefull done wrote vnto ſuche beleued certenly howe ought receiue whole ſupper ſhould doe nothing againſt owne conſcience rather ſuffer death wherfore thus encouraged ſticke vnto whan prince called hym geuing two monethes reſpite deliberate woulde alter purpoſe bannyſhed town luther letter lipſia called duke george apoſtle sathan whiche thinge breade muche trouble duke george accuſe hym coſyn electour saxon howe rayled hym alſo ſtyred vp ſubiectes rebellion prince electour letter charged luther withal amonges thynges ſayth vnleſſe make purgation herein muſt neceſſitie punyſhe hym wherfore vpon occaſion luther wryteth booke wherein confuteth accuſation declaryng howe gaue counſel reſiſte prince luther purgation commaunding doe wickedly rather ſuffer death exile whiche concerneth rebellion aſcribed vnto teache howe magiſtrate ſhoulde reſiſted force armes ſedicious deede whome alſo peter apoſtle hath prophecied belongeth profeſſion goſpel condempned ſeditious chriſt hym ſelfe cauſe put death moſte vnworthy though would haue bene kyng iewes chriſte called ſeditious haue made people rebelle againſt emperour ſame booke adioyneth epiſtle wherwith doth comforte thoſe banyſhed men lipſia admoniſhyng thē take exile paciently alſo geue god thankes whiche hathe graunted comforteth eri • e conſtancie mynde perſeuerance ſhewed league concluded betwene emperour clement ſeuenth emperour retourned spayn clement requeſt frenche kyng toke ſhipping arriued marceilles harueſt tyme intier frēdſhip marrieth niece pope clement cōmeth macilles katherine medices vnto henry kynges ſonne duke orleans younge prynce fiftene yeares age becauſe occaſion ſerueth purpoſe ſpeake litle touching ye houſe medices sylueſter euerarde iohn firſt accompted name whiche senatours florence fyrſt ennobled houſe coſmus rycheſt marchaunt owne citie alſo italy ſonne peter two ſonnes laurence iulian iulian ſonne borne dead called iuly afterwardes clement ſeuenth withſtanding reporte diuerſly touching byrth lawrēce ſonnes peter iulian iohn made byſhop many ſuppoſe hym baſtarde rome leo tent iulian chyldrē peter expulſed florence lenght drowned mouth lyre reaſon tēpeſt left ſonne named lawrence married galla houſe bolonois katherine whome mention made clement made abode marſeilles moneth ſomewhat gratifie kyng noble made foure frenche cardinalles whome perceiued moſte fauoure conſecrating cardinalles kyng odet chaſtilion philip bolon claude gifrie iohn uenerie byſhop liſiens man doubted affinitie pretended alteration ſtate italy many marueled vniqualitie mariage ſo muche clement hym ſelfe report unmete mariage goeth doubtfull woulde beleue ment good erneſt mariage ſolempniſed within fewe monethes lantgraue goeth french king cauſe wherof lantgraue goeth frēch kyng duke ulrich expulſed yeare lorde 1519 ulriche duke wirtemberge driuen countrey confederatours sweuicall league takyng rutelyng towne imperiall whiche confederacie prouince firſt emperour reſt diuiſion inheritaunce ferdinādo receiued emperour aſſemblie auſpurg certen prince peticioners duke whiche bene eleuen yeares exile might thā reſtored vayne emperour reciting cauſes beginning whiche exiled dyd create brother duke openly countrey wherfore lantgraue dere frende nere kinſman duke ulriche thought attempte ſome thing preſent diſapoynted certen promyſed theyr ayde differred matter vntyll better oportunitie ſerued nowe emperours abſence cō ſidering sweuicall league made eleuen yeares diſſolued goeth fraunce layeth pledge countrey mount pelicarte vnto kyng ſumme mony name lantgraue boroweth monye frēch kyng duke ulriche vpon condicion redeme within thre yeres inheritaunce realme fraunce beſides ſome money kyng alſo promyſed lende hym another ſom hope lande ſhould redemed tyme fortuned wonderfull alteration englande occaſion henry great alte ratiō englande ſeuenth kyng englande two ſonnes arthur henry arthur maried katherine daughter ferdinando kyng spayne diyng without iſhewe henry father coueted much alliaunce spanyarde myght continue lycence byſhop rome iuly ſeconde deuyſeth marrie katherine ſonne alſo whiche kyng departed yeare grace 1509 wherfore henry eight name maried father beyng dead nowe manye yeares kyng hēry ſufficiently eſtablyſhed kyngdome propoundeth ſcrupuloſitie conſcience certen byſhoppes calleth queſtiō whether lawfull marrye brother wyfe longe tyme abſtayned company byſhoppes hauynge priuate talke quene kinges aſſignement declare vnto byſhop rome lycence herein neyther good lawfull aunſwereth late nowe examyne licence whiche ſo longe ſynce allowed dyuerſe tymes miſcaried chylde brought forth none proſpered ſauynge one daughter called marie byſhop rome committeth hearynge matter vnto two cardinalles campegius whome ſent englande cardinalle yorke longe muche debatyng whan kynge put hope rome ſentence ſhould geuen ſyde campegius maner ſame inſtant iudgement ſhould haue paſſed byſhop rome admonyſhement inconſtancie pope clement began drawe backe fynde delayes cauſe wherof men ſuppoſe death duke captaine lawtrech diſtruction frenche armie naples androwe de aurie moſte experte man ſea forſakyng frēch kyng fled vnto emperour whiche thynges chaunced ſo ſame tyme byſhop afrayde offende emperour nephewe quene katherine whiche ſuche lucky ſucceſſe aſſayes italy wherfore campegius fyne retourned without thyng determyned wherwith kyng toke excedyng muche diſpleaſure neuertheleſſe leſt ſhould appeare ſhould anythyng vniuſtly kynge ſent fraunce italy germany enquyre opinion vniuerſities moſte part conſented kyng emonges diuines paris vniuerſities paris others approued kynge vniuerſitie seale thoughte lyberally rewarded therfore amōges others quenes maydes one excellent beautie called anne bolen whome kyng began fantaſy ſo muche men myght eaſelye quene anne loued goſpell perceyue entended marrie wyfe whan cardinall yorke perceyued whiche chief kyng ſaye authour diuorſement chaunged purpoſe admonyſhyng byſhop rome letter ſhould approue diuorſement ſhoulde ſuccede quene katherine whiche infected luther opinion whiche thyng whan kyng vnderſtode ambaſſadour ledger rome ſore offended longe thinges whiche practiſed 〈…〉 e chauncelour realme thre beſte byſhop 〈…〉 he york dureſme wyncheſter firſt diſplaced hym office taketh away two byſhoprikes concluſion time leading priuate lyfe home ſpooken certen wordes arrogant importing deſire reuengement kyng ſent syr william kingſtone captaine garde diſcharge houſe brynge hym london fallyng vehement 〈…〉 ixe way dyed buried leceſter byſhop rome death cardinall woolſey intent campegius myght haue ſome excuſe departe reuoked ſute handes perceiuing marriage quene anne would hym preiudiciall warneth kyng full ofte goeth alſo feare threateninges ſhould leaue enterpryſe whan could preuayle pleaſe emperour gaue ſentence 〈…〉 katherine yeare xxiij marche kynge yeare married forſakynge katherine proclaiming daughter marie baſtarde lady mary baſtarde perceiued ſentence geuen againſt hym conceaued mortall hatred againſt byſhop immediatly maketh lawe whereby declareth ſelf head church englande aboliſhyng byſhop vtterly commaundeth vnder payne death maketh treaſon man aſcribe vnto kinges hatred againſt pope byſhop rome ſupremacie denieth alſo yearely penſion whiche wont geuen biſhoppes collectour moſte weightie wordes enacteth henceforth monye conueyed rome conſent whole nobilitie common realme ordre hyghe courte parliament fraunces frenche kynge thoughte haue furthered muche diuorcement intent myght thus cleane drawe frendſhyp emperour concerning trybute payed rome thus ſtandeth inas kyng britane aboute inas kyng yeare lorde fiue hundreth forty opinion religion deuotion made realme tributory byſhop rome leaft memory ioynyng euery houſe paye penny wherfore byſhoppes collectours cōtinually gather annuall ſtypende called common people peter penny byſhoppes collectour tyme peter uan retourned rome remayned ſtyll englande money bene continually payed frō time vnto theſe day kynge henry firſte men made reſtrainte therof inhibitiō contē tion betwen eraſmus luther ſhould payed haue heard eraſmus luther wrote one againſte free wyll fourthe booke yeare contention began freſhe luther takyng occaſiō one frendes epiſtles chargeth eraſmus ſore though ſhould call chriſtian religion doubt mocke condempne alſo alledgyng certen place owne workes goeth proue ſame ſheweth wrytyng ambiguous eloquence practyſeth kynde tyraunye muche godly thynges trifleth dalieth thus doubtfull wordes coulde oughte ſpeake playnly aduoucheth thynges ought conſtrued agaynſt wherunto eraſmus afterwarde aunſwered ryght ſharpely feared moſt al thynges left workes ſhould loſe grace authoritie tyme fraunce grey freers traged grey freers orleaunce wrought terrible bloudy enterpryſe thus thinge mayer wyfe citie prouided wyll ſhe would buried without pompe noyſe whan departeth fraunce belmen hyred goe citie place moſte frequented aſſemble people ſounde bell declare name title partie deceaſed alſo wher whan ſhal butied laſt exhorte people praye dead whan coarſe caried forth moſte ſolēne burieng fraunce parte theſe beggyng freers go churche many torch borne pompe ſolempnitie vſed concourſe gaſyng people woman wold haue none gere done wherfore huſbande loueth well followed mynde herein gaue vnto graye freers whoſe churche ſhe buried beſydes father grandfather ſyxe crownes rewarde looked great deale afterwardes whā cut wood folde freers craued haue part therof without money ſayde nay toke maruelous euyll parte loued hym deuiſe waye reuenged ſaying wyfe damned euerlaſtingly worker tragedy coliman stephen arras doctours diuinitie firſt dede coniurer trynkettes falſe doctours furniture concerning ſuche matter redineſſe vſed matter thus ſet yoūg man yt nouice aboue ouer vaulte churche came mumble vp mattyns mydnyght accuſtomed maner made wonderfull noyſe ſhryking lofte goeth colman croſſynge coniuring aboue woulde ſpeake beynge charged make ſigne declare dume ſpirit ruſtleth maketh dume spirite noyce agayne ſigne token whan layd foundation go certen chiefeſt citie fauour red moſte tell heuy caſe chaunced theyr houſe yet vtter entreate take paynes come ſeruice night came ſeruice begonne loſt made great noyſe beinge demaunded would ſignified could ſpeake commaunded aunſwere interrogatory ſigne hole made laying eare might heare perceyue coniurer ſayde queſtions moued yt dome ſpirit table hande wherupon aſked queſtion clapped beat ſo myght eaſely heard beneth wherfore fyrſte demaunded whether haue bene buried rekening vp name order whoſe body bene buried laſte come mayres wyfe ſigne made ſheweth ſpirite queſtioned whether ſhe dampned deſerte offence whether couetouſnes pryde letchery ſhe workes charitie el newe ſprong vp hereſye lutheraniſme furthermore ſhe ment noyſe diſquietnes whether body buried within holy grounde ſhoulde digged vp caried ſome place unto theſe thinges aunſwered ſygnes like caſe commaunded wherby affirmed denied thynge ſo muche ſtroke vpon table twyſe thryſe whē thus ſygnified luther hereſy cauſe dampnation body muſt taken vp freers deſyre citezens preſent beare witnes ſuch thynges ſene heard ſet handes wryting taking aduiſement leſt ſhould offende mayor bring ſelues trouble refuſed ſubſcribe notwithſtāding freers take pyxe hoſte terme reliques ſainctes cary place ſay maſſes thing acuſtomably done biſhop rome lawe tyme churche ſuſpended muſt hallowed againe byſhops iudge deputed whome call officiall heard came thether vnderſtande matter better aſſociatynge hym ſelfe certen honeſt men cōmaundeth coniure preſence would haue choſen certen go vp uault ſe caſe ſpirit doth appere steuen ara ſore againſte thinge exhorted inſtantly might ſayinge ſpirite ought moleſted albeit official earneſtlye vrge coniure hym yet coulde bryng thē meanetyme maior makynge frendes priuie would doe went kynge enfourmed hym whole matter much yt freers reaſon priuileges refuſed come vnto iudgement kyng choſe certen court parliament paris examine matter gaue themfull authoritie ſame alſo anthony prate chauncelour cardinal byſhop rome legate fraunce wherfore hauing exception caried paris conſtrayned make anſwere woulde confeſſe nothyng yet kept parte game prayer called paris nouice whiche fumeus senatour home often tymes examined woulde vtter nothyng fearyng leſte ſhoulde murthered ſclaundering ordre iudges promiſed hym ſhould eſcape free ſhould come freers handes declareth whole matter ordre brought others aduouched ſame albeit conuicted maner taken deede yet refuſed iudges bragged priuileges vayne condempned open iudgement ſhoulde caried agayne orleaunce put pryſon afterwardes condēpnation fal 〈…〉 r brought openly cathedral churche ſo place puniſhment malefactours executed ſhoulde confeſſe owne wyckednes euen ſame time chaunceth aperſecution againſt lutherians cauſe ſame ſentence albeit gentle ſo great offence put execution becauſe perſecution againſt lutherians name lutherians moſte odiouſe feared leſt puniſhment theſe men ſhould haue bene ſo muche thought dewe theyr offence done reproche ordre ſoeuer miſfortune happened vnto many iudged ſame woulde moſte pleaſaunt ſyght ſpectacle lutherians ordre franciſcanes common people eſtemed holye time caried paris certen woman moued pitie followed vnto gate vniuerſitie manye teares ſyghinges came vnto orleaunce beſtowed ſeuerall pryſons beganne boaſte agayne theyr liberty pryueleges lengthe longe impryſonment diſcharged ſet lybertie without punyſhement whyleſt pryſoners wanted nothynge hadde thynges miniſtred vnto aboundauntly eſpecially woman theſe perſecutions fyrynges mentioned letted thing kynge determined dede reported plucke downe theyr houſe make euen grounde romyſhe kyngdome wonte many ſpyrites spirites popyſhe kingdome beleued certenly dead men ſoules dyd walke buried wherefore ſhewed eyther dampned el tyme tourmented fyre purgatory woulde ſollicite nereſt kynſfolkes frendes ſucour moſte commonly requyred eyther performe vowes pylgrimages behight ſome ſainct lyfe tyme el cauſe trentall maſſes ſayd thē whiche thynge increaſed maruelouſly opinion purgatory brought maſſe highe authoritie prieſtes gainful aboue meaſure luther doctrine ſpred abroad luther apt 〈…〉 ō touching ſpirites knowen thoſe ſpirites lytle lytle vanyſhed cleane ſyght luther taught ſcriptures howe ſoules dead men quiet reſt loking laſt daye iudgement ſuche terrible noyſes viſions ſtyred vp deuyl letteth none occaſion ſlyppe confirme men myndes idolatrie falſe opinion quenche benefite ſauiour chriſte whan lantgraue bargayned frenche kynge begynnyng ſpring tyme leuied armie wrytyng letter vnto kyng ferdinando declared cauſe theyr enterpryſe whyleſt ferdinando referreth matter trial lawe marche forwardes armie fourtene day may chauncing mete theyr ennemies twelue thouſand foote men ſhotte theyr ordinaunce put flyght beſydes towne lauſene lande wirtemberge generall ferdinando armie philip counte victory lant palatine ſame battell hele ſtryken great pece chaſe many drowned ryuer neccar wher ran headlong feare ennemies purſued whan battell done men moſte parte dukedome wirtemberge yelded ſelues naturall prynce ulrichus aſperge ſituated vpon verey hyghe mountayne ſtandyng alone alſo urach tubinge nipha ſtronge caſtelles nature fine rendred alſo ferdinando fyrſt maye ſet forth proclamation man ſhoulde ayde faction al men ſhould reſiſte vttermoſte power wrytten proteſtauntes ſeueral letter touching ſame matter likewiſe emperour done litle openly man aſſiſte al men marueled end ſtiring wold grow tyme warre archbyſhop mentz george duke saxon lantgraues father lawe ſought reconcilement kyng ferdinando prince electour saxon cadamea town boheme laſt day iune ſauing one concluded peace thoſe cōditions religiō force attempted ſute lawe commenſed ſame peace condition peace ceſar hath made obſerued ferdinando emperours place ſhall brynge paſſe iudges chamber ſhall ſurceaſe al proces againſt proteſtauntes amonges whome notwithſtanding neyther anabaptiſtes sacramentaries ſuche lyke ſectes comprehended duke saxon fellowes ſhall acknowledge ferdinādo king romaine gyue title ferdinando ſhall againe within certen tyme deuiſe ſo emperour prince electours decree made ſorte whan tyme ſhall hereafter require make kynge romaine duryng lyfe emperour electours firſt aſſemble conſulte whether cauſe iuſte reaſonable ſo appere proceade tenure lawe carroline whiche ſhall otherwyſe done fruſtrate vnleſſe decree made within ten monethes duke fellowes ſtande bound theſe cōdicions within ſame time emperour ſhall alſo cōfirme duke ſucceſſion poſſeſſious father progenitours ferdinando ſhal alſo endeuour emperour ratifie ſuch compactes matrimony betwixt duke saxō cleaue whileſt thei treate theſe matter take hande alſo peace making duke saxon offereth lātgraue duke wirtemberge ſubſtitute ſhal ratifie ſo euer ſhould agree vpon muche debating dukedome beinge wholy recouered cōdicioned thus ulrich prince heires condicions betwixt ferdinando duke ulri male ſhall holde dukedome wirtemberge kyng ferdinando archeduke auſtriche ſo wardes clientes fortune houſe wirtemberge without heyres male prince auſtriche poſſeſſe region holde ſame empyre whiche ſhalbe bounden therunto ulriche acknowledge ferdinando king romaynes make league againſte hym lantgraue duke ulriche reſtore ſuche goodes haue gotten tyme warre owner doe conſtreyne man chaunge religion ſhall lawefull ſuche fled feare ſhamefaſtnes retourn home lyſte take theyr goodes goe wyll peces ordinaunce defence auſpurge ſhall remaine kyng ferdinando kinges debtes priuate affayres ſelfe ſhall paye employed cōmoditie countrey duke ſhal aunſwere ſuche landes dukedome holden kyngdome boheme duke heire ſhall holde ſtyl ferdinādo heires king boheme philip palſgraue reſidue pryſoners let go without raunſome lantgraue duke ſhall ſubmitte ſelues aſke pardon kyng ferdinando either perſons deputes duke ulriche receiue full ſtate poſſeſſion kyng ferdinando ferdinādo ſhall entreate emperour alſo forgeue thē charge warre nothinge required either parte lantgraue duke ſhall ſende vnto ferdinando armes fyue hondreth horſe men thre thouſand fotemen whiche ſhall immediatly go ſege munſter coſt charge promyſe fidelitie ferdinando othe nede requyred ſerue thre monethes ſame time munſter towne weſtphalia kept anabaptiſtes beſeged hereafter ſhalbe declared wherfore king ferdinando requyred thē aide winning towne whan duke meane recouered countrey wirtemberge made peace ferdinando yeare ended repaied french king money recouereth poſſeſſion mompelicarte lone money king forgaue liberal 〈…〉 tie yt frēch kyng whiche ſmall ſomme peace making peter paule uerger byſhops legate toke well clements name expoſtulate ſore king ferdinando taken luther prince amitie anſwered dyd cōſideratiō time auoyding turkes retire ſayde emperour retourned italy motion aduiſe frendes cōueyeth ſelf emperours traine repareth bauier ſole heire thought deuiſe yt ſholde haue bene lead ſome ſtraūge countrey made religious father reſtored wēt fraūce attended vpon frēch king matter pacified lātgraue ſent meſſager wt letter emperour spain cōditions peace writing lantgraues letter emperour craning pardon ſelf duke ulrich henceforth promiſeth al due obediēce moneth iuly septēbre following emperour anſwereth hym letter frō ualentia vnderſtode whole matter already empe aunſwere brother ferdinādo vnto whome hath written mynde behalf ſheweth ambaſſadour whō may vnderſtand clemencie deſire peace quietnes wherfore doth admoniſhe perfourme deede thinges hath promiſed wordes vſing ſelf obediētly eſchewig troubleſome coūſell warres wirtēberge fraunces sfortia married yt emp nece sfortia duke millā taketh wife chriſtine ye daughter chriſtierne king denmarck captiue emperours nece ſyſter curtius chaunged diet aged man dieth moneth septembre ſucceſſour paule third paule ye iii ſurnamed farneſius whiche ſhortly made alexander young nephewe baſtarde sonne peter aloiſe nephewe aſcanius baſtarde daughter conſtance bothe cardinalles calleth home peter paule uerger oute germany vnderſtande ſtate countrey conſulteth cardinalles howe counſell myght differred tyll ſuche tyme priuie practyſe might fynde meanes ſet emperour kynges together eares concluſion agreed ſende uerger againe germany make promyſe generall counſell ſhould ſo handle matter craft ſubtiltie ſuſpected clementes tyme paule 〈…〉 r clement ſhould aduertyſe prynces howe counſell ſhould holden mantua entreate condicions ſhoulde chiefly marke forme diſputation proteſtauntes would ſeke haue one knowen myght preſcribe vnto ſuche lawes knewe woulde come ſame alſo commaunded incenſe harte prynces practiſe prelate againſt kyng englande whoſe realme intended geue awaye pray hym coulde get ſhoud ſee ouer whether luther melancthon myght throughe anye meanes broughte purpoſe alſo certen cardinalles byſhoppes choſen deuiſe ſome refourmation clergie whiche fyne made pupliſhed place ſhalbe declared kynge ferdinando cauſer paule ſent againe uerger ſaying fitte man purpoſe tyme andrewe gritte andrewe gritte duke ſtate uenyſe man great authoritie ſingular wyſdome experience tyme liued conſtantinoble baſtarde ſonne called lewys whiche lewys ſonne brought vp frō yougth good witte ſyngular induſtrie attayned great ryches throughe lyberalitie gotten many frendes firſt gentleman courte meanes ibrain baſcha tyme myght doe thynges alone ſo well knowen emperour soliman alſo admitted vnto priuate talke thus vſing oportunitie tyme beneuolence liberalitie hongary great turke came hongary great power dignitie poſſeſſe part slauonie next vnto border uenife priuate vſe kepe nether part hongary wherof belgrade chiefe emperour ye turkes ſonne named anthony biſhop quineueeccleſia biſhop clement purpoſed father grādfathers ſake haue made cardinall meane whyle lewys hope leſſe kyngdome muche reputation men father glad exceadingly good lucky ſucceſſe sonne occaſion grudge faction reyſed occaſion citie paris certen place euen within kynges palace aboute one tyme night ſeaſon ſondry billes ſet vp againſt maſſe poinctes religion ſtreight wayes inquyrie ſearche made many apprehended ſome information ſome ſuſpition whiche racked brent alyue vnſtrangled whiche terrible beholde beyng faſtened engyne lifted vp ayre wer punyſhment godly let downe fyre hyghe fynged ſkorched hoyſed vp agayne length hangeman ſhoulde cut corde fall downe fyre vnderneath ſuche alſo thynge learned tongue cut leſt either thei ſhould vtter cauſe death declare vnto people crueltie iohn morin ſomme doctrine buſines iohn motine lieuetenaūt criminell mete miniſter could moſte craftely ſmel ſearche thynge ſuſpected ſo lykewyſe whan founde execution extreme booke marchaūted punyſhement paſſed extremitie neuertheleſſe ſame tyme came forth booke frenche without name authour againſt romyſhe marchauntes tempered mirth grauitie firſt ſayeth howe marchandiſe kynde trade lyfe neyther diſhoneſt vnprofitable common wealth ſo voyde fraude auarice kynde men chriſte toke ſimilitude tyme commaunded talentes receiued ſhould occupied might made gainfull whiche place dede vnderſtande miſtery nothynge leſſe becommeth paſtours miniſters churche leſt ſuſpicion filthy lucre notwithſtanding almighty god offended wickednes men hath ſuffered enter churche ryche welthy marchauntes alſo theues murtherers wyll call hym thefe eyther ſelleth othermans goodes owne counterfeited ware ryght true bier foule diſceaued thyng hath chaunced vnto v longe ſynce ſteade true ſhepeheardes crept exceadyng rauenyng wolues al man witte tongue ſufficiētly able expreſſe theyr craft ſubtiltie yet wyll touche little wherfore theſe marchauntes whome ſpeake craftie beyonde crafty marchauntes meaſure haue ſo auaunced trafficke ſo lytle corner haue fylled full theyr ſtuffe al pretenſed kynde fayned holines apparell differ reſt moſte part ſhauen crowne neyther maye others ſuche haue greate beaſtes charact balles marke permitted occupie trade marchaundyſe theſe ſell ſell againe chaunge buſy marchauntes al time marchauntes ceaſe buſynes vpon holy dayes eſpecially principall feaſtes agayne followe occupie moſte part one kynde marchaundyſe woulles sylkes el corne wyne el cattel metall groſſery ware theſe marchauntes let ſlippe time yeare thei occupie al maner ware nothing eſcapeth handes nother men woman young chyldren well borne vnborne reape againe thinges generall unto luſte ſerueth heauen hell earth tyme ſelfe yea creature lyuinge without lyfe wyne bread oyle flaxe milke butter cheſe water ſalte fyre perfume theſe thynges wrynge golde ſtraunge chaunge ſyluer wonderfull loſſe people concernyng goodes chiefly ſoule hauing infected vtterlye extynguyſhed true doctrine god thinke point ſubtile marchaunt ſell thyng dere wherof bier hath none commoditie ſauyng ſyght thing marchaū te whan ſet forth ware ſell wonte ſay commō ly ſhall ſee loue money theſe farre otherwyſe man departe ſtreightwayes readye demaunde whether wyll haue beſte croſſe beſte bere cloth whan corp goeth burieng el yt worſte beſt ſauyng one ſhall choyſe ſo ſhall paye accordingly beſeche haſt thou thy money thinge carieſt thou awaye beſydes ſyght therof laye vp ware againe next daye ſell muche lyke policie encreaſe pryce thynge better apparell marchaunt price maſſe derer ſom tyme parſō caſe abbot biſhop ſay maſſe muſt coſte monke chaplayne ſaye whiche thynge deede differ nothing common harlottes gayer whore derer ſhe ſelleth filthines pratty ſleyght ſell ſelfe ſame thynge one inſtaunt ſondry men neuer wyſer eſpecially 〈◊〉 ſuche place great reſort people cometh man honour worſhip freers church deſireth haue maſſe freer doucketh ſayeth ſyre furth craueth ſame lykewyſe thyrde alſo laſte commeth forth diſguyſed whan maſſe done taketh whole rewarde euery thinke nothynge gere doth wante wylie wytte moſte parte ſhall fynde nede lytle thynge make profite crafte pollycie fortuneth poore woman commeth churche ſetteth vp candell image marchaunt prieſt hande whiche fyngereth candell putteth ſelleth ſame ſundry others one al ſorte occupie waxe poorer ſorte haue tolde greatter cobbes ſealyng letter writinges whiche ſorte thoſe commonly called officialles commiſſaries seale kepers notary ſuch lyke great choploch whiche ſo farre exceadeth others placeth ſelfe two degree aboue god god called od marchaunt sanctus deus wyll called sanctiſſimus ſaye holy god moſt holy father dede vſeth ware maruelous artificial policie thaungeth leade golde farre exceadinge alcumiſticall multiplier euer agayne ſelleth harte dere namely redde purple whiche byers haue one gotten heades bragge proude pecockes iette vp downe place great reſorte people ſhewe ſet forth ſelues moſte commonlye frequente
