courtes kynges emperours whome checkmate haue wonderfull great prerogatiues maye enioye many byſhoprikes benefice lyſte without charge paymentes againe numbre whiche election clyme hygheſt degree ſeate dignitie whoſe example doctours louen paris namely sorboniſtes ſell cappes alſo batchelars diuinitie charge fare ryght delicately woulde fayne pope iohn woman knowe muche iohn eyght name woman deliuered chylde going proceſſion thirde yeare byſhopryke ſaye would fayne know firſt whether ſhe choſen vertue holy ghoſte whether doinges approued ratified tyme ſhe ſolde cardinalſhippes byſhoprikes abbotſhippes finally thought prieſts marke ſhe receiued returne purpoſe declare whole worlde founde fyne crafte ſubtiltie theſe kynde marchauntes ſee howe haue gotten handes empyres kyngdomes countreis city great poſſeſſions haue oftentymes depoſed couetous marchaunts kinges prynces ſpoyled realmes dominion brought muche myſery nowe ſuche force power kepe al theſe thynges ſtronghand proude marchauntes wyll tourmoyle heauen earth together rather wil forgoe loſe one iote oh vnſatiable woulues howe ryghte tymes paſte haue prophetes apoſtles namely paule peter paynted ſet forth colour marchauntes force man bye ware theſe doe compell men wyll nyll bye refuſe baggage crie vpon heretike fyre hym dieth poore man leauing behinde wyfe chyldren able helpe ſelues pitiefull caſe ſurely poore wydowe worthy releued haue compaſſion vpō hauing eye praye immediatly haue mumbled vp fewe prayer muſt haue money good chere beſydes parſon vicar wyll haue mortuary coarſe preſent beſt thynge houſe greater iniurye theuiſhe marchaunts done ſell thynge owne yea ſell vnto thoſe haue moſte ryght ſondry men one thyng tel pray bought belle hanged vp unto whō belongeth churche flowre patrimony forſouthe ſel ryngyng belle church floure ſo dere ſo oftentymes perauenture wyll ſaye right churche graunt churche whiche chriſte hath waſhed inſtituted iuſtified ſame wherein walke replenyſhed theftes robbery kynd vice chriſte commaundeth theſe thynges geuen frely ſporte pleaſaunt ſyght ſee howe rauens wyll ſtryue amonges ſelues carion ryche man dead brawlynge freers come flockyng ſwarming gaping eche man praye full buſely eſpecially thoſe called beggyng freers graye freers contende dominickes white freers auſten oftentimes buriyng kynde people idle ſloughtful vnprofitable alſo chargeable worthy whipped euery good common wealth theſe thynges haue ſayde denied ſene dayly yet miſerable worlde ſo aſſotted mortall men ſo blynded vnderſtande ſpyrite moued whan benefice prebende fallen lord god buſie ſuite gadding prickyng vp downe diligent inquiſition selling benefice made knowe yearely value worthe abſent reſident vpon profites arryſe chriſtenyng childrē mariages pilgrimage reliques ſaintes may leuied buriynges habites diriges legacy laſte willes moſte auauntage gotten ſuche ſainctes ſome notable propertie power ſore feared ſainct laurēce angry ſalutes anthony roche ſuche angry ſainctes whiche muſte pleaſed vowes great giftes oh ye kinges prince wynke ſo wicked deteſtable thinges ſo longe ſuffer ſo paciently ſo many great enormity wyll dede refuſe reformed yet doubtles haue rule ouer whether wyl god hath geuē ſword authoritie punyſhe vſe ſame auenged moſte cruell kynde extortioner god requyreth dutie handes whiche ye neglecte wyll leaue vnpunyſhed would god diligent auauncing glory vigilante circumſpect handlyng matter let ſlyppe none occaſion kepe ſo good watche wyly marchauntes nothing eſcape hauing many eye eyther ianus argus ſound bel runne thither ſtreight welthie perſone ſicke put ſelues preaſe neuer awaye tyll haue rewarde euery mariage wil muſt bleſſe bride bed ſaye ouer certen praiers chaſt holy men warrant whiche liue ſengle lyfe moſte filthely entent may libertie play partes naughtines whiche haue ſpoken marchauntmen concerneth alſo marchaunt woman called nunnes wherof ther ſondry order idle n 〈…〉 expreſſed wordes idolatry wickednes rabble induced laſt arryſe thou god auenge thy ſelf glory thy name whoſe league ſocietie man ought preſume come foreſayd buchery began moneth nouembre ianuary followyng kyng came paris appeaſe god wrath goeth pylgrymage diuers ſainctes vncredible nombre concourſe people worſhyp paris ſainct geneuefa virgin aboue al ſainctes whoſe image nowe caried great pōpe ſolempne proceſſion whiche neuer wont done tyme geneuefa yt goddes paris extreme daunger whan either god wrath pacified muſte fyght great battell el feare great penury ſkarſitie corne wyne flye vnto vnto laſte ancker porte theyr ſuccour people perſwaded helpe neuer yet deſyred vaine ſo mutch ſome wyll ſaye howe god verey mutche ſaynct geneuefa ſauiour paris caried foure butcher olde cuſtome whiche prepare ſelues hereunto certen dayes faſting prayer officer appoynted make rowme waye whiche done without great payne image borne people runne vnto euery ſyde great deuotion well may touche theyr fyngers ende el theyr cappe handkerchief ſo thronge preaſe people beyonde reaſon whan maſſe done kyng dyned byſhops palace lady churche preſence kinges oration chyldren foreyne ambaſſadours al nobilitie made oration full affection teſtifying inward ſorow conceaued preſumption naughtines theſe wicked perſones made longe diſcourſe concernynge obedience churche exhorted beware peſtiferous ſecte none ſhould eſcape without punyſhement taken maner knewe part owne body infected contagion ſayed woulde teare away leaſt ſhould growe make amendes towardes god ſame daye ſyx brought forth whiche beynge faſtened engine ſayde ſondry place kynge ſhould paſſe home owne houſe burnt fyre beyng kyndled ſame inſtaunt kyng ſhould go waye beſeching hym mercie pardon cuſtome fraunce doe execution none ſilence proclaimed redde cauſes punyſhemen whan man executed hereſy maner execution fraunce touchyng iuſtification fayth without reſpect workes againſt praying ſainctes haue affyrmed chriſte byſhop aduocate mankinde haue eaten fleſhe dayes forboden whiche death ſuche thyng ſpoken generally reported haue offended diuine maieſtie bene cōtumelious againſt virgyn mary ſainctes haue broken lawes mother holy churche therfore people beleue nothynge hurtfull wicked lutherians ab borred worlde kynde people cōmonly ſeen whan burning flammes fyre people wyll gnaſhe theyr teeth euen myddes theyr tourmentes wyl curſe deteſte thē wicked vnworthy loke vpō ſonne turkes ambaſſadours ſame tyme fraunce kyng hymſelfe heard ſame cauſe brought hatred ſuſpicion throughout germany fyryng offended manye firſt day february addreſſed letter vnto prynces ſtates empyre excuſyng frēche kinges letter commyng turkes ambaſſadours fraūce example others whiche haue ſent receyued ambaſſadours turke lyke caſe alſo burnyng lutherians ſaiyng conſtrayned ſeuere againſt owne nature wyll reaſon raſhenes certen whiche vnder pretence religion intended deſtruction common wealth ſo excuſeth matter though bene rebellion religion theſe men executed firſt beginning ſpring tyme lantgraue went vnto king ferdinando yeare lantgraue agreed vpon full reconcilement founde peter paule uerger newly come thither rome vpō occaſion meſſage lantgraue concerning counſel mentioned taking deliberation made none aunſwere yt uerger traueling reſt prince applied buſines diligence fewe monethes lantgraue duke ulriche alſo went vnto kyng ferdināde conuenaunted ſhould come aſke pardon commyng ſeueral tymes eaſely graunted howe beit duke ulriche ſore offended lantgraue alſo duke saxon conſented ſhoulde holde landes houſe auſtriche long tyme doubtful whether woulde ratifie peace made lengthe perſwaſion frendes went ferdinando according conuenauntes moneth aprill emperour tooke ſhippinge emperour voiage barbaria barchin tranſported armie barbarie whan wonne citie tunnes taken caſtell golete reſtored kynge countrey muleaſſes mahumetes religiō whome barbaroſſa turkes admirall expulſed byndyng hym paye tribute fortified caſtell ſtrong garnyſon ſayleth sicilie unto warre byſhop paule ſent certen galleis furnyſhed cōduicte virginie urſine alſo permit take tenthes clergie spaine barbaroſſa men negligence ignoraunce ſteppynge barbaroſſa aſyde eſcaped firſt fled hippon thence argiers repared nauie returned conſtantinople englande two notable men iohn fyſher byſhop rocheſter ſyr thomas moore knyght well learned rocheſtr beheaded fyrſt wrote ſondrye bookes againſt luther moore alſo whileſt chauncelour whiche chiefeſt office extremely puniſhed ſuche ſuſpected luther doctrine neither approued king diuorſemēt much leſſe act parlamēt denying byſhop rome ſupremacie affirmed ye kyng head church englād wherupōbeing apprehended wher perſeuered obſtinatly ī opininiō th • yere ye month iuly beheaded byſhop rome made rocheſter cardinall whyleſt pryſoner towre thyng ſuppoſed rocheſter cardinall haue kyndled hatred againſt hym afterwarde ende octobre fraunces sfortia duke millan died without iſſewe whiche gaue occaſion newe death sfortia warre ſhalbe ſhewed hereafter meane tyme emperour came sicilie vnto naples letter written laſte daye nouembre proteſtauntes ſayd dede wold obſerue peace norinberge notwithſtandyng informed howe thei taken churche goodes withholde ſame whan iudgement geuen ſhould make reſtitution refuſed alledging pacification norinberge appereth vnto hym vnreaſonable diſcontente offende hym time alſo went prince electour saxony vnto kyng ferdinando auſtriche hauing diſpatched buſines whiche went thether retourne home prage chief citie bohemy met byſhoppes legate peter paule uerger declared vnto hym meſſage touchyng generall counſell uergerusto duke saxen whiche byſhop paule intended ſayed holde mantua free godly lawfull without condicions whereunto al prynces conſented bene namely germany wherfore ſhould nowe refuſe men woulde ſuppoſe nothinge could contente hym emperour kynge ferdinando willyng thing place byſhop ſo erneſtly deſyreth ſame vnleſſe brynge paſſe wyll doubtles wery lyfe therfore nowe tyme requyreth ſhould declare howe muche loueth aduauncement god glory common wealth willing let paſſe preſēt oportunitie whiche ſhould hardely tyme hereafter recouer albeit woulde nothynge counſell yet neuertheleſſe ſhould procede chriſt truſted would fayle wher vnto duke saxon ſayd whā deuiſed fellowes duke aunſwer wold make anſwere requiring deliuer vnto ſuch thinges ſpoken wrytinge wherfore kalēdes decembre exhibiting wryting declareth thinges large otherwyſe ſpoken howe ambaſſadours ſent vnto kinges vnto king ferdinando prince germany mantua place agreed vpon emperour kynges germany ful sacramētaries anabaptiſts ſuche ſectes muche daunger nation kepe counſell emonges moſte parte franticke without reaſon agayne ſuch ſuppoſed byſhop woulde gyue place ryght hath bene ſo longe time confirmed farre diſceaued alſo beleue howe emperour holde prouinciall counſell germanye agaynſte byſhops wyll muche abuſed talke ſaufe conduicte pledge theyr commyng italy cauſe ſhould ſo mantua citie empyre nere vnto germany nexte dominion emperour uenetians wherfore daunger finally ſayeth howe wil go kyng ferdinando abiding aunſwere uergerus ſpake luther saxony ſpokē luther wyttemberge retourne kyng ferdinando met duke comming thence homewarde proteſtauntes appointed mete smalcalde ſixte december matter wherfore xxi anſwer prot ſame framed aunſwere byſhops rome ambaſſadour whiche ſaye ſo exacte thynges requyreth yet muche deſyred haue ſame expedition playne manifeſt firſt howe haue declared myndes concerning counſell diuerſe aſſemblies alſo two yeare ſynce emperours byſhop clementes ambaſſadours alſo wyſhe haue lawfull counſel preſeruation cōmon wealth common ſaluation men haue required emperour ioyntly prince alſo thought nedefull hym ſelfe doubting good men deſyre ſuche counſell may helpe profite common wealth greueth many good men true holſome doctrine wicked crueltie certen men euery oppreſſed member churche tone ſondre open crymes mainteined ſuche crueltie becommeth crueltie vnſemely churchman ruler churche wherfore euer nowe moſte nede counſell bothe olde accuſtmed vyces maye roted alſo vniuſte violence crueltie reſtrayned churche henceforth ſet due ordre therfore wyll fayle common wealth herein wyll ryght gladlye come vnto ſuche counſell ſondrye aſſemblies empyre hath bene agreed vpon beſechyng god doinges may redounde vnto glory ſaluation men wher biſhop hath choſen mantua place truſte aſſuredly emperour wyll poynte ſwarue decree empyre owne promyſe alſo muche prouyded counſell ſhould holden germany ſayeth daungerous keping ſame truthe farre wyſe peryll prynces cyties obedient emperoure onlye cyties ſo ordered defende ſtraungers iniuries ſaue peryll therfore oughte chieflye kepte intent matter controuerſie might duely debated men might frankely ſpeake iudge vpryghtly feare force faction ſaye theyr myndes freely two yeares paſte clement ſeuenth promyſed counſell condition verye caption nowe chiefeſt point craftely left touchyng lybertie counſell treatie partlye referred craft ſpied byſhop rome whoſe office ſaye call ordre counſell nowe byſhop whiche hath ſo ofte condempned theyr religion doctrine opē enemie caſe ſhould permitte theyr aduerſary geue iudgement coulde counſell free wherein aduyſe emperour prynces mete men ſhould choſen whole numbre whiche accordyng vnto god worde might heare determine cauſe counſell iudiciall ſeate byſhop rome ſtates alſo proued example primatiue churche alſo holy ſcripture prynces ſtates haue tymes paſte admitted counſelles hearyng matter whereſome woulde haue byſhoppes power aboue authoritie whole churche agaynſt reaſon full tyrannye belongeth well emperour ciuile empe may order counſels ſtates ſet foote counſelles choſe experte men eſpeciallye ſuche cauſes byſhoppes errours impugned wytte falſe doctrine idolatry thynge permitted alſo byſhop rome lawe feinge vniuerſall cauſe men concerneth pepes concempned hereſy whole common wealth emperours parte prynces forſee vpryght iudgement byſhops owne people alſo byſhoppes rome haue time paſte bene condempned hereſy obſtinacie emperoure churche together tyme contention manie weightie matter whiche byſhop doth defende wordes alſo wycked cruell decree puniſhyng moſt ſharpely ſuche obey ſame muche therfore aduerſary ſuſteineth one halfe ſute thinge ſelfe requireth whole church emperour kinges take hande preſcribe ordre deciding matter wherfore haue done euer ſo requyre nowe alſo matter maye handled vpryghtlye accordynge example holye wrytte olde primatiue churche ſo maye wyll behynde theyr partes truſtynge truthe ſhall come lyghte glorye sauioure chriſte aduaunced tranquillitie reſtored churche otherwyſe doubte greater commotion wyll arryſe therof hytherto hath bene ſeen partes wil tyme neglecte common wealth forſake ſhrynke true doctrine ſo lykewyſe matter thynges peace concorde kyng fraūce whiche fully determined make warre italy ſent ambaſſadour williā bellaye aſſemblie smal oration frēch ambaſſad calde xix daye decembre eloquent oration firſt excuſeth kynges ſeueritie punyſhynge certen owne ſubiectes whiche withſtanding nothing preiudicial hurtfull cauſe religion though ſome euill tongue dyd reporte ſo diſpleaſure tyme force ſuppreſſe rebellion common punyſhed anabaptiſtes yet nothing without iuſt cauſe wherfore diſtruſteth men ſuch wyſdome grauitie wyll lyght reporte conceaue euill opinion ſo noble kynge frende nowe vrgent cauſes ſpoken conſtrayned againſt nature vſe extreme puniſhment folyſh pitie marreth citie leſt hauing ſo large realme ſhould ouermuche lenitie ſet open wyndowe wickednes temeritie manye touching religion doctrine kyng wyll take vpō perſone iudge dede lyketh many thinges well reſt leaueth vndiſcuſſed goeth wynne theyr fauour confuteth theyr opinion whiche warned ware forayne ambaſſades proueth ſame doth tende theyr owne hynderaunce bondage ſayinge people ſo ſtronge long proſper floryſhe vnleſſe mainteined league amitie theyr neyghbours frendſhyp kynges fraunce prynces germanye fraunce germany one ofſpring hath bene ſuche auncientie nation procedinge one originall lye ſo borderynge together maye onlye ayde ſtrengthe alſo honour beautie one vnto therfore whan kynge hearde ſaye howe germaynes dyd hardely agree amonge ſelues ryght ſorye muche hym lyeth wyſheth reconcilement fearyng leſt diſſention religion ſhould come ſome ſorowfull ende wherfore vnderſtandinge theyr owne preſeruation nowe aſſembled kynge ſent hym declare vnto aduiſe thus muche free general counſel could yet obtained germains within thē ſelues ſhold aſſemble altogether come ſome vnitie concord furtheraūce cauſe caſe ſo contented choſe certen well learned men experte diuines fraunce ſende germany ſame reconcilement el woulde ſende ſome fraunce lyke purpoſe ſhould maruelous great pleaſure meane tyme doth exhorte peace amonges ſelues knitte mindes mutual conſent brotherly loue king wyl neuer ayde ennemies neyther helpe counſell caſe continue good wyll towardes hym haue done alwayes hitherto beginnyng booke ſhewed howe iudges imperiall chamber contrary emperours decree made proces againſt proteſtauntes iudges chamber trouble yt proteſtātes iudges dede wer romiſh religiō tyme emperour retourned warre auſtriche italy ſuite clergie whiche complayned proteſtauntes attempted lawe againſt albeit emperours proclamation contrary yet proceede againſt proteſtauntes wrote herein emperour duke saxon ſelfe traueled kynge ferdinando cō maunded lawe ceaſe ratifieth peace made emperour would ſtaye proteſtauntes vtterly refuſe iudgement ſuſpected enemy declaryng cauſes wherfore would admitted encouraged emperours letter whereby gaue emp letter authoritie iudge whiche matter religion ſo proceaded onlye doubtfull cauſes ſuche alſo concerned religion nothyng el duke saxon obtayneth newe commaundement kyng ferdinando vayne finally muche adoe ferdinando conſented would fynde meanes ſtaye matter lawe whiche duke fellowes touchyng religion cō pryſed peace norinberge unto ſuche thynges french anſwer proteſtauntes frenche ambaſſad ambaſſadour ſpoken anſwere made albeit execution done reportes went diuerſly yet ſayeth thei went ſedicion muche offended kynges doynges herein whiche deede woulde ſuffer ſuche thynge ſelues owne countrey neuertheleſſe woulde wyſhe kynge ſhould haue reſpecte vnto ſuche profeſſe pure doctrine goſpell whiche proteſted aſſemblye auſpurge punyſhe reſt denied many falſe wicked opinion crept churche vnlearned malicious perſones defende great crueltie maynteyne lucre authoritie maruelous polycie forge oftentimes great crymes vpon good innocēt perſones exaſperate kynges mynde agaynſt ſeyng propre office kynges prince ſeeke god glorye duty prince pourge churche crrours inhibite vniuſte crueltie deſyre inſtantly ſame moſte mightie kyng would wholy applye ſelfe hereunto ſo doe wyll ſuppoſe beareth frendly louyng mynde towardes wyſhe lucky fortunate highnes churche touchinge auncient alliaunce frendſhyp betwixt kynges fraunce prynces almaygne talke ryght pleaſaunt wyll power endeuour ſame mutuall loue amitie may long continue concernyng reconcilement opinion religion deſyre nothyng el matter may heard indifferently determined lawfull counſell muche office byſhop rome appointe counſell ſame thynge alſo concerneth kynges prince deſyre kynge forſee violent counſell called place ſuſpect perillous intent vnder name counſel true doctrine extinguiſhed ſo weyghty matter concerne preſeruation peace vniuerſall churche euery particular perſone free diſputations vpright iudgement accordingly whiche thinge ſhould get kyng immortal fame thankes preſent age alſo tyme come ſo longe worlde ſhould endure conferens betwene learned mē fraunce germany requireth long deliberation diuerſe cōmiſſions extende ſuche matter ſo ſone thyng may determined herein wyll aduertyſe kyng letter deſyre nothyng holſome doctrine myght ſet forth auaunced laſt ſayde howe kynge would geue none ayde againſt glad heare thereof wherfore thynges concerne emperour empyre alſo wyll aſſiſt man againſt hym ambaſſadour alſo priuate talke pontane melancthon lantgraues learned men iames sturmins ſondry doctrine declared kynges opinion euery article myndes alſo learned men fraunce eſpecially paris byſhop rome ſupremacie kinges opinion matter controuerſie lordes ſupper maſſe inuocation ſainctes image free wyl purgatory iuſtification monaſtical vowes marriage prieſtes moſte theſe thynges kyng agreeth booke melancthon hath wrytten common place touchyng byſhop rome kynge wholy philippus commō place malancthon opinon chief ſupreme god lawe man lawe affirmeth kyng england denieth certenly byſhop vſurpeth ouermuche authoritie whan taketh vpō hym depoſe kynges emperours whiche nowe entendeth put practyſe againſt kynge englande albeit kynge alſo diuers cardinalles iutreate contrary diuines ſay head churche god lawe kyng demaunded place could ſhewe miſliketh alſo defence pourgatory wel ſpryngeth maſſe dirige al theyr marchaundiſe maſſe taken away combes cut maſſe mainteineth purgatory ſhould lōger able defende authoritie whā kyng graūted certen monethes wherin ſhold proue purgatory scripture aunſwered lengthe howe oughte reache enemy weapon whiche myght vſe againſt thē touching monaſticall vowes kyng ſuppoſeth might obteined byſhop none ſhould taken yong monaſticall voues vower type yeares ſhould lawfull depart thence whan woulde mary thinketh good deface theyr houſes conuerte college wherein yought may brought vp learnyng vertue diuines would caſe haue prieſtes liue vnmaried king deuiſed meane waye ſuche haue maried wyues ſhold remayne ſo ſtyll reſt mary abſteyne frō miniſtration churche concerning y• whiche alledged paphnutius counſell niece perſwaded mariage paphnutius prieſtes diuines aunſwere proued prieſtes haue maried tyme withſtandynge wyl deny wyues admitted ordre prieſthod concerning lordes ſupper receyued wholye vnder kyndes terme kynge conference herein lordes ſuppervnder kyndes clement ſeuenth truſteth alſo wylbe obtayned byſhoppes handes ſhalbe lawfull euery man receiue conſcience moreouer kynge affirmeth hondreth yeare ſynce fraunce receiued whole ſupper myddes churche chappelles heard old men make relatiō agayne kynges fraunce receyue whole communiō kynge obiected vnto diuines made aunſwere kynges anoynted well prieſtes scripture ſpeaketh prieſthode royall ſame whiche lawfull kynges permitted others lyke caſe furthermore mattins dayly ſeruice kyng doth acknowledge many thinges may cut many taken cleane away clemēt ſeuenth committed charge vnto cardinall crucei spaniarde whoſe boke ſame thing remayneth whiche diuines paris haue condempned hereſy whiche ſuche kynde men wyll condempne onlye germaines wicked erring religion alſo byſhop hym ſelfe cardinalles caſe require ſeynge whole matter full difficultie kyng altogether addicted haue churche reſtored vnitie concorde hath talked herein duke bauier fyndeth ſtiffer thā diuines paris finally exhorted admitte place counſel kyng maiſters alſo kyng englandes aduiſe whiche wyll conſent one moreouer certen yeres paſt lewys frenche kyng contended laweful kynges fraunce nauane ercommunicated iuly byſhop appointe counſel without conſent emperour kynges kyng nauarre ſame opinion iuly excommunicate ferdinando kyng spayne title inuaded nauarre kyng nowe alſo mynde opinion neyther wyll admitte counſel vnleſſe place ſure ſuſpected apt iniury wherin man may ſpeake mynde frely beſydes talke mentioned earneſtly hand enter league kynge principall cauſe hys ambaſſade except emperour againſt ſayde myght attempte nothynge departed without proteſt would make league wt kyng purpoſe certen ſpake counſell marueled would neglecte ſo mightie kyng ſayde tyme woulde come wherin would wyſhe haue redemed frendſhyp derely kyng englande alſo henry eyght ſent thether ambaſſade chief wherof edward foxe byſhop hereforde begynning made relation muche aliaunce kinred oratiō byſhop fore ambaſſa kynge englande great betwene kynges england prince saxō kyng beare muche good wyll towardes hym hys cōſortes eſpecially ſynce chief endeuour ſet forth god true knowledge vnto others al cauſe haue ſuſteyned great reproche yet doth miſlyke neuer whyt therfore iudgeth otherwyſe ſuche good men contrary dutie without reaſonable cauſe wyll doe nothing haue reſpect true preachynge goſpell god glory myght aduaunced ſame deſyre alteration religion englande kyng alſo whiche ſufficiently enough declared alteratiō englād kinges cōmaundemēt great part errours abolyſhed commō aſſent whole realme byſhop rome deceiptfull iugglynges frō thence cleane banyſhed lyke caſe saxony ſo muche ſame deſyre good wyll common kyng hath wonderfull great affection towardes woulde thus procede profeſſe al one doctrine ſhould doubtles eſtablyſh continuall peace quiet commotion haue arryſen diuerſitie opinion kynge vnderſtandeth anabaptiſtes theyr example haue declared byſhop nowe pretendeth though would calle counſel certenly remayne diſſention doe agree doctrine wyl make much againſt whan ſhall come counſell wherein notwithſtandyng imputeth fault diuines ſtate churche neuer ſo quiet ſome tyme hath diſſention whiche thynge alſo proued example peter paule ſtate churche troubleſome barnabas therfore vniformitie ſought maye grounded vpon ſure foundation scripture byſhop rome endeuoureth myght let peace concord wherfore kynge opinion ſo longe authoritie tyranny crueltie endureth vnpoſſible come agrement kynge hath lately deliuered realme englande moſte fylthie bondage reſtored vnto lybertie idole antichriſte nowe ſtarke madde work miſchief openly goeth fraude gyle falſe forged ſclaunders incenſe kynges againſt hym al woulde thynge mainteyne authoritie yet deuyſe polycie ſtyre vp cruell warres ſet one others toppe kynges pleaſure ſhould thus declare vnto ſtode feare byſhop ſo furnyſhed thynges cared neyther hym yet adherentes intent might clerely perceyue antechriſtes purpoſe rage antichriſt chieflye preſent tyme whan pretendeth holde counſell mynde intendeth farre thynge kyng doeth confeſſe graunte lawfull diſputation profitable expedient common wealth yet ought forſeen wyſe ther ſuch coūſel ſhal intreate eſtablyſh biſhoppes authoritie wherfore requyreth admonyſheth wyll allowe counſell common peace made chriſtendome moreouer wiſheth god true religion ſeruice maye reſtored whiche thinge accomplyſhe mayntaine content ioyne hym ſelfe theſe thynges commaū ded declare vnto moreouer required thē might hereafter haue conference theſe matter priuately certen appointed perſones kyng bare ſuche affection towards religion would employ herein al treaſure hym ſelfe alſo whereunto made aunſwere commending kinges good wyll ſhewe howe chief deſyre doctrine goſpell myght ſpred far abrode whatſoeuer herein done dutie haue ſuffered ſame great rebuke iniuries although thei haue procured thē ſelues hereby moſte heinous diſpleaſures haue oftentymes endured malice threatnynges many yet haue nothynge relented ſlacked therfore enterpryſe ſettyng forth moſte holy thyng cauſe ſo great hatred malice forſaken wicked errours falſe doctrine kyng promyſed ayde herein ſo ample maner alſo hath expulſed banyſhed realme tyranny byſhop rome whence well ſprang wicked idolatrye glad ioyful heare beſeche god may thus procede moreouer doeth admonyſhe thē beware diſſention doctrine gyue hym harty thankes doubtles controuerſie doe perſeuer ſame doctrine whiche profeſſed auſpurge concernynge anabaptiſtes thē extremely punyſhed vnleſſe come amendement alſo reigne chiefly thoſe place wher doctrine goſpell prohibited talke alſo byſhop craftie dealynge pleaſed muche byſhops legate nowe germany makyng promyſe counſel holden mantua howe talked herein prynce electour saxony deliberate aunſwere made vnto demaundes compriſed wryting whiche ſhall haue deliuered vnto hym beare vnto kyng intent may vnderſtāde mynde herein kynges ſocietie coniunction wherof ſpake yelde harty thankes alſo intent ſo holſome doctrine may kepe ryght courſe wil ſpare neyther paynes peryl doubte god wyl gouerne theſe affayres although aduerſary doe neuer ſo muche contende ſpurne againſt becauſe deſyreth conferre theſe thynges large ſome men priuatly haue choſen certen ſame purpoſe whome may cōmunicate thing praying reporte ſo vnto kynge theyr good wyll towardes hym may appere better commendation whan duke saxon retourned kynge ferdinando proteſt league renewed smalcalde twelfte decembre chriſtmas euen decree made league whiche laſted one yeare longer ſhoulde renewed ten yeares howe reſte furniture ſhoulde prouyded agreed receyue ſame league ſuch wyllynge deſyrours ſo profeſſe doctrine propounded auſpurge woulde beare ſcot lotte emonges whome prynces pomerane ulriche duke wyrtemberge roberte bauier prynce bipounte aulpurge franckeforte kempten hamborough hannobria herein toke ordre howe withſtande defende themſelues againſte vniuſt iudgement emperiall chambre ſame tyme alſo william erle naſſowe admitted league albeit lantgraue reaſon controuerſie betwixt erle naſſowe lande chattes aſſente yet wrong offered profeſſion goſpell ſayde woulde fayle caſe deſyred ayde yeare alſo senate goſpel receiued auſpurge auſpurge diſſention length taken cleane awaye receyueth doctrine goſpell wrytinge letter vnto luther intreate hym would ſende faithful miniſters churche amonges others urbanus regius ✚ tenth booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument tenth booke citie munſter preachyng barnarde rotman receaued goſpell wherupon clergie theyr byſhop forſoke place neuertheleſſe reconcilemēt made lantgraue came thether hollande anabaptiſte called iohn leiden hauing wonne rotman diuers others infected whole citie poyſon ſo muche ſecte ſet miſchief became ſtrōger thinges common married many wylles iohn leiden death iohn matthewe declared chiefeſt prophet ſhortly kyng vniuerſall hauing cheyalry power life death citie beſeged metinge appointed confluence enforce ſiege anabaptiſtes ſent letter lantgraue booke doctrine whiche luther impugned citie extreme famine laſt ſurpryſed wonne kyng companion taken priſoners whoſe execution recited buſines mū ſter aſſemblie appointed wormes duke sauope beſegyng geneua repoulſed kyng fraunce prepareth armie go towardes millan occaſion mentioned ryght whiche pretendeth haue emperour beynge aduertyſed enterpriſes commeth rome accuſeth kyng ſolliciteth pope holde counſell proteſtauntes make league kyng englande pope publiſheth counſell kept mantua warre betwyxt emperour frenche kynge archebyſhop collon reformeth countreis nowe muſt come ſiege munſter munſter citie weſtophalia metropolitane citie weſtphalia firſt certen thinges repeted euen beginning vntyll ſuch tyme citie finally taken chief malefactours executed ſpake thomas mūcer fiſt boke howe reyſed tumulte communaltie ſhewed doctrine alſo howe endeth lyfe ſchole procedeth original anabaptiſtes doctrie maners kynde prople whiche practiſe doctrine called anabaptiſtes alſo ſome thing mētioned thei prohibite chriſtening child thē ſelues baptiſed affirming others ought lykewyſe take away al efficacitie former baptiſme pretende certen outwarde holynes teache howe lawful chriſtians go law beare office take othe neither haue thynge priuate yt al thīgs ought cōmō vnto al mē thꝭ ye begīning afterwardes thei propounde great deale heinous matter ſhall hereafter declare whan began ſpreade ouer germany luther almoſte learned men inueyhed againſt magiſtrate alſo punyſhed ſo much could great nūbre cleaue together length placed ſelues forſayde citie whiche dede great ſtrengthe fortuned thus farre citie munſter churche ſainct morice wherin yeare lorde xxxij barnarde rotmā preached goſpell great rotman preacher audience citie deuiſed receiue citie catholickes hinder gyue hym meane ſumme money intent ſhould go ſome place exerciſe ſelfe learning departeth certen place thought attayne ſome knowledge fewe monethes retourneth wherewith beinge ſore offended doe endeuour debarre preaching vayne ſo great fauoure people within whyle certen beſte principall senatours receyue hym citie kept churche ſet vp pulpet hym churche porche heare hym without audience encreaſed daylye requeſte made churche myght open hym el ſhould dores broken vp longe aduiſe certen people choſen writinge letter heſſia far lantgraues countrey deſyreth certen good well learned men myght ſent thether helpe hym preache goſpell wherfore couple ſent thether marpurge came thether conſulted rotman thre others howe myght bannyſhe byſhop rome authoritie fyrſte myghte teache goſpel profit hearer compaſſing wherof waye ſemed vnto beſt drawe certen article byſhops error numbre thyrty delyuer senate beynge meane tyme ſo prepared vnleſſe could proue scripture theſe directly againſt god worde would refuſe punyſhment senate cōmaundeth catholiques clergie come court propoundeth vnto forſayde article errours becauſe haue alwayes pretended theyr doctrine pure grounded vppon goddes worde preacher denye ſame wyll ieoperde theyr lyues proue demaunde whether wyll confute scripture ſuche thynges obiected beyng thus ſpoken vnto perceyuynge senate tooke pleaſure thynge aunſwere fewe wordes haue nothyng alledge ſelues haue affirmed hitherto doinges papiſts cō ſeſſe ignoraunce ryght good done wening ignoraunce senate muche conuicte falſe doctrine nothyng ſaye ſelues confeſſed owne naughtines commaundeth henceforth teache geue place church theſe newe preacher whiche haue detected errours conſent senate common people church aſſigned euerye ſhoulde preache whiche thynge popyſhe prieſtes toke diſpleaſauntly eſpecially thoſe cathedrall churche beynge moſte parte gentleman borne good houſes tyme coulde otherwyſe preuayle departe thence great diſlikynge go vnto byſhop citie layinge heades together doe papiſts forſake citie deuiſe ſtoppe wayes paſſages ſhould corne brought vnto citie lyttle whyle whan wayes ſtopped euery ſyde byſhop others afore ſayde conſultation come telget litle town myle without citie whence meſſenger ſent ſenate letter effect ſhoulde forſake enterpryſe reſtore olde former ſtate el would take thē ennemies byſhop countie fraunces waldeck laſt hym frederick brother archebyſhop collon frederick forſaketh byſhoprike eyther coulde haue health thoſe party el becauſe ſmelled ſome thynge long forſoke place owne accorde content lyue priuate lyfe home countrey munſterians conſulting matter deteyne meſſenger ſetting forth vpō chriſtmas euē night mū ſter oppreſſe papiſtes • c coming vpon thē ſoden taking towne keping gate yt none ſhold eſcape apprehend thē al biſhop gone thēce day happened cary priſoners citie amōges wer chief clergie diuers others nobilitie ſenate demaundeth thē intēt whether purpoſe hereafter diſturbe preaching yt goſpell make gentle anſwer wyl endeuour ſame doctrine may floryſhe wherupon cōuenaunt made copie condicious peace wherof senate ſent vnto lantgraue requeſtinge goſpell common wealthes ſake would matter ſendeth certen counſel whoſe meditatiō cōcluded reconciled myndes forgetting al diſpleaſure paſt partes ſhould obſerue peace goſpell ſhould preached ſyxe church al wicked ſuperſticious religion ſhould aboliſhed cathedrall churche nothyng ſhould altered neyther citie ſhould imagine ſame cōcerned thyng cōcluſion peace confirmed seales lātgraue biſhop clientes nobilitie cōmon people foretenth day february yeare ſaluation xxxiij whā al thinges thus pacified cōmeth certen cobler mū ſter hollande one iolm leidan ranke anabaptiſt acquainted preacher goſpel demaūded iohn leidā anabap priuatly whether ſuppoſed yonge childrē rightly chriſtened affirmed wholy addict contrary opiniō began ſmile contempne theyr anſwere thing perceiued barnarde rotman mētioned exhorteth people ſermō pray yt may kepe ſtill trewe doctrine maynteine infected fantaſtiēall perſons namely anabaptiſtes alſo priuely crept amongs kept company others whoſe opinion ſhoulde preuaile ſtate cōmon wealth religiō alſo ſhould become miſerable ſame time came thither alſo hermā stapred herman stapred beyng cōpagnion rotman inueighed openly againſt chriſtening child ſcholler henricke rollie whiche lyttle executed utreight thopinion anabaptiſme another occaſion newe doctrine nowe matter comen ſo farre great brute anabaptiſtes throughout citie albeit yet thynge cloſſelye ſecretly wroughte man admitted vnleſſe theyr ſecte beſydes chiefe aucthors profeſſe theſe thynges openly neyther taught night mē ſtepe practiſed theyr miſteries whan thinge knowen many citezens ſore offended whiche ſaid ſuffrable newe doctrine ſhould priuatly taught night decree senate commaunded departe citie anab baniſhed citie went one way came another braggyng god commaunded remayne defended theyr cauſe earneſtly thing troubled senate alſo ſtroke ſoden admiration wherefore auoidinge tumulte daunger senate commaunded preacher aſwell anabaptiſme goſpel come certein learned men rotman bewray opinion rotman became anabaptiſt kept cloſe vntill time condemned chriſtenynge child wycked deteſtable herman buſche chieflye defended contrarye opinion senate ſuche ſorte commaunded get oute cytye immediatlye common decree alledged myghte ſafelye paſſe throughe byſhoppes countrey senate obtayned ſaufe conduicte gaue alſo money beare theyr charge whiche longe determined go whither el went priuely follower theyr ſecte lurked certen ſpace meane tyme came abroade agayne senate ſhut vp church ſaue one fearyng leſt anabaptiſtes numbre whome encreaſed dayly accompanied teacher ſhoulde haue driuen preacher goſpell church afterwardes moneth nouembre lantgraue requeſt senate ſent two thether preache theodoricke fabritius conſtā cie fabritius iohn melſinger dede vnderſtanding trouble towardes affrayde daunger retourned home agayne aboade ſtoutely admonyſhyng citezens diligently beware anabaptiſticall doctrine keepe ſtyll courſe perſeuered tyll anabaptiſtes gettinge vpper hande droue reſte citie hereafter ſhalbe recited entent thei ſhould fynde lacke nothyng penneth certen fourme doctryne eccleſiaſticall adminiſtration whiche allowed senate commōs moreouer leaue senate peter peter wirtemie wirtemie began preache agayne made fewe sermon inſtigation rotman expulſed anabaptiſtes nowe waxinge fierſe prouoked fabritius others diſputation senate conſente matter ſhould tried scripture ſuche like wrytinges agreable ſame ſhould certen well learned men arbitrers conſyderynge ſentences reaſons eyther parte ſhould determine caſe decreed ratified intent fine controuerſie ſecluded peace might reſtored churche cōdition rotman fellowes refuſed wherfore whan would abyde iudgement began diſpyſed intent myght waſhe ſpotte inuente waye eaſye one though moued ſpirite prophecie prophet inſpired tuneth vp downe citie cry repente repente baptyſed agayne wrath god ſhall nowe ouerwhelme began common people ſturre many chriſtened agayne cryed ſame maner dyd many feare god anger ſo much bragged abuſed ſimplicitie beyng deede otherwyſe euyll followe myndes herein others alſo ſauyng goodes rebaptyſed anabaptiſtes puniſhed ſore theyr aduerſaries beſt loſſe theyr ſubſtaunce ende decembre nowe agayne crept dennes ſpake reſortyng market make outcrye cōmaund whiche rebaptiſed ſhould ſlayne paganes wicked men take common piece ordinaunce eiuile war citie munition inuade towne houſe muche miſchief many others intent myght defend ſpoyle iniurie kepe againſt ſtronge place citie take diuers contention anabaptiſtes kept market fortified euery ſyde continewed ſo longe tyl laſt came compoſitiō geuing pledge party wherby agreed euery one ſhould follow religion ſhould go home kepe peace meane tyme rotman cnipperdoling whiche chief faction notwithſtandynge commended compoſition cnipperdolyng yet ſendynge letter priuely townes nere warned men ſecte leauing goodes behynde ſhoulde repare vnto poſſible diligence ſoeuer left behinde ſhoulde receiue ten tymes muche recompence allured ſo large ample promiſes came thether great nombres men woman hauing aſſured hope attaine better fortune eſpecially ſuche poore able lyue home reſorte citie munſter tounes mē eſpecially thoſe great ſubſtaunce ſawe theyr citie full ſtraungers conueyed ſelues thence well myght leauing anabaptiſtes multitude ſhroftyde moneth february mdxxxiiij tyme one parte thus weakened anabaptiſtes doe chouſe newe ſenatours owne factiō alſo make new conſelles one cnipperdolyng ſhortly fyred churche ſaint morice ſuburbes buyldinges thereabout ſpoyle church vndermyne cathedrall churche within done flocke together euerye ſtrete crye firſt repente repente auoyde thence quickly ye wicked men vnleſſe intende hazarde lyues finally aſſemble armure al ſecte immediatly thruſt citie without reſpect age ſexe ſo muche hurly burly diuerſe woman miſcaried chylde ſone put flyghte ſtreight wayes toke goodes albeit happened yt day beſieged citie yet neuertheleſſe certen thē fled chaū ced byſhoppes handes toke ennemies dyuerſe loſt heades emonges others one two preacher goſpell ſame peter wirtemie beyng daunger amonges reſt requeſt lantgraue preſerued whiche thynge moued reſidue honeſt citizen mynded forſake towne yet ſeyng preſent daūger without maner conſtrayned tary agaynſt wil ſame tyme chiefeſt prophet amonges name doe vſurpe themſelues iohn mathewe commaunded loke golde ſyluer euery man ſhoulde brynge iohn matthewe high prophet foorth vnder payne death ſame purpoſe common treaſure houſe appointed people beyng fore aſtonied cruel decree durſt obeye neyther myght man diſceiue begile thē part two certen yonge maydens prophecied coulde declare fraude vſed neither bryng maydens prophecie toke alſo owne vſe goodes thē whome expulſed ſame prophet cominaunded man henceforth ſhould haue kepe booke ſauing holy byble others commaunded brought forth brent commaū dement ſayde geuen hym aboue therfore bookes brought thether wonderfull numbre conſumed fyre chaunced ſame tyme one hubert trutelynge ſmyth ſpoken ſome thynge ieſte againſt whiche named ſelues prophetes whan knowen called people together ieſtyng p • nyſhed commaunded put harneſſe mā accuſed cōdemned die whiche thinge aſtonied people maruelouſly chief prophet named taketh poore man caſteth hym downe flat vpon grounde thruſteth ſpeare hym yet gaue deadly wounde although pearſed hym great violence done commaunded caryed away another place caught boore ſpeare young man hande ſtode next laie iobbed ſtaffe heade ſeyng man would die ſayde howe declared vnto hym heauen tyme yet come dye god graūted pardon notwithſtandyng died within fewe dayes whiche thyng whan prophet knewe toke long moriſpike rode vp prophet inſpired wt 〈◊〉 downe towne great pace crieng god father commaunded hym diſcomfite ennemies without citie put flyght whan came nere campe ſouliour encountred ran albeit yt falſe prophecie thus detected ſeconde tyme yet fellowe prophetes ſo bewitched men made matter ſo fayre common people ryght ſory loſſe hym ſaying hanged ſome great plage ouer ſo worthye man taken next prophet vnto hym iohn leidan bad good comforte reuealed vnto hym longe ſhoulde thus ende lyfe ſhould marry wyfe two day eaſter ran euery churche range belle one fewe dayes cnipperdoling prophecieth ſuch cnipperdoling prophecieth placed high dignitie ſhalbe caſt downe others preferred rowmes lowe baſe degree commaundeth church ſhould deſtroyed affirminge earneſtlye commaundement came god therfore obeyed commaundement whiche ſayd came heauen accomplyſhed great diligence longe iohn leidane deliuereth ſworde execution vnto cnipperdoling appointeth hym hangeman thus hath pleaſeth god whiche horſe aſſe borne hygheſt office conſulſhyp ſhould haue loweſt office hangeman refuſyng toke offer good part alſo whan byſhop nowe ſpace two thremonethes borne whole charge warre alone herman archebyſhop collon iohn duke claeue ſent hym money munition certen bandes horſemen fotemen ayde archebiſhop wēt alſo campe taſiſt hym coū ſell longe citie aſſaulted diuers place hope wynne aſſaulte buylded ſeuē bulwarkes fortes citie take away victualles put euery forte enſeigne fotemen certen bādes horſmen wynter continuance ſiege warre whiche aſwell concerned others byſhop munſter deſyred ayde thoſe prince city prouince rhine reaſon nere hande whiche cauſe aſſemblie appointed cōfluence xiij daye decembre yeare mdthe diuiſiō germany prouice xxxiiij germany deuided ſixe prouinces frankony bauier swelande saxonie coaſte rhyne burgundy within whiche limites prince city aunciēt cuſtome accōpted aſſemblies empyre saxonye deuided hyghe lowe agayne baſe countrey germany weſtphalia auſtriche added hereūto ſo empyre conteineth ten region aſſaulte attempted vayne iohn leidane gaue ſelf reſte ſlepeth thre whole day together tyme awake ſpake worde ſalſhod leidane laſt called forpaper wherin wrote name twelue men wherof certen gentleman whiche twelue trybes iſrael ſhould rule gouerne thynges ſayde twelue iudges wyll heauenly father thus meanes theſe twelue men prepared awaye kyngdome propoundeth certē opinion preacher whiche requireth haue confuted teſtimonies scripture vtter people may approued ratified ſome wherof man boūden one wife might paradox iohn leiden lawfully marry many liſt whan preacher reproued opinion calleth counſell houſe twelue mē alſo come thither taketh cloke throweth grounde newe teſtament withall witneſſing ſwearing ſame thinge whiche propounded reuealed vnto heauen therfore thretneth right high wordes thoughe ſhould haue god theyr frende vnleſſe conſented fine agree opinion doctor preache matrimony three dayes together ſtreight way marieth three wyues one wherof one wife aforeſaid great prophet iohn mathew whoſe example afterwardes others folow ſo muche accompted praiſe often married diuerſe honeſt citezens miſliked doynges geuing notice throughout citie called ſuche profeſſed doctrine sedition citie goſpell market place afterwardes apprehended prophet cnipperdolinge preacher whiche thing raſcall people vnderſtode came armure tooke away priſoners ſlewe fiftie wt great crueltie tyed vnto tree pillers ſhotte dagges theyr highe prophet greatly commendinge wylling would god pleaſure ſhoote firſt howbeit others otherwiſe murthered eight kalendes iuly arriſeth newe prophet goldſmith calling aſſemblie people marketplace declareth vnto howe commaundement heauenly father iohn leidane ſhould poſſeſſe thempire whole worlde marchyng forwarde puiſſaunt iohn leidā inuadeth kingdome armie ſhould diſtroy kinges prince without reſpecte ſpare multitude leaſt ſuch loued righteouſnes ſhould poſſeſſe ſeate dauid father vntill ſuche time father ſhould reuoke kingdome owne handes howe wicked beyng deſtroyed godly men ſhould reigne life theſe thinges openly declared iohn leidane immediately fell downe vpon knee liftyng vp handes vnto heauen ſaid men brother thing knew many dayes ſins yet would neuer ſpeake intent might better credit new king anabap father hathe vſed another miniſter beynge thus made kinge forthwith diſplaceth xii men cuſtome kynges chouſeth vnto noble commaūdeth alſo ſworde á gylte ſeabarde two crownes cheyne ſ •• ptre ſuche like ornamentes ſhould prouided pure golde appointed certen dayes wherin wyll heare openly haue ſutes hym ofte came abroade accōpanied pompe noble officer houſhold next followed two yōgmen ryding wherof one ryght hande caried crowne byble bare ſworde drawen lyke pompe went chief wyfe diuers one market place prepared hym highe ſeate hanged cloth golde ſuch complaintes ſutes came moſte part concerning wyues diuorcementes whiche moſte common caſes ſo much many liued together long time firſt diuorſed fortuned tyme people ſtoode thicke preaſing heare beholde cnipperdoling lea peth forth creping vpon men heades ſholders ſtoode madnes cnipper thick together breathing mouthes ſayd vnto euery one father hath ſanctified receiue holy ghoſt certen tyme daunced kyng thus ſayeth wonte playe tymes paſt whore father hath commaunded lykewyſe kyng ouer tedious could make none ende kyng offended departed thā getteth vp kynges ſeate toke vpon king kynge retourning meane tyme plucked headlōg kepeth pryſon thre dayes ſiege compyle ſet forth booke whiche call reſtauration wherein amonges thinges teache kyngdome chriſte ſhalbe boke reſtitution ſorte laſt daye iudgement elect choſen ſhold reigne wicked vtterly deſtroyed place teache moreouer howe people may put downe magiſtrate albeit apoſtles commaundement vſurpe iuriſdiction yet ſuche nowe miniſters churche ought take vpon ryght ſworde force eſtablyſhe newe common wealth man ought ſuffered churche whiche true chriſtian againe mā ſaued vnles make goodes common kepe nothing priuate hym ſelf ſaie alſo luther biſhop rome falſe prophetes yet luther worſe finally ſaye mariage ſuch lyghtened true fayth polluted filthie rather reputed whoredome aduoutrie theſe opinion wrote againſt thē comfuted chiefly melanchthō iuſtus ionas menius urbanus regins whoſe workes full eloquence remayne touching ſame fewe weakes newe prophet ſpake blewe trompet euery ſtrete commaūded men arme ſelues repayre head churche porche enemy muſt driuen citie whan came thether fynde ſupper ready commaunded ſate downe ſupper numbre foure thouſand afterwardes alſo ſuppe thei watched meane tyme 〈◊〉 thouſand kyng quene theyr familie ſerued tyme eatē wel ſupper almoſte done king ſelfe reacheth bread vnto euerye one theſe wordes take eate ſhewe death lorde quene geuing cuppe ſayeth drynke ſhewe lordes death done prophete mentioned goeth pulpet demaundeth whether wyll obey god worde whan ſayde yea heauenly father commaundement ſaith ſende forth preacher worde numbre twenty eight whiche going foure partes worlde may preache ſame doctrine taught citie reciteth apoſt munſter name ſhe weth whether eche man ſhall go wherfore ſixe ſent oſenbridge many warrēdorfe eight soeſt many coſ • elde kynge quene ſuppe reſt ſeruitours preacher appoynted ſent forth ſupper tyme kynge ryſeth vp ſayeth hath little buſines father hath communded chaunced ſouldiour taken pryſoner whome kyng accuſeth treaſon iudas beheaded hym ſelfe kinges murther retourneth ſupper telleth merely done ſupper theſe foreſaid eight twenty ſent away nyght beſydes charge euery man deliuered piece golde whiche commaunded leaue ſuche place would admitte doctrine whiche ſhould token deſtruction death euerlaſting refuſyng peace holſome doctrine offered ſetting forth whan euery man came place cried throughout townes men ſhoulde repent penaunce preacher mū ſter el ſhould ſhortly deſtroyed ſpread clothes vpon grounde magiſtrate threwe vpon ſame piece golde whiche receiued affirming ſent father offer peace wyl receyue thei bid thē communicate ryches refuſe ſo doe ſygne witneſſe acte vnthankefulnes ſame tyme prophetes haue ſpoken wherin god would haue ryghteouſnes obſerued whole vniuerſall worlde whan kyng ſhal accordyng duty haue brought matter ſo paſſe iuſtice ſhall reigne place ſhall chriſt deliuer vp kyngdome father tyme ſpoken thus apprehended fyrſt gentle meanes afterwardes tormentes examined beliefe kynde lyfe fortification citie make aunſwere howe racked haue true doctrine woulde witneſſe ſtande death ſince apoſtles tyme hitherto worde god neuer preached ryghtly neither hath bene iuſtice foure prophetes wherof two iuſte dauid iohn leidane two vniuſte byſhop rome luther worſe damaūded expulſe innocent people citie contrary fidelitie promyſe taking goodes wyues childre place scripture could proue defend iuſtice ſay nowe tyme come wherin chriſt ſayd meke ſhould poſſeſſe earth yt ſame ſorte time paſte god gaue goodes egiptians vnto people iſraell afterwardes ſpeakyng numbre men victualles within citie affirmed diuerſe many aboue fiue wiues moreouer howe loked dayly greater power hollande friſelande ſone ſhould come kyng would marche forwarde whole armie ſubdue cōquere world deſtroying kinges prince miniſtred iuſtice racking whan perſeuered ſtyl purpoſe would acknowledge obſtiuacie magiſtrate beſides owne kynge rewarded loſſe heades neuertheleſſe one eſcaped nowe citie euery ſyde ſo narrouly ſtraightlye beſieged waye go wherfore citezens fearing famine carefull owne perill thought apprehende kynge ſende hym byſhop boūde king hearing therof choſe kynge taketh hede hym ſelfe twelue amonges whiche thought moſte faithful vnto called duke appointed euery garde ſome part towne kepe leſt ſhould aryſe anye tumulte amonges people maketh promyſe multitude howe eaſter ſhould deliuered ſiege penurie vnto twelue duke whiche choſe promiſed ample thinges great deale telling howe ſhoulde haue chiefe rule gouernment namyng alſo coūtreis townes caſtels would geue vnto euery one ſayd would ſpare lantgraue truſted woulde take parte length ſhewed aſſemblie appointed confluence moneth decembre ſtates prouince rhine unto alſo friderick prince electour saxony annexed ſelfe owne accorde aſſemblie conſultation decreed ayde byſhop munſter immediately thre hundreth horſemen thre thouſande footemen ſyxe monethes ouer whiche garryſon whole warre alſo wiricke countie oberſted charge decreed moreouer ſollicite reſidue ſtates imperiall ayde becauſe emperour spayne entreate king ferdinādo againſt moneth aprill aſſigne generall metyng ſame purpoſe admoniſhe beſeged letter earneſtly wrytten ſhould leaue forſake theire enterpriſe whiche ſo diſhoneſt wicked nothynge could vnleſſe thei would obey ſubmit ſelues vnto laweful magiſtrate proteſte byſhop nowe beſegeth ſhal wante ayde whole empyre ende decembre ides ianuary yeare xxv thei write many wordes dede ſmal purpoſe yet ſo cōmended mainteined quarel vnto whiche obiected vnto makynge kynge aunſwered nothynge howe theyr letter lantgraue go excuſe matter ſpeakinge many thynges ſalle deſtruction wickedmen deliueraūce kyngdome godly lyfe ſende withall booke reſtauration mentioned admonyſhyng amende attempte warre againſt wycked prynces doe holy men good people lantgraue readinge ouer booke letter noted thought blame worthy cōmaunded learned mē aunſwer muche fewe wordes thoſe abſcure written king ſo muche god appointment demaundeth thē wherfore expreſſe thoſe place scripture wherby thought lawefull thus doe dyd confirme thynge ſignes wonder cōminge chriſte god declared longe prophetes ſo euidently well knowen houſe familie alſo whan ſhould borne alſo requeſted matter might heard wherunto lantgraue anſwered ſame might take place ſo much takē vpon aucthoritie ſworde bene worker ſo muche miſchiefe men ſee marke ſhoute certēly ſubuerte lawes common wealth lyke intente wicked deteſtable ſo nowe requeſte haue cauſe heard fayned diſſembled doubtles ſent vnto thē faythful preacher miniſters churche whome ryghtlye inſtructed nowe contēpning doctrine reſiſt errours miſchief anabap magiſtrate take men goodes mary ſondrye wyues haue choſen newe kynge alſo denye chriſte toke humane nature virgyn mary affirme man hath free wyll compell men make goodes cōmon ſaye remiſſion ſinner falleth theſe thynges againſt lawes god man whan anſwer brought vnto thē wryte agayne ſende booke compyled vulgare tōgue miſteries booke yt mi •• ries ſcripture scripture againe epiſtle amplefie cauſe defende opinion booke deuide courſe tyme whole worlde thre partes fyrſt age adam noe ſaye deſtroyed deluge water ſecōd wherein nowe daye ſhalbe conſumed fyre diuiſiō world thyrde ſhall cleane newe worlde wherein iuſtice ſhall reigne neuertheleſſe laſt tyme ſhall appeare preſent age muſt pourged fyre ſhall tofore antichriſte ſhall reuealed power vtterly abolyſhed thā ſhall come paſſe ſcate dauid whiche decayed ſhal newly erected chriſte ſhall poſſeſſe kyngdome earth wrytinges prophetes ſhall accomplyſhed preſent worlde lyke tyme eſaw iuſtice kepeth ſilence godly perſecuted captiuitie babylon ſo nowe alſo preſēt age cumpared eſaw tyme reſtauration hande delyuer v theſe myſeries rendre vnto wycked aboundantly demerites apocalipſe declared ſame reſtauration goeth worlde come intent vngodlye beynge deſtroyed houſe ſeate iuſtice myght prepared beautified whan lantgraue red booke ſet hande miniſters churche wryte againſt reſidue ſtates imperial aſſembled eſſinge miſlyke doinges cōffuence affirming authoritie impoſe charge burthen vnleſſe bene conſent emperour ſtates moneth february corne within citie waxed ſcarſe ſo muche ſome alſo died honger wante meate fortuned one quenes pitieng people ſayde reſt howe ſhe ſuppoſed god woulde men ſhould peryſhe thus famine kyng whiche ſtoore houſes furnyſhed home kynge beheaded quene neceſſitie alſo riot voluptuouſnes knewe brought forthe market place reſte commaundynge knele downe ſtroke heade whan ſhe dead vttered haue played whore done reſidewe ſyng gyue thankes god heauē lye father kynge daunceth wyth exhorteth reſt multitude whiche nothynge lefte breade ſalte dauncynge mery paſtymes whan eaſter came deliueraunce appered kyng whiche promyſed ſo ſtoutely inucnte ſome excuſe fayned ſelfe ſicke ſpace ſyxe dayes commeth abroade amonges people telleth thē howe hath ryden blynde aſſe god father hathe blynd aſſe layde vpon backe ſynnes people wherfore made cleane delyuered euery ſpotte deliueraunce whiche promyſed wherwith ought holde cō tented luther amonges thynges whiche ſet forth vulgar tongue tyme wrote alſo tragedye munſter luther writig mūſt ala ſayeth howe ſhould complayne lamente thoſe wretched men thynge ſelfe declareth dwell deuylles thycke threfolde yet ought praye infinite mercy god herein haue good cauſe ſo doe albeit contempt goſpell reproche goddes holy name ſhedyng innocent bloud germany hath iuſtly deſerued plaged yet hathe god hetherto reſtrayned force violence sathan hath permitted haue reignes libertie mercifully admonyſheth v tragedye munſter nothinge artificious calleth v amendement lyfe vnleſſe god brydeled god bridleth power sathan hym holden hym backe doubte moſte ſubtille fynde wylie artificer would haue handled matter farre wyſe nowe god hathe made reſtraynte rageth tourmoyleth ſo muche woulde ſo much permitted wycked ſpirite ſeketh ſubuerſion chriſtian fayth goeth way worke perſwade marriage many wyues ſeyng vnlawfulnes fylthye beaſtlynes thynge apparent ſyght men perceiueth well enough men woulde abhorre dede politicke ciuile gouernemēt may meane diſturbed kingdom chriſt muſt attempted weapon ingines would circumuente deceaue men maye affectate rule gouernment playe tyraunt men diſalowe meanesmen diſceaued ſee playnely intente muſt attayne thereunto ſecrete meanes certen bypathes goe olde euyll fauoured apparell looke graue countenaunce hange downe heade towardes grounde faſte handle croked necked cattell money abſteyne fleſſhe abhorre matrimonye eſchewe bearynge offyce prophane thynge refuſe gouernemente profeſſe wounderfull lowelynes mynde ſay ready way meane deceyue alſo ryght wyſe whiche couertly priuely ſetteth open way kyngdome ouermuche impudencie mā take vpō ſelf king fleſhly luſte mary many wyues craft ignoraūt deuyll fanſieth ſure ye policie ſkilful deuyl one yt yet rude ignorant expert thā aſſuredly god hath ſo boūde chayne yt worke craftely whiche doubtles doth intentethat ſhoulde feare deitie amende liues let loſe cunning deuyl whiche certenly wyll aſſaulte v muche fierſly deuyl ſymple grammarian hath ſtyred vp ſo muche trouble ſhal whan sathā muche knowledge expert lawyer perfite diuine ſhall make towardes v full ſayle wherfore great feare ſo vngoodly deuyll ſuppoſe alſo citie lyke well ſport game playe many ryght ſory whiche without ſyghynges teares deſyre god delyuered chaunced certen yeares ſynce alſo ſedition countrey men woulde god whole worlde craftier deuyll munſter god would take worde v beleue fewe woulde geue credite ſo groſſe ſo drunken maiſter yet ſurely whan god wrath kyndled errour ſo abſurde god wrath vnſauery whiche deuill perſwade ſee happened doctrine mahomet albeit altogether folyſhe yet lyght god worde beyng quenched toke force ſtrengthe ſpread abroade ſuche ample maner ſee god infrynged deuiſe enterpryſe muncer ſame woulde haue come paſſe alſo germany sathan rayſe vp great meanes deuil vanquiſhed flamme god permiſſion verey ſmall ſparke neyther better waye quenche fyre worde god ye armure ennemies al together incorporate cā neyther ſubdued trope horſemen yet force munition warlyke furniture prynces byſhoppes go contrary waye worke hynder doctrine goſpell whiche myndes harte men healed meane tyme exercyſe cruel punyſhement bryng body deuyll leaue hym better part man whiche harte ſoule whiche thyng ſhall haue like ſucceſſe wyth thē iewes time paſt thought quēche chriſt croſſe paſſion concerning thoſe thinges munſter haue wrytten ſet forth ſuppoſe thynge ſtandeth thus theyr wrytinge lately publyſhed maketh ſo thinke wherin haue gallantly paynted theyr owne furye fyrſt touchinge faythe teache verey abſurde thynges chriſte though borne virgyn mary withſtanding errours munſterians fayth confeſſe howe came ſeede dauid ſufficiētly declare thinges aſſuredly sathan bringeth vp ſome monſtre dede doth ſignifie nothinge darkely ſeede fleſhe marye delyuer v laboureth vaine scripture ſaith chriſt borne virgin mary whiche vocable ſure al tonges referred vnto chyld baptiſme whiche conceiued fleſh bloud mother takyng ſhape brought forth worlde againe condempne baptiſme tyme paſte prophane thinge vnwittely done iudge eſteme worke thyng ordeyned god man caſe euery thing ought diſpiſed caſt away wicked men geue haue maruel ſurely wherfore aſwell contemne gold ſyluer ryches taken wicked inuente ſome newe metall deuiſe lyke theſe ſo alſo baptiſme worke creation god whan wicked ſweareth abuſeth true name god haue true name god offendeth nothyng robeth ſtealeth breaketh commaundement god caſe haue true commaundemēt god ſynneth ſo likewyſe former baptiſme nothyng ſuche waſhed therewith haue erred thā theſe fellowes deteſt chriſtening though wycked thyng nothynge ſelues doe confeſſe mariages fourmer tyme accompted whoredome adultery becauſe contracted mariage ſuche wanted faith ſaye praye graunt ſelues whore ſonnes packe nowe baſtardes miſbegotten tell doe enioye landes patrymony citie theyr aunceſters reaſon woulde deede muche ſorte ſhoulde inherite lande newe kynde matrimonie ſhould prouyde newe poſſeſſions ryches whiche myght haue honeſt tytle ſemelye ſo holy godlye people doe pretende ſhoulde lyue vnlawfull baſtardelye goodes harlottes muche leſſe take frō others vyolence playne robberye touchynge theyr foolyſhe kyngdome ſo many open crymes one thynge nedeth longer diſcourſe certenly whiche ſayde maye ſeme ouer muche greatly neceſſarye eſpeciall ſeynge theſe matter ſufficiently treated declared others aſſemblye empyre whyche kynge ferdinando requeſte prynces kepte deputes moneth aprill wormes city whiche hitherto geuen money proteſte beginning comming thether aſſemblie wormes decree made confluence obeye emperour king ferdinando great altercatiō prince contribution length condeſcended giue ayde fyue monethes twenty thouſand crownes monethly decreed moreouer tyme citie ſhould wonne taken innocent people ſhould ſpared ſuch good men either beſeged el fled thence ſhould reſtored goodes whan decree made byſhop munſter deliuereth armie vnto oberſten money ouer negligētly leuied almoſt dede late coulde notable exploicte done captaynes ſelues lacke money oftener one daunger lyues ſedicion ſouldiours tyme matter brought ſuche extremitie within citie many died dayly famine many alſo departed thence went broade ſo pyned hongerſtoruen ennemies pitie compaſſion vpō captaines ſent worde citie required rendre townes men caſe would deliuer king certen others ſhould haue harme whiche albeit citezens woulde fayne haue done yet ſo afrayde kynges crueltie vigilācie durſt attempte nothynge ſo obſtinate ſo lōg thyng remayned ſelfe fewe others eate would neuer rendre wherfore captaynes wryte againe bidde ſende hence forth ſo muche woman childrē firſt day iune next day wrote anſwer cōplait ye munſterians complayning matter could heard ſaid afflicted without deſert parte man coulde detecte errour would ſhould become doe expounde certen place daniel fourth beaſt much cruell reſt concluſion letter would god helpe perſeuer ſtyl confeſſion veritie whiche thinges thus wrytten kynges mynde whan thynges brought maruelous extremitie two eſcaping betraye citie citie two certen men eſcaped one taken ſouldiours vpon fidelitie came byſhop eyther thē ſhewed meane wynne citie countie oberſten byſhop hearyng bothe tale two twenty iune ſommoned towne charging citezens rendre vp yelde ſelues people might ſaued peryſh thus honger cauſe rotman aunſwer walles kynge ſtanding ſuche ſorte would relent chaunge purpoſe two dayes aleuen clock nyght fotemen brought cloſely citie certē choſen ſouldiours conduict two men eſcaped got ouer dyche vp walle ſlewe watche others followyng thē fynde poſterne gate open fiue hondreth certen captaynes enſignes entred citie tounes men aſſembled together ſtayed reſte would lykewyſe haue inuaded longe euer coulde put backe ſhut gate done geue charge vpon thoſe wer come ſlew many whan foughten ſore ſpace one houre wynnyng mū ſter two ſouldiours encloſed ſtept next gate kept ſmall garde breake open perforce ſo made way fellowes without immediatly preſſed ſtrōg power wheras townes mē firſt made reſiſtaunce kept market place whiche wel fortified defence laſt matter deſperate many ſtayne firſt encountre craued founde mercy kynge cnipperdoling taken ſame inſtante botman kyng taken hope liue running amōges ennemies thickeſt ſtayne leſt ſhould come handes alyue whan citie byſhop toke hym ſelfe munitiō half rotman deſperate ſpoyle diſcharging armie reſerueth ſelfe two enſeignes aſiſte citie followed counſell imperiall wormes moneth iuly wherin kyng ferdinando deputes propounded demaundeth whether citie beyng nowe taken ſhall treate furthermore howe deſtroye anabaptiſtes admonyſheth alſo call vpon byſhop rome counſel thei ſaye touchyng anabaptiſtes hath bene redy ſet forth diuers proclamation mete done byſhop byſhop munſter demaundeth charge hath bene oft enoughe ſollicited counſell euen emperoure hym ſelfe neyther doe thinge therein ſame counſell byſhop munſter requyreth recompenced charge cōplayneth money promyſed yet paide whan nothyng el could concluded fewe ſtates alſo wer preſent metinge aſſigned againſt nouembre wherin ſhoulde take ordre accomptes charge warre howe commō wealth munſter hereafter ſhould gouerned whan daye come ferdinando ambaſſadour fewe wordes repeteth cauſes aſſemblie amonges thynges myght deuiſe alſo citie lately taken maye remayne hence forth olde religion byſhoppes ambaſſadour declareth charge hath bene warre tyme great ſomes money hath borrowed howe citie taken auoyding tumultes • ut ther daunger enforced buylde two fortes citie manne thinges deſyreth cōſideration might hereunto aunſwere made byſhop greateſt part ſpoyle munition alſo citezens goodes whiche thynges dede apperteyne common wealth empire wherfore reaſon would al theſe thynges eſtimate ſhould made ſo much charge diducted ouerplus aunſwered accordinglye decreed byſhop munſter ſhould vnder empire according olde cuſtome nobilitie citie ſhould reſtored citezens alſo fled awaye ſo anabaptiſts touching religion byſhop ſhall take ordre therein accordinge decree empyre ſpring next yere following ambaſſadours prynces ſhould go munſter vnderſtande ſtate citezens ſaue innocent people deſtroye fortification made anabaptiſtes byſhop ſhall alſo caſte downe two fortes whiche hath buylded within citie execute immediatly king cnipperdoling crechtinge pryſoners according demerites kepe longer point concerning religiō duke saxon lantgraue duke wirtemberge countie anhalde proteſted openly would neuer aſſente city alſo profeſſed ſame neyther would haue olde fortification defaced newe againſt kyng two fellowes kyng fellowes caried 〈…〉 caried hither thither vnto prynces ſhewe mockery whiche occaſion lantgraues preacher enter diſputation kynge touchynge theſe opinion chieflye kyngdome chriſte magiſtrates iuſtification baptiſme lordes diſputation ye king 〈…〉 ſupper incarnation chriſte mariage teſtimonies scripture priuayle ſo farre albeit chaūge wholy ſtroue defended opinion ſtifly yet turne cōfounde ſo fyne graunted many thing whiche withſtanding ſuppoſed haue done ſaue lyfe whan retourned vnto ſeconde tyme promyſed myght haue pardon brynge paſſe anabaptiſtes whiche hollande brabant englande freſelande exceadyng great numbre ſhold kepe ſylence obey magiſtrates thynges afterwardes ſame preacher reaſoned fellowes alſo mouthe wryting mortification chriſtening chyldren communion goodes kyngdome chriſte tyme brought telget kyng beyng demaunded byſhop authoritie durſt ſo bolde vſurpe ſo muche libertie vpon citie people aſked hym gaue power aucthoritie ouer citie wher bolde aunſwer kyng byſhop made aunſwere conſent college people rule iuriſdiction ſayde called hether god thirtene kalēdas february thei brought munſter cōmitted euery man ſeuerall pryſon ſame daye alſo came byſhop thether accompanied archbiſhop collon ambaſſadours duke cleue ſpace two dayes followyng ſpent godly admonition myght reduced hereſy deede kynge confeſſed faulte fled vnto chriſte prayer two neyther woulde acknowledge offence yet ſtode obſtinatly opinion next daye king brought vp ſkaffold tied poſt two hangemen ready eche payre tonges read hote three firſt pulles helde peace afterwarde callyng continually goddes mercy whan bene cruell death kyng thus turmented howre laſt thruſt harte ſharpe poynted dagger left lyfe fellowes ſame punyſhement whan thei dead faſtened grate iron hanged hygheſt towre citie called ſaynet lambertes king myddes man height aboue two moneth ianuary preſent yeare died lady katherine dowager whome henry eyght kyng englande death quene katherine put away thre yeares ſhewed fourth booke howe fridericke duke holſte helpe lubeckes made kyng denmarke whoſe death arroſe mortall warre betwene ſonne chriſtiane kinge citie lubecke duke saxon lantgraue erneſt duke lunenburge citie breme hamborough maydē burge brunſwicke lunenburge hildiſſeme intreated peace yeare moneth february pacified charles duke sauoye certen ſpace maynteyned warre againſt citie geneua beynge ayded byſhop ſame citie warre geneua ye duke sauoy ſet rather partely profeſſion goſpell partly matter citie geneua ioyned league citie berne swicerlāde whome length receiuing great ayde gaue repulſe ennemies berne marching ſubdued al laye cōmodious countrey euen loke geneua reſidue swicers alſo bordered ayde berne vpō sauoye ſame whyleſt working kynge fraunce whiche longe purpoſed warre italye eſpecially ſynce death fraunces sfortia leuieng armie begynning ſpryng tyme maketh warre alſo duke frēche king againſt duke sauoye sauoye vncle controuerſie inheritaunce whiche ſaid due vnto poſſeſſed deteyned duke beynge already much inpoueryſhed swycers therfore vnmete matche ſo puiſſaunt ennemye ſhort tyme diſpoſſeſſed maner whole duckdome kyng paſſing ouer alpes inuadeth alſo countrey piedmount amonges taketh turrine chiefeſt town thoſe partes fortifieth workes ſtrength men conduict philippe schabotte admirall duke sauoy marryed beatriche daughter emanuell kyng portugall emperours ſyſter iſabel former tyme addicted ſelfe neyther ſemed incline emperour ſtyred vp king nephew owne ſyſter leweſſe againſt reporte howe byſhop clement tyme marſeilles laſt booke recited pope counſel inuade sauoy gaue kyng counſell caſe intended recouer millan ſhould firſt ſeke lorde sauoy piedmonte adioyning ſame howe ſoeuer kyng yeare followyng certen newe cuſtome ordeyned realme fraunce legion souldiours numbre forty thouſande legion souldiours whiche ſhoulde exerciſe weapon readynes tyme ſeruice came aunciently kynges fraunce haue alwayes maynteined cheualry whole force hathe bene horſemen man would haue alſo footemen ready monſtered ſhold euermore haue nede forein ſouldiours kynges purpoſe leade forth armie make warre thereby lū bardie intent myght recouer duckdome millā enioyed ſyxe yeares together contented right child ualentine grandmother ſiſter philippe uicecounte laſt duke millan familie thus matter ſtandeth houſe uicecoūtes bare noble brute houſe vicecoūtes lumbardie firſt accompted otho archebyſhop millan tyme raffe emperour expulſed turrians noble worthy familie whome nephewe matthewe brother theobaldus ſonne ſucceded hym galeace actius luchine iohn matthew ſeconde galeace ſeconde barnabas iohn galeace emperour wēceſlans created firſt duke millan two ſonnes iohn philippe died without iſſewe one daughter ualentine fraunces sfortia ſtoute warriour married baſtarde daughter philip occaſion vſurped dukedome millan ſecludyng ualē tine philippes ſyſter whome lewys duke orleaunce brother charles ſixt kyng fraunce maried sfortia thre ſonnes galeace lewis aſcanius wherof lewis inuaded dukedome frēche kinges title millan begot two ſonnes maximilian fraunces duke orleaunce ualentine charles philippe iohn charles father lewis duke orleaunce whiche king fraunce twelfth name philippe died without iſſewe iohn erle engoleſme ſonne named charles father kyng fraunces toke maximilian sfortia priſoner ſubdewed lumbardie leo tenth emperour diſpoſſeſſing hym agayne reſtored fraunces sfortia exile nowe dead kyng fraunces reclayme ryght ſaieth auēged moueth warre agayne death sfortia emperour taken poſſeſſiō lumbardie anthony leua whō left depute tyme ſayled barbaria mentioned wherfore ſo ſone anye knowledge kynges enterpryſe leuieth immediatly power myghte germanye place come italy coming frō naples rome beginning aprill within fewe dayes repayre required senate might called wherin byſhop emperous oration againſt frēche king great numbre cardinalles ambaſſadours foreyne prynces graue vehement oration againſt frenche kyng breakyng league olde hatred malice hindreth impecheth moſte worthy godly enterpriſes ende oration declare ready fight combat intent priuate loſſe one two rather publique domage whole worlde warre might one haue ende departed naples uenetians entred league uenetians league ye emperour againſt turke rather hoped well would delyuer poſſeſſion millan ſome priuate man ſtates italy chiefly uenetians wouldneyther emperour yet frenche kyng ſhould enioye goodly dukedome millan therfore theſe former yeares conſpyred oftentymes one whyle againſt frenche kynge whyle againſt emperour fraunces sfortia myght reſtored whome ſuppoſed ſtande leſſe daunger league clement uenetians made againſt emperour ten yeares cauſe thinkyng emperour hauyng diſplaced sfortia would haue kept owne vſe lumbardie whiche dede ſuppoſed would great hinderaunce interceſſion byſhop clement ſixe yeares paſt reſtored sfortia boloigne la graſſe got wonderfull fauour great good wyll naples alſo emperour finiſhed vp mariage baſtarde daughter alexander medices whome made duke florence tolde ſeuenth booke duke florence marieth emperours baſtarde alexander baſtard ſonne laurence medices father peter whiche drowned mouth lira laſt boke mentioned haue heard howe uergerius ſent germany whan emperour arriued naples byſhop calleth hym home againe returning great expedition whan came rome declareth ambaſſade proteſtauntes required haue free chriſtian counſell within precinct empyre place conuenient emperour made promyſe luther reſt hope luther conſtancie vnleſſe diſpatched way concerning king englande proteſtauntes wyll aſſente reſte prince colde howe george duke saxonye affirmeth great daunger lutherians whiche otherwiſe eſchewed auoyded vnleſſe emperour byſhop make warre againſt ryght ſhortly whiche thynge whan byſhop vnderſtode ſendeth hym naples ſpede recite theſe thynges uergerius ſent emperour emperour eſpecially concernyng warre attempted agaynſte lutheriās aterwardes whā emperour come rome earneſtly hande haue counſel called coueted greatly cary hym letter patentes ſame byſhop ſaid content notwithſtāding woulde chouſe ſome citie italy preſcribe therein certen condition neceſſary churche rome hereunto emperour ſo woulde one cared would bryng greater parte germany followe hym herein ſo therfore byſhop chouſeth nyne nū bre make wrytte thoſe campegius ceſius simonet ginucius cōtarene poole cardinal archebiſhop brunduſe diuiſers b • byſhop rhezo uergerius thā made byſhop modruſe long inſtinopulis theſe together firſt byſhops preſence afterwardes ſeuerally ſelues deuiſe forme somoning counſell haue heard ambaſſadours englande whome accorded smalcalde vpon certen condition kyng ſhould ſet forth pure doctrine goſpell whiche profeſſed auſpurge maynteyne ſame lawefull counſell ſuche ſhalbe neyther admitte calling place counſell cōmon aſſent neuertheleſſe may appere certayne manifeſt reaſons ſuche counſel like hath bene declared peter paule uerger byſhoppes legate refuſed caſe byſhop continue purpoſe enterpryſe letted open proteſtation refuſed lyke kynge hath ioyned hym ſelfe religion ſo lykewyſe ioyne league alſo called patroneand king england patrone ye pro • league defendour ſame common opinion ſupremacie byſhop rome vtterly reiected euer anye warre attempted againſt parte religion cauſe ayde geuen vnto hym inforceth ſame defence league kyng ſhal paye one hundreth thouſand crownes wherof one halfe confederatours ſhall may employe whā nede ſhall requyre reſt charge borne money whiche ſhall contribute amonges warre ſhal longe endure force ennemy driue thā king diſburſe two hundreth thouſand crownes much lyke chaunce ſhould fortune ſtande alſo bounde ſpēd goodes bloud lyfe alſo ſomme alſo like conſideration emploied vſe defende league remainder reſtored whan warre finiſhed ambaſſadours ſhall wryte kyng hereof whan knowe mynde aduertiſe duke saxon lantgraue therof commō ambaſſade engliſh ambaſſad wynter witteberg • maye ſent vnto hym whan ambaſſadours ſent theſe requeſtes vnto king going wittemberge paſſed away reſt wynter meane whyle reaſoned diuines certen article chiefe controuerſie mariage prieſtes lordes ſupper popyſhe maſſe monaſticall vowes chief deſyre diuines would approue kynges diuorſement ſayde coulde ſcriptures whan alledged many thinges perſwade matter one chieflye byſhop clement varied ſentence declared frenche king priuate talke thought diuines anſwered caſe ſo king great cauſe ſo vrged thē ſay cauſe moſt iuſt would graūt letter come englande pourporting declaratiō kinges letter proteſtants kynges mynde herein ambaſſadours aduertiſe prince electour hereof xij day marche wittemberge whether duke tyme come ſpeaking firſt many thinges kynges great good wil declare moſt part requeſtes content fewe might amended albeit england thinge quiet neither cauſe wherfore kynge ſhould feare man happely cauſe hath bene ſame taken away death wyfe forſaken neuertheleſſe recouer mayntayne true doctrine doth refuſe de • ray ſomme money whiche requyre ſo league goe forwarde hereof wyll treate large theyr ambaſſadours offer vnto hym honour ſhoulde defendour paîrone league geueth great thankes acknowledgeth good wil although vnderſtandeth howe muche enuie diſpleaſure ſame annexed yet common wealthes ſake could contente agree vppon fyrſt ſeconde demaunde vnleſſe vniformitie doctrine ſuppoſeth charge greatly honour would chiefly wyſhe learned men realme myght wholy one opinion ſeeth king england requireth cō ference lerned men well ſame wyll vnleſſe certen place confeſſion apologie doctrine maye priuate talke ſome thynge qualified therfore deſyreth inſtantlye ſende ambaſſadours amonges ſome one excellently learned whiche may conferre diuines whole doctrine ceremony determine matter ſheweth ſelfe ſo lyberall vnto requyreth agayne caſe anye man attempte warre againſte hym fyrſte wyll ayde hym eyther fyue hondreth horſemen el ten shippes well manned fournyſhed foure monethes vpon charge ſhall prouyde hym two thouſande horſemen fyue thouſande fote men finally ſentence whiche diuines kinges deuorcemēt wittemberge prononced touchinge diuorcement made wold approue alſo defende next counſell duke aunſwereth muche whole matter concerneth conſortes wyll make priuie vſe counſell ſame foure twenty daye aprill aſſigned mete franckeforth cauſes firſte preſcribe fourme ambaſſadours followe whiche ſhould ſent englande wherein prouided amōges thinges whan ſhall come thether perchaunce cōclude vpō league al thinges except
