coſtly carpet poſies written euery place wherin extolled wonderfully reſtoryng peace vnto world recō ciling prince yeare strauſeborough erected colledge grā mer colledge erected strauſ • scoole youth meanes chieflye iames sturnne principall senator whiche ſhorte time thoroughe diligence learned men ſo floriſhed repared thither onely furtheſt partes germany alſo foreine nation maner teaching youth diuiding fourmes whole order deuiſed iohn sturmie whiche fyrſt exhibited senate afterwardes booke put forth declareth large wheras many fayne flie religion conſciēce ſake fraunce flaunders senate appointed churche wherof iohn caluine fyrſte certeine yeres ſuperintendent iohn caluin peter brulie peter brulie whoſe ende wil ſpeake herafter englande thomas canturbury long time great reuerence body ſhryned ſiluer hanged rounde coſtly iewelles gold precious ſtones beyonde meaſure amonges others one riche iewell called regal fraunce yeare king henry take ſhrine burne reliques thomas ſurnamed becket thomas becket time paſt archebiſhop canturbury ſtode ſtyffe defending liberty clergie fell diſpleaſure kyng englande henry ſeconde name commaunded exile fledde biſhoppe rome alexander thyrde tyme themnitie themperour friderick barbarouſſe fraunce length thomas becket interceſſion lewes vij kinge fraunce reconciled retourned home ſeuenth yere exile afterwarde troubled certen biſhoppes toke kynges parte excōmunicate kyng beyng againe offended ſaid miſerable eſtate could liue quiet one prieſt lamē ted alſo man aboute woulde deliuer ſuche diſquietnes whiche wordes ſo ticled many knowing ſhould diſpleaſure kinge went cantorbury ſlewe thomas kynge pretended great ſorowe ſendynge ambaſſadors rome make purgation fyne entreated biſhoppe ſende inquiſitours england enquire examine matter time biſhoppe laſte ſente two cardinal murther could ſearched kyng pourgeth ſelfe othe becauſe former hatred wordes ſpoken ſome ſuſpecion fault concluſion reconciled vpon condicion yeares ſhuld go syria warre vpon saracenes murther committed yeare man ſaluation mclxxi longe memoriall thomas waxed famous throughe miracle monkes canturbury ſayd wrought whereof biſhoppe rome aduertiſed legate came englande canoniſed made ſaint time metyng nice ioachim marque brandenburge prince electour ſonne ioachin beginninge iune ſent ambaſſador euſtace schlebie duke saxon theſe inſtructions howe sigiſmunde kinge pole iohn wayuode kynge hungary aduertiſed hym turkes made great preparation inuade hungary ſo fortifiyng buda make incurſion germanye ſame themperour newes turkes approche turkes ſignifie vnto uayuode inioyned father open aſſemblie whan intelligence turkiſhe matter ſhould aduertiſe ſtates therof therfore alſo performe dewtie common wealth litle moued theſe newes chaunce calamitie natife countrey therfore cauſes went kyng ferdinando luſatia comming alſo receiued letter meſſagers touching ſame thinges wherfore caſe ſhould reſiſted doubt lie nexte ſhould ſe ſhortly theyr countrey moſt cruell enemie way buda vntill theyr frontier nother caſtell towne fortified able hold ſuch power mountaines ſtreight paſſages ſtoppe carriage ſauing onely citie uratiſlauie towne lignice ſituation morauie sileſie howe champion fruietfull countrey knoweth well enough nedeth rehearſall albeit hath promyſed ayde kynge ferdinando common daunger yet ſeeth howe lytle ſuche maner ayde able helpe greatnes caſe requyreth al ayde power whole empyre muche ſame haplye obtayned without generall aſſemblye vnleſſe ail germany quieted agayne preſent daunger wyll permitte long delaye therfore hath talke moued kyng woulde wholy diſpoſe ſelfe vnto thynge onlye fyrme ſure peace myght concluded wherunto kyng ferdinando anſwered ryght honorably promyſed endeuour cauſe emperour ſo might vnderſtande league frendes furthermore demaunded ſeing ſtandeth thus deſyreth hym geue mynde hereunto open vnto hym vnfaynedly ſuche condition peace thynketh mete intreated hym ſelfe wyll deuyſe owne name ferdinando ſhall preferre emperour ſuche ſorte truſteth treatie ſhalbe commodious vniuerſall worlde nowe alſo maye turkes violence eaſelye reſiſted muche iohn uayuode reconcyled kynge ferdinando kynge hym ſelfe tolde hym counſel would haue bruted abroad leſte ſhould come turkes care certen yeares paſt hetherto hath great part hongary bene plucked awaye chriſtendome ciuile warres nowe myndes appeaſed diſpleaſure paſte goodlye occaſion offered well doynge wherfore eftſones beſecheth hym would help cauſe common wealth marque maried daughter sigiſmunde kyng poole whiche nece iohn uayuode ſyſters ſyde hereof came frendſhyp familiaritie betwyxt alſo receyued religion saxony ſet forth booke marquſes 〈…〉 denburge proteſtantes religion ſame kepte hym league otherwyſe wholy addicted emperour kynge ferdinando reteyned certen ceremony ſought quiet offence duke saxony ſignifieth whole matter letter lantgraue twelfth daye iune wryte bothe marque brandenburg wyſe albeit matter muche importaunce altogether ſuche oughte make fellowes priuie yet doe ſee diſcommoditie myghte come thorowe delaye eſpecially conſideryng turke flacketh nothyng fierſenes haue alſo conſulted ouerlonge quiet germany withſtande hym power aduertiſed ambaſſadours nedefull reſiſte moſte cruell ennemie truthe confeſſe common wealth requyred leſſe ſtād caſe chiefly nede ſuche peace honourable trewe ſyrme nothyng doubtfull caſe ſhould ſpende theyr treaſure turkyſhe warre meane whyle haue vnquiet neighbour home ſeeth ſelfe howe vnmete hurtefull ſame would vnto parte verye deſyrous peace whiche obtayne therfore doubtfull matter diminiſhe parte power meane time cōmon wealth ſuſtayne damage may blame therof imputed together vnto thoſe refuſe condition peace moreouer ſuppoſe ſhould concerne kinge ferdinādo others border turkes relatiō made theſe thinges vnto ſtates alſo hetherto counſel imperiall called profite commō wealth though perchaunce time wil permitte publique ayde ſhould decreed ſodaynly nede requyreth craue ayde ſome men yet turke ſuche power able continew warres many yeares wil ceaſe tyl eyther hath obteyned pourpoſe hauing ouerthrow cōſtrayned breake vp warres time wherfore thinke aſſemblie empyre expediēt peace germany therein myght eſtabliſhed cō ſultation conſerning turkiſhe warre later ſo great force albeit al thinges quiet germany yet neuer theleſſe common aſſembly nedefull ſkileth greatly perchaunce kyng ferdinādo well emperours name ſo ambaſſadours ſent full commiſſion authoritie whiche thing bring paſſe ſame ſhalbe cōmodious emperour germany howe leſte ſhoulde point fayle common wealth hinder cōmoditie woulde haue readynes ſuche ayde partes acuſtomed oughte finde alwayes readye ſerue whan nede ſhall require neyther doubte theyr fellowes wil ſame vnder condition kyng ferdinando immediatly obtayne emperour ſure vndoubted peace whiche prince empyre byſſhoppes religion ſhall ratifie done ſuites action chamber ſet apart ayde ſhalbe ſtreight wayes ready caſe emperour reaſon abſence brynge prynces heeeunto time leſte perſwade theſe opinion william lewis duke bauier george duke saxony archebyſhop mentz collon treuers alſo biſhops saliſburge maydenburge breme bamberge wyrtenburge munſter auſpurge aeſlet caſe perſwaded emperour kyng ferdinando doe confirme ſame peace ſelues ſubiectes make promyſe endeuours prynces alſo maye geue theyr aſſente ſame whiche caſe ſhall refuſe doe yet ſhall neuer ſwarue conuenant ſo ſhortly may cauſes ſhall call aſſemblie empire done truſte league frendes alſo wyll ready ſende theyr ayde lyke themſelues determined doe caſe league frendes agreable ſame well maye enioye benefyte peace whiche came league compoſition norinberge ſuche ſhal repare vnto hereafter moreouer ſame may extende prince empyre alſo kyng denmarke entent may well appere howe deſirous peace muche ſtate empyre ſo ſoone aſſembled therefore wyll appointe aſſemblie company iſenacke againſt xxiiij iuly moſte ample commiſſion wherfore well done could brynge paſſe emperour kyng ferdinando hym ſelfe alſo palſgraue ſent ambaſſadours thither whan aunſwered wyſe diſpatched letter vnto league frendes requyringe daye iſeuacke towne turingie marque cauſed ambaſſadour ſhewe caſe ſo content wold deuyſe palſgraue tēdred alſo cōmon welth ſhould trauayle ſame matter letter marque brandenburge ſent alſo whole treaty heldus emperours ambaſſadour myght clerely perceiue whole matter whiche thynges receyued marque intrateth kyng ferdinando would immediatly preferre matter emperoure fore retourned italy spayne requireth palſgraue take matter hāde together hym maketh aunſwere albeit proteſtauntes ſpoken hym herein yet woulde refuſe men gone whiche wonte ſerue hym ſame affayres wherfore wylleth hym ſende counſellours vnder one matter ſhould afterwardes requyre preſence would fayle whan daye came marque ambaſſadours declared firſt duke saxon lantgraue reſt iſenacke prynces ſelues preſent wylled deſyre palſgraue take trauayle payne daye myght appoynted wherin mete agayne meane whyle matter may brought paſſe emperour conſent alſo aucthoritie may moreouer requeſted woulde ouer ſtreight laſed graunt ſo muche myght ſaufe conſcience kynge ferdinando wyll ſlacke maner dilygence neyther doubteth emperour alſo greatly inclined peace hereunto proteſtauntes aunſwere iſenacke fifte day auguſte make concorde deſirous ſo emperours wyl cōmaundement accordingly though thinke nedefull intreate palſgraue whiche ſelfe well diſpoſed emperour cōmaunde hym wil refuſe yet wyll wryte vnto whan emperours pleaſure ſhalbe knowen aduiſe palſgraue wyll aſſigne daye wherin ſhall mete treate forſayd matter aſſemblie receyued league lady elizabeth lady elizabeth ſiſter lantgraue receiued league proteſt lantgraues ſyſter wydowe city alſo halle hailbrune made ſute admitted mediation auſpurge ulmes heard alſo euery mās complaintes eſpecially cauſe goflarians whome henry duke brunſwycke ſore oppreſſed wherfore agreed requeſte marque woulde obteyne emperour meanes kyng ferdinando precept wherby duke brunſwicke may compelled aunſwere matter otherwyſe ſtate cō dition goflariens ſo miſerable forſake diſtreſſe hitherto alſo newes brought peace concluded betwene emperour frenche kyng aſſemblie brake vp nynth daye auguſte yeare ſprang vp ſecte whiche called antinomian fecte antinomiās theſe doe affirme repentaunce taught ten commaundementes impugne thoſe whiche teache goſpell preached vnto myndes firſte ſhaken broken declaration lawe determyne ſoeuer man lyfe neuer ſo ſinfull yet iuſtified beleue promyſes goſpell chiefe iohn iſlebie ſurnamed agricola luther doth plainly confute theſe thynges proueth lawe geuen iohn iſleby intent ſhould iuſtifie declare ſynne feare conſcience therfore ought fyrſte taught goſpell whiche ſheweth vnto v ſonne god mediatour aduocate mankynde fyne iſlebie admoniſhed luther priuatly conference ſcriptures better inſtructed perſwaded luther opinion afterwarde open wryting witneſſed ſame confeſſing errour laſte booke haue heard muche ſpeaking heldus emperour ſent ambaſſadour germany receiuing proteſtauntes ſuche aunſwere woulde goeth moſte parte prince deuiſing ſclaunder though proteſtauntes could abyde right hearing matter refuſed moſte reaſonable condition peace hym propounded began moue league wherof proteſted bothe emperoure kynge ferdinando aucthours reſted brought paſſe ſome thoſe archebyſhops mētz saliſburge william lewys duke bauier george lege papiſtes againſt proteſtātes duke saoxony ericke henry duke brunſwicke matter aſſembled norinberge league made vnder title caſe man iniuried moleſted byſhops religion whiche call olde others ſhoulde aſſiſte aide therfore thei called holy ordeined god glory defence churche decreed eleuen yeares frenche kyng returnyng nice came cōmunication marie emperours ſyſter regent flaunders compegue towne swycers men thought dryfte occaſion newe made peace frendlye metynge aeguesmortes ſhe myght turne awaye kynges mynde duke cleaue poſſeſſed gelderlande opinion kynges amitie myght make hym ſore afrayde ye haue hearde much iudgement imperiall chamber euermore lyke ſelues nothyng relentynge wonted rygour lately outlawed citie myndin ſute betwyxte citie mynden ou • lawed clergie citie whiche thynge one knowen duke saxony lantgraue name league frendes publyſhe wrytynge ides nouembre wher recite ordre trouble haue chamber theſe certen yeares paſte becauſe neuer quiet vpon moſte iuſte cauſes haue bene refuſed yet neuertheleſſe procedyng obſtinatlye haue nowe preſcrybed theyr fellowes citezens myndyn doe admonyſhe praye prynces ſtates would repute ſentence geuen vniuſte ſuffer ſelues ſtyred vp violence wyſe ſentence put execution would ſure neglecte iniuries confederatours meane tyme emperour beyng moued kyng ferdinando ſayde ſent letter germany declarynge good wyll towardes common wealth howe muche deſyred appeaſe thys controuerſie religion becauſe fewe dayes paſte receyued aduertyſement proteſtauntes alſo dyd refuſe concondicions peace required treatie ſo conſente therto therfore vnto whome nothynge lieuer publique tranquilitie doeth allowe waye maketh deputes archebyſhop londe matthie helde one geueth ful aucthoritie theſe preſentes together counſellers brother kyng ferdinando prynces interceſſours may treate determyne matter ſoeuer ſhall doe wyll ratifie theſe letter dated toledo xxv daye nouembre whan afterwardes brought germany twelfth daye february aſſigned whiche daye ſhoulde mete franckefurte tolde litle league made norinberge chief ryngeleaders hereof lewis duke bauier henry duke duke brunſwick deſyrous war brunſwycke whiche wholy addicted diſturbe common quiet endeuour ſtyre vp warre agaynſte proteſtauntes ſame tyme receyued letter archebyſhop mentz morowe chriſtmas day aunſwereth fewe wordes committing reſte credite hys secretary stephen faber whome ſente withall laſt daye ſaue one december chaunced farre towne caſſel lantgraue going hunting mette yonge man archebyſhop mentz brought letter lantgraue almaigne facion demaunded younge man firſte mette hym ſayeth ſeruaunt prynce electour brandenburge lykewyſe whan stephen nowe came nere hym aſketh hym ſelfe aunſwered done enquireth whether goyng ſayde spyres howe doeth prynce health beyng demaunded whether woulde iuſtifie theſe thynges trewe ſayde yea woulde ſo dimiſſed afterwarde whan gone little waye one lantgraues ſeruauntes tolde howe duke brunſwickes secretary whiche alſo affirmed knewe hym lantgraue ſent fetche back caſſelle tyll came huntynge hym ſelfe meane tyme lantgraue intercepteth duke letter stephen faber whyleſt stowffe plucketh boſome lether bagge takynge certen letter haſteth doer one houſhold ſeruauntes perceiued gaue notice stewarde chaunced preſent lookynge downe ſtowffe wyndowe courte vnderneth wherfore aſked letter draweth thē boſom steward receiueth thē cuſtody delyuered lātgraue whan came hunting thoſe two letter wherof one directed archebyſhop mentz matthie helde al certen table remembraunce inſtructions thinges incredite ſeing matter ſelfe ſuſpicious note within table increaſed ſuſpition lantgraue openeth ſomme archebyſhoppes letter receyued letter reioſeth muche hath hym contynuall remembraunce commaunde howe hath ſent vnto stephen secretary truſtye man whome maye vnderſtande whole matter newes brought hym bauier unto whome deſyreth hym geue credit wyſheth well hym theyr adherentes aduerſaries commendeth sathan ſame effecte wrytten alſo heldus howe ſent agayne stephen inſtructions deſyreth heare hym gently gyue leſſe credite hym ſpake preſently hym perſone ſo longe lyueth wyll take emperours parte howe ſo euer matter falleth neyther doubteth emperour wyll deuyſe thynges well enough remembraunce archebyſhop lantgraue vnquiet could take ſlepe reſte ſo geuen huntynge almoſte madde wherby thing myght better done ſome parte already brought paſſe lantgraue goeth aboute vnknowen duke bauier moſte certen wil make warre againſte one two wherfore muſte perſwade fellowes college come league ſhall doe well alſo addicte ſelfe wholy vnto league haue reſpect whome beynge one forſaken receyued muche diſpleaſure howe duke bauier intende talke together conferryng counſelles determine ſome thyng moreouer ſtate sweuia moued vnto league matter brought almoſte ende inſtructions heldus theſe truſte emperour wyl come ſhortly spayne perſeuer cō ſtante purpoſe thynges ſhall procede well truſteth kynges alſo whiche yet haue vttered ſelues wyll fauour ſame waye confederatours ſame mynde wylle ſhall wante nothynge howe ſoeuer others vſe ſelues wyll euer remayne conſtant obedient emperour howe thynketh good chamber cōmaunde lantgraue laye aparte weapōs meane whyle wyll duke bauier readines obeye chamber may cōmaunde duke bauier forſee cōmon wealth ſuſteine dā mage inioyne prynces alſo geue aſſiſtaunce forme league time theſe thinges thus come light becauſe great daunger towarde occaſion warre ſought lātgraue furthwith wrote letter father lawe duke george declaringe whole matter ſtoode ſheweth hath great wrong offered maketh preparation warre ſame time matthias helbus rode great poſt haſte fraūce spayne emperour afterwardes lantgraue wrote king ferdinando ſyſter mary regent flaunders prince electours duke bauier ſame ſorte duke george 1539 father lawe maketh purgation whan duke brūſwicke perceiued matter diſcloſed heard lantgraues letter aunſwereth hath ſuſteined wrong handes whiche nowe hath taken secretary alſo duke saxon laſt yeare whan commaundement kyng ferdinando emperours name went duke george saxony againe comming home norinberge tyme league made laye wayte unto duke saxon aunſwereth muche denied fellowes ſaufeconduicte whan went brunſwicke againſt lawe cuſtome empyre coulde thinke none otherwyſe hym ennemye dyuerſe tymes gone two thre hym diſguyſed ſeruauntes apparell ſhould knowen brother countrey priuely neyther whiche knewe well enough empeche lette would haue paſſage ſtopped hym league frendes ſhould thinke haue libertie men wyl graunt vnto wherfore vpon occaſion began write one againſt long ended moſt ſharpe bitter inuectiues hauing dede beginning duke inuectiues vnmete prince brunſwicke whiche rare example amonges prince let paſſe kynde raylyng opprobrious wordes bokes ſet forth prynte doe declare whyleſt theſe thynges workynge dieth iohn duke cleaue leauyng william ſonne heyre whome death iohn duke cleaue conradus hereſbachius chyldhode inſtructed good letter maners tyme come franckefurte moneth februarye accordyng appoyntment much ſondrye ſharpe debatynge matter concluded laſt nyntene daye apryll vpon theſe condition emperour intent cōmunication learned mē may cōcerning religion graunteth cōfederatours doctrine profeſſed auſpurge whiche nowe numbre truce xv monethes commaundeth meane tyme moleſted caſe concernyng religion peace norinberge emperours decree regenſpurge alſo tyme ratified duryng tyme truce fully agree religion yet ſhall peace force vntyll nexte aſſemblie empyre perchaunce aſſemblie truce expyred yet neuertheleſſe peace ſhall take place vntyll aſſemblye meane whyle tyme truce emperour doeth ſuſpende ſuites action lawe commenced againſte proteſtauntes alſo outlawyng cytie myndin anye thynge otherwyſe done commaundeth fruſtrate wonte obiected vnto though profeſſion religion myght conſiſte iudgement ſame ſhall take place longer ſhall enioye benefite lawe without exception agayne proteſtauntes ſhall moleſte man durynge truce ſhall take none theyr league yet ſo man ſuſteyne anye wronge quarell religion emperour ſhall alſo forſee man receyued ouer contrary league proteſtauntes ſhall permytte clergie enioye thoſe yearelye profites whiche haue daye conſent emperour daye ſhall aſſigned kalendes auguſte whiche daye ſhould mete norinberge cathoqliues proteſtaūtes ſuch good men deſirous peace contention frowarde thoſe ſhal chouſe certen numbre diuines whiche quietly frendly may conferre religion alſo ſhalbe ioyned others profeſſe diuinitie yet experte men ſobre moreouer emperour kynge ferdinando lyſte maye haue deputes conference ſoeuer ſhall agreed vpon conſent eyther partie ſhalbe ſignified ſtates yt abſent approuing ſame emperours ambaſſadour alſo ſhal ratifie el emperour ſelf next aſſēblie thempire ſhal haue cōfirmed ſhal cō maund kept inuiolate party ſhal lay away ye preparatiōs vnto war yt ſhal ſeme go thīg ſhalbe enforced ſhew cauſe doeth yet ſo mā inhibited kepe defēce neceſſary al thīgs law thēpire ſhalbe party obſerued truce cōprehēded neither anabaptiſts others yt followe doctrine cōtrary cōfeſſiō auſpurg proteſtātes ſhal haue redines ayde turckiſh warre yt ther delay whan prince electours principall ſtates ſhall emperours commaundement ſende deputes woormes xviij daye may proteſtaūtes ſhall ſende alſo may conſulte ſoden ayde againſt turke ſomeuer ſhalbe agreed vpon conſent parte ſame ſhall alſo ſubſcribe turke ſhall moue warre duryng tyme truce ſhall reſiſte hym reſte theſe thynges ratified caſe emperour within ſyre month ſhall allowe ſame begynning kalendes may meane tyme agrement concerning truce augmente league ſhalbe force caſe emperour declare mynde within ſame tyme • yet ſhall peace norinberge full ſtrength vertue hereafter emperours depute iohn archebyſhop londe heldus gone spayne ſayde kyng ferdinando alſo ſent thether ambaſſadours proteſtauntes many duke saxon ſelfe lantgraue whiche brought certen diuines palſgraue marque brandenburg electours intreate meanes duke saxon amonges thynges proteſted duke saxony woulde geue ferdinando title kyng romains tyme would attribute ferdinando title king romains ſtode conuenaūtes cadame uienne ſame archebyſhop londe germayne borne counſellour chriſtierne kyng denmarke beyng expulſed alſo exiled loſt byſhopryke came agayne germany attended vpon emperour afterwardes made byſhop conſtaunce whyleſt treaty frankefurte certen bandes souldiours aſſembled saxony commaunded gouernours go lye countreis citie breme duke lunenburge others ſame religion remayne tyll campe remoued kept ſecrete firſt whoſe conduicte aucthoritie leuied length certenly knowen muſtred henry duke brunſwycke brother chriſtopher archebyſhop bremen 〈…〉 ried complayned dede imperial chāber vayne proteſtaūtes afterwardes induſtrie leſt ſhould harme procured ſame men ſerue whome notwithſtanding vſed iniurie man requeſt prince wer interceſſours stephen faber ſet libertie lantgraue gaue paſſeporte ſayde owne accorde woulde retourne prince truſted hym whan releaſed went ſtreight way aſſemblie william duke cleue ambaſſadour exhibite wrytinge proteſtauntes wherin declared ryght tytle poſſeſſed gelderlande prayed would meanes emperour commende cauſe alſo emperours ambaſſadours frenche kyng aduertiſed ulrich duke wirtenberge frēcha kyng geueth toūſel duke wittemberge ambaſſadour heard ſaye howe motion confederatours determined make warre vppon certen byſhoppes germany pourpoſe alowe good wyll beareth hym doth admonyſhe hym ſhould offende emperour kyng ferdinando vnto whome lately reconciled bryng ſelfe al euer great daunger duke geuyng thankes good admoniſhement ſayth ſclaundered howe ſuppoſeth ſame reyſed vp duke bauier hathe faſly ſowen lyke bruite hym germany deſyreth hym geue credit neither entent yet fellowes ſtyre vp trouble attēpte thyng force armes vnleſſe conſtrayned doubteth alſo ſhal heare therof wyl pourge ſelues herein wherfore whan declared fellowes franckefurte duke saxon lantgraue xix daye aprill addreſſe letter kynge ſaye howe vnderſtande duke ulriche reporte duke saxon lantgr write frēch kyng made vnto hym ſclaunder forged ennemies euill wyllers entende make warre muche deſyre peace prince tell interceſſours albeit wayes one prouoked albeit theyr fellowes citie outlawed league made dyuerſe defence vniuſle decree though bandes souldiours hired great vnaccuſtomed wage nowe ſpoyling countreys league frendes yet quiet ſtyre one whytte loue natiue countrey remitte iniuries cōmon wealthes ſake aduerſaries lead certen impudent hatred followe temperate wayes wyll admitte lawefull reaſonyng ſeke germany maye ſwymme ciuile bloud ſeyng thus deſyre hym credit theſe falſe reportes geue ayde churche maye quieted godly meanes properly dutie kynges maynteine truthe innocencie defende cauſe religion done none euyll pourpoſe certen godly dutie doubte doctrine whiche doe profeſſe agreable vnto god worde whiche maye wyſe forſake duke george saxon • irth ende aſſemblie xxiiij daye apryll died george duke saxony without chyldren two ſonnes departed without iſſewe whereof one maried elizabeth lantgraues ſyſter one houſe mandeſfielde wherfore duke george legacie maketh heyres brother henry ſonnes maurice auguſte vnder condition alter ſtate religion whiche vnleſſe ſhall perfourme geueth whole landes emperour kyng ferdinando vntyll ſuche tyme eyther ſonnes nexte kynſman familie doe accomplyſhe condition wyl ſo made ſheweth firſt nobilitie cōmons countrie beinge nowe olde ſickly wylleth confirme ſame othe neuer alter laſt wyll fearyng leſte ſhould occaſion warre betwene kinſmē intreate would content ſende brother henry truſte wyll conſente alter nothing religion whereupon ambaſſadours ſent perſwade whan alledged ambaſſadours ſent brother henry ſondry reaſons eſpecially ſayd muche ready money great quantitie plate goodly ſtuffe whiche ſhould come wholy handes caſe would obeye brother wyll aunſwered thus certenly meſſage ſemeth vnto reſemble ſame writtē goſpel tyme sathan promyſed chriſte kyngdomes whole worlde ſo would falle downe worſhyp hym doe youthynke ſette ſo muche ryches would therfore forſake truthe pure religion aſſuredly farre abuſed ſo thinke wherfore whan anſwere departed without purpoſe came home duke george lefte hys lyfe brother henry going immediatly dreſda townes bindeth people hym othe eaſely done reaſon league proteſtauntes moreouer prince electour saxony hearyng death haſteth home expedition nede myght ayde henry prince popyſh parte loſſe ſo ſure pyllour ſo lucky ſucceſſe proteſtauntes ſore agreued eſpecially archebyſhop mentz duke brunſwycke hereafter ſhal heare thus duke george ſucceſſour heire cleane contrary wylle whome hated moſte men duryng lyfe tyme namely luther ſent new prince lipſia preache alter religion tyme moneth may appered blaſyng ſtarre ſhortly departed iſabel wyfe charles emperour whome frenche kyng ſo ſone heard therof kepte ſolempne funerall paris maner kynges ſhewed counſell uicence whiche byſhop rome proroged tyll eaſter yeare ſeyng none would come publiſheth letter tenth iune wherin prorogeth counſell ſuſpendeth owne pleaſure ſenate cardinalles kyng englande certen monethes ſet forth another wryttyng touching synode uicence declareth howe byſhop deludeth whole worlde excuſed hym ſelfe duke mantua playne mockery ſeing taketh vppon hym ſo great anothoritie compelle hym coulde wherfore ſhoulde commaunde men come place vncerten whiche power nowe albeit hathe choſen uicence ſame pourpoſe yet doubt 〈…〉 enetians men ſo great wyſdome wyll ſuffer citie peſtred ſuche multitude without garmſons souldiours woulde duke mantua fyne wylbe ſmall reſorte thether mantua fore deluſion ſo euer doeth neyther oughte permitted diſſolute lybertie longer nothynge dede better commodious lawfull counſell whan applied vnto priuate lucre commoditie eſtablyſhynge certen men aucthoritie brynge wonderfull deſtruction common wealth whan name counſell churche nowe common euery man mouthe luther ſetteth forth booke either vulgare ſpeache fyrſt treatefh aſſemblie apoſtles hieruſalem whiche mentioned xv actes reciteth contrary opinion doctours eſpecially auſten ciprian concernyng baptiſme ſame occaſion maketh mention thoſe lawes called canon apoſtles proueth manifeſt reaſons thei 〈…〉 cōmonly called apoſtles falſe falſe countrefeated thoſe geue tytle deſerue death doeth recite ordre thoſe foure counſelles chiefe authoritie counſell nyce conſtantinople epheſus calcedonie declareth cauſes aſſēbled ther decreed euery commeth principall queſtion ſheweth aucthoritie counſell wherfore ſayeth howe counſel maye confirme newe doctryne commaunde newe worke neyther bynde men myndes newe ceremony intermedle ciuile gouernementes make decree eſtablyſh authoritie dutie therof abolyſhe condemne newe opinion contrary holy scripture newe ceremony whether ſuperſtitious vnprofitable churche ſuche thynges brought controuerſie examine determine written text god worde diffineth churche ſheweth token ought knowen comparyſon made declaring chriſte apoſtles taught ſayeth howe byſhop rome whiche hath brought churche farre cōtrary doctrine wicked meanes hath pylled whole world intollerable exaction ought condempned dryuen make reſtitution amonges diuerſe thynges wherby ſame boke declareth blyndenes men led vnder byſhop rome howe ſhameful vyle religion ſayeth freers maketh deuyll afrayd come thus farre monke freers wede thought ſufficient bryng man eternall lyfe manye onlye meane folkes alſo great prynces would buried freers garment thoſe ſhall come peraduenture wyl beleue yet true wont commonly done italy mory fraunces marque mantua ſeconde name put laſt wylle myght buried gray freers cote ſame albertus pius prynce carpes paris chriſtopher longelie bourgonnion buried padwey man excellently langelius oration againſt lutherians learned great ciceronian alſo wrote oration againſt lutherians lyke caſe alberte diuers againſt eraſmus roterdame immediatly death duke george henry duke brunſwycke rydeth emperour spayne thorowe fraunce ſame tyme henry eyght kyng englande calleth parliament wherein amōges thinges enacted certen decree religiō called ſyxe article followeth vnder ſyr article four bread wyne true natural body bloud chriſte wordes conſecration remayned ſubſtaunce bread wyne receiuing whole ſupper lorde neceſſary ſaluation chriſt wholy cōteyned vnder kyndes lawful prieſtes marry vowes chaſtitie ought perfourmed priuate maſſes reteyned auricular confeſſion good neceſſary ſuche thought otherwyſe appoynted punyſhement dewe heretikes ſame tyme kynge ſtoode termes marry lady anne cleue mayde excellent lady anne cleaue beautie ſhe affianced within monthes ſent caleis whether kyng ſent lorde admirall others ſhyppes receyue tranſporte englande hymſelfe accompanied noble gentleman realme receiued vpō blacke heath brought grenewitche ſhortly married archebyſhop canturbury ſaye howe biſhoppes perſwaded kyng cōſent ſyxe article intent myght bring archebyſhop cantorburye lorde crumwell whiche great fauourers religion aucthoritie creditie yeare mōth auguſt barbarouſſe turkes lieutenaunt barbarouſe taketh caſtel neweſ taketh aſſiege caſtelneufe towne slauonie borderinge vpon goulfe ueniſe ſleying souldiours leadeth awaye many captiue yere moneth october emperour uenetians beyng one confederacie wonne emperour dede put garriſon foure thouſand spanyardes made captayne fraunces sarmiento whiche chaunced uenetians contrary expectation ſayde town ſtanding coaſte ought rather therfore longe miſlyked ſocietie ſawe wold daungerours aſke truce turke obteyne maner ſame tyme aroſe ſedition gaunte whiche citie rebellienat gaunte great force aucthoritie thoſe party hath oftentymes made many ſore bickeringes lybertie gouernours flaunders whoſe dominion ſtandeth emperour hauing intelligence hereof firſte thought haue gone italy germany altered purpoſe determined paſſe fraunce ſeyng kyng required hym inſtantly ſo emperour paſſeth throughe fraunce doe promyſed hym thynges franckely meane tyme palſgraue marque brandenburge interceſſours addreſſyng letter emperour pacification franckfurte requyred hym permitte conference learned men norinberge ſayde death wyfe certen affaire would ſuffer hym entende ſuche matter whan interceſſours ſent copie theſe duke saxon lantgraue yet ſignified whether emperour confirmed truce xv monethes xix daye nouember aſſemblie appoynted aruſtet towne turingia conſulted augmente confederacie nedefull defence caſe emperour wyll allowe peace makyng franckefurte well diſpoſyng churche goodes ſende ambaſſadours englande touching ſyxe article mitigate kinges mynde moue frenche kynge innocente perſones tormented religiō moreouer ſende ambaſſadours emperour ſo ſone ſhall vnderſtande commyng flaunders becauſe certen confederatours abſent ſome commiſſion determine certē matter daye aſſigned smalcalde kalendes marche wherin treate reſte receiued league men rigen citie linonia whiche cōtencion archebyſhop lyke many others germany neyther wer receyued vpon condicion defended counſel chā ber commō procurer therfore payed confederatours thouſande fyue hundreth crownes henry duke saxon taken league two yeares without charge becauſe poore yet vpon condition tyme enriched ſhould beare like charge reſte nowe therfore auaunced goodly inheritaunce aſſemblie treated hym touching ſame whiche aſſemblie ended tenthe decembre prynces preſent ſent deputes duke saxon ſent iohn dulcie fraunces burcarte vicechauncelour englande moneth nouembre name preſent marriage betwene kynge lady anne cleane married ſyſter sibille mentioned ſy •• booke wherfore vpon occaſion enioyned arnſtade treate kyng name proteſtaūtes theſe matter ſayd emperour receyuing ſaufe conduictetoke iourney ſmall company moneth nouembre whan came frontier fraunce borderynge vpon spayne met kynges two ſonnes henry charles come thether poſte conſtable gone thether long great parte nobilitie fraunce receyued conduicted myddes fraunce greateſt city whā came loche burges mette kynge hym ſelfe ſcarcely amēded late diſeaſe paſſyng leaunce newe yeares daye rydynge myddes betwene kynges two ſonnes entred citie paris conſtable 1540 bare ſworde kinde ioyful myrth gladnes honour ſolemnitie mynde man coulde delight emperour entreth paris left vndone thether came byſhoppes legate alexander farneſius cardinall together cardinall bellaye byſhop citie receiued emperour cathedrall churche paris emperour remaining ſeuen dayes afterwardes departeth kynge hym ſelfe accompanying hym uermandois ſonnes brought hym farre ualencenes towne henaulte kynge brought great almoſte ſure hope recouer millan chaunced farre otherwyſe hereafter purpoſe declare tyme emperour frenche emperours frēch king ambaſſade uenetians kynge fraunce ſent ambaſſadours uenetians moſte nobly accōpanied emperour ſent alphonſe daualle gouernour millan king claudie hannebalde lieutenant piedmonte theſe exhorted senatours longe diſcours ioyne ſelues amitie theſe two moſt myghty prince put theyr good willes power ouerthrow turke whan moſt honorably dimiſſed ambaſſadors uenetians ambaſſador turke conſidering thing diligently thought mete reconcile ſelues turke trewce already wherfore concluding laſt rendre vnto nanplia epidaurum obteyned hande peace ſaye frenchemen albeit exhorted openly themperours ambaſſadour yet ſecretly whiſpered eares ſhould prouide themſelues enter ſuch daunger fyrſt like ſmarte king ſelfe apologie againſt themperour reporteth common wealth uenetians deſtroyed meanes releued recouered aloiſius bardnarius ambaſſadoure uenetians ſente turke peace 〈◊〉 commaunded fyrſt offer al condition reſerue thoſe two city extreme neceſſitie turke priuie eſpiall knewe determination senate longe expoſtulate declare commiſſion plainely directly without thoſe two place deliuered would conclude beyng amaſed ſeyng priuities common wealth ſecrets ſenate vttered turke bewrayed full ſore againſte permitteth haue laſte whan retourned ueniſe declared whole matter senatours greatly aſtonied moſte diligente inquiſition apprehende certen fyndynge giltie cut theyr trators executed heades one fledde frenche ambaſſadours lodgyng biſhoppe mompelier saintuary wherefore officer ſent haue ſearched houſe whā might ſuffered enter senate commaundeth certeine great piece fetched theyr ordenaunce houſe ouerthrow lodging wherupon frenchman conſyderinge theyr owne daunger bring forth vnto senate afterwarde wrote vnto kinge cauſe ſo dyd leſt ſhoulde thynke ambaſſadour ſuſteined wrong themperour came flaunders themp arriueth flaunders kyng ferdinando comming auſtriche met alſo proteſtantes ambaſſadors condeſcended arnſtad xxiiii daye february beyng admitted emperours ſpeach gaunt welcome low countrey pourge ſelues euill reportes theyr aduerſaryes complayne duke brunſwike iudges chaumber declare deſirous peace howe many way haue ſought nowe deſyre graunt eſtabliſhe euer emperour telleth granuella hath conſulted matter wyll make aunſwere maner ſame tyme ſent ambaſſade emperour prote wryte frēche king wrote alſo frenche kynge reioyſinge muche great good wyll amitie betwene emperour hym long proces intreate hym cōſent mindes cauſe religion publique quiet emperour kalendes marche ambaſſadours prince city proteſtauntes aſſembly smalcald met smalcald appointed alſo came theſe diuines ionas pomerane melancthon cruciger bucer inioyned deuiſe fourme wryting wherwith ſhoulde thinke mete treate aduerſaries cōciliation religion aſſemblie cōſulted ſuch matter left vndiſcuſſed arnſtad ſaid meane time dulcie burcarte returned englande ſeuenth day marche make reporte smalcalde ſtate religion england decree made yere great puniſhement latimer shaxton notwithſtanding hugh latimer byſhop woorceſter shaxton byſhop saliſbury deteined priſon religiō yet releaſed lorde cromwell whiche moſte authoritie lorde cromwell doth appeaſe mitigate kynges mynde alſo kyng ſelfe familiar talke opened vnto mynde ſuppoſeth thus diuines proteſtauntes thinke rightly cō cerning mariage prieſtes lordes ſupper vnder kyndes priuate maſſe requireth write vnto theſe neceſſary queſtions large alledging cauſes reaſons opinion wyll ſee agayne learned men realme ſhall wryte aunſwere thus waye may made come knowledge truthe moreouer cromwel certen others thinke mete expedient ſende great ambaſſade kinge melancthon meane agrement religion might kynge woulde beſtowe great ſomme money vpon league purpoſeth make onlye cauſe religion generall kyng marueleth greatly confederated religion tyme wyll come ſhalbe attempted warre vnder contrary title fewe dayes diuines exhibite wryting ſome wrytinge exhibited diuines wherof ſwarue ſteppes confeſſion auſpurge apologie afterwardes annexed ſame ſentence afterwardes diuines abſent approue letter ſent thether tyme came henry duke brunſwick emp aunſwer proteſt gaūt day ides march thēperour anſwereth ye proteſtātes ambaſſadours cornelles scepp gētly ſo ſo yet ſuche ſorte coulde wel perceiued whether would graunte peace wherfore ambaſſadours emperours leaue going litle aſyde retourne deſire hym inhibite proceſſe imperiall chamber graunte peace whereunto emperour ſayde aunſwere tyme woulde take delyberation aunſwere recited smalcalde tenth daye eaſter munday xxix marche came thether prince ſelues tyme certen contention hatred betwyxte granuella heldus fine came ende hatred betwixt counſellers heldus diſplaced departed courte lyued priuate lyfe aboue hym authoritie brought heldus hatred obloquie ouer vehement counſell matter affaire conſtreyned emperour thinkyng nothyng leſſe haue warres maner againſt wyll whan granuella geuen certen manifeſte inſtructions wyll mynde inclyned peace concorde beynge requeſted proteſtauntes perſwaded emperour alſo conditiōs peace hymſelfe begynning though bene owne name ſent smalcalde interceſſours ambaſſadours theodoricke manderſchitte william nuenarie erles men great wyſdome dignitie notwithſtanding firſt taried waye ſore ſycke demaundes reaſonable enough neuertheleſſe ſignified emperour almoſt perſwaded falſe perſwaſiō emper though cared religion neyther deſyred peace theyr harte altogether ſought conuerte churche goodes theyr priuate vſes delyghted diſcorde bare good wyll addicte take partes open ennemies theſe thing reported emperour partly aduerſaries partly frenchemen ſayde certentie tyme emperour went fraunce thinges lyke growe perfite frendſhyp certen thinges diſcloſed proteſtauntes letter vnto kyng ſhewed vnto emperour ſome impute kyng ſelfe ſome conſtable chief authoritie ſought al meanes poſſible quiet agree prince dyd beare proteſtantes good wyl becauſe religion ✚ thirtene booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument thirtene booke proteſtauutes make aunſwere emperour demaundes ſhewyng haue regarde religion churche goodes confute alſo argumentes kyng englande touchyng ſyxe article emperour hauing punyſhed gaunt ſendeth letter aſſigne metyng proteſtauntes againſt whome ſpeaketh alexander farneſe pope legate followed emperour fraunce meane tyme frenche kyng made league duke cleane whoſe ſyſter kyng englande refuſed aſſemble hagenawe certen poinctes religion agreed vpon reſydewe referred conuention kyng ferdinando aſſigned woruies whether granuellan ſendyng firſt naues came afterwarde alſo hym ſelfe made oration hym campeigius pope legate conference brake offe differed yt iourney regenſpurg meane whyle luther anſwereth booke ſet forth duke brunſwycke ſpoken dere mantell archebyſhoppes counſell beyng begonne regenſpurge granuellan preſenteth booke interim duke cleaue commynge fraunce marrieth daughter nauarre vnto whiche thinges proteſtauntes eleuenth daye apryl make long aunſwere anſwer prot grāuellā declaryng innocencie ſuche thinges emperour ſuſpected chief cauſe great charge peryll profeſſe doctrine done neither priuate cōmoditie pleaſur diſpleaſure perſone reſpect ſaue god requyreth dutye ſhould profeſſe name ſonne goſpell commaundeth v flye idolatrie warneth v moſt ſtraightly allowe crueltie whiche perſecute true doctrine touchynge churche goodes ſhewe vnto good vſes imploye diſſention others author thereof diſcourſe cauſe religion large confute ſclaunder ſhould inclyned emperours ennemies hym goodly large offer whiche cauſe refuſed ayde aſſiſtaunce whiche haue geuen hym warres finally requyre monſer granuellan great cōmendation hath euermore hytherto perſwaded emperour frō ye bloudy coūſels aduerſaries peaceable wayes wold preferre emperour complainte chamber intreate hym graunte peace ſo often ſought deſyred tyme made anſwer ides apryl ende theyr intreaty appointe diuines make confutation ſyxe article enacted confutatis ſix article kyng englande booke afterwarde ſent thether entent caſe diuines englande wyll aunſwer hope agrement communication may make league otherwyſe relion man thought expedient alſo decreed intreate kyng ſuche perſecuted fraunce religion firſt learne ſtate fraunce howe kynge affected whether maye thought mediation wyll take place dyuerſe decree touchynge churche goodes ſeueral complayntes haylbrune ſhould abolyſhe popyſhe maſſe remayned yet certen church fynally determine nedefuull done caſe emperour eyther refuſe peace aunſwere doubtfully chamber procede olde maner power reiſed vp againſt pryuelye whileſt theſe thynges workyng emperour doth great great execution done gaunt execution gaunt making chiefeſt rebelles hoppe headles taketh away armure weapon priuileges commodity buyldeth caſtell placeth garniſon neckes citie euer wonte rebell againſt theyr prince haue alſo declared parte played charles burgundy emperours great graundfather phylip father lewys erle flaunders great grandfather ſame philippe motherſyde whiche emperour ſemeth haue reuenged neuer ſo ſubdued thys tyme eyghtenthe daye apryll emperoure addreſſed hys letter duke saxony lantgraue howe hathe emp letter prooteſtāt talked wyth hys brother ferdinando kynge romaynes amonges thynges state germanye eſpeciallye diſſention religion whiche woulde fayne appeaſed lyke tofore hathe omytted nothynge herein ſo nowe alſo ſame mynde ſtyll wyll acknoweledge zeale abuſe ſame deſyre peace whiche haue longe ſynce pretended wordes promyſes wyll nowe perfourme deed hath vſed many yeares nowe ſondrye gētle meanes treaty hathe priuayled hetherto nowe matter come poynte vnleſſe ſhortlye remedied wil followe great diſſolutiō cōmon welth maruelous ſturre ſtates although ſo yet benigne gentlenes appointeth againe aſſemblie spyres ſyxte daye iune perchaunce plage infection ſickenes wyll permitte ſuche place brother ferdinando ſhal appointe deuiſe meanes great daunger hanged ouer germany may auoyded willing ther preſent ſelues daye aſſigned lettes ſet aparte vnleſſe ſyckenes ſende chief counſellours ſuche louers peace mete treatie priuie doings ſignifie ſame fellowes entent daye thether ſhall come brother ferdinādo declare mynde wyll theyr ambaſſade ſent vnto hym ſo frame ſelues preſeruation ſelues countrey diſſention beyng taken awaye may ſo muche better conſult affayres empyre cauſe feare daunger wylaſſure thē vpon fidelitie graunteth benefite peace norrinberge wyll ſuffer man doe againſt yet ſo agayne doe offende man unto whiche letter aunſwered xv day anſwer prot emp letter may followeth counſelles peace geue hym moſt harty thankes admonyſhed ſhuld acknowledge ſtudious deſyre abuſe ſame cauſe ſaye ſhould thinke otherwyſe thē cōfederates league frendes nothing derely beloued peace matter hath ben agreed vpō hetherto ought imputed vnto thē greatnes cauſe aduerſaries whiche coulde abyde declaration doctrine nowe would haue preſente daye appointed wyl gladly obeye howe beit becauſe woulde kynge ſhoulde trauell vayne wyll ſhewe fantaſye vnknowen hyghnes euerſynce fyrſte beginning controuerſie muche delyberation aſſemblies empire waye ſemed beſte vnto al men eyther lawefull counſell myght el prouinciall synode germany ſythe ſhortnes tyme ſemed litle purpoſe deuyſed franckefurte haue communication matter decree made ſame ſeynge matter weightie wherein ſaluation man cōſiſteth ſhortly determined ſhould purpoſely done therfore ſhould troubleſome paynfull kyng ferdinando alſo others traue ſuche matter fore communication waye prepared wherfore whiche pleaſed men franckefurte ſemeth nowe beſt vnto alſo caſe conuocation germany communication myght appointed iudgement better way founde declared alſo late counte nuenar wherein truſte holy scripture euen commaundement ſhall occupie chief place whan aduerſaries ſhall ſwarue ſame maye called agayne waye albeit maye go thether without makinge fellowes priuie tyme ſo ſhorte aſſemble yet whan thing ſhalbe cōmenced ſhalbe hope good wyll let come thether perſone requiring hym would graunte ſaue conduicte whiche promyſed onlye ambaſſadours deuines alſo muche ſhal haue moſte doe matter laſte deſyre vnderſtande pleaſure herein tolde cardinall farneſius went emperour paris flaunders ſcarſely yet come man ſtate ſo muche emperour toke euill part byſhop ſent ſome man rype yeares counſell tyme therfore conſulte religion turkiſh oratiē yeūg cardinall warre granuellan ſpoken mynde laſte young cardinall preſence emperour king ferdinando ſaid fantaſie inueighing chiefly againſte lutherianes throughout whole oration amonges many thinges ſayd could well diſcerued whether againſt chriſte proteſtantes turkes one ſhewe crueltie onlye prote 〈◊〉 turkes againſt body others drawe ſoules alſo euerlaſting perdition farneſius ioyned hym marcellus ceruinus byſhop nicaſtre gouernour counſelles ſame legacie made cardinall oration farneſius coming abroade fewe monethes ſet forth prynte iohn caluine made comentary leſte man ſhould miſtake tyme duke cleaue came emperour point poſſeſſion gelderlande woulde therfore returnyng home agayne began conſulte frenche kynge whan hope recouer millan emperour offering hym ſuche condicions woulde lyttle haue priuy hatred yt frē che kynge againſt emperour thought tourned mynde wholly frendſhyp yet couertly complayned ſo farre abuſed began miſlyke conſtable whiche put hym great hope cauſe emperour paſſed fraunce could neuer abyde hym thynges therfore ſought meanes priuelye howe moleſte emperour duke cleaue able ſuſteyne ſo great ſute diſpleaſure alone beganne entre mutuall bandes amitie frenche kyng nece lady iane daughter ſyſter margarete quene nauarre eleuen yeares age greateſt inheriter fraunce excellent beaultie well brought vp vnto whoſe frendes kyng made ſute eſpecially quene ſiſter ſhe myght maried duke cleaue brought duke cleaue ioyned frenche kynge paſſe ſhalbe recited place tyme dyd byſhop rome warre vpon peruſians refuſed pay certen cuſtome ſalte thynges reyſed vpon ſo brought citie vnder iuriſdiction like cauſe expulſed aſcanius man great power houſe columnois pope warreth vpō ye peruſiās dominion cardinall farneſius hauing done commiſſion ſeyng peace take effecte betwixt emperour frenche kyng alſo vnknowen hym daye aſſigned hagenaw proteſtauntes decide cauſe departed flaūders came paris ides may feaſte pentecoſte cathedral churche conſecrated anthony uncle madame deſtampes kynges darlinge cardinall medone ſetting vpon head purple hatte latelye brought rome ſalutyng kyng waye goeth great ſpede rome afterwarde kyng ferdinando toke iourney bruſſelles goe aſſemblie hagenaw could holden spyres reaſon plague unto aſſemblie frē che kyng alſo ſente lazarus bayſius aduyſe emperour eyther diſſembled theyr grief matter hetherto handled flatteryng wordes firſt daye iune kyng fraunce ſet forth ſore proclamation againſt ſowers abroade hereſie falſe doctrine luther companion twelfthe daye ſame imprinted proclaimed paris aboute tyme kynge englande beheaded lorde cromwell whome lowe degree auaunced hyghe dignitie lorde crumwell beheaded little made erle eſſex forſaketh lady anne cleaue marrieth catherine hawarde nece duke norfolke lord cromwell maker marriage houſe cleaue kynge loued hawarde kynge marieth katherine hawarde thought perſwaded hir cromwel ſhe iudged lette vnto matter might diſpatched waye man alſo wellbeloued nobilitie ſuſpected though ſhould ſeke diſtruction papiſtes meane tyme duke brunſwicke accuſed moſte heinouſly boeth proteſtantes chiefly henry duke saxony duke brūſwik accuſed proteſtaun contrary wyl brother george condition expreſſed teſtament altered ſtate religion moleſteth byſhoppes merſeburge miſene iuriſdiction kept hym ſelfe money brother lefte vſe league ſome lx thouſande crownes wherfore admonyſhed emperour compell hym doe dutie whiche ſhall refuſe diſpoſſeſſe hym inheritaunce fourme wyll wrought alone albeit principal certen others alſo ſame confederacie nowe wyll ſpeake aſſemblie hagenaw whiche began fyue twenty daye iune kynge ferdinando aſſemble hagenawe come thether moneth fewe dayes cōmencement proteſtauntes ſpoken palſgraue archebyſhops collon treuers ericus duke brunſwick byſhops auſburge spyres euerye man ſeuerallye owne houſe would entreate peace ferdinando therfore forſayde daye callyng proteſtauntes hym declareth vnto cauſe aſſemblye becauſe prynces came ſelues whiche emperour thought verely woulde haue done wylleth ſhe commiſſion aucthoritie nameth interceſſours lewys paulſgraue iohn archebyſhop treuers lewys duke bauier william byſhop straſborough contente beganne treaty thether came alſo diuines proteſtantes great number iuſtus menius piſtorius urbanus regius bucer brentius blanrer oſiander shirepſius many others melanchthō fell ſore ſycke waye theſe preached home euery man company chiefly tyme al ambaſſadours mette together conſulte vpon matter ferdinando whan vnderſtoode forbade ambaſſadours agayne ſhewed hym howe preachyngs forbydden preached openly priuatly neyther anye cauſe ſhould offended duke saxon lantgraue come caſe talke gone forwarde taried vpon frōtiers entent hearing newes therof might haue bene interceſſours requyre proteſtātes deliuer brief ſomme article controuerſy ſay exhibite ſomme confeſſion doctrine ten yeares ſynce auſpurge apologie ſame whiche ſticke vnto none beyng ready make aunſwere man fynde lacke therin becauſe knowe thynge chiefly aduerſaries reprehende therin haue nothyng exhibyte ſame rather requyred hādes ſhewe ſuppoſe contrary god worde whiche doe matter come diſputation thoughte mete franckefurte wyll againſt cōcorde ſhew againe within fewe dayes foraſmuche dwel ſtyll confeſſion exhibited auſpurge doe fynde readinge treaty certen thinges brought conciliation certen nowe reſte alſo myght come reconcilement wyll doe endeuours deſyre vtter myndes herein proteſtauntes agayne ſaye dede talke certen article nothyng concluded anye agrement al made thus matter debated fro proteſtauntes requyred myght come diſputation againe ſayd howe cōmaunded king emperour ſhould procede accordinge treaty auſpurge kyng ferdinando xvi daye iuly callyng al ferdinādos requeſt hym foraſmuche ſayth matter ſtandeth thus nothyng nowe determined chiefly abſence duke saxō lātgraue day muſt appointed wher ambaſſadours learned men partes ſhall mete lyke number conferre article profeſſed auſpurge longe controuerſie betwyxt kyng proteſtauntes peace confederatours reſtitution churche goodes iudges chamber ferdinando xxviij daye iuly maketh decree reciting whole matter decree hagenaw appoynted day cōmunication wormes xxviij daye october vpon condicion emperour ſo content prynces electours duke bauier duke cleaue byſhoppes madenburge saliſburge straſburge commaunded ſende thether counſellours proteſtauntes alſo ſo eleuen eyther part alſo many scribe wryte diligently euery man ſayeth conference proteſtantes doctrine profeſſed auſpurge requeſt made emperour wyll call counſell empyre meane tyme commaundeth men obſerue peace abſtayne violence vnder great penaltie appointed emperours commaundemēt prynces mentioned aſſemblie chriſtopher byſhop trent henry duke brūſwycke went home matter ended greateſt peace maker aſſemblie byſhop collon paulſgraue electours alſo byſhop auſpurge reſte extreme agaynſt proteſtauntes duryng aſſemblie died iohn uaiuode kyng hōgary leauing death iohn uayuode king hungary behinde hym younge ſonne stephen whome iſabell daughter sigiſmunde kyng pole borne hym lytle whiche cauſe alſo kyng ferdinādo beyng aduertyſed therof letter haſted homewarde time alſo certen townes village proteſtantes ſet fyre saxony aboutes burnt vp cleane wicked acte ſayde done duke brunſwyck fyres saxony ſhalbe declared hereafter ſeconde kalendes iuly robert barnes doctour diuinitie brent london smithfield certen tyme fled englande doctrine doctor berne burnt smithfielde goſpell tyme vnderſtode howe kynge henry gaue mynde knowledge truthe retourned home agayn ambaſſade ſent germany one whiche treated diuines wittēberge touching kinges diuorſement wrytten tenth boke kyng exiled name byſhop rome kept ſtyl doctrine man whiche loued truthe chieflye meanes byſhop wyncheſter daye executed proteſted hys fayth openly place execution hym alſo thre prot burnt thre papiſtes hanged one tyme brent two others ſame religion ſame daye ſelfe ſame place three others hanged vpon gallowes helde ſupremacie byſhop rome ſo yt neyther rāke papiſts erneſt proteſtauntes eſcaped puniſhement moneth auguſt ended lyfe paris williā budey maiſter requeſtes man great learning worthy perpetuall memory death budey cauſe cardinal bellaye byſhop paris counſell perſwade fraunces frenche kyng moſte noble acte appoint great ſtipendes reader tongue good artes paris welſpryng mā beleue clere plentiful ryuers flowe fraunce alſo countreis lyke hath henry eight done englande cambridge oxforde buden would buried without ſolemnitie yeare notable reaſon intollerable heate drought alſo excellent good wyne erceadig hote ſōmer meane tyme kyng fraunce diſpatchyng abroade letter byſhoppes commaunded go proceſſion place albeit peace emperour whiche would willingly breake yet feared greatly leſte olde enemye mankynde would ſtyre vp warre miniſters euer longe emperour aduertiſed letter brother ferdinando interceſſours whole matter cōfirmeth decree hagenawe wryting letter utrecht ides auguſt exhorteth proteſtauntes ſende ambaſſadours diuines wormes daye aſſigned ſendeth ſaufe conduicte becauſe affayres hym ſelfe ſayeth wyll ſende thether ſome notable man doubteth byſhop wyl ſende thether alſo quiet cōtrouerſy promiſeth moreouer aſſemblie thempire whither come parſon vnto aſſemblie alſo ſumme talke muſt referred afterwardes ides octob letter dated bruſſels maketh granvellan deputie giuing full authoritie communication time granvellā bizanſe highe burgundie towne borne beynge ſo occupied affayres coulde come thither day writyng letter archebiſhop mentz reſidew prince appointed talke ſeconde daye nouembre ſendeth iohn nauie lucemburge excuſe hys longe tariyng wronge oute mathew helde ſaid called forth man obſequious agreable maners placed rome meane time themperour nauius hath place heldus calleth counſell thempire moneth ianuary ſhould al ready regenſpurge whan granvellan ſelfe came wormes accompanied ſonne biſhoppe arras certen diuines spaine muſcoſa maluenda carrobello ſhewing fyrſte commiſſion emperours letter xxv daye nouembre made oration excuſynge matter neither themperour king ferdinando declareth oratiō granvellan wor louing frendly minde themperour beareth common wealth wiſheth nothing earneſtly olde feaſtred ſtrife might taken awaye wherewith onely church alſo common wealth ſore afflicted doubteth ſelues ſee preſent calamitie wil iudge reformation churche neceſſary therfore nothing concerne dewties throughe godly counſels remedy euill ſpread abrode like caſe part good citezins quenche fyre happeneth caſualtie ſo muſt worlde caſe peace concorde may reſtored furthermore let wet ſelues ſet eies heape euilles haue throughe diſſention ouerflowed germany paſſe ouer murther miſchief religion deſtroyed charitie men herts euils cōmeth diſcention religion cleane quenched reuerence olde catholike churche taken away finally great miſery ſufficientlye expreſſed man eloquence time paſt germany hath floriſhed relion kinde vertu nowe hath muche degenerated accompted cauſe author diſcommodities vniuerſall commune weale vnleſſe remedye found diſeaſe thinges go ruine aſmuche themperor hathe appoynted thys diſputation thentente bothe truth myght ſearched god glory auaunced muſt bring mynd neyther ambitious couetous godly moderat hauing regarde vnto chryſt armes ſtretched foorthe wold imbrace deſyreth ſame menne alſo wiſh high biſhop themperour moſt auguſt king ferdinando therfore beſecheth death chriſt loues woulde amende oure lordes coate rent torne euery ſyde remembryng name chriſt geuen holy baptiſme remembring alſo noble prouince germany natife countrey except reconſyled aſcribed vnto miſchiefe ſome euer ſhall arryſe hereafter theyr obſtioate mynde yf wyll handle ſo weyghty matter modeſtie ſobrietie ſame ſhalbe bothe god moſt acceptable themperour alſo accepte ſteade greate benefyte wyll afterward endeuour nexte aſſemblie thempire matter ſhalbe wholy accompliſſhed death uayuod tutours reſt noble ſent ambaſſadours turke commend childe vnto turke receiueth infant uayuode hym promiſeth defend ſendeth hym giftes fernando alſo knew therof ſēdeth hieroſme laſcie certen yeres paſt forſaken uaynode hagenaw conſtantinople fit man myght appeaſe turke whē came home thought beſt make warre quene beyng wydow tutours infante furniſhed knowen turke throweth hys ambaſſadoure pryſon moſte priuie farnando counſel alſo ſendeth ayde withſtanding laſcus committed priſed letted reaſon winter came ſomwhat late nexte daye granuellan hys oration beegan deuyſe notaryes ſcribes eyther ſyde choſen two whyche ſhoulde penne kepe althynges diligentelye proteſtantes aſſygned caſpar cruciger woolfangus muſculus diuines eyght daye yf december thomas campegius biſſhop feltre roomiſſhe legate oration preface wherof ſpeakyng many thynges concernyng peace whych ſo greately commended vnto v chryſt lamentyng alſo ſtate germany affyrmeth ſerten biſſhops rome eſpecially paule thyrde haue done put calamitie ſame cauſe late called counſell uicence certen monethes paſſed man came conſtreined differre tyll tyme themperoure whyche eldeſt obedient childe churche roome protectour alſo aduocate hathe appoynted conference certen preparatiue treatye ſhalbe regenſpurge whoſe wyll aſſent byſhops cōmaundement coomen thither intreat would applye theyr whole endeuours vnitie concorde ſertaynly biſhop rome herein ſauing holines preſidents aſſemblie toke order beginning man ſhould made priuie theire talke vnleſſe nomber appoynted actes therof ſhould bee publiſhed till themperoure wer firſt aduertiſed together moreouer required proteſtantes would compriſe exhibite wryting ſuch article wer fully reſolued ſticke vnto theſe matter maner othe nōber alſo diſputers geuing voyces longe altercation catholickes perceyued counſellours paulſgraue marque brādenburg electours alſo duke cleaue inclined towardes proteſtants fearing leſt ſhoulde ouer coōmen voice ſet pourpoſe differred matter day day tyll ſuch tyme worde themperour papiſts ſeke delayes herafter ſhall declare ſecond daye ianuary doe propounde new ſtraunge condicyons whole nomber ther ſhould choſē two diuines reaſon matter ſcribes ſhould wryte theyr argumentes delyuer preſydentes leſſe parte ſhoulde bee bounden followe opinion greater vnleſſe themperoure ſtates thempyre ſhoulde thynke expediente notaryes ſhoulde write talke reaſoners bare ſentences whether wer agreed vpon left controuerſie decree auſpurge ſuch lyke ſhoulde neuertheles force proteſtantes agayn require foraſmuche ther bee xxii bothe partes appoynted conferre euery man mighte ſpeake hys mynde bare ſentences alſo argumentes reaſons probation ſame committed wrytyng declare alſo vnreaſonable moſt holy cauſe al others follow opinion part rather preſcripte god worde compell man ſhoulde eyther thynke ſpeake againſt whileſt time thus prolonged proteſtantes oftētimes cōplain thereof deſire diſputation doctrine propounded auſpurge may accordinge decree hagenawe forthewith commenced eſpecially conſyderyng ſame frendly diſceptation captious thentent certen way vnto concorde might prepared diuines alſo many required ſame melancthon capito bucer oſiander brentius caluine aleſius scot ſent thither marque brandenburge diuers others vnto wer annexed symon grineus iohn sturmius laſt aboute ides ianuary catholickes chooſe iohn eekius thothers melancthon diſpute together diſputation betwixte eekius melancton firſt thentent might procede order reaſon originall ſynne courſe open conſiſtory beholde thirde day diſputation began themperours letter wer brought granuellan reſt ambaſſadours wherin differreth whole matter vntill aſſemble regenſpurge commaunding chiefly proteſtantes come thither granuellan repare vnto hym ſyede theſe letter beyng red conſiſtorie xviii daye ianuary granuellan exhorteth obey themperoure come vnto regenſpurge deſyrous peace yf ſelf occaſion talke hath ſpoken thyng roughly deſyreth take euell part promiſeth beare hys good wyll towards publyke weale whereunto proteſtantes ſay ryght ſory diſputation begō great whyle ſouner cānot procede therin aſmuch themperour doeth ſo commaund muſt obey wherfore wyll retourn home declare howe thinges ſtande doubte prince city gratifye thē perour herin notwithſtandyng caſe longe euer come ſende ar holden excuſed reaſon time ſhorte thys aſſemble alſo peter paul uerger biſhop iuſtinople worde frenche kyng ſent dede biſhop oratiō uergerivs roome ſuppoſed myght ſerue hys tourne better beynge another man name made oration vnitie peace churche ſettyng foorthe prynte gaue dyuers wherein goeth chiefly proue maye one thynke vpon counſell prouinciall ſame aſſembly dyd repreſente certen ſhew lyke thyng ſemed prepare waye byſhop coulde abyde nothynge worſe uergerius knewe hys mynde full well hym therefore ſuche others biſſhops miniſters thynge letted lengthe dyſſolued tractyng tyme fyndyng delayes ſeeke ſtartyng holles wayes eſcape begynnyng ianuary themperoure takyng hys iorney bruſſels came vnto mentz head citie lorayne thence spire goeth regenſpurge way ſent thoſe ſayd letter grāuellā traueled norinberge whiche citie ſene receyued moſte ſumptuous preparation eleuenth day februarye philyp schabotte admirall fraunce man great honour beyng brought ſuſpicion kynge acquitinge himſelfe admiral fraūce condemned warre sauoye beefore mentyoned longe mooche inquiſityon hys demeanoure condemned extortyon treaſon depriued al honour dignity moſt ample without hope reſtitution committed priſon uincen farre frō paris william poiet chaūcelor fraūce gaue ſentence mellon iudgement notable men iudges lawe fraunce albeit ſentences geuen ſort wont euer diſſolued altered yet kynges authoritie longe cleane releaſed ye ſhall heare afterwardes time alſo maurice ſon henry duke saxonie maried agnes daughter lantzgraue moneth marche diuers prince ſtates reſorted greate aſſemble regēſpurg regenſpurge themperor taried certen ſpace thither came alſo lantzgraue great company almoſt atthende marche nexte daye wente themperor garde receiued right gentlye duke saxonie ſent thither moſt honorable ambaſſador diuines among melanchton biſhoppe rome alſo came caſpar contarene right famous cardinall preſent prince elector brandenburg friderick otto henry paulſegraues william lewis duke bauier henry duke brunſwike charles duke sauoie george marque brandenburge philip duke pomerane moreouer biſhops mentz saliſburg breme bamberg spire auſpurge eiſtet conſtance luther boke agaiſt duke brunſwick hildeſſene brixie paſſaw aboute time came forth brought regenſpurge boke martin luther vehement written vulgare tounge againſt duke brunſwycke laſt boke mētioned duke inuectiues againſt duke saxon lantzgraue booke ſet forth late called duke saxō heretike rebel cain monſter eeſope hauing nether vertu qualitie body yet mind luther alſo ſelfe maketh god doth laughe contemne luther thinking ſame concerne eſtemation anſwereth ſharpely ſaieth ſclaunder aſmuch aduerſaryes take vpon title churche diuers ſundry argumentes brought proueth haue cleane forſaken trew church compariſon made ſheweth biſhoprike rome hathe altogether defyled corrupted trew doctryne chryſt antechriſt ſo manye yeares ſynce daniell apoſtles haue prophecyed obiecteth vnto flye lyght though ſpeake muche lawfull counſell yet dare abyde yf youre church holy ſayth afearde counſell nedeth reformation yf nedeth cal ye holy ye alſo redreſſe youre holynes neuer deſyred counſell refourme churche god hathe already ſanctified worde pourged romiſhe fylthynes reſtored trew doctrine howbeit life doeth anſwere profeſſion neither perfourme dede ſo muche bounden wiſhe alſo complaint prophetes apoſtles whileſt liued felicitie ſhal happen vnto v timr deliuered ſynfull body priſon ſhall obtaine like condition wt angel deſyre counſell thentēt church might openly proteſt deſyre counſell heard doctrine contrary doctrine chriſte might condemned men beyng called agayne mighte knowe folow trewe religion chriſt nowe ye obiecte vntd v rebelliō diſobedience falſe euen teſtimonie ſtates imperiall know prince obeidient themperour thinges beyng called aſſemblie go warfare haue bene euermore ready ye raile thus v becauſe obey thēperours decres condēne doctrin glad geue god thankes ſhewing obeidience way thing dew vnto god ought giuen themperor ſhould god client god hath giuen gouernement themperor god client ouer realmes nation alone gouerne church worde neyther doeth admit man ſocietie honor themperor hath ynough concernyng thadminiſtration common weale vnto office hath god appointed preſcribed theſe limites procede doeth inuade vſurpe vpon god iuriſdiction duke brunſwike written inuectiues amonges thinges luther reiſed vp tragedye religion motion duke friderik enuy albert arch biſhop mentz biſhoprike madenburge wherunto luther anſwerynge ſclaunder ſaieth commeth duke brunſwicke ſuggeſtion mentz diſſembleth know whan knoweth beſt ſhall declare cauſe original al buſines ſeuentēth yere grace aboue thouſande moued luth writ againſt papiſtes fyue hundreth iohn tecell dominicke frere caried pardon ſell germany tecel themperor maximiliā condemned die commaunded drowned riuer inſpruck interceſſion duke friderick whoſe chaunce time eſcaped daunger ſay amonges thinges taught howe ſo great authoritie yt biſhop rome yt although mā deflowred yt virgin mary gottē hir wt child power forgeue hī money moreouer onely forgeue ſynnes paſt alſo ſo euer man liſted commit herafter within came blaſphemie frere tecell forth boke armes title biſhop albert wherein pardoner wer cōmaunded moſt diligently ſetforth people vertu thoſe iudulgences wherfore knowen tecell hired ſaid biſhoppe make thoſe outrageous ſermons albert lately created archbiſhop mentz vpon condicion ſhoulde redeme palle rome owne coſtes moſt coſtly ſtole palle charge thre biſhoppes citie wer deceaſed within ſhort ſpace bertolde iames uriell ouer chargeable colledge beare ſo great burthen ſo often time palle ſtoode good xxx thouſande crownes euer came home dere coulde biſhoppe rome ſell ſory piece clothe money marchantes auſpurge diſburſed meane get money pardon wherfore pay albert deuiſed kinde gaine biſhop graunt yet ſo one halfe ſhold brought rome buildyng peter church time knew none gere therfore wrot biſhoppe mentz humble wyſe exhorting woulde inhibite thoſe crier anſwered one worde biſhoppe brandenburge beyng alſo moued admoniſhed ceaſe bring ſelfe danger propounded certen theames contrary thoſe tecels within fewe dayes caried ouer germany gredely red many men complained pardon eſpecially thoſe tecell taught becauſe neuer biſhoppe yet doctor durſt gaineſay tecel feared men biſhoppes thunderbolt name began ſpoken founde one length worlde reſiſt vaine glory verye pleaſaunte ſcarſely vnderſtode name indulgence mēt fyrſt originall cauſe motion whiche came duke friderick proceded biſhop mentz practiſe collector briber frere tecell wherfore anye thing nowe nippeth let thanke himſelfe therfore cauſe trouble gaue moſte holye father leo tenth time curſed excommunicated manye place triumphe ouer neyther anye man ſo vnlearned luther curſed pope practiſe ſtyle write againſt thought aſſuredly fyrſt biſhoppe would aſſoile condemne tecell canon lawe maketh whiche teacheth plainely iudulgences deliuer ſoules purgatory lo whileſt loke ioyfull ſentence rome ſtriken thonderbolt condemned moſt wicked mā aliue began defende doynges ſettinge forth many bokes ſame inſomuche matter brought laſte aſſemblie thempire thus wollen threde wherof palle made breede matter contention nowe ſame ſo faſt wollē halter ſtrangle pope wrought ſuche ſtrength biſhoppe rome daū ger ſtrangled withall ſeyng ſo let thē impute fault ſelues ſo impudently exceſſiuely handled matter maye well laughe ſleue dwelleth heauen hath ſtrikē would ſuffer ſo great wickednes raigne longer hath brought people yt darkenes egipte moſt cleare light pleaſant ſyght ſonne palle ſo often mentioned geuen onely archbiſhops ſyngular benefite fewe biſhoppes whiche numbre biſhop bamberge germany one made thys maner makynge palle ceremonie feaſt agnes uirgyn whiche xxi day ianuary time come agnus dei meſſe two white lambes laide vpon aultar afterwarde deliuered subdeacon peter churche put forth paſture whan ſhering time commeth clippe woll mingled woll whan ſponne fine threde made theſe palles paſt three finger brode hange downe ſhoulders midde breaſt reines backe like ſtoale eche ende thinne plat leade ſame breadth beyng thus wouen wrought caried body peter paule certen prayer beyng ſaid ouer left al night next day ſubdeacons receaue againe keps diligently vntil ſuch time ſome archbiſhoppe hathe nede one proctor ſue deliuered many ceremony haue cariage therof inioyned remaine aboue one night place ware whiche neither coſtely curiouſlye wrought archebiſhoppes redeme biſhoppe rome wonderfull ſome money lawefull weare ſame predeceſſor euery one bounden purchaſe newe ſelfe rome againe caſe become patriache metropolitan another churche throughe promutation meane althoughe bought one yet muſt neceſſitie bie another againe ſuche kinde pillage greate complaintes complaint pillage haue bene often made nation ſhewed fourth boke chiefly germany yeare lorde thouſande fyue hundreth xviii tyme leo tenth aſſemblie auſpurge cardinall caietan exhorted maximilian prince turkiſh war went ſtates ſhould pay money cleargye theyr partes tenthes anſwer made yt hope obteine theccleſiaſticall perſons ſo manye way newe policy pilled poled courte rome people anye thinge ſhoulde impoſed woulde make great exclamation haue ſo oft geuen theyr money thys theſe fyeres ſet duke brū ſwike purpoſe maruell conſumed whither money goeth gathered yearly germany tolde ſundry fyers kindled late saxonie whan diuerſe malefactours apprehended taken ſundry place examination teſtified howe hired money captaines officer henry duke brunſwike ſet affirmed laſt breth cauſe therefore matter lantzgraue thambaſſadours saxonie accuſe duke brunſwicke emperor regenſpurge exhibite writyng ſeuerall confeſſion euery one theſe make fyers ioinetly william brunſwik accuſe brother henry ſore kept many yeares pryſon whan moſt part commen together began ſit fyft day aprill thēperours name maner propounded trauaile paine alwayes takē treatie regenſpurge publike weale might well eſtabliſhed longe diſcourſe done aſwell appeaſynge controuerſye religion reformation churche alſo defence thempyre againſt cruell inuaſions turkes fine themperor demaunded chiefly proteſtauntes would geue leaue choſe certeine conferre herein truſt nothing ſhall concerne preſeruation countrey whan graunted xiij day aprill appointeth friderike paulſgraue thys choſen themp talke iulius pflugius iohn eckius iohn gropper philippe lanchton martin bucer iohn piſtor ſhould treate oppinions controuerſie make reporte bringe prince againe two twentie daye aprill calleth vnto gyueth great charge handling matter ſhould giue nothing affection pertialitie ſet apart ſhould onely haue reſpecte vnto god glory full modeſtly excuſe themſelues require al mete might appointed ſauing eckius ſaid raſhnes eckius well prepared fourniſhed themperor dyd inſtant take vpon content alſo intreate would aſſigne ſome preſidentes diſputation others bee witneſſes hearer matter ſo commaundeth fridericke palatine granuellan bee governours willeth theodorycke countie manderſchit eberhart ruden henry haſie fraunces burcarte iohn figius iames sturmins beare witnes theſe came together xxvii day april fridericke palſgraue admoniſheth collocutours ſhould ſeriouſly go matter conferre together frendly granuellan exhibiteth booke written boke preſented collocutours ſayd delyuered themperour certayne good well learned men fit reconcilement themperour woulde thentent might haue lawful argument matter treat ſhoulde reade ouer ſame booke alſo waye looke ſhoulde allow therein commende contēts boke reſt correcte booke contayned theſe article following creation man fall integritie nature freewill cauſe ſynne originall ſynne iuſtification man church token authoritie ſame notiſe woorde repentaunce fal authoritie churche diſcerning interpretyng ſcripture ſacramentes order bapteſme confirmyng lordes ſupper penaunce abſolution matrimony vnction bond charitie dignitie churche authoritie eſtabliſhe weale publicke image maſſe miniſtration ſacramentes diſcipline churche bothe miniſters people proteſtantes letter frēch king ſuche wer perſecuted goſpell moneth may proteſtantes wryting letter frō regenſpurg frenche kynge entreate ſuch ſame tyme fraunce profeſſion goſpell wer partly priſon partly exile partly hyd corner led miſerable lyfe becauſe many receyued fauour incaſe woulde abiure require woulde releaſe condicyon declarynge howe heynous matrer wounde conſcience cauſe thys perſecution ſentence geuen agaynſt merindolans prouince preſident bartholomew chaſſanie lawyer beyng terrible cruell beyonde meaſure put poore men wonderful feare withſtanding full execution therof differred tyll tyme perſecution thys yere balle playe compariſon whiche followed foure yeares ſhalbe recited hys place whyleſt theſe thynges done regenſpurge duke cleaue hauing themperour hys heuye duke cleaue goeth priuely fraunce lorde poſſeſſion gelderlande goeth priuely fraunce appoynting ſuch would haue hym day place wher going way ſhould mete hym tyme therfore arryued paris aboute thende aprill receiued kynges officer conducted throughe orleans ſixte daye maye came kyng amboſe towne turin riuer loire imbracing none otherwiſe father would owne ſonne ſent word immediatly kyng nauarre hys ſyſter ſhoulde repayre vnto hym expedition brynge theyr daughter wer ſame time gaſcoigne wer coommen kyng began entreate maryage albeit parentes greatly lyke yonge mayde alſo ſomewhat vnwyllyng ſomoch owne iudgement contempte hym whiſpering perſwaſyon ſertayne whych diſpyſed germanye rude barren compariſon delycacye pleaſauntenes fraunce yet vanquiſhed kynges authoritye whiche iudged ſame affinitie fit hys pourpoſe laſt gaue place wherfore ides iune maryage ſolemniſed kynge hymſelfe duke marieth daughter nauarre leadyng bryde hys nece churche cardinall turnon played preſt kynge gaue goodly dyner ther thambaſſadours roome englande portugall ueniſe saxonye themperours made excuſe fewe dayes duke retourned homewarde leauing yong ſpouſe fraunce mother woulde haue remayne tyll ſhe wer rype yeares man dukeof cleaue came fraunce kyng enlarged admirall ſpake ſent hym home hys owne houſe moneth may commaunded admirall reſtored hym come vnto hym receiued moſt gently reſtored hys former dignitie called wer hel light agayne ſtraung example ſeldome heard made ſentence geuen agaynſt hym princypal iudges hys realm cleane fruſtrate partlye hatred conſtable thoughte partly requeſte madame deſtamps whych allyed admirall new affinitie therfore memorancie counſtable loued thadmirall egall oute conſtable put courte kynges fauoure themperours paſſage ſayed beyng contempt gotte hym home led priuate lyfe ruled kynge wholye hymſelfe alone ✚ fourtenth boke sleidanes commentaryes concernyng ſtate relygion common weale duryng reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument fourtenth booke proceſſe communication treated order eſtablyſhed churche ſondry aduyſes aunſwers bee gathered eckius diſpray ſyng booke preſented accuſeth hys fellow collocutours themperoure hauing intellygence turkes commyng remitreth thys colloquie counſel fregoſe rincon thambaſſadours french kynge greate turke taken ſlayne wherupon baſtarde maximilyan areſted turke taketh poſſeſſion cytie buda thēperoure arryueth argiers plage germany great calamity auſtriche ſupplication prince auſtriche kynge ferdinando myght haue goſpell wherunto aunſwereth ouerthrowe hongary aſſemblye holden spire oliuier beeing french kynge made longe oration cardinall maron pope ambaſſadour offereth counſell trcent luther wryteth booke intitled ſermon soldiours comparyng papiſtry turkes alcorane warre beyng proclaymed betwene frenche kyng emperour marten van roſſem inuadeth brabante decrces made fraunce agaynſte lutheranes farell preacheth mentz aboute ende aprill diſputation colloquie lerned men regtnſpurg began ſhewed yon eckius vnpatient froward abhorred booke miſlyked hys fellowes lyttell fell agewe ſo coulde bee yet went fellowes conferred hym al thynges certen place boke exhibited throughe conference amended common aſſent ſome coulde agree churche authoritie therof ſacrament body bloud chryſt recytall ſynnes ſatiſfaction vnitie order theccleſiaſtical miniſters ſainctes maſſe vſe whole ſacramente ſingle lyfe booke deliuered vp themperoure corrected diuines proteſtantes written theyr mindes vpon theſe forſayd opinion leafte controuerſy laſt maye themperoure commendeth theyr good endeuour lyketh well incaſe matter herafter ſo require exhorteth thē ſhew like goodwill dilygence eyght day iune conſiſtorie prince ſtates maketh relation hathe ben done howe farre haue proceded howe collocutours haue handled matter dilygentely haue reconcyled dyuerſe weyghty article doctryne touching reſt yet agreed vpon diuines proteſtantes haue opened theyre myndes exibiteth vnto ether boothe wrytinges requiring ſo ſhortly may bee woulde conſulte thervpon vtter theyr mindes either moreouer would conſyder howe ſtate weale publike well ciuile eccleſiaſticall maye ought reformed hys parte leaue nothyng vndone herein doubtyng biſhops legate alſo inclyned ſame senate prince conſiſteth moſte parte biſſhops therefore nomber preuayled whyche worſe parte ouer cometh nomber voyces bothe reiected booke exibited themperoure alſo whole treaty collocutours reaſon therof cōpriſed writing ſomewhat extremely tyme electours certain prynces loued common wealth would aſſent therto another wryting framed delyuered themperoure ſecond day
