iuly wherin doo admonyſhe hym advocate defendour churche doe communicate whole matter byſſhops legate accordyng decree hagenaw eſpecially thoſe article collocutours haue agreed vpon bee wayghed dilligentlye whether bee anye thynge eyther ſence woordes agaynſt doctryne godly expoſytours alſo cuſtom church moreouer incaſe thyng darkely ſpoken may declared done hymſelf make reporte ſtates opinion mynde touching ſame wold hande proteſtantes woulde contented inſtructed reſydewe article controuerſie yf obtayned matter referred either generall counſell el prouinciall sinode germanye amonges ſtates wer ſertayne hyndred reformation relygion thought motion whole treaty referred biſſhops legate themperoure aunſwered ſame vii day iuly ſuppoſed collocutours wold haue vttered theyr myndes playnly eſpecially conſyderyng booke ſo long aſmoche ſtick herein wyll follow theyr counſell know legate mynd euery poynte thentent omit nothynge conſerneth hys dewtie proteſtantes alſo declare vnto themperour wryting theyr mynde open full doctryne reconſyled ſhew harde accord reſte lyke caſe ſaie kepe thē ſelues confeſſion auſpurge touching third requeſt emperour cōcerning ciuil gouernment meanes reſtore theccleſiaſticall function cōmen wealth ſay howe lawes yt made xi yere ſince auſpurge muſt put vre execution ſhew theccleſiaſtical function may reſtored goſpel taught ſincerely according aunciēt lawes miniſters church may choſen cōſent people biſhops doe retaine ſtyll hādes ciuile miniſtration aſmuch old cuſtome ſelues neither wil appoint others execute ſpiritual office finde reuenewes miniſters churche may frely permitted mary yt foule bying ſellyng whiche ſondry ſortes simon magus called simony may vtterly taken away goodes may ſo diſtributed simonſ muſt takē awaye law made long ſince preſcribe chyldrē brought vp invertue yougth learne firſt principle chriſtiā doctrine notable offēdours expulſed ye cōmuniō church til come amēdement magiſtrate duty herein aboliſhe al idolatrie theccleſiaſtical iudgemētes might cenſours maiſters maners apointed enquire diligētli behauiour miniſters people faultes vice themperour told doth cōmunicate whole matter biſhops legate nd requireth inſtantly ſtate cōmon wealth chiefly church myght refourmed pope legate wherunto legate anſwered muche proteſtātes certen opinion ſwarue cōmon conſent churche yet ſome hope fine wil come way againe diligent cōſideration whole cauſe thinketh mete determinatiō made touching matter whole treaty referred byſhop aſſuredly wyl either generall counſell ſome meane fitte tyme deuyſe thing controuerſie ſhal profit whole common wealth chiefly germanye afterwarde intent might ſeme deſirous refourmation calleth home hym al byſhops geueth leſſons ſhould demeane thē ſelues al thing gouerne family haue care flock cōmitted charge ſhould beware errours appoint learned preacher reſiſte beſtow benefice vpon mete perſones ought imploy churche goodes vſe poore ſpende thē riot ſuperfluous vſe howe ſhould ſe yougth brought vp good litterature knowledge diligence proteſtantes iu teaching child tongue thing proteſtantes exceadingly yt meanes allure yougth vnto infecte doctrine dutie biſhops warne parētes yt thei ſēde child ſuche place daunger hereſie diuers lyke thinges delyuered wryting byſſhops deſyred alſo themperoure xii day iuly reporteth ſtates aunſwere made cauſe appeareth nomore determined aſſē bly concernynge relygion turke maketh great preparation ſea lande inuade chriſtendome thinketh chieflly requiſite treaty brought ende decree bee made concernyng religion peace ayde againſt turke wherfore requireth know theyr mindes whether thinke expedient thoſe article doctrine collocutours haue accorded ſhalbe receyued till generall imperyall counſel thentent controuerſy religion whiche haue ſo many yeares bene tourmoyled may ſomewhat abated reſidue yet agreed vpon may hereafter eaſelye brought vniformitie wyll go ſtreight way byſhop may certenly knowe truſt ſhortly wyll retourne germany ſe common wealth prouided always theſe thinges nothing preiudiciall decree auſpurge whan diuines proteſtantes red two forſayd wrytinges diuines prote aunwer yt popeslegate contarene aunſwer one accorde ſhewe doth wrong ſay conſidering learning loked much better thing hande alſo exhorteth prince puniſhment crueltie reproue therfore exceadingly byd thinke wil euer allow ſuch errours thei nowe condemne time retourne vnto churche whiche defendeth ſo manifeſt vice whan contarene meane tyme heard aunſwere diuerſly taken thaduiſe certen ſendeth ſtates third wryting wil aſſent ye article newly accorded ſhalbe receiued vntil coūſell referreth al thinges general highe byſhop next day ides iuly prince electours make prince electours anſwer themperour anſwer themperours demaunde ſaye howe contented article agreed vpō ſhould receiued vntil time coū ſel ſame expediēt auoiding incōueniē ce hereafter wilbe alſo great helpe vnto agrement hope reſt myght tyme accorded deſire ſhew fauour herin ſhortnes time wil ſuffer yt thā according fre ꝓmeſſe wold deuiſe wt biſhop kinges might wt al expeditiō coūſell appointed ſome cōuenient place germany either general prouincial wold ſende legate thether ſame obteined haue truſte ſhall wold retourne againe germanye declare ſame fidelitie countrie hathe doone hitherto eſtabliſſhe peace quietnes proteſtantes deſyre themperour wolde commaund article religion al ready accorded enacted taught ſo ſhal truthe opened ſhalbe waye amende diſeaſes churche alſo wolde take awaye abrogate decree auſpurge vnprofitable concorde leſtwyſe leaue ſuſpence opinion concernyng counſel wil permit biſſhop cliētes iudges therof ſorte ought haue declared heretofore remayne ſame opiniō percaſe ſuch maner counſel wil ther aſſemblie ſtates germany cōmaundement ſame wil declare doctrine prince amonges biſſhops chief two bretherne duke bauier henry anſwer popiſh prince brunſwicke declare theyr aduiſe themperour ſeuerally ſo many vice ſectes hereſies diſſentions germani alſo place maner chriſtendō ouerflow could holpen counſell ſhoulde alteration religion ceremony thai ſo many yeares continewed could nowiſe geue theire aſſent eſpecially conſidering biſſhop legate doth promiſe counſel ſelfe moue herein preſently ſay determined ſticke old religion coū ſels doctrine forefather hath continewed apoſtles tyme vnto day alledgeing moch matter great pourpoſe thinke moſt expedient differ cauſe religion vnto counſell eſpecially biſſhops legate ſame opinion reſidew city whyche nomber proteſtantes collon mentz spier wormes tully hagenaw regenſpurg schwinfurth colmaria semund roteburg dyuers others whan excluded couſultation prince wolde geue copie aunſwere complayne herof themperoure ofte requeſtinge myght hindered theyr ryght many content article agreed vpon ſhoulde receyued whan themperoure hearde men opinion maketh new propoſitiō recytyng euery thyng order becauſe whole matter cannot determined moſt certenly ſtande great daunger turke time farre ſpente ſayeth referre matter couuſel wherof biſſhops legat hath put vndoubted hope himſelfe alſo hande biſſhop promiſeth alſo retourne ſhortly germany deſyreth proteſtantes wyll meane tyme attempt nothyng el beſydes thoſe thinges wherin diuines accorded warneth biſhpops deuyſe biſhops inioyned reforme church meanes wherby euery one thē maye reforme owne church intent ther way prepared cōmon redreſſe mind themperoure moſte parte al men commended thinke inete biſſhops legate ſhould geue alſo erneſt ſtreighte charge biſhops redreſſe pourge theyr church proteſtantes concernyng conciliation doctryne thynges promiſe according theyr dewtie require may lawful prince ther propounde church article nowe accorded haue hearde eckius preſumtuouſnes eckius abhorred bothe booke exhibited themperoure alſo collocutours wherefore conference whan booke agayne reſtored themperoure matter debated counſel prince lying ſick feuer ſendeth epiſtle prince effecte neuer lyked foolyſhe booke wherin fyndeth ſo many errours therfore ought admitted cuſtome olde father church layde ſyde ſtepes phraſis melanchthon well perceyued moreouer ſayeth ſawe booke whiche fellowes corrected reſtored themperoure laye ſycke wer red vnto hym certen opinion lutheranes moche leſſe allow wrytyng preſented themperoure boke neuer ſaw thing knowne iulius pfiugius iohn gropper whiche thought ſame concerned eſtimation deſyre preſidentes hearer conference witneſſes whole matter would defend theyr honeſtie againſte ſclaunders eckius informe themperoure matter publicke writing gaue vnto bothe goodly honorable report affirming haue donne herein becō meth honeſt men mentioned cauſe religyon referred generall prouinciall counſell germany contarene vnderſtoode xxvi day iuly wrote ſtates prince requiryng laſt might croſſed cancelled controuerſies religion ought determined ſuche maner counſelles ſame belonge vniuerſall churche ſomeuer determined ſuche caſes one nation none effect wherfore ſhall ſhew greate pleaſure biſſhop head churche counſelles yf dede omitte ſame vnto agayne woulde bee diſpleaſaunte caſe ſhould ſame would ſtyre vp great ſtryfe offence onlye germany alſo country doeth admoniſſhe bothe commaundement byſſhoppe alſo hys owne dewtye ſame day prince make hym aunſwere howe byſſhop maye auoyde offenſion caſe call counſell whyche hathe ſo longe promyſed yf ſtate germany bee ſuche muſte neceſſitie fynd ſome waye ſalue ſore therfore require earneſtly wold hys wyſdome gentlenes ſo cauſe byſhoppe remedie might founde moreouer diuines proteſtantes doe confute thoſe letter reaſons proteſtantes confute letter reaſons contarene longe wrytyng proue manifeſtly apperteyneth vnto prouinces eſtabliſhe god trewe ſeruice religion done themperour cauſeth decree made red xxviii iuly referreth conference learned men whole treatie vnto counſell synode germany ſtates imperial hys iorney italy promiſeth intreat diligently biſſhop roome counſell yf neyther generall prouinciall counſell obtayned wyll call convocation thempyre within xviii monethes quiet cauſe religion deuyſe bifſhop ſhall alſo ſende hys legate thither chargeth proteſtātes attempt new thing beſydes article alreadye accorded biſſhoppes ſhould clenſe church theyr faultes enormity decree certen article religious houſes ſhoulde defaced churche goodes ſhoulde bee put prophane vſes man ſhould allured contrary religion iuriſdiction iudges chamber whiche thinges whan proteſtants dyd miſlyke themperour certen priuate wryting declareth emperours priuat wrytiug proteſtantes ſeuerally opinion herin doctrine yet conciliated doth preſcribe vnto meaſure monkes houſes wold dede bee pulled downe yet mete bee reuoked godly reformation lyke bee thought churche reuenewes man iuriſdiction oughte intyſed theyr religion ſo bee mayneteyned yet ſhall bee lawefull receyue come vnto vncalled furthermore decree auſpurge concernynge relygion doubtfull cauſes ſame common quyet ſuſpendeth tyll cauſe determined eyther counſell aſſemblie commaundeth mā ſhalbe reiected chamber contrarye relygion lawe ſhalbe miniſtred vprightly vnto men tyme theſe thynges confyrmed vnder themperours ſeale promiſe hym ayde agaynſte turke whoſe commynge bruted daylye ambaſſadours hongary auſtryche commen thither greate intreaty required ayde ſodayn ayde almaignes ſent hongary cō duict friderick countie furſteinberg thys aſſemblie themperoure thirde day iuly al ſtates greuous complaynt wyllyam duke cleaue emperours complaynte duke cleaue poſſeſſion gelderland exhibiteth alſo booke vnto wherin declareth hys ryght tytle ſame ſayeth willed hym haue ben tooke contrary waye ſignifyinge couertly fraunce ſayd preſent ambaſſadours cleaue excuſed theyr prince proceded declare title themperour xiſeth vp departeth xxi day iuly prince ſtates go themperoure intreate prince make interceſſion duke cleaue duke cleaue requeſt hym wold receyue tuition thempire permit caſe may decided frēdly promiſe take paynes thynge caſe cannot make ende beſeche hym make clayme recouer right law wherunto themperoure maketh aunſwer iohn nauie foraſmoche aſſemblie called common welthes ſake thentent diſſention diſcorde taken waye germany myght reſtored quyetnes herin hath moch tyme ben conſumed yet nothyng concluded reaſon contention diuerſitie myndes vnto greate griefe hinderance hys owne affaire ſayeth marueleth greatly cauſe properly hys ſo wel agree thus ſendeth awaye withoute diſpleaſure next day raymunde frenche kinges ambaſſadour longe oration written reciteth oratiō frēch ambaſſador cauſe expulſing charles duke sanoye day accuſed kinge emperoure al ſtates durynge aſſemblie frenche kynge ſendeth ceſar fregoſe italyan gene anthony rincon spaniarde exiled ambaſſadours themperour turkes ſayling riuer po towards frēche ambaſſadors intercepted thimperiall ueniſe wer taken flayne abont kalendes iuly time william bellaye kynges lyeutenaunt piedmount beynge ſertifyed thynge maruelous circumſpecte induſtrious immediatly aduertiſeth kyng alſo fyfte day iuly wryteth turryn alphonſus daualus marque piſcare gouernoure millan lumbardie woulde ſee kynges ambaſſadours wer taken might reſtored knewe certentie hys menne apprehended el ſame cauſe ſhoulde trewes broken made thre yeares paſt thinterceſſion biſſhop rome required might reſtored eyther becauſe firſt knewe el diſſembling knewe hapned marque maketh ſtraunge though knew nothing matter pourge himſelfe ſendeth counte fraū ce ladron ambaſſadour kynge langeus certen epiſtle whych wrote marque eleuenth iuly would doubte ſayeth counſell whole worlde ſpeake diuine langens letter alphonſe matter aptely euer kinſman aunceſtre thomas aquyne yf experte diuinitie ſoom youre familiar perfit priuie murther alphonſus hys graundfather called indicus ſonne rodorick spaniard maryed great inheriter houſe aquinas alphonſus coſyn germane fernando dauall piſcare moſt worthye captayne xx day iuly king anſwereth alphonce letter liner towne burges admoniſſhing hym regarde hys honour eſtimation ſheweth hym vnles reſtored neglect iniury done hys men many wer letter ſent fro betwene bellaye marque matter nothyng el done whan daualus moche ſearche ſayd could fynd nothing herin perſeuered king moreouer ambaſſadour complayned themperour regenſpurge whan receyued ſuche aunſwer wolde declared manifeſtly enough warre wold inſue therof chaunced ſame time george auſtriche maximilian baſtarde ſon archebiſhop ualencene came spain george auſtriche apprehended lyon retourne flaunders lyon apprehended caſt priſon reueng rincon fregoſe aboute ſame tyme fraū ce ſon anthony duke lorayne maryeth chriſtine daughter chriſtierne kynge denmarke dowager millan frenche kynge tooke thys diſpleaſauntly ſo moche yere daughter lorayne maryed renat prince orenge whiche depended wholy themperoure whattyme themperour helde counſell regenſpurg king fernando beſegeth offen buda layeth battery wherein ferdinando beſegeth buda wydowe iohn uaynode yong ſonne stephen infantes tutours noble realme deſyred turkes ayde wherfore turke ſendeth thither liuetenant armie whyche came offen iuly longe commeth power ſo wer fernando men repulſed almaignes bohemers morauians leuing ſiege withoute greate ouerthrowe armie diſcomfited loſſe alſo peſtum towne ouer agaynſte offen reſidew wer glad ſaue themſelues runnyng away thend auguſt turke ſendeth preſentes infante stephen cloth golde goodly horſes letteth ſhew hys mother howe deſyrous ſee childe requyring ſende hym vnto hym hys tente woman ſore affrayd whan ſhe might otherwiſe doe thaduiſe counſel ſendeth hym hys norice accopanyed greate nomber nobilitie receyueth hym right gently ſendeth word quenes counſellours woulde haue buda deliuered vnto ſayeth able kepe agaynſte enemie ſhoulde driuen come oftē hither armie would painful charg able therfore ſhould better cuſtodi affraid owne daunger haue word ſay forthwith captain ianizarens appoynted enter towne neither could quene receiue ſome thing accompliſſhed whan poſſeſſiō towne vnarmed citezens require alſo haue ye caſtell deliuered vp handes wherin quene turke meſſagers ſent betwene comforteth permitteth ſon enioie trā ſiluania whan ſhe therfore ſodēly packed vp ſtuffe departed conducted captaines ſoldiors ye turkes thē perour turkes two ſonnes came offen ſecond daye septembre entring churche newly hallowed geuing thankes god lucky ſucceſſe retourneth agayne campe leauing garriſons offen peſte leadeth home reſt armie way deliuereth laſcus leaft priſoner belgrade went offen takyng fregoſe rincon frenche kyng ſore offended acte ambaſſadour poline ſignifyed whole matter vnto solyman ſeſſians dou regenſpurge themperour goth ſtreight italy end talketh biſhop rome luke whileſt armie toke ſhipping gathered almaignes italian spaniardes becauſe winter hand biſhop could put feare ſayling although heard ouerthrow geuen hō gary thend might vex turkes quarter fully reſolued go foreward wayinge ankers hoyſed ſayle emperours torney barbarie porte uenery keping courſe corſicke ilandes baleare xxiii day october arriued argier citie barbarie sea coaſte nombre footemen xxii thouſande hys horſemen littell aboue thouſande vantewarde spaniardes led farnando gonzago uiceroye sicilie battel germanes emperour reerewarde italian knyghtes rhodes camillus columnas ſame daye themperoure arriued nexte daye wether fayre sea calme thyrdde great tempeſt diſtroyed hys ſhips daye arroſe ſo greate tempeſte ſo contynuall rayne letted warlyke enterpriſes ſo muche emperoure loſynge verye manye shyppes hys munition hys fournyture beeſydes two three thouſande hys menne enforced departe without pourpos length retourned spayn moneth nouember sir henry kneuet ther ſame tyme ambaſſadour king henry eyght loſt syr henry kneuet eſcaped drowning verye narrowely owne ship ready ſynke lept receyued vppō oare ſhippe thomas kneuet kinſman hys recouered ſhyppe thus affaire sea lande well affrica europe doulfull ende yeare alſo noyſome germany reaſon contageous ſicknes eſpecially aboute rhine amonges others straſburge plage germani rhine died capito baſyll symon grineus men excellent learnyng thone great diuine thother philoſopher great fauourer scripture themperour departure germany tooke order fridericke palatine ſhoulde prince electours treate duke cleaue reſtoring vnto hym gelderlande ſende theyr ambaſſadours admoniſhe hym boothe hys owne priuate perill alſo publicke diſturbaunce ſayeth bothe ryght heyre tooke poſſeſſion lawfully alſo content matter tryed law beſeching wolde ſuffer hym ſuſteyne wronge perſwade themperours mynde vnto equitie whan themperour imbarked hym ſelfe italy leaſte granuellan ſollicite biſſhop counſel ſet order comon weale sene ſore tormoyled ſedition newes came fraunce december themperours loſſe argiers ther many merye harte ioye fraunce temperours loſſe many men ſtamped murther rincon fregoſe ſayde tyme comen reuenge king fernando euill lucke loſſe peſte offen calleth aſſēblie hys ſtates prage chief citie boheme laſte amonge thynges nobilitie auſtriche xiii day decē ber putteth vp ſupplicatiō kyng wherin firſt haue good nobilitie auſtrich put vp ſupplication goſpell fauoure offer haue maynteine hys proſperous eſtate dignitie lament vnfortunate ſtate comune weale theyr owne condition whiche haue ſo nere vnto turke moſt cruell enemie alſo late conquerour wherfore ſaye howe muſte looke remedy chiefly wrath god may appeaſed offended men ſynfullnes ſendeth great calamitie whole body common welth parte cleane ſounde al honeſte diſcipline caſt ſyde aſwell priuate common welſprynge enilles yet contempte god worde chiefe cauſe god doeth ſo ſcourg plage v ſeene ſaye proue • • othe ſacred prophane hiſtories god hathe often time greuouſly plaged great moſt floriſſhing kingdom theſe lighter ſinnes graffed v naturally idolatrie contempt hys word people iewes wer led awaye captiue kingdom diſtroyed • dolatry aſſiria babilon contemnyng prophetes newe religion worſſhipping themſelues deuyſed length vtterly diſtroyed hieruſalem quite ouerthrowne crucifying ſonne god moſt triumphante empire world time paſt babilon perſia grece ſubdewed turkes haue ſo cleane loſt theyr religion lawes comō welth theyr dignitie ſelfe ſame cauſes day maner tokē chriſtianitie remayning wher partly forſoke partlilothed god benefites fel horrible darknes moſt filthy bondage whether ſodē alteration turkes maintened warre ſixe hondreth yeres aboue beefore conquered grece whiche happened lengthe tyme beyng ſo ofte prouoked warned wolde neuer amend heaped vp ſinne vpon ſynne yf man ſhould compare thoſe kingdomes wer ſuch power dignitie wherein floriſſhed ſo many excellente wittes rude beaſtly common welth turkes ſhall fynde ſyns no floud neuer chaunced greater calamitie yf ſo ſtronge mightye nation able reſiſte ſo weake people turkes wer beginnyng god thus auengyng ſynnes people maye looke dede gyltye ſame fault ſo much worſe caſe matched anenemie ſtrong meaſure ſee god doeth plage v chiefly theſe party wyth warre famyne peſtilence moſt plage god ſēt auſtriche germany cruell enemie hathe taken late offen chiefe citie realme hathe brent ſpoyled land bohema miſerie haue ſuffered theſe ſixtene yeres howe moche blod hathe bene ſpilte many thouſand peopele led waye moſt miſerable captyuitie certenly turkes power ſo increaſed far exalted aboue kinges cauſe obteyneth oure handes maner contynuall victory perceyueth ſelf bee turke ſcurge god ſcourge god man able eſcape vengeaunce seing therfore ſynnes ſo great many haue truſte vnto howe ſhall defende ſelues agaynſte aſſuredly one remedy thinges handes god god geueth taketh awaye empire whiche woundeth god offereth word plageth healeth prouoketh v repētaunce offering v knowledg word thing dede doth euer plageth ſent ionas prophet niniuites forgaue thē repēted loked mercyfully vpon nabuchodonoſor kyng aſſirians followyng counſell daniel certenly moſte myghty kyng knowe none meane remedye god worde may purely taught people exhorted amendement life entent ful confidence may boldely withſtande turkiſhe violence herein conſiſteth oure ſaluation ſerue god ryghtly wherfore ſeing manye errours crept churche whiche tyme diſcloſed lately counſel empyre diverſe opiniōs wer agreed vpon certen tyme peace graunted religion byſhop commaunded refonrme church beſeche hyghnes geue commaundement goſpell preached chiefe article doctrine iuſtification ſincerely eſpecially article iuſtification whiche teacheth ſynnes forgeuen chriſt agayne men excited vnto loue charitable workes whiche true fruictes token fayth moreouer let made afrayd ſynne accuſtome ſelues geue god thākes mere mercy delyuered chriſt ſynne death hell made inheritours heauēly kingdome ſuch deſyre may receiue lordes ſupper maner primatiue church alſo byſhoppes cōmaunded according decree empyre newly made redreſſe amiſſe churche appoincte mete miniſters inſtructe people reiecte true preacher haue euer done heretofore let grace thinke make ſute vnto either ſeke libertie intende tyme diſobey cōfeſſe whole ſaluation conſiſteth chriſte knoweledge goſpell muſt adourned godly liuing acknowledge bounden dutie ſhewe vnto obedience farre forth goodes lyfe wyll extende ſeing ſo doe humbly beſeche ſuffer v enioye benefite laſt decree ſuche ſhall followe fourme religion v rehearſed indaungered therfore ſo ſhal haue faith full miniſters church whiche nowe many vacant boyde men ſhall hardines warre againſt moſte terrible ennemy vnto whome ingratitude wickednes god hath geuen ſo many victory conqueſtes hitherto noble ſtates auſtriche put vp ſupplication foure twēty men honour ten city wherof uienne one next neighbour stirians carnites ferdinando ferdinando deſfateth requeſt uobles hetherto aunſwered calamity mentioned ryght hartely ſory doubteth theſe plage ſent ſynnes people therfore hath oftener admoniſhed miniſters churche ſhould exhorte people amendement lyfe moreouer ſayeth howe neuer againſt god worde ſhould ryghtly taught according traditiō ſettyng forth apoſtles ſuch interpretours churche hath receiued allowed neuertheleſſe chargeth religion alter nothing tyll ſuche tyme matter fully determined generall prouinciall counſell germany el ſome conuocation empyre thynke decree regenſpurge concerned thynge wherof meaning catholickes ſhould remayne olde proteſtauntes ſame religion whiche followed tyme reconcilement tyll ſome one theſe counſelles appointed within eightene monethes ſeing ſo may permitte ſubiectes thyng contrary deſyre againe fewe wordes true religion chriſte maye auaunced noble reſterut •• te good preacher brought daunger otherwyſe let hym neuer loke haue victory lucky ſucceſſe turkes hande litle dyed byſſhop numburge whoſe ſteade strife biſſhop ricke nū burge college choſe iulius pffugius mentioned prince electonr saxon contended myght doe withoute conſente reiectyng flugins ſubſtituted roume nicolas amſtorfe noble houſe doctour diuinitie wittemberg whome luther ſtalled moneth ianuary ſet forthe 1542 booke ſame dutche wherin declareth howe flocke chriſte ought cōmitted pffugius ennemie pure doctrine pffugius thus repulſed complayneth ſtates empyre howe wrongfully put ryght prynce agayne aunſwereth howe gyfte belongeth properlye houſe saxon reciting many olde preſidentes great antiquitie alledgeth amonges cauſes wherfore ſuffer bee byſhop alſo one openlye againſte confeſſion auſpurge ouerthrowe hongary ſaid emperour calleth aſſemblie ſtates spiers brother ferdinando begynne moneth ianuary appointeth ioyneth aſſemble spire aſſiſtaunce hughe monforte iohn nauie prince preſente marque brandenburge electour fredericke palſgraue albert duke megelburge erneſt marque baden byſhoppes mentz wormes spier conſtance hildeſſem reſidue ſent ambaſſadours tyme aſſembled nynth daye february kynge ferdinando emperours abſence propoundeth maner cauſe aſſemblie whiche brief conſulte howe turke myght kept hungary ayde touchyng ſame aſſemblie regenſpurge whan iohn gropper ambaſſadour archebyſhop collon retourned home cōmended gropper cō mended bucer bucer exceadingly ſayde meteſt others take hande reformation religion bothe well learned louer peace pure lyfe byſhop therfore whiche knewe bucer well enough thought vſe helpe ſendeth hym february come hym bonna verey gentlye receyued namely gropper intreated hym goe hym collon ſo tyme lycenced biſhop departe come agayn whan ſhould ſent wyll declare hereafter moreouer time alſo beheaded catharine haward englād king maried mayde founde ſhe troden ſhowe wrye defloured gone irelande office beynge called home againe whan ſhe quene taken ſeruice beheaded alſo certein others partly concealement partly lyke offence deathe kynge king englād maried ſyxte wyfe marieth ſyxte wyfe catherine parre bene wyfe lorde latimer ſyſter marque northhamton aſſemblye spiers frenche kyng ſent ambaſſade chiefe wherof fraunces oliuer chauncelour alenſon preſence ſtates whan conſulted turkyſhe warre theioration frēche ambeſſrdour fourtene daye februarye made longe oration begynnyng whereof ſekynge wynne theyr fauour reciteth howe yeare kynge vnderſtandynge turke woulde inuade hongarye loue bare vnto germanye ſent ambaſſadours immediatly perſwade myght cōtrary emperours men toke italy yet certeinlye knowen whether theibe dead oraliue wherby truce broken alſo lawe armes certein encourage germaines warre againſt turke defence hō gary al chriſtientie alledgyng albeit great power perſwaſiōs warre againſt turke yet maye ryght well vanquyſhed example iohn hunniades matthie kyng hongary scanderbeg lorde epirus tamberlane emperour srythiās al whiche haue wonne honour haude alſo themſelues uienne fewe yeares paſt vſe diuerſe perſwaſions pricke thē forward contrary wyſe affirmeth thoſe whiche geue counſell doe well conſyder ſtate germany howe full diſſention daunger warre myght enſue myghtyer crueller ennemye whole worlde one better furnyſhed thynges belongynge warres neither warre finyſhed one battell two euer requyreth newe freſhe men continuall marneylous greate charge force power germany dede exceading great yet turkes ten tymes greater whiche paſſeth litle loſſe two thre hondreth thouſand men ſhould loſe one battell daunger ſhould whole countrey ſhould leuie grudge diſſention mindes therfore aduiſe attēpte warre againſt turke neyther ſeke recouer hath already gotten hongarye feare miſchief caſe ſhould tyme inuade germany ſhould ſtande vpon honour bende force againſt ſtoutely giue repulſe otherwyſe medle vntill ſuche time ſhalbe fully throughly accorded matter religiō like caſe partly already namely chiefeſt article iuſtificatiō faith workes certenly without perfit cōcorde ſtate thempire long endure eſpecially turke ſtil inuading romains became lordes al world ſo much power force armes certē craft policie policie romaine eſtabliſhing empire loke natiō thei purpoſed ſubdue vnto empire thei wold euer practiſe weaken ciuile diſcorde time wold maintein thone parte faction till laſt thei vanquiſhed thē meane people carthage aſia french men grekes ſupplāted thus alſo germains deluded tiberius time moued war italy britaine englande eſcaped yoke vnderſtode ſubtill fetch always cōmon perill powred ciuile hatred vpon ennemy ſame meanes length concord england romains thē ſelues ſubdewed philip alſo king ye macedoniās craft conquered grece ſetting together theares men athens corinthe theſſalie ottoman firſte emperour turkiſhe nation toke bythinia diſſentiō among chriſten prince laſt ſame occaſion turke inuaded europe cōquered thrace al grece morea yea turkes haue theſe thre hondreth yeres wonne ſtil diſcorde treaſon howe turkes acheued empyre time citie conſtantinople taken italy ful ſedition whileſt one ſorte wold called gwelphiās gibellines whiche name themperial popyſhe faction chaunced lately rhodes hongary occaſion nede recite thus indede turkes poore vile gwelphiās wibellines barbarous nation creping ye corner scithia haue increaſed diſſention atteyned ſo great empire whyleſt eyther light grekes opened thē gate europe yt faithles mē gene haue tranſported thē ſea heleſpōte prynces peloponeſus brother falling variaunce ſent one deſtroye whileſt epyrus ayde thē myſians conſpyred hongarians owne accorde dyd moue come therfore mainteine common lybertie muſt fall vnitie concorde may thynke whyleſt ſelues ſytte ſtyll doe neglecte beynge denyded ſectes faction foreyne nation wyll take car hande ſayeth kynges aduyſe counſell whiche deſyred accepte good parte hym loke amitie frendſhyp byſhop ſente thether legate iohn morone byſhop mutma beyng demaunded kyng ferdinando emperours deputy byſhop rome opinion pope ambaſſad mynde xxiij day marche ſpeaketh wyſe laſt yere whan emperour went africa paſſing italy cō ferred hyghe byſhop concerninge turkyſhe warre generall counſell ſythe matter weighty emperour made great haſte nothynge determined granuellan remayned italy whome caſe debated afterwarde declareth howe byſhoppes mynde euer hath bene warre vpon turkes wil ſende ayde fyue thouſande fotemen caſe emperour come fielde hym ſelfe halfe nombre lykewyſe cōtent ſhalbe counſell ſame ſhould holden germany neyther age beare wyll ought preſent alſo pope ſuſpecteth germany farre iourney alteration ayre wyll permitte therfore lyketh better mantua farrare bolognia la gras placence whiche ample city fyt ſuche purpoſe howe beit none theſe wyll pleaſe wyll refuſe kepe trent whiche towne nere vnto frontier germany woulde haue begonne whytſontyde ſhortenes tyme hath differred ides auguſte praying al diſpleaſure ſet aparte woulde wholy applie ſelues hereunto king ferdinando emperours deputy catholyque prynces geue hym thankes meter place maye germanye regenſpurge collon ſaye howe contente trente proteſtanntes doe neyther allowe byſſhoppes counſell place anye mention made thereof decree openly pronounce contrary whan frenche kynges ambaſſadours coulde preuayle ſtates inclyned turkyſhe warre ſawe emperours men lothed ſuſpected preſence ende aſſemblye departe halfe diſpleaſure trent alpes riuer atheſe towne farnādo hys dominion thre dayes iorney ſyde ueniſe two uerona chauncelour dutchie alenſon retourned home kyng begā ſtreight wayes prepare war albeit already effecte reſtored admiral vſed hym frendly yet leſt ſhould herafter preiudicial childrē cauſeth whole matter compriſed writing reſtoreth poſſeſſions dignitie fame proteſteth hee committed neyther treaſon yet extortion releaſeth geueth hym condemnation ſeuen hondrethe thouſande crownes commaunding theſe letter ſhould enrolled paris place remayne matter recorde twelfte daye march whan french kynge ſame tyme beſydes paris caſtell uincenne word came ye night ſodē tumult ſoden fear frēch courte though enemy themperours contrie ſhoulde make incurſion contrie uermandoeis picardie whereuppon prince chaunced time bee ſent thither al haſt duke uandome guiſe aumall niuerne diuerſe others great nomber gentleman whan came al huſhte neyther ſaw heard man many men ſayd thys brute reyſed people might perſwaded themperour ſought warre wherof kinge ſelf wold accōpted author whan already vtterly determined ſame ſhalbe declared herafter foraſmuch ſtate germany ſuch haue ſhewed great ayde decreed commaunded army agaynſte turke armie ſhould leuied ioyned power fernando might reſiſt turkiſhe force recouer loſt leading ordering wherof common aſſent alſo themperours pleaſure committed charge ioachim marque brandenburge prince electour continently departing spier prepareth ſelfe iorney war gathered polle money germany graunted magiſtrates might cauſe impoſe taxe agreed moreouer demaund ayd suiſes prince eſpecially king denmarke italian furthermore decreed mē ſhould obſerue peace reiſe tumult within limites thempire xi day april aſſemblie diſſolued maner ſame time saxonie ther grew greate contention betwixte elector ſaxon duke moris hatred betwene prince electour duke moris ſucceded henry father lately departed contention lymites certen towne maurice manifeſtly mayneteyne cauſe pflugius ſuite hys frēdes matter vtterly lyke brede ciuile warre eyther mē vp armure yt mediation ye lautzgraue appeaſed beginning diſpleaſure betwyxt whiche increaſed tyme wrought deadlye wounde germanye ſhalbe recited place certenly many men marueiled maurice would ſo earneſt bitter agaynſt brought hym vp whome father may thanke theyr good fortune certen coūſellers duke george thought haue ſet forwarde matter whiche neyther loued religion yet prince electour whan decree luther oretion field made men prepared thē ſelues warre luther ſet booke vulgare tongue exhortation warre whiche dedicated vnto philip lantgraue hathe declared cauſe wrote contrary argument yong day ye warre againſt turkes nothing elles reſiſte god whiche vſeth hym ſcourge afflicte v whiche ſentence leo tenth amonges thynges condempned byſhop rome ſo ofte mynded procure maſſe monie germany vſed euer collour gather turkiſhe warre ſhewed reaſons moued hym amonges others chriſten man ought reuenge reſiſte euil ſuffer thynges according ſaying chriſte leauinge thy rote agayne emperour excited vnto warre head chriſtendome protectour churche defendour faithe tytles falſe vayne glorious iniurious chriſte allone defende churche iniurie certen kynges prynces moſte bytter ennemies true doctrine therfore concludeth turke warred vpon reſiſted diuerſitie religion becauſe robbeth ſpoyleth maketh vniuſt warr pope •• pared yt turke bringeth moſt ſhameful example lyfe cōpariſon made proueth yt byſhop rome nothing better thā turke alcorane ſo hath byſhop decreetales quenched doctrine goſpell whiche doeth force ſame doth byſhop curſe thei worke reproche vnto matrimony abide puniſhment contempte god lawe ordeined holy matrimony time god geueth thē ouer filthy luſtes burne moſt deteſtable deſires worke moſt wickedly againſt order nature finally ſpeakig turkiſh power admoniſheth thē careleſſe warfare knowe thei haue moſte fierſe ennemy theſe diuerſe ſuche lyke thinges treateth firſt boke time ſtate thēpire requeſt thempe king ferdinādo decreed war cōpiled worke ſaid warlike exhortation ſermon thentēt ſuch miniſters churche followed warres myght haue ſome forme order howe teache exhorte firſt therfore ſayth men may vnderſtande thought turke scripture ſpeaketh two houge cruell tyrantes ſhall deſtroy chriſtendome two mighty tyrantes laſte daye iudgement one falſe doctrine whome prophecied daniel paule verely byſhop rome power force armes ſaye turke whome daniel ſeuenth chapter ſpeaketh pleaſant lyfe loked thoſe therfore wylbe chriſtians let plucke vp harte loke peace quietnes pleaſaūter life frō henceforth miſerable tyme prophecied come let v comforte ſelues comming chriſte finall deliueraunce whiche immediatly thoſe afflictiōs ſhal appeare let v knowe certentie al woodnes malice deuyll powred wholy vpon v turke neuer tyrante practyſe ſuche crueltie doeth expoundeth ſeuenth chapter daniel whiche foure beaſtes cōming sea declaring turkiſhe empire deſcribed ſame litle horne whiche ſprang vp betwene thoſe ten horne fourth beaſt albeit wonderfully increaſed yet ſhould power like romaine empyre prophet doeth deſcribe foure empyres turke ſhal ſuch force romaine ſhould ſucceade order laſt empyre rome therfore ſhall none may cōpared greatnes romayne aſmuche daniel attribute vnto three horne whiche ſhould plucke thoſe ten violence henceforth ſhall proceade muche thoſe three plucked long ſynce aſia grece egipt whiche beinge three greateſt prouinces empire turke poſſeſſeth whiche limites prophet hath included wherfore good hope henceforth ſhall poſſeſſe prouince empyre nowe ſo buſy hongary alſo readye inuade germany laſt acte tragedy may bee laſt act yt turke ſhall inuade thoſe country thynke euer ſhall haue quiet poſſeſſion hathe aſia grece egipt prophecie playne manifeſt treateth partes prouokyng chiefly repentaunce exhorteth ready wylling obeye magiſtrate commaunding vnto warre employe goodes herein alſo ſerue wt body priſoners alſo whiche couſolatiō pryſoners turkes eyther nowe turkes handes hereafter ſhal come ſame captiuitie comforteth many perſwaſions admoniſheth well ware fayned pretenſed religion turkes heareth ſaye howe many haue profeſſed chriſt doe owne accorde falle religion hath certen ſhewe vertue holines ſuffer bondage patiently ſerue maiſters faithfully though thei prophane wicked neyther runne away fordo ſelues vnpatientnes lothſomenes eſtate beare alwayes memory ſame peter paule wryte dutie bounde ſeruauntes tyme ſhal attempte warre againſt chriſtians haſarde lyues rather ſerue vnder thē murtherers make warre againſt ſainctes daniell ſayeth ſhead innocent bloude therefore muſte chiefly beware partaker ſo great miſchiefe wickednes unto oration annexeth maner praying againſt turkyſh fury ende diſcourſing vice reigneth tyme ſortes men ſheweth howe germany whiche ſo corrupted wholy infected longe continewe proſperitie fourme prayer preſcribeth oeuerlaſting father haue verely deſerued ſore afflicted prayer luther punnyſhe v thyne owne ſelfe lorde thy wrath diſpleaſure according thy great mercy muche better v falle thyne handes men ennemies thy merci vnſpeakeable infinite haue certenly offended tranſgreſſed thy commaundementes thou knoweſt heauenly father howe deuill byſhop turke haue rightnor cauſe punyſhe v haue treſpaſſed nothyng againſt thou vſeſt ſcourge whippe v haue mo way one al life time ſtyred vp againſt v ſaie haue quarell againſt v would rather ſhould euer example offende moſte greuouſly idolatry falſe doctrine lye diſceiptfull craftye iugglynge murther thefte extortion fornication adultery ſorcerie myght offende maieſtie thy name thing thei moſt wiſhe becauſe confeſſe honour god father thy ſonne ieſus chriſte lord holy ſpirite one euerliuing god ſame offence wickednes whiche ſo greuouſly hate perſecute v ſhould forſake fayth fal vnto lore thā ſhould loke diſpleaſure hāds uoucheſaufe therfore loke vpon v god father ſend remedy thyne aduerſaries whan doe tormente v tormente doctrine profeſſe thyne sathan abyde wylbe worſhipped thy place thy worde ſet aſyde goeth feede v lie turke alſo ſteade thy ſonne ieſu chriſt wold place mahomet nowe yf thys ſynne profeſſe thee father thy ſonne holy ghoſt trewe god certenly arte thou ſynner whiche ſo teacheſt v requyreſt dewty v whā cauſe perſecute v hate afflicte thee alſo awake therfore god take hande thy ſelfe aueuge thy ſacred holy name defyle deface neyther ſuffer thou iniurie hande punniſhe ſynnes vice ſeke quenche thy worde v doe thou ſhouldeſt reigne neyther ſhouldeſt haue people whiche might ſerue honour thee nowe touching ofſpringe encreaſe turkes becauſe many haue written nedeth note thing therof place originall turkes ſmal beginnyng haue maruelous encreaſe firſt emperour accompted othomanne aboute yere lord thouſand thre hōdreth ſuccedeth orchanes amurathes fyrſt tranſported armye ouer ſea helleſponte europe inuaded thrace baiazethes cyriſcelebes moſes mahoniethes amurathes mahomethes baiazethes selime solyman ſame tyme alphonſe marque piſcare mentioned ſendyng booke prince germany accuſeth markes piſcare accuſeth frēch king blameth frenche kinge whiche ſo troubleſome tyme comon welth goeth ſtyre vp ſtryfe thentente might hinder moſt noble enterpriſes themperoure al ſtates pretendeth lyght forged matter anthony rincon ce fregoſe ſhould intercepted vnto thing hath chauuced could long diligent ſearche fynd frēch kinge whan knew thereof declareth exceadinge great iuiurie done haue ambaſſadours ſo cruelly deſtroyed kinges purgation thinge hathe ofte complayned ſore biſſhop themperoure hath requyred might ſatiſfyſed herin vayne ſeing ſo vnworthie act without greate ſhame diſhonoure name neglecte ſecond maye addreſſing hys letter senate paris thende ſayeth god maye illumine heartes graunt v conſtancie fayth bring thoſe ere way ſaluation ſende v peace throughe recompence iniuries haue ſuſteyned vſurping right outrage donne oure meſſagers ambaſſadours diſpayre haue peace muſt nedes haue warre would graunt v victorye requeſt people go proſeſſion pray church ſome fyt preacher cauſe therof recyted cōgregation moreouer caſe ther thinketh rightly oure fayth religion neither promiſe amendement commaund ſuffer openlye offence longe ſendeth duke longuill prince cleaue leauing ther power ſomer ſeaſon conduicte martyn van roſſen looked occaſion doe ſome exploicte meane ſeaſon kalendes iune biſſhop appoynted connſell trente agaynſte fyrſt nouember time commaundeth repayre counſell called trente thither patriarch biſſhoppes abbottes ſuche lyke eyther right priuiledg haue intereſt preſēt counſels permitted ſpeake minde exhorteth alſo themperoure french kyng eyther wolde come ſelues ſend theyr proctours commaunde biſſhoppes biſſhops germany inuiteth aboue others theyr cauſe chiefly theyr requeſte payne trauaile taken moneth iuly frenche kinge moſte hatefull woordes proclaymeth warre againſt themperoure wryting frēche king proclaimeth warre publyſſhed geueth ſubiectes libertie ſpoyle diſtroy contries ſea lande meanes ſo euer might littel duke longeuill martyu roſſen made inuaſton brabant wonderful terrour men vnprouided commyng vpon ſodayne lyke haue taken andwerpe duke languile martin van roſſen invade brabant louayne wantyng thinges neceſſarie munition could make battery marching forewarde whiche way ſo euer wente diftroyed al fyer ſword extorted many thus making theyr waie force auguſt ioyne themſelues kinges ſonne charles duke orleans warred tyme land luke force foure hondreth horſemen ſent kynge denmarke beſydes danuillier uirton iuey taken alſo lucemburge chiefe citie kinge hym ſelfe maketh warre ſyde marchinge foreward perpiguſan beſeged ſtrong armie beſegeth parpignan towne ruſcinon mountaynes pyrene moreouer moueth warre piedmount conduicte william langey alſo border flaunders gouernment duke uandome aſſayled enemy fyue ſondry place wherby iudgement many ben better haue ſet vpon ſome one prouince whole power thende alſo declared attempted parpignan vayne alſo whan duke orleans retourned home imperialles recouered agayne except iuey occaſion began fortifie andwarpe eaſy bee wonne kinge pourpoſed haue warres ſente agayne poline turke entreate hym wolde ſende uanie fraunce longe poline came solyman differred thyng vntil next yere duryng warre king ſetteth forth proclamation againſt lutherians moreouer parlament paris chargeth printer vnder great penaltie ſhoulde neyther prynte ſell bookes condempned ſuſpected namely booke caluine whiche intituled inſtitution chriſtiane religion requeſt inquilitour terme hym ſeuenth daye iuly maketh decree preacher ſhall admonyſhe people doe duty churche know lutheriane one thinketh amiſſe religion preſent hym worke god moſte acceptable miniſters churche order preſcribed whiche ſhould followe inquirie cōmaunded inquyre promoter whether maner ſ • rche yt lutherin̄s knewe man would ſaye purgatory whan man dead eyther ſaued dampned mā iuſtified obſeruing god commaundementes god muſt called vpon sainctes yt worſhipping image idolatry yt ſainctes worke miracle ceremony churche profite nothing lawes churche doe bynde man knowledge goſpell neceſſarye men without exception fonde parte common people pray god latin prieſt cā forgeue ſinnes sacrament penauuce miniſter pronounce benefite god whiche forgeueth ſynnes church bynde man mortall ſynne lawfull eate fleſhe al tymes fourme inquiſition geuen priuately prieſtes openly ſet forth proclamation wherin cōmaunded preſented accuſed whiche doe neglecte rite lawes churche ſuche haue bookes contrary chriſtiā fayth eyther geue others reade purpoſely let fall wayes goe thei may founde thoſe aſſemble priuate houſes garden forge diuiſes againſt lawes chruche receyue ſuche kynde men houſes garden priuie ſuche thyng commaū ded preſente within ſyxe dayes doctours diuinitie choſen inquiſitour el ſtande accurſed stacioners alſo charged thyng eyther prynted wrytten point ſuſpected ſwarued frō cuſtome churche within ſyxe dayes ſhould bryng thē none excuſe taken ſame daye acte proclaymed generall proceſſion preſeruation realme genefeua religion ſaynt genefeua truſty goddes borne ſuche ſolemnitie haue declared nynth booke theſe dayes certen brent place moberte religion ſame tyme fraunces landr • e uicar crois paris taught people ſyncerely ſayde maſſe branke wyne whether nature purpoſe knowe againſt whome diuines conceaued great hatred thei noted certe thinges preaching propounde vnto hym theſe article ſacrifice maſſe inſtituted chriſte vayleable quicke dead muſt praye ſainctes maye mediatours aduocates v vnto chriſte howe ſubſtaunce bread wyne chaunged article sorbe niſtes conſecration preaſtes may conſecrate bread wyne whole ſupper lorde apperteineth monaſticall vowes muſt kept sacramentes confirmation vnction receiued holy ghoſt prayer faſting good workes ſoules delyuered purgatory lawes churche concerning faſtyng choyſe meates doe bynde conſcience one hygh prelate byſhop churche whome al bounde obeye lawe god many thinges muſt beleued neceſſitie receyued expreſſed ſcriptures byſhop rome pardon doe releaſe paynes purgatory prieſtes beyng neuer ſo ſynfull vicious doe conſecrate lordes body deadly ſynne muſt confeſſed prieſt receyue hym ſacramentall abſolution howe man hath free wyll wherby may doe good euyll ryſe ſynne repentaunce howe fayth charitie true penaunce obteyned remiſſion ſynnes churche counſell beyng lawfully aſſembled erre therfore muſt obeyed howe iudgement interpretation scripture apperteyneth churche thyng controuerſye theſe thynges would haue ſubſcribe confirme seale fewe dayes aunſwereth generally good godly ſo euer holy catholyque churche hathe taught theſe matter content aunſwere attempted greater thinges againſt afterwarde ſhall heare tyme alſo one two freers ſaint dominickes order preached goſpell metz whan prieſtes ſhewed two frier preache goſpell metz ſelues ſore offended diuerſe citezens made petition senate would forbidde thē promyſing al dewe obedience ther came alſo william farell taught firſt priuatly citie afterwardes certein caſtell without tyme emperours letter brought wherin commaunded williā farell ſhould alter nothyng religion punyſhe offendours people forbodē heare ſermons vnles preacher werlicenced byſhop senate ſommer infinite nombre graſſehoppers came flieng germany hither parte italy wonderfull graſhoppers germany italy bignes ſoeuer lyghted eate vp bothe graſſe corne concerning duke brunſwicke moſte bitter inuectyues againſt duke saxon lantgraue burnyng certen place saxony haue ſpoken oftener nowe vexed continuall inuaſions robbery goſlarie brunſwicke city empire inlincked proteſtantes would obeye decree emperour kynge ferdinando requeſt commaunded ceaſe violence duke saxon lantgraue name al confederate make warre againſt duke saxon lantgraue mouewar againſte duke brū ſwicke flieth ſhort ſpace brynge countrie ſubiection ſtrong caſtell wolſebutell ſtanding farre frō citie brunſwycke wherein put truſte wanne compoſition taried long hymſelfe whan began inuade fled eldeſt ſonne charles uictor duke bauier forſayde caſtell founde ſondrie letter wherby evident ſee thinge duke bauier byſhop mentz heldus diuerſe others went ſhalbe repeted place conuenient proteſtauntes wrytyng ſet forth declare large cauſes doinge ſhewe howe dyd begynne warre neceſſitie defended fellowes fourmer aſſemblie spier intreated kyng ferdinando emperours name would cōmaunde ſuffer goſlarians lyue reſt hym ferdinando followed myndes ſame tyme nede ayde agaynſte turke ſendyng ambaſſadours warned hym ſharpely ſurceaſe aunſwered contemptuouſly proudlye would leaue whereupon enſued deſenſion reherſed ſhewed kyng ferdinādo spier vnleſſe obeyed decree would ſuffer fellowes ſuſteyne wrong ides iuly aſſemblie empyre norynberg ſo decreed spier becauſe warre hōgary aſſembly noriberg kyng ferdinando preſent emperours deputy fridericke palſgraue biſhop auſpurge fridericke counte furſtemberge hugh monforte iohn nauie ferdinando propoundeth howe emperour toke good parte ſente army hongary purpoſed haue bene ſame warre ſelfe power therfore called aſſemblie ſtates spaine cōfutation fell great ſickenes ſo conſtrayned neceſſitie differ tyll tyme whan nowe fully reſolued matter haue ſent force italy burgundye brake foorthe thenterpriſes hys enemyes ſo much hath cauſe feare ſome perill • aly alſo flaunders artoys wherof notwithſtanding hath geuen none occaſion chieflye loueth comon tranquillitie knowe well enough thenemies haue euer ſins aſſemblie spier endeuoured leuie men suyſerlande germany begin warres thus emperour againſt mind impeached letted ſo neyther come hym ſelfe ſend force hathe nede owne defence neuertheleſſe fully mynded nexte yeare goe aboute retourne germany accompliſhe warre hys mynde ſo long intended haue sea alſo nauie well prepared furniſſhed turke beyng aſſayled double warre maie bende hys whole power agaynſte hongary moreouer whan cometh germany wil leaue nothyng vnattempted maye make godly tollerable reconcilemēt relygyon complayning almen obey decree laſt aſſemblie ſome ſent ſoldiours others ſente full nombre ſom ſent foorth without money wanted alſo munitiō furniture promyſed thinges becauſe captaynes made complaynte vewed himſelf ſawe ſo whole iorney letted herby detriment daunger empire commen vnto aſſemblie without loſſe hinderaunce require thē ſo nedefull time would faile cōmon wealth fernādo toke iorney uienna come aſſemblye norinberge beeing aduertiſed war brunſwick ſent meſſager exhorte thē ſurceaſe comen norinberge cōmō aduiſe ſent ambaſſadours ſōme whoſe oration ambaſſadors duke saxon lantzgraue ſhould try matter force armes eſpecially time caſe feared leſt ye turkiſh war ſhould behindered ciuil warreſtered vp germany unto duke lantzgraue made aunſwere xi auguſte oute theyr campe caſtell wulfebuttel recyting cauſes enterpriſed defence declare thyng might otherwiſe haue ben doon albeit dryuen neceſſitie take thys warre hande theyr greate charge yet haue neuertheleſſe ſent ayde turkiſhe warre fully moche wer boundē neyther wolde fayle alſo dooe lyke hereafter yf men wold doe ſame ther ſhould nede feare diſſolution armie lacke many men reported mouthes letter diuers ſeing ſo foraſmoche duke brunſwick coulde non meane quieted contemning emperours kyng ferdinando cōmaundement alſo decree empire deſire miſconſtre doyng ſeeke man warre neyther doe refuſe whan thinges appeaſed ſende al force aide hōgary much able make aſſemblie ended ſixe twenty daye auguſt penaltie ſet ſuche obeyed decree spier certein thinges warre requiſite enacted prynces ſauinge walter maſter pruſſia biſhops bamberge eiſtet trente themperours deputes named haue harde cardinall contarene hys ambaſſade greate thanke biſhoppes cardinalles contarene diſpleſure yt pope cardinalles charged vehemente enoughe reſyſtynge lutheranes almoſte brought common welth roome daunger many blamed hym ſore hys abſence cardinall fregoſe ſtode hys defence retournyng germany italy came luke biſſhop paule attended emperours comming goe barbarye going biſſhop roome ſhortly created legate hys death bononie laſt departed thys yere thend auguſt without ſuſpicion poiſon whan frende cardinall fregoſe alſo dead little knowe well ſay beleued ryghtly touching man iuſtification man excellently learned wrote boke magiſtrates comon welthe uenetians ſame moneth chaunceloure fraūce chaū celour fraunceput priſon williā poret king cōmaundement went thā perpignan taken night laye bed carried priſon time brute therof came paris al men reioiſed exceadingly thoſe foure yeres ben office offended ſortes men ſome lady kynges courte came miſfortune condēnation alſo admiral augmē ted hatred ſaid great maner aſſured hope bee made cardinall therfore two three monethes wold nedes take holy order thing notwithſtāding ſom mē ſaied foraſmuch hatred mani might better beare eſcape daunger life caſe heat ſhould tyme breake boyle ouer third mockeri fortune chaunced fraūce monethes together theſe three mentioned conſtable admirall chauncelour higheſt degre dignitye burned mutuall mallice declared theyr enſample diſceiptefullnes vncertentye ſlyppernes woordly thynges tyme otto henry palſegraue embraced doctryne goſpell ſame dyd heildeſſem tolde counſell byſhop ſent immediatly letter palſgraue receyueth goſpell bulles therof emperoure spayne wherunto ceſar aunſwereth fyue twenty daye auguſte fyrſt cō mendeth endeuour zeale towardes common wealth greueth hym frenche kyng ſhould compared vnto prodigall chylde hym ſelfe neuer ſwarued empe aunſwered popo dutie ſayeth ought derely imbraced hath refuſed paynes peryll coſte counſel myght whole common wealth beyng pacified myght ſette vpon turke handes contrary wyſe mynded euer waye wherfore fyndeth ſome lacke letter wonte make boaſte cardinalles hys becke wherfore doubteth whether thynge trewe countreſeared howe ſoeuer reſteth vpon good conſcience doinges openly knowen hym ſelfe hath bene ouergentle hym fauoured hym great deale muche labour hath taken theſe many yeares vayne hath ofte bene warned dutye ſondrye great iniuries haue bene remitted league hym haue often tymes bene remoued theſe thynges waxed worſe vtterly doeth abuſe lenitie patience brake league gaue occaſion warre hathe declared rome hathe happened ſince wyll vtter alſo frendly deſirous peace hath bene hereby may eaſely appeare truce taken nice came talke aegnes mortes cōmitted ſelf vnto yeare followyng paſſed fraunce great admiration without reprehenſion many ſeing hath oftener broken fayth fickell vnconſtant counſelles ſure great daunger hazarde perſone vpō fidelitie promeſſe moreouer knoweth certeintie thei deliberated deteine ſame time many ſay rebellion gaunt muſt nedes paſſe waie nocauſe rebellion ſtired vp fewe baſeſt ſorte men al coūtrey remayned allegeaunce fidelitie quene ſiſter could haue remedied thoſe matter beit prefixed retourne germany italy moued intreaty chaunge purpoſe went fraūce thing able proue letter letter ſōnes noble requeſted thing ſo erneſtly yt rekened ſhould diſhonoured caſe toke way fraunce tyme wt hym fraunce affirmed many time yt wold obſerue truce made began complayne millan redred vnto according promeſſe withſtandinge vnto ye ſame promeſſe added thys condicyon ſhould reſtore hys vncle duke sauoie doe ſerten thinges yet ſyns tyme hathe practiſed agaynſte hym ſondry place germanie italy turke iohn uaiuod wyfe widdow certen noble men hongatye whoſe meanes turke citie offen yet meane ſeaſon coulde full well cloake hys mallice promiſe hym greate frendſhyp ſubtill fetche polycie myght tracte tyme ſet vppon hym vnware tooke firſt occaſyon tyme hys miniſters fregoſe rincon intercepted thing enterpriſes fregoſe rincon wolde dede haue ſatiſfyed hym hymſelfe tell whiche choſen vmpere arbitrement betwene therfore dyd pretende bee cauſe newe trouble diſturbaunce weale publicke whan prefyxed long fregoſe rincon attempted hys commaundemente italye turkie ſeruyce oftetymes donne hym knowen well enoughe wente aboute throughe treaſon haue broughte chriſten common welth great daunger therfore coulde inioye benefyte peace nicene whyche ſelues infrynged publycke peace agayne wente ſtealthe priuelye throughe lumbardie companye oute lawes whyche deathe cuſtome countrye blameth ſore marque piſcare offered abide iudgment whye ſhoulde refuſe alſo forſake ſatyſfactions vnknowne certenly thinking ſatiſfyed paſſed ouer barbarie ſendynge hys ambaſſadoure commended vnto hym publycke peace queyet albeit hee made fayre promiſes yet attempte diuerſe thinges agaynſte hym germany denmarke place intēded alſo inuade nauarre agayne aſſemblie spier coulde nurryſhe ſtryfe religion whileſt promyſed ſeuerally eyther partye hys amytie fauour indeuoured moreouer diſwade ſtates empire turkiſſhe warre ſollycited turke ſent power italye mooued warre agaynſte hym brabant martyn roſſenn lande luke duke orleans beefore ſame proclaymed reſte hys force hee bent wholy agaynſt frontier spaine thys fruict gathereth hys dylygence whyche hath geuē hym ſo moch wil exhorted ſo oft vnto peace furthermore hath ſuffered deteine arche biſſhop ualencene priſoner certen noble men spayne outrageouſly iniuried frēche men auignion hath dede bene ouermuche ſufferaunce nowe therfore compelled neceſſitie make reſiſtaunce tyme lefte feare hym reaſon moſte large ample promyſes alſo tyme prepared hym ſelfe turkyſhe warre therfore reſolued retourne germanye iniurie ſure great dammage ſmalle hathe done vpon frontier yet moued ſo muche theſe thynges calamitie common wealth concernyng owne affayres muche doeth ſo ofte breake conuenauntes muche better hym haue open warre truſte truce condicions whiche fyrſt light occaſion wyl abholyſhe make fruſtrate peace oftentimes diſceiptful peace diſceiptful meane ſeaſon doeth practyſe newe deuyſes hurtfull common wealthe mayteyne faction wholy occupied wery hym ſelfe loſſe charge maye dryue hym reſiſte turke beyng diſpoſition hym ſelf bryngeth vp chyldren ſame diſciplyne nowe ambition vnmeaſurable couetouſnes ſo increaſed frēche king accuſed ambition hydde aunceſtours dyd vſurpe frenche prouince whyche dominion empyre nowe doeth poſſeſſe sauoye parte piedmont ſo fortifieth ſame verye apparente entendeth reſtore pourpoſe inuade lumbardy alſo parma placence luke seine alſo dominion church rome entent myght thus haue waye open naples sicilie doubt entente maye eaſely perceyued ſuche thynges attempteth practiſeth italye brief couetous deſyre conteyned within certeyn limites great infinite neyther thought euer wyll obſerue conuenauntes ſo longe thyng remayneth may take way frō others conuert owne vſe diſeaſe vice mind caried raging tempeſte forgettyng vertue religion hathe lyncked hym ſelfe league turke doeth participate onlye counſelles alſo goodes fortune ennemye common wealth nowe alſo maketh boaſte full ſtoutelye barbaroſſa ſhall come sea nauie whether theſe thynges doe make reformation common wealth begynning counſell ought wyſdome cōſyder ſtudy hath bene euer ſhoulde bee counſell iudged bee moſte profitable ſo owne priuate commoditie therfore thing wayed cōſidered deuiſe way reconcile appeaſe controuerſie religion germanye herein reſpecte vnto god glorye dignitie churche therfore let imputed kynge counſell hath euer impeched ſame hym whiche hathe taken behalfe ſo much trauayle payne wherfore holynes nowe diſpoſed helpe common wealth thus afflicted ought dutie profeſſe ſelfe ennemie authour trouble calamitie moueth allureth turke inuade chriſten cōmon wealth leaueth waye vnaſſayed accomplyſhe ambition mynde moſte deſyrous reuenge ſythe chief care chriſtianitie apperteyneth vnto hym reaſon office paſtorall thynge ſelfe doeth ſurely requyre ſhould longer ſuffer hym cauſe vexation trouble declare hym ſelfe vtter ennemye whiche thyng would doe accordyngly ſhould moſte accepted al good men alſo profitable reteyne kynges dutie haue counſell recouer peace eſtablyſhe common wealth remedy wherin wyll doe owne dutie vnfaynedly wyll bee behynde parte ✚ fiftene booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument fyftene booke pope could accorde emperour kyng warre waxed hote betwyxt englande scotlande frenche kyng appeaſeth rebellion rochelle aſſemblie norinberge granuellane demaūded emperour ayde againſt frēch kyng certen anſwere obiecteth emperour many thinges fraunces landry examined bucer ſent collon make reformatiō pope would buye millan incenſeth clergie collon agaynſt archebyſhop launderſey taken dure ſacked aſſemblie holden spyers greuouſe complayntes made againſte frenche kyng ſo muche herauld ſent backe threatninges proteſtantes accuſed duke brunſwycke recite acte doyng young damſell duke sauoye accuſeth kyng frenche ambaſſadours ſet forth oration whiche ſhould haue made caſe bene admitted ſpeake counſell aſſemblie accorde made betwyxt kyng romains duke saxon prynces graunt ayde againſt frenche kyng emperour beſiegeth ſaynt deſier kyng englande great force taketh boloigne emperour concludeth peace frenche kynge contrary men expectation whan warre waxed hote euerye ſyde cardinalles ſent mak peace byſhop xxvi daye auguſte ſent ambaſſadours two cardinalles treate peace michaell uiſenſe portugall emperour iames sadolete king fraūce praying remitte priuate miuries commō wealthes ſake frame ſelues vnto peace ſendeth alſo three cardinalles legate synode trente paris poole morone emperour anſwereth legate preſydentes counſell trente uiſenſe alſo wryteth byſhop almoſte ſame effecte dyd former letter vayne make peace hym wyll kepe conuenauntes therfore aduertyſeth hym agayne would profeſſe hym ſelfe ennemye hath often ſayd would auenged ſhould breake tcuce make league turke nowe ſureſt fitteſt meane eſtablyſh cōmon wealth theſe letter ſent away ambaſſadour eyghtene daye october aſmuche duke longeuille martyn roſſen leuied armye dominion duke cleaue emperialles conduiet prince orenge inuade gulicke diſtroye countrie fyre farre wyde take compoſition dure chiefeſt towne thoſe party gulicke dure taken mounten came duke cleaue mother time alſo emperiall armie hongary exploite done attempted vayne wynne towne peſta retourneth home infection dyed many thouſandes duke maurice saxonye ſerued thys warre voluntarily yonge prince aboute xxi yeares age certen daye ryding campe one mā meting chaunce certē turkes foughte hauing horſe ſlayne vnder ſmitten ground ſernaunt gentel man borne lay downe vpon hys lorde body couered duke defended bare ſtripes ſo longe vntill certen horſemen came reſcewed prince ſo ſaued hys lyfe man hauing receiued many woundes caried camp dyed ſhortly thus ended warre hongarye biſſhop ſente ayde thre thouſand footemen whiche wer led alexander uitellius thys tyme alſo began hote warre betwene england scotland occaſion wherof miniſtred yere scottiſh warre betwixte england scotlande king promiſed mete hys vncle king englande yorke make accorde touching theyr limites diſwaded hys mother certē noble came fortuned scottes yere beginning december great ouerthrowe place called solymoſſe whiche battell taken moſt part lordes scotelande loſſe scotes taken solymoſſe kynge toke ſuche thought retournyng home dyed within fewe dayes day ides december eight day quene brought forth daughter mary whiche thinge alſo greatly augmente ſorrowe theyr king dieth wanted heyremale yere loſte two ſonnes ſondri place within ſpace foure twenty houres wyfe marye daughter duke guyſe houſe lorayne scottes werre thys calamitie frenche kynge ſent monye munition kynge dead gouernement committed iames hamelton erle arrayne whiche kinges greate coſyn next place vnto hym cardiuall andrewes moſt addickte kynge fraunce ſhewed henry prince saxonie ſelfe ſonne maurice entred league proteſtantes death duke maurice moued herein ſayed hys father coulde bynde hym neyther wolde tyed bondes father whē henry duke brunſwicke expulſed ſayd accuſed duke saxon lantzgraue theyr conſortes imperial chamber afterwarde duke sarō lantzgraue refuſe iudgmēt chaumber cited moneth december refuſe theyr iudgemente thinges ſendinge ambaſſadours thither declare vnto alſo proteſt doe refuſe lawfull ordynarye iuriſdiction take exception iudges themſelues contrary relygion prayſe decree made auſpurge twelue yeres paſt haue confirmed ſame othe ſame cauſe diſſent exceadingly beare thē greate mallice whiche take heretikes thinke vnworthy haue iuſtice miniſtred ſōdry preiudices haue oft tymes vttered bewreyed theyr hatred conuentiō regenſpurg decreed chamber would yeare moneth ianuary refourmed proteſtantes allow ſo men alſo theyr rellgion might admitted nombre thing themperour graunted king fernando renewed aſſemblie spier appoynted moneth iune ſame reformation meane obteined ayde turkiſhe warre yf ben otherwyſe tolde tyme plainely wolde beare charge frō henceforth touching iudges chamber alſo wold refuſe hereafter obey theyr decree therefore nothinge donne hitherto ſayde ſending ambaſſadours doe refuſe theire iudgment agayne iudges wrytyng ſet forth dooe reiect ſame refuſall agreed theyr laſt metinge norrinberge aſſemble agayne turkiſh warre xiiii daye nouember matter differred duke cleauerecouereth dure moſt ſharpe time winter duke cleaue beſegeth recouereth dure tyme frenche kynge beſeged perpignan arroſe rebellion rochel hauē towenin pantois verey famous ſituated place right commodious one poſſeſſed englyſh men rendred frenche tyme charles rebellion rochelle firſt ſonne heire father iohn cauſe commotyon gariſon placed king vnder gouernemēt iarnacke admirall kinſinā place alſo aboutes vp tribute saltepittes droue awaye reproche kinges officer treaſurers came thither ſoone kinge vnderſtode ſente thither new garriſon horſemen footemen iarnake alſo taketh theyre munition armure kepte gate watche warde laſte day december followyng kyng hym ſelfe came thyther 1543 next daye ſettyng place iudgement whan townes men theyr neyghbours aboute laye proſtrate hym beſought hym mercy albeit ſayeth tyme thildren occupied moſte weightie affayres defence kynges oratiō thē rochell oure whole realme al forgetting dewtie owe vnto v haue made rebellion vprore ſuche wyſe haue iuſte cauſe punniſhe eſtate oure perſon enormitie offence myght dryue fyne yet accompt leſſe honorable prayſe worthye prince clemēcy king fraū ce extend mercy people honeſt hys ſubiectes remain duty againe becauſe ſet ſubmiſſion wyllyng myndes rigour lawe doe intende forget iniurie haue done vnto v haue conſideration ſo much errour treſpaſſe accuſtomed gentlenes vpon trnſte confidence wyl committe ſuche lyke facte hereafter el ſteade gentle mercifull prince ſhall haue ſeuere executour iuſtice owne faulte whiche doubtles ought accoūpted leſſe theſe laſte yeares paſt gantois handled extremely whan executed puniſhed alſo loſt liberty euer whiche example dede though myght followe without reprehenſion becauſe haue neyther ſuſteyned leſſe iniurie neyther inferiour vnto hym thynge whiche hath thus reuenged griefe yet much loke encreaſe rather loue fidelitie beneuolence ſubiectes thā enriched goodes ſubſtaūce clerely forgeue act reſtore former eſtate notwithſtanding ſuche thinges haue frely lyberally geuen v doe accepte reteyne ſo euer alſo hath bene taken tumulte wyll reſtored agayne whan oration kyng enſued reioyſing confuſed noyſe audience heard moſte ſwete pleſaunt melodie ſteple head churche ſaynct bartholomewe teſtifying publique ioye gladnes senate made kyng moſte coſtly ſupper next daye kyng beyng ready departe ſayde chief people goe nowe parte realme defende ſame ennemy defende truſte aſſuredly wyll doe moreouer thyng apperteineth bettering cōmoditie citie wyll denye requeſte ſeuentene day ianuary kyng ferdinando two ſonnes came nurrenberge aſſemblie nurrenberge aſſemblie eyght daye came thether alſo granuellan spayne comming trente ſonne byſhop arras exhorted byſhoppes legate conuention emperour ſubſtituted deputy fridericke palatine biſhop auſpurge iohn nauie ſeconde kalend february king fernando maketh hys propoſition foraſmuch certen aſſemblies continual ayde agaynſt turk hath decreed admoniſſheth requireth wyll condeſcend vpon nowe nothing nedefull wantyng reported men wyll retourne thys yere hongarye exceadynge greate power prouoked ſo doe certen chriſtian prince albeit country ſore impoueriſhed almoſte continuall warres yet faile part great matter defend hongary auſtrich morauia country adioining ſame man maner knoweth better perſwaſion red diuerſe letter ſente vnto king fernando others ſondry place maner pourported thys turke prepared new armie nauie warre bothe ſea land wer alſo ambaſſadours quene marie gouerned lowe coū trye themperour wiricke criechinge uiglie zwichem lawyer longe oration accuſed ſore duke cleaue hys ayde counſell french kyng conduict treatye norinberge martyn roſſenn made warre thoſe party wherfore requeſted reduce frame dewtie myght leaue poſſeſſion gelderland recompence dommage fifte daye februarie granuellan ſhewed commiſſion good themperour towardes publicke weale ſayd nede recite reioyſed lyttle laſt yere whan ſhe wed hym made oute theyr power together ioyntely agaynſt turke wolde dede haue ben therepreſent hym ſelfe prepared thynges ſame iorney french king duke cleaue moue war agaynſt hym vnloked thing certēly diſapoynted former pourpos force intended haue ſent agaynſt perpetuall enemie chriſtianitie conſtrayned reteyne aboute owne defence eſpecially ſeynge enemyes bragged alſo verey moche turkiſſhe nauie wherin ſayd came great ſoccour thys notwithſtandyng perſeuereth ſtyll ſame mynd hath euer ben alſo declared determined ſpende hys treaſure alſo hys lyfe bloude turkiſſhe warre ſo agayne ayde hym agaynſt french king duke cleaue wherunto zeale towardes common welth alſo ſtate dangerous tyme onght perſwade thē french king hath expulſed vncle duke sauoie oute inheritaunce vnknowen ſame intendeth doe alſo vnto others astune occaſyon ſerue becauſe themperoure dooeth let violent enterpriſes therfore doeth beare hym thys hatred mallice heard ryght nowe letter wer redde worketh turke practiſeth germany ſeketh hynder turkiſſhe warre foraſmuch duke cleaue ioyned league hym alſo diſtourbeth themperours moſte worthye exploictes let ſaufgarde germany requiſite ayde decried agaynſte bothe theyr inſolente raſſhenes may repreſſed meane tyme ſupplication proteſtantes proteſtantes deliuer ſupplycation king fernando themperours deputy wherin make longe reherſal hath ben religion theſe many yeres peace geuen norinberge iudges chamber haue infringed howe themperour made prouiſo two yeres paſt regenſpurg declared playnely hys mynde howe decree made reformation chamber vpryght miniſtration iuſtice alſo proteſt openly vnleſſe decree obſerued ſeing nothing redreſſed hitherto iudges chamber ſtil moleſt theyr wonted maner firſt theyr defence agaynſte duke brunſwicke ſecondly paying ſtipendes chamber therfore haue refuſed whole iuriſdiction thing dede proteſted longe open aſſemblie wolde doe therfore yf matter otherwiſe reported vnto deſyre geue credit conſtrayned neceſſitie thus doe vſed lawefull remedy whych law equitie ſelfe doeth permitte ſhould wyſe procede vſurpe authoritie iudgement pronounce publycations penalty ſame wolde alſo publicke weale hurtfull time throughe mallice hatred kindled amonges ſtates theire whole treaſure ſhalbe conſumed ciuile warre fyt profitable ſame wilbe turkes man knoweth wel enough howe harde thing althynges exaſperated quyet matter maye dyuers example ſhewed turk increaſe loſſe chriſtians verely doe wiſhe nothyng fyrme peace vpright iuſtice publicke quiet might ſtabliſhed germany certenly diſſention religion arriſeth al grudg diffidence diſſention ſpringeth ſame wel doctryne goſpel god trewe relygyon prohibited errours open crime taken awaye mended alſo ambition lucre ſake defended maynteyned therfore god beyng offended prouoked wrath thys vnthankfulnes doeth plage v greate calamity ceaſe hys hand ſo longe perſeuer ſame praye therfore wolde applye theyr ſtudye hereunto leſtewyſe ſo trauell matter relygion ſake bee trouble moued iuſtice maye bee miniſtred men indifferentlye ſomoche ſtate chamber thys preſent requyre accordyng olde lawes empire themprours declaratiō iudgemente may reformed iudges appoynted action remayne ſame ſtate refuſall made iudges bee charged obſerue exactely fourme reformation ſhalbe attempt nothynge agaynſt peace makinges former yeres vnleſſe thyng maye thus bee ordered may haue ſufficiente warraunte haue peace cannot conſulte turkiſhe warre althoughe deſyre doe anye thynge maye common welth matter beyng longe mothe debated whan bothe kynge fernando themperours attourneis ſayed howe counſell alreadye appoynted ar trente themperoure alſo would come thyther iudges chamber coulde remoued without theyr cauſe hearde redreſſe already decreed ſhortely ſhall take effecte howe coulde denye duke brunſwicke expulſed makyng claime hys owne haue lawe neyther aucthorytye make graunte proteſtauntes ſhew agayne neyther allowe counſell neyther wyll come neyther ſatiſfyed thynges ſufficiently aſſured neyther take delyberation notwithſtandinge fernando ſtates make decree decre norinberg fortyfying place nere turkes dominion contribution monye ſame appoynte thirde daye iuly reformation chamber ordeynynge ſhoulde redreſſed fourme preſcribed eleuen yeares paſte regenſpurge appointing penaltie thoſe ſhall refuſe contribute ayde accordyngly proteſtantes agayne proteſte doe aſſente vnto decree becauſe made withoute theyr aduiſe becauſe certen thing eſtabliſſhed touching peace law becauſe great pertialitie cōcerning contribution themperours cominge matter lyke tende mortal warre betwene duke cleaue prince electours ſtates theyr ambaſſadours doe intreat hardely laſt obteyne trewes granuellan certē determinat ſuche ſhoulde ſtande themperours pleaſure ſo ſoone ſhoulde ſette foote germanye whether wyll approue refuſe meane ſeaſon sittarde verey ſtronge towne frontier gulicke ſhoulde haue emperours poſſeſſion vntyll declared hys mynde interceſſours promyſed thys alſo wold ſend ambaſſadours mete emperoure treate matter granuellan put greate hope theye ſhoulde receyue hym gentle aunſwer thys treatye thambaſſadours cleaue chiefe whereof iohn ulatten noble man birthe well learned dyd well allowe gaue thankes interceſſours theyr paynes taken meane whyle battell foughten towne sittarde xxiiii daye marche duke cleaue wanne feelde partely reaſon victorye partly duke cleaue refuſeth truce throughe perſwaſion frenche kynge fed hym money waxed obſtinate forſakynge treuce whan hys ambaſſadours retourned home newes proſperous battel brought ſpedely fraunce cauſed great reioyſynge paris kynges commaundemente ſange te deum duke banier bretherne theyr ambaſſadours make interceſſion proteſtantes thys conuentyon amonges condicions propounde thys alſo duke brunſewickes landes myght committed cuſtody themperoure certen prince germany tyll matter examined herein could nothynge determyned aſſemblye chriſtopher byſſhop auſpurge dyed ſoden paulſey appoynted make death biſhop auſpurg feaſte nexte daye houſe stadious man learned peaceable otto truckeſſe ſuceded decree made entered recorde accuſtomed neyther authorytye longe frenche kynge receyued themperours letter wrytten biſſhop roome therefore nowe laſte aunſwereth full themperoure wolde preferred hym though well deſerued french kinges aunſwer emperours letter church roome mockerie vayne thyng neyther themperours aunceſters bee compared hys hymſelfe alſo hym thys behalfe certenly good ſonne moche prayſe worthye whoſe armie dyd beſiege vexe take priſoner father good man houſe clemente vii ſacked chiefe citie whole world polluted church temple god immortall ſondry wayes lefte vndonne kynde miſchiefe fylthy luſte crueltye vnto ſo greate outerage gaue alſo hym ſelfe prettye mocke tyme made vowes ſupplycatyons spayne delyueraunce hys father moſte ſtreyghtely deteyned home captiue hys progenitours kinges fraunce euer ſyns charles martell pipine lewis haue ſtudyed alwayes auaunce kinges fraunce moſt addicteth pope enryche byſſhoppes roome prayſeth moche owne dilligence zeale common welthe thynge farre otherwyſe yf bee indged ryghte throughe hys order conduite haue many thouſandes chriſtians ben ſlayne turkes within ſhorte ſpace hongary one twyſe goulfe ueniſe caſtelneufe barbarfa argiers whither ſame tyme ſayed muſte nedes gooe whan deede fled leafte germany appraye enemie approchynge throughe hys faulte yong infante iohn uayuode owne brother fernando realme hongary fallen thys calamitie telleth brauerye thoughe came aegneſmortes confirme peace yf prayſe thys thynge ought rather bee aſcribed vnto hym whiche wente fyrſte shyppe hym alſo ſente hys chyldrene thyther wherein ſurely great daunger bothe hym ſelfe truſte man alſo androwe de anxie hys admirall man ſubtyll craftie witte tooke hys iorney fraunce requeſte dede fyrſte hys ambaſſadour letter meſſagers craued thys hym offered hym millan alledgeth nonne cauſes conſtrayned neceſſitie rebellion gaunte paſſe waye ſayeth howe conſultation haue ſtayed hym faulſe neuer came hys thought duke sauoye wronge denyed bothe hys mother dowarye herytaunce woulde permitte hym redeme nice beſydes dyd euyll intreate duke sauoye frend thē peroure hys lieutenauntes ſoldiours recouered foorce armes coulde gette lawe equitie eſpecyallye ſyns wrought thinges maner emperours pleaſure whoſe vſe propertye perſwade kynges ſubiectes reuolte bryng miſerye example duke bourbon sauoye prynce salarne duke henry brunſewicke alſo chargeable hurtful kinſe folkes alies chriſtierne king denmarke fernando brother hym chieflye whiche hathe maried eldeſte ſyſter turke hathe late inuaded hongarye taken chyefe cytye ought aſcribed vnto hym hymſelfe hys brother whiche layed wayte yonge heyre uayuodes ſonne made warre agaynſte hym ſo aunſwereth euerye poynte emperoures letter concernynge turke hys ambaſſadoures ſente vnto hym touchynge germanes relygyon counſell ſeme bee faulte deſerue well title mooſte chriſtian kynge geuen longe ſyns hys noble progenitours fyne deſyreth biſſhop geue credyte ſclaunderous reporte hys aduerſary thynke howe nothynge wyll bee glad doe common welthes ſake hys churche roome little time dyed willyam bellaye langeis wee haue oftetymes mentioned man moche honoure vertue eſpecyall ornamente death praiſe w bellay frenche nobilytye reaſon hys notable learnynge eloquence experyence ſyngular aptnes affayres farre vnlyke vnto moſte parte followe lawe ſeeke onlye auaunce augemente theyre ryches ſo noble courage thys reſpect onely howe myght vertue wynne trewe renowne ſerue hys prynce trewelye thoughe hys owne hynderaunce tolde beefore fraunces lander preacher paris whan made doubtfull france lā der cōmmitted priſon aunſwer article propounded perſeuered ſtyll hys preachynge two three dayes eaſter commytted warde thys doone procuremente diuines accuſed hym lieutenaunte criminell within fewe day kynge came sangermane whyche little towne caſtell ryuer seine fyue myles benethe paris weknes kynge beyng infourmed whole matter calleth preacher beefore hym whan came thither beynge put feare ſome mennes woordes whyche ſayed howe kynge ſore offended declared conſtancye whyche many men looked hys hande beynge caryed agayne vnto parys xxix daye aprill enforced recant
