ſuche thynges taught day cathedral church aſſemble senatours iudges parlamente moreouer magiſtrates officer parys great nomber diuines church dores wer made faſte men ſet armure dryue waye people whan placed hys opinion recyted beynge demaunded euery one beleued therein aunſwered pleaſed confeſſynge howe erred promyſeth obedyence hencefoorthe acknoweledgeth thoſe article doctryne fryſte diuines kynges counſell propounded vnto recantation hym bee trewe godlye ſame ſorte alſo handled preacher depenſius thoughe ſo greate ſolemnitie whan fyrſte made hys retractatyon nothynge depenſius driuen recante playnlye compelled daye hys ſermon beefore people declare eche thynge diſtinctelye apertelye tyll divine preſent fully ſatiſfyed fraunce liued clemente marotte vulgare tounge ſurmounted far al poetes eyther wee hys dayes liued alſo tyme prayſe clements marot greate knowledge latyn tongue yet company learned menne profyted verye moche neyther thynge almoſt bookes poetes kneweit ſo theyr woorkes tooke moche applyed hys pourpoſe thus tranſlate certē thinges couertly tibullus propertius ouide hys owne elegy ga •• llus tooke marriage hercules duke farrare senate armoricke daughter lewes xij kynge fraunce tranſlated alſo moſte excellently fyrſt booke ouides metamorphoſys later dayes bente writynges holy ſcripture prefixed haue expreſſed dauid pſalter frenche metre pſalmes tranſlated marot taken away ſickenes finiſhed fyfty pſalmes remaine red without thadmiration hys excellent wit nothinge pleaſaunte hys ſtyle nothynge purer ſpeache nothyng apter pleaſaunt hys rythme ſet foorthe thys yeare geneua whither repaired tyme hee myghte ſafelye make longer bode fraunce ſuſpycyon lutheraniſme prynted xxx pſalmes two yeares parys moche diffycultye thys myghte doo beefore doctours sorbone pronounced nothynge conteyned booke contrary chryſtyane fayth thys peraduenture maketh moche pourpos thought good commend name ſo excellent artificer alſo nation fraunce hys memoryal ſhal endure laſt poſterytie moſt men thys opinion ſhall ryght harde anye man matche hym thys kynde vertue tullye reporteth ceſar maketh wyſe menne frayde wryte others haue taken hande ſame argumente deede better learned doo attayne fynes perfectyon tenth booke mentioned archebiſſhop collon coueted refourme hys churche allowed archebiſſhop collon calleth convocation synode hys prouynce notwithſtandynge booke went foorthe hys name conuention regē ſpurge biſſhops enioyned bothe kinge fernando alſo biſſhop roomes legate euery man hys owne dyoceſſe ſhoulde ſee godly reformation bee calleth conuocatyon hys ſtates whych clergye cathedrall churche erles nobilitie ambaſſadours city matter beyng debated agreed ſo godly holſome worke ſhoulde taken hand therefore appoynteth certen conceaue writyng draughte reformation ſhalbe eſpye good men bee myniſters churche thys wryting ſendeth diuines collon wylleth iudge thereof scripture ſhew theyr opinion hys requeſte ſaſatiſfyed hauing conuenyent miniſters inſtructe people ſent martyn bucer straſburg whō iohn gropper alwayes commended vnto hym highly hymſelfe alſo knewe ryght wel familyar comunication commyng thither laſte yere decembre begynnyng thys yere commaundemente prince beganne preache bomia towne vpon rhine fyue mile aboue collō ides march biſſhop calleth newe aſſemblie ſtates bomia requireth bucer preacheth bomia wolde conſulte vpon godly reformation clergie aſſigned man pourpos reſt ſtates deſyre archebiſhop according hys owne iudgemente hee wolde chouſe mete men thynge wherfore committeth thys charge vnto bucer ſhoulde penne oute article chriſtian doctrine thentent thynges might better donne biſſhops boke reformatiō intreateth prince electour saxonye wolde ioyne vnto hym melancthon commen iohn piſtor frō lantzgraue woorke fyniſhed archebiſhop ſent clergie head church collon whych noble melancthon piſtor come collon houſes requireth wolde ponder dyligently doctryne booke xxii daye iuly calleth synode exhibited vnto booke reformation requiring euery ſtate wold choſe certen whyche myght pervſe booke ouer conferre hys thentent ſome tollerable godly accorde myghte fyne bee clergie ſayed vrged obſtiuately bucet eſpecially certen others appoynted late inſtructe people myghte bee dyſplaced require tyme delyberation touching booke refuſe conferre reſt albeit knewe well enoughe pourpoſe made thys delaye yet thende ſhould fynd lacke graunteth tyme conſulte ſpake remouing bucer hys companion refuſe caſe man able conuicte eyther falſe doctryne euyll lyfe ſondrye tymes offered lybertie trye beyng ready exhibite lawefull indifferent iudg whā matter therfore ſtayed prepare contrary booke booke called antidagma title antididagma preface ſame booke wonderfull raylynge agaynſt lutheranes affirme expreſſe wordes rather lyue vnder dominion turkes vnder magiſtrate wolde followe defend reformation author diuiſor booke ſay gropper albeit familiar bucer two yeres regenſpurge albeit comyng home thence cōmended gropper forſaketh goſpell hym maruelouſly archebiſſhop alſo euerye others albeit written many moſt frendely letter yet whan matter brought vnto poynt forſoke frendeſhip altogether leauynge hys prince hys preferment reuolted tentes aduerſaries ſame barnarde hagie chauncelour bothe many fatte benefyces diuines collon affailed bucerfore rattled hym vp manye opprobrious wordes requyred matter might come diſputatiō proteſted wold defende doctrine agaynſte aſſemblies hys defence alſo melanethon ſet forthe booke ſame tyme exhortinge vnto modeſtie ſheweth ſhamefull errours defende duke moris saxonye maketh certen lawes tyme duke moris maketh lawes ye miniſters churche obſerued within hys dominiō fyrſt dede exhorteth preacher miniſters church execute theyr office diligently preache goſpel ſincerely ſhyne theyr ſtock honeſt example lyfe exhorte men prayer mutuall loue rebuke vice ſharpelye ſequeſter deſperate perſons communion church conſent magiſtrat vntyll amende ſuche thus refourmed preſent vnto magiſtrate secondly foraſmoch youthe ſtore churche publicke weale founded three grammer foundeth three ſcooles scooles miſene merſeburge porte euerye place fyndeth certen nombre scolars bothe theyr apparell common payeth alſo yerely ſtipendes theyr scolemaſters thys vſe doeth applye reuenewes relygious houſes wherin monkes dwelt ſuche others graunteth youthe ſhal remaine ſpace ſixe yeres ſame land beneficiall uniuerſitie lipſia alſo geueth augementation uniuerſitie lipſia two thouſand crownes yerely certen raſers wheat moreouer forbiddeth beggynge appoynteth yerelye ſomme monye certen place releue poore houſeholders ſuche defloure lawes agaynſt deflowerers uirgins adulterer maydes mary appoynteth thys puniſhement albeit ſett foorthe afterwardes marye others yet ſhall committed pryſon commaundeth aduouterers ſhall dye ſworde noble men marie ſuche wyues haue accompanied beefore punniſhethe thus taketh awaye theyr child borne marriage poſſeſſion profites ſuche landes holde fee meane time themperoure cōming oute spaine arriueth nauie gene xxvi day may addreſſyng letter thence duke saron lantzgraue theyr conſortes moche alreadye ſufficientlye warranted hys proclamation publyke peace alſo reformation chamber ſhal ſhortely exhorteth would refuſe contribute theyr ayde agaynſt turk whoſe preparation exceading greate alſo hys commyng credebly certifyed letter meſſaugers infourmed dooue conuention nauius wente vnto hym ſame tyme alſo calleth counſell thempire spier agaynſt laſte daye nouembre departyng frō gene ſpake biſſhop rome buſſet aſſemble spier towne riuer tare betwixte placence cremone agayne lyke caſe letter required proclayme hymſelf enemie french kynge ſayde howe expedient common welth herin perſeuered biſſhop geuen hys ſonne peter aloiſe parma placence whiche obteyned latelye college cardinalles exchaunge made becauſe theſe city ſometyme duke millan required emperour hys authorytie would pece monye confirme hys ſonne poſſeſſion thē pope woulde bye millan create hym duke ſame themperoure helde millan wolde deminiſhe part hys ryght refuſe ſaye moreouer howe byſſhōppes intente haue perſwaded themperour ſomme vfmony haue made nephew octauian duke millan emperour breaking talke might longer letted whan deliuered vnto coſmus medices duke florence caſteles florence liburne vntill time owne cuſtodye receyuing hym therfore two hondreth thouſand ducates procedeth hys iorney came spayne created hys ſonne philip kynge gaue vnto hym marriage ladye marye daughter vnto philip created kynge spayne iohn kynge portugall yere alſo sigiſmunde ſonne sigiſmund kyng polle mary lady elyzabeth daughter fernando kyng romanes henry duke brunſewicke going mete themperour italy heynouſlye accuſeth proteſtantes cremoiſe whan themperour comming italy hys armie proteſtantes whiche lately receyued hys letter dated gene mete together ſinalcalde xxiiii daye iune conſulte ſending hym ambaſſadours matter apperteyning defence kepyng dutchie brunſwicke theyr league ſollicite duke maurice king swecia otto henry palatine wuolfange prince bipounte biſſhop munſter whiche deſyred receyued league aſſemblie ended xxi iuly moche aboute thys ſame tyme emperoure kyng england make league league themp king england againſt frenche kyng agaynſte frenche kynge whiche ayded scottes ſayde confederacie biſſhop rome toke maruelous euill part therfore thoughte french frendeſhip nedefull hym whan themperour commen spier thende iuly proteſtantes ſende thither ambaſſadours fraunces burcart george bemelberg chriſtopher ueninger iames sturmius proteſt ambaſſad themperor admitted ſecond auguſte ſpeake maner ſame effecte king fernando concluſion theyr tale caſe might ſufficiently warraū ted haue peace yf iudgement chamber myght refourmed lately decreed regenſpurg yf inequalitie cō tributyng may takē away wil fayle beare theyr partes publicke neceſſities touchinge duke brunſwicke theyre deſyre matter maye come hearyng ſaye howe proue manifeſtly whiche firſte done open iniurye city goſlarie brunſwicke haue benryghtlye expulſed dryuen oute hys countrey hereunto themperoure nauius preſence granuellane two dayes bee required well enouge aſſured peace fourmer decree iudges chamber bee remoued theyr cauſe heard moneth october inquiſitiō ſhalbe made fault may found ſhall eſcape vnpunniſhed moderation contributinge made without comon aſſent ſtates let conſider preſent ſtate publicke weale becauſe matter moſte daunger vnleſſe holpen time let geue theyr ayd agaynſte turke lyke ſtates doe muſte hym ſelfe goe hys whole force agaynſt frenche kyng duke cleaue thentente maye defende hys ſubiectes iniurye duke brunſwick vrgeth ſore reſtored therfore let ſaye theyr fantaſye matter deſire haue aunſwere deliuered wryting may better conſyder thē perour content nexte day went frō spier mentz ſo farre ambaſſadours followed hym whan receyued wryting ſhewe granuellan nauius wherfore ſatiſfyed touchinge peace becauſe theyr deſyre cauſe brunſwick might hearde haue comiſſion matter archebiſſhop collon came themperoure spiers intreate duke cleaue vaine themp viage againſte duke cleaue excepthe wolde fyrſt departe poſeſſion gelderlande themperour wold heare mention peace ambaſſadoure saxonye hys prince commaundemente made ſuite duke cleaue granuellan mentz perſwade dyd ſaye howe priuate iniurye muſte bee forgeuen common welthes ſake eſpecially turk inuadeth maketh aunſwer themperour wil goe frō hys pourpos inuaſyon ſoeuer turkes ſhall make tolde heldeſſeme forſaken popiſſhe religion entred league proteſtantes ualentyne biſſhop cytye hildiſſeme accuſed emperour accuſed heynouſely chamber kynge fernando nowe alſo themperoure chaunged religion ceremonyes churche howe appoynted new preacher teache people put downe maſſe punniſſhed follower olde relygyon howe haue broken beaten downe aultars fontſtones alſo church howe haue taken theyr handes cuſtody mouables good iuelles clergie late alſo haue ſetfoorthe gameplayes mocke deryde openly uirgin marye ſainctes pourpoſynge forſake hys iuriſdiction lynked themſelues confederacie proteſtantes conſtreyned monkes ſuch others obſerue theyr religyon violence thoſe wold obey haue put open ſhame alſo banniſhed themperour heard thys complaynte ſyxte daye auguſt wryteth vnto wormes terrible threatenyng commaundeth reſtore relygyon thinges theyr fourmer ſtate vntyll ſome publicke decree eſtabliſſhed ſuch matter thre dayes addreſſeth letter senate collon heareth certen preacher themperours letter collon labour ſore remoue aunciente religion notwithſtandyng haue ſtoutly reſyſted hytherto whych ryght ioyefull heare admoniſſhing perſeuer ſame kepe citezens theyr dewty ſhalbe moſt acceptable whiche alſo declare dede tyme come kalendes iune biſhop roome wryteth ſame effecte vnto prebendary cathedrall churche collon care pope letter clergie colion ſorrow mynd hath archebiſſhopppes folye conceaued greatly cōforted theyr ſtoutenes conſtancy themſelues alſo theyr neyghbours righte holſome nexte immortall god deſerue thankes bothe moſte noble citie alſo whole prouince ſayfegarde therfore geueth ryght harty thankes ſtandyng ſo ſtyffe cauſe whyleſt lyueth neuer forget ſame albeit theyr dewtie yet thing ſelf example muſt nedes confeſſe moche bounden vnto notwithſtandyng nede bee conſtant thys cauſe chiefly left ſhould faynte archebyſhop ſhoulde happely gette vpper hande wolde wreake hys tene extremly therfore let ſtronge ſtoute defence goddes name catholicke relygyon theyr owne lybertye ſaluation whyche wicked archeheretike goeth aboute ſubuerte deſtroye haue nede counſelloure yet wolde alſo thruſte thys ſpurre vnto runnyng deſyreth erneſtlye take good hede whiche vn woorthye name archebiſhop doe infect moſt noble cytie contagion neyther take hym theyr paſtoure enemie wyl fayle aſſiſt bothe hys counſell otherwyſe theſe letter dyd iohn poggius biſſhops ambaſſadour themperour ſent vnto xxv auguſt little thys tyme french kyng goyng army uermandois taketh little towne themperours called landerſey maketh french king fortifyeth landerſey ſtronge fortification gariſons aboute ſame tyme alſo barbarouſſe turkes lieutenaunt conduit poline frenche man arriued greate nauie tolloye whiche hauen towne prouince fraunce betwene marſelles nice turkes nauie arriueth prouince whan kyng knewe hys comyng ſendeth duke uendome angiane force galleis aſſiſte hym goe bothe nyce whan taken towne havon xx day auguſt layeſege caſtell armie caſtell nice beſeged turkes made incurſyon hongarye whyche tooke towne quinqueccleſe citie caſtell strigone wanne stulweyſenburge aſſaulte biſhop roome ſente ayd wherof baptiſta sabella iulye urſine captianes came ſō late whan diuines paris thus triumphed ouer lander depenſius beefore ſayde publyſhe thoſe article doctrine propounded preacher lander whiche nombre xxv matter ſolēnely donne paris firſt daye auguſte people beyng called together maner trompet thoſe article recited alſo kynges commaundemente wer put prynte proclamation made vnder great penaltie man ſhould worke teache agaynſt decree alſo added ſearching oute lutheranes diuines moreouer charge theyr ſtudentes called bacchelaures batchelaurs others ſtudie diuinitie follow fourme el expulſed colledge agaynſte theyr doctryne caluine wrote booke whych calleth antidotum paynteth forth abooke caluine againſte sorboniſtes collours moch aboute ſame tyme ſetteth forth booke frenche relyques saynctes thintente bothe thys age alſo tyme come may ſee caſe relygiō fallē recyteth theſe thinges vnto knowē booke relieques sainctes wiſſheth ſame done lykewyſe country nombre cribbe swadling clothes bearing clothe foreſkinne blud chriſt partely pure partely delayed water ſixe waterpottes mariage citie cane galilee wyne chriſte made water ſtuffe furniture hys maundie laſt ſupper hys apoſtels manna people iſraell croſſe cane nayles sponge launce crowne thorne cote shoe handkerchef teares chryſt milke smocke heare girdel slipper combe ring uirgin marie ſworde bucklar michel tharchangell scull iawebonne braynes fingar iohn baptiſte chaire honlette maſſinge garmentes brayne peter body sainctes ſame diuerſe ſondry place ſheweth veneration people worſhipped theſe thynges whan priſtes without monye let haue ſyght therof ſhewe farre verey tryfles thinges nought yf well conſidered haue nothing craft colloure diuiſed priſtes lucre vaſe dutchelande ther two famous city thys behalfe treuers achon hither ſaye men wonte come two city full relicies ſee reliques oute hongary slauonye tyme thoſe marchauntes ſet forth theyr ware euery ſeuenth yere thauthorytie wonder mighte bee greater themperoure came mentz bomia water ther taught bucer ſame tyme caſper hedio alſo ſent thither newly frō straſburg archbiſſhop man verey milde nature verey mete inſtruct people bothe great daūger eſpecially spaniardes beyng thete themperour alſo doth wyll archebiſſhop ambaſſadours ſend waye melancthon departed thence alſo long obteynyng lycence departe hauing taken order miniſters church retourn home themperour wente dure tyme came towne xx auguſte nexte daye ſent herauld ſommon towne willyng render vnto hym el wil attempte force ſoldiours within aunſwer hym contēptuouſly ſayinge affrayde hym good whyle ſence made bayte fyſſhes brute went howe themperour afalſereport emperours deathe hys retourne barbarie ouerthrowe argiers ſuffered shipwreake drowned opinion ſo ſetrled myndes cleauois would neyther credite whiche ſayed ſene hym ſcarſely thoſe ſpoken hym prynce hym ſelfe alſo lykewyſe perſwaded acerten fatall credulitie frenche men thought author forger vanitie leſt cleauois ſhould relēt feare themperours power fall ſome cōpoſition themperour receyuing aunſwer whan fortyfyed camp furniſhed thinges xxiiii day auguſt ſōne ryſyng beginneth make battery geueth thaſſault eſpecyally spanyardes whyche exceadyng preſte wyllyng beyng often repulſed hauyng loſte many men neuer ceaſed taken force fortune townes men ſuche wonte bee whan waye entrie made ſword howbeit wont ſhewed head saint anne ladyes mother thither came yearelye greate multitude people xxvi daie iuly whyche dedicated ſainct spaniardes victours caried head incloſed golde greate pompe deuoutely graie freres churche leſt ſhoulde bee loſt ruine burnyng churche towne ſpoyled diſtroyed fyre themperour marchinge forewarde rendred vnto hym gulick ruremunde ſtronge towne gelderlande ſituated ryuer rure maſe mete ſodein diſtructyon dure broughte men wonderfull feare perplexitie ruremunde goeth uenlon thither laſte came duke cleaue hym campe accompanyed henry duke cleaue craueth pardon themperoure duke brunſewicke ambaſſadours archebiſhop collon time humbly beſought themperoure perdon hym duke brunſwicke alſo ambaſſadours erneſtly intreated hym themperoure laſt ryſeth vp appoynteth prynce orenge granuellane preſcribe lawes vnto hym therefore vpon theſe condition receyued againe fauoure ſeuenth daye september ſhall departe condiciōns impoſed relygyon catholycke churche yf haue altered thynge let reſtored promyſe hys fydelytie allegeaunce themperour king fernando thempire doe renounce league fraunce denmarke ſhall make confederacie wherin ſhall excepte themperoure fernando heires ſhall leaue poſſeſſion gelderlande releaſe people theyre othe caſe place place ſhall refuſe render ſhall ayde emperoure recouer ſame emperoure agayne reſtoreth vnto hym lande gulycke latelye conquered excepte two townes henſeberge syttarde whyche hee wyll kepe tyme tyll haue ſomme experience hys fydelytie loyaltye whyleſt emperoure wente agaynſte duke cleaue frenche kynge marcheth throughe champagne towardes lande luke ſendeth lady iane hys syſters daughter whyche deſpouſed ſolemnelye maryed two yeares duke cleaue carye huſbande wente full ſore agaynſte wyll ſhewed beefore howbeit ſhe obeyed kynge uncle daughter nauaris ſent duke cleaue kynge appoynted vnto cardynall bellaye byſſhop parys man mooſte meete perſwade kepe companye iorneye ſhe commen nowe soyſſons goe thence kynge woorde broughte duke cleaue ſubdewed wherwith beeyng greatlye reioyced ſhe ſawe ſhee nede feare thinge longer knewe wolde bee ende thereof neyther ſhe deceaued kynge theſe newes ſore aſtonyed ſo ſhe retourneth home neuertheleſſe procedynge taketh cytyo lucemburge aboute thende september delyberatyon fortyfyeth aboute thys tyme alſo henry eyghte kynge englande confederated latelye emperoure ſendeth hym power men conduct syr iohn wallop capytayne launderſey beſeged guiſnes whyche ioynynge themperoures armye beeſege towne landerſey moneth october charles roſſet lawyer ſente emperoure mentz preacher goſpel thruſt oute metz tooke order senate monkes clergie obſeruing olde relygion bannyſſhynge preacher others inclyned proteſtantes vnles ſhoulde reconcile ſelues within certeine tyme whan barbarouſſe beeſeaged caſtell nice vayne themperoures power lū bardye ſege leuied nice alſo approched whyche led marque piſcare leuyed ſege ſomewhat ſooner tyme yeare requyred leadeth backe hys armie wynter tollon towne kynge aſſigned hym commaundyng citezēs inhabiters auoyde thence yeare moche diſſention diſſencion scotland trouble scotlande mindes noble beyng deuyded thoſe lordes whyche ſayed priſoners englande lib •• ally diſmiſſed kynge furthered hys cauſe moche myght cardinall scotlande great yerely reuenewes benefyces fraunce quene beynge daughter duke guyſe tooke frenche kynges parte yonge quene scottes affiaunced kynge edwarde death scottiſh king henry eyght wholy yonge quene scottes might affianced prince edward ſō thing thoſe noble ſpake good ſeruyce perſwaded hameltō gouernour toke cardinall beſege quene certen caſtell makyng wrytynges confyrme marriage french kynge diſturbed deuyſe nobilitie alſo pitied moche quenes chaunce gouernoure reuolted thother ſyde brake theyr conuenauntes warres beganne agayne afreſihe betwixt england ſhalbe declared herafter kyng denmarke alſo warre themperialles low countrye king denmarke warreth vpō thē perialles kyng chriſtierne captiue axed ayde proteſtantes ſaye thys quarel concerneth theyr league prouyded caſe ſhoulde haue warre hys religion ſhoulde cōmon ayde defended duke cleaue made hys peace thēperour ſendeth ambaſſadoure kynge fraunce renounceth hys league duke cleaue renounceth frenche leage requyreth wyfe maye bee ſente hym whoſe paſſage hathe obteyned ſaufe conduite themperoure kynge aunſwereth ambaſſadour howe hath ben let hym hath bothe wyfe delyuered armye alſo ſente hath ben hys owne faulte certifyed ther neyther open way paſſe thoſe party vitaile ſoeuer hath promiſed hath lyberally perfourmed ſō alſo bounden hath donne well forgettyng noble lynage eſtate hathe brought hym ſelfe ſuche bondage concernynge hys nece maie knowe mynde parentes nothyng bounden hym whan themperoure eſtablyſſhed thynges gelderlande moneth october came landreſey exceadynge greate armye thyther came alſo french kynge hys whole force thynge none lyke haue commen battell frenche men vytayled towne departure frenchman lāderſey went awaye nyght ſo pryuely enemy perceiued day light length purſuing ouer tooke rerewarde ſlew many becauſe winter came themperour thinking good attempt whan ſēt certen power ſege lucēburg diſchargeth reſt hys army duke maurice ſerued themperour landreſey hys owne duke moris voluntarye mynde wherby gote moche good wyll made way obteyne hys frendſhip winter ſeaſon duke lorayne certen others intreate peace vayne themperoure retournynge home landerſey ſent fardinando county willyam forſaketh frenchking gonzage uiceroy sicilie kyng england might incenſe hym agaynſte frenche kynge haue oftentymes mentioned william countie furſtēberge beyng made ſtraū ger frenche kinge made ſuite granuellan come themperours fauour declare hys fydelytie leuyed certen power foote men hys owne iuriſdictyon wente myddes wynter lucemburge ioyned hym ſelfe thē perours armie frenche men conduite duke longouile vitayled within departeth without thynge doon many dead colde honger ſhewed howe counſell thempyre appoynted laſt nouember wherfore proteſtantes aſſemble together franckfourd conſulte thynges ſhoulde treate whole aſſemblye matter delayd reaſon frenche warres duke saxon lantzgraue moneth nouember addreſſyng letter themperoure aduertiſe hym howe wyll come counſell yf hymſelfe wyll bee graunte ſaufecounduite theyr league frēdes wherunto themperour aunſwered frō bruſſeles x day decembre would come doubtles moneth ianuarye ſendeth withall ſaufconduite howebeithe excludeth ſuche addicte hys enemyes promeſſe faythe conuenaunte ſignifyinge priuie eſpialles frenche kynge begynnyng ianuary takyng hys iorney commeth spire xxiiii day thys moneth great eclipſe sonne daye tyme ſo men beheld without great 1544 wonder yeare alſo thre ful eclipſes moone matter dede bee wondred whyche aſtronomiers thre eclipſes moone ſaye hathe chaunced ſynce tyme great charles alexander farneſe cardinall paſſyng throughe fraunce ſpoke themperoure goynge towardes thaſſemblye tooke hys leaue hym wormes cauſe ambaſſade thought treaty peace aſſemblie spier exceading great booth king great aſſemble spiere farnando prynces electours ſeldome ſeene maner prince amonges alſo duke cleaue duke saxony comyng whych xviii day february lantzgraue archebiſſhop colō friderick paulſgraue uiceroye sicilye went foorth met hym two dayes counſel began themperour propoundeth cauſes leauynge spayne nowe retourned germany hath called conuention hath ſufficiētly declared hys letter dated gene neyther nede recyte howe moche hathe euermore loued publyke weale thynges put order home myghte warre agaynſt common enemye chriſtendome howe hath ben impeached hytherto vnknowen thys laſt yere procurement french kyng turkiſſhe nauie comen sea ligurie hath inuaded countrey duke sauoye prince thempire taken citie hauen nice greate force beſeged caſtell vattered ryght ſore albeit conſtrayned throughe hys armye approchynge leuye theyr ſiege yet haue ſyns attempted place thempyre spayne alſo nowe wholy aboute diſtroie together therfore matter nowe brought extreme daunger vnleſſe ioyne theyr mindes power helpe feared leſt germanye ſhall acknoweledge bewayle hys miſerye al late hath often wiſſhed redreſſe theſe euilles frēch kynge mouing warre agaynſt hym inſondry place could neither retourne germanye ioyne power theyres turke doeth ſo boldly inuade germany warres cauſes turkes proſperitie alſo attempted agaynſte hym haue ſo euell ſucceſſe hytherto cauſe hathe ben fyrſt hath ben aduertyſed tyme tyme frenche kyng diſſention relygion publycke priuate dyſpleaſure al degree ſtate thempyre thynges donne therein secondlye ſeeth howe frenche kynges hand fyndeth fauour ſocour ready hath declared witneſſe letter nowe alſo proued dede aſmoche therfore ſtyreth vp armeth comon moſte cruell enemye others agaynſte chriſten publyke weale ſuppoſeth ſhoulde eſteme thys warre whyche conſtreyned maynteyne agayſte hym non otherwyſe attempted agaynſte turke truſtynge moreouer wyll onlye condemne hys practyſe enterpryſes alſo wyll french king compared turke aſſiſte hym thentente beyng delyuered domeſtycall enemye maye dyſplaye hys whole force agaynſte turke thys expoſtulatyng ayd decreed turkiſh warre ſente accordyngly wante wherof turke hathe agayne thys laſte yere preuayled taken certen townes caſtels hongarye requyreth ſeeyng turke goeth wynne hongarye maye inuade germanye wolde conſyder depelye ſo weyghtye matter may haue ayde oulye defend inuade alſo thende thys moſte noyſō plage may one driuen away theyr wyues child natif contrie declaring moreouer willing ye thinges amiſſe ſhoulde refourmed emongs iudgement chamber ſame day king fernādo hys ambaſſadours ſpeakīg many thinges proteſtantes oration themperoure roades invaſions turkes craueth aide immediatly duke saxon lantzgraue confederate addreſſing oratiō thēperour know ſaye moſte victorious emperoure howe haue offered oure ſelues euer ſyns beginnynge declare moſte honorable senate cauſe defence taken agaynſt henry brunſwicke yet alſo ſame mynde doubtyng matter ſhalbe hearde ſhall appeare vnto weyghty iuſt cauſes wherfore dryuen neceſſitie lawfull hym preſent counſell prince howbeit becauſe ſee hym put hymſelfe preaſe occupie place thys moſt noble conſiſtorye moche agaynſte oure willes moche maye doe proteſt wee neyther take hym acknoweledge hym prynce thempire neyther right oures ſhoulde hys preſence diminiſhed wherunto duke brunſwicke aunſwereth ſtreyghte waye hys chauncelour duke brunſewicke accuſeth proteſtauntes duke saxō ſayeth lantzgraue theyr fellowes breakyng god law man law infringing ſtatutes thempire faythe publicke violence open wronge haue ſpoiled countrey cauſe haue accuſed thē iudges chāber ſeeyng ſo ought haue place senate thempire yf haue nowe loſt ſame committing acte worthye whoſe companye men ſhoulde eſchewe ſo muſte nedes ſyt thē comon counſelles proteſt neyther attribute place vnto therfore ſame ſhould preiudicial caſe proteſtantes verye deſyrous euen haue recited cauſe theyr enterpryſe whole matter wrytynge leſte hys complaynte ſhoulde appere trewe ſettle mennes heartes thēperour fridericke palatyne nauius required foraſmoch day farre ſpent wold differre affirming alſo wolde aſſigne thē day pourpos ſo followed hys mynde becauſe prince ſat counſell fortuned lantzgraue ſate next duke brunſwicke prince palatine iohn suner auoyding ſtryfe arryſeth hys place ſytteth downe myddes betwixte bothe proteſtyng ſame ſhoulde bee preiudice hym familye yt thought thē perours requeſt day duke saxon lantzgraue intreated fridericke paulſegraue iohn nauie wold ſo deuiſe themperour duke brunſwicke might come comon aſſemblie could obtayned themperour alledging might excluded vnleſſe cauſes fyrſt declared frenche kyng knowing certē tie french ambaſſade aſſemble spier themperour wold make greuous complaynte hym prynces determineth moſt honorable ambaſſad iohn bellaie cardinal fraunces oliuer chauncelour alenſō affricane malley preſydent diuion whan theſe wer commen nance towne lorayne remayne lookyng themperours ſaufcondict king ſent spier heraulte ſame cauſe letter themperour ſeuerall letter alſo prince electours wherin required ſaufe conduite hys ambaſſadours came spier ende februarye hys rich cote armes accuſtomed ſtayed granuellan vnto delyuereth kyng maiſters letter written themperoure whan myghte otherwyſe doe declareth cauſe hys comyng requyring thambaſſadours farre maye accordyng law armes haue ſaufconduite beyng cō maunded tary within dilligētly watched man ſhould french herault euil receyued spier come ſpeake hym fourth day diſmiſſed moſt ſharpe wordes played fond part daū ger haue loſt hys head whych durſte preſume come thyther kynge beyng enemy germany hathe doe lymites thempyre neyther worthy enioye law nation let hym retourne home therfore tell kynge thus howe ther cauſe herafter either may comefor nowe dede fault forgiuen perdoned themperours clemencie deſert let take hede hēceforthe el wil eſcape vnpunniſſhed hath againſt law army neyther laweful hym haue comen themperours habitation without leaue permiſſiō touchyng letter whyche ſayeth hath kyng hath ſo well deſerued chriſten publicke weale chefely germanye thys preſent ſtate thynges themperour neyther wyll ought receyue leſt hys accuſtomed maner writing promiſes eyther alſo others myghte diſceaued aunſwer delyuered vnto hym wrytten frenche thus ſent back kynges letter wrytten themperour prynces certen horſemen ſente hym conduite nance prince made priuie many thoughte done agaynſt cuſtome thempyre thys thyng knowen ambaſſadours pecke trouble toke great thought retourne home without daunger vſing counſell authony duke lorayne went waye ſecretly nyght ſeaſon ſo retourned fraūce whyleſt yet remayned nance ambaſſadors retorne nighte chriſtine duke daughter lawe ſente spier thing neither could certen others might ſhe themperours nece ſiſter intreaty teares certen commendation kind obtayne yet vayne themperour wholy bent haue warre hys counſellours ſayde muſte ſo doe mayntaine hys eſtimation dignytie duke lorayne albeit addicte neyther long ſyns couenaunted myght newter yet aſmoche warre kepte vpon hys frontier ſawe howe coulde done without hys greate loſſe domage verye carefull peace ix daye februarye certen priuces themperours motion wryt letter frō spire prince letter pope biſſhop roome partely commendyng hym laſte yere adioyned hys force themperours reſcue caſtell nice partly requiring moch enemye reparyng nauie tollone repare agayne nice win caſtell ſhoulde greate ſhame ſore anoyeaunce vnto italy churche roome common welth father comon welthe hygh biſſhop wolde ayde duke sanoye hys helpe counſell hys ſyngular wiſdome wolde deuyſe ſome meanes howe cruell enemye myght expulſed nice alſo frō thoſe place hathe hauens holdes hys refuge thys ſhoulde thynge bothe god moſt acceptable whole common wealth alſo moſte holſome profitable diuerſe perſwations touching ſame matter biſhop aunſwereth xxvi day february theffect aunſwer thys caſtell nice may bee pope aunſwer defended wyll leſſe carefull hereafter hathe ben hytherto truſtyng carefull ſo wyll leſſe mydnfull take paynes whole common welthe ſhall beſt become longe rehearſal ayde men captaynes hath ſent hongary affrica agaynſt turkes hath waſted treaſure ſuche affayres ofte hath ſent ambaſſadours oft traueled ſelf aboute publyke weale ſayeth fyne lyke commende vnto hym nice ſo doeth commende vnto ſtate comon welth whiche ſore afflicted decayed chiefe waye helpe thys matter myndes kynges may reconciled meane heale comon welth thys welſprynge procedeth diſcommoditie comon welth diſſention betaken awaie fourmer beautie come agayne grudge diſpleaſure neyther hereſies germany turkee hongarye ſo ſoone waye made throughe ciuile diſcorde immediatelye ſprange vp hereſyes faction hatred bothe publyke pryuate hitherto hath alſo counſel ben letted hyndered therfore muſte ſeeke recouer peace thexample phiſitions take away fyrſt cauſe ye diſeaſe peace warre turk put flyght counſel peace may kepte hereſyes ſo euer amiſſe may refourmed otherwiſe let thinke eyther nyce bee defended enemye part chriſtendome kept fre daunger men ſhalbe wrapped ſame calamitie diſtructiō moneth march paulſegraue lewis prince electour departed lyfe brother fridericke ſuccede prince electours thother ſtates themperours aduiſe ſecond day aprill ſende letter swyſes prince letter swiſſes diſwade aydyng french kyng vtter decay ruine chriſten relygyon hathe lincked hym ſelfe turkes thys laſt yere hath conducted theyr nauie ſea lygurie haue warred vpon duke sauoye taken nice yet remayne ſtill fraunce intendiuge worke miſchiefe themperour hys country wherfore require hencefoorthe ſuffer non theyr men ſerue frenche kynge thys wicked league people mahomet ought deteſted men taken comon enemie yf gon hym already call home agayne ſo vſe ſelues maye appere doe neglecte publycke preſeruation whileſt conſulted matter propounded themperoure duke lantzgraue theyr confederate fyrſt daye aprill themperoure kyng fernando al proteſtantes accuſe duke brunſwicks ſtates thempyre accuſe henry duke brunſwick moſt heynous offence alſo recite order wrytinge harmes iniuries done cytyes brunſwicke goſlarye theyr conſortes whoſe defence wer cōſtrayned repulſe vniuſt violence reherſe howe theſe many yeres hys whole endeuour hath ben ſeeke occaſyon moue warre agaynſt proue ſame teſtimonye letter founde tolde whan expulſed hys princypall caſtell thoſe letter whych wrytten moſt parte archbiſſhop mentz duke bauier heldus tenure letter dryuē oute wiſſheth oft themperours comyng spaine hope therof braggeth threateneth tyme themperour comē ſlacked matter complayneth hys lyngering delaye wayleth hys fellowes ſatiſfyed league made norinberge neglected layeth blame therof granuellan corrupted mony proteſtantes raileth hym wiſſheth hym ſhamfull death demerites ſaieth themperour ſlepe awaked vſeth hys name ſometime clooke terrour faukners wonte many tymes ſhewe foorthe dead hauke feare fowle withall theſe many letter ſuche lyke ſorte wherin vttereth hys mynde affection red openlye moche ſame effecte duke bauier heldus wrytten agayne becauſe henry brother duke george saxonie league proteſtantes altered religion ſaide duke brunſwicke letter meſſagers ſollicited themperour take awaye hys landes truſtyng ſhould ſet kepe poſſeſſion contrie herof wer letter alſo recyted furthermore declare hym wycked mā duke brunſewicke contē neth hys owne religion doeth contemne delude biſſhoppes relygion wyll ſeme maynteyne proue moſte euydent teſtimonie thys duke brunſwick maryed lady mary ſyſter ulriche duke wirtemberge gentlewoman waytyng vpon excellente beautye called eue trottine vpon huſbande doted loue perſwaded mayde diuers child thentent matter ſhould ſtraunge tale ſaide duke bee perceyued myght vſe company longer geueth counſel faine though ſhe wold go home parētes fourniſſheth horſes charyote althynges neceſſarye iorney departeth ſhe thought haue gone home ſhe conueyed caſtell hys captayne made priuie thyng ſhould done woman two appoynted wayte vpon moſte truſted eue within day ſhe came thither kepeth bed fayneth ſelf ſycke cauſed made image wood whiche dyd repreſente head necke boulke dead body partes made ſet lynen clothes wemen ſtuffed filled earth aſſhes might ſeme proportionate ſo ſet image wood clothe together cloth ſo ſhapē couered alſo otherpartes wood body therfore thus ordered lapped wynding ſhete layed foorth floure ſtreyght way cometh one womē parlour dore captain declareth eue dead commaundeth coffin made lay body make men affrayde body ſhould come nere hir fayne ſhe dyed plage perfume houſe graines iuniper ſauoury thinges corp brought foorth ſolemne pompe caryed graye freres churche honorably buried image buryed ſle • e eue meſſe dirige freres pray al yere long deſyre people theyr ſermons doe ſame moreouer duke commaundemente funerall made chapell caſtell ſayde ſhe dyed lykewyſe hys head caſtell woulſebutell whiche farre citie brunſwicke thither came alſo reporte death obite exequie wyfe dutch woman trayne maydens mournynge apparell thithere came manye priſtes ſente oute contrye whyche dyner made monye geuen rewarde euery man ſomewhat olde accuſtomed maner amonges papiſtes meane tyme eue whoſe deathe ſo many bewayled liueth fareth well caſtell stanſſeburge oftentymes duke viſiteth ſyus tyme hath ſeuen child perſwadeth hys wyfe alſo ſygnyfye parentes frendes eue dead bruted abrode ſhe alyue kepte caſtell stanſſeburge hys wyfe alſo inkling therof conceaueth vehement ſuſpicion inquyreth ſeruaūtes howe matter ſtoode forbad man ſhoulde come thoſe knewe thyng thys ſuſpicion ſticked faſte mynde ſo longe ſhe lyued wryting ofte vnto hym bewayled miſerye thys fact hys recyted emonges others ſame preſence thentent men might vnderſtande opinion hys owne relygion concluſion theyr accuſation proue howe iuſte neceſſarye cauſes attempted war agaynſt hym contemnyng proclamation themperour kinge fernando diſturbed publicke peace wrought kynde iniurye theyr fellowes confederate duke brunſwicke preſent thys action themperoure ſo willing proteſtantes deſyred myght haue ben preſente herein moued themperour eaſter monday xiiij day aprill themperours ſoldiours led marque piſcare foughte battell piedmont frenchemen towne carignane loſt felde french victory carignane many thouſandes ſlayne generall frenche armie angian duke uandoſme mentioned whanreport came ouerthrow many men ſuppoſed themperoure wolde haue refuſed treatye peace erneſtly bent haue warre made preparation accordyngly duke brūſwicke aunſwereth accuſation proteſtantes xxiij day aprill powryng greate heape reproches obiecteth vnto thē conſpiracie rebellion treaſō extortiō ſocietie wirth turkes frenche men touching letter founde caſtel excuſeth well maye yf theyr cloſettes ſearched ſaieth might great deale worſe ſtuffe befounde matter concernyng eue hys darlyng toucheth little reproche proteſtantes make aunſwere agayne whan themperoure wolde ſuffer matter pleaded openly exhibite wryting ſame afterwardes doth duke brunſwicke xxvij day aprill charles duke sauoye agayne hys ambaſſadoures duke sauoye accuſeth frēch king accuſeth french kyng beſydes violence iniuryes foormer yeres ſayeth hathe ſtyred vp turkes lieutenante barbarouſſe beyng ayded frenche men hath taken compoſition hys citie nice agaynſt fidelitie promeſſe ſpoyled leadyng many awaye captiuitie hath ſette fyre requireth therfore would help hym thys hys extreme miſerye eſpeciallye ſeeyng enemy fully prefixed retourne ſege caſtel hath craued ayde biſhop roome hath graunted hym trybut whiche clergie wonte paye hym yerely verye ſmal reliefe thys hys pouertie ſcarſely poſſeſſeth tenth parte hys dominion came hym ſelfe counſel excuſeth hym hys age longe iorney iminent daunger hys enemye ſaieth moreouer hable beare charge whiche hath ſcant ſomuche wyll fynde hym hys ſōne hys familie aboute thende aprill swiſes aſſemble badē ſwyſſes aunſwer prince letter make aunſwer letter ſtates thempyre howe theyre captaynes beyng demaunded queſtion affirme ſaw band turkes frenche campe hearde thynge therof woulde haue ſerued frenche kynge beyng moued herin doeth complayne ſent ambaſſadours laſt winter coulde admitted myght haue ben hearde ſpeake coulde eaſely haue confuted thys ſlaū der themperoure refuſe peace promiſeth bohemers wrote hym februarie alſo germanes hys ayde agaynſt turke nowe touching themſelues ſomme dede bounden ſerue french kyng warres compoſition ſome agayne league amit 〈…〉 hym haue ben theſe many yeres whoſe dominion • runne fraunce done contrary theyr knowledge lyke may alſo happen ſome place germany rekon beſte kynges ambaſſadours ſhoulde hearde peace eſtablyſhed wherin may good wil al heartes tyme kyng england ſend great nauie scotlande chauncynge good wynde whan arriued thengliſhe nauie inuadeth ſcotlād take fyrſte lythe notable hauon eddenborough head cytie scotlad caſtell kept agaynſt ſituation vnprenuable burnt begynnyng moneth may thys aſſemblie themperoure ſolemn ceremonie created woolfang maſter pruſſe openly gaue armes aperteynynge office whyche alberte brandenburge brother george caſimire enioyed many yeres marieng wyfe vſurped ſame hym ſelfe therfore oute lawed chāber twelue yeres declared sygiſmunde kynge poole defended hym hys cliente nowe tyme inueſted haue ſayed kynges ambaſſadoure prote • ted openlye thys creation vnlawfull neyther oughte bee derogation kynge hys maſter vnder whoſe defence protection lande pruſſe whan ambaſſadours hongary recited theyr miſfortune loſſe yeare paſte requyred ayde thempyre nowe matter broughte verey extremitie yf bee nowe leafte deſtitute muſt nedes doe men wont matter deſperat man blame thē wil accept right harde condition yea bōdage ſelfe rather whileſt men ſit ſtill loke ſhould fal preſent deſtructiō frēch king heraulte ſent away spier letter declared whan ambaſſadours therfore wer retourned home ye oratiō oration frēch ambaſſadours ſhould haue ſtates germany ſet forth print beginning get good ſay bothe nation haue one ſame originall neither thing chaunce vnto germany apperteineth wel vnto fraunce thā cōfute reportes aduerſaries though king warre ſhould diſturbe cōmon welth haue made league turke vſing certē preface appeace themperour affirme former warre begon king could obteine duke sauoie mother inheritaūce later ye kinges ambaſſadours wer ſlain againſt law nation yt king hathe league ſocietie turke marchandiſe cōmon quiet ſuch uenetians poloniās others haue albeit ther wer league betwixt thē wer reprehended aſmoch time paſt abrahā dauid salomō phineas child tobie captaines machabeis holy men haue league men contrarye relygyon haue done like alſo themperours honorius cōſtātine theodoſtus ye yonger iuſtinian ſecōd palaologus leo frederick firſt ſecond haue vſed aide ſuccour nation contrary religiō doubtles fredericke ſecond euen vpon ſhoulders ſaracens caried italy frō whence biſſhopes rome expulſed know great power aide king hath oftener promiſed turkiſh warre hereof alſo biſhop senate cardinalles good wytneſſes cauſe whye turke inuaded hongarye contentyon aboute gouernemente moore provoked war affricke taking townes late turkiſſhe nauie came ligurian sea imputed kynge neyther maketh pourpoſe poline kinges ſeruaunt ſame thintēt barbarouſſe ſearche take androwe de aurie enemie could fynde hym beſeged caſtell nice hys owne determination kyng dede hath taken trewes turke lyke hath tymes ſhewed honeſt hurtfull man ought blamed conſydering greateſt men haue alſo lately muche deſyred ſame ſtate publyke weale ſore afflicted kynge right ſory meane maie peace recouered themperoure reſtore kinge thinge owne ryghte heritaunce yf brynge thys paſſe kinge wyll ſpare neyther trauell coſt perill defende germanye foreine violence fourmer bookes haue hearde duke saxon wolde acknoweledge fernando kynge romanes thys conuention matter wente duke saxon ſet throughe kynge ferdinando moneth maye duke promiſed honour hym accordingly themperour agayne ratifyeth marriage conuenauntes betwixte hym houſe cleaue whiche euer refuſed permitteth caſe duke cleaue fortune dye withoute heyres malles duke saxon whiche maryed hys ſyſter heires male ſhould ſuccede yet vpon thys condiciō chaunce ſhal agree vpō religion bande amitye fernando themperours conſente promiſeth geue daughter elenore marriage duke saxōs eldeſt ſonne yf reconcilemente religion may ſhe marying able latter thyng kepte verey ſecret cloſely couered eyther ſyde ſo neyther lantzgraue hys fellowes knewe anye thynge thereof matter done fewe counſellours themperoure vſed granuellane feruando hoffeman duke saxon pontane burcarte king dē marke alſo ſendynge hys ambaſſadours fell compoſytion themperoure kepte hys power wynter longe chaunce myghte haue happened ſemed forſake frenche kynges frendeſhyp turkyſhe confederacye french king hate • men turk ſocietie ſomuch ambaſſadours dyd ſygnyfye famylyar talke fellowes nowe wyll retourne demaundes themperoure kynge fernando matter beyng longe muche debated tenth daye iune conuention ended state thempyre albeit thoughte muche bee charged double ayde yet ſuppoſynge ſhoulde better warre agaynſte turke yf domeſticall enemie fyrſte broughte vnto hys bewtye graunted themperoure monye fynde foure thouſande horſemen xxiiii thouſande footemen halfe yere agaynſt ſtates thempire decree aide againſt frenche kynge frenche kynge parte monye themperouce departeth hys brother fernando thentente ſhoulde fortifye ſuche place nere turkes turkiſhe warre come agreed moneye ſhouldbe gathered euerye man throughe oute germany men ſeaſed theyr landes goodes man bee exempted enacted man ſhoulde ſerue foreine prynces eſpecyally frenche kynge magiſtrate permitted execut thoſe taken maner becauſe controuerſy relygyon could theſe warlycke affaire decree relygion bee treated differred tyll nexte aſſemblye bee holden moneth december meane ſeaſon wyll themperoure appoynte certen good well learned men compile ſome godlye fourme reformation alſo exhorteth prince lyke ende throughe conference made next aſſemblye ſomethyng common aſſent may eſtablyſſhed obſerued vntyll generall counſel holden germany prouincial sinode ſame meane tyme let men quyet ſtyre vp trouble dyuerſitie relygion church alſo relygion ſo euer bee maye inioye theyr commodytyes eyther partie parte thoſe goodes imployed fynding myniſters churche free schooles poore chā ber iudges chamber ſhall kepe theyr place vntyll tyme prefixed whan ſame ſhalbe expired ſhall receyued nomber indifferently without reſpecte relygion decre auſpurge action commenced agaynſt proteſtantes doctryne ſake caſe alſo goſlarie minden hang ſuſpence vntill nexte treaty anabaptiſtes ſuffer puniſhement long ſynce determined yet ſhall magiſtrates aſſigne learned godlye men ſhewe theyr errour call agayne amendemente catholickes miſlyked thys decree reſiſted withal theyr force byſhopes collon munſter held proteſtantes alſo duke cleaue marque baden referred althinges thēperours pleaſure lōg diſceptation deuiſed thys way meane tollerable party wel ſhortned nūbre ſay certēly wil aſſent howbeit preſcribe themperour reſyſt hys authorytie cōtent ſuffer friderick paulſgraue marque brandenburge prince electours intreated yt might thus decreed proteſtātes deſired alſo yt duke brū ſwickes caſe might haue ben cōpriſed ye ſame decree could obtayned themperour vrged thē eyther ſhould reſtore el permit vnto prouince ſequeſtration til matter tryed therof treated duke lantzgraue preſent theyr departure moche theyr deputy city fyrſt refuſed ayde french warre reaſon theyr intercourſe trade marchandiſe tyme prynces aſſented frenche kynges cauſe full hatred ſubſcribed alſo thoughe ſore agaynſte theyre willes eſpecyally nere vnto fraunce ambaſſadours duke luneburge wirtemberge refuſed alſo admonyſſhed priuately chaſtened woordes alone ſhoulde lette good reſidewe whan lātzgraue ready goe home came take hys leaue themperoure themperoures gentlenes lantzgraue moſt gentle intertaynement themperoure ſaid howe wolde trouble hym thys tyme ſerue agaynſte frenche kynge thys cauſe wolde bringe hym hatred whan thys warre doone wyll goe ſtreight waye agaynſte turke wyll make hym hys lyeutenaunte generall warre whan certen modeſtie excuſed abaſed hymſelfe vnmete ſuche charge haue done righte well euer nowe ſayeth themperoure bothe youre ſelfe others doubte doe v alſo ryght good ſeruice theſe wordes taketh hys leaue hym moſte frendely beyng full good hope ioyefull themperoure ſo moche hys good lorde whan declared ſame certen hys frendes retourneth home touching ſequeſtration longe moche pleadinge agreed landes dutchie brunſwicke ſhould committed themperoure hyghe magiſtrate tyll caſe heard determined duchye brunſewicke committed thēperoure eyther frendely ryghte lawe themperour ſhoulde committe gouernement contrye eyther paulſgraue electoure brandenburg moreouer duke maurice duke cleaue ſhall abyde thys ordre ſuffer penaltye breakynge publycke peace themperoure doe aduertyſe duke brunſwicke obeye ſame yf puniſh according lawes thempire theſe condicions laſt themperour propounded herin perſeuered thā proteſtantes ratifie ſame ſhalbe declared herafter aſſēblie ous finſſhed thēperour goeth frō spier mētz themperoures iornoy fraunce nowe armie aſſembled lorayne vpon border fraunce thēd may recouered citie lucē burg cōpoſition warre ther ſerued thēperour duke maurice saxonie marque albert ether thouſand horſemen moreouer counte william furſtemburge captayne footemen sebaſtian sherteline proteſtantes relygion whyleſt themperour mentz takē lorayne huberte erle richlynge germane ſerued frenche kynge beyng brought mentz condēned ſuffer coū teſſe hys wyfe whan ſhe comen thither fel downe proſtrate themperours feete coulde fynde fauoure nowe thynges prepared executiō length procured maximylyan ſonne kyng fernando themperour lately receyued thende obtayned hys pardon ſaued hys life meane tyme barbarouſſe eyther hys bufynes requyred ſo orheyng perſwaded kynge el fearyng leſte frenche barbaroſſue retourneth kyng ſhould conclude peace themperoure retourneth home ſo euer place sea ſyde apperteyned themperoure thempire inuadeth ſpoyleth biſſhop rome landes refraineth moſt lyke french kinges perſwaſion themperours armye marchynge forewarde taketh towne caſtell lyney three myles barrey thence goeth sandeſyre frenche towne ſtandyng vpon riuer marne kept ſtronge garriſon ouer mounſer landren captayne ſo valeauntely yere beefore defended towne landerſey themperour thengliſhemen whileſt theſe thynges thus woorkynge death • duke lorayns anthony duke lorayne departeth lyfe ſo moch age thoughte care tooke thys nere almoſte domeſticall warre fraunces hys ſonne ſucceded whiche maryed themperours nece chriſtine ſayde thys meane whyle kyng england ſendeth ouer sea caleis duke northfolke one armye marchynge throughe bollonois went beſeged mouſtrell maximilyan countiede bure themperours accorde ſerued kynge england immedyately ſente ſtronge armye duke suffolke layed ſege bollogne thyther came king kyngs beſegeth bollogns perſon frenche kynge appoynted gouernoure mounſer ueruyne man honoure whan themperour enuironed sādeſyre army maketh batteri bretch onſe made geueth thaſſault yt ides iuly townes men ſtode theyr owne defence moſte valeauntelye themperialles repulſed fyue hondreth soldiours ſlaine fynally ſeconde moneth tyme landrey gouernoure ſlayne fall houſe gunner wanted pouder towne rendred durynge thys ſeege renate prynce orenge beeynge ſtryken greate peece nexte daye whan made coſyn erle naſſow hys ſonne heire ended lyfe without great grief themperoure tyme deathe prince drenge proteſtantes ambaſſadours lorayne myght confyrme couenauntes sequeſtration latelye propounded themperour fyrſt reſted metz tullie ſendynge dyuerſe letter themperour granuellan declared rauſe theyr commyng themperoure laſt excuſyng hym ſelfe hys warlyke affayres bad go home agayne differreth whole matter next conuention thempyre ſome tyme conuenient whan sandeſyre taken themperour xxv day auguſt marcheth ſtyll leauing catalāne towne champagnie pitcheth tentes riuer marne ſyde wherof laye certen bandes frenche horſemen ambuſſhe counte willyam furſtemberge whyche counte willyam taken priſoner knewe ſytuation fraunce euery paſſage goeth foorthe nighte one man ſearche place ryuer myght wade ouer foorde paſſe theyr armie hauing peſaunt contrie bee hys guyde whan founde forde gone ouer ſyde intercepted frenche horſemen caryed theyr campe greate deryſyon withoute reproches ſeruinge caryed greate deale golde oute fraunce thence ſente parys thyng chaunced themperonre contrary hys expectation helde hym long ſuſpence french king becauſe swyſſes commen eſchewed battell themperoure procedynge foorth ryuer ſyde dayly auaunced hys campe thoſe partyes towne eperney moche ſtore victualles munition warlycke furniture whiche thynges leſte ſhoulde come enemyes handes conueyed greate haſte downe riuer coulde bee caryed awaye conſumed fyre frenche men themſelues eperney brunte ſettyng towne fyre wherfore themperoure withoute reſiſtance marched caſtell theodoricke towne ſame ryuer two dayes iorneye paris albeit frenche kynges ambaſſadours ſente entreate peace themperours campe yet marched forewarde neuer leſſe whan commen thus farre aroſe wonderfull feare amonges parys men welthe fled thence neyther coulde kepte backe kynges proclamation forbiddynge feare flyghte pariſians man ſhould flee vileſt ſorte remayned ſtyll therfore ſome daunger leſte greateſt citie europe exceadyng ryche alſo ſhoulde euen thoſe ſame haue ſpoyled ſame uninerſitie wonderfull nombre studentes al country chriſtendom fled alſo king dede proclamed alienes ſhoulde departe immediatlye vnder payne deathe thys begynnynge september fewe dayes kynge englande hauynge ſore ſhaken battered bollen hys myghtye ordenaunce rendred vnto hym whiche neyther hys father kynges former tyme could bollon rendred euer wynne dyd batter walles canon ſhot ſhake ſondre caſtell bulwarkes vndermynyng whyche wynnynge ſtronge place common practiſe prince alſo greate heuge morter peces whyche ſhotte ſuche compaſſe fell ryght downe looke lyghted brake downe beefore grounde ſo many wer oppreſſed ruine made reſt loued theyr lyues driuen kepe caues ſellars vnder earth laſt xxiiij day september thēperour maketh peace peace concluded betwixte themperour fraunce frenche kynge whan commen caſtell theodoricke towne soiſſons peace maker themperours parte gonzage uiceroye sicilie granuellan frenche kynge claudie annebalde admirall charles nulley gilbart baiarde condicions wer theſe ſoeuer hathe ben taken eyther ſyde ſyns trewes condicions peace nice reſtored agayne french kyng ſhall render duke lorayne towne aſteney becauſe vnder protection lucemburg ſhall aydeone ioyne al force together olde relygion concorde churche maie reſtored frenche king promiſeth ayde themperour turkiſſh warre ſixe hondreth men armes ten thouſand footemen renounceth title clayme arragonie naples flaunders artois gelderlande themperour agayne renounceth hys ryght countie bollonois perone townes ſtandyng vpon water moreouer lowe burgundye contrie macon promiſeth geue maryage kynges ſonne duke orieans lady mary hys eldeſt doughter el daughter hys brother fernando whether wyll geue ſhall declare foure moneches yf geue daughter promiſeth dowary brabant gelderlande lucemburge limburge flaunders holland henaulte artois namures friſeland utrecht hys dominion alſo hyghe burgundie hys deathe maye inioye poſſeſſe ſame yf thus doe kyng hymſelfe hys chyldren renounceth hys ryght millan fortune themperours daughter dye hauinge child duke orleans departeth poſſeſſion ryghte millan remayneth wholy frenche kynge themperoure ryghte houſe burgundie yf geue daughter fernando graū teth dowarie dukedome millan howe ſo euer mariage ſhalbe accompliſſhed within yeres ſpace kynge ſhall wholy reſtore duke sauoie kynge alſo permytted kepe heſdin themperour promiſeth whole endeuour peace maye bee made alſo betwixte fraunce englande concernynge duke cleaue beecauſe kynge quene nauarre affirme theyr daughter neuer conſented marriage alſo witneſſed contrarye ſolemne accuſtomed maner frenche kynge ſhall ſende proteſtation thē peroure within ſyxe weekes ſome thynge maye bee determyned thys peace compriſed biſſhop roome kynge fernando portugall polle denmarke uenetians swyſes duke sauoye lorayne florence farrane mantua urbine cytyes gene luke sene prynces electours al ſtates thempyre obedyente themperoure thys peace concluded themperoure dyſchargynge hys armye retourneth home bruſſelles men woondred thys peace makynge euen thoſe whyche themperours frendes famylyare hym loked moſt certenly conqueſt went fielde made theyr boaſt fewe monethes fraunce ſhoulde bee theyres three moſte myghty enemyes fraunce kynge ſhoulde commaundemente three moſte myghty enemyes themperoure germannes kyng englande ✚ ſixtenth booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyſte ❧ argument ſixtenth booke ¶ pope letter admoniſheth taunteth threateneth themperoure hys ſonne maketh new cardinalles clergie colon reſiſteth archebiſhop maſter peter bruly preachynge tournay brent quicke whileſt aſſemble woormes merindolle cabriere named uandois ſacked burnt pope notwithſtandyng counſell hym called burned deſyre make warre agaynſt proteſtātes luther wryteth againſt hym paynteth hym hys collours grignian ſente proteſtantes cauſe approue counſell archbiſſhop colon cited roome open warre betwixte duke brunſwicke lantzgraue wherin lantzgraue victory palſgraue prince electour receyueth goſpell bruites warre ſowen agaynſt proteſtantes colloquie ordeyned regenſpurge diſpute relygion broken counſell trente publyſſhed ſeſſions beginne meane tyme luther departeth oute preſente lyfe whan warres hoteſt byſſhop pope letter emperoure roome eyghte kalendes septembre wryteth hys letter themperoure wherin rebuketh hym ſharpelye vſurpinge ſayeth hys authorytie intermedlinge reformation relygion whiche neuertheleſſe dooeth aſcribe hys owne nature malycyous perſwations ſuch euell men hathe lately made league frendſhip threateneth thexamples dathan abiron core whiche wolde haue taken vpon authorytye moyſes aaron alſo kyng ozias god ſtrake leproſie wolde attempte burne incēſe vpon aultar telleth hym playnely hath nothing doe reformation church ſame longe vnto hys office chyefly god hath geuen authorytie bynde looſe proueth enſamples ſuche emperours haue aided see roome biſſhoppes therof god hath euer rewarded great gyftes benefytes greate conſtantyne theodoſe charlemaygne agayne ſuch haue reſiſted haue enemy romiſh church ben punnyſhed greate miſfortunes morys conſtans phylyp leo henry fourthe fridericke ſeconde whyche came vnto ſhamefull endes ſome taken ſome alſo ſlayne owne chyldren ſuche diſobedience kynges emperours alſo whole nation haue ben plaged namelye iewes grekes one crucifying chryſt ſonne god others contemnyng hys vicar moreouer wylleth imitate example greate conſtantyne refuſed iudg biſſhops cauſes notwithſtandynge coulde contente vſe hym coadiutour matter relygion herin head gouernour abyde hym fynally warneth frō hence pope abide ſuperiour foorthe treate relygion aſſemblies thempyre referre vnto hys indgement diſanulle abrogate ſuche thynges hath ouer moche fufferaunce already graunted thoſe rebelles aduerſaryes churche rome el muſt conſtrained deale roughly either hys cuſtome nature alſo beare yet wil neglect hys dewtie example god plage vpon helithe preſt euer eye hitherto hath vſed clementie father themperoure pope eldeſt ſonne thys ſerue muſt feele another waye therfore let conſider whether ſhalbe hys honour aſſiſt olde age recouerynge tranqullytie churche el fauour thoſe ſeke deſolation ſame thought frēch king ſet hym wryte thus extremely made matter odious reaſon englyſh league incenſe byſſhop herof cometh wryteth societie euel mē wont ſwe craue hys frendſhip right buſyly bothe letter great prince ſwe pope fauoure ambaſſadours eſpecyallye tyme warre eche laboureth hym ſelfe may bee hym moſt acceptable aboute thys tyme stephen biſſhop wincheſter ſet foorth boke agaynſt bucer verey opprobrious bitter wherin emonges thinges defendeth ſengle lyfe yere biſſhop created cardinalles chriſtopher madruce trente otto truckeſſe biſhop creatyon cardinalies auſpurge germanes george arminiack iames anuebald frēchmen fraunces mendoza bartholomewe cueua spaniardes gratifye emperoure fernando frenche kynge ſame tyme alſo calleth counſell whyche ben hindered heretofore reaſon warres agaynſt ides marche yere counſel called following becauſe themperour french king wer peace vttereth greate gladnes writte wherewith reneweth connſel beginneth place scripture letare ieruſalemin theſe dayes alſo cometh foorthe booke luther touchyng lordes ſupper wherin reneweth olde controuerſie luther booke lordes ſupper ſpeaketh many thynges agaynſte zwinglius fellowes ſame doctryne aunſwered zuricke ryght ſharpelye tolde clergie uniuerſitie collon howe theyr whole force reſiſteth archebiſſhop reformation religion procedeth ſendyng clergie collon arche biſſhop agayne ambaſſadours letter requyre hym leaue attende decree counſell yf muſt cōplayne higher magiſtrate fynde remedy quyet theyr conſcyence pacifye god wrath lothe take waye yf goo forewarde muſte nedes whan coulde thus preuayle ix daye october aſſemble head churche collon recyte wrytyng amonges thynges hath ben done wormes xxiij yeres paſt luther common aſſēt prince condemned themperoure decreed auſpurge regenſpurge latelye spyer theſe thynges neglected ſaye theyr archebyſſhop herman hathe gon new waye worke hath ſent bucer apoſtata twyſe polluted inceſtuous mariage ſacramentary defendour opinion hym hath committed theccleſiaſticall function hath appointed euery new preacher lewde euill perſons alſo fourme refourmation diuiſed ſet forth prince commaundement thinges haue euer theyr power reſiſted ofte deſired archebiſſhop woulde ſtaye vntyll counſell leſte vntill conuention thempire vayne nowe foraſmuche ſtate prouince lamentable tendeth greate vnquyetnes perſwaded neceſſitie doe flee laſte remedye doe appeale biſſhop roome themperoure hyghe protectour aduocate god churche committe appeale pope emperour theyr thoughtes vnto theyr tuition chief aſſemblye george brunſwicke duke henry hys brother prouoſt ſame college thynge knowne archebiſhop ſettynge forthe wrytyng ſayeth cauſe appellation done nothynge contrary hys dewty therfore reiecteth theyr appellation truſteth wil leaue theyr enterpryſes wil procede withſtanding thoſe thinges concerne god glorye amendemente church agayne wrytynge confuteth theyr ſclaunderous reporte luther bucer affirmeth neither priuie condemnation luther ſawe print conſented decre auſpurge luther dede condemned rome cauſe hearde violently tyrannically decree regenſpurge biſſhops enioyned reforme theyr church ſente bucer throughe meanes gropper ſo ofte ſo hyghly commended hym alſo could fynd nothing blameworthye greate tooken ſhoulde bee honeſt man themperoure amonges many choſe one colloqutours man godly learned louer peace ſame iudgement hath alſo reſt miniſters churche appoynted peace concluded themperour ſent byſſhop arras granuellans ſon frenche kyng cardinall bellaye ioynctely kynge englande treate peace vayne king refuſyng reſtore boloingue theſe day alſo ambaſſade kynge englande duke orleans cardinall turnon ladyes frenche courte came themperoure bruſſelles mutual reioyſyng peace themperour appoynted captaynes bandes spaniardes wynter lorayne contrie aboute themperours prouinces annexed houſe burgū dye many euery deſyrous know goſpel ſecretly feare themperours proclamation punniſhment thoſe party towne called tournoye chiefeſt amonge neruians thither came frenche preacher straſburge beyng peter brulie ſente one peter brulye mention made twelfth booke whan commen thither moneth september beyng gently receyued ſent began inſtructe priuately ſame cauſe went lyſle towne flaunders retourneth aboute thend octobre agayne tournay nowe matter brought lyghte ſearche made hym throughout al cytye gate kept ſhutte therefore preſent daunger coulde longer hyd ſecond day nouember night ſeaſon ſerten hys frendes let downe ouer walles acorde whan touched earthe ſatte downe grounde one laining ouer walle ſoftly coulde bad dew whyleſt thus leyned fortuned thruſte ſtone cleaued faſt morter whiche fallynge vpon hym ſate brake hys legge vexed partely ake legge partely colde could ſtyrre thence ſatte ſtyll bewayled hys chaunce miſerie hearde watchemen ſuſpecting dede came vnto hym take hym carye hym pryſon brute hereof came germanye senate straſburge ſendynge theyr letter intreate ſame alſo afterwardes ambaſſadours prote ſtantes wer tyme wormes ſomwhat late theſe letter came whiche ſēt name duke saxon lantzgraue dyſpatched waye xix day februarye 1545 brulie burnte tourney maner hys executiō extreme brent ſmall fire hys torment might ſo mutch greaeer confeſſed doctryne conſtantlye euen laſte breathe laye priſon comfortyng hys diſcyples letter fettred chaynes exhorteth thē conſtāt ſentence pronounced againſt ſhould ſuffer tranſgreſſing themperours commaundement many yeres paſt themperoure ſet forth moſt ſtreit proclamation hys dominyons awaye agaynſt lutheranes red euery yere twyſe leſt mā ſhould pleade ignoraunce whē ſent priſon examined ye freers wer diuines axe magiſtrate opinion hys examination ſacrament altare calle meſſe conſecratiō adoration hoſt purgatorye worſhipping ſainctes ſteewil good workes iuſtification image baptiſme vowes confeſſion ſynnes uirginitie lady wherunto aunſwered verey body blud chriſt receiued mouthe ſpirit fayth neyther ſubſtannce breade wyne chaunged whan ſupper diſtributed congregation chryſtes inſtitution vulgare tongue verely conſecrated euen wordes chryſt ſtill ſecret mutteryng wherwith prieſtes doe treate ſpeake breade wyne belongeth rather inchaunters charmer vnto chriſtianes popiſſh maſſe haue nothyng cōmon lordes ſupper ſeruice inuented men reproche iniurye chryſt adoration bread conſecrated idolatry worſhipped creature place creatour knoweth fynde non purgatory ſauing bloud chryſt forgeueth v treſpas alſo payne dew ſynnes therfore maſſe praiers applied vnto dead non effect alſo wicked aſmoche inſtituted beſydes god woorde sainctes better worſhipped yf followe theyr faythe vertues ſoeuer cometh beſydes euyll whyleſt lyued wolde permit worſhyp donne vnto therfore ought called mediatours ſame honour apperteyneth chryſt adames ſinne man nature wholy corrupted wyll weakened ſo withoute goddes grace doe nothyng good howbeit man regenerate dooeth god motion good tree bryng forth good fruictes faith bryngeth vnto v ſaluation yt truſt vnto god promeſſes beleue ſtedfaſtlye chryſt ſonne ſake ſinnes forgeuen v tradition whervnto mindes men bounden ar receyued haue image ye church thing full daunger idolatrie baptiſme ſigne league god hath made v wherby teſtifieth yt forgeueth ſīnes ſigne alſo cōtinuall mortifying new lyfe ought folow baptiſme thys sacrament ought receiued al men ſomuche little chyldren kept frō ſame alſo partaker godly promiſſion ought vow made eyther beſides goddes worde el cannot bee perfourmed man howe euerye man ought daily confeſſe hys ſinnes vnto god craue mercy moreouer yf ſcrupuloſitie trouble hys conſcience axe counſell miniſter church hys comfort conſolation auricular confeſſinge synnes hathe neyther teſtimonye scripture yet bee perfourmed tormentynge mynde ryghte peryllous perpetuall virgynitye ladie nothynge doubteth concernynge theſe thynges fewe dayes ſtode foorthe wrote vnto hys wyfe others hys frendes requyred thys vſing ſeruyce hys ſyſter whan condemned dye aduertiſeth hys wyfe letter kynd punniſhmenthe ſhould end life next daye alſo comforteth ſhewyng condicyō diſciple ought better hys maſters geueth certen inſtructions preceptes lyuing diuines paris made decree relygion two yeares paſt recyted conuentiō diuines mellon kinges cōmaundement mete mellon towne iland seine ten myles aboue paris kyng therby caſtell fountayne blewe commaunded aſſemble foraſmoche peace concluded counſell ſhoulde ſhortely enſewe myghte conſultatyon reſolue vpon ſuche artycles churche expediente myght thought mete bee defended counſel publycke showe place al chryſtendome ende whyche conſultatyon thys allbeit altercation amonges greate yet wolde alter iote thoſe thynges whyche ſetfoorth parys example pariſiās diuines louaine alſo draw article themperoures permiſſion ſet foorth article lovayne nomber xxxii ſame ſecte worlde bee paryſyans rehearſed thoſe doeth ye emperour hys proclamatyon confyrme ratyfye publyſhynge hys letter therof day beefore ides marche diuines wrytte howe tooke thys payne wyllyngly knewe ſame ſhoulde well accepted themperour hertofore requyred thē moche lyke thynge compoſytion peaſe agreed themperour frenche kynge ſhoulde vttermoſte theyr power reſtore olde relygyon terme thoſe thynges wee haue nowe recyted ſeme tende ſame ende cardinall tournon went duke orleans flaūders thought haue furthered much matter luther aunſwereth louain cōtrary theames luther aunſwereth thē louayne calleth heretickes bludſuckers teaching wicked thynges neyther defended reaſon ſcripture doe ad vyolence perſecute fyre ſworde bothe alſo paryſians propounde onlye bare propoſitions preſcribe wyll haue followed alledge place scripture proue incenſe magiſtrate perſecution aſſemblie thempire woormes themperoure beynge diſeaſed aſſēble wormes goute longe euer came theyre hys deputes cardinall auſpurge fridericke countē furſtemberg xxiiii day marche kyng fernando themperours abſence propoundeth wherfore thys conuention called verely eſtablyſhyng relygion lawe peace turkiſſhe warre ſheweth howe themperoure wyſſhed haue ben perſon hathe ben letted hitherto reaſon ſyckenes yet intendeth come ſo ſoone hathe recouered healthe becauſe wyll longer hynder common conſultation therfore hathe requyred hym commence thynge chieflye concernynge turkiſhe warre cauſe themperoure made peace frēch kynge thentente thynges beyng pacyfyed relygyon maye quyeted refourmed force power bee prepared agaynſte turke hathe declared trauell themperour hathe euer taken procure counſell fyrſte wyth clement vii bononie paule iii roome gene nice luke lately buſſet becauſe brought paſſe already hande trente themperours aduiſe treate relygyon thys conuention attende vpon procedynge counſell yf ſhalbe none thende thys aſſemblye appoynt conuocatyon thempyre ſame pourpos requyreth eſpecially cōſult turkiſhe warre aduertyſed ſondry letter meſſengers turke comming hongary greater power thā euer thentente may inuade germany let cō ſulte therfore whether thynke mete mooue warre agaynſte hym defende onlye ſhall determyne ſignifye ſame themperoure hath perſwaded biſſhop rome french king societie war truſteth alſo ye others proteſtātes make aunſwer behynd wherunto proteſtantes alſo archbiſhop collon palſgraue electour third day april make aunſwer cōuentiō appoynted chiefly religiō yt fourmer conuētions entrie acceſſe hath bē made come vnto agrement therfore hope yt ſhould wholy accord wherfore wolde right gladly begin firſt wt matter ſtate germany doeth require ſhould ſo yf feare god theyr eies doubte haue good ſucceſſe howbeit either weightines thing ſhortnes tyme el preſēt daunger turke wil permit yet ſhall nedefull decree concerning peace declared peace dede graunted religion vntill counſell acknowledg counſell trent lawful counſell counſel trēt vnlawefull ſuch hath ben promiſed coūſelles thempire doe accept haue oft time heretofore declared therefore haue nede peace doe depende popiſhe counſell may take place til ye matter godly chriſtiāly determined becauſe firme peace bee except execution law miniſtred indifferentli ſhould laſt conuention spier decreed theyr partes redy accompliſſh ſame therfore theſe two partes may decided wil refuſe conſulte turkiſſhe warre reſte prynces ſtates amonges archebiſſhopes deuiſe popiſh prince mentz treuers determine caſe religion ſhalbe referred counſell already ſommoned chamber eſtabliſſhed according auncient lawes thempyre iudgement geuen law written certē ſhould choſen whole nomber conferre turkiſh warre proteſtantes kyng fernando emperours deputes make aunſwer howe decree made spier touchinge peace pleaſed well enough without exception counſel tyme called ſhould beginne ſhortly senate chamber alſo ſhoulde mete men receyued accordyng decree made spier ſeyng thus reaſon wolde ſhoulde requyre conferre reſte turkyſhe warre againe ſaye inacted spier firſt ther ſhould bee troubled moue relygion ſecondlye thys diſſention ſhould accorded godly frendly diſputation vppon thys foundation reſteth peace germanye neyther wolde haue founde lacke yf matter myghte thus haue remayned nowe inaſmoche byſſhop hathe called counſell let diſturbe reconcilement wherin alone hys adherentes hathe power determyne whoſe decree alſo moſte men affirme foormer pacification ſhoulde bee finiſhed haue nede aſſurance howe haue euermore refuſed ſolemne proteſtation biſſhoppes counſell haue many yeres ſynce ſet foorth bookes declaryng cauſes ſame nowe albeit non exception made thys thyng spier yet caſe ſhould haue warre turke requiſyte firſt thynges quyet home people muſt pay monye thys warre equitie countenaunce man exact mony cōmons vnleſſe put ſure hope wiues child ſhal liue ſafely home religion euen cauſe doe warre agaynſt turke euery man goodes cōmon welth trew religion may cōſerued warre turke meane ſeaſō daunger home great differente betwixte theſe two therfore haue iuſt cauſe demaund ſuerty cōcerning chamber contēted haue ſayed eſtabliſhed accordinge decree spier touchīg charge ſame wil conſult reſt contended theſe thinges frō begynning aprill til vii day maye hearing themperour taken iorney king fernando differred thē tyll cōming alſo requyred meane tyme conſult reſidew turkiſh matter prince preſent neyther proteſtantes catholyckes ſaue cardinal auſpurge french kyng ſent thither ambaſſadour grinian grinian french ambaſſadour gouernour prouince fraunce whoſe abſence arroſe great perſecutiō thoſe party ther french prouince people called ualdois aunciente cuſtome doe acknowledg biſhop rome haue alwayes ſomwhat ualdois pure doctrine luther floriſhed gotte vnto thē gredely ample knowledge cauſe ofte cōplayned vpon king though contēned magiſtrate wold make rebellion kinde accuſation many vſe nowe day odious trewe certen townes uillages amonges merindolum one sentence geuē againſt thē fiue yeres paſte aignes high iudgmēt place cruell ſentence aygnes prouince ſhould bee deſtroyed without reſpect houſe ſhould pulled downe village made euē plain groūd tree alſo ſhould bee cut downe place made altogether deſert howbeit though thus pronounced yet thā put execution meanes certē men perſwaded king contrary amonges thē william bellaye ſame tyme kinges lieutenaunt piedemount ye laſt yere xii day april iohn miner preſidēt counſel aygnes iohn myners calling ſenate readeth kinges letter cōmaunding thē execute yt ſentēce geuen letter miner obteined meanes cardinal tournō fyt ſollicitour philip cortin cardinal tournon therfore receiued thē ye moneth januarie ſhewed kept tyme cōuenient worke feate letter red certen senate wer choſen execute matter preſidente miner promiſed aſſiſt miner preſidente aygwes abſence grmian gouernoure prouince ruled common welth euery kinges cō maundemēt muſtered men thengliſh warres vſed pourpos moreouer marſelles aygnes arles great townes toke vp able weare armure leuieth power agaynſte ualdois ayde ſente hym oute auingnon place aboutes biſſhop roomes dominion wherfore fyrſt impreſſion made vpon merindolanes countrye aboute towne peruſe ides april miner garded company noble captaynes commeth cadenet meane ſeaſon certen centurious ſet vpon village two riuer druence diſtroying al ſlaughter ſpoilyng fyrynge dryue awaye greate nomber cattell lyke alſo others ſondrye place ſame time merindolāes ſeyng burne rounde aboute leaue theyr houſes flee merindolans flee woodes wooddes wonderful feare reſte alnight vilage sanfaleſe inhabiters readye flye alſo byſſhop cauallon deputie biſhops legate appoynted certen captaynes go ſlaie nexte daye theygo little hide ſelues woodes daunger euery ſyde miner commaunded vnder payne deathe man ſhoulde ayde thynge ſhoulde bee ſlayne withoute redemption wherſoeuer founde ſame proclamation force alſo biſſhop roomes dominion therby ſayde biſſhops countrie fynde great part armie wherfore wente werye paynefull jorney carying theyr child vpon theyre ſhoulders theyr armes theyr ſwaddling clothes many woman great childe commē place appoynted thither alreadye reſorted greate nomber whiche loſt theyr goodes ſaued themſelues flyght long ſhewed howe miner came power geue charge vpon euenynge becauſe muſt goe thorow rough combrous place take counſel leaue ther behinde woman child fewe others kepe amonges miniſters churche reſidew appoynted go towne muſſie vpon hope enemye wolde ſhewe mercye multytude lamentable departynge woman child beyng deſtitute ſuccour ſighes ther fetched imbracynges lamentation euerye man maye eaſely perceyue whan gonne al nyght long paſſed ouer great hyll leberon might ſee many uillages fermes ſet ſyre minerius diuidyng hys armye two partes marcheth ſelfe thone towardes towne merindolum hauing knowledge eſpiall waye meriudolans fled ſendeth thother parte hys armye hunte oute came wood one ſoldiours moued pitie runneth toppe hygh rocke iudged merindolanes ſatte vndernethe caſteth ſoldioure geueth warnynge downe two ſtones afterwarde calleth vnto though could ſee ſhould immediatly flee thence ſelfe ſame time came two thoſe went muſſie ſhew theyr enemyes approched ſo cauſe miniſter reſydew leaft woman runne way ſhewing narrow way wood wherby might eſcape daunger theſe ſo ſoone gone soldiours came ſtreight way great rage drawing oute theyr ſwordes greate outcrye bad kyll theſe heretickes neuertheleſſe ſeyng men amonges abſteyned ſlaughter time whan done greate outrage ſpoyled theyre money vittayle leade awaye theyr pourpos haue handled ſhamefully beyng letted captayne captayne defendeth woman horſemen comming meane tyme threatened thē puniſſhment cōmaunded goe ſtreight waye miner forſake filthye enterpriſe leauinge woman dryue waye theyr botye cattell woman nomber aboute fiue hondreth meane ſeaſon miner came merindolum fyndyng without dweller ſpoyleth ſetteth fyre ſhewyng cruell fact miner one cruell example fyndyng one yonge man commaunded ſhoulde bee tyed oliue tree ſhot dagges goeth towne cabrier battereth cabrier yelded hys ordenaunce vſynge ſeruice capitayne polyne brought turkes nauie perſwadeth townes men open theyr gate promiſyng ſhoulde haue harme whyle whan ſoldiours lette ſlayne without reſpect eyther age womankynde many fled churche ſome place dyuers wyne ſellar caſtell beyng brought foorthe meddowe ſtripped naked ſlayne eche one men onlye alſo woman greate chylde miner alſo ſhutteth fourtye woman barne terryble example crueltye full
