ſtraw hey ſetteth fyre burneth ſely woman put theyr clothes therewith haue quenched fyre coulde ranne great windowe whereat hey wont caſt barne haue lopen kept backe pickes iauelyns burnt together xx daye aprill done miner ſent parte armie winne towne coſte whā marching theyr way found oute tolde lyttell fled wyne ſellar caſtell whervpon reyſed outcry though ben treaſon ſoldiours called backe diſtroy nombre ſlaine within towne withoute aboute eyght hondreth infantes eſcaped theyr furye baptiſed agayne theyr enemy whan thynges diſpatched cabrier ſente power coſta lord towne denyſed citezens ſhould carie theyr armure caſtell caſte downe theyr walles foure ſondry place yf wolde doe promiſeth obteine miner eaſelye ſhalbe diſpleaſure wroughte beeinge perſwaded folow aduiſe departeth intreat going farre meteth ſoldiours marche one notwithſtanding firſte daie yet repulſed next day aſſault great violence hauyng burned ſuburbes aboute take eaſely night many eſcaped ouer walles cordes ſlaughter committed ranne orchard caſtell woman maides fled thither feare rauiſſh euery one kept ther incloſed daye nyght handled ſo beaſtely thoſe greate belyes yonger maydens dyed ſhortely meane ſeaſon merindolanes diuerſe others wandered woddes mountaynes intercepted eyther ſente galeis ſlayne many alſo dyed honger moreouer farre towne muſſie named certen went hid themſelues caue vnder rocke nomber xxv bewraied ſmothered ſmoke burnt ſo kinde crueltie omitted neuertheleſſe diuerſe eſcaped bouchery came vnto geneua place nere therfore whan report herof bruted germany offended myndes many dede swyſes swiſſes intreate ualdois popiſſhe relygion intreated kynge wolde ſhew mercye ſuch wer fled kyng ſayeth ther iuſt cauſe hym doe neither ought carefull doeth within dominion puniſheth offendours aboute theyr affayres yeare theſe men ſharpe aunſwer kynge ſent kyng confeſſion theyr doctryne compryſed writing wherof yt article god father creatour al thinges ſonne mediatour aduocate mankynd holy ſpirite comforter inſtructour treweth church whych confeſſion ualdois doctryne ſaye fellowſhip god electe wherof ieſus chryſt head miniſters churche wolde ſhould remoued vnleſſe doe theyr dewty magiſtrate graunte ordeyned god defende good punnyſh tranſgreſſours owe hym loue alſo tribute cuſtome man herein excepted euen example chriſt payed tribute hym ſelfe baptiſme ſaye viſible outward ſygne repreſēteth vnto v renewyng ſpirite mortifycation member lordes ſupper whych ſaye thankes geuing memory benefit receyued throughe chryſte matrimony beyng holy inſtituted god ough inhibited mā good workes ſaye muſt obſerue exerciſe holy ſcripture teacheth falſe doctryne whiche becauſe leadeth v waye trewe worſhippyng ſaye ought eſchewed brief order rule theyr faythe affirme olde new teſtamente doe proteſt beleue thoſe thynges conteyned crede apoſtles finally deſyre kyng geue credyt thys declaration incaſe otherwyſe informed trew ſay wyll proue yf maye heard tyme king occupyed affaire warre therfore matter ſlept whē peace made renewed prouocatiō many brought thys wonderful crueltie ſhewed spaniardes themperour placed lorayne wynter ſeaſon wrought moche euyll thoſe party themperours cōmaundement depart thence moneth aprill trauelyng straſburge whē paſſed ouer rhm goe sweuia auſtriche three thouſande footemen thys tyme ended hys lyfe lewis duke bauier brother wyllyam hauynge chyldren ſo accorded ſhould marie kepyng together deathe lewes duke bauier thinheritaunce duke brunſwicke exceadyng great frendes chiefe captaynes league deuiſed againſt proteſtātes whan henry brūſwicke dryuen oute hys countrey fled fyrſt vnto hym thys xvi daye maye came themperour wormes next daye cardinal farneſius cauſe commyng cardinall farneſius cōming wormes able ſaye thought certentie came ſtyre vp warre agaynſt lutheranes nothinge openly comynge roome paſſed throughe lande wirtemberge whan ſtayed tyme dilling towne cardinalles auſpurge vpon riuer danubius torned way kyng fernando written duke wirtemberge ſake wold let hym paſſe ſaſſye ſhewe fauour myghte bee made aunſwer rather wolde take ſome waye neuertheleſſe doe hym pleaſure yf diſpoſed paſſe waye wolde let hym ſayd tooke waye came wormes one daye thē perour themperoure ſo ſoone peace made french kyng ſollicited prynces alſo helpe forewarde counſell thys cauſe ſente ambaſſadours kynge themperours ambaſſadour kyng poole polle requyring hym ſende hys deputes counſell trente amonges thinges ſayed aſmoche themperour ſuppoſed howe proteſtantes whyche ben euen ſtubburne wold forſake cōfeſſion theyr doctryne exibited auſpurge alſo obey publycke decree counſell thinge ſelfe requyred kynges prince ſhould take matter hande yf doe obey bee auenged diſturbers publycke weale godlye relygion amonges others hath comendation godly chriſtian kyng themperoure prayeth hym thynke vpon turkiſſhe warre ſubcribe counſell trente yf proteſtantes beframed amendement aſſiſte hym hys ayde counſell alſo kynges haue promiſed king polle agayne made aūſwer deſyred myghte ſee day whan chryſtian kynges kinges aunſwer themperour prynces ciuille warre diſcorde layde parte ſhoulde bende theyr whole power one agaynſte turke wold none laſt concernyng counſell proteſtātes wil doe thynges maye profite publycke weale trā quillitie churche neyther yf nede repuyre wyll greate daunger fayle themperoure hys frende alie ſame tyme pope moſt deſyrous war wrytten rome biſſhop notwithſtandyng called counſell ſente hys legate thyther ſo deſyrous warre agaynſt lutheranes hereunto promiſed aide xii thouſande footemen fyue hondreth horſemen priuelye alſo hyred centurion captaynes whan ſhewed hym agayne howe time farre ſpent great good could donne yere muſt tary ſome better occaſyon declared ſame immediately hys captaynes put hope next yere following morrow feaſt pē tecoſt frere obſeruaunte ſtireth thē peroure warre frere obſeruaunt italian made ſermon themperour kyng fernando cardinal farneſius biſſhop auſpurg granuellan hys ſermon makinge digreſſion lutheran inueyhed moche ſpoken diſpitefully againſt thē tyme ſayeth moſt victorious emperour laſte doe offyce certenly hathe ben delayed ouer longe thyng ſhoulde haue ben long ſince god hath bleſſed many great gyftes ordeyned defendour church wherfore extende youre power diſpatche waye peſtiferous ſorte men lawefull longer behold ſonne whiche doe thus pollute confounde althynge neyther ſay doe ſhoulde haue ben done already already ſaye long ſyns therfore may ther longer delay many thouſand people thinke daunger euerlaſting ſaluation theyr madnes whych god ſhall requyre handes vnleſſe fynd remedye ſayde granuellan moche offended thys trompete eyther fayned ſo el ſawe howe warnynge proteſtantes many day ſermō farneſius departeth ſecretly nyght retourneth rome great expedition theſe dayes luther ſetforth boke vulgare toungue intitled againſt luther boke againſt pope biſſhoprycke roome ordeyned sathan booke aunſwereth fyrſt byſſhoppes letter wherby ſo vehement wordes diſwadeth themperoure reformatiō relygion lyke haue hearde thoſe place ſcripture biſſhop doeth vſurpe eſtablyſhe hys ſupremacie confuteth moſte aboundantly applyeth make agaynſt hym booke ſet picture whych declareth ſōme argumente byſſhop ſytteth hyghe chayre hys handes ioyned ſtretched ſolemne apparel hathe aſſe eares aboute hym many deuelles diuers ſhapes wherof ſome ſet triple crowne vpon hys head tourde toppe others let hym downe cordes hell vnder neth hym hortyble holde ſome bryng wood colle others ryght ſeruyceable ſtaye feete may deſcend rightly ſoftely longe came foorthe certene theames hys whyche heretofore diſputed three gouermentes eccleſiaſticall politycke oeconomike luther theme thre gouernmentes whiche ſayeth god hathe ordeyned agaynſte furye deuill vtterlye excludeth byſſhop theſe condemneth oppreſſeth goſpell bryngeth vnder hys ſubiection lawes euen ciuile lawe aſmoche forbiddeth matrymony pleaſeth hym therfore calleth beaſt named germany beare wylde beaſte wolfe together nothynge ſayeth fierce cruell ſhe wherfore token geuen ſhe hearde ſtreyghte wayes men get theyr weapon intent maye kyll yf hapely ſhe ſhould take caue anye incloſure gouernour iudges ſoyle wolde exempte alſo defende ſhe ſhoulde perſecuted notwithſtanding ſhould let diſturbe hunter myght ſlayne lawefully ſelfe ſame ſorte muſt biſſhop reſyſted doe attempte moue warre lyke wyld rauenyng beaſt aide ſomeuer mayneteyned wil ſerue helpe theefe ought looke rewarde thynge deſerue thā alſo ſende foorth picture fonde dede yet propheſye thyng come biſſhop hys prelate apparell ſitteth vpon greate ſowe manye dugges whyche luther picture againſt pope diggeth ſpurres hauyng two fyngers hys ryght hand nexte hys thume ſtretched ryghte vp maner bleſſeth ſuche chaunceth mete hys lefte hande holdeth new ſmokinge tourde ſmell wherof ſowe lyfteth vp ſnowte wyde mouthe noſe thirlles catcheth praye deryſion blamyng beaſt full bytterly ſhall ryde thee ſaieth ſpurres whether thou wylt noe thou haſte troubled longe aboute counſell thowe myghteſt rayle thy pleaſure accuſe franckelye beholde nowe thys ſame counſell thou ſo greatlye deſyreſt ſowe ſygnifyeth germany theſe tryfles hys many mentaunted vnſemely hym verey modeſt hys reaſons whye ſo thought haue greater foreſyghte thynges certenly hys bookes diuerſe ſondry prophecyes wherof ende prooved ſome trewe reſidew yet hande god meane ſeaſon themperoure taketh order granuellan nauius hand proteſtantes touching counſel luther prophet turkiſh warre longe deciſion nothyng could concluded grinian french ambaſſadour becauſe vnderſtode latyn tounge conpryſed hys matter wrytyng vttered ignorāce grinian interpretour xx daye iune ſomme thys oration exhort al counſell grinian nere frende cardinall tournon thought haue ben occaſyoner thys ambaſſade ben themperoure bruſſelles ſayde treated matter concernynge counſell thus agreed kinge ſhould ſende ambaſſadour exhorte counſell whych themperoure already approued thys thought bee meane make proteſtantes affraid tyme dyeth fraunces duke lorayne leauing behynde hym yonge ſonne charles chylde two deathe fraunces duke lorayne yeres olde duke brother called niclas biſſhop mentz betwene childes mother chriſtien themperours nece arroſe contention aboute wardeſhyp al nobilitie fauoured hym lothed woman gouernement thē perours mediation bothe appointed gardins yet ſo mother authorytie chiefeſt thoſe dayes alſo departeth daughter ferdinādo maried two yeres ſon sigiſmunde king polle spayne brought birth charlesſōns kyng philyp glad tydinges birth charles themperoures nephewe ſonne kynge philip whyche cauſe spaniardes made greate ioye wormes dayes came worde mother childe dead themperoure wormes came marque piſcare broughte hym certen chiefe inhabiters millan thought themperour determined marye daughter kynge fernando duke orleans therfore ſent theſe men vnderſtande ſtate lumbardie whiche promiſed geue hym dowarye whyleſt themperoure helde aſſemblie duke brunſewicke goeth frenche kinge time fridericke rifeberge leuie certen power footemen border saxonie king england henry brunſwicke eſpying occaſion promyſeth perſwadeth frenche kyng incaſe wyll geue monie ſhall eaſely fynde meanes ſcatter thē ſo getteth hym certen thouſandes crownes neyther duke brunſewicke getteth monye frēch kynge letted rifeberge cōuerted monye receyued warre againſt proteſtantes ſhalbe declared herafter unto conuentyon came prince ſayde thēperoure paulſgraue electoure came alſo requeſt proteſtantes maketh interceſſion whan themperour ſaw wold graunt nothyng turkiſſhe warre vnleſſe obteyned theyr requeſte concerning counſell chamber ſendeth ambaſſadoure turke trewes gerarde ueltuniche man themperoure taketh truce turke verye well learned experte toungues duryng thys conuention senate mentz maketh inquirye ſuche olde cuſtome receyued eaſter baniſſhed towne founde herein culpable ſhewed howe clergie uniuerſitie collon appealed themperoure biſſhop clergie vniuerſitie collō againſt archebiſhop myght hereby hynder thenterpriſes theyr archebiſſhop ſtil proceded wolde diſplace preacher miniſters church whyche thyng chiefly requyred renewe theyr ſute themperoure making hym greuous complainte therfore aboute thende conuention themperoure hys letter publiſhed wormes receyueth hys tuitiō chargeth al men vnder paine outlawyng man diſturbe temperourciteth archebiſhop thē religiō right poſſeſſion againe letter citeth archebiſſhop within xxx dayes come hym ſelfe ſend proctour aunſwer accuſations meane time commaundeth intermeddle alter thynge yf haue chaunged ought reſtore hys olde place ſame commaundemente alſo geueth towneſemen andernake bonna lyntz campene theſe place chyefly archebiſſhop appoynted preacher inſtructe people agayne xviij daye iulye paule iii citeth hym ſame maner pope citeth archebiſhop colon within two monethes appere hym roome cyteth alſo henrye stolberge dean cathedrall churche collon hys college whyche noble houſes iames ringraue fryderycke weden chryſtopher oldenburge rychard rauier phylyp oberſten theſe bothe loued archebiſhop allowed ſuite reſt byſſhop roome dyuerſe yeres paſte miſlyked muche archebiſſhop whyche chiefly longe uergeryus byſſhop inſtinople beyng ambaſſadour germany comming time collon whan heard aboute reformation hys churche rebuked hym ſore bothe wordes letter accuſed hym whan came home longe diſceptation concernyng peace chamber turkiſh warre themperoure fourthe daye auguſt maketh ende pleadynge becauſe manye thynges coulde determyned vnleſſe prynces preſente themſelues prorogeth whole treaty vntill moneth ianuarye next followyng commaundeth prynces come regenſpurge vnleſſe letted ſyckenes ſayeth wyll hym ſelfe forſomuche deſyreth controuerſye relygion myghte bee accorded appoynteth conference learned men foure collocutours eyther ſide two auditours commaundynge bee regenſpurge kalendes december begynne matter aſſemblye prynces ſhall repayre thyther recyteth decree peace fourmer yeres confirmeth commaunding man attempt thing decre auſpurg contrarye taketh order howe money graunted yeare turkyſſhe warre ſhoulde leuyed reſerued reformation chamber differreth tyll nexte conuention parte concernynge conference learned men catholyckes refuſe neyther wold aſſent themperoure herein reſte doe refuſe proteſtantes doe repete fourmer treatye ſaye faulte treated relygyon ſayed beefore touchynge refuſall counſell chamber inferre agayue vrge decree spyer made laſte yere decree themperoures diſſenteth proteſte doe admit ſame ambaſſadours proteſtantes followed themperoures campe yeare paſt themperour differred tyll tyme ſhewed wherſore aſſemblie matter throughly determyned vpon condicions mentioned whē duchie brunſwicke ſequeſtration permitted themperour cōmaundeth henry ye duke trye matter law abſtaine frō force armes wyll aſſente thereunto hereof maketh proteſtation tyme themperoure againe chargeth hym extremelye vnder frowardenes duke brunſwick paine outlawing ſhold obey thorder taken diſobeyed alſo wrote agayne bitterly raileth vppon counſellours eſpecyally granuellan nauius content herewith ſecretly began gather men myght recouer loſt lyttell ſhall heare themperoure goeth downe ryuer rhine wormes collon thence retourneth bruſſelles byſſhop collon beynge cyted appere themperoure ſoeuer ſende hys proctour within xxx dayes albeit olde cuſtome germany priuelege prince electours bounden ſeke thē peroure withoute limites thempire yet ſent thither proctour ſhould defende hym time warre hote betwirte fraunce england mayneteyned aſwell ſea lande frenche king moche doe builded forte warr • fraunce england nere vnto bologne vpon sea coaſt intending cut theyr vitayle driueu fynde armye tyll woorke finiſſhed neuertheleſſe fyrſt diſcōſited great deale leſſe power engliſſh men cōduite erle herforde loſt theyr tentes caryage greued proteſtātes ſee theſe two kynges ſuch mortal warre together ſo many yeres peace wherefore knowynge proteſtantes ſend ambaſſadours fraūce englande ſhoulde diſpleaſaunte neyther partye ſende ambaſſadours fraūce chriſtopher ueninger iohn bruno nidepōt iohn sturmius englād lewis bambache iohn sleidan coming amiens tenth day septēber heare death ye duke orleans departed ye day ſhould haue ben eyther ſon inlaw allied thēperour declared wer moſt ſure bonde perpetuall frendſhip deathe duke orleaūce tyme maryage maner appointed kept died ſhort ſickenes yong man xxiii yeres age ſelfe ſame tyme duke henrye brunſwicke beinge furniſſhed armye duke brūſwick french golde ſayde hyreth bandes ſoldiours ſecretly aſſēbled beſides uerded aboute thouſande fyue hundreth horſemen eyght thouſande footemen goeth rotburge towne belōging citie breme myghte ioyne munition hys brother archebiſſhop breme hys owne gether labour loſt senate breme ſente thyther men defende place marchynge therfore countrey luneburge moche hurte waye commeth hys owne prouince taketh caſtel stēbrucke compoſition worketh moche miſchief coūtrie ſpoylyng fyreyng houſes ſendeth worde city nexte hym brunſwicke hanobrye minden breme hamburge ſhoulde recompence hym iniutyes done forſake conſpiracie smallcald ſo pleaſure cal el threateneth thē vtter diſtruction force aboute eyght hundreth horſemen thre thouſand fotmen whau ſpoyled burned coūtrie countie deckelburge fellow proteſtātes done moch harme paſſed ouer riuer uiſurge ioyne themſelues vnto wherfore goeth beſegeth warolbuttell chiefe caſtel dominion conſtrayneth people place geue hym theyr ſaythe othe meanetyme lantzgraue commaundement lantzgraue goeth againſt fellowes gathereth hys owne countrey nombre ſeuen thouſande men thre enſeignes foote men aboute thouſand ſixe hundreth horſemen thys power xxiii piece ordenaūce marcheth northeme thither came vnto duke erneſt brunſwicke ſonne philip ſent duke saxon thouſande horſemen thre thouſande footemen ſyxe thouſande leuyed hys owe dominyon xii felde peces duke brunſwicke vnderſtode leavynge ſyege caſtell whyche garriſon within defended manfullye tourned waye ſcrapynge together monye myghte gette payeth ſoldiours whyche readye ſlyppe aſyde marchynge forwarde encampeth hymſelfe calfelde whyche uillage myle lantzgraues campe thys troubleſome ſtate duke ericus brunſwicke mother wydowe iohn marque brandenburge ſonne inlawe duke henry certen others intreate peace lantzgraue saxon ſaye howe doe nothynge herein cōſent theyr fellowes therfore doe make ſuite duke moris praying hym perſwade lantzgraue hys father inlaw followeth theyr requeſte whan came campe duke moris intreateth peace xvi daye october propoundeth whole matter deſyreth myghte bee permytted treate peace lantzgraue excuſeth matter dyd beefore nexte daye certen bandes horſemen duke brunſewyckes came nere vnto northeme ſkermyſhed lantzgraues horſemen beynge repulſed ſhotte retourne theyre campe ſame daye nyghte duke mauryce ſollyciteth agayne lantzgraue becauſe hathe promyſed duke henrye hys frendes take paynes thynge deſyreth haue ſome condycyons propounded whych yf duke henry ſhall refuſe maye honeſtly leaue matter lantzgraue propoundeth ſuche condicyons doubte wolde refuſed duke morys ſendeth chryſtopher ebleb comerſtrate ciuilyan make hym offer meane came worde duke brunſwycke commyng hys power gette hille nere vnto lantzgraues campe lantzgraue came fyrſte thyther leauynge three bandes horſemen certen enſeygnes footemen defende campe remoueth hys whole armye vnto ſame hylle longe beganne ſkyrmiſhe bothe partyes whyleſt theſe thynges working ambaſſadours duke mauryce retourne ſhew hym ſkirmiſhe betwirte duke lantzgraue duke henrye aunſwered franckly committeth hym ſelfe wholy duke moris wil impugne relygion henſeforth matter beynge debate froe whan duke moris verey erneſt lantzgraue ſheweth hym howe thys onlye way haue peace put ſufficyente warrantyſe relygion yelde hymſelfe cuſtodye duke morys delyuer hys whole prouince vnto hym looke duke morys ſhal iudge hym paye charge warre harmes donne controuerſye betwixte hym cytie goſlarye ſame ratifyed theſe condycyons dooeth lātzgraue permitte duke morys interceſſoure ſhall propounde whiche yf wyll receyue conference herin duke saxon cyties bee nere ſayeth ſhalbe concluded thys commiſſyon duke morys ſendeth agayne hys ambaſſadours whattyme retourned bryng word good hope hurly burly conflictr together ther nothing ryghtly dōne therfore nede trewes durynge treatye almoſte nyghte lantzgraues permiſſion trewes taken tyme tyll nexte daye nyghte meane ſeaſon goeth duke morys talketh duke brunſwicke myght perſwade hym cleane refuſeth thoſe condicyons propoundeth others farre vnlyke communication vanitie duke brunſwick ſome duke mauryee counſellours within theſe three houres ſayeth hee ſhall appere whether lantzgraue bee lorde worlde haunyball ſayde scipio alſo brake truſe made geuyng charge vpon lantzgraues forragers wherfore lantzgraue hearyng condicyons duke henrye propounded breaketh treatye thanked duke moris paine xx day october duke brū ſwicke hys counſellours proueth againe duke moris requireth maye mete agayne conuenyent place betwixt campes lantzgraue wolde duke moris proclameth warre alſo agaynſt duke brunſewycke thyng tolde hym woulde doe vnleſſe agreed peace ſendynge hym hys letter mulluſe thys whan farre nyght lantzgraue ſent conrade hauſtē eyght guydons horſemen aboute twelue thouſande footemen ordenaunce hym ſelfe reſt force followeth accompanyed two duke moris erneſt whan day began appeare forewarde came certen ſtrayte vppon toppe hill far duke brunſwickes camp alſo lantzgraue reſydew hys armye ſore conflict reaſon ſtraytnes place whych could paſſed one way fyght good whyle doubtefull ſame inſtant lantzgraue ſhotynge hys ordenaunce conflicte betwixte duke lātzgraue repulſed enemye takynge delyberation whan found place alſo wher might paſſe lātzgraue auaunced ſome parte hys armye ſhotte amonges enemyes hys greate piece duke brunſwicke ſendeth trompet duke moris deſyreth comunication lantzgraue makynge aunſwer fyrſt bringeth armye ſetteth order battel diſchargeth hys peces agayne come two meſſagers duke henrye making lyke requeſt vnto lantzgraue made aunſwer condicion peace none duke hys eldeſt ſonne muſte come yelde themſelues vnto hym ſo doe well good yf wyll proue ſayeth doe thys ſhew hym conclude briefly goeth duke moris hād agayne father inlawe armye ſayeth conueyhed hope therof peace wil ſaieth henry ſonne ſhall ſubmitte themſelues vnto ſhall refuſe wyll trye battell whan thys aunſwer duke moris goeth agayne ſpeaketh brunſwicke lātzgraue neuertheleſſe prepareth battell ſtyll ſhoutyng ordenaunce approcheth nere hys enemye ſtayeth aboute fyue hō dreth paſſes hym ſendeth woorde duke morys cō rade hauſtē cānot quiet feareth leſt occaſyon talke duke henry ſhoulde eſcape awaye duke moris ſayeth muſt nedes tary till haue ſpoken praieth hym ſo longe abſteyne little whyle retourneth ſheweth duke henry plentifull teares wayleth myſerye wyll render hym ſelfe hys ſonne deſyreth hym wolde vſe cruell wordes towardes hym duke commen hys ſonne charles uictor lantzgraue ſayde vnto hym thy power thou art nowe myne thou woldeſt duke hēry hys ſon yelde themſelues ſuffer lyue longe wyll vſe thee greate deale better thy deſertes came thy mynde thou wouldeſt obey emperoure refuſyng ſequeſtration certenlye thys meane thouhadſt wel prouyded thee thyne ſpeakyng thys wyſe appoynteth thē vnto kepers thys meane whyle lantzgraues armye lyke haue bickered enemye lantzgraue duke moris greate expedition runnen betwixte ben wonderful ſlaughter duke brunſwickes armye pourpoſed depart wholy gether one companye becauſe daunger leſte occaſyon ſhoulde attempte ſome newe enterpryſe lantzgraue followeth ouertakyng vpon playne compelleth thē ſhould teare piece enſeignes promiſeth hym vpō theyr fydelytie ſhoulde ſerue agaynſte hym hys fellowes within theſe ſixe monethes taketh waie thē theyr munition nomber xviii piece therunto belongeth marching foreward recouereth caſtel stē brucke ſweareth people trewe hym commaundeth geue god thankes victorye punniſheth iohn schamburge otto ritberg erles aydyng hys enemie ſo diſcharging hys army retourneth home thys tyme dyeth albert deathe cardinall mentz cardinall mentz sebaſtian huſeſtene ſuccedeth hym biſhopricke maydenburge iohn alberte hys coſen germayne whyche hys ſuffragan therebe fore reporte afterwarde bruted duke maurice though diſceiptefull captious woordes ſhoulde haue brought duke brunſwicke bondage knowen ſetteth foorthe wrytynge ſheweth cauſe beyng requyred duke saxō lantzgraue coulde denye recyting whole matter order declareth ſuſtayneth iniury yet neuertheleſſe intreateth maye deliuered luther booke ſet foorthe exhorteth prynces wolde let goe theyr pryſoner thys victorye without bludſhed geuen god maner aboute thys tyme countie william furſtemberge whan coūte willyam deliuered ben priſoner paris vntil paying xxx thouſand crownes hys raunſome delyuered paſſyng flaunders whan declared hys myſfortune themperoure retourneth home themperoure wylleth hym eſpye ſome meane whereby thys dammage may recompenſed herin promiſeth fauour good whan henrye duke brunſwicke ſōne takē duke saxon lantzſſaue immediatly ſignifye themperour letter whole matter inaſmoch contēninge proclamation diſquieted germany newe warre require fellowes breaking publycke peace may outlawed fourme condicions sequeſtratiō conuenaunted thys laſt october ye lantzgraues letter thē peroure lantzgraue accuſing countie ritberge themperour making mē tion former letter whan made ſame requeſt ſayeth duke brunſwicke taken found ſondrye letter great importaunce ſecret deuyſes hys tentes ſhew well enough went ſome great miſchief eyther agaynſte kinge ferdinando amonges others ther epiſtle whiche prince electour wryteth agayne hym maye vpon ſuch condicions come league cōfederacy rather dewty vtter ſuch maner counſel doubtles wolde haue done promiſed vpon fydelytie haue kept cloſe wherfore let hym moue hym nomore matter henforth yf doe ſhalbe counſell theſe ſuche lyke thinges hath ſhew ſhall thynke anythynge concerneth hys perſon maye ſende ſome truſty man hys ſhal ſhew letter let haue copie ſame themperour beyng tyme bruges towne flaunders ſyxte daye nouember ſendeth lantzgraue nicolaus conricius themperoure lātzgraue meſſage heareth ſorte duke brunſwicke hys ſonne came hys hādes albeit wold haue wiſſhed accepted condiciō ſequeſtration yet ſeing matter cō men poynt ſuppoſeth nedefull puniſhe hym moreouer breakinge publyke peace hys truſte alſo wyll ſo moderately vſe thys victory man ſhall nede feare hys vyolence admonyſſheth hym moreouer accordyng auncyente cuſtome prynces doe intreate hys priſoners quyetlye honeſtyle neyther enforce vnreaſonable condicyon vnworthye permytte matter maye bee frendelye indifferentlye hearde wherin verelye hys offyce place wyll omytte nothynge becauſe neyther hys confortes neede nowe feare anye daunger hee requyreth hym dyſcharge hys armye obſerue peace yf haue oughte ſaye man socyetye warre ayde minyſtred wolde trye lawe wyll doe herein ſhall reaſonable conricfus thus declared xviii daye nouember lantzgraue ſame day aūſwered caſſels aſmuch duke brunſwicke hys fellowes haue moe wayes one broken imperial decree truſteth themperoure wyll playnly declare euill parte taketh thys theyr doyng one chiefeſt hys adherentes otto erle ritberge client whō hath punyſſhed therfore therbe alſo diuerſe others myght iuſtely auenged thentent themperour men ſhoulde clearly ſee howe littell hys fellowes loue trouble hathe done nothyng hath diſcharged hys ſoldiours ſeeyng thus tooke hand nedeful defencion deſyreth erneſtyle themperoure wolde banniſhe duke hys fellowes though taken yet hys adherentes bee punyſhed notwithſtandyng whych alſo wyll ſhew themſelues ſtyll lyke enemyes hys priſoners intreated metely lyberally touchyng reſt conferre duke saxon hys fellowes ambaſſadours whyche tolde ſente proteſtantes fraunce englande doe cō miſſion ſame tyme alſo thēperoure ſought make peace treatie peate beetwirt fraūce england appoynted daye bruges ambaſſadours kinges mete frenche kynge ſente mounſer annebalde amirall kyng england stephen biſſhop wincheſter could accorde meane ſeaſon ambaſſadours proteſtantes wrought ſo moch bothe kynges content haue treaty therfore ſend ambaſſadours frēch kyng arde kyng englād cales guyſnes mete mydde waye betwixt arde guyſnes xxvi daye nouember tentes pitched playne felde whan ambaſſadors proteſtants propounded certen cōdicions peace matter longe moche debated betwyxt frēch mē wolde haue bologne reſtored eſpecially vrged scotes myght compriſed peace theſe engliſhmen vtterlye refuſe matter reported letter meſſagers eyther kynge moche intreaty ther nothyng fyniſſhed wherfore ſyxte day ianuary amboſſadours 1546 kynges proteſtantes depart retourne home next daye frenchemen vitayled theyr forte kyng builded nere vnto bologne engliſſhemen would haue letted fought together many ſlayne bothe party king englande warneth proteſtants daunger fort vitailed tyme theſe āmbaſſadours proteſtantes englande kynge waye communication tolde howe lyke haue fore mortall warre therof moſte certen warned thē alſo wryte ſame theyr confederate one hys counſellours whych hygh fauour declared moche one ambaſſadours naming alſo certē practicioners meſſagers whoſe meanes chiefly thing wrought moreouer king ſemed take maruelous euill parte themperour yere made peace french king ſo moch offēded ſayd made warre frenche king throughe procurement reaſon turkiſſhe league moneth ianuarye proteſtantes conuented frankeforthe conſulted counſell trente augementyng theyr league charge warre brunſwicke howe forfake archebiſſhop collon howe ſolicite themperour aſſemblie thē pire wyll graunte peace relygion refourme iudgment chāber thys cōuention ambaſſadours archbiſſhop collon complayne iniuryes clergye commaundementes citation bothe themperour alſo biſſhop roome meane ſeaſon paulſegraue prynce electour ordeyned euery miniſters church preacher palſegraue ordeineth miniſters hys church goſpell permitteth alſo whole ſupper lorde mariage priſtes tenth daye ianuary ſtead popiſſſhe maſſe ſeruice ſayde head church nedelberg duche tongue wherfore proteſtantes ſending ambaſſade reioyſe therat geuinge thankes aunſwered archebiſſhop collon ambaſſadours ſo frankelye exhorte hym alſo procede profeſſe doctryne confeſſed anſpurge doe hys endeuour nexte aſſemblye regenſpurge peace lawe maye eſtablyſſhed wherunto aunſwereth hath bē euer deſyrous peace wilbe ſo long liueth archebiſſhop collō right ſory thus moleſted eſpecyally hys olde dayes therfore tyme ſhal ſend ambaſſadours themperoure clergie senate collon intreate hym wyll alſo ſende hys truſted theſe many yeres haue ſome agrement religion moch ſeeth matter daungerouſly differred neither theire greate hope coulde longer delaye wiſſhe expectation hys ſubiectes therfore hathe begonne reformatyon relygion whych pourpoſeth anaunce furthermore profeſſe openly ſeuententh daye ianuarye weſell mete ambaſſadours prynces electours named rhine thoſe mentz collon treuers paulſegraue coū te palatyne dominion theſe ſtretche vnto rhine paulſegraue vrged archebiſhopes mentz treuers wolde ſende theyr ambaſſadoures hys marque brandenburges intreate archebiſſhop collon fearynge get diſpleaſure refuſed thys tyme rumour brute war againſt proteſtantes noyſed abrode themperour ſhoulde ſecretly mynde warre wherfore lantzgraue wrytyng hys letter granuellā xxiiij ianuarie ſayeth howe reported onlie germany alſo ſygnyfyed oute italye otherplaces themperoure biſſhop roome make preparation warre vpon lutheranes wyll maynteyne counſell beegynne warres ſprynge yere howe intende ſet vpon archebyſſhop collon force lowe contrie germany vpon saxon boheme inuade high almaigne power italie themperour wil alſo haue ten thouſande foote men certen trouppes horſemen garde hym conduicte regenſpurge brute ſpread abrode commonlye alſo reported head captaynes centurion wherof ſome make theyr boaſt haue receyued money thē peroure already ſeyng themperoure hathe peace fraūce hath alſo taken trewes turke ſome affyrme many men doe maruell vſe pourpoſe ſhoulde wage men warre neyther hys conſortes whyleſt conſyder peace makyng norinberge confyrmed regenſpurge spier place eaſelye perſwaded beleue ſhoulde bee trew eſpecially ſynce haue done ryght good ſeruice bothe thē perour kynge ferdinando agaynſt turke enemyes alſo howbeit thought good declare theſe thynges frendly vnto hym whych ſygnyfyed hym hys fellowes many letter meſſagers maye like thinges reported themperoure malycious perſons hym hys confederatours whyche maye rayſe ſuſpicion cauſe trouble put bothe charge doubteth wyll make hym aū wer aſmuche hathe ben euer hitherto counſelloure peace deſyreth henceforthe alſo wolde perſwade themperoure ſame granuellan wrote aunſwer thys granuellan aunſwer lantzgraue ſeuenth day february themperoure hathe neyther made compacte biſſhop leuyed ſoldiours geuen money capitayne albeit yf ſhoulde haue ſome force aboute hym man ought maruel thys daungerous tyme doubtfull ſtate thynges whan kynges prynces nere aboute doe mouſtre theyr men ſhoulde reprehende hym yf fore ſee hys country ſuſteyne non iniurye ſayeth report vntrew alſo reſt ten thouſand men ſhould garde hym regenſpurge themperoure ready take hys iorney ſmall treyne hathe declared howe deſyrous euer themperoure hathe ben peace tranquilitie germanye yet ſame mynde ſtyll ſheweth alſo howe frendely gentlye hathe vſed archebiſſhop collon fynally wiſſheth vniuerſal common welth namely germany thinges ſafe fortunate aboute end ianuary lantzgraue fridericke paulſgraue prince electour mete frankeforte auſpurge receyuing intelligence oute diuerſe place warlicke preparation themperour biſſhop roome ſent sebaſtian scherteline man warre sebaſtian scherteline addicted vnto paulſegraue lantzgraue ſhoulde inſtruct priuely al ſuch matter therfore ſpoken eyther thē ſeuerally brought paſſe bothe came thither conſulte paulſegraue alſo accompanyed otto henry hys coſyn germane fewe dayes came thyther alſo proteſtantes ambaſſadours fraunce englande report ambaſſade ye lātzgraue fellowes next day fourth day february lantzgraue departeth thence goeth archebiſſhop mentz newly created whiche one germane mile amonges thynges intreateth yt nexte aſſemblie regenſpurge wold geue aduiſe coū ſell tranquillitie germany ſhortly diſſolued conuention franckefort decree made proteſtātes ſendyng theyr ambaſſadours themperour clergie collon intreate ye archebiſſhop duke moris saxonie league proteſtantes yet ambaſſadour chriſtopher carlebice gentelmā verey well learned immediately conuention ended went themperoure ſame time themperoure gelderlande ben aduertyſed proteſtantes conſpyred agaynſt hym franckeforte neyther wanted proteſtantes accuſed conſpiracie matter ſetters foreward cōmon ſaying powred oyle vpon fyre wolde ſaye theſe aſſemblies ſtates prynces kept hys contempte nauius ſent thē peroure archebiſſhop collon came thence archebiſſhop mentz paulſgraue waye fortuned talke renarde counte solmen man warre ſtoute courage touching preſent ſtate thynges themperoure aduertiſed erle tolde hym agayne thinges bruted themperoure throughout germanye vtterly denyed ſayde neuer came themperours mynde ſo much loueth peace al owne affaire ſet apart counſel thempire neyther doubteth lātzgraue woulde come vnto hym ſhould frendly vſed hys aduyſe ſo wyſe ſo maye bothe pourge hymſelfe hys fellowes becauſe happely wyll goe regenſpurg know themperours mynde preſently conferre hym comon welth meanes alſo maye ſuſpicion diſtruſt bee taken awaye reyſed miſreportes eyther ſide deſyre come thēperours ſpeache ſhal dee well come ſmall company maye declare therby fayth conſydence hathe themperoure lantzgraue aduertyſed hereof counte solmenſe xx daye februarye writeth nauius auoyd ſuſpicion ſheweth partely donne franckefurte declareth report went themperoure ſhould prepare haue warre amonges captaynes appointed marque albert leuie thouſād lantzgraues letter nauius horſementhowebeit erle solmen vpon hys report affirmeth vntrewe becauſe granuellan alſo wryteth ſame rather credite ſuch flyeng tale talked brode hys fellowes hope well themperour wil ſhrink conuenauntes decree spier eſpecially ſeyng cauſe geuen whie ſhould ſo doe come ſpeake thē peroure refuſe fyrſt muſt conferre hys leagefrendes ſom wold haue preſent talke many ſhewed howe themperoure appoynted talke coll 〈…〉 quie learned mē regēſpurg learned men regenſpurge commaunded bee begynnyng december proroged daye ides december thither came ſent themperoure peter maluenda spaniarde eberard billicke white frere iohn hoimeſter auſten frere iohn cochleus diuines many hearer proteſtantes came bucer brentius george maior erard schuepſius diuines alſo ſoure auditours kalendes ianuary came preſidentes diſputation moris biſſhop eiſtet fridericke counte furſtemberge length beganne conference xvii daye ianuary preſidentes ſpeaking theyr charge thynges cōcerning themſelues require diuines ſo graue holy buſines wolde followe affection treate ſyncerely hauynge feare god theyr eye reſpecte concord herin promiſe theyr paine fidelitie vprightnes recite howe thēperours cōmaundement doctryne proteſtātes exibited tymes paſt auſpurge ſhoulde communication treated omittynge thoſe thre firſt article trmitie incarnation word originall ſinne two firſt controuerſie thys laſte hathe ben ſufficientlye debated alreadye reſidewe bee treated vpon order iuſtyfycation forgeuenes ſinnes fulfylling law faythe good woorkes deſerte sacramentes purgatory praying dead veneration inuocation ſainctes reliques image monaſticall vowes mariage prieſtes choiſe meates holy dayes theccleſiaſticall tradition churche power keyes ſacred order authorytie biſſhop roome biſſhops generall counſelles theſe thynges declared proteſtantes conſideryng aduerſaryes matched requeſt theyr talke treaty myght written oute notaryes thentent themperour prince may vnderſtande whole matter argumentes probation eyther partie contrarywyſe preſidentes ſaye ſhould longe woorke ſhoulde ſuffice yf chiefeſt poyntes noted agayne ſaye howe nothynge whiche done maye vttered aſſigne forenoone diſputation muche debatyng agreed two eytherſyde ſhould commit al talke wrytyng ſame ſhould laied vp cheſte faſt locked ſhewed man except reſt preſent yet kepte ſilence theſe thynges doethe preſidentes agree ſo thēperoure content whō ſayed haue cōmaundement behalfe proteſtantes alſo accept vpon condicion ſignifye ſame theyr prince concerneth knowe haue willed wryte hereof whā thys order takē peter maluāda doctour paris beginneth maluenda treateth iuſtification fyrſte daye februarie hys preface ſpeaking muche commendation themperoure diſcourſeth large article iuſtifycation ſcoole maner bucer interruptinge hym ſayde agaynſt lawe conference order preſcribed themperoure confeſſion theyr doctryne lyeth hym maye take chapter iuſtifycation yf haue oughte ſaye agaynſte let hym confute order obiecte ſhalbe aunſwered neuertheleſſe procedeth ſo concludeth attributeth muche freewyll ſayde man iuſtifyed faythe onlye alſo hope charytie nexte daye bucer declareth howe article iuſtifycation accorded talke bucers aunſwer regenſpurge yeare ſynce ſheweth themperoure reſydewe prynces ſtates decreed touchyng ſame deſyreth ſame bee enrouled amonges recordes followyng order preſcrybed themperoure repeteth ſame artycle deuideth foure partes man iuſtyfyed god hys owne woorkes merytes freelye iuſtyfyed chryſte throughe faythe tyme beleueth bothe receyued vnto grace alſo hys ſinnes chryſte forgeuen howe chriſte hys deathe hathe made ſatyſfactiō ſynnes god doeth impute fayth righteouſnes theſe thynges doeth confyrme declare teſtimonies ſcripture ſheweth thinges agreeth maluē da confuteth hys argumentes maluenda carmelite billicus taketh place confuteth amonges thinges ſpoken bucer alſo iuſtification denyeth euer accorded xiii daye februarye maluenda aunſwereth bucer concludeth theſe three thinges workes doe diſpoſe prepare vnto iuſtification charytie fyrme iuſtifying workes men iuſtifyed doe accompliſſhe iuſtificatition deſerue eternall lyfe whyleſt treatynge aboute theſe matter xv daye februarie came themperours letter cōmaundyg receyue iulius pflugies biſſhop numburg pflugius amonges preſidentes amonges preſidentes nomber collocutours additours augmented extraordinarye men none ſcrybes appoynted ſuche preſydentes choſen promyſe kepe ſylence vtter parte conference man liuing reported themperoure ſtates thempire thynges accorded eyther parte ſhall ſubſcribe ſuche remayne controuerſie bee noted fewe wordes letter thus recyted proteſtantes aunſwer amonges thynges obſerue poynte ſo ſtrayte kepynge ſylence becauſe commaunded aduertyſe theyr prynces tyme tyme ſtate dyſputation whereaboute moche contention whileſt preſydentes ſayde muſt followe themperours cōmaundement proteſtantes agayne alleaged myght ſwarue commaundementes theyr prynces wherefore preſydentes laſt wryte vnto themperoure theyr requeſt meane ſeaſon duke saxon lyked condicions diſputation hearde thereof ſendeth hys men home agayne vnderſtande whole matter gonne bucer xx daie marche departeth alſo declare colloquie diſſolued doone lantzgraue whiche thing preſidentes tooke verye vnpatientely geuen warenynge ſuche preſente remayne ſtyll nowe diuerſe ſlypped awaye exhorte charge reſte wyſe attende themperours aunſwer ſaye ſeynge theyr chefeſte fellowes gonne inuayne tarye yf diſputatyon ſhall contynewe promyſe bee abſente papyſtes afterwarde theyr bookes ſetfoorthe rayle vppon betterlye ſame cauſe thoſe bucer aunſwereth full ſoeuer ſayde iuſtifycation man treateth moſte largelye wyth ambaſſadours proteſtantes ſente themperoure intreate archebiſſhop collon ambaſſadours thē peroure archebiſſhop collon ioyned ambaſſadours paulſgraue marque brandenburge electours theffect theyr requeſt themperoure wolde referre hys caſe reſydewe matter relygion ſtaye proceſſe commenced hys clergye yf violence wronge ſhalbe offered hym ſygnifye neglecte hym whan emperoure hearde utreyght xxvi daye februarye ſeconde daye march gaue aunſwer nauius declarynge good wyl borne hym hytherto howe frendely aduertyſed hym ſhoulde oughte doe whyche hathe contemptuouſly deſpyſed truſtynge vayne appellation whyche take place neuertheleſſe takynge theyre ambaſſade good parte ſuppoſeth procede zeale peace reconcylement relygion contente rather theyre requeſte vſe thys matter aduyſe counſell prynces next aſſemblye regenſpurge whyther nowe ready goe deſyreth theyr prynces wolde come thyther themſelues lyke caſe albeit troubled ſyckenes yet thentente ende controuerſyes myghte wyll refuſe trauell payne aboute tyme dyed alphouſus daualus marque piſcare gouernoure millane hys place ſucceded ferdinando gonzaga uiceroye sicilie ſhewed gonzage go uernour millane counſell differred trent vntill ides march thither ſent biſſhop thre legate iohn marimoūtayne marcelle ceruine reinalde poole cardinalles thither came alſo frō themperoure daye appoynted iames mendoza pope legate counſell trente spaniarde ſpoken moche commendation themperoure hys greate good zeale towardes counſel churche roome excuſeth hys abſence promyſeth hys endenoure furtheraunce hys name biſſhoppes yet commen oute spayne whyche themperoure called ſayeth muſte aſcrybed farre payneful iorney thys aſſemblye wormes cardinalles hereunto make aunſwer albeit neuer doubted themperours zeale towardes religion yet thys oration hys right acceptable much biſſhop trew vycare chriſt ſucceſſoure peter prynce apoſtelles conference themperoure hathe appoynted thys counſell refourmatyon publicke weale namelye germanye theyr truſte emperoure wyll ſee bee nothynge decreed wormes concernynge relygion al thynges referred counſel ſhoulde otherwiſe auncient cuſtome churche alſo lawe bothe god man ſhould infrynged moreouer ſhoulde euyll preſident wold deface whole dignytye counſell touchyng hym ſelfe hys preſence perſone ryghte acceptable therefore many long came nothing done yere certen freres made ſermons biſſhoppes tyme aduente preachinge freers bul perdonnes byſſhop alſo ſendynge foorthe bull indulgence ides december ſayeth miſerye thys tyme ſuche reaſon ouerflowyng hereſyes albeit take neuer ſo muche laboure trauell payne common welthe yet ſcarſelye ſatyſſye hym ſelfe therfore hath called counſel woundes churche myghte bee healed whyche made wicked heretyckes becauſe ſaluatyon men conſyſteth therin agayne father counſell beynge holpen prayer others maye god commended exhorteth al men generall immediately frame themſelues repentaunce confeſſe theyr ſynnes prieſt thre day weke tame theyr body faſtynge ſame dayes preſente diuine ſeruice caſe ſicke geue ſome thing poore let poorer ſorte oftymes ſaye ouer theyr pater noſter receyue sacrament unto al obeye graunteth pardon remiſſion theyr ſynnes cōmaundeth byſſhops declare theſe thynges people ſeuenth daye ianuarye whan number byſſhoppes wel increaſed begynnyng counſell beganne counſell whan commen cathedrall churche maſſe donne foreſayde cardinalles byſſhop roomes legate oration father wrytten wherin declare howe counſell called three cauſes chiefly oratiō pope legate hereſyes maye weded vp rootes dyſciplyne churche maye reſtored peace maye recouered ſaye howe whole blame thys preſente calamytie imputed clergie hereſies warre diſorder ſoeuer haue geuen occaſyon theſe euylles throughe theyr auaryce ambition naughtie lyuynge therfore iuſte iudgment god nowe thus contemned troubled afflicted yet accordynge theyr demerytes one dooeth dutye therefore admoniſſhe euerye man acknowledge hys faulte ſtudie appeaſe goddes wrathe thē 〈…〉 g eſedras nehemias repentaunce amendemente lyfe vſyng herein example eſdras nehemias capytaynes theyr retourne admoniſſhed earneſtly people iſrael confeſſinge father offence ſhoulde call god mercye come declare theyr owne duty whiche iudges thys caſe howe oughte free voyde anger hatred frendeſhyp geue nothyng affection aſcribe honour vnto god aungels beholdeth thys congregation neyther man thought hidde therfore muſt worke ſyncerely exhorte ambaſſadours kynges prynces ſame oration red decree ſinod iohn fonſſeca biſſhop caſtremarine spaniarde thys al chriſtians warned amende theyr lyfe feare god many tymes decree sinode redde confeſſe theyr ſynnes go ofte churche praie god publicke peace biſſhops priſtes addicte prayer alſo euerye ſeuenth daye leſte whiche called sondaye ſaye maſſe make interceſſion hygh biſſhop themperoure whole comō wealth faſt moreouer geue aulmouſe poore head churche maſſe ſonge weekelye vpon thurſedaie honour holy ghoſt maſſe time almen attentife vnto prieſte refrayne talkynge moreouer biſſhoppes leade ſober life fare ſumptuouſly table eſchew light idle talke vſe familie lykewyſe ſpeakyng apparel al behauiour maye ſhewe honeſtie much synnode hath thys reſpect chiefly darknes errours hereſyes haue ſo many yeres ouerwhelmed earth dryuen awaie light treuth maie ſhyne foorth al ther warned chiefly learned ſorte conſyder diligentlye ſelues waye thys maye beſt brought paſſe geuyng theyr voyces follow decree coūſell toletane modeſtlye clamourouſelye contentious obſtinate pronounce thynges temperately quietly ſitting fourth daie february wherin nothyng done ſeconde ſeſſion synode ſauing confeſſed article fayth daie appointed third metynge eyght aprill hearde moe cōmyng therfore thought good tarye authoritie theyr decree myght ſomuche whyleſt thys donne trent luther ſent go erles manſfelde ſet agremente betwixt wer controuerſie luther choſen arbiter piece lande nouer accuſtomed treate ſuche affayres onlye applyed hys ſtudye dayes hys lyfe becauſe borne iſſebie towne ye erles manſfelde coulde take ſo muche payne hys countrye came iſſebie whych later end ianuarye felte hym ſelfe ſkant well eaſe yet accomplyſſhe thyng came ſometyme preached churche receyued alſo communion xvii daie februarie waxed ſore ſicke hys ſtomake three ſonnes iohn luther ſicke martin paulle certen others frendes emonges alſo iuſtus ionas miniſter churche halle thoughe weake yet bothe dyne ſuppe reſte whyleſt ſate ſupper ſpeaking ſōdry thinges moued alſo queſtiō among others whether life euerlaſting ſhal know one time deſyrous learne hym ſayeth chaunced adam neuer ſeene eue whether ſhall knowe eche lyfe come tyme god ſhaped caſte maruelous depe ſounde ſlepe awakyng ſame whan ſawe axeth ſhe whence ſhe came ſayeth ſhe fleſhe fleſſhe bone bone howe knew uerely beyng full holy ghoſt repleniſſhed trew knowledge god ſpake thus lyke maner ſhall alſo another lyfe renewed chryſt ſhall know perfitly parentes wyues child ſo euer beſydes adam tyme knewe eue ſupper whan went ſide praie accuſtomed payne ſtomake began increaſe aduiſe certen dranke unicornes horne wine ſlept quietly trindle bed ſtowfe ſpace houre two awakyng goeth hys chamber laieth hym downe againe reſt biddyng hys frendes good nyghte hym wylled praye god wold graunt v kepe ſtill doctryne goſpell biſſhop counſell trente workynge ſome great miſchief whan thus ſayed al huſhte ſlepeth good whyle force hys diſeaſe increaſing vpon hym midnight complayneth ſtraytenes hys ſtomake perceyuing thende lyfe drewe nere calleth god theſe wordes god heauenly father father oure lord ieſus chryſt god al conſolatiō geue thankes luther laſt prayer thou haſt reuealed vnto thy ſonne ieſus chryſt whō haue beleued haue profeſſed haue loued haue ſet foorthe honored biſſhop roome al wicked rabel doe perſecute diſhonour beſeche thee lord ieſus chryſt receyue ſoule heauēly father although taken thys lyfe albeit muſt leaue thys body yet know aſſuredly ſhall remayne thee euer noman take thy handes long thys prayer ſayde whan quiet departure luther one twyſe cōmended hys ſoule handes god though fallen ſlepe little littel departeth oute lyfe withoute paine hys body could perceyued thus dyed hys owne natyfe countrey whyche ſeene manie yeres xviii daye februarye greate lamentation many erles manſfelde deſirous myght haue ben buried theyr countrey becauſe borne commaundemēt prince electour honorably caried wittemberge buryed fyft daye yeres aboute lxiii borne yeare oure lorde thouſande iiii hondreth luther birthe foureſcore three tenthe daye nouember ryght honeſt good parentes iohn margarite learned hys fyrſt prynciples home thence beynge ſente maydēburge iſenacke farre excelled hys fellowes came erford gaue hym ſelfe wholie ſtudye logicke philoſophye whan ben whyle makyng neyther parētes frēdes priuie profeſſed hym ſelfe college auſten freres applyed hys ſtudye ſcripture forſakyng lawe whyche ſtudied time uniuerſitie newly erected wittemberge wherefore stupicious mention made fyrſte booke hauynge charge hereof bryngeth luther thyther reade diuinitie luther ſent roome conuente luther ſent rome hys order aboute ſuite hanged lawe thys yere lord mdx whan retourned home motion hys frendes commenced doctour charge duke fridericke force plētie eloquence luther eloquence dutche tongue workes doe ſufficiently declare certenly dutch toungue beautifyed enryched exceadingly hathe chiefe commendation therin hathe tranſlated latin toungue ſuch thynges thought vnpoſſible expreſſeth matter moſt apte proper termes many tymes one worde ſetteth youre eye whole matter wryteth certeine place biſſhop howe hathe polluted lordes ſupper hathe alſo applied maſſe dead ſayeth hathe pearſed hys maſſe corner chriſtendome alſo purgatorye ſelfe vſeth dutche word whyche repreſenteth noiſe wont made whan man doeth rattle ſhake together nomber dead men bone caſt aboute amonges courage inuincible tyme beganne fyrſte preache agaynſt pardon knewe matter mente hym ſelfe confeſſeth inuincible conſtā cie luther thing therfore wrote verey lowly bothe biſſhop others whan profited knowledge ſcripture dayly perceyued doctryne agreable god worde withſtode violence hys enemy malice whole world moſt ſtoute courage lyke awalle braſſe remayned ſtyll vnmouable deſpyſynge daunger whan themperoure helde counſell ſtates imperyall auſpurge immediately crowned bononie clement ſeuenth terrible tempeſt lyke enſwe ſeuenth booke ſpecifyed couinfort bothe hys frendes priuately others openly applying thys pourpoſe xlvi pſalme god ſayeth oure ſure caſtell bulwarke olde enemye mankynde taketh matter hande hys force power layeth hys munition indede power ſmall neyther longe ſuſteyne ſo greate violence howbeit noble champion god hym ſelfe hath choſen vnto hym hathe put armure fyghteth v knowe forcertentie ieſus chryſt muſte nedes haue victory conqueſt albeit whole compaſſe thys worlde full deuilles yet affrayde moſt aſſured confidence doe looke ioyefull ſucceſſe although sathangnaſſhe hys teethe rage neuer ſo fierſely yet ſhall nothyng preuayle agaynſte v iudged already throughe worde falleth downe hys armure thys worde ſhall victory conqueſt word aduerſaryes take v nyll ſhall leaue behynde tentes armye ſpirite gyftes defendeth v yf take awaie lyfe goodes wife chilchildren take patiently winne nothyng therby v prepared kyngdome euerlaſtynge pſalme whiche tyme applyed relyeue ſorrowe heuynes whan tranſlated vulgare toungue ſomethynge wraſtynge ſence made alſo metre ſet note verye conſonant argument mete tune ſtyre vp minde ſo euer ſynce tyme thys pſalme hathe alſo muche ſonge amonges others ſuche decree made auſpurge aſcribeth blame therof booke ſetfoorthe afterwarde clement ſeuenth hys legate campegious ſpeaketh honoure good themperoure whoſe name authorytie vſed clooke reporteth hym bee blameles ✚ ſeuententh booke sleidanes commentaryes concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument ſeuententh booke iohn diaze beyng ſent ioinetly bucer colloquie regenſpurge murthered hys owne brother alphonſe lantzgraue commyng themperours ſpeche declareth vnto hym condition counſell whyche proteſtantes requyre afterward makyng excuſe cannot come aſſemblee taketh hys leaue frendly themperour sentence excommunication thondereth roome againſt archebiſſhop collon thē peroute couertly maketh preparation warre germany thoſe counſel trent make theyr decree peter dane ambaſſadour frenche kynge themperoure ſoliciteth certen city germany alſo swyſſes polycye vnderſtand proteſtantes hauinge intelligente hereof take theyr weapon tenure league betwixt pope themperour recyted themperour ſo vrged pope letteth alone turke falleth vpon proteſtantes caſtell erenberge tonauert ſurpryſed themperoure hys letter patentes banniſſheth duke saxon lantzgraue pope armye commeth ayde themperoure lyttle mention made conference iohn diaze spaniard regenſpurge iohn diazius spaniarde wente thyther bucer ben many yeres ſtudent paris diuinitie sarbonites red bookes luther others dilligentlye ſtudied ſcriptures doctryne began waxe vyle euery day laſt thentent might profit ſo much leauing paris went geneua caluine miniſter churche whan remained went straſburge becauſe bucer perceiued much learnyng erneſt zeale monethes whan ſhould go diſputation regenſpurge moued ſenate appoint companion felow iorney commyng therfore regenſpurge moneth december goeth peter maluenda knewe diaze goeth maluenda paris one amaſed bewayleth lamenteth ſee theſe party company proteſtantes whiche wil trihumphe one spaniard allured vnto opinion fewe spaniardes loue goſpell great meany thouſandes germanes therfore begā admoniſh wold haue reſpect name ſo ſhamefullye ſtaine ſpot countrey honeſt familie diazius aunſwereth hym modeſtly commendyng proteſtantes doctrine ſo departeth tyme whā came againe fewe day accorded maluenda planteth al ordenaunce myght put hym feare ſpeaking many thinges authoritie biſſhop roome rekeneth vp large daungerous thing curſe becauſe themperoure ſhould come thyther ſhortely aduiſeth tary hys commyng perchaunce daungerous counſelleth hym goe mete waye fallinge downe feete themperours confeſſour craue perdon hys offence promiſeth furtherance hym herein wherunto diazius aunſwereth ſtoutely throughlye ſayeth howe doctryne proteſtantes conſonant doctrine apoſtels prophetes lamenteth miſerye spayne nat countrey ſo great darkeneſſe rebuketh maluenda fellowes impugne manifeſt veritie geue themperoure euill counſell erneſtly warneth leaue refuſeth counſell ſheweth hym wyl god helpe profeſſe thys holſome doctryne wyll refuſe daunger hys lyfe therefore whan maluenda ſawe hym ſo ſtrongelye confyrmed thy commyng hither ſayeth vayne ſhalbe nothing determined yf liſte doe good openly ſeme boaſt ſhoulde haue gone trente metinge diazius came nomore hys company maluenda wryting letter themperours cofeſſour repeteth whole matter exhorteth moſt erneſtly helpe diſeaſe tyme theſe letter delyuered spaniard marquina whiche came lately roome vnderſtandyng accuſation beganne excuſe diazius marquins excuſeth diaze knew verye wel dayes retourneth home agayne declarech matter diazius brother alphonſus lawyer roome hearde themperours confeſſour meane ſeaſon diazius went regēſpurge nuburge towne otto henry paulſgraue ſtandyng riuer thonawe twelue myles aboue regenſpurge cauſe hys goynge thyther ouerſee correction booke bucer ſent thyther prynted hys brother alphonſus kyndled tale marquina haply alſo letter ſom others beſides brother alphonſe coeth germany immediately prepareth ſelfe take iorney greate haſt cometh firſt auſpurge thence regenſpurge whā vnderſtode diazius haſteth thyther hym marueled lyttell ſodan comming declareth cauſe vſeth maner ſelfe ſame argumentes reaſons maluenda regenſpurge whan aſſayed vayne traytorous mind alphonſe promiſeth hym greate yerely penſion hys benefyces ſo wil goe roome wolde take place nother certen dayes confeſſeth himſelfe vanquiſſhed fayneth though loued doctrine goſpel exhorteth leauing germany hath aboundance learned men nedeth hys trauell wolde goe italye maye profit many firſt ſhall come trent many men ſingular learnynge iudgement wilbe right glad hys company goe roome naples ſo ſhall come paſſe many ſhalbe ryghtly inſtructed hym ſondrye place italye occaſyon ſame doctryne maye ſet forth alſo spayne therfore prayeth beſecheth hym follow aduiſe herein promiſeth beare hys charge ſo euer nedefull beſydes diazius ſtriken great ioye gladnes reioyſeth bothe hys owne cauſe alſo hys brother ſendyng letter regenſpurge vnto bucer reſt requyreth haue theyr counſell write agayne admoniſſhe hym goe hym wherfore alphōſus put quite beſyde hope deſyreth hym leſte wiſe goe hym farre auſpurge whyleſt gere brewyng bucer commeth nuburge intendynge goe home ſayde counſelleth hym ſturre one foote thence himſelfe departeth alphonſus gon whiche xxv daye marche daye alphonſus went thēce talked brother moſt curtoiſely exhorteth hym vnto conſtancie thynketh hym ſelfe happye man hath profited ſo muche fewe dayes throughe hys talke trewe knowledge god prayeth hym wolde wryte vnto hym ofte promiſeth good wyll cauſeth hym take xiiij duckates whether wolde noe thus ſheding teares eyther ſyde departeth riding wagon auſpurge ſixe myles nuburge next daye tarying lettinge alphonſe retourneth nuburge kill brother wagoner flattering woordes rewardes myght hym taketh ſame waye came bying hatchet waye carpenter xxvii daye marche dawenyng daye commeth agayne nuburge leauynge hys horſes without gate poſte auſpurge whō brought hym goeth towne accompanyed man murtherer commeth hys brother lodging ſeruant leſt ſhould ſtreyght way knowen put apparell meſſē ger poſteth letter going knocketh dore axeth diazius vnto hath letter let goeth vp hys chamber alphonſus taryed benethe ſtayre foote watching man ſhoulde let theyr enterpriſe diazius awakyng hearyng ſaye meſſenger commen hys brother leapeth bed hauynge nothyng vpon hym hys clooke caſte aboute hym hys nyghte gere goeth foorthe dynyng chamber next laye commeth letter delyuereth ſkarce lyght daye effect letter howe verye carefull daunger let hym well ware maluenda ſuche enemy goſpell whyleſt diazius readynge murtherer ſtandyng behynd backe letteth dryue hatchet hyd vnder hys clooke hys myght ſtrake murtherer killeth diaze ryght ſyde hys head vp healue ſo hauing ſodainly hys braynes thus clouen ſonder neuer ſpake worde murtherer leaueth axe ſtickyng ſtyll wounde getting hym quickly downe ſtayres immediatlye principall maſter haſteth towne leaping vpon theyr horſes ready gate cōmen exceadyng great ſpede bothmey bayting towne mid waye beetwixt nuburge auſpurge takyng freſhe horſes whiche leaſte pourpoſely come auſpurge ſame chamber diazius ded ly one claudius cenarcleus yonge gentleman cladius senaclyus sauoye murther ſo ſecretly done nexte chamber perceiued nothing vntil ſuche time hearde ſpurres ſtrike ſtayres whan murtherer ranne haſtely downe thā aryſyng came forthe ſawe miſerable heuy ſight brute miſcheuous dede facte moſte horrible immediately ſpred abroade throughout nuburge diuerſe prince ſeruauntes loued diazius tooke horſes purſued whan cōmen auſpurge coulde fynde thē cleane hope determine retourne backe agayne one whiche elder ſtouter reſte called michell herffer rideth forthe wonderfull ſpede reſt village werines iorney getteth came ſonner inſprucke declareth whole matter maieſtrate whan came alſo longe cauſed apprehended accuſeth murther writing prince otto henry counte palatine aduertiſeth hym howe taken whervpon prince ſent two counſellours frō nuburge inſprncke playde caſe taking poſte horſes came thither kalendes aprill put matter doubt bring night cappe diazius bluddy hatchet ſlewe brother letter fore came alphōſus gotē leaue write frēdes caſe ſtoode ſecond day aprill whan ambaſſadours nuburge cōmen magiſtrate informed hym whole matter requyred myghte bee put executyon yf wyll ſtande denyall facte might racked magiſtrates referred matter iudges came murtherers permitted take aduocates pleade thoſe matter differred day daie laſt plaintines commaunded exhibite theire accuſation latin spaniſſhe thys came themperours letter went regenſpurge wherin themperours letter paracide commaunded ſurceaſe let proceſſe alone brother haue hearyng matter regenſpurge whē coulde obteyne none aunſwer otto henry electour palatine intreate senate inſprinke vpon ſufficient pledge ſend defendauntes nuburge murther committed make excuſe thēperous letter time thys murther donne themperoure came spyer goynge regenſpurge waye bipounte whyche towne prynce wuolfangus paulſgraue wife lātzgraues thēperoure viſiteth lantzgraue hys daughter daughter laye chylde bed themperour went viſyte geuyng moſte gentle comfortable woordes dealeth great rewardes amonges woman hauyng woorthye gyfte readye hande geue ladye ſelfe ſendeth backe spier whyther came ende marche lantzgraue admoniſſhed nauius ſayde mete themperoure waye goyng regenſpurge ſame woord ſent hym granuellan moneth februarye whan thē peroure utrecht vpon maſe wherfore receiuing ſaufecō duite thēperoure came spier thither came alſo paulſgraue lantzgraue commeth thē peroure electour wyllyam manſbach ambaſſadour duke wyrtemberge xxviii daye marche goeth lantzgraue themperoure talkynge hym priuately chauncelour whan tolde cauſe occaſion hys comming one place germany alſo foreine nation reported moſte myghty emperoure throughe byſſhop roomes procurement ſhulde mynd great diſpleaſure proteſtantes goeth abrut alſo concluſyon peace ſhuld haue perſwaded french kyng ayde punniſſhyng ſame moreouer ſollicite turke trewes may ſo muche eaſelyer brynge youre pourpos paſſe therefore ſaye biſſhop hathe called cōmaunded counſell vpon decree made haſte matter myght put execution maketh v rather think report trewe ſee howe erneſtly buſyly ſuite procedeth againſte archebiſſhop collon certenly foraſmuche haue ayded chargeablye againſt french kyng turk offered doe declared spier becauſe haue donne alſo euer aunceters accuſtomed moreouer inaſmuche haue graunted v large warrauntes concerninge peace law bothe regenſpurg spier theſe thinges chaunce v beyonde expectation yet truſt departe germany wyll cauſe relygion eſtabliſhed preſcripte goddes woorde prouinciall counſell germany caſe diſſention throughly accorded yet peace whiche promiſed v spier wold commaunde wholy obſerued ſuche wyſe bee neyther chaunged taken awaye decree counſell hereunto themperoure aunſwereth nauius howe ſondrie reportes haue commen hys eares alſo ſhould attempte ſome enterpryſe yet wolde credite ſame eſpeciallye hearde hys letter written nauius nowe alſo beleueth muche leſſe concernynge whyche ſpake frenche kynge man able proue hathe peaſe nothynge el guiſe fraunce braue bragge matter bee vayne moued turke trewes chiefly loue germany ſeyng ſondrie aſſemblyes thempire complayned greate charge pouertye people thought beſt waye relyeue duryng tyme trewes myght conſulte make war agaynſte ſet order religion herein yet nothyng determyned hereof muſt conferre hys brother fernando counſell haue ſo many yeres requyred nowe throughe hys greate ſuite labour aſſembled ſo euer hathe done therin hathe donne good affectyon publicke weale ſome perchaunce taketh otherwiſe well donne hathe vſed archebiſſhop collon frendlye coulde abyde delaye hys preparatyon warre ſeeth preſētly man houſholde ſeruauntes neyther doeth gather power cauſe whie ſent ſuppoſeth man deſireth peace therfore requireth declare fantaſye howe relygion may appeaſed thinketh maye obteyned fellowes liſt wil appoint coūſel cō ferre ye matter thē lantzgraue ſpeaking himſelfe yf laye noble emperoure doe anye thynge welthe lantzgraue theperoure germanye maynteynge amytye beetwene ſtates thempire certenly wold ſpare paine cauſe chiefly came hither wiſſhed ſurelye haue ſome moe fellowes could ſhortnes tyme duke saxō farre iames sturmius troubled ſicknes beleue ryghte well haue hearde ſondrye reportes doubteles trewthe ſo wrote nauius conſultation agaynſt frankefurte treated onlie howe myght bothe perſeuer oure relygion alſo repulſe vniuſte violence french king ſhewed v affinitie duke orleans king promiſed ayde againſt v many wiſe mē marueled ſued turke trewes ſuppoſed lyght cauſe moued ſo doe eſpeciallye hauyng peace frenche kyng foraſmuche ſaye done common welthes ſake haue nothyng obiecte againſt germany nede longe ſynce haue ben vnburthened ſuche charge deſyred counſell treweth ſo ſame free godly holded germany doe counſell proteſtantes deſyred eſteme thys trent ſuche ſufficientlye declare vnto woormes ſhewe waye howe accorde relygion maye withoute aduiſe manye fellowes perceyue well ſhould haue ſmall thanke neyther partie yet refuſe conferre counſell herein ſo preiudiciall haue dede hope counſel others ſecluded biſſhoppes onlye ſuch others biſſhop roomes ſworne men ſhall determyne thynges ſuppoſe ſynode germany ſhulde vnprofitable yet nation differ muche v opinion doctrine thyng ſo farre entred germany altered therfore nothyng better yf woulde permit relygion free yet ſo men ſhulde obſerue peace ſuppoſe ordeyned colloquie regenſpurge verye good intent heare ſom preſent freers diſturbers peace howe certen bitter freers call agayne queſtyon article already accorded ſo naughtye lyfe withal good looked theyr handes archebiſſhop collon doubteles goodman ſo euer dooeth thys matter ſuppoſeth bee hys dewtye eſpecyallye ſyth decree regenſpurge inioyned hym refourme churche reformatiō cauſed made temperately might taking awaye thā nedeful church goodes altered boke reformation collon verie littel boke agreable holy ſcripture cōfirmed teſtimonies auncient doctours tertuliā auſtē ambroſe others wer nerer time apoſtles wherfore violence ſhould offered hym thys matter ſame might awarnynge others altered great deale ſayeth themperoure leaue treaty franckfurte neither beleued tale wer tolde neyther haue geuen anie occaſyon ſhoulde ſo haue procured counſell intent profite common welth mynding yf thyng decreed ſhuld wrong donne proteſtantes therfore euen cauſe appointed conferēce regenſpurge beginnyng wherof well caſe proceded archebyſſhop collon albeit promiſed ſurceaſe differ matter procedeth neuertheleſſe rigor compulſion putteth ordinary curate putteth others hys pleaſure handeleth clergye extremely ſtayeth witholdeth reuenewes cuſtomes chanons preciſe thynges ſo conſtrayned aſſiſt clergie complaynynge vnto theyr iniuryes talke betwene counſellours ſhoulde preiudiciall therwith well contented hereunto againe lantzgraue beare ſo good affection towardes germany league frendes moſt victoryous emperoure ryght glad ioyful beſeche god maye perſeuer herein ſurely yf accordyng youre excellent wyſedome doe well conſyder waye ſelfe commoditye germanye youre magnificence youre realmes prouinces ſhall fynde nothyng wiſhed ſtates ſhoulde bee glad theyr ſupreme magiſtrate agayne maye haue ſtyll louyng obedient certenly yf fortune germany ſhoulde weakened ſame wylbe chiefly youre diſcommoditie touchyng lorde collon matter ſtandeth euen ſo ſayde inaſmuche sheparde wolde fayne haue hys flocke fedde good holſome foode thynketh hys dutye leſſe therefore hathe cauſed fourme thereof ſet foorthe nowe hys aduerſaryes begynnynge moſte gredye reformatyon commen paſſe refuſe drawe backewarde themperoure interruptynge ah ſayeth archebiſſhop collō accoumpted vnlearned ſhulde good man refourme ſcarſelye vnderſtandeth latyn al hys lyfe neuer ſayde three maſſes wherof heard two ſelfe learned readeth ouer diligētly germane bookes ſayeth yt lātzgraue wel aſſured vnderſtādeth religiō againe thēperoure refourme bring new faith religion neyther doeth ſayeth lantzgraue graunt hath receyued new relygion hathe renewed olde leafte chryſt hys apoſtles hath diſplaced certen curate churche placed others ſame aperteyneth hys charge office yf perſon naughty lyuer vnlearned ſurely biſſhops parte ſubſtitute hys ſteade fyt within iuriſdictions diuers biſſhoppes many church lye uacant able ſaye beyng deſtitute curate people fedde kind doctryne gouerned diſcipline lyke brute beaſtes lyue barbarous diſſolute lyfe hathe taken ſomwhat ignorance people lacke teachyng clergye hath thys reaſon hym imployed greate ſome golde turkiſſhe frenche warres maner thempire prince ſhal cauſe commaunde ſubiectes paye therefore thys thynge deſerueth blame commonlye bruted relygion hys aduerſaryes inuented brynge hym hatred nexte daye paulſegraues lodging mete lantzgraue granuellā nauius maſbacke nauius began talke repeteth ſome communication lātzegraue others parte thēperours cōmunication daye declareth wherfore nowe mette ſheweth howe deſyrous themperoure peace ſame cauſe appoynted conference regenſpurge ſayeth diuines wēt waie aunſwered lantzgraue theyr departure thence yet knoweth nothyng duke saxon aduertiſed letter vnreaſonable condicions offered begynning whan might neyther haue theyr ſcrybes wryte ſee copye treaty yet permitted write thyng home hearde alſo howe vntemperately freers collocutours freers vile lyfe learnyng handled matter wolde ouer throwe article reconciled tooke awaye hope concorde diſhoneſt example life offenſe many whether theire diuines departed therfore diſpayre matter yet knoweth certenly called thence thē talked granuellan fyrſt ſpeakyng much themperoures good nature loue peace partely excuſed condicions diſputation prohibited ſygnifye oughte home ſayeth done without themperours commaundement lantzgraue exhorting theſe thynges ſet ſide wolde come preſent matter commendeth decree made spier yere paſte concernyng peace order lawe declareth prouinciall counſell germany moſte expedient accorde quyet religion aſmuch italyans spaniardes frenchemen diſſent ſo farre germanes doctryne hys opynion generall counſel ſhuld little porpos withſtandyng ſoeuer matter fall though none agrement made yet ſheweth ought obſerue peace decree spier mighte aboliſſhed ſtate relygion ſuche germany whoſo wolde aſſaye extinguiſh muſte diſtroye innumerable thouſandes whyche ſhoulde bothe exceading great loſſe themperoure force germany hathe auaunced alſo nation loue chiefly turkes greate reioyſing commoditie decree spier ſayeth granuellā made time neyther fault themperoure force lōg knowen well enough priuate counſelles ſeuerall natyons ther hath ben redreſſe made vice maners faithe religion mention made thinges full diſſē tion ſectes touching faythe one opiniō wherfore diſceptation concerneth germanes al chryſten people lyke caſe moſte parte diuines frowarde men ſtubburne obſtinate caſe diuines ſtubburne obſtinate dipatched therfore muſte prynces noble men ſkannyng therof certen meane waie relygion founde oute ſelues permitte religion free ſuche contrary opinion puniſſhed impriſonment purſe ſeeyng themperoure deſyreth chiefly concorde maye wyſe graunte thyng vngodly yf thynges permitted common people ſhoulde magiſtrate liue ſaftie doe vnwiſely ſayeth lantzgraue reaſon ſo weightie matter fellowes beyng abſent notwithſtanding cauſe matter handled preiudice wyll procede ſuppoſe themperoure made decree spier good intēt aduerſaries ſame content ſuffer ſo promiſed maye nowe go backe theyr wordes agayne inaſmuch gaue themperoure ſtronge ayde agaynſt frenche kinge truſte ſurely thyng agreed vpon confirmed ſeales ſhal broken moreouer nothyng ought let prouinciall counſel profeſſe ſame faythe apoſtles counſell nice athanaſius oure diuines agreed vppon chiefe principall article ther dede controuerſie amonges cōcernyng lordes ſupper ſame nowe appeaſed none confeſſeth body blud chriſt truly receyued anabaptiſtes dauidians know beſydes dede doe punniſh therfore nedeful foreine nation ſhulde preſent theſe thinges ſhalbe determined neuertheleſſe gaue themſelues knowledge trueth chieflye wiſhed certen meane opinion ſhuld eſtablyſhed men honour doe greatly reſiſt thinke cā hardly donne diuines ſincere preaching goſpel whole ſupper lord marriage prieſtes might permitted tyme paſte paphuntius perſwaded counſel nicene ſuppoſe concorde might eſtabliſſhed know place men conſtrayned come oure religion ſuffer contrary ſondry doctryne ſelfe ſame place compell man kyll man ſpoyle hym hys goodes caſe men relygion myght remayne harmeles dominiōs might haue theyr church ſeuerally aſſuredly coulde contente myne owne parte ſuffer youres haue theyr church lyke caſe rule dominion aſmuche wyll graunt ſame deſyre alſo haue oure doctryne equiualente therefore looke ſayde decree spier prouincyall counſel germanie ſame doe take beſt alſo bee man ſayeth granuellan worlde loueth peace aſſuredly themperoure indede biſhop roomes pleaſure wyll ſwarue one heare breadthe equytye hath kept alſo decree spier without greate offence partye alſo biſſhop • ea nauius doe ſuſtayne ſmal diſpleaſure ſame cauſe counſell prouinciall cannot ſee ſhuld iudge al men doe vnderſtand ſcripture one ſorte becauſe conference learned men appereth ſmal hope doubtles ſom meanes muſte bee founde article indede accorded agayne moe yet cōtrouerſie moreouer thoſe accorded bucer doth interpret largely thyng ſelfe permitteth yf ſhoulde nowe reſte eaſy iudge wolde ſtate thempyre lengthe lyke righte well ſayeth themperoure ought compell pope dutie lantzgraue ſaye howe themperoure hangeth biſſhop ſleue wolde god myghte brynge biſſhop hys dutye tymes paſte biſſhoppes roome honour themperour theyr ſupreme magiſtrate emperours ar bounden othe controuerſies god woorde oughte chyfe iudge whyche obſcure ſo che minde men wolde frame themſelues accordynglye ſheweth vnto v ſynne prouoketh v repentaunce amendemente lyfe preacheth vnto v chryſte hathe taken waye ſynnes worlde whoſe name alſo god father called vpon woolde graunte v hys holye ſpiryte uerelye thys faythe doctryne hathe euer ſtyll remayned churche lordes prayer crede apoſtles dyuerſe songes beeſydes accuſtomed church doe inſtructe v benefite chryſt neither muſt conſyder greateſt multitude weneth ende scripture trewthe ieruſalem alſo time diuerſe apoſtles diſciples wolde haue heathen people receiued goſpel circumciſed peter paule iames barnabas contrary opinion errour reſidew ſhewed abrogate yoke lawe whyche tyme greateſt beſte thinges pleaſe ſeweſt parte congregation gaue place obeied iudgement right verely doe preſcribe nation couet germanes might agree within themſelues treate meane way could cōtent ſo ſwarued decre spier concernyng eſtabliſſhment peace lawe thynges ſene may eſtablyſſhed god woorde maye wold haue alſo coſen frend paulſe graue hathe ben many aſſemblies knoweth muche matter paſt ſpeake hys opinion herin ſpeaking themperours good diſpoſition mynde paulſ graue ſayeth howe conference regenſpurge well muche purpoſe begonne renewed article already accorded decided thinketh myght come ſome tollerable agrement reſt themperoure ſayeth granuellan deſyreth acōcorde verie muche hath ben ofte repeted excepte eſtablyſſhed ſurely redounde dammage publycke weale albeit themperour hath thus muche profyt thempyre albeit hath hys health alſo yet loue germany hathe taken iorney hath taken ſecret counſell eyther french king others neyther commeth craue ayde prouyde generally men bothe fraunce englande leuie great force men whiche greatly ſuſpected moreouer thēperour hath doe spayne reaſon death hys daughter inlawe yet theſe thynges ſet part goeth aſſemblie yf prince come thither ſhall doe alone much calling cry hyn refourme thinges yet wyll come place appoynted conſultation therfore ſhould doe well lordes ſpeaking paulſgraue lantzgraue whiche two chiefeſt wolde goe thyther albeit ſayeth lantzgraue themperoure hathe greate reuenewes thempire yet aſmuche hathe ayde alwayes thence agaynſte turke agaynſt frenche kynge others dignitie thempire getteth hym great authorytie profit hath thē peroure germany amonges kinges may leuye alwaies force power hys pleaſure maye aſſemble greate armyes germany others maye doe lyke muche thys eſtemed aduerſaryes clamorous yet wyll follow good coūſell bothe allowed ye decree spierand article accorded fyue yeres ſynce regenſpurge deſired haue enrolled matter recorde admitted alſo al reaſonable condicions laſte conference contrary wyſe none al theſe neyther wolde brought cōformitie open proteſtation wormes refuſed communication go regenſpurge charge ſo greate alſo matter controuerſye betwene electour saxonye duke lantzgraue arbiter beetwirte duke saxon moris becauſe theyr counſellours determyne put arbitrement neuertheleſſe wyll ſende ambaſſadours aſſemblye large commiſſion thus departing fewe houres commeth nauius agayne lantzgraue telleth day talke hath pleaſed themperour ſolliciteth come hymſelfe regenſpurge alſo enquireth hym whether wolde talke agayne themperoure ſame daye euenyng refuſeth whan came themperoure geueth hym thankes nauius fyrſte came thyther ſecondely thēperoure thanketh lantzgraue ſeeth paulſegraue bothe deſyrous concorde howebeit ſuppoſeth collocutours wil retourne againe regenſpurge yf doe wyll ſende agayne meane tyme requireth wolde come hym ſelfe aſſemblie though begynnyng yet towardes later ende hym ſelfe hath verely affaire layde parte taryed theſe three yeres germany thentent myght quyet ſame wherunto lantzgraue aunſwered departure colloquitours hearde thys daye hath alſo recyted cauſes wherfore thinketh done yf deſyre fellowes content ſame diuines contrary parte doe retourne agayne hys alſo ſhall tary thence ſelfe may goo thyther hath ben great charge warre brunſwicke hath lately maryed daughter choſen vmpere betwene duke saxon goe thyther great company becauſe hys abſence hys countrey might daunger confederate duke brunſwicke priſoner ſayeth thēperour hys intent burthen hym vnneceſſarye charge deſireth hym erneſtlye come ſuppoſeth howe hys preſence wolde whole conſultation saxon others myght ſo couraged cauſe ſhoulde thing affraide duke heuries fellowes neyther power ſo greate thoughe ſhoulde attempte thynge yet wolde let ſuffer man ſhal diſturbe publycke quyetnes lantzgraue agayne recytyng cauſes ſaieth promiſe nothyng neuertheleſſe wyll ſende ambaſſadours whiche ſhall trauell peace whych yf thynges obeye gratifye hym deſyreth hym take diſpleaſauntelye neyther thynke obſtinacie mallice feare godes diſpleaſure thys lyfe tyme verey ſhorte vncerten therefore muſt thinke euerlaſtingnes themperour againe ſpeaking hys owne paine taken ſayeth matter saxon maye differred therfore let hym come ſet lettes parte hym ſelfe beyng preſent myght bothe counſell cauſe hys league frendes ſhewe themſelues tractable meane
