beginning treaty maye reaſonable lantzgraue complayninge dyuers ayded duke brunſwicke maketh briefe reherſall whole matter howe taken ſayeth duke morys doe ſuſteyne great iniurye light perſons borne ſtyre vp trouble amonges friderick spedius tolde yeſterdaye yf wolde heare hym spedius blabbe wold open certen ſecret priuie deuiſes nowe working aſmuche truſted man refuſed talke hym wylled hym ſygnyfye vnto hym wryting ſuch thinges wold haue tolde hym preſētly whan lantzgraue declared thēperour maruelous angrie spedius wherfore thys communication amonges lantzgraue lantzgraue taketh hys leaue emperoure takyng hys leaue themperoure bad farewel ryght frendely went thence hedelberge home themperoure went ſtreyght regenſpurge ſelfe ſame time ſaye kalendes aprill ambaſſadours proteſtantes aſſemble wormes conſult whole matter becauſe themperoure ſent awaye lantzgraue ſo gently receiuing letter hym ſame meane tyme reported matter duke saxon xxiii daye aprill depart myght conſulte ſame matter regenſpurge whyther muſt go imperiall aſſemblie thys conuention rauēſpurge entred league proteſtantes eight daye aprill thirde ſytting father counſell thyrde ſeſſion syneode trente trent recited bokes olde new teſtament cōmaunded taken ſacred holy parte iote omitted olde common tranſlation bibell commaunded vſed church scooles alſo decreed man interpret holy ſcripture owne ſēce vnderſtanding al mē follow herin cōſent church aunciente father moreouer printer commaunded prynte ſet foorth nothing conſent ordinary byſſhop furthermore forbidden ye man ſhal vſe termes teſtimonyes ſcripture triflyng thynges vayne fable ſuperſtition inchauntmente witchecrafte alſo ralyng ſlaunderous libelles daye appointed next ſyttyng ſeuententhe daye june themperours ambaſſadour oration emperours ambaſſadour ſame tyme fraunces toletane ſpoken much themperours prayſe declared moreouer howe ioyefull daye themperoure wherin biſhop rome cōmenced counſel ſheweth ioyned commiſſion didaco mendoza hauing caught ague retourned ueniſe olde ambaſſade promyſing hys ſeruice ſayeth muſt praye god wold long continew conſent myndes biſſhop themperoure ſo godlye holſome publycke weale intent vice refourmed euill weedes plucked vp rootes lordes felde maye receiue auncient tillage eleuenth daye aprill biſſhop addreſſeth hys letter hierome franch ſent backe swyſſes vnto biſſhoppes sedune chur certen abbottes thoſe partyes howe hathe called prelate chriſtendome generall counſell trent reaſon repreſente pope letter biſſhops sedune chur churche swiſſes ſhoulde come thyther chieflye people nation vnto hym derely beloued reſt peculiar child see apoſtolicke defendours eccleſiaſtical liberty trēt commen alreadye verey manye biſſhopes oute italy fraūce spayne nomber encreaſeth daylye wherefore ſemely thoſe dwell ſo farre ſhoulde preuente nere hande greate parte theyr people infected hereſyes ſo muche nede counſell wherefore let nowe dilygence recompence thys ſlackenes get thyther immedyatelye delaye ſet parte vnleſſe wyll incurre penaltye lawes preſcribed cryme neglectynge theyr dewtie playne dyſobedyence reſte ſhall hys ambaſſadour tell vnto prayeth geue credyt clergie uniuerſitie collon followed theyr ſuite roome againſt theyr archebyſſhop verey erneſtlye wherfore biſſhop roome xvi daye aprill aſmuche forgettyng hys owne ſaluatyō hath offended diuerſeſly agaynſt eccleſiaſtical rule doctrine agaynſt tradition apoſtles rite ceremonyes chriſtiane religion church accuſtomed cōtrary cenſure leo archebiſſhop collon excō municated pope tenth ſetfoorth againſt luther fellowes doeth excommunicate communion church depriueth archebiſhopricke al others benefice priueleges dignity commaundeth people hys iuryſdiction generall frō henceforch obey hym releaſeth alſo theyr othe whyche bounden hym commaundeth hym ſylence awardeth hym pay contrary parte coſtes dō mage collon ioyned byſhops liege utreiche uniuerſitie louain ſentēce imprinted roome moneth auguſt themperour came regenſpurge infourmed whole matter preſydentes thēperoure commeth regenſpurg conference toke going awaye diuines moſt euill parte diſpatching hys letter throughe germany complayneth greatly therof exhorteth prince moſte erneſtly come themſelues proteſtantes came ambaſſadours thyther came duke moris ericke duke brūſwicke iohn albert brandenburge biſhoppes trent auſpurge bamberge wirciburge paſſawe hildeſſeme aboute thende maye came alſo kyng ferdinando ſecond daye iune ye proteſtāts goe themperoure complayne murtheryng diazius deſyre murtherer may ſuffer accordyngly themperour murther diaze vnpuniſhed ſayeth wyll conſulte wyth hys brother ferdinando moued alſo maketh lyke aunſwer proteſtantes ambaſſadours paulſgraue archebyſſhop collon mū ſter norinberge regenſpurge norling thirde daye themperoure calleth al ſtates declareth cauſe callynge thys conuention hath complayned muche abſence prynces fyndeth hym ſelfe leſſe greued collocutours ſo ſodaynely broken departed wherefore inaſmuche coueteth greatlye relygion myght ſet ſome ſtaye germany deſyreth theyr aduiſe counſell herein moreouer iudgment chamber maye refourmed vnburthened charge therof fynally ſheweth howe relyfe quyet germany hathe throughe meanes frenche kynge taken trewes turke one yere ſeeyng trewes commeth oute october nexte brother king ferdinando telleth broken alſo already knoweth wylbe ende therof ſuppoſeth ſhalbe fayne whan tyme requyreth geue hym ayde whych heretofore promyſed wyll defence thempyre myniſter helpe counſell able prince electours wonte conſulte conferre together thys tyme ambaſſadours mentz treuerſe forſake ambaſſadours collon palatyne saxon brandenburge adiuiſion amonges electours reuolt catholickes conference thē approue counſell trente exhorte themperoure wolde maynteyne ſame perſwade proteſtantes bothe wolde goe thither alſo ſubmytte ſelues vnto decree iudgement synode proteſtantes deſyre themperoure wolde eſtablyſhe fyrme peace vpryghte iuſtyce wolde referre cauſe religion laweful counſell germany aſſemblie thempyre conference learned men vpon certen condycions ſhew counſell trente ſame hathe ben promyſed decree thempyre whyleſt conſulted aboute theſe matter behold brute warre againſt proteſtantes bruted brode themperoure kynge ferdinando byſſhoppe roome made greate preparatyon warres inſomuche themperoure peace fraunce trewes turke thys yere oportunytye tyme ſemed fytte work theyre feate certen byſſhoppes themperours confeſſoure byſſhop roome practyſed thought amonges others haue greate occaſyon hereof wherefore whan themperoure fullye reſolued haue warre ix daye iune ſendeth cardynall trente greate poſte haſte roome meſſage biſſhop procure ayde promyſed two dayes diſpatcheth awaye captaynes chieftaynes money goe leuie men incontinentlye commaunded marimilian erle bure bring low country al force could get bothe horſemen fotemen commaū deth alſo marque albert marque iohn brandenburge falſehod marque albert iohn brandenburge wulfangus maſter order germany gether bandes horſemen thoſe two though proteſtantes religion marque iohn alſo league yet aſmuche themperoure ſayde howe attempted warre religion agaynſt certen rebelles promyſed hym ſeruice marque iohn maried duke brūſwickes daughter priſoner lantzgraue ambaſſadours proteſtātes troubled heare theſe matter taking care cōmon daunger germany deſyre ſtates thempire wold goe thē themperoure intreate wold haue warre vaine eſpecially ambaſſadours mentz treuers vtterly refuſed lantzgraue lantzgraue circumſpecte good eſpialles euery ſēdyng oft letter regēſpurge aduertiſed intelligence ſondry place admoniſhed bandes horſemen whiche ſuſpicion warre hyred ſhuld ſtyl reteyned newe taken vp prouyded aſmuch thēperours demaundes pretē ded likelynes warre lenitie deſire peace thoughte verely ſhuld haue ben warre yeare tyme thing ſelf declared brute vayne whan nowe germany alſo italy power leuied moreouer force spaniardes approche xvi daye iune goe themperoure becauſe place full warlycke motion inquyre hym whether theſe thynges hys commaundemente aſmuche reporte goeth myndeth warre agaynſt turke foreine prince maruell ende thys preparatyon tendeth ambaſſadours collō palatine hereunto themperoure appoynted nauius make aunſwer loue hath imbraced germany euer ſynce fyrſt emperoure nede recyte nowe ſame wyll alſo neyther hath pourpos peace iuſtice maye obſerued thē pyre ſtates may reconcyled herein ſuch ſhall obeye hym commaunded looke good wil hym againſt thoſe ſhall doe otherwyſe ſayeth howe muſt procede accordyng hys ryght authorytie nexte daye addreſſyng letter thēperours letter city proteſtātes dyuerſe city league proteſtantes eſpecyally straſburge norinberge auſpurge ulmes doubt ſayeth know well enough howe derely beloued germany common countrie v al hathe ben alwayes trauell paynes haue taken charge haue great dammage realmes kyngdomes thintent weightie daungerous diſſention religion might appeaſed wherin doubtles haue ſought myne owne priuat cō moditie alwayes indeuoure offence taken waie germany might quiet decree doe teſtifye ſo oft renewed albeit certen doe enterprete theſe thynges otherwyſe doe falſely aſcribe vnto contrary moreouer thys gouernemente common welth haue euermore eſpecyall care preſeruation free city ſhulde oppreſſed certen whyche yf myghte fynde occaſyon brynge theyr pourpoſe paſſe wolde fayle thing ſuppoſe wyſe mē haue marked former actes nowe though certen men haue oftentymes attēpted diuerſe thinges hynderaunce boothe ſtates alſo thēperours crafte yet aſmuche could without greate ſturre redreſſe haue ſuffered hytherto good hope ſurelye ſhoulde lengthe reape fruyte thys pacyence lenitye profyt publycke weale whiche doubtles ſo commen paſſe ſome men ſecrete wonderfull polycyes letted thys agremente certes thys cauſe eyther loue relyon reſpect god glory vnder certen pretence holynes wherwith myghte cloke theyr wickednes myght oppreſſe ſtates bryng theyr goodes landes theyr owne handes reuenewes ſome haue vſurped already violently deteyne ſame greate iniurye many nowe haue brought matter thys paſſe iuſtyce ſet aſyde feare nothyng ſhoute office moe wayes one raſeſhely demyniſſhe ſame thys intente certenly maye ſubdewe ſtates thempyre eſpecyallye cytyes partely force partely craftie meanes whoſe talke maketh beleue thynge certenly trewe whan bragge credebly infourmed threatē alſo wil attempt force warre agaynſte ſame thyng wytneſſed ſo many theyr forged ſedytions famous lybelles picture ſetforthe reyſe ſedition inflame people againſte therfore haue hope euer ſhulde lenitie pacience waxe better amend leaue theſe inſolent facciōs certenly hitherto haue ſo littell profyted meane theſe many yeres become nothing al better alſo worſe themſelues obſtinate rebelles deſperate whiche thing certenly tendeth diſtruction publycke weale vnleſſe remedy found wyll come paſſe germany ſhall fall hys auncyent lybertye moſte greuous bō dage tyranny maye neyther beare ſuffer anye longer neither cā meane excuſed though wold wherfore thintent dygnytie may preſerued peace iuſtice maie conſiſt vertu ſtrength iminent daunger may repulſed empyre youre heades haue prefixed bring thoſe diſturbers common welth theyr dutye reſtore germany olde beautie lybertie intēt myne thought good ſygnifye vnto ſhuld geue credite vnto ſuch haply ſhal brute broade pourpoſe otherwiſe doe aſſure vpō honour doe none reſpect thē ſame haue declared therfore truſt alſo faile herein bothe boldnes may repreſſed youre dignitie may alſo recouered ſhall thus doe bed looke goodwill handes wil declare incaſe ſend ambaſſadoure touching ſame like thing effect wrote alſo duke wirtēberge ſame daye wherein theſe letter dited granuellan nauius calle vnto ambaſſadours city beforeſaide ſpeaking euerie ſeuerally maner one ſort ſaye warre ment prepared againſt cyties againſte certen rebelles haue committed treaſon infringed themperours authoritye haue taken poſſeſſions certen prince biſhops whiche dede occaſyon wil ſpare city neyther wherfore looke ſhewe theyr fayth allegeaunce thē peroure ayde enemy themperoure haue cauſe diſpleaſure agaynſte vnto wiſſheth well • let wryte thys whome ſpede exhorte theyr cyties remayne theyr de wtye themperoure alſo wryte vnto like wiſe ſende ambaſſadours ſame daye trent ordeyned ſtatute trente abbey monkes chanons ſome learned man appointed reade lecture diuinitie herunto ſome benefyce aſſigened ſteade penſion man admitted office reading whoſe learning maners lyfe biſhop abbot certayne becauſe preachyng goſpel nothyng leſſe neceſſarye readyng ſelfe biſſhops al prelate churche commaunded inſtructe people yf haue lawful impedimēt ſubſtitute others ſhall moreouer headpriſtes paſtoures people charged ye leſt euery ſondaye declare vnto men thoſe thinges neceſſary ſaluation exhort vnto vertu feare vice ſyn penaltie appoynted ſuch neglect dutye biſſhops alſo admoniſhed note dilligentlye thinges taught incaſe hereſies abſurde opinion ſowen abrode vſe remedie lawes preſcribed decree made originall ſynne ſaye whole ſpot thereof taken decree oryginal ſin awaye baptiſme remayueth dede baptiſed motion ſynne concupiſcence albeit paul ſometyme calleth ſynne yet done becauſe ſynne dede properly ſo becauſe inclineth ſinne uirgin marye compryſed thys decree obſerued tyme paſte ordeyned byſſhop sirtus fourthe name nexte daie limited ſit xxix iune sixtus fourth make decre wherin excommunicate heretickes whyche teache uirgyn mary conceaued oryginall ſynne daye conſecrated churche roome memoryall conceptyon oughte kept holy thys decre written part byſhops law called extrauagātes foreſayd counſell ſitting peter daneſe ambaſſadour french king made oration ſpeakynge oration frēch ambaſſadour daneſe many thynges deſertes godly zeale kinges fraunce towardes churche roome begynnynge kynge clodowey declareth howe kinge fraunces deſcendinge ſame progenitours kynde dewtye inferyour lynked leo tenth continuall bonde amytie likewyſe adrian clement paull third whyche tempeſtuous ſtorme religion hathe ben well ware alteration hath ben within hys dominion wold haue whole iudgement matter referred church albeit hys owne nature moſte mercifull yet hathe put moſt greuous tormentes certen priuate raſhenes haue aſſayed diminyſhe ſtate church dillygence ſeueritie hath obteined deliuereth vnto fraunce peaſable wyſe new ſtraūge doctryne auncient cuſtome olde diſcipline confyrmed hathe alwayes thought profytable publycke weale church ſhuld one namely biſſhop roome ſucceſſour peter vnto others head myght referre theyr doynges hath ben euermore carefull thys magiſtrate myghte ſtyll kepe ſupremacye albeit hath often time large offer ben moued contrary vnderſtandith kynge england followe thexample hathe ſhewed hys eye yet coulde neuer bee remoued hys pourpos late whan counſell called hearde howe certen father aſſembled forthewhich commaunded certen hys cheife biſſhops repayre thyther whan decree made brought fraunce appointed hym fellowes come declare hys lykyng opinion touchyng ſame therfore fyrſt requeſt wold one eſtabliſhe generall thyng relygion frēche kynges •• qu • ſte followed beleued agayne theccleſiaſticall perſons wolde preſcribe moſte ſharpe diſciplyne lyfe maners ſo euer ſhal decree let thē put doubte hys commaundement ſhall obſerued fraunce moreouer muche kynges fraunce haue done muche churche roome wolde ſuffer thyng dimiſſhed altered poſſeſſion wherof kynges fraunce haue euer ſynce lewis ſurnamed pius ſonne great charles finally frenche church whereof hathe patronage left hym hys elder wolde confyrme ryghtes priueleges lybertyes letter mentioned credite alſo came lazarus schuendius straſburge ye xxiiii daie iune waye ſpoken reſt cytyes aunſwer straſborough thē peroure senate ſendyng hym awaye long wrote vnto thē peroure made directe aunſwer lazarus ſaye ſtraungenes difficultie thing concerne thē others lyke caſe nowe ſaieth beareth ſuch loue germany geue hym great thākes beſecheth hym perſeuer ſame ſuffer hym ſelfe ſtyrred vp ciuyll warre complayneth moreouer certen doe theyr de wtie neither ſhew theyr dew obedience ſory heare yet truſt none theyr religion culpable ſo greate crime fault hath ben v ſaye relygion hath ben accorded knowe ryght wel noble emperoure howe willinge confyrmable haue haue recontilemente bothe fyue yeres paſte regenſpurge alſo ſynce tymes certen others thaduiſe perſwaſion biſhop haue refuſed ſame referred althinges roome biſſhop intendeth violēce power reteyne ſtyll thoſe greate errours whyche arroſe pope tyrante thys diſſentiō church doeth ſo handle matter al thinges maye cōmit cauſe vnto iudgment wherby may wel perceyued ſuſteyne wrong yf man ſhulde lay blame v thys controuerſye appeaſed obiected vnto ſhulde ſeke plucke church goodes theyr owne handes vnder pretence relygion vnfrendly ſayde haue heard knowen ceſar oure fellowes coulde ſuffer longer monkiſhe lyfe theyr dominion growen ſo farre order howe haue conuerted clergie abuſed churche goodes ſame better vſes fyndyng scooles releuing poore agayne well knowne howe men contrary relygiō heape vp churche goodes abuſe voluptuouſnes yet nothyng ſpokē furthermore ſelfe haue made decree bothe regenſpurg lately spier common quiet thoſe goodes oughte vſed nowe incaſe man hathe obſerued meaſure herein doubte yf ſame called forthe heard ſpeake wolde abyde iudgement geue none occaſyon germanye ſhulde therefore layde waſte warre obiect men haue ſubuerted miniſtration iuſtice ignorant moſte mightye emperoure wherfore haue cōplayned iudges chamber howe erneſtly haue deſyred redreſſe whiche albeit hath ben ofte promiſed yet neuer came effecte therfore preſeruation peace diſplace lately spier takynge order howe chamber ſhoulde hereafter eſtabliſhed order alwayes cōtent obeye ſo declared wormes oure aduerſaryes vtterlye refuſe ſayde rather haue iudgement therfore blame matter imputed vnto finally could neuer perceiue euer oure league frēdes aſpire couet office wēt aboute oppreſſe others el boaſted threatened woorke kynde violence certenly beleued theſe thynges beatē head byſhop roome miniſters hatred beare relygion howbeit doe ſuppoſe haue perceyued good wil towardes warres haue foreine nation wold god incenſeth nowe agaynſte v borne euer ſame good doe goodwyll proteſtātes toward thē peroure ſome warres either ben attempted al el much ſoner ended nowe thoſe ſeditions warres haue chaunced germany ſynce emperoure haue demeaned themſelues towardes howe frankly oure men haue geuen theyr ayde agaynſt turke openly knowen chiefely defence youre country auſtriche foraſmuche therfore doubt thoſe ſtates free giltles thoſe crime whych reported vnto yf might heard able declare theyre innocency others moſte erneſtlye requyre moſt merciful emperoure father countrie loue god preſeruation germany beſeche laie aſide thys ſo great preparation call iudgemente ſo heynouſly complayned vpon hyghnes accordynge auncient maner predeceſſours accuſtomed whiche truſt omitte yf thus doe put doubt ſhall ſoone perceyue haue ſuffered iniurye beare greate good wylles towardes thys conſultation beholde beſeche miſerable ſtate germany reaſon continuall dearth thynges alſo terrible cruell enemye turke conſyder fydelytie bothe theyr elder haue ſhewed auncetours alſo vnto kyng ferdinando brother whan bothe agaynſte turke againſt youre enemy haue ſent aide thā haue donne whyche doe refuſe doe nowe alſo ponder weye ſelfe mortall warre thys wylbe calamitie euilles ſhall redounde therby innocente people chyldren infantes woman ſuche lyke doe theyr perſwaſion whyche mainteyning theyr rule power doe malygne heape euylles ciuill warre men brynge matter paſſe noble countrey germany parte therof vnto doubtles moſte addicted beynge waſted owne force ſore afflicted able longer reſyſte withſtande turkiſhe violence wherfore ryght humbly beſeche youre excellencye wolde compliſh oure requeſt ſhall take ſame ſteade great benefyte yf ſhalbe man matter hearde refuſe obey contrarye lawe equitie allowe doynges wil aſmuch lieth v ayde high prince magiſtrate geuen v god euermore ſhowe dew obedience duke moris came regēſpurg xxv daie may thēperoure ſecrete talke duke moris long much talked themperoure priuely departeth xx daye iune theffect theyr communication thinge itſelfe ſhal declare whan ambaſſadours proteſtantes ſaw thinges tended warre violence neyther could daunger eyther conſult thynges nedefull wryte home theyr ſtates cōueyhed themſelues one another retourned home ides iune themperoure ſent hys ambaſſadour iohn muſchet treaſurer hygh burgundie swyſſes preface ſpeakynge hys loue themperours anbaſſadour swyſſes zeale towardes common wealth namely germanie deſire peace ſayeth therbe certē prince germanie vnder pretence goſpell doe many thynges ſeditiouſely ſubuert al lawes iudgement nede feare doe whoſe boldenes hath ſo far proceded attēpte thynges agaynſt office dygnytie threaten war violence non otherwyſe lyke hys abſēce intende inuade oppreſſe common countrey whyche conſiderations conſtrained moue warre dignitie hys place office maye repulſe daunger commō welth reſtrayne ſuch outerage neyther diſtruſteth god enterpryſe ſuppoſeth alſo ſtates whoſe welth conſyſteth herein aſſiſte ayde ad counſel wherfore requireth wold otherwyſe perſwaded hys aduerſaryes hatefully ſpitefully deuyſe many thinges agaynſt neither atempt matter theyr perſwaſion permit ought done theyr limites wherby enterpriſe might impeched hindered warre taken hande welth al germany non cauſe let remayne therfore olde amytie league betwixt doe nothing contrary ſuffer hys ſhall whan occaſion ſhal ſerue wyll ſhew loue fauoure dede hathe done hytherto whiche thinge may diuerſely perceyued chiefly thys neuer made league kynges ſtates compriſed ſame city hygh germanye duke wirtemberge hearing themperours aunſwer geuen cyties wirtemberge puton armure nauius ſpecifyed immediatly ſendyng letter duke saxon lantzgraue captaynes league ſhew nedefull donne promiſeth al theyr aide fidelitie doe leuie many bandes fotmen able make felde fyrſte al men theyr armie deuided two partes one company duke wertemberg conteining xxiiij enſeignes foote men amonges thē wer many noble gentle men hyred city theſe aſſembled ulmes xxi day iune marche gunſperge nexte daye whan muſtred encamped ſeuerall place theyr captaines iohn hedecke scherteline balthazar gutling sebaſtian beſſerer mathew langemantell iohn harder ioyce roſeberge doe fyrſt bynde power city othe maner charging follow obey scherteline vntill prince ſelues come captaynes confederacie going dukesmen done lykewyſe appointe hedecke captayne ſame ſorte done balthazar gutling noble mā borne oraiion balthazar ſoldiours counſellour duke wirtemberge conſente reſte ſpeaking hys prince ſoldiours derely beloued fellowes ſaieth sathans uicar biſhop roome intendeth againe kindle ſuch fyre ſhall inflame burne germany natyle countrey v vtterly diſtroye ſame bothe wonderfull hatred beareth trew relygiō alſo deſyre vengeaūce calamytie receyued fourmer yeres almaignes rome taken ſacked doe moue herunto therfore hathe ſtyred vp charles moſt puiſſaunte emperoure attēpt warre againſt prince ſtates ar lincked godly league truſting violence great crueltie ſhall cōpell ſeruice obſeruaunce theyr wicked deueliſh religion reported certentie howe proude deteſtable bōdſlaue deuil hath leuied already ſmall force bothe horſemē foormen wil ſend thēperoure heare treweth alſo yt approching spaniardes euilles enſwe cōmon countrey foreine ſoldiours diſtructiō miſchief euery man vnderſtanding may eaſely perceiue therfore prince ſtates foraſmuch knew dewtie repulſe al violence iniurie frō people theyre dominiōs alſo trauel forſee deſceaued falſe religiō run daunger euerlaſting dānatiō wholy prefixed god help defend war moued againſt thē beyōde al expectatiō alſo contrary conenauntes promeſſe therfore haue hyred others moe al ſpede might aſmuch chieftanes leage yet abſent wilbe heare within theſe dayes moſt noble prince wirtemberge duke ulriche thentent meane time whole matter may gouerned order neyther yt enemie may eſpie occaſiō hurt v hath appoynted captayne iohn hedecke man noble houſe parentage wherfore hym ſhall obeye ſo demeane ſelues thinges ſame worthye notable fame whiche oure elder tymes paſt haue goten ſondry battels foughtē foreine nation without much māhod bludſhed may alſo bequethed oure ofſpryng poſterytie al otherthynges ſhal committe almyghtie god doubtles ſo iuſte cauſe godly defencion prepare ſuche meanes v vnto diuine maieſtie ſhal ſeme good expedient told howe proteſtantes ambaſſadours departed regenſpurge whan longer place conſultation armie leuyed haue ſhewed aſſē bled ulmes conſult donne wherfore xxi day proteſtātes letter uenetians iune adreſſe theyr letter duke ſtate uenyſe complayning iniurie biſhop roome deſyre wold ſuffer hys force paſſe theyr dominion biſhoppes power ſhulde augmented ſhew example fourmer tyme people italie may loke diſpatche theyr letter alſo moſte noble men germany admoniſhe doe ſtop ſoldiours repare vnto agayne becauſe rhatia tirall ſore vexed commyng foreine ſoldiours laſte day iune exhort letter ſuffer paſſe hereunto promiſe ayde alſo aſſiſtaunce cytie norimberge ſaye cannot haue ſkante mē ſufficient defend theyr owne frontier moreouer commaund scherteline ſecond daye iuly inuade enemy wer muſtering vnderneth alpes finally ſend ambaſſadours swiſſes ſhewed cardinall trente whō themperoure ſent ſo haſtely inpoſt roome wherfore leage beetwyxte pope emperoure ſolliciting league whiche conceaued penned xxvi daye iune decreed vpon theſe couenauntes foraſmuch germany hathe nowe theſe many yeres perſeuered great errours ſomuch great daūger feared therby theſchewing wherof counſel called trent commenced laſt yere paſt moneth december proteſtantes doe reiect ſame ſaie concerneth nothyng therfore hathe biſhop themperoure god glory preſeruatiō publycke weale chiefly germany concluded betwene ſelues vpon certen cōdicions fyrſt dede themperoure ſhall prepare armye althynge nedefull warre moneth iune next enſwyng furniſhed thynges ſuch refuſe counſell maynteyne thoſe errours reduce forte armes olde relygion obedience holy see yet endeuour proue al meanes yf bring paſſe without warre make peace compoſition ſhalbe preiudiciall hurtefull churche relygion biſſhop beſydes thoſe hundreth thouſande dukates whyche hathe alreadye defrayde ſhall laye downe muche ueniſe whych hys lieuetenauntes ſhall imploye vpon warres vſe yf warres ſhall receyue hys money agayne moreouer ſhall furnyſhe themperour warre twelue thouſand fotemen italian fyue hondreth lyght horſmen hys owne charge halfe yeres ſpace ouer power ſhal place lieutenaunt captaines centurion fortune warre finiſhed end ſyxe monethes take commoditie therof ſhalbe lawfull themperoure yere byſhop rome permiſſiō take one halfe church goodes spayne moreouer ſhalbe lawful hym ſell much abbey landes spayne ſhal amounte ſumme fyue hundreth church goodes spayne imployde herein thouſande dukates thys mayntenaunce warre yet vpon condicion laie thē againe mortgage ſo mutch hys owne landes becauſe thing ſtraūge ſhal make ſufficient warrantiſe arbitrement biſſhop man wyll impeche let thys theyr enterpriſe hym ſhall ioyntly reſyſt bothe theyr force one help theother bothe bounden thus doe ſo longe warre ſhall indure ſyxe monethes beſydes warre ſhalbe finiſhed ſhall free euery man ioyne hym ſelfe vnto thys league partaker charge gaine compoſition alſo ſhall senate cardinalles confyrme ſpoken iune vnderſtande moneth iune thys preſent yere wherin bothe haue ſubſcribed leage cōceaued copie thys confederacie biſhoppes legate hierome frāch ſhewed swiſſes ſhalbe declared place aboute thys tyme peace concluded betwene fraunce englande peace betwixt fraūce englād french king permitteth kyng englande enioye bologne vntill ſuche tyme hath payed hym hys money dewe ſame tyme hēry dolphin daughter borne called iſabell better confyrmation frendeſhyp kyng england deſyred godfather fountſtone ſent hys deputie fraunce sir thomas cheynie knight lorde warden cinke porte alſo cardinal saint andrewes cardinall scotland ſlaine scotlande hys owne caſtell aboute diner tyme ſlayne certen gentleman whoſe brother euyll intreated lutheraniſme murther fled englād third daie iuly byſhop rome ſendeth letter swiſſes threatning vpō kindnes frenſhip ben betwene pope letter swiſſes thē predeceſſours bewayleth ſom thē diſceipt deuil law breaker plucked apoſtolicall relygion frō moſt deare child boſom armes teares crocodile moſt louing father notwithſtanding great gift god many haue perſeuered cōſtant faith towards god church thintēt verely others talke wicked men haue ben diſceaued ſhould haue exāple ſet eye length conuert vnto religion forefather great token god goodnes diſcention religiō peace themſelues wherin place occaſion hath ben great ſedition tumultes whiche appeaſe hath euer ſince firſt biſhop vſed al ye gentle remedy could deuiſe alſo fled laſt refuge calling generall counſel trent towne germany within limites wherof euil ſede heretikes hath chiefly increaſed vnto whiche towne might ſafly com defend matter yf wold truſted inſo ſacred ſenate alwaies chriſten kinges nation haue attributed much aſſemble ſo many biſhoppes inſtinctiō holy ghoſt ſhuld treate religiō man wold ſo wicked wold ſubmit ſelfe ſo great authoritie ſhuld incontinently caſting awaie wicked opinion imbrace iudgement catholicke church hath alſo ſame opinion reaſon theyr concord home hath good hope ſo many haue continewed faithful conſtant obey coū ſell reſt ſet purpos certen credulytie haue ben broughte errour diſpyſe authoritye counſel thing wold doe come vnto counſell vnto certen heauenly senate ouer god himſelfe preſydent exhorteth moſte erneſtly hathe donne alſo ſayeth howe hathe ben greate grief hym dyuerſe germany yea ſame number called prynces whyche doe proudely inſolently contemne counſell alſo bayte curſed raylyng wordes ſaye wil obey decree therof chiefly ſory cauſe contumacie diſobedience theſe obſtinate perſōs dryuen attempt matter warre coulde longer pope attempteth matter force armes ſuffer ye loſſe ſo many ſoules whych theyr hereſies periſhed dayly yet oppreſſion chriſtians wherof belōgeth office paſtorall dignitie degre wherin placed whyleſte thynkynge vppon remedye prayed god ſhew hym waye chaunced luckely themperour prynce moſt godly zeale offended like faultes maner thought good auenge cauſe religiō againſt thoſe wicked heretikes force armes interceſſion meanes counſell graunted vnto germany ſemed vnto ſuch refuſed contemned diſpiſed alſo authoritye wherfore occaſion offered euen god tooke holde right gladly prefixed ſelf noble myde themperoure wel owne treaſure alſo church rome ſhuld otherwiſe handel ye thing negligently ſlackly ther doubt god wold require hādes father ſoules ſomany child wer loſt throughe falſehead heretickes cauſe doeth open mind counſell vnto maye ſee carefulnes vered may ioyne theyr prayer god religion haue verely many godly actes neuer non noble wil kepe olde amitie god elder haue ſhew churche rome hathe euer olde loue fidelitie yf ſo godly cauſe wil geue theyr ayde aſſiſtaunce thing deſireth grealy wold doe ambaſſadours proteſtantes vpper part germany come ulme baden conuentiō proteſtantes ambaſſadours swiſſes swiſſes declaring meſſage delaied ye moneth auguſt requeſtes wold ſuffer foreine ſoldiours paſſe countrey wold permit men ſerue war thing ſo required time alſo brunſwicke goſlarie hildeſſem hanobrie commaundement duke saxon lantzgraue raſe wuolbutel chief caſtel duke brunſwicke hitherto kept garniſō paulſegraue prince electour paulſgraue axeth cauſe warre hurly burly maketh ſuite themperoure regenſpurge ambaſſadour sir wuolſie affeſten knight knowe cauſe war againſt preparation made deſyreth alſo leaue warre beſech geue licence interceſſour cauſe day themperour maketh aunſwer granuellan nauius hard know cauſe war concerneth reciteth ſame thinges effecte letter city pretence mouing war obey haue practiſed thinges againſt germani forein nation vnder pretence religiō wilbe bounden lawes take men goodes poſſeſons bothe ſacred prophane ſtyre vp ſtates rebellion reiecte decree thempire woorke altogether crueltye kynde tyrranye therefore purpoſeth thys warre appeaſe relygion diſpleaſures lyke caſe reſtore peace libertie vnto germany ſuch ſhal dewtie defend protection thoſe diſturbers ye cōmon quiet oppreſſours libertye punniſh ſore extremly according theyr demerites aunſwer themperoure palſegraue ſeketh reconſile proteſtāt themperoure paulſgraue tenth day iuly brought day ſendeth duke saxō lantzgraue duke wirtemberge declaryng common daunger hanged ouer germany eſpecially ſtraunge ſoldiour war ſhould waxe mortal beſecheth condeſcend graunt much maye albeit likelynes thinges ſharpe ſorrowfull holde yet ſuppoſeth caſe wold make ſubmiſſiō thēperoure follow mynd certen thinges wolde agreat furtheraunce bryng matter concord theſe thinges wherby perceiueth themperoure wilbe appeaſed fyrſt wil craue perdon theyr offence ſecondly mā hath thing vniuſtly amēded fynally yf poſſeſſe ought man wold permit themperoure ſome ſhall thynke mete wherin maye doe good promiſeth hys fayth trauaile meane time duke saxon lantzgraue ſoden tumult chaunced much vnloked duke saxon lentzgraue prepareth war eſpecially themperour lately departed ſo frendly frō spier aduertiſed whole matter great diligence gather theyr force alſo warne fellowes lyke ſuffer thēſelues diſwaded craftie counſel certē whan aſſembled take counſell fourthe daye iuly ſendyng letter themperoure haue heard ſaye moſt mercyful emperoure ambaſſadours ſent cōmaundement regenſpurg time heard preparation letter thē peroure warre fellowes league religion ſollicite dillygently wold force germany ſuſteined dōmage albeit aunſwered ſo tyme myght wel ſuſpect ſomthing yet wer good hope yt ſame war ben moued againſt v ſtate thempire ſo much called aſſēblie ſent ambaſſadours thither ful authoritie alſo conſulted vpon demaundes ſhewed aduiſe ſo much could ſuſpect diſpleaſure moreouer aunſwer youres doeth cōcerne thynges paſt yet come whileſt ſaye eſtabliſhe common welth accordyng youre authoritie punniſhe thoſe ſhalbe diſobedient wherfore could thinke publiſhed demaundes made aunſwer wold haue prepared war lengthe whan manye coniectures chyefely youre letter adreſſed certen prynces city alſo wordes granuellan talke nauius perceyued youre purpoſe punyſhe certen prynces diſobedyent brute euerye warre bente agaynſte v tooke dede heuely greuouſely becommeth v leſſe thought good ſende thys epiſtle pourge oure ſelues fyrſte truly able affirme oure leagefrendes haue alwayes dorne common charge impoſed vpon v others whan ſome alſo haue gonne free moreouer ayde deſyred laſt aſſemblie spier found meanes graunted perfourmed ſame oure ſelues theſe ſeruices donne ſhulde charged diſobedience doeth greue v alſo muche diſpleaſaunt bytter wolde haue wiſhed ſurely ben alſo reaſou ſhulde fyrſt haue ben accuſed hearde commen hande ſtrypes oure accuſation ben thus blaſed abrode ſo ſhulde bothe eaſely haue proued owne innocencye cōfuted theyr ſklaunder v haue thus cōplayned louingly dealt v bothe lately spier alſo fiue yeres ſynce regenſpurge openly knowen ſo v obiected rebellyon dede vnworthy omytte youre requeſt put poſſeſſion dukedome brunſwicke arbiterment one yere paſte daunger therby haue loſt oure lyues goodes furthermore ignorant time wer created emperoure frankefurt ſort bound ſelfe thempyre promiſed moſte ſacred othe howe thēperoure periured doynges ſhulde accordyng lawes empyre whā ſuch crime obiect vnto v ſhuld layd man charge intende worke violence agaynſt v oure matter hearde knowen committe vnto god ſhall heare matter doe accuſe v ſhal ſo make aunſwer men ſhall vnderſtand bothe ſuffer iniurye alſo inſtigation roomiſh antichriſt wicked counſell trent attempt war intent doctrine goſpell alſo libertie germanye author war may oppreſſed wil proue none cauſe cō dicion ſtate thinges requyreth ſhuld thus muche declare vnto ſhall take therfore part ben great deale pleaſaunt v haue gratifyed approued fauour dilligence themperoure ſeuēth iuly writing thēperours letter archebiſhop collon letter archebiſhop collon welth germany ſayeth ſaye common quiet right equitie dignitie office libertie thempire may recouered thynges dede certen ſeditious perſons haue almoſte expulſed cōmon welth vnleſſe ſhould reſtrayned wold take cleane waye conſtrayned attempte war may reduce theyr dewtie muche heare ſaye goe aboute euer allure others fellowſhip commaund fyrſt throughout whole prouince let proclame doe foreſee man ſerue war vnleſſe ſerue captaynes ſuche ſhall haue commiſſion ſhewe ſecondly yf gonne foorthe already ſerue call againe immediately commaund tary home attende vpon commaundement ſuche obey punniſh extremelye ſo demeane youre ſelfes maye perceyue loue quyet germany except thus doe know certentie ſhalbe great daunger loſſe haue theſe letter whan archebiſhop receiued publiſhed place commaunded ſhuld obeied beſydes gaue commaundement ſhulde praye church god hys mercy wolde tourne awaye greate daunger nowe hanged ouer germany ſame tyme proteſtantes ſēd ambaſſadours kinges fraunce england newely reconciled making ſuite ayde duke lātzgraue wrytten thus themperoure priuately ſayd yt ides iuly ſet forth publicke writing alſo wherin thēperours polycie declare howe thys warre made againſte religion bee themperours intent vnder ſerten pretence rebellyō though wolde punnyſh fewe myght plucke awaye fellowes league one ſo muche eaſelie length ſubuert hereof bryng manye proues reporte kynge fernando granuellan nauius others ſpake priuately regenſpurge verelye contempt counſell cauſe thys warre moreouer ſaye howe themperoure ſent commaundement rauenſburge whyche lately receyued doctryne goſpell within dayes ſhuld ſake theyr enterpryſe el wolde geue theyr citie landes deuyded amonges soldiours meſſager called backe letter waye leſte ſhuld come forthe brode war agaynſt relygion foraſmuch alſo byſhop rome hath geuē ſentēce againſt ye archbiſhop collon reformatyō doctrine hath depriued cardinall auſpurge firebrand thys warre hys dignitie thēperoure maner doeth threatneth ſame doeth yt ſufficiētly declare cauſe war cō mon brure theyr drift yt cardinal auſpurg hath ſet matter fyre ſhall throughe violence ſubſtituted hys place reported moreouer bee vanquiſhed bandes soldiours ſhalbe placed partes germany whych themperours name ſhall ſee decree counſell concernyng relygion maynteyned put execution furthermore wrytten dyuers men howe archebyſſhop toledo chiefly ſuch prelate spayne geue great ſumme monye thys warre wold haue donne ben religion wel knowen alſo maner decree made auſpurge xvi yeres ſynce tyme themperoure proteſted could abyde thys ſecte doctryne luther diſtroye ſame vtterly wold beſtowe hys force treaſure lyfe blud alſo yf oppreſſed god forbid ſhuld quickely appere whether wolde ſpare thys religion wolde rather ſlaye miniſtere churche inforce theyr wyues child reſtore monkes freers relygious rabbell themperoure may lawfully worke force agaynſt ſtate banniſh man cauſe behearde bryng foreyn ſoldiours within bondes germany chaleng hym ſelf inherytance ſucceſſion belonginge thempire bounden theſe condicions hath confyrmed othe yf lawful doe otherwiſe ſtate publycke weale could long endure cauſe diſpleaſure ſhulde haue agaynſte cannot worlde perceiue touching ſaieth duke saxon ſo euer diſſention betwene brother fernando wholy quenched two yeares paſte spier nerer frendſhip lady elenore daughter kynge ferdinando promiſed freely eldeſt ſonne ſo could agree religion ſame themperoure cōfyrme tyme ſhoulde retourne home aſſemblie ſent owne lodging granuellan nauius moſte large wordes offered good wil frendſhip child whole countrey great cryme haue commytted ſynce time ſhould intēd crueltie againſt doubteles matter euē ſo haue ſhewed becauſe refuſe biſſhoppes counſell incurred diſpleaſure reaſon wolde ſhulde imagine theſe thinges againſte houſe saxon knoweth death maximilian mine vncle duke fridericke hauing crowne imperiall offered hym hys voyce duke fridericke choſen emperoure meanes gaue vnto hym omitte meane tyme many benefites houſe saxon hathe imploied houſe auſtriche caſe offended putting iulius pūugius biſhopricke nunburge haue bookes ſetfoorthe declared ryght tytle patronage themperour wold appoynte indifferent iudges offered abyde theyr iudgment nowe concerning owne parte ſayeth lantzgraue throughly reconciled hym fyue yeres ſynce regenſpurge intended fewe yeares paſt haue warred certen biſſhops afterwardes helpe coſyn duke wirtemberg recouer hys owne thys ſo euer haply beſydes agaynſte lawe wrytten decree thempire eyther priuely apartely geuen wrytinges made therof cō firmed handes ſeales therfore deuiſe imagin ſhould cauſe thys grudge againe whan ſpake nowe lately spyre ſhewed hym ſelfe ſo frendelye bothe wordes countenaunce could perceyue ſparke diſplaſure couenaunted fyue yere ſynce regenſpurge ſhuld attēpt thyng herafter agaynſt duke cleaue ſhuld meddle matter moued war agaynſt kept touche promiſe time receyued ſame duke agayne hys fauoure whiche uerlone perdoned yt ſerued aſſiſted hym ayde yf ſhould take euill parte abſence came ſelues regē ſpurge haue bothe made oure excuſe duke hys ambaſſa dours preſente talke hym spier lybertye germany ſtate ye publicke weale yf muſt haue warre therfore whan bothe others heretofore alſo conuention nowe regenſpurge many prynces abſent warre brunſwicke bee blamed lawfull men ſaue ſelues violence haue often lawſul repulſe violence tymes deſyred ſondry aſſemblies hys vyolence myghte reſtreyned wordes letter could obteyne nothing yet thoſe letter whych fernando requeſt wrote herof duke henry openly wer letter incloſed wherby myghte eaſely perceyue neded obeye others theſe letter founde caſtel wuolſbuttell ſubſcribed kinges owne hande foorth commynge nede caſe lyke ſeueritie ben extended duke brunſwicke themperoure ſheweth nowe vnto v albeit haue deſerued ben warre aſmuche impugned v profeſſion goſpell doe ſuſteyne greate hatred coulde winke hys myſcheuous actes thēperoure knoweth commytted prouince taken gardience defence takē hande offered ſelues abyde order lawe arbitrement hym appoynted yf would haue taken ſame way forſaking arbiterment contemnyng themperours order attēpted new warre wolde haue tryed matter v lawe way ben eaſy enoughe conuict iudgement obeyed ſhulde themperour haue iuſte cauſe put lawe execution nowe ſhulde thus doe hath al finally time duke ſon taken themperoure neuer demaunde thing v ſame therfore cauſe wherfore ſhould accuſed negletynge oure dewtie caſe ſhoulde bee aſcribed v though ſhuld impeache law haue muche wronge aſmuche many yeres thoſe receiued iudges chamber whych hated religiō moſt bitterly iudges chā ber papiſtes ſame iudges cōpoſitions ſet part gaue ſentence againſt v fellowes matter religion alſo ciuill cauſes wolde let v haue iuſtice myght doe euen order lawe neceſſarely lawfully refuſe ſuſpected aduerſaries proteſtyng wold declare large cauſes refuſal choſen iudges therfore nothing imputed vnto v halfe moreouer two yeres paſt decried spier chamber ſhuld eſtablyſhed vprightly ſo cānot aſcribed v fellowes vnknowē themperoure laſt yere aſſēblie wormes ther man reſiſt decree themſelues whiche wyll ſeme loyall obedient prince intent verely oure aduerſaries myght oure iudges alſo doe heare moreouer layed charge much blame worthy ſeke allure vnto v certē nobilitie maruell ſhould reproued matter founde proued hath ben alwaies maner dayes oure forefather ſhould ioyne vnto thē gentelmen owne coūtries biſhops alſo though werſom fault therin therfore lawful moue warre againſt v cauſe leage betwixte thre houſes heard albeit league heritaunce betwene houſes saxon brandenburg heſſe themperour excepted yet ought ſo taken abuſe authoritie wherfore let albert iohn brandenburge coſins haue promiſed ſerue themperour againſt v conſider thēſelues dilligently doe remēber othe wherwith ar boūdē wold ſhuld haue knowledg warninge alſo clientes take wage vnder thē war neither excuſed haply wil ſay thēperour pourpoſed punniſh certen prince diſobedience knewe themſelues howe ſuch thing imputed v iuſtly themperoure accuſed v crime reaſon wold haue requyred could haue confuted ſame ſhulde haue neded vſe theſe polycies ſollicite fellowes withdraw themſelues v yf coulde haue ſhewed offence wolde haue forſaken v theyr owne accorde cauſe ben good wold haue biden commō daunger furthermore tyme reſt gaue hym ayde two yeres ſynce againſt frence king promiſed warre ſhulde finiſhed wolde goe hongary hymſelfe agaynſt turke nowe doe turkes inuade hongary place ther aboutes great force power dede reported many doubteles therbe thoſe party offen peſt great garniſons turkes poore men liues yt countrie neglected caſt vnto theyr enemyes praye meane ſeke howe make ſlaughter germanye thynge maye ſwymme full theyr blud profeſſe chryſt ſeing ſo truſt ſurely moſte men pitie lament caſe wil aſſiſt aduerſaryes whiche ſeke extinguiſh doctrine goſpell haue donne others place theyre dominion bring v extreme bondoge wilbe content reaſonable wage rather followe oure campe wherin romiſh antichriſte adherentes whoſe chyfe endeuour thintent papiſtes thys euen ſlaughter germany maye eſtabliſh agayne confirme theyr wicked deueliſhe doctryne aſmuche muche intreatinge peace beyng crime yet cōuicted enforced warre defend ſelues violence truſt god aſſiſt treweth agaynſt lye thys hys cauſe wilbe hygh emperour enſeigne bearer againſte wicked deuiſes biſhop unto verely doe commit whole matter beſeche hym confounde cruell counſelles blud thirſters euer auaunce maieſtie glory hys name ſame daye wryte iohn marque brā denburge becauſe bothe league proteſtantes proteſtātes letter iohn marque brā denburge owne letter proued agayne priuate confederacie olde tyme admoniſhe hym weare armure agaynſte doe accordynge conuenauntes bonde league otherwiſe vtter whole matter declare openly farre agaynſt hys dewtie hys doynges whervnto aunſwereth ſerueth themperoure doeth denye foraſmuce hath put oute doubte warreth againſt religion indede proteſtantes league meane confeſſion auſpurge touchyng pryuate league therin themperoure excepted expreſſed wordes ſeeyng ſo cauſe ſhuld offended hys ſeruics ſaye doeth ought agaynſte hys faythe promyſe aunſwer geuen ſet foorthe publycke writing amonges thinges confute ſayed confeſſion auſpurg proue hys owne letter boū den helpe theyr leagefrendes yf matter ſhuld come ſuche paſſe albeit man pretende fayne cauſe war agaynſt thē thēperoure doeth wherfore admoniſh dilligently almē chiefly captaines ſoldiours yt ſerue vnder hath broken faith ye ides iuly biſhop publiſhing wryting ſpeaking much care zeale towardes ye pope bull againſt proteſtantes common wealthe men ſaluatiō counſel begonne alreadie obſtinacie heretickes contemne refuſe ſame haue moued warre agaynſt godly men exhorteth men generall faſt praye vnto god confeſſe theyr ſynnes euery man choſe ghoſtely father lyſte receyue ſacrament intent god intreated may proſper warre themperoure haue nedefullye attempted roote hereſies reſtore peace churche albeit themperoures intent leuying power euery place ſecretly might diligēce proteſtantes leuying theire armye might ſet vpon proteſtantes wer prouyded yet theyr dilligence ſo greate courage men ſo cherefull defend warre xvi daye iuly lantzgraue felde hys men withſtanding lowe duchland coūte de bure maner hys whole armie readines neither certenly knowen wold firſt inuade lantzgraue marched hys owne countrey ſent william eldeſt ſonne xvi yeres age straſburge exceading ſtronge lantzgraue ſent hys ſonne strauſburg citie departure home duke brunſwicke pryſoner ſent word wold geue hym hearyng wolde open vnto hym tyme deuyſed thentente pourpos thys warre lantzgraue ſuppoſed ſaid craft eyther leſſon owne offence get hym libertie refuſed talke hym wolde vtter man hym ſelfe alone fyrſt explocte proteſtantes highe fyrſt enterpriſe proteſtantes germay agaynſt enemie vnder alpes reported ſondry meſſagers yt biſhop power hauing already almoſt paſſed ye alpes approched nere germany thought good preuent thus ſtandeth caſe come oute italy paſſe trent iuſprincke towne king ferdinando frō thence two wayes goe bauier eyther downe riuer oeno copſteyne el ye left hād ouer middes alpes kynge fernando hathe almoſt going oute alpes caſtell erenberge ſituated vppon exceadyng hyghe caſtell erēberg mountayne nature place ſuch reaſon ſtraitnes holownes waye headlong pitchehill ſtepenes looke dowewardes ſo hath paſſage maye prohibit beit neuer ſo great armie paſſing way wherfore moneth iuly thither wēt sebaſtiā scherteline meane power commaundement proteſtantes ambaſſadours aſſē bled ulmes ſayde waye takinge fieſſa towne cardinalles auſpurge ſtandeth riuer leyche tenth daye iuly taketh alſo foreſayde paſſage caſtel compoſition made ſoldiours garriſō within intent haue marched alpes haue taken alſo inſprucke fortyfyed ſtrong garryſon ſo ſhulde haue kept way wherby come italye germany ſo ſhulde haue ſhut vp themperour hauynge eyter ſoldiours vitalles partyes thys greate tumulte commaundement king fernando men wer called armure countie tirol came great power inſprinke vnder leadyng fraunces caſtelalte gouernour trent leauing gariſō defend towne kept thoſe way sherteline retireth paſſages wherfore scherteline placing ſoldiours caſtell erenberge towne fieſſa retireth hys force repareth armye aſſembled high germany aboute riuer danubius called duche thonaw armie counte hedeck led taketh dilling towne caſtell biſhops auſpurge compoſityon ſweareth trewe hym xxiii day iuly aboute ſame tyme maurice biſhop eiſtet ſendeth ambaſſadours chieftaynes warre praying wold ſpare promiſeth alſo geue paſſage hys prouince vitaile couenaunte beneth dilling towne donauerde whiche ſommoned render refufed donauerde taken time armie came ordenaunce plāted yelded vnto proteſtantes meane ſeaſon duke saxon lantzgraue marche forward theyr armie paſſing frankome whan biſhop wirciburge put ſufficient ſuertie ſtoppe theyr vitaile wente ioyned theyr fellowes ſame tyme theyr campe ambaſſadours marque brandenburge prince electour duke moris ſent permiſſion treatie referred matter theyr fellowes nothing donne certen ryche men dwelt auſpurge packed vp theyr ſhort endes gonne citie becauſe brute wente lent themperoure monie ambaſſadours thā ulmes ſending theyr letter meſſagers senate auſpurge ſhewe howe vnworthye dede admoniſh erneſtly wold ſorſee like ben hereafter senate maketh aunſwer howe long geuen monie intereſt maner becauſe ſhuld vnoccupied knowing warres ſuppoſe mā geueth hys monye lone none ſhalbe ſuffered doe vnpunniſhed maye know al time themperoure regenſpurg beſides thre thouſand spaniardes fiue thouſand themperours power fotemen almaignes ſeuen hundreth horſemen power commen time ſent spaniardes hongary ſame whyche peace concluded french kyng wintered lorayne went germany hongary ſhewed laſte booke peace lately made betwene fraunce england chaūced luckely proteſtantes almaignes ſerued french king came vnto thē cōduite counte bichling george recrode client lanzgraue thēperour yt xx day iuly letter patens doeth outlaw ye duke saxō duke saxon lantzgraue ar lawed thēperour lantzgraue beginning accompteth large paynes hath taken hytherto yt germany myght throughly quyeted decree hath made ſame force ſhulde man kynde matter al thinges might law cuſtom agayne ſheweth ſtates thempyre bounden fidelitie ought perfourme theſe thinges ſaieth neglected iohn fridericke electour saxonie philip lanzgraue heſſe certen raſh boldenes haue tymes muche laye hindred oure trauaile paynes taken publicke weale neyther haue ben obedient haue ſelues reſiſted v haue alſo intiſed ſtates doe lyke make vnlawful cō ſpiracies lantzgraue certen yeares paſt pretending cauſe knew attempted war againſt ſom chiefeſt ſtates thempire inuading dominion extort agreat ſomme monie together ſet vpō prince thempyre cauſe knowen droue prouince kepte ſelues haue alſo gotten theyr owne gouernmēt ſondry biſhoprickes office well eccleſiaſticall ciuile lordes wherof auncyente cuſtome vnder iuriſdiction thempyre haue theyr place conſiſtory amonges ſtates yet alſo thoughe haue ofte complayned ſued v aſſemblies deteine ſtyll ſeruitude haue alſo ſpoyled many theyr goodes yerely reuenewes receyued theyr tuition clientes ſubiectes others nowe lately alſo throughe certen ſinguler boldnes haue ſollicited diuers ſtates ſhould come thys conuention thintent myght let procedynges brynge v contempt theſe thinges doe ſo much boldely contemne iudgementes neyther acknowledge feare magiſtrate throughe theyr fault hyghe iudiciall place thempyre taken awaye lawes kepe ſilence long tyme hathe ben iuſtice miniſtred great loſſe domage many ſtraunge example ſuche hathe ben hearde worſte worke theſe thynges proteſtantes accuſed treaſon vnder goodly pleaſaunt name religion peace lybertie theſe vſe clokes couer theyr doinges deſyre nothyng leſſe eyther agrement relygion germany peace libertie certes proue neuer place ſcripture lawfull obſtinately reſiſte theyr hyghe magiſtrate caſe contrary moſt manifeſt aſwell holy ſcripture alſo autenticke hiſtoryes thoſe auncient profeſſours chriſten doctryne confirmed faithe wordes alſo theyr dedes death obey heathē prince wherfore doubtles ought much leſſe denie v theyr dewtie vnder pretence religion denie declare euidently theyr intente take frō v crowne imperiall ſcepter oure authoritie vſurpe ſame thēſelues haue confounded thinges oppreſſe religiō law peace lybertye thus auaunced hyghly new honour poſſeſſions bring men vnder theyr tyrany wordes teſtifye ful malicious threatninges alſo famous libelles picture diſperſed place great mockerye contempt name moreouer haue made league againſte v thoſe conuenticles haue alſo ſtyred vp forein kinges againſt v ſecretly aided ſame theyr helpe coūſel ther ſomme olſo cantel haue attempted induce yt turke germany thing rather credited ſame ſhuld verey fitte commodious pourpos wherfore theſe theyr doinges breake theyr allegeaunce owe vnto v infringe dignitie oure office reiecte decree neuer eſtemed otherwyſe yf bē made thys intent others myght repulſe violence frō ſelues permitted thē doe iniurie mē therefore haue fallen moſte heynous crime treaſon condygne puniſhement ſuche offence lawes preſcribed becauſe theyr doinges beknowen nede declare thē albeit yt authoritie yt haue might haue punniſhed long ſynce according vnto demerites yet loue peace auoyde trouble haue fauoured verye muche graunted ofte many thynges alſo became v herin haue oftener hurte owne conſcience miniſhed oure authoritie well prouyded others thus fyue yeres ſynce regenſpurge deale moſte gentlye lantzgraue two yeres paſt spier duke saxon thys hope verely beyng vanquiſhed great lenitie pacience clemencie ſhulde length leaue theyr vngodly deuiſes ſhuld nede extreme remedy dede perceyued good abuſed gentlenes inaſmuche contemning decree thempire breaking conuenauntes procede obſtinately throughe licencious luſt rule take men landes poſſeſſions wilbe bounden lawes ſeke ſubuert whole ſtate ye publicke weale certenly vnleſſe firſt put ſilence neyther relygion accorded partes cōmon weale eſtabliſhed refourmed conſtrayned vſe agaynſt thē authoritie god hath geuen v becauſe theyr rebellion manifeſt inſomuch themſelues cannot denye agayne woorke violence abyde iudgment therfore doe outlaw falſe rebelles ſeditious treaſon giltie diſturbers cō mon quiet prefixed punniſhe haue deſerued thintente maye haue libertie afterwarde eſtabliſh common wealth doe ſuche thynges properly concern office therfore ſtraytly charge commaunde man ayde thē caſe neither take theyr parte ſhall doe wyſe ſhall curre daunger lyfe goodes let ſuch happely gon already ſerue retourne ſoone poſſible let men geue theyr ayde vnto v fynde let cauillation throughe league priuate conuenauntes make theſe thinges fruſtrate moreour releaſe nobilitie common theyr dominion theyr allegeaunce othe wherby bounden aſſure ſaftye yf doe obeye ſuche ſhall refuſe punnyſhed lyke ſort xxii daye iuly gerarde uelduuiche ſente agayne regenſpurg cōſtantinople frō whence lately retourned thēperour whan nothing could determined prorogeth conuentiō thēpire vntil ye kalends february next yere following biſhop rome letter ſent heluetiās pope letter swyſſes haue ſhewed whiche biſhops legate hierome franch receiued ſent lucers writeth alſo hym ſelfe xxv daye iuly thre dayes ſynce deliuered vnto hym letter biſhop senate cardinalles albeit maner ſame effecte wer hys former letter yet conteyne ſomewhat ſendeth nowe copie ſame ſpede nexte conuention ſhew principal foraſmuche ſame league whyche lately nowe ende iune biſhop themperoure made leafte alſo aſpace others come ſame confederacye moreouer becauſe couuenaunted themperoure ſhoulde trye whether hys aduerſaryes enemyes churche roome myghte haply warre reduced theyr dewetye amendement biſhop doeth erneſtlye require wolde pronounce expreſſe wordes whether wilbe thys league whether wyll obey decree counſell trente haue appoynted hym daye nexte aſſemblie baden wherein make hym aunſwer hys former demaundes therefore hathe nowe wrytten alſo entente maye conſulte meane ſeaſon therefore dooeth beſeche blud ſauioure chryſte wolde dilygently conſyder themſelues noble famous acte thys wylbe howe profytable theyr ofſprynge yf wolde bothe helpe quenche fyre germany approue alſo decree generall counſell biſhop vttered cauſe league ſumme men ſuppoſe pope bringeth emperouro hatred bee donne hym craftie polycie myghte thys meanes put themperoure narrowe ſhyftes moſt certen tooke verey diſpleaſauntely themperoure pretended cauſe warre ſhalbe declared herafter thys time alberte ſonne duke bauer maryeth ladie anne daughter kyng fernando duke cleaue lady marye hys daughter duke cleaue mariages broyle warres longe looked daughter nauaire fraunce vayne ſayde byſhop roome graunted hym lycence marye wherefore maryeth theſe ſame bothe mariages ſolemniſed regenſpurge myddes vprores tumultes warre eyther maryage concerne newe bonde amitie daye ſyttyng appoynted father trent haue hearde end iuly matter defferred till begynnynge nexte yere hys place ſhalbe declared trent beſides cardinalles biſſhoppes legate cardinalles trent pacher spaniard foure number father trēt archebiſhops xxxiii biſhops two frenche fyue spaniſhe one slauoniſhe reſidew italyans doctours diuinitie relygious xxxv others yt profeſſed religion twelue moſt parte spaniardes amonges thoſe foure archebiſhops two thē bare name olans magnus upſalya robert uenaut scotte chaunced thus whā king swecia receyueth goſpell guſtaue kynge swecia nere vnto denmarke altered relygion yere lord mdxxxvii iohn magnus archebiſhop upſalya miſlyked alteration forſaking countrey fled vnto roome came thyther meane company afterward going uenyſe became suffragan patriarche citie fyne waxing werye ſtate retourneth roome beyng broughte exigente verey lowe ebbe tyme ſolde hys horſes maner putte awaye hys ſeruauntes biſhop roome placed hym hoſpytall holy ghoſte wherin ended hys lyfe full poorelye hym hys brother olans unto byſſhop gaue archebiſhopricke gothlande thoughe precincte church roome commaunded hym counſell geueth hym xv crownes moneth paye hys bord scotte whan infourmed biſhop archbiſhopricke armacane irelande obtayned hym name title therof scotte blynde yet ſaye maſſe alſo wold ryde poſt wherfore biſhop wolde haue theſe two counſel oſtentation though thoſe two nation ſo farre gothes iryſhemen acknowledge hys authorytie verey dede nothyng shadow bare name thing mentioned duke moris priuate talke themperour departed regē ſpurge whan cōmen home king fernando followyng ſhortly goeth vnto hym prage fyrſt daye auguſte thēperours letter duke moris themperour ſendeth duke moris regenſpurge copie proſcription rehearſed writing letter commen people reporteth maner ſame thynges compriſed table lawerie becauſe allied vnto outlawes kinred affinitie ſo nere may haply claime ſom ryght theyr landes poſſeſſions chargeth moſt erneſtly aſſiſt hym force wynne theyr country yea get ſelf ſo ſoone holde owneryght el wil come paſſe ſhalbe catche ſo euer neyther ſhall ryght conſinage compactes profet hym thynge agayne contemnynge hys emperours commaundemente ſhall incurre ſame penaltie others doe commaundeth alſo gentelmen people obeye hys proclmatiō ſerue theyr prynce faithfully vpon like penaltie letter written duke moris commen alſo brother auguſtus whole armie proteſtantes letter duke bauer proteſtantes commē riuer danubius duke saxon lanzgraue counſellours warre wryte theyr letter willyam duke bauer iii daye auguſt ſpeake much thēperours preparation war nede knoweth whole matter albeit haue omitted kynd dewtye towardes themperour ſuppoſed ben cauſe diſpleaſure yet haue hearde longe ſynce bothe aunſwer alſo talke others intendeth war thē though ſhould diſobedient yet neither conuict crime haue done wrong mā beit ſo offēce moſt trew imputeth yet lawful caſe examined attempte matter force armes enterpriſe agaynſte ryght lawes thēpire againſt couenaunt cuſtome former time thēperours matter againſt ſtate ſame hath bē euer accuſtomed examined opēly knoweth many yeres hathe ben meanes deuyſed germany myght loſe libertie without doubt thys warre alſo tendeth ſuche ende albeit haue alwayes hitherto perceyued deſyre mainteyne common lybertie although lately promyſed manye thinges touching good wardes ſent word wold ſuffer foreine ſoldiour paſſe countrey yet reported vnto hath geuē waye already alſo vitayle munition whiche thinge greueth lyttel ſuppoſe perſwaded ſo falſe ſclaunders theyr writinges lately ſetfoorth declared aboundantly iniuriouſly emperoure dealeth howe many couenauntes aſwel publicke priuate thys one thing broken truſt yet defēce lybertye aſſiſt thē hys ayde counſell eſpeciallye ſeynge put hope ſamethynge nowe lately hys meſſager therfore ſhall doe well cōmaunde themperours ſoldiours depart townes roene ingolſtad el permit place manye theyr men alſo geueth free ſafe recourſe throughe hys countrey relieue victualles aſſure hereof wryttynge albeit thynke wyll ſaye naye yet deſyre aunſwer within ſyue dayes yf ſhulde otherwiſe doe muſte doe theyr counſell ſhall ſerue ſeuenthe daye auguſte machlin veraye fayre towne thēperours brabant gunpowder lay tower vppon walles catching fyre lyghtning firſt ouerthrewe ſame towne foundacion thē lighted vpon houſes lightenyng cauſed ſtruction machlin within citie without aboue fyue hondreth paſes circuite wherof ſome brente ſome ouerthrowen many ſhaken piece tourned vpſydedowne ſame houſes many heuge exceading great ſtones flewe threſcore paſes violence powder ſo tearyng ſonder houſes ſhakynge breaking glaſſe windowes euery ſtrete defaced maner whole citie ſinged tree turned vp rootes calamitye periſhed two hondreth perſons aboutes partly cō ſumed fyre partly ruine fall houſes ſtones tyles ouerwelmed beſydes thoſe ſore wounded yet eſcaped death wherof nomber great many two dayes three ſomme foure dayes found drawen ſellars caues vnderneth grounde wherunto fled diuerſe dead whiche periſhed eyther honger lacke breathe ſome lyue fynding theyr vitayles layde vp ſuſteyned theyr life moreouer great nomber horſes beaſtes wer burnt vp ſtables wal itſelfe toure ſtode throwen downe flat grounde aboue two hondreth paſes length ix daye auguſt swiſſes mete agayne baden fourth day maketh aunſwer proteſtants swyſes aunſwer proteſtantes ambaſſadours appoynted ſame tyme mentioned swiſſes ſuche wer popiſhe religyon ſayde ſory warre moued betwene themperoure neyther anything rather wiſhed peace therefore wolde intermeddle warre fro incline themſelues either partie howbeit wolde kepe foreine ſoldiours ſuffer paſſe thorow theyr dominion ſtaie owne men home muche lyeth ſame cauſe haue geuen ſtrayte commaundement already man goe foorth ſerue warres attend vpon magiſtrates pleaſure looke defence theyr countrey yet notwithſtandyng many gonne warfare haue takē wage thing great grief therfore deſyre diſcharge ſame ſuffer retourne home agayne beſydes former demaundes proteſtantes requyred moreouer wold enter confederacie themperour biſhop roome ayde thē men wherunto biſſhop eſpecially moued thē wold aſſiſt whych wer conſtrained defend vniuſt warre repulſe violence reporting many thinges biſhops iniquitie wyll rule counſell iudge alſo holdeth ſame place ſet iniurye vpon occaſyon ſpeake death iohn diazius deathe diazius vnpuniſhed ſhew deſtable murther daie vnpuniſhed ſo much commended many alſo though worthy great rewarde thing warning daungerous vnmete come ſuche place theyr aduerſaties haue al gouernement amonges biſhop trēt lately made cardinal depely bounden biſſhop moe wayes one aſmuche proteſtantes theyr force water thonawe themperoue whiche yet fully fourniſhed begynnyng auguſt leauing regenſpurg garniſon went landſhut towne duke bauers riuer iſara pitcheth tentes without walles duke saxon lantzgraue theyr felowes ſendyng theyre proteſtantes proclayme war agaynſt thē peroue letter donauerd eleuenth daye auguſt declare mynde towardes hym maner lawe armes laſt moneth ſaye made purgation letter emperour charles ſuche thynges accuſed albeit reaſon wold eyther ſhuld haue layde ſide warlike furniture leaſt haue declared cauſe warre hearing v ſpeake lykewiſe ſhuld haue accordyng cuſtome thempyre fayth promiſed othe yet foraſmuche doe neuertheleſſe procede alſo compelled put armure beare thys vniuſt violence muche vnworthy perſonne nowe ſeke extinguiſhe doctryne goſpel lybertie thempyre ſondry actes may proued knowe youre ſelfe maner conſultations haue nowe many yeres roomiſh antichryſt foreyne kynges myght eyther ioyne incenſe agaynſt v agayne without aduiſe prince ſtates thempyre haue taken trewes turke contrary quite youre promeſſe tyme germany gaue ayde two yeres paſte agaynſt frenche kyng affirmed ſame warre beynge finiſhed wold goe ſelfe armye agaynſt turke nowe haue made compoſition hym verely thintēt myght better accompliſh thyng haue intended agaynſt v nowe thys conuention regenſpurge haue ſet newe collour face matter ſpeakyng much youre owne induſtrie zeale cōmon wealthe countrey germanie contumacie certen others whice doubtles done intent might ſeuer v one another ar confederated relygion able charge v faulte neglectyng dewtie diſtruſting cauſe haue ſommoned v appere come aunſwer senate thempire yea ſomuche name party crafti 〈…〉 themperoure yet meane ſeaſon wryting letter dyuers prince city diſſembled ful craftely though attempted warre againſt religion punniſhe certen rebelles manifeſt enough ſhoote relygion appereth herof ſufficyently ſollicited biſhop counſell wherin beſydes clientes adherentes man maye haue place libertye ſpeake fewe ſomwhat franke ſpeakyng lybertie exiled counſell meane founde called awaye worſe placed theyr ſteade maner decree alſo ye father trēt haue made knowen al men wherfore coū ſell hath ben ſo often promiſed aſſemblies thempyre ſhewed laſte yere wormes ſame thinges ſayde ſhuld nowe repeted moreouer pourpos cōpell v approue counſell proued biſhops letter lately ſent heluetians wherin complaineth ſore diuerſe germany reiect authoritie counſel ſayeth cauſe attempteth warre becauſe alſo prefixed warre ſame matter ſayeth howe chaunced hym luckely therefore wold imploye therupon force treaſure churche roome hys owne alſo wherefore ſeeing biſhop hathe vttered pretenſed pourpoſe youres wold haue cloked coloure doubt longer pricke relygion certenly knowe oure ſelues faulty nothyng eyther wold ſhuld heard openly wel aunſwer concerned office example predeceſſours haue called v senate prynces lykewyſe haue hearde oure reaſons neyther become thus vſe v call v aſſemblie propound common wealth axe aduiſe counſell meane whyle prepare warre agaynſte v kynde thing thys leaue turke bend furye rage warre againſte v thoughe greate deale worſe truſte aſſuredly god impeche hynder thys ſo vnworthy facte grudge diſpleaſure betwene youre brother fernando v ſame wholye forgeuen cadame uienna regēſpurg spier therfore maye paynte ſet matter muche lyſte yet knowe certentie cauſe trewe relygyon ſhuld oppreſſed germany loſe lybertye wryte dede diuerſe go aboute perſwade though deſiered greatly doctryne goſpell myght auaunced opinion vniuerſitie louayne confyrmed iudgement agayne execution godly men within realmes dominion article uniuerſitie louayne confideracie made romiſh antichriſt declare ſhew well enoughe intente verely euen myght recouer eſtablyſh agayne kynde papiſtrie quenching trew doctryne profeſſed auſpurge ſeing caſe thus made league pourpos myght perſeuer thys relygion defende ioyntely together although man el ſhuld pretēd ſome cauſe diſpleſure agaynſt v dryuen neceſſitie ſtande oure owne defence whyche bothe god lawe alſo lawe nature doeth permitte graunt v albeit reaſon enterpriſe nothing bounden therfore neded declare vnto part mynd yet aſſurance renounce allegeaunce dewetye wherby boundē wold deminiſhe ryght commoditie thē pyre rather preſerue mainteyne ſame therefore proteſt openly ſolemuwyſe mynd purpoſe repulſe v thys warre fellowes ſo godly honeſt cauſe ought refuſe perill ſent theſe letter yong gentelman trumpeter maner thēperoure woulde receyue proteſtants letter themperoure hys campe landſhut whiche refuſe receyue alſo cummaunded paine theyr life cary agayne added moreouer man hencefoorth came vnto hym ſhoulde inſteade chayne golde rewarded haulter deliuereth vnto table preſcription ſaied geueth table preſcription moſt ſtreight charge delyuer ſame theyr prince ſent thys epiſtel debated howe themperoure ſhulde termed ſpoken duke saxon wolde haue geuen hym name themperoure otherwyſe lawfull warre hym lantzgraue contrary minde eyther ſoothers vpholders ſaing length thys meane waye diuiſed ſhulde call hym vſed place themperoure conſult whither goe ſome ſayde landſhut themperoure experte knowledge countrey ſhewed howe muſt goe fennes wayes ſo narrowe oftentymes ſpace myle coulde goe one horſeman alteryng theyr purpoſe determine goe regenſpurg themperoure leaft garniſon munition bothe place commodious incampe themperoure wolde come reſcowe beſeged myght trye matter hym playne felde wherefore remouing theyr campe march foreward howebeit verey flowly maner aboute ſame tyme whyche ides pope armie commeth thē peroure auguſt arriued landſhut italian biſhoppes force ryght welcome themperoure beyng aduertiſed eſpiall progreſſe hys enemyes ſente diuers ſondrye meſſagers exhortynge make haſte footemen teen thouſande fyue hundreth demilaunces ouer al theſe biſhop made hys nephewe hys ſonne octauius farneſius general hym ſerued many noble captaynes alexander uitellius iohn captaynes ſaid armie baptiſte sabello sſortia palauicino fridericke sabello paullus uitellio iuly urſine alexius laſcaris hierome piſe iohn mary padowaye niclas plumbine niclas petilian power alſo coſmus medices duke florence ſente two hundreth horſemē conduite rafe balion hercules duke farrare hundreth alphōſo baſtard brother biſhop ioyned octauius cardinall hys brother alexander farneſius eſpie themperours doinges alſo aſpurre vnto hym prycke hym forewarde yf nede required whan farneſius departed italy ſhulde ſaye reported wolde make ſuche ſlaughter germany hys horſe myghte ſwymme bludde lutheranes longe came alſo spaniardes themperoure called naples millan aboute ſyxe thouſande olde expert ſoldiours theyrechieftaynes philip lauoye prince sulmone aluar sandey alfonſe uiues iames arzie themperours lieutenaunte capitaines thē peroures armie fernando toletane duke alba ye next place hym iohn baptiſte caſtalde cardinall auſpurge head commiſſioner vitayle ſerued themperour alſo maximilian auſtriche emanuell philiberte ſonne duke sauoye ericus duke brunſwicke philip ſonne duke henry priſoner george duke megelburg george duke brunſwicke brother henry man church friderick furſtemberg renard solmen erles diuerſe others tētes proteſtātes iohn erneſt duke saxon brother prynce electour prince proteſtantes cāpe iohn fridericke electour hys ſonne philip duke brunſewicke hys foure ſonnes erneſt albert iohn wuolfange fraunces duke luneburge wuolfang prynce anhalde chriſtopher henneberge george wirtemberge albert manſfelde hys two ſonnes iohn uolrate lewis oetingen ſonne ſame name william furſtemberge chriſtopher oldenburge hubert bichling iohn hedecke erles moreouer recorde rifeberge eyght enſeignes swiſſes wherfore whan theſe force commen together beſydes power coſite de bure brought oute lowe countrie emperoure remouyng hys campe marcheth towardes regenſpurge knowen many beganne ſuſpect wolde meyſſen saronie wherfore made bridge tranſported theyr armye ouer ryuer thonnawe marched little waye towardes norgouia intellyngence themperoure wente frō regenſpurge ingolſtad tournynge againe ouer rough vneuen wayes repare dannbius leſte themperour ſhuld take nuburg thre mile aboue ingolſtad donauerd ſo ſhoulde haue waye open lande wirtemberge whan comen naſielſe nexte daye lantzgraue wente foorthe greate company horſemen take vieu ingolſtad knowyng themperours armye hearde fewe spauiardes laye therin garriſon lantzgraue rioeth foorth eſpye wold haue prouoked eſcarmouche whyleſt marcheth appere certen horſemen prynces sulmone charge beyng geuen dyuerſe ſlayne partes yet moe hurte taken knowen taken themperoure wolde encampe ſame daye ingolſtad thys facte lantzgraue electour saxon toke diſpleaſauntly greuouſely yf doe lyke hereafter without makinge hym priuie proteſteth wyll departe marchynge foorthe little waye theyr whole armye ſuche order yf ſhulde haue foughte battell retyred theyr ſoldiours theyr campe ſame nyght followyng men theyr fyrſt ſlepe spaniardes enter campe counte hedecke laye appoynted vnder duke saxon kyll spaniardes inuade proteſtantes cāp number hundreth hys fotemen loſt dyuerſe owne men alſo wherfore greate vprore throughoute campe whych reaſon darknes alſo encreaſed nexte daye whyche xxix auguſt certen centuryons captaynes ſente oute vieu ſituation theyr enemy campe upon horſemen italy breakyng ambuſhe gaue charge ſodaynely many ſlaine cyther ſyde retourned agayne without theyr pourpoſe wherfore nexte mornynge lantzgraue accompanyed fewe others choſen oute whole number goeth foorthe knowe ſome certentye fyndyng foorde horſemen ſent oute hym ſayde nonue retourneth backe duke saxon ſheweth hym howe horſemen maye paſſe riuer laſte daye therefore auguſte agreed ſetfoorthe mornynge ſoone daye appered take hygher grounde tymes paſte ſtoode watche tower ingolſtad plant certen piece ordenaunce ſhoute theyre enemyes campe ſee yf perauenture prouoke themperoure battell far foorthe nyght duke saxon aduertyſed lantzgraue twyſe ſondrye tymes themperoure departed hys campe ſmoked geuynge credite reporte ſente foorthe whilliam schacht fyue bandes hys owne herſemen kepe foorde make brydges munition footemen ſhortly followeth hys whole power munition greate haſte commen waterſyde schachte ſhewed hym howe themperoure remoued oute hys place ſente duke saxon intellygence hereof marcheth hylle beforeſayde planteth part hys ordenaunce placeth hys menne alſo lefte hande ryghte ſame duke saxon whan commen thyther hys companye ✚ eightenth booke sleidanes commentaryes concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument eyghtenth booke erle bure paſſeth rhyne meanes archebyſhop mentz counſell lantgraue allowed ſet vpon emperour switzers wyll meddle warre wherfore duke lantgraue ſollicite bohemers aunſwer fully accuſations diſſemblinges emperour remoue theyr campe cutte waye erle bure peter stroſſe kepeth promyſe lende money touruert rendred emperour duke maurice holdeth aſſemblee ſtates againſt duke saxon vnto whome lantgraue aunſwereth duke saxon countrey ſet fyre deſtroyed hongarians duke moris ſurpriſeth certen townes fourtene martyr brent meanx proteſtauntes hauyng leuied campe purſued duke wittēberg certen city make peace emperour father trent eſtabliſh article inſtitution man death kyng henry eight goſpell fre paſſage englande marque albert taken pryſoner duke saxon whan maximiliā erle bure whō mētioned aſſembled al power erle bure leadeth army themperour coulde lowe coūtrey foure thouſand horſemen ten thouſand fotemen emonges certen bandes spanyardes italian whiche ſerued kyng england warres againſt fraunce marching forwarde ſame brabāt moneth auguſt paſſeth ouer rhine aboue beneath mentz wherſoeuer coulde get ſhipping notwithſtandinge proteſtauntes layde power ſyde leading chriſtopher oldenburge riſeberge ſhuld haue ſtopped paſſage archbiſhop mētz thought haue holpen much matter whole armie proteſtauntes come forſaid place ſhot al ordinaūce themperours cāpe moſt terrible euen ther lantgraue calling duke saxō ye counſellours captain y• war y• gouernmēt alone bould profitable counſell y• lantgraue ſaith time reſtored y• duke wirtēberg wold firſt vndertake geue y• charge vpō thēnemy wt ii legiōs bring ye piōners caſt trēches done aſſaile thē wt whole force power herein whileſt thopiniōs mē diuers ſome diſwaded y• thing ful moſt peril others miſliked y• ſame ſo yt ther wer daūger feared townes men great ſtore ſhot munition horſemen alſo firſt charge giuen nothyng attempted whiche thing doubtles ſo much reproued many ſame errour thought cauſe beginning cauſe proteſt miſery calamitie emperours victory farre excelled horſemen emperours campe intrenched lowe ditche ſo ſmall force time emperour ſuſteined ſhot brunt day next night followyng ſo well fortified campe better confidēce might endure eaſely ſtormes came ſaye ſo great daunger emperours harte feare emperours campe courage wonderfull good declared token feare ſelfe alſo boldened others exceadingly offered take ſuche part emperour ſolicited switzers treaſurer burgundy ſhewed laſt boke unto thoſe requeſtes aunſwere made aſſemblie baden holden moneth auguſt mentioned wil infringe league swiſſes aunſwer emperour haue houſe auſtriche burgundy moreouer wyll call home agayne ſuche gone forth warfar vnleſſe ſhall obeye punyſhe accordingly thus aunſwered thoſe nyne townes popyſh religiō zurich berne baſill alſo schafuſians muche emperours byſhoppes letter importe one ſame cauſe warre againe muche copy emperours byſhoppes league ſhewed byſhoppes ambaſſadour ſpake playnly warre attempted roote religion proteſtauntes tolde emperours ambaſſadour would take deliberation makyng aunſwere attende vntyl ſuche tyme emperour aduertiſed whether would permitte kepe ſtyll religion ſafitie whan emperour harde emperour swiſſes goſpeller ſeuen twenty day auguſt addreſſeth letter cāpe ingolſtad haue made ſame anſwer reſt haue done perceiue cauſe ſuppoſeth yt done ye craft aduerſaries heareth former aſſembly badē went perſwade wt though moued war puniſh rebellious prince againſt certē city thintēt yt ye biſhops aid ye doctrine ye goſpel alſo ye libertie germany might oppreſſed hereth moreouer thei haue ſollicited thē aid agaīſt alſo concerning league wherof vnderſtandeth haue put good hope next aſſembly ſhal make thē direct aunſwer touching cauſe y• war much haue vnderſtāden ſame aſ wel priuate letter writtē vnto thē ſuch alſo hath publiſhed opēly nedeth repeted hath ether moleſted man religion ſake giuen occaſion rebellion ſhewed proued yt ſtreight wayes frō beginning preparatiō vnto war treated frēdly gently diuerſe alſo thā decent perſon men ſo meane eſtate degre nether excuſe rebelliō yt byſhop rome doth aſſiſt prince italy certen alſo germany diuerſe gentleman right noble houſes emonges thē ſom religion league proteſtauntes ayde wil venter liues ſpend blud war whiche doubtles thei wold caſe matter ſtode theſe ſeditiouſe profeſtaūtes one againſt another perſons falſly report yt haue alwayes gone vnder pretēce religion reſiſte hygh magiſtrate oppreſſe religiō libertie germany bryng al ſtates ſubiectiō many doings ſo well knowen nedeth declaration verely vnder ſwete name religion haue
