allured cōfederacie ye chiefeſt city germany force ought vſed religion force furniture haue gottē landes poſſeſſiōs others alſo go worke compelle prince ſubiects take partes diſturbe many religion inforce another kinde lyfe caſt alſo diuerſe pryſon fetter threaten cruelly robbe ſpoyle church thyng ſelfe declareth cauſe couet haue league meane made ſtronger might eaſely accomplyſhe pretenſed purpoſe doubted alſo perceiue theſe thinges vnderſtande ryght well incommoditie diſcommoditie may loke ſocietie ſeing matter thus inaſmuche ar ignoraunt good alſo cauſes warre truſteth wyl refuſe league kepe ſoldiours home call home ſuche gone ſerue warre vnder ſet penaltie doe nothing contrary auncient league example reſidue obſerue peace amitie ſhall redounde theyr owne prayſe ſhalbe hym alſo ryght acceptable vnto letter wryte ſame ſort anſwered thambaſſadour deſire accept good part delay anſwering aſmuch affirmeth war nether oppreſſe religion yet ye libertie countrey ſay none wyſe thā ſhal become thē gone confynes warfare ſame done without leaue knowledge oft time chaunceth maner call thē go forth without licēce time retourne home puniſh moue swiſſes ſo likewyſe duke saxon lantgraue ſollicited bohemers thei made ſuch aunſwer proteſtauntes ſēd bohemers appered wel yt myndes alredy perſwaded thaccuſation king ferdinando whan perceiued letter end auguſt wryte ſhewe manifeſtly war attempted againſt religion ſent vnto bokes whiche haue bene lately ſet forth concerning ſame require thē worke diſpleaſure againſt laſt ſignifie vnto thē intend ſame time alſo thei publiſh wryting wherin ſay aduertiſed credit worthy biſhop antichriſt rome inſtrument pope hireth men poyſon deuil authour war certen yeres paſt hired miniſters ſet many townes fire saxon hath ſent forth impoyſoners infecte welles ſtanding water thintent ſame war yt ſword diſtroy theſe may diſpatche poyſon wherfore admoniſh vniuerſally al mē chiefly owne ſubiectes waite narrowly ſuch men apprehē ded put torture whan ſhall haue tried miſchief ſuffer accordingly within fewe day duke saxon ſonne iohn william letter publiſhed geueth warning coūtrey yt take diligent hede thē ſelues lately far frō weynmar town turing certen italian taken ſuſpiciō cōfeſſed diuerſe others money giuē rome byſhops name yt ſhuld fiering poyſon much hurt germany poſſible might cōcerning outlawyng themperour ſent copy therof ye duke ye proteſtauntes anſwer table outlawery lantgraue haue ſhewed wherfore whā receiued cāpe ingolſtad ye ſecōd day septēber ye defēce honor eſtimatiō anſwer lōg wryting ſo highly cōmendeth zeale good wil tomany nothing diſſimulatiō ſince time firſt choſen emperour hath always ſought meanes bring bondage verely cauſe leauing spaine countreis hath retourned ſo oft germany bene ſo importunate charge like ſort ſame ſpeaketh religiō purpoſe hath bene alwayes ye hauing oportunitie might oppreſſe ſincere doctrine ſo oft ſay graūted peace vnto v emperours crafte towarde proteſtants religiō craftely time vntil giuē money ſerue publique vſes neceſſities thempire called decree made doubt queſtion helde matter ſo long ſuſpence till made peace french king taken truce turck biſhop eſpiyng time conuenient appointed counſell trent concluded vpon league hereof wil bring probation fiue yeares paſt regenſpurg made decree religion wher diuerſe pointes miſliked ſame declared minde large gaue v wryting ſufficiently ſame aſſemblies deputy king ferdinando cōfirme yet two yeres ſince cō uention spier whan mention made therof ſayd remēber ſuch declaratiō laſt yeare cō uention wormes byſhop hildeſſeme ſaid openly al prince themperour promiſed catholikes yt decree spier ſhuld take place frēch warres monethes paſt went conuention regenſpurg granuellan ſpake ſayth lantgraue preſence paulſgraue counſellours ambaſſadour duke wirtēberg decree spier applied vnto time themperour longer mainteyn ſame againſt ſtates sixe yeres paſt hagenaw king firdinando whan ſheweth commiſſion emperor decree made fear catholiques ſaid vnto v ſhould decree obſerued made fear turkiſh warre time nede ayde thinke goodly cauſe fetch ſupplant v felowes confeſſe craft thē ſelues wherby licked v money therfore playn intended alwayes diſtructiō religiō late cōfederacie declareth taried time ſerue purpos becauſe wold appere haue ye matter lawfully decided euer hād wt v yt ſhuld ſubmit ſelfs ye biſhop rome coūſel might ſo ſufficiētly declared ī bokes ſet forth purpoſe maintain execute decree counſell accompliſhement wherof longe ſollicited certen forrein prince fearing leſt mean ſhould ſet top cleaued religion pretended cauſe fained rebellion might withdrawe fellowes whan vanquiſhed chiefeſt myght compell reſidue obey commaundement albeit brother thought kepe maruelous ſecret ſubtill craftie counſell yet ſingular goodnes god commeth lyght dayly biſhop himſelfe ambaſſadours declared switzers cauſe warre copie league wherby manifeſt alone al profeſſe ſame doctrine lyke daunger indeuour reſtore papiſtrie place let men iudge therfore truly matter handled lately conuention regenſpurg went perſwade cōcluded alſo appeaſing religiō would vſe lawfull quiet remedy tolde hym ſelfe ſayth lantgraue lately spier diſſimulation emperour league byſhop ſame affirmed granuellan verely ſame fatherly mynde affection zeale loue peace wherof ſpeake ſo muche euer man heare lyke thing wold perſwade prince quite contrary whiche hath ſo long prefixed minde know right well dutie prince owe vnto emperour againe ought perfourme vnto bounden hym ſo againe bounden alſo vnto v wher cauſe heard doth outlawe v ſeketh put v beſides lādes poſſeſſions breaketh bonde ciuile lawe wherby patrone bounden againe cliente nowe chargeth v rebellion nothing ſelfe knoweth doth v wrong euen ſame cauſe ſaith lantgraue gaue thākes lately spier haue omitted diligence appeaſe religion ſayth prepared warre punyſhed certen ſtates purſe denie iuſt cauſe ſo neuertheleſſe openly knowen mediation lewys paulſgraue richard archbyſhop treuers matter quietly ended ſelf alſo writing letter taken matter diſpleaſauntly yet muche diſcharged mine armie ſignified required time ſpake ſame ſixtene yeares ſynce auſpurg made purgation ſuche ſorte king ferdinando friderick paulſgraue certen others contēt ſatiſfied wherfore ought make mattir part occaſion warre reſtored ulriche duke wirtemberg interceſſion george duke saxō archbiſhop mentz matter reconciled compoſition ratified regenſpurg vpō faith aſſuraunce toke away cleane abolyſhed al diſpleaſure ſpeaketh alſo ye warre duke brunſwick cauſe therof haue expreſſed wrytting moſte frequent audience empyre ſelf alſo preſent declared large two yeares paſte duke tyme made anſwere emperour refuſed heare confutation ſame wold heare examine dewly whole matter aduyſe prince haue taken ſome ordre thing certenly becauſe deſyred ayde frenche turkyſhe warre purpoſe let ſlepe wold haue put garden herein fulfilled deſire wormes content frederick paulſgraue coſin iohn simmer ſhould kepe gouerne prouince v taken vntill ſuch tyme matter ſhould lawfully decided determined done aſſured v duke brunſwick ſhould alſo aſſent ſame wryting letter charged hym earneſtly ſhould obeye cōtemning commaundement rayſed warre againſt v taken therin appereth wryting ſet forth duke maurice therfore nothing warre contrary dutie nothing againſt lawes herein appeale egall iudgement ſene fauour beareth religion albeit duke brunſwick contemned commaundement moſt raſhely although tyme heard ſequeſtration ſpake themperour many lewde opprobrious wordes yet becauſe duke brūſwi 〈…〉 bitter enemy ye proteſtants moſte bitter enemy religion althyngs vnpunyſhed ſayth haue brought certen vnder ſubiection farre otherwyſe haue ofte made aunſwere ſame dede may wel verified whiche hath brought vnder iuriſdiction diuerſe prouinces empire alſo byſhoprikes againſt preſent warre hath aſſembled noble gentleman might al lure diſtruction verely graunt haue receiued diuers tuition fidelitie ſhould daunger doctrine goſpell ſhould defende ſuppoſe duty god commaundeth ſuccour afflicted none haue nede theſe many yeares nowe helpe defence thoſe taken lutherians thing concerne religion defend haue always exhorted geue magiſtrate right honour due obiecteth v ſhould haue exhorted ſom repare aſſemblie vayne abſurde ambaſſadours wer lately aſſembled wormes went regenſpurge commaunded thē al thinges ſet part ſhould go alſo aſſemblie unto aſſemblies thempyre ether haue comen ſelues always ſent ambaſſadours concerning ſayth chamber iudgement hath ben ofte confuted heretofore moreouer maketh mention heathen magiſtrate declare might reſiſt hym haue done duty alſo ought haue geuen euer aunceſters haue accuſtomed great loſſe hinderaunce hath cauſe complaint ſhall appere ſhall recite certen ambaſſadour frenche kyngs ſent vnto hym french ambaſſador diſſwadeth emperour warre lately occaſion fell talke warre ſaieth great enterpriſe taketh hand aduiſeth conſider ſelfe great force germany muche daunger thing perchaūce one two haue offended may meane founde pacifie matter without warre wherunto made aunſwere nedeth pacifieng matter wil conquer germany hazard euer hath worlde emperour cō quer germany power therof ſo great nedeth muche feare twenty yeares ſynce hath layde foundation matter oftentymes haue giuen hym ayde ſondry many warres lately alſo againſt kyng ſelf haue bene great charge many aſſēblies empyre moreouer ſondry warres haue loſt great number mē ſo ſtrength decayed al theft thinges hath done intent germany might diſtitute power voyd force ſtrength therfore tyme commodious worke feate heard talke mouth ambaſſadour honeſt man worthy credit reported ſame vnto v ſhould impute cauſe war v ſeing hath intended ſame ſo long tyme whan priuate perſones drowned dregges romiſh religion ſtande decree conuenauntes wold haue done duty aſmuch hath brokē ſame chief obedience dew vnto god let aſcribe faulte vnto ſelfe conſidering intēdeth deſtruction religion libertie geueth occaſion wherby may reſiſt good conſcience caſe lawful reſiſt proued ſacred prophane hiſtories god authour vniuſt violence god anctour wrong nether bounden otherwyſe fulfyll condition whiche created emperour graūteth hath agreed v priuatly v great pleaſure heare wherfor thē doth moue war thoſe matter faithful agrement made proued haue committed rebellion ether ſame compoſitions thus caſe ſtandeth made decree wormes xxv yeares paſt ſet forth proclamation againſt luther ſuch imbraced doctrine appointed moſte extreme puniſhmēt ſame acte warre intendeth put execution crown scepter neuer coueted content owne landes reuenewes praye god feare may kepe maynteine ſame true ſayth haue ſo oft geuen ayd lately two yeares ſynce againſt kyng fraunce whiche deſert benefit ought dede forget al diſpleaſure though reconcilement bene made neuer reported euil opinion vertu haue al way commended hym highly famous libelles picture nether haue diuines yet others ſet forth againſt hym yea diuines learned men haue euer extolled great prayſes exhorted people ſermons ſame praye god preſeruatiō perauenture haue ſet forth ſomwhat againſt byſhop rome cauſe ſhould inhibie ſo vilaynouſly ſlaūderouſly cochleus hadamar white frere collon haue rayled againſt v fellowes diuines euen regēſpurg whan rable papiſtes aſſemblie holden appeaſe controuerſie manifeſtly knowen obiecteth vnto v conſpiracies conuenticles wherin doth v great iniury thinges borne bred germany men far void ſuche crafty deuiſes haue bene wrought againſt v theſe many yeares paſt firſt bewray ſelues howbeit might defende ſelues againſt vniuſt violence made league denie defende ſelues iniury mā wherfore made haue two ſeuerall writinges declared fiue yeares ſince ſaith lantgraue went emperour regenſpurg granuellan ſayd chauncelour emperour nothing offended league could content alſo ſhould receiue ſame many would ſpeaketh darke wordes though ſhould haue moued turke inuade germany ſhall thing ſelfe confute haue always giuen ayd againſt turke yea euer progenitours haue done ſuche tymes bounden couuenauntes kept whan diuerſe others whiche promyſed ayde perfourmed nothing haue heard already brother haue deuiſed ſo turke might oppreſſe ſodainly v fellowes ayde giuen lately publique decree againſt fraunce promyſed whan warre ſhould finiſhed would go ſtreight againſt turke made peace enemy without knowledge whoſe money made warre behold bēdeth al force againſt v goodly matter ſe munition brought auſtriche warre germany meane ſeaſon ſuffer hongary ouer runne turkes ſeditions cōſpiracies treaſons wherwith chargeth v none nether ther cauſe war ſame rehearſed ſayth hath graunted v ouer muche wynked doinges grudge conſcience fayned alſo deſire long ſince haue made warre againſt emperour pretended war long v could impeched hitherto neceſſitie conſtrained differre till quieted duke cleaue king fraunce turke hys mynde hath bene thoſe extreme moſte greuous execution godly men coūtreis declare alſo agreed v heretofore firſt perceiue done intent diſpatched affaire might entent diſpatched affaire might intēd warre wherof aſſuredly coulde ſuſpecte nothyng ſayth lantgraue reaſon great good wyll humanitie ſhewed lately spier time alſo nauis wylled chauncelour caſe talk might kept ſecret finally ende accuſation pluck fellowes v therfore aſcribeth vnto v tyranny extortion diſturbaunce clergie vndeſeruedly punyſh extortion murther dominiōs extremely therby haue purchaſed ſmall hatred ſelues lately innocent man iohn diazius ſo cruelly deteſtably murthered neuer man beginning worlde vntyll day fratricide brother apprehēded accuſed certen prince made requeſt ſo horrible fact myght punyſhed inſued therof matter ſelfe declareth imputeth cauſe diſpleaſure trouble vnto v decree wormes decres wormes trō pet warre cauſe together wherunto aduerſaries cleaued moſte ſure foundation eſpecially duke brunſwick whiche made confederacie diuerſe conuentiō auſpurg maner decree made openly knowen certenly thoſe cruell fierce wordes ther pronounced cauſed v make league cōfederacie daye byſhops adherētes haue bene euermore buſy v al aſſemblies would haue compelled v choiſe meates holy dayes owne makyng moreouer permitted emperour auſpurg whan promyſed v faire largely ſhould appoint preacher knowen wel enough wicked ignoraunt men aſſigned office auncient cuſtome cuſtom thempire aſſēblees thempire whā prince minded retourne home thaſſemblie may emperours leaue father ſayth duke saxon tyme auſpurg could obtaine licence departe heard alſo reported caſe prepared goe ſhould yet ſtayed againſt wyll albeit vncle friderick done muche hym yet would neuer long father liued confirme hym dukedome becauſe decree wormes religion seing therfore cauſe warre manifeſtly knowen deſyre men geue credit contrary defende v common natife countrey ſubiectes clientes hath releaſed allegeaūce owe vnto v doubt wyl duty vnto v bunden proteſtaūtes letting ſlippe occaſiō fight ingolſtad ſayd remayning thre dayes whan emperour meane ſeaſon fortified campe ſtrongly fourth day septē ber remoued thence might encountre proteſtauntes remoue campe erle bure ſtop paſſage notwithſtanding ſome againſt ſaid nede go ſeke enemy ſight eies pitched next tyme neuburg fortified garniſon two day marched donauerd tenth day september encāped beſydes uending towne erles oeting ſending thence eſpialles bring ſome intelligence erle bure perceiuing emperour ſent aduertiſement erle turning way marching norinberg regenſpurg came emperour ingolſtad ſafitie wherfore proteſtauntes fruſtrated hope third day returne vnto donauerde hether came vnto chriſtopher counte oldenburg friderick rifeberg two legion erle bichling fiue enſeignes fotemē meane tyme emperour remoued campe nuburg whan aide came ſouldiours garnyſon rendred towne emperour pardoned al taking ſtipulation ſhoulde weare armure nuburg rē dred vnto ye emperour againſt report went emperour would auſpurg wherfore germaines paſſe ouer thonawe let iourney whan leauing garniſon nuburg marched toward marxeme returne back former campe tolde ſent ambaſſadours ayde fraunce englande vaine king fraunce dede excuſed matter hauing made peace ye emperour ſayd could beit would haue emperours fraunce de 〈…〉 ed ayde ther proteſt power increaſed deſyred peter stroſſe florētine man war exceading riche lende thre hondreth thouſand crownes intent might eaſelier doe payeth great ſomme money ought content aſmuche straſburg auſpurg ulmes became ſuerties goeth forth iohn sturmius ſent ambaſſadour fraunce prince campe donauerde whan came thither honorably receiued departed ſuche ſorte would aſſuredly defray money tyme came ſhuld diſburſe could found fraunce many men ſuppoſe wrought policie cardinall peter ſtroſſe diſceaued ye proteſtātes tournon hatred bare religiō wyſhed aduerſitie proteſtauntes chief authoritie king thende september proteſtauntes write zurick berne baſill schafuſians ſhew themperour intēdeth prote write swiſſes goſpellers daunger ſhal ſtand alſo caſe get victory conſider whether wiſdome thē declare ſelues ennemies emperour byſhop rome inuade emperours countrie next thē wyll ſo doe promyſe ayde fidelitie wherunto make aunſwere howe reſt ye swyſſes lyke caſe haue league inheritaūce houſe auſtriche burgundy whiche aunſwer proteſtātes countreis haue wyne bread corne whiche league ſhould ſelues infringe swiſſes fellowes whiche contrary religion ſhould haue iuſte cauſe aſſiſte emperour kyng ferdinando opē ſtrayte paſſages alpes whiche haue great labour ſhut vp cloſed ſo ioyne ennemies moreouer wynter hande ſo albeit would neuer ſo fayne yet great thing yeare ſhould leaue owne countrey naked feared leſte others would take poſſeſſion meane ſeaſon therfore muche better tary ſtyl home ſo ſhall fellowes ſtyre haue already declared vnknowen beare ryght good wil wyſhe proſper owne harte deſyre howebeit thinke mete thē enter ſo great daunger therfore deſyre take good parte emperour remoueth marxeme donauerde fyndyng place conuenient encampe tourneth left hand thyrde daye october marcheth monheyme fortuned great myſte eſcoutes ſent knowe whiche waye emperour went brought contrary reportes fine whan lewys erle oetinge brought certen worde paſſed great part armie ouer ryuer wernize followed immediatly two clocke none towardes nyght pytche tentes paſſing halfe myle emperour hitherto came vnto meſſengers city norling ſeing themperour ſo nigh required ayde aunſwered emperours proteſtātes campes nere together frankely nex day myſte forewarde led duke saxon lātgraue middle ward george malſpurg rifeberg rerewarde duke saxon marching forwarde fiue legion many troppes horſemen approcheth nere vnto thennemy ryding pricking courſing vp partes whan waxed clere themperour perceiuing ye vantwarde kept ye way towardes norling rereward come yet ſight auaunceth al horſemen though would geue battell lantgraue therfore mids time ye whole armie enemy made towards aſketh coūſel ſome aduiſed folow ye duke saxō becauſe reward yet far behind departure ſawe ſhuld like fal lapſe ennemies thought good depart ſending meſſēgers haſte forward cal back duke saxō kept hilles vpon ſtired midway betwixt army ye riuer egra dede ſmal yet hard paſſe ouer eſpecialy themperour wold haue foughten battel unto riuer come erle bure power whan like ſhuld haue ioined battel themperour calleth back cōmaundeth ſtraitly go thus returned campe proteſtauntes pitched far frō norling next daye certen troupe themperours horſemen ryde nere vnto enemy gaue thē hote ſkirmyſche conflict hurt albert brunſwick ſonne duke philip going vnaduiſedly wel tippled albert brunſwick hurt caried norling died long emperour remayning certen dayes ſendeth meane tyme octauius farneſius owne force almaigne fotemen munitiō take donauerd fortune fauoured man deuiſe ſettyng forwarde night whan come thither ſone day appered auauncing ladder ſcale townes men yelded ſelues ſouldiours garnyſon fayne donauerd rendred ſaue thē ſelues flyght done themperour marcheth donauerd proteſtantes intent haue aſſaulted emperour campe departure altered yt purpoſe thought themperour ſome intelligence therof eſpial thoſe day duke alba ſent demaūde lantgraue kept ſo much hilles mountaynes cometh downe plaine fielde trye matter battell lantgraue ſent word howe duke alba raūteth ye lātgraue fellowes fiue dayes together plain fieldes ingolſtad offered battell would fight bicker norlinge taried whole daye whyleſt done sweden fell great alteration saxonie emperour deuiſed alteratiō sauonte duke maurice regenſpurg ferdinando prage emperour commaunded inuade enter poſſeſſions electours saxonie lantgraues countreis ſpecified wherupon duke maurice firſt beginning warre retourning home regenſpurg calleth conuention chemnice al ſtates within dominion cōſulteth nedefull done counſell know certenly emperour duke maurice conſulteth againſt proteſt whether wyll permitte kepe religion ſafely ſecondly marque brandenburg electour ſhould make interceſſion caſe may aſſuraunce religion interceſſion wil take place exhorte much bounden al matter beſides religion obey emperour would ſit quiet hire power defende countrey unto thing promiſe ayde chouſe ſyx whole nū ber aſſiſte time aduiſe counſel whan themperours cōmaundemēt ſaid came vnto hym king ferdinando alſo muſtred men hongary leuied power boheme holdeth another aſſembly ſtates fridberg eight day october reciteth ye former treaty ſayth aduiſe marque brandē burg haue ſolicited duke saxon lantgraue permitte yt might intreate matter haue earneſtly admonyſhed alſo perill thing would ponder diligently yet dede haue receiued conuenient aunſwer libelles ſet matter come hand ſtripes haue bickered together haue ſondry ſmal cōflictes albeit yt thei haue diuers time required ayd yet foraſmuch themperour hath giuen ſufficiēt warraūtiſe religiō therfore hath following coūſel ſtired nothing hath kept ſoldiours ye defence prouince conferred matter coūſell wt ſix choſē time ſo troubleſome perillous yt thoſē ſay thei ar able beare ſo great burthē wherfore requeſt aſſēbly called thēperours cōmaundementes brought vnto hym ſhewe ſore moſte importance ſuch ſorte caſe neglected whole countrey therby like come wounderfull daunger moreouer bohemers theyr fellowes prepare warre comen countrie al ready purpoſing inuade prouince duke iohn friderickes albeit hath firſt letter ambaſſadours laſt al going ſelfe alſo intreated king ferdinando contrary yet could obtayne nothing aſmuche alſo ſuppoſeth ſame done themperours commaundement neither may neither lieth power reſiſt would dede right gladly ciuile warre appeaſed turkiſh violence might repreſſed beit knowe ſorte coūtreis lincked together hope ſucceſſion howe hath ſiluer mine alſo comon prince electour ſuffer theſe thinges plucked away houſe saxonie siluer mynes cōmon ye duke saxon come ſtraungers handes ſhould great grief moreouer whole coūtrey lieth ſo intermingled per celles caſe foreine ſoldiours ſhould inuade coſyns prouince daunger leſt countrey ſhuld alſo ſuſtain great hurt therby ſe alſo good forein nation ſhould remaine theſe party ſeing matter thus deſyreth alſo brother auguſtus name would way whole caſe diligently help ayde counſell eftſones wyl omitte nothing ſhalbe duty ta agayne thē matter debated condeſcended immediatly aduertyſe duke saxon lantgraue emperours commaundement preparation kyng ferdinando deſyre auoyding deſtruction would permitte duke moris myght enter poſſeſſions countrey ſo ſhuld eſchew vnreaſonable requeſt duke mauris counſell forein warre kepe ſafe religion whan matter appeaſed great deale eaſely obtayne ſame agayne handes thā others therfore writing letter effect eleuenth day october thei deſire way ſelues whole matter cōformable counſell doubtles beſt may troubleſome tyme geuē requyred alſo lātgraue letter would perſwade prince electour take ye ſame way duke moris wrote alſo letter ye lantgraue father lawe much like inportaunce becauſe foreine ſoldiour hande ſayeth howe muſt neceſſite prouide saxony ouerrunne promyſeth hym muche good wyll amitie ſheweth deſyreth nothyng ſayeth moreouer kyng polle wyl petitioner emperour thyng glad heare wherfore let hym ſo content exaſperated wordes lykewyſe perſwade electour neyther refuſe ſubmit ſelf emperour maner waye come reconcilement wil alſo helpe make peace conuention fridberg iohn william electour ſonne saxonie whan heard preparation kyng ferdinando ſending ambaſſadours requyreth duke moris according league inheritaūce wold ioyne force ſaue common countrey daunger duke moris ſayth hath ſpared payne matter might haue bene appeaſed ſeing hath takē labour vaine armure may nothing againſt ſupreme magiſtrate whome alſo aunciēt league doth except ſong euer ye proteſtaūtes heard emperours going donauerd nex day ther purpoſe go lawging towne vpō riuer thonaw thre mile aboue donauerde night whan vncerten whether emperour gone forward ſhould leaue back many ſaid daunger leſt ſhould take norling vale remſie inuade lande wirtemberg altering purpoſe remayned one day toke scherteline diſpleaſauntly likewiſe thinges going auſpurg scherteline departeth proteſt auntes citie ſent forth warres leadeth away ye garniſon lawging returneth field meane ſeaſon themperour marching forward frō dona uerde taketh cōpoſition dilling hochſtet ſhortly lawging gundelfing ye riuer brent wherfore hauing gotten poſſeſſion water thonawe great cō modities ſerue purpoſe leauing algarniſō lawging emperour winneth riuer thonawe whan paſſed ouer brent pitcheth tentes village sontheyn ye way ulmes thre myles ye ſame place xiii day october proteſtātes length remouing campe whan heard emperour kept iourney towardes ulmes nex daye came sieng town ſame riuer litle aboue sontheim ſo water mids betwixt army ſtaied yet pitched tentes eſpie certen horſemen top next hyll amongs whiche thēperour ſelf rode forth wt duke alba eſcoute abroad ſame day duke saxon ye forewarde haſteth ſpedely toward enemy ſendeth alſo worde lantgraue make haſte hym time enemy fled ſlacketh matter tarieth lantgraue hyll thought loſt occaſiō taking emperour loſte agayne moſte goodly oportunititie well foorde ryde ouer ryuer one brydge al thoſe party though emperour peraduenture eſcaped ſame yet chief captaines bene great diſtreſſe thei ſelues afterward ar reported haue hid emperour omitting iourney ulme leſt leuing enemy behinde back ſhould loſe vitall thonawe goeth another way worke ides october next wood laieth ambuſche thre thouſand arcubuſiers whan prince eulmone offered warlike pollicie ye emperour ſkermyſche light horſemē charge geuen infayning fled allured wood ſide thei breake thēbuſchemēt diſcharge ſeing lantgraue came ſtreight wayes reſcue company daūger fowre bandes horſemen wherfore ſore conflicte day till night field piece brought bickering whyle duke saxon abode armie caſe emperour ſhould tumulte haue aſſaulted campe might ready gyue repulſe whan wold take place emperour attempteth matter camiſade night chouſeth whole nombre fotemen almaignes spanyardes pollicie cōmaundeth put whyte ſhirtes ouer harneſſe appointeth alſo horſemen duke alba captain ſendeth forth night ſone watche ſet myght go ſtyll cloſely enemy campe ſelfe immediatly followeth reſt power whan came thither perceiued nomber watchemen increaſed vp armure wherfore enterpryſe vayne muche vnderſtode matter eſpiall fewe howres wante forage vytayle peſtilencein emper campe tyme yeare continual rayne died ſore themperours campe tyme alſo cardinall farneſe departeth campe homeward certen bandes italian horſemen emperour alſo ſame cauſe compelled chaunge place retourne old cāpe beſides laweging daye kalendes nouember unto letter ſtates duke moris dated fridberg xi day october ſayd lantgraue anſwereth xx day ye ſame moneth hartely ſory lantgraue aunwereth ſtates duke moris warre ſhould attempted thoſe countreis muche common daunger doe ioyne force together example elder doe conſider warre againſt religion ſemeth hym great maruel ſeing byſhops letter ye swiſſes league made betwixt emperour ſhewed vnto heluetians byſhops commaundement doe opēly teſtifie plainly declare ſame ſince league made great force haue commen emperour italy italian taken affirme certenly purpoſely ſent warre againſt lutherians moreouer fellowes ſame religion war much cruelly handled others ſpoyling firyng robbery woman maydens wickedly defloured yong chyldren infātes crueltie wrought papiſtes haue handes fete cut euen hatred doctrine emperour hath warraunted religion diſſimulation caſe demaunded whether would luther religiō ſhould ſubmitted authoritie decree byſhops counſell doubte craft would ſone appere wherfore let truſte promeſſe affrayd themperours ſentence outlawyng marueleth greatly knowe ſame lawfull hym ſo doe vnleſſe party firſt bene ſommoned conuicte iudgement greateſt grief noble houſe people saxonie ſhuld thus deuided one mynde would ioyne force together daunger ſo feared might eaſely repulſed hath verely talked electour herein nothing agreable waye whiche ſhewe ſhould chaunge fortune require lyke duke moris doubteth would refuſe alſo would counſell contrary wherfore doth lyke theyr coūſel worſe duke moris hath lately writtē ſory heare bruted ſhuld couet poſſeſſe cōſyns prouince reporte vntrue iniurious therfore praied credit ſame whan receiued theſe letter contented excuſe thought matter ſhold ſeaſe vpō coūtrey thei ſe men would iudge deſireth therfore would impeche thing done otherwyſe forreyne warre ciuill alſo wil enſue vpon ſame caſe ſuſteyne iniury reaſon emperours proſcription neither fellowes ſtande ſame caſe helpe wilbe ende therof hard iudge therfore let indeuour houſes saxō heſſe deuided duke maurice doe aſſiſte fellowes ſhalbe chiefly honour welthe alſo wrote ſame day alſo moris like effect admoniſheth waye emperours proclamation outlawyng cal remembraunce electour haue done father duke george vncle made wil themperour ſhould poſſeſſe whole prouince vntil brother proie benefites duke moris forſake proteſtauntes religion knoweth benefit receiued moreouer duke george gaue vnto father yearly penſion ther ſome feare leaſt woulde haue denied ſame hatred bare religion proteſtauntes promyſed hym ſo came paſſe would liberalitie gyue hym aſmuche yearly wherfore let hym ſurceaſe enterpryſe attempt nothing duke saxon prouince without loue leaue otherwyſe ſhall want fellowes ayde ambaſſadours pole dede emperours campe haue ſignified duke saxon haue done condicions ſuche ſort make nothing peace lyke importaūce councellours warre wryte duke moris ſtates proteſte force done yt duke saxon wyll neglecte iniury electour ſelfe made none aunſwere tyme ſhall declared hereafter ſame day alſo lantgraue counſellers write proie letter city city maydenburg brunſwyck breme hamburge goſlary hildeſſeme goting hanobrie embeck minden duke pomerane duke luneburg prince anhalde ſhew daunger toward saxonie chiefly electour vnto whoſe frountiers ennemies comen already beginning cometh kyng ferdinando hath enforced bohemers vnto warre duke maurice taketh parte pretendeth cauſe emperour hath outlawed howbeit haue ſende duke moris ſhould medle ſhall duke saxon wante helpe muche whole countrie ſtandeth preſent daunger duke aſketh helpe ayde mynde haue delyuered hym part armie haue together becauſe ennemie far good hope matter ſhall ſhortely tried mayne battell wherin welthes conſiſt thinck wyſdome preſent make ſelues ſo muche weaker fetche ennemie moleſted warres ſhould auaunce whole force againſt ſeing ye caſe ſtandeth thus require name wold ſende ayd fotemen ſo ſone wittemberg weinmar alſo reſt money dew league pay vnto electours ſonne counſellours caſe cō mon whan fellowes ouerrunne lyke miſfortune wyll ſoner chaunce vnto haue ſpoken bohemers ſerued fardinando dede howbeit full ſore againſt willes reaſon aunciēt bohemers ſerued againſt duke ſax vnwillingly league houſe saxon agayn ſaid war nedeful many thought electour alſo wrong ferdinando brought ſent power hōgary sileſie ſo might conſtraine whether wold horſmen hongary commonly called huſſares exceadyng huſſares rauenous cruell kynde men wherfore leuing force alſo whan paſſing owne limites sebaſtian weittemulle general armie ſending letter xx day october proclameth warre duke sarons people certen yeares paſt prince ſeaſed ferdinando depute proclaimeth saxonie handes abbeye dobrilug renoū ced lately fidelitie emperour confederate breaking league betwene bohemers houſe saxon albeit thing requireth declaratiō muche outlawed emperour yet leſt thing might appeare omitted would diſcharge geue aduertiſement tyme ambaſſadours proteſtauntes aſſemblie ulmes common cō ſultation wher saxonie came diuerſe meſſages ſtate thing electour ſending letter xxvii day october chargeth ambaſſadours ulme declare whole matter fellowes require conſider caſe aſmuche duke ſarons requeſt hys fellowes hath ſpared peryll paine might defende higher part germany diſtruction counſellours warre day paſt ſent worde city saxony ſhould helpe hym wil vncerten though would yet feareth greatly ſhall able reſiſt ſo great multitude enemy daunger leſt euer ready enemy wyl haue inuaded countrey theſe thinges therfore let require fellowes firſt aſmuche ſhould great grief diſcommoditie extremitie leaue longer deſtitute wyfe child people wold geue counſell herein moreouer would graunte ayde wherof lantgraue counſellours warre haue put hope already finally make peace ennemy haue recouered yt hath loſt hereunto ambaſſadours aunſwere franckly chiefly intreate would tary armie tyll emperour ſhall haue broke vp campe wynter ſhewe daunger ſhould departed ferdinando maurice doe wrong promyſe ayde ſay ther doubt fellowes prince ſtates wyll according league faithfull helpfull hym wyll conclude peace haue recouered owne caſe thought good would alſo lyke maner lantgraue counſellours warre haue done ſignifie ſo much duke maurice truſt alſo vndoubtedly ſuche ſtates cō federacie saxony wyll doe dutie herein forſayd xxvii day october duke maurice wryteth duke maurice letter electours letter dreſda prince electour emperour hath commaunded hym doe peryll matter conſiſteth hath heard lately letter ſtates countrey ſo muche emperour hath aſſured people concerning religion therfore determined intent emperour may ſatiſfied ryght alſo may remayne vnto hym whole aduiſe counſel fynde meanes lande prouince doe come handes ſtraungers doth owne alſo brother auguſtus name denounce hym tyme come ſhall agayne reconciled emperour kyng ferdinando wyll refuſe wyll ſuffer ſtates iuriſdiction ſhall treate betwyxt order whole matter ſelfe ſame wordes writeth alſo iohn william electours ſonne warneth hym ſee letter adreſſed father conueyed meane whyle bohemers nuſſars make inuaſion uoetiande next coſitrey electours ſleying ſpoyling electours countrey • nuaded burning rauiſhing meaſure bohemers taried long becauſe ſayd ſerued vnwyllyngly eleuenth day nouember forſakyng enſeignes ſlyppe home euery man hongarians ſuch bohemers ſlyp away others ferdinando hyred ioyne ſelues vnto duke maurice taketh rendring firſt swiccauie ecne berg aldeburg moſte parte electours townes ſweareth vnto hym ſauing gothe iſenack wittemberg newes therof brought themperous campe ſtyred vp great ioy gladnes emperour declared great peale ordenaunce accuſtomed theſe dayes emperour chaungeth campe againe lyke cauſes chouſeth commodious drye ground myght ſomwhat refreſh poore ſouldiours releue alſo vitaile others moſte part counſelled ſouldiours might retire vnto place ſhould wynter ſelfe opinion continew armie field maintaine warre men moſte part cried vpon duke duke maurice 〈◊〉 ali men maurice whiche ſerued ſo ſknekyſhely whome oughte haue honoured father maner ye authour requite ſuch vnthākfulnes ther came forth reproche diſpraiſe libelles verſes moſte bitter whiche charged falſefying fayth treaſon moſte ingratitude ſo muche wold nothing herein intreaty neyther wyfe father lawe thing knowen publiſheth wryting purge excuſes ſelfe ſheweth maner religion countrey hath promiſed people furtheraūce religion hath founded certen scholes ſaith emperour hath aſſured people hym prince alſo concerning religiō preſeruation lybertie germany neyther wyll thyng done violently cauſe maye lawfull wyſe appeaſed accordyng vnto many decree empyre already enacted wherfore geueth credit promeſſe letter enſample thoſe prince whiche ſerue hym doe home campe alſo warfare profeſſe religion ſuche familiar hym dayly ſight may eaſely knowe mynde caſe perceiued ſuch thyng without doubt would tary hym biſhop aydeth done bicauſe warre attempted againſt thē chiefeſt aduerſaries errours authoritie neither ſo muche conſidered moueth emperours minde maketh warre wherfore ſeing religion aſſured ſeeth cauſe ſhould obey themperour al thinges chriſt commaundeth geue god alſo emperour whiche trauell payn hath taken matter might without ciuile warre haue ben pacified vnknowen emperour kyng ferdinando diuerſe others peace could graunted emperour ſent ſtreight cōmaundement ſeaſe vpon landes iohn friderick alſo kyng ferdinando hauing leuied force hongary boheme auſtriche ready inuade would intreated ſent armie taken already certen ſyluer mynes whiche common betwene coſin hym dryuen neceſſitie prouide got reſydue inuaded purpoſe firſt declared boeth lantgraue duke coſyn alſo sonne ſeing ſo deſyreth man miſtake doyng credit ſuche thynges ſhall haply reported duke maurice nothing coucious hym mainteyning religion wylbe conſtant hath none reſpecte thinge landes dignity houſe saxon ſhuld come ſtraungers handes tyme began perſecutiō fraunce perſecution fraunce town thoſe party called melda ten mile paris byſhop therof former yeares williā briſſonet deſirous purer doctrine appointed good preacher inſtructours people excluding al freers tyme ſame cauſe diuines sorbone procured ſome daunger ſhewed conſtancie refuſed enterpryſe notwithſtanding remnaunt doctrine remayned mindes many yeare thre ſcore townes men conſulting matter chouſe ſelues preacher worde aſſembling priuate houſes whan sermon ended certen dayes receiue lordes ſupper order goſpell chriſtes inſtitution thing could long kepte ſecret eſpecially ſythe dyuerſe alſo came countrey wherfore beyng taken whan together put pryſon examination caried paris carte receyuing ſentence death caried home agayne fourtene bounden ſeuerall ſtakes burnte quicke one tyme reſidewe whypped banniſhed retournyng home warde paris one commeth runnyng next village exhorteth perſeuer ende wherfore beyng apprehended ſuffered lyke punyſhement others ther brent put torture intent ſhould vtter fellowes follower theyr doctrine could extorte nothyng many ſuppoſed done pourpoſe breake amitie knitting betwene kynge proteſtauntes duke maurice letter defiaunce duke saxon delyuered campe ſyxt daye nouember fourmer booke haue ſhewed howe byſhop xvi daye apryll gyuing ſentence agaynſt tharchebyſhop collon appealeth frō pope archbyſhop collon depriued hym al eccleſiaſticall office nowe heard fyrſt therof certentie fourth daye nouember hymſelfe mentioneth fewe dayes ſettyng forthe wryting declaryng cauſes acknowledge byſhop hys iudge accuſed already hereſy idolatrie appealeth ſentence vnto lawfull counſell germany whan ſame ſhall begynne ſayeth wyll perſecute ſuite againſt byſhop proteſtauntes ambaſſadours whiche ſhewed aſſembled ulme aboute ende october whan could agree ſentences moneth nouember went campe gienge conſultation might eaſier propounded ſo muche ſome fellowes religiō geue ayde cōfederates luneburg pomerane certen others reſt state city saxonie helpe muche nothyng brought fraunce reaſon ſoldiours doe dayly ſlippe awaye tyme yeare diſcommodities armie deminiſhed muſt chouſe one theſe thre thynges eyther geue battell departe field retyring ſoldiours place may wynter el make peace truce matter debated condeſcended make mention peace aſſigned adam trotte cauſe electour brandenburg acceſſe marque iohn brother breake matter emperour whiche eſpiall knewe throughly caſe diſcommoditie lately receyued glad tydiuges saxony propounded verey harde condition determined reſte force beyng led saxonie thouſande horſemen eight thouſande fotemen ſhould wynter certen place coſte charge duke wirtemberge city vpper partes germany thre twenty day nouember retyre makyng fyrſt decree ambaſſade ſhould ſent fraunce englande two twenty daye ianuarye mere agayne frankefurte thus warre gouerned nothyng luckely whiche miſfortune vnlucky ſucceſſe proteſt warre thought principal cauſe matter wrought order wyll one duke saxon lantgraue authoritie egall chaunced many goodly oportunities diſceptation omitted ſame whiche authoritie cānot beare equalitie alſo decreed placyng soldiours came none effecte whan many refuſed contributaries longer emperour intelligence theyr departure maketh forth horſemen immediatly vnderſtande iourney ſhortly commaundeth duke alba erle bure followe ſelfe alſo goeth forth horſemen germany leauing fotemen cōmaunding remayne moſte part proteſtātes already campe ſhould reſte al nyght lantgraue albeit led forwarde ſame day yet taried duke saxon either thē ten guidons horſemen fiue hondreth gūners theſe ſtayed vpon hill plāted redy ſuch field piece thē thus abiding ennemies whan almoſt darke night emperour calleth mē back went alſo ſoftely forwarde tyll came campe beſydes heydenem lande wirtemberg eſcapyng moſte preſent daūger emperour peril proteſt geuen charge whiche ſo fewe nomber compariſon ennemies bene either taken ſlayne ſo let ſaye ſelues afterwarde themperour knewe force ſuppoſed many mo thā nothing haſty thē ſame night commaunded fotemen marche forward followe intent verely might haue foughten next day ſaid goyng ſecretly away night nowe come army wherfore emperour retourneth campe made abode two day refreſhe ſoldiours becauſe ſuppoſed wold wynter franckonie fertile plentifull countrey thought preuent therfore taken rendring bophing norling coſitie oeting dingelſpulle haſteth great expedition roteburg citie empire ſtanding • riuer duber lantgraue going duke wirtē berg deliuered force duke saxony retourneth home kalendes december came franckfurt duke saxon although wanted senewes warre yet marching forwarde army battred gemund towne sweden hath rendred cauſeth senate geue ſomme money whiche gathered euery man twelfth daye duke saxon •• acteth mony papiſtes december came army frankefurt getteth thē nyne thouſand crownes impoſeth archbyſhop mentz fourty thouſand proceding ſtyll handleth ryche abbot fulden certen others romiſhe religion ſame ſorte lantgraue returning home ſendeth letter duke maurice ſonne lawe ſignifiyng wyll come ſo wyll aſſure ſaufe conduite woulde intreate peace betwixt duke saxon duke maurice doeth aſſure dede ſendeth letter ſame therin ſo many condition thought good goe ſent ambaſſadours herman hundelſuſe henry lerſuer laboured matter erneſtly yet could nothing cō cluded whileſt maurice ſaid might accorde wtout thē perours cōſent duke saxon army ready wold haue delay yt wold attēpt war againſt therfore whan hope peace lantgraues ſoldious retourne home howbeit recrode brought fotemen almaines fraunce ſayde remayned ſtyll duke whan emperour rotburg ſendeth away erle bure gyueth hym charge fynde ſome meane get franckefurte ides december wryting letter thence ulrich duke wirtemberg al beit ſaith war certen emperours letter duke wirtemberg yeares paſt lantgraue attempted againſt brother kyng ferdinando taking dukedome wyrtemberg reaſon would ſhould haue punyſhed extremely yet forgeue al iniurie penaltie ſhewed fauour nowe late begynning warre although deſertes farre otherwyſe muche exerciſe tyranny vpon owne people alſo ouer certen ſtates city empyre neither obey lawe iudgement ſente ambaſſadour man honour whiche ſhold declare vnto cauſe war enterpriſed alſo requyre ſit quiet ſhould loke fauour handes al theſe thinges neglected regarding allegeaunce owe vnto v haue aſſociated ſelf outlawes confederate haue incurred lyke cryme rebellion haue done firſt haſt taken certen townes brother ferdinando ſtates myne alſo empyre vpō ſoden men owne faction content whan theſe thinges workyng denounced warre againſt v certen mallaparte boldenes moſte opprobrious wordes haue hurte fame eſtimation goyng take v degree hygheſt honour dignitie deniyng vnto v fidelitie ſtreyghtways conſpiratours durſte leade forth armie againſt v doynge outtrage vnto many clientes brother ferdinandos myne wherby haue fallen penaltie whiche dewe vnto periured outlawes conuictes hygh treaſon ſeyng thus haue iuſte lawefull cauſe auenged moſte extremelie accordynge demerytes yet accuſtomed clemencie myſerable people maye ſpared ſtrayghtely charge commaunde immediatlye vppon ſyghte hereof doe ſubmitte vnto v ſelfe countrey haue world without condition exception may ordre vſe ſame pleaſure vnles ſhall obeye ſame ſhal perſecute thine ſworde fyre thoſe letter whiche ſent foure dayes ſynce doe content v neyther ſufficient pourge excuſe thyne offence ſendeth copie ſame letter vnto ſubiectes alſo chargeth obeye hym longer ſende ambaſſadours vnto hym know pleaſure releaſeth alſo allegeaunce othe wherby bounden hym wyll doe wil prouide ſayth ſhall lyue better ſtate hereafter threatneth lyke puniſhement time emperour wrote duke alba armie border countrey wyrtemberg duke ulriche goyng caſtell tuel ſtanding vpon high hyll without region emperours letter delyuered vnto hym way xx day duke letter ſubmiſſiō themper december wryteth vnto hym moſte humbly great ſubmiſſion brought thus hygh diſpleaſure moſt hartely ſory neither could thing haue chaunced vnto greuous diuerſe intreated ſelfe alſo acknowledge faulte craued pardon good hope diſpleaſure ſhould haue bene appeaſed ſame hope reteyneth ſtyll hath tried experienced clemēcy wonte vſe towardes ſuppliauntes hereof armo example one ſhewed many yeares ſince vnto certen prince whiche happely gaue ſomwhat occaſion diſpleaſure hath done caſe wold haue heard ambaſſadours doubteth woulde haue wrytten muche gently wherfore craueth mercy beſecheth chriſtes ſake forgeue hym worke extremitie againſt hym beyng myſerable prince yet againſt poore ſubiectes tyme came vnto emperour men armes naples numbre fiue hundreth leading iohn baptiſte spinello emperour goeth marching hale towne sweuia vnto lately reconciled thether came vnto hym fridericke paulſgraue paulſgraue aſketh pardon themps prince electour ayded proteſtaūtes foure hondreth horſemen whiche came vnto ingolſtad wherfore goeth vnto emperour ſheweth hym done reſiſt fulfyll league wherby bounde duke wyrtemberge themperour taketh vp ſharply accompting much done blameth ſore neuertheleſſe remitteth offence warneth hereafter recompence fault errour truſty fidelitie alitle warres whan paulſgraue intended haue ſet ordre church ſent paulus fagius mā learned eloquent come straſburg hedelberg paulus fagius might guide doctrine goſpel ſhew way vnto others ſucceſſe emperour begonne quite daſſhed fewe day came ambaſſadours ulme ulmes recō ciled emperour made ſubmiſſion craued pardon reconciled citie chiefeſt force authoritie al sueuia wherfore breaking frō felowes great matter writing letter frēdes thende december ſignifie cauſe ſo emperour preſt haue beſeged city roūd vtterly forſaken fellowes ſawe man helpe able defende againſt ſo great power moreouer certen chiefeſt confederate ſued vnto emperour priuatly reconciled emperour condempneth thē hondreth thouſand crownes twelue piece ordenaunce put citie ten enſeignes fotemen meane whyle erle bure inuadeth lantgraues dominion liyng aboue franckfurt towne caſtell darmeſtat wynneth partly force partly ſurendrie fireth caſtell ſpareth darmſtat wonne people none defended inhabitauntes company taken coūtrey paſſeth franckfurt hope wynne ſame violence eſpecially tyme yeare ſoldiours ſo euyl plyght ſendeth away parte army paſſe ouer rhyne willeth tary mentz whan thought nothing leſſe returning home behold franckfurt ſending ambaſſadours offer render theſ frā kefurte render therle bure ſay wilbe commaundement without tariyng turneth backward entryng town armie bringeth ſubiectiō emperour gentleman plain nature whan senate gaue ſupper ieſted reported rendryng ſo lightly timourouſly ſaiyng howe darmſtat worthy inhabite franckfurt remoued dwell darmſtat towne compariſon franckefurte village howbeit cauſe ſo amonges others ſawe howe ulme duke wirtemberg ſhould reconciled fearing leſt marte ſhould taken welth ſtandeth ſame neither thei ignoraunt mentz wormes laboured emperour either citie ſelues haue frō ſending ambaſſadours receiued againe emperours fauour paying foure ſcore thouſand crownes whan duke saxon come armie frōtiers xxii day december ſending letter ſtates duke maurice made aunſwere ſayeth electours letter ſtates duke maurice letter bearing date xi daye october purpoſely would tary ſe ende hath ben done meane tyme openly knowen howbeit reaſon coſynage league amitie amonges v benefites toward prince certenly loked ſuche thing either yet woulde neuer haue thought euer would haue vſed people ſuche ſorte h hath done much leſſe wold geue ſuche counſell ſhoulde tende deſtruction whole countrey owne dommage alſo thinke tyme ſemeth vnto conuenient wherin ſhould vttered craftie deuiſes counſelles certen contriued many yeares ſince god alwayes repreſſed conſider ſelues acte whan counſelled duke george diſherite brother hys brother chyldren becauſe contrary religion make emperour king ferdinando heires vnles would profeſſe reſtore byſhops religion wyl legacie toke place whole inheritaunce reduced brother henry doctrine goſpell reteyned chiefly wrought meanes induſtrie league frendes albeit profeſſing religion entred league alſo wrytynges made ſame ſygned aſwell owne alſo ſonnes name yet muche fyrſte hope fruſtrate moue much might ſwarue couenaunt whan departed hys ſonnes alſo followed ſteppes father vndoubtedly counſell like inheritaunce againſt willes deſcended vnto henry ſonnes ſo alſo frendſhyp henry litle greue full ofte haue aſſayed ſame might vntwyned neyther enterpryſe altogether fruſtrate could bryng paſſe whyleſt liued haue laſt obteined ſonnes eſpecially maurice conceiued mynde moſte hope vertue frendſhyp fiue yeares ſynce long made magiſtrate ſtyred vp againſt whiche deſerued handes ſuche wyſe matter wanted great daunger albeit tempeſt blowē ouer mediation lantgraue bonde made ſuche thyng ſhould attempted hereafter matter ſhould ordered party according thaunciēt league yet haue abſēce perſwaded hym brother auguſtus ſeaſe vpō prouince thing aſſuredly greueth ſo muche wryting receiuing ryght frendly letter ſignifie ſuche thinge againe would nothyng herein requeſt lantgraue fellowes calamitie innocent people ſubiectes greueth calamitie saxony exceadingly whome bringing foreine cruel barbarous ſoldiours hath plaged robbery ſpoyling murther greueth alſo miniſters churche preacher ar euery driuen put flight yea virgin matrones defiled autragious crueltie doubt god wyll one auenge muche greueth troubleth handlyng thing ſo trayterouſly ſpitefully vnloked attempted coūſell vndoubtedly whiche example traytour iudas hyred vnto bribe rewardes cauſe pretēded ſhould take poſſeſſion landes charles hath ſo commaunded ferdinando vrgeth hym coſinage nere aliaunce league conuenauntes whiche commen houſes ought preferred far aboue theyr proclamation touching al thinges concerne religion charles ferdinando agreed long ſynce crime aſcribed v falſe ar troubled religion commaundement doe moue doth vnworthines thing ſelfe moue conſider whether prince might lawfully execute ſo wicked commaundement grounded reaſon brought counſel cankred mind long ſynce corrupt affectiōs prince liked dukedome better equitie ſelfe true iudgement otherwyſe reaſon would haue ſhewed muche condempned came aunſwer ſame outlawing preſcription againſt lawes decree conuenauntes wherby bound empire maurice alſo might eaſely haue ſene ben lawfull obeye ſo wicked wylfull commaundemēt ſhuld haue regarded preſeruation coſitrey rather walke foteſteppes wicked doeg duke maurice followeth doeg fayned neceſſitie dutie cloke couer fact neither maketh matter ſaye woulde haue done ſuche thyng ferdinando approched lande armie matter farre otherwyſe hath bene reported credible men firſt ſelues maurice craftie ſubtill counſelles moued theſe thynges emperour ferdinando regenſpurg alſo prage tyme ſelf hereafter wil bring lyght moreouer ſame done commō aſſent miſcheuous acte contriued fewe choſen whole nomber nowe therfore muche goodnes god retourned home armie fully determined requite prince lyke thankefulnes attempte thinges whiche requiſite defence recouery prouince whiche thing verely ſo reuenge vpon eſpecially whiche authours ſo miſcheuous counſell according wickednes hereof ſhal wel vnderſtand cruell iniurie wrong haue ſuſteyned greueth ſuerly matter come paſſe ſory dommage common countrey ſythe beginning commeth thing ſelfe requyreth ſhould defende myne owne violent wrong proteſte euyll ſo euer ſhall hereafter come therof imputed alſo fre miſdede wyll trie innocencie ſhall lawfull ſo wyll vſe courteſely gently king denmarke ayded yt proteſtātes king denmarke albeit cōfederate yet gaue ayde proteſtauntes emperour remouing hala hailbrune receiuing townes men fauour ſendeth duke alba inuade lande wirtemberg ſayd taking 1547 condition impoſed yt du wirtemberg certen place rendryng doth verey muche harme ſute paulſgraue duke wirtemberg third day ianuary reconciled vpon theſe condition ſo muche ſicke let ſende ambaſſadours make ſubmiſſiō deſire emperour mercy theſame ſhall doe perſone within ſixe weakes ſhal obſerue emperours decree concerning common wealth ſhal giue ayde duke saxon lātgraue aſſiſt emperour proclamatiō outlawry ſet forth againſt may put execution ſhall permitte emperours ennemies haue nothing doe within precinct dominion ſhal make league time wherin emperour kyng ferdinando houſe auſtriche ſhal compriſed ſubictes ſhall fortune ſerue againſt thēperour king ferdinādo houſe auſtriche ſhall puniſhe moſte extremely moreouer ſhall bynde nobilitie othe none ſerue againſt oft ſhal pleaſe thēperour paſſe countrey ſhall make way thinges munition whiche fellowes haue left within prouince ſhall deliuer euery piece furniture towardes ye charge warre ſhal pay thre hondreth thouſand crownes one half hande reſidue within xxv dayes aſſuraunce ſhall deliuer aſperge kirchene schorendorffe emperour may place garriſons pleaſure ſhall compound ſuche hath iniuried warre ſhall ſtande emperours arbitrement ſonne ſhall followe cuſtome court high burgundie whan ſhall haue matter lawe thoſe party ſhall auenged vpon ſubiectes whiche haue rendred vnto title kyng ferdinando remayne vnto hym whole within ſyxe wekes ſonne chriſtopher people doe confirme ratifie ſame brother george ſhall inioye benefite peace time theſe thynges drawen wryting third day ianuary ſaid ambaſſadours duke ulriche balthaſar gultting lewis frauenburg iohn feſler ciuilian fift daye came hailbrune falling proſtrate themperours feete ſaye howe duke letted ſicknes come hath gyuen charge make excuſe howe confeſſeth fault openly wonderfull ſory fence committed deſireth god loue might receiued mercy extremitie ſhewed poore ſubiectes doth ratife condition peace alſo ſone able come ſelfe requyre ſame wyll neuer forget ſo great benefit hereunto emperour maketh aunſwere nauius foraſmuch acknowledgeth faulte aſketh pardon ſatiſfied ſayth howe wyll mercy ſpare people pardon offence ſo obſerue conuenauntes henceforth omitte dutie came ambaſſadours memming bibrach rauenſburg kempten iſnen making humble ſupplication deſyre pardon thecities proteſtātes ſend ambaſſadours yt emperour fault haue offended ſaye imputed partly owne errour partly occaſion others flie vnto refuge vnto welſpring mercy beſeche woulde forgeue reſtore olde eſtate deminiſhe nothing priuileges fredome emperour byndeth othe faithful vnto henceforth obeye ſame lawes ſtates doe forſake league duke saxon lantgraue ayde kynde thinge make league againſt henceforth done taketh mercy condēpneth citie meming fifty thouſand crownes came emperours emperour wyll heare mē tion religion preſence deſired aſſured haue religion chaſiged nauius emperour vſed chiefly interpretour ſuche matter warned wiſe make mention therof incaſe emperour would ſurely aſcribe certen diſtruſte hym beginning warre declared mynde ſufficiently therfore let holde content requyre aſſuraunce thought done intent leſt ſhould haue nay might appere thing intended emperour publiſhed letter ſhold graū ted expreſſe wordes ſame ſhold offende byſhop rome whoſe purpoſe warre doctrine proteſtauntes might vtterly extinguiſhed theſe day aroſe rebellion gene againſt houſe rebellion aſ gene agaiſt yt hous aurie aurie prince wherof ſame tyme androwe moſt expert man sea liued emperours auauncemēt chiefeſt cōmon welth chief captaine ringleader vprore counte fliſcane ſame amonges others murthered coſin androwe iohannine aurie mā great courage erle fliſca chaunced ſlippe sea drowned thought would haue bene blacke daye muche euyll done whan gone fellowes conſpiracie ſhranke away immediatly ſtreightwayes tempeſt followed great caulme emperour affirmeth farneſians authours enterpriſe eſpecially byſhops ſonne peter aloiſſe duke placence ſhalbe declared place ſitting father trent whiche ſhuld haue ben ende iuly adiourned vntill tyme xiii day ianuary tyme father aſſembled cathedrall churche maner make decree iuſtification man condēned affirme ſince fall adam man hath fre wyl decree ye counſell trent iuſtification man iuſtified fayth chriſte imputeth rightuouſnes ſay iuſtification nothing el confidence god mercie forgiueth ſinnes chriſtes ſake ſaye neceſſary man beleue aſſuredly doubte ſynnes forgeuen nombre god elect ſuche agayne ſaye man able kepe commaundementes god though iuſtified whiche ſaye iuſtification receiued kept increaſed thorowe good workes whiche baptiſme affirme iuſtifications loſt recouered fayth ſacrament penaunce ſaye penitent ſynner hath offence wholy forgeuē remayneth puniſhement ſame neyther worlde lyfe come purgatory finally whiche affirme theſe decree derogation god glory merites chriſte whan duke saxō coming armie duke maurice fortifieth lipſia garniſon burneth ſuburbes ſame tyme came ther aboue thouſand horſemen hongarians xiii daye ianuary began ſiege townes men defending ſelues duke saxon ſegeth lipſia moſte valiauntly ende ſame moneth enemy departeth without purpoſe howbeit towne nomber ſhot went thicke hayle wonderfully rent torne vtterly defaced duke saxon departing thēce recouer ſhortly al loſt countreys thuring meyſſen alſo wan duke maurice townes ſauing lipſia dreſda bringeth alſo poſſeſſion byſhoprike magdeburg maurice loſeth townes halberſtat making compoſition byſhop iohn albert daye aſſayled lipſia kyng ferdinando commaunded bohemers ſhoulde take armure goe ayde duke maurice obeyed dede retourned home without cōmaundement wherfore king ende ianuary cōmaundeth likewyſe common prage whiche citie moſte authoritie thoſe party deſire senate ſue ye king wold ſtay cōmaundement againſt bohemers refuſe warre saxony libertie ſuche honeſtly obey cauſe ſhuld haue warre prince electour saxon moſte thinges religion one moreouer hath always ſhewed ſelfe lyke noble prince aided againſt turkes wherunto ferdinando made aunſwer amonges thinges howe warre attempted againſt religion rebellion ſay howe hath geuen great aide againſt turke matter far otherwyſe ſent meſſengers ye turke monethes paſt might procure moue war hongary boheme ſhuld take longer truce ſhould infringe ſame graūted intēt thing might haue better ſucceſſe would fayle inuade contrary ſyde whan themperour vnderſtode matter went saxony aduertiſed ſondry letter duke maurice ſendeth certen bandes horſmen fotemen ayde leading marque albert cōmaundeth force spaniardes italiās follow wherof sandey marignane wer captain marque albert departeth frō hailbrune cōpany ix day ianuary themperour alſo remoueth marque albert ſent ayde maur frō thēce ulmes ye way liudaue eſling recōciled byſhop rome told gaue ſentēce depriued tharchbiſhop collō eccleſiaſtical fūction whā thus gaue away al right authoritie ſelf ſame tyme vnto adolphe erle schauenburg adolphe ſubſtituted herman archebyſhop collon whome fewe yeares archbiſhop amōges others choſen vnto coadiutour wherfore byſhop ſending bulles warneth ſtates ye countrey accept acknowledge archbiſhop moreouer vrgeth themperour ſhuld execute ſentence archbyſhop beyng ſondry time admoniſhed leaue enterpriſe ſayde euer could ſafe conſcience emperour hauing almoſt nowe gotten victory ſendeth collō ambaſſadours philip lalenge gouernour gelderlād uiglie zwicheme lawyer calleth aſſemblie state whole prouince cōmyng certen daye ſhuld forſake archebyſhop herman goe coadiutour vnto whome ſhould ſhewe al fidelitie obſeruance high prelate clergie dede ready graunt vnto occaſion hereof nobilitie many clergie alſo noble houſes againe ambaſſadours city declare lawful forſake thei haue ſo long tyme obeyed ſo many yeares founde good godlye prynce vnto whome owe fayth allegeaunce othe matter ſtickyng harde poynte duke cleaue next neighbour auoyding trouble ſendeth coūſellours thither make intreatie whiche long much deciſion obteyne clergie wyll quiet tyll ſuche tyme state may declare whole matter archebyſhop wherfore theodoricke manderſchitte william nuenarie erles chiefeſt nobilitie ſent vnto hym ſingular wiſdome eloquence perſwade hym compaſſion people leſte whole countrey ſhould diſtroyed warre would content geue place tyme therfore releaſed men othe allegeaunce herman leueth byſhoprike forſayd coadiutour whome loued owne brother doeth ſuccede hym xxv daye ianuary archebyſhop brother named fridericke tolde tenth booke bene byſhop munſter nowe prouoſte bonna alſo depriued office gropper share lyke chaunced counte stolberge dean collon defended archebyſhop ryght conſtantly gropper ſpoyle friderick whole prouince commaundement newe byſhop religion agayne altered ſo euer bucer ſet forth quite abolyſhed whan ambaſſadours proteſtauntes bene frenche kyng went englande myght bring ſame paſſe nowe king henry ſore ſicke diſeaſe increaſing departeth life thend ianuary ye xxxviii yere reigne whā legacie death henry eight kyng england made ſon edward ix yeres heire ſubſtituted daughter mary firſt wife elizabeth ſecōd wife howbeit died condēneth thomas ye duke norfolke whoſe authoritie always gret vnto per beheaded erle surrey ſonne ſpeaking certē wordes ouer muche ſuſpected king liyng ſicke death inſued alteration religion hereafter ſhall heare albeit expulſed dominion alteratiō religion biſhop rome authoritie albeit death mā acknowledge chief head churche albeit cōmon prayer ye churche deteſted tiraūt kyng hēry baniſhed pope popery antichriſt yet kept ſtill popiſh religion hereto fore hath ben declared cauſed ſonne well inſtructed childhode whan ſhould depart appointed counſeilours nombre xvi amonges edwarde erle herford yong prince vncle unto whome afterward becauſe ſuppoſed would moſte faithfull cōmitted chefeſt part protection reſt counſailours honorable ſtyle geuen ſhould called protectour kyng realme alſo created duke whan king geuen duke somerſet dutchie somerſet loued goſpel indeuour alſo ſame might receiued moued king nephew imbrace like caſe herein companion helper thomas cranmer archebyſhop thomas cranme primate england canturbury man notable learning primate england time alſo dieth wyfe king ferdinando quene anne mother many child emperour maketh funerall ulme meane ſeaſon auſpurg moued example fellowes auſpurg make peace themperour owne daunger together hauing interceſſours fit purpoſe amongeſt others anthony fugger receiued emperours fauour condemned hōdred fifty thouſand crownes xii great piece ordenaunce furnyſhed fynde garryſon within theyr cytie ten enſeignes footemen citie captaine scherteline ſerued many yeares wage whome emperour sherteline moſte hated themp kyng ferdinando hated chiefly takyng caſtell erenberg vpon alpes wherfore albeit senate intreated muche yet ſeing emperour ſtifly refuſe wyſe wold accorde conſtrayned flie countrey ſo went hole family conſtaunce citie ye border swiſſerlād ſiege lipſia electour brandenburg intreateth peace ſending ambaſſadours thē requyreth thē myght permitted take electour brā denburg intreateth peace vp matter electour content duke maurice blaming ſore ye made ſo ſharp war ye ſixt day ye length anſwereth ſomwhat ſtraūgly whan ſaw towne able hold thennemy wherfore marque immediatly doth ſignifie ſame lātgraue praiyng hym perſwade duke maurice ſo muche ciuile war saxony well appeaſed vnles publique war themperour ſhuld ceaſe alſo deſireth would geue minde unto rather perſwade ſheweth great daunger ſtandeth fellowes moſt part already recōciled themperour duke wirtemburg hath accorded vpon moſte ſtraite condition thēperour prepareth new army much alone able long reſiſte ſo great power admoniſheth yt wold refuſe ſubmit ſelf condeſcende vnto theſe condition ſelfe hath cōceaued ſent ambaſſadours much many cauſes themperours minde ſore irritated thing ſelfe requireth certen humble ſubmiſſion craue pardon wherfore let hym haue reſpect ſelfe chyldren common multitude dryue nayle head neyther bryng matter extreme daunger wryteth alſo ſame effecte duke saxonie emperour lytle proteſtauntes departed nouember appointed certen leuie thēperour leuieth new army ſtreight wayes newe armie make warre next partes saxonie leſte state city ſhould ayde duke lantgraue ouer armie whiche nombre xxi thouſande fotemen thouſand two hondreth horſemen made general ioyce grunninge gouernour selande compell conrade erle deckelburg league proteſtauntes city oſnabruge mynden erle lippen certen others obeye cō maundement take caſtell ritberge marche thence breme moneth february ſerued emperour philippe eberſten erle chriſtopher uriſberger frideriche spedie whan electour saxonie hearde emperours ſucceſſe addreſſing letter elect saxon lettern thē ſtraſburg senate straſburge xiii daye february ſignifieth vnto howe hath recouered owne wonne almoſte duke maurice countreis thuring meyſſen cauſed nobilitie ſworen vnto hath allotted vnto ye ſhoprick maidēburg duke wirtemberg moſt part yt city vpper germany haue compounded themperour vpon condition moſte vnreaſonable omitting mention religion haue promiſed themperour ayde againſt fellowes hath chaunced vnto beyond al expectation altogether repugnaūt maner ye league heard ſay remained conſtant great pleaſure wherfore let holde fainte doe becometh confederate thing require ſo let defende maintein thē ſelues ayde swiſſes french king deſire aſſuredly ſhew alloue fidelitie letted domeſtical warre wherin god make ende cōmoditie ſhal want helpe ambaſſadours ſtates city saxony already aſſembled maydenburg treateth thoſe matter conuention appointed franckfurt truſt perfourme dutie eſpecially city wil forſake cōfederatie ides february cometh straſburge ambaſſadour frenche kyng mendoza spaniard exile promiſeth mendoza ambaſſa frē che kyng straſburge largely senate already decreed ſend themperour ambaſſade peace ſo departed thing done ambaſſadours thēperour iames sturmius matthie pharrer marke hagie cauſe ambaſſade going ulme thei ſhould know certentie vpon condition themperour might cō pounded themperour counſel anthony biſhop arras father granuellā gone beſanſon nauius ſame time chaūged life death whoſe roume afterward ſucceded george selde ciuilan death nauius annexed reaſō ſo much buſines germany iohn marquard badē harry haſie bene conſellour paulſgraue lately prince bippount right expert matter germany kyng ferdinando intent myght ſtyre vp bohemers kyng ferdinando moueth bohemers warre refuſed ſerue ſaide ſixte daye february marcheth forth ferdinando ſonne commeth letmerice frontier towne boheme tyme taried day two noble ſtates realme longe oration muche duke maurice deſyreth helpe exhorteth put armure wel auncient league betwene people alſo thēperours clic̄tes becauſe diuerſe ſay libertie herby infringed promiſeth thē aſſurāce yt ſhalbe hinderaūce thē time come ſtates whiche preſent ſay determine nothing conſent reſt require therfore ſo ſhortly call altogether certen others promiſe ſeruice duty thoſe gouernours townes vnto whome king gaue thākes others declared large time ſtande queſtion thing ſelfe requireth preſent remedy againſt ennemie time warre ſhalbe finiſhed wyll refuſe call aſſemblie deminiſhe part liberty wherfore let ſtande content follow length fearing diſpleaſure whan king taunted thē ſomwhat ſharply thei gaue aſſent alſo caſe thei ſerue perſone promiſe finde others ye ides february nobilitie men prage writing letter pray king ſo muche perſeuereth cōmaundemētes new ſtraunge example againſt xx daye marche wold cōmaunde ſtates prage caſe aſſemble determine ſome thing deſire take diſpleaſauntly reciteth done letmerice promiſeth aſſemblie againſt xviii day april warneth meane time attempt nothing neither aſſemble together wyſe fourth day thus wrytten league bohemers thei make league maintein libertie marque albert come saxony duke maurice aſſigned lie towne rochlice reuenues wherof lantgraues ſyſter wydowe daughter lawe duke george knowen iohn fridericke prince electour aldenburge three myles ſame kalendes marche ſendeth erneſt duke luneburge uolrate erle manſdfelde certen guydōs horſmen recrode legion fotemē night ſelfe reſt armie followeth next morning day lyght horſemen ſent eſcoute ſet vpon watche ſome toke reſt fled town ſuburbes foure enſeignes fotemen accompanied certen horſemen winig roclice going forth ſone day appered giue ye charge hauing repulſe retourne back ſuburbes whan electour come rereward ſhot ordenaunce town next hill fotemē alſo entring perforce fyred ſuburbes thoſe forſaid enſeignes fotemen flye awaye brydge horſemen alſo riuer mulda wherfore fotemen already poſſeſſed ſuburbes go aſſault towne luſty courage wynne ſpoyle taketh ordenaunce ye ennemy whyleſt theſe thing thus working marque marque albert takē priſoner albert ſeketh whiche way might eſcape taketh ryner intercepted ye duke luneburg brought prince electour garriſon within town ſix enſeignes fotemen putting ſelues ringe ye helpe horſmen ſtand defence vanquiſhed multitude taken ſtriped armure whā made promyſe ſerue againſt duke saxon fellowes ſix monethes ſo let go without raūſom horſemen pourſuing thoſe iiii enſeignes footemen eſcaped ouer bridge ſlea great numbre moſt part italian spaniard marque albert kyng ferdinando emperour good thouſand fiue hundred horſemē ten enſeignes foot men xiiii field piece thei fought breake day tyll none duke saxon loſt many men amonges wuolfie theodorick man noble courage beyng ſtryken gunne lefte lyfe fewe dayes nombre ſlaine within town accompted thouſand without town ryuer thre hondreth conflict electour albert priſoner retourneth aldenburg ſignifieth whole matter boheme ſheweth wil nothing againſt league deſireth haue thoſe puniſhed attempted againſt ſubiectes ſword fyre duke wirtemberg condicioned ſo ſone might ſickenes come make ſubmiſſion emperour commeth therfore ulme moneth marche • han duke wirtemtemberg craueth pardon emp yet recouered ſitting ſaddel emperours permiſſion aſmuche could remoue bowe ſelf coūſellors kneling deſireth pardoned fault promiſing henceforth aldew obediēce whan themperour hereunto made gentle aunſwere departeth immediatly war saxō goeth norling whileſt duke wirtemberg wiſe made ſubmiſſion great reſort concourſe people hauing therof knowledge came thither flocking thicke threfolde thoſe thre forſaid place land wirtemberg emperour placed garriſons good moſt part spaniardes ✚ nyntenth booke sleidanes commentaryes concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument nyntenth booke father trent make ſeuenth ſeſſions emperour hauing accorded straſburg marcheth forth armie fraunces frenche kyng dyeth ſhortly kyng england counſell trent diuided duke saxō taken battell notwithſtanding condemnation death remayneth conſtant religion wittemberge rendred vniuerſitie deſtroyed suite made agrement lantgraue coming emperour ſtayed pryſoner kyng ferdinando appeaſeth prage commotion naples reaſon spaniſh inquiſition coronation frenche kyng deſcribed citie maidenburg outlawed aſſemblee holden auſpurg peter aloeſſe pope ſonne murthered duke somerſet wynneth great battell scottes whan prince proteſtauntes vanquyſhed city made afrayd stryfe aryſeth impryſonyng lantgraue requeſt made father ſhould retourne trent pope ſuche gone boloigne le graſſe ſtode ſtyf opinion ſo muche great diſordre counſell trent third day marche ſeuenth ſeuēth seſſion trent ye sacramēts seſſion father trent condēpned al ſuche either ſay fewer sacramentes church thā ſeuen al chriſtes inſtitution deny one dignitie ſay externall ſignes grace rightuouſnes receiued chriſte faith deny grace geuen receiuinge ſame ſay baptiſme confirmation order imprinted ſoule ſpirituall token marke neuer ſcraped ye al men haue lyke authoritie miniſter ſame accuſtomed ceremony churche adminiſtration ſame may omitted altered whiche ſay doctrine churche rome mother maiſtres al others concerning baptiſme ſincere whiche ſaye uowes made baptiſme importaūce rather derogation faith haue profeſſed ſay confirmation idle ceremony tymes paſt nothing el inſtruction youth deny vertue inſtinction holye ghoſt preſent confirmation aſcribe cōfirmyng child byſhops take fūction prieſt decree made eccleſiaſticall benefice byſhops prelate church eccleſiaſticall benefice lawfully begotten yeares maners learning ſufficient man eſtate degree ſoeuer enioy byſhoprickes one poſſeſſe many may kepe ſtyll whiche liſte within one yeares ſpace ſhall put away reſt ſuche haue cure charge ſoules ſelues reſident neyther let ſubſtitute others place vnleſſe tyme ſo haue declared cauſe abſence byſhop hath allowed ſame whoſe part ſhalbe forſee people neglected prieſtes offence puniſhed ſuch vice reigne amonges ſtraitly corrected xxi day aprill aſſigned next aſſemblie whan king ferdinando come duke maurice dreſda eight day marche writeth bohemers howe iohn friderick prefixed inuade therfore let take hede matter obeye weittemulle whome hath appointed deputie abſence ambaſſadours straſburg whiche ſayde went straſburg compounde themperour ulme returning home senate miſlyke condition preſcribed emperour ſent agayn cōclude throughly traueling fynde emperour norlyng liyng ſicke gowte xxi day marche making ſubmiſſion thei reconciled condition tollerable neyther emperour charged garriſon content xxx thouſand crownes demaunded aboue xii piece ordenaunce prince electour brandenburg erneſt ſuter lantgraue alſo preferred matter kyng ferdinando condition moſte vnreaſonable thoſe ſhould allowe without exception al condition offered lantgraue decree empyre enacted hereafter ſhuld geue one ſonnes pledge ſhould releaſe duke brunſwicke henry ſonne ſtande emperours arbitrement ſhould ayde hym againſt electour saxonie fellowes certen centaynes horſemen eight enſeignes fotemen propre coſtes charge ſpace ſyx monethes ſubmitte hym ſelfe emperour cōfeſſe faultes openly theſe condition refuſed vnleſſe mitigated muche honour aſſente vnto ſignifieth letter frendes rather wyll abyde fortune ſoeuer happen themperour ſame daye accorded straſburg departed norlinge towardes nurrinberg next day adreſſing letter state duke maurice much ſaith iohn friderick outlaw retourning home flight hath recouered thoſe place whiche maurice prince electour toke commaundement ſutch alſo brother ferdinando ſeaſed thoſe party vnder tuition boheme entred verely vpon iourney repreſſe boldnes rebellion wherfore firſt foreſee ſuche place wherby ſhal paſſe armie want nothing neceſſary ſouldiours wel vſed moreouer contemning others cōmaundementes perfourme vnto prince al loue due obedience dede haue done hetherto euen intent haue taken warre hande fierſenes oppreſſed peace quietnes may recouered ſame daye alſo wryteth counſellours gouernours prage prefixed auenged vpon iohn fridericke according vnto demerites let prouide therfore campe may vitayled countrey xxiiii marche noble city boheme whiche lately made league whan aſſembled prage determined make warlike lawes ſuche requiſite warres nede requyre committe chief gouernment caſpar phulgius tyme king ferdinando duke maurice brother auguſtus came caſpar phlugius captaine bohemers armie force priccie whiche bohemers toke diſpleaſure thei entred already vpon frontier wherfore requyre ferdinando letter woulde ſuffer ſtraunge nation inuade countrey example ſtraunge perillous wryte moreouer duke maurice brother auguſtus departe immediatly limites without hurt doyng otherwyſe wyll doe counſell ſhall ſerue wherunto ferdinando aunſwereth xxvi daye marche howe ſhall nede feare come thoſe party intent might ioyne ſelues emperour nowe approching againe wryteth prage beſtowe ſuperfluous coſte duke saxon retyred electour ſent land boheme ambaſſadour nicolas minquit renew auncient league falling ſicke way whan duke saxō ſendeth ambaſſadour boheme able go prage wryting letter deſyred ſende ſome mē credit may treate cōclude whan theſe letter receiued noble men boheme wryte duke saxon prage xxviii daye marche ſignifieng minquit required howe deſyrous gratifie herein graunt reaſon would ſhould ſo howe beit impeched reaſon troubleſome tyme preſent diſquietnes duke maurice brother come force boheme intending doe ſome miſchief procurement kyng ferdinando praying take ſo though would league ſhould renewed wyll kepe ſame perſeuer olde amitie well already renewed wyll alſo doe indeuour ſhalbe confirmed ſone may therfore power lenied force prepared againſt refuſe breake league moue war againſt hym require therfore yt caſe duke maurice procede wyl vouchſaufe ayde ſhal daunger ſo great wyl refuſe venter vpon preſeruation ſaye ferdinando nowe priccie thence wyll marche armie uale ioachime reported ſo ar purpoſed fewe day marche armie leade ſame thether nede ſhall require laſt day marche ſauing one wryte ye lordes morauie exhorting thē according mutuall league bohemers letter morsuians would take armure come ſpede intent common countrey may defended wicked sodomiticall kynde men spaniardes huſſars buggerers emperour kyng ferdinādo bring fraunces frenche kyng whan reigned xxxii yeares ended lyfe laſt daye marche rambolet death frēch kyng whiche dayes iourney paris whome ſonne henry ſucceded man xxviii yeares age immediatly ſendeth cōſtable anna momorancie ſpace ſixe yeares liued priuate life fauour reſtored former dignitie great eſtimatiō againe ſuch chiefeſt authoritie partly grow fauour partly diſplaced committed priſon alteratiō court fraunce thoſe cardinall tournon anebalde admiral grinian gouernour frenche prouince duke longeuale bayarde poline eſpecially ſhe whiche bene kinges darling madame deſtampes death kinge fraunces chaunced vnfortunately ſtudentes learned mē king fraū ce fauiour learning loued liberal ſciences man better ſhewed liberalitie auaunce ſame long vſe cuſtome gotten muche knowledge dining ſupping talke commonly learning moſte earneſtly vſing many yeares ye ſame purpoſe iames coline learned knowledge man vulgare tonge moſte eloquent peter caſtellan theſe two learned whatſoeuer wrytten bokes poetes hiſtoriographers coſmographers moreouer knew perfitly whatſoeuer ariſtotel theophraſte plinie ſuche like haue wrytten nature plantes herbes beaſtes metalles precious ſtones dayly vſe hearing remember wont alſo deuiſe muche mathematical ſciences reaſon oft scripture table ſtoode alwayes notable men eche degree muche talke inferred ſondry argumēts harde one would alwayes propounde ſome matter might euery man lawfully caſe thing knowen example alſo deſire kyng excited men vnto great diligēce might reaſoning deſerue prayſe owne tongue always accompted right eloquēt graue throughout grece italy notable library kyng fraū ce ſought copied workes olde writer made goodly librarie whiche yelded certen notable bookes afterwardes keper wherof caſtellan alitle death ſent duke saxon lantgraue mayntenaunce war eyther thē hondreth thouſand crownes
