tyme departed ye mony ſcarſely deliuered ſame tyme alſo ambaſſadours proteſtauntes retourne england fraunce myght finiſhe vp reſt matter lyke found kyng henry whan fyrſt arriued ſo retourning thence fynde king fraū ce extremely ſicke wherfore happened alſo reſte emperours good fortune thoſe two moſte mightie kynges neither wanted oportunitie many men ſuppoſed wyll alſo impeche hynder enterpryſes died maner one tyme force emperours whiche oppreſſed certen noble men death two kinges happy emperour taken citie mynden ſayde went marching breme ende ſame moneth ſuch ouerthrowe loſt chief captaine warre grunninge gouernour selande whan power bremers increaſed acceſſe hamborough men uriſberger ouerthrowe emper armie death grunning chief gouernment remouing campe fetching long circuite fennes lay way began beſeige citie ſyde thither came ſhortly alſo ericus duke brunſwyck emperour ides marche ſent away norlinge intent ſhould leuie newe power horſemen fotemen leade thoſe party emperour remouing norling norinberge went thence egre towne king ferdinādos border boheme king ſondry time admoniſhed citie prage weapon reſidue ſtates therof aduertiſed fourth day aprill wryte againe cauſe haue put armure led forth armie defende countrie vniuſt violence eſpecially abſēce pray intreate themperour war againſt duke saxō ſuffer caſe may frendly debated deſire alſo haue parlament promiſe time emperour cōming egre vi • day april whan ferdinano maurice come yt day writeth ſtates boheme empe letter ſtates boheme repeting briefly writtē moneth ſheweth thē ſeketh duke saxon wherfore let bring forth vitayle furniſhe corne retourne home concerning religiō nede feare war hath moleſted mā religiō ſame tyme commiſſioners prage diſpatching letter partes warne ſtates moſte earneſtly would put armure come haſte poſſible deſend countrey matter brought extreme daunger ferdinando eleuenth aprill aunſwereth ferdinando bohemers laſt letter egre lyke effecte maner emperour therfore let leaue enterpriſe el wil fynde meanes repreſſe raſhenes wel enough intreate duke saxon lyttle maruell hath deſerued ſo neither emperour yet lande boheme touching requeſt parliament wyll doe herein ſhall become hym meane tyme duke saxon taketh duke maurice fridberge miſen towne ryuer albis tyme father trente remoue part counſell trent flitt banonie bolonia la grace neither ſeſſion wherein treated sacramentes made decree al cauſe departure ſayde ayre place greatly holſome opinion hieroſme fracaſtor phiſition father counſell byſhop rome therfore threſcore duckates moneth emperour toke matter moſte diſpleaſauntly commaunded byſhoppes diuines hys dominion remoue thence one fote wherupon parte counſell trente parte bononie tyme emperour marched norlinge norinberge erle bure whiche kept frankefurte twelue enſeignes fotemen foure hondreth horſemen ſent came thither whan come agayne franckefurt xii daye aprill putteth two two executed frankefurte death wherof one iohn uerden ſame towne william gelluſe ſubiect lantgraues cauſe execution ſayde ſent lantgraue ſhould bye smyth keyes one gate ſhould ſet town fyre foure ſondrye place ſhould dryue iron nayles canon great piece ſo might ſhot whyleſt others quenching fyres helpe fellowes ſhould ſlaye erle bure familie conſull senate ſhould infecte welles town poyſō eſpecially ſerued erles kitchin whiche court came forth wrytting pourporting howe confeſſed pryſon cōſpiracie perſeuered ſame whā led execution lantgraue pourgeth hym ſelfe lantgraues purga •• affirmeth ſynce tyme franckefurt came emperours handes hath attempted nothing cō futeth crime obiected many weighty wordes ſondry time dede cōmaunded geluſe vnderſtād way themperour counte bure marched armie thing caſe thei vāquiſhed ſharpnes torture extremitie ye payn haue ſpoken unreaſonable torment isaperillous matter yt falſe haue iniuried others alſo deſireth ſame wraſted diſdayne hatred racking torture exceadeth meane vncerten perillous probation wherof ſuch nominated fellowes conſpiracie whan place execution declared innocētes xiii day april cōmiſſioners prage wryte againe ſtates realme warne erneſtly cleaue vnto league haue houſe saxon complayne alſo diuerſe haue infringed ye ſame already wherfore thei commaunde henceforth man offende againſt ſame daye ſende letter king ferdinando beſeching neither themperour wold offēded warfare moreouer war againſt electour saxony firſt mutual league ſecondly deſireth matter might come hearing ſelfe ſame day ferdinando ſendeth iohn byſhop olmuce certen counſellours parliament ferdinādos ambaſſad bohemers prage whiche aſſigned xviii aprill thē maketh excuſe come againe requireth aboliſhe newe league laye part armure weapon otherwyſe counſell holden free denied thā ambaſſadours cōmaū dement ſhuld treate obey procede preſcribed determine thyng referre al themperour ſame daye departeth egre whole armie accompanied empe iourney againſt duke saxon brother ferdinando men armes ſyxe hondreth huſſares thouſand ten enſeignes fote men alſo two brethrē maurice auguſt like force whan marched continually ten dayes together length xxii day april commeth nere vnto miſen duke saxon hauing intelligence therof forſaketh towne whan fyred bridge pitcheth tentes nere mulberge riuer albis emperour fearing leſt ſhould haue retired wittemberge ſtrongeſt chiefeſt town dukedom ſawe nede make haſte commaunding therfore armye marche forewarde whan repoſed ſelues one daye xxiiii day apryl come water mornyng tymes duke saxon placed certen contrary banke field piece let emperour ſhould neither make brydge finde foorde tranſport armie alſo might defende brydge whiche ſelues ready made boates ſmall veſſels time thei ſawe emperour come whole army force spaniardes nomber thouſand ruſhed water great violence vp chynne holding armes aboue water ſhot fierſly piece caſte fyre bootes partly burnt therewith litle litle ſhrinke away banke towardes myddle ſtreame certē spaniardes threwe ſelues ye riuer naked carieng ſwordes ouerth warte mouthes thus ſwymming ouer moſte ſyde lay holde thoſe bootes caried downe ſtreame saxon broken reſt bridge although ſhot many piece wounded ſore yet bryng away thoſe veſſels ſuche others themperour brought hym cariage made bridge ouer riuer ſo fotemen cariage might paſſe tourmoile thinges ye duke saxon time hearing sermon ſendinge cariage followeth ſelf marcheth toward wittemberg themperour ſawe ye whole matter reſted ſpede finding foorde firſt cōmaūded huſſars emperours celeritie ouerta king yt du light horſemen paſſe ouer goeth hym ſelfe alſo horſmen complete armure tariyng nothing al neither carriage fotemē haſteth ſtil thre mile beyond yt riuer albis ye wode lochan ouertaketh prince electour encouraged men exhortaciō vnto battel giueth yt charge army deuided two partes yt forwarde duke alba lanoie anthony toletane baptiſte spinelle duke maurice rerewarde led themperour king ferdinando two ſonnes duke sauoye ſonne duke saxō might wel haue reſiſted force perchaunce haue diſcōfited ſame caſe empe fighteth battell duke saxon whole armie together great parte hys force wittemberge ſtrong garriſons left euery place william thumſerne power abſent neither could al reſt put ordre ſo great expedition themperour wherfore lēgth vanquiſhed wt greater nomber multitude whan fought till night ſelfe receiuing wound left cheke defendyng ſelf māfully taken brought firſt ye duke alba duke taken fighting preſented thēperour whoſe ſight whā come yelde ſelf priſoner ſaith moſt merciful emperour deſiring may kept vſed lyke prince thy emperour ſayeth ſhall handle thee thou haſt deſerued ferdinando toke hym vp ſharper wordes chargeth ſought diſpoſſeſſe hym chyldren euer hym taken alſo erneſt brunſwick duke philippe ſonne electours eldeſt ſonne although ſore woūded yet eſcaped came wittemberge pryſoners nomber great eſcaped flight nomber foure hondreth recouered wittenberg refuge amonges whome counte bichling recrode horſmē following chace make great ſpoyle take munition cariage duke ſent duke alba cōmit ye duke saxon duke erneſt brunſwitck cuſtody alphonſe uines time emperour came nere vnto miſen xxii april agayne next daye ſame day paſſed riuer fought battell certen day sunne loked pale dimme inuironed certen darkenes ſo perdigieof sunne ſight ſorrouful greuous beholde ſo muche whiche great way saxonie knewe nothing matter iudged pourtende ſignifie ſome great trouble obſerued germany alſo fraunce england ſo dede many thouſandes teſtifie ferdinando ambaſſadours ſent ye conuentiō prage haue ſpokē peres realme hearing demaundes make anſwer haue made league put armure neither done amiſſe againſt ye cuſtome boheme determine ſend ambaſſade king ferdinādo might declare yt ſame alſo require intreate themperour duke saxon tofore thambaſſadours ſent came newes frō king ferdinādo themperours victory duke taken chaunging purpoſe promiſe corne vitayle deſire king make meanes themperour al armie may led hongary againſt turcke whoſe comming report went daily kinges alſo might moued vnto yt ſocietie war thing may brought paſſe thei wil behind wt partes whan yt duke saxon taken themperour marcheth wittēberg came thether armie iiii day may duke condempned loſe head thre day condemneth iohn friderick loſe head ſaith treaſon whan heard therof ſhewed ſigne token minde diſcouraged aunſwered thought emperour would haue dealte ſo neuertheleſſe prefixed determined deſireth haue certen knowledge intent maye take order matter concerning wyfe child prince electour brandenburg heard battell taketh iourney immediatly comming cāpe ſixt day may doth mitigate emperours mynde ſo altering ſentence ſaued duke lyfe wherfore emperour propoundeth condition duke confirmed xviii daye may redemed life amonges others wrytten alſo ſo euer condition wherby duke redemed life counſell emperour ſhould decree concerning religion ſhould approue would wyſe aſſente perſeuered ſame herein reſpected daunger emperour commaunded part croſſed blotted reſt condition theſe renounce dignitie electourſhip ſelfe chyldren permitte emperour diſpoſe pleaſure deliuereth vp emperour wittemberge gothe ſecond fortreſſe dominion yet ſo may take way ſtuffe prouiſion ſauing munition third part vytayle emperour permitteth ſoldiours garriſons departe yet without enſeignes duke saxon frely releaſeth marque albert without raū ſome reſtoreth ſuch thinges taken emperour againe ſetteth libertie duke erneſt brunſwick taking firſt promeſſe fidelitie duke saxon reſtoreth ſuche thinges warre tyme haue bene taken away erles māſfielde marque pruſſe solmen renoūceth title maydenburg halberſtate halle promyſeth obey iudgement chamber imperiall whan ſhalbe eſtabliſhed themperour geue towarde charge therof aſſenteth duke hēry brunſwick ſonne ſhalbe deliuered neither wyll commence action againſt forſaketh league made againſt emperour king ferdinando neither wyll make frō henceforth wherin prouinces fellowes ſhal compriſed emperour doth confiſcate landes geueth ſame brother ferdinando duke maurice yet ſo duke maurice ſhall paye yearely hym child fifty thouſande crownes emperour thinke good duke saxō promiſſion maurice ſhal kepe ſtill town caſtel gothe al profite howbeit ſhal raſe caſtell fortifie towne ſo muche duke saxon greatly indebted intent thoſe debtes may payed whiche dew league smalcalde duke maurice ſhall geue child ſubſidie hondreth thouſand crownes moreouer ſhall paye ſuche debtes depende vpon landes confiſcated geuen emperour meane ſhall ſuites controuerſies betwixt haue finall ende duke ſhall attempte nothing againſt haue ſerued emperour warres yet againſt kyng denmarke ſhall obſerue lawes ſtatutes emperour ſtates empyre ſhall decree muche releaſed execution bodely puniſhement ſhall remaine henceforth cuſtody themperour ſonne prince spayne goodes mentioned child ſhall vſe enioye ſo people alſo ratifie condition peace peace exempted albert erle manſfield child counte bichlinge ringraue recrode thumſerne neuertheleſſe ſhall diſcharge armie within moneth ſhalbe therin comprehended theſe thinges conditioned emperour campe wittemberge ſyxte daye may ſummoneth aſſemble thempyre ulmes ſtates empyre mete ulme ides iune intent make league ſendeth thether ambaſſadours cardinall auſpurg marque iohn brandenburg lirane henry haſie ſame doeth kyng ferdinando unto whiche commiſſioners prage kyng ferdinandos letter bohemers lately ſayd concerning league made though newe thyng againſt cuſtome countrey ferdinando aunſwereth campe w ••• emberge ides may plainly new ſtraunge enterpryſe whiche appertaineth vtterly iniury moreouer declareth haue attempted abſence many wayes haue rebelled ſondry reaſons goeth proue ſame league made againſt emperour wherfore chargeth commaundeth abolyſhe defeate ſame reſtore vnto euery man ſeale againe deliuer copie league ambaſſadours unleſſe obeye accordingly wyl doe counſell ſhall ſerue albeit emperour accorded duke saxon ſaid yet garriſon kept wittemberge nombre thre thouſand ſoldiours citezens alſo refuſed rendre except prince ſelfe ſo commaunde townes men feared chiefly oultrage ſouldiours whan might ſee maner towne walles hurte countrey eſpecially spaniardes hongarians duke saxon therfore xxi day may whan brother hys ſonne certen counſellours came towne hym doeth releaſe othe warres commaundeth departe thence thre day ended whan commaundement geuen townes men make requeſt emperour would bryng foreine ſoldiours wittēberge rendred made promeſſe kept gaue moreouer authoritie kepe ſuche ſhuld preaſe enter without expreſſe commaundement whan ſurrendred ye ducheſſe saxon sibille cleaue going forth ſonne huſbandes brother cometh campe making ſupplication moſte humblie beſecheth themperour plentifull teares good duke huſbande emperour enterteined ryght curteouſly put good comfort licenſeth duke go citie remayne eight dayes wyfe child ſame daye ſouldiours iſſued wittemberge duke saxon commaundement whiche xxiii day may emperour ſent almaigne fotemē leading nicolas madruce two dayes king ferdinando two ſonnes came towne accōpanied electour brandenburg duke maurice ſee making long abode retourneth campe none alſo emperour hym ſelfe entreth whan come caſtel ſaluteth ducheſſe comforting wylleth good chere ſhewed death fraunces frenche buriall kyng fraunces kyng xxiiii day may buried churche ſaint denis conſecrated buriall kynges two ſonnes fraunces charles wherof one departed xi yeares paſt two yeares ſince ſayd remayned vnburied hitherto meane ſeaſon funerall preparing kyng fraunces picture certen ſpace appareled riche array hys crowne scepter ornamentes layde vpon bed wherunto certen howres dynner ſupper ſerued lyke ſolemnitie accuſtomed lyue theſe garmentes taken away mourning apparell put continually preſent xlviii monkes ſuche commonly caled begging freers thoſe ſange maſſes diriges hym without ceaſing dead corp ſet xiiii great taper ouer againſt ſtoode two aultars wherupon firſt day light tyll noone ſayde maſſe continually alſo chapel iuſt wherin burning innumerable taper lightes chariot wherin coarſe caried went xxiiii freers ſo many taper went fiue hondreth poore men mourning apparell euery man torche beſydes noble fraunce preſent xi cardinalles funerall sermon made peter caſtellane byſhop macon whome mentioned amonges thynges declareth howe king prefixed buylde college wherin artes tongue ſhould haue bene red taught ſixe hondreth ſhuld haue bene founde learning ſame vſe aſſigned fiftie thouſand crownes yearely ſhewed duke ericke brunſwick went breme howbeit xxii day may departeth ſiege defend owne coūtrey ſpoyling ſame uriſberger whiche led part armie firſt agreed vpon place ſhould mete againe power duke chaunceth vpō ennemies duke erick diſcomfited force hamburge came ayde bremers fought ſore till within night fine duke erich diſcomfited driuen backe horſemen ye riuer uiſurge loſt many men neuertheleſſe ſelfe eſcaped loſt munitiō comming emperour layde faulte uriſberger came helpe bremers fellowes counte albert manſfelde erle hedecke thumſerne conrade phenninge diuers others duke saxon cōdicioned emperour al theſe force ſlipped away whileſt theſe thinges electour brandenburg duke maurice intreate diligently lantgraue intent thing might conueniently duke maurice electour brandenb intreate lantgraue accōpliſhed ſende lipſia emperour would wyſe ſhould ſubmit ſelfe without condicion deliuer caſtels munition alſo retourneth home without concluding thing ſame day cometh weiſſefelſe foure mile lipſia next day waye ryding talked chriſtopher eblebe condicions propounded fortune eſtate knew ſayth emperour might intreated ſuffer retourne home againe let haue one caſtels furniſhed ordenaunce could content common quiet raſe reſte deliuer munition accordingly ſayeth eblebe wyll reporte tale vnto duke maurice within fewe dayes wyll eyther repare vnto agayne aduertiſe certētie hereof letter meane ſeaſon deſire ſurceaſe deuiſes going therfore vnto duke maurice long retourneth letter hym frō duke maurice electour brandenburge bearyng duke maurice letter lantgraue date fourth day iune campe wittemberge whiche importaunce ſo ſone vnderſtode mynde eblebe became agayne peticioners emperour haue obteyned doth copie ſelfe condition peace whiche eblebe bryngeth declare muche condition tollerable doubte wyll admitte ſame eſpecially conſidering great daūger ſtandeth aduiſe therfore refuſe ſubmitte hym ſelfe emperour without condition nedeth feare leſt emperour ſhuld burthē great thinges deteine pryſoner wyll become ſuertie matter thing ſhould chaūce vnto beſydes whiche conteined copie peace ſhall receiue eblebe ſhould deteyned ſtyll captiuitie wyll refuſe abyde ſame fortune called vpon child wyl offer ſelues make recompēce religion ſhall haue ſame aſſuraunce yt marque iohn haue already ſeing ſo muche compoſition ſhalbe hym ſelfe alſo common wealth expedient hartely require hym would come withall expedition bryng duke brunſwick ſonne receiue cō ditions followe aſſuraunce fidelitie herein let afrayd pryſoners ſhould taken way beare daunger whan ſhall entred way ſhall mete horſemen ſhall conduite ſaufetie copie peace ſubmitte ſelf prouince emperour without condition come emperour ſelfe humbly require pardoned behaue ſelf emperour henceforth obediently according dutie obſerue ſuche decree emperour ſhall make preſeruation common wealth ſende ayde againſt turke ſuche tymes prince forſake confederacy namely league smalcalde deliuer emperour ſuche kynde wrytinges make league tyme wherin ſhall compryſed emperour king ferdinando forbid emperours ennemies come within dominion emperour lyke puniſhe man ſhall take vppon hym defende ſame ſhall geue emperour leaue paſſe hys countrey whan thing ſhall ſo require ſuch ſubiectes ſhall ſerue warres againſte emperour kyng ferdinando punyſhe extremely ſuche ſerue preſent calle home againe ſo theſe xiiii day forſake enſeignes vnles obey make thē forfeate goodes whiche ſhall come emperours vſe charge warre ſhall pay emperour within foure monethes hōdreth fifty thouſand crownes ſuche caſtelles fortes hath ſaue zegenheme caſſell ſhall raſe grounde gariſons captaynes yt ſhall place ſame ſhall ſweare true themperour hereafter fortifie piece conſent emperour deliuer emperour immediatly munition gunnes whole furniture whiche emperour ſhall graunt ſo many ſhalbe ſufficient defence place whiche wyll permit kepe obey iudgemet chamber emmperour ſhall eſtablyſhe beare part towades charge ſame ſet libertie hēry duke brunſwick ſonne rēder vnto prouince releaſe ſubiectes othe compounde harmes done reſtore ſuche thinges hath takē marque pruſe frō others force attempte nothing againſt king denmarke others either ayded toke emperours part ſhal deliuer pryſoners ſerued vnder emperour without raunſome ſhall aunſwer men wyll trie matter lawe theſe condition ſhall ſonnes alſo confirme ſame ſhall nobilitie ſubiectes lykewyſe ſhall obſerue conuenauntes ſhall apprehende delyuer emperour theſe thinges electour brādenburg duke maurice woulfange paulſgraue ſonnes lawe become ſuerties except accompliſhe premiſſes lantgraues ſons lawe promeſſe bende ioyne force againſt whan receiued peruſed theſe thinges common aduiſe conſent ſtates lantgraue admitteth ſame yet ſo deſyred declaration diuerſe pointes ſixte day iune whan emperour ſhould remoue campe calleth ſouldiours wittēberge immediatly duke maurice putteth ſame daye calling conſulles senate caſtel ſaith demiſhe parte priuileges liberty ſo cauſeth ſworne wittemberge principall towne electourſhip whiche emperour lately geuen maurice confiſcating iohn friderickes wittēberge town electorſhip landes ſaid towneſmen nobilitie deſire duke maurice would repare scoole whiche fallen tumulte war promiſeth commaundeth countrey men scoole fallen whiche fled ſent againe promiſeth ſtuffe building wheate ſeede bread corne poore frely lende vnto reſt putteth iulius perflugius poſſeſſion byſhoprike numburge diſplaceth nicholas amſtorfe inſtituted duke iohn fridericke mentioned xiiii boke moreouer lazarus schendie ſent force men raſe caſtel gothe alſo deliuer marque albert captiuitie laſte wynter archebyſhop maydenburge made compoſition duke iohn friderick geuen place prouince chaunge fortune emperour alſo clergie toke euill parte coadiutour aſſigned fridericke ſonne prince electour brandenburg kyng ferdinando retourning campe wittemberge lande boheme ſtayed whyle letmerice frontier town thence beginning iune wrote letter al ſtates boheme wherin complaineth league ſaying ſame made againſt wherfore commaſideth forſake thing euery man wryte vnto ſeuerally mynde therin knoweth many haue fallē lacke experiēce mynded pardon moleſte man ſuche haue cōmitted high treaſon againſt princelyke maieſtie whan ſtates come ulme emperours ambaſſadours named recite long circūſtaunce greatly treatis ulmes emperour king ferdinando haue traueled peace germany aſwel publique alſo priuate affayr • ye duke saxon lātgraue hauing reſpect ſame haue rebelled ſelues alſo procured others like breaking al lawe equitie haue tourmoiled al thinges germany therfore hath thēperour bene driuen reaſon office dignitie attemp warre without great daūger life loſſe goodes harmes theſe rebelles outlawes haue done lordſhips mentz maydenburg halberſtat eiſtet auſpurg fulden stolberg manſfeld citie gemund warre wel knowen aſmuche themperour ſeketh meanes germany might haue quietnes thinketh verye requiſite ſome league made cōcerning peace therof ſame mynde alſo king ferdinando come cōfederacie thintent preſent tumulte ſhall hereafter aryſe maye lightly repreſſed euen commoditie cōmon coū trey omitte diligence loke againe ſhould lyke cōſultation interrupted vehement plage wherfore length remoue auſpurge themperour prefixed holde great aſſemblie ſhalbe declared hereafter whan themperour taken order thinges wittemberge remoueth hale saxony towne riuer sale go thence heſſe vnleſſe lantgraue compound wherfore lantgraue ſtanding perplexitie whan ſawe better remedy truſting aſſuraūce duke maurice marque brandēburg taketh iourney xviii daye iune cometh hale euening ryding middes betwene duke maurice electour brandē burge lantgraue commeth emperour hale whiche went mete hym numburge one houre came thether alſo duke henry brunſwick ben pryſoner ſonne charles uictor ſecond ſonne philippe duke erricke brunſwick ouerthrowen battell came thether ſayde next day mornyng chriſtopher carlebice comming lantgraue exhibiteth compoſition peace ſhould ſubſcribe ſame added emperour myght interprete euery article therof wherfore lantgraue aſmuch yt copy thelectour brādenburg duke maurice ſent ſheweth byſhop arras might ſubſcribe therunto ſaith omitted negligence wryter vrgeth theſame ſo folowed mynd thā doth biſhop arras require yt aſmuch wil haue aſſuraūce religion duke maurice thelectour brādenburg ar aſſured warraūt promiſe thēperour yt wil obey ye decree yt coūſel trent contrariwyſe ſaith neuer thing mentioned cōteined yt cōpoſition peace rather want themperours warraūt alſo ſhuld nede make aſſuraūce whā lōg cōtended threatnings alſo geuē themperour already ſet hal taried tooke delay diſpleaſauntly therfore let make ſpede leſt peraduenture cōceaue ſome extreme diſpleaſur againſt ye laſt lātgraue ſubſcribeth theſe wordes wold obey decree fre godly general coūſel wherin ſhuld aſwel reformed yt head reſt mēbers like caſe duke maurice marque brandenburg ſhuld thei promiſed ſhrinke one whit frō doctrine profeſſed auſpurg done v clock none whan themperour ſet vnder cloth eſtate home lodging two electours beforeſaid bring lātgraue whā came nere vnto themperour falleth vpō knee next chaūcelour guntherode reciting writing followeth lantgraue kneleth emperour aſmuch ſayth moſte mighty emperour lantgraue fourmer war hath ſore offended highnes ſo haue iuſt cauſe auenged hartely ſory therfore promiſed ſubmitteth ſelf wil pleaſure alſo moſte humbly beſecheth great clemēcy pardō fault redreſſe outlawery dew offence reſtore old place receiue al thinges faithful protectiō wil accept ſtead gret benefitie wil declare vnto frō henceforth al fidelitie ſeruice dew obedience thē perour pauſed taken deliberatiō anſwereth unto george selde albeit hath deſerued moſte greuous punyſhement openly knowen emperours aunſwere hym ſelfe alſo confeſſeth yet contente owne benignitie aſmuche certen prince haue intreated ſhall eſcape outlawerie puniſhmēt hath deſerued nether ſuffer perpetual impriſonment indaūgered furthermore compoſition peace preſcribed pardoneth alſo nobilitie ſubiects ſo kepe conuenaūtes wil acknowledge henceforth ſo great benefite preſent ſubmiſſion maximilian auſtriche philibert prince piedmount duke alba marque pruſſe byſhops arras numburge hildeſſeme duke brunſwicke henry ericke charles philippe ambaſſadours rome boheme denmarke cleaue certen hauon townes beſydes many others nobilitie lantgraue whiche thought bene ſaufe well geueth emperour thākes ſuffered hym lantgraue driuen net vnwittingly knele long arroſe vnbidden litle whyle marque brandenburg cometh ſheweth duke maurice muſt ſuppe duke alba lodging yet could ye lātgraue perceiue nothing whā thei came duke alba thei ſuppe ſupper duke maurice marque fall talke duke alba byſhop arras meane paſſe away time lantgraue playeth cardes whan nowe far night duke maurice marque brandenburg call vnto aſide mouth euſtace schlebie declare vnto haue al life time dealt faithfully becometh prince doe haue promiſed thing haue perfourmed ſame diligētly lobed alſo haue founde like fidelitie others duke alba byſhop arras tel ye muſte remayne night priſoner greateſt grief lantgraues captiuitie euer chaunced howbeit ſpeake ye emperour ſelfe truſte ſhall deteined ſayed loked thing ſoner thā ſhould haue happened howe came thether truſting vppon aſſurance knowe wel enough howe bounde chyldren wherfore let diſcharge bonde promeſſe whan muſt nedes tary duke maurice diuerſe marque coūſellours abode al night next day go themperour make greuous complaint ſhewe howe much concerneth eſtimation caſe conceiued leaſt ſuſpition world matter neither would haue counſelled haue gone thether neither woulde euer haue come ſhoulde haue loſt libertie wherfore require haue ſome conſideration thē interceſſours let hym goe libertie whiche thyng haue promyſed hym vpon fidelity ſhould emperour ſayeth dede made promeſſe reſtore againe vnto libertie immediatly meaning herein ſhould kept per petual priſon went counſellours chiefly byſhop arras long ſharpe contentiō ſhewe lantgraue may departe ryght gladly ſaith ſo may conducted home ſafely theſe two prince intreate agayne ſaufe conduite al vain two dayes ſhewed muſt wayte vpō emperour forth vtterly refuſed doe ſayeth wyll go one fote vnleſſe drawen forth violence duke maurice marque intreate exceadingly beſeching wold refuſe go perſwade take righthād preſence diuerſe noble men make promeſſe yt wyl departe emperours courte deliuered ryding forth numburg go emperour make ſuite thre dayes whiche xxv iune ſende vnto carlebice followe themperour deſire take diſpleaſauntly hath vtterly forbiddē thē yt thei ſhuld thei wil ſend spain neuertheleſſe c fifty crownes payd make aſſuraunce performe reſt cōuenaūtes thei perceiue ſo much ſhuld deliuered within fourtenight thei wil ſhortly ryde thaſſemblie auſpurg wil omit erneſt paine diligent ſuite hym toke chaunce moſt vnpatiētly ſaith yt paiment y• mony raſing caſtels wil deuiſe care truſteth loke thei promiſe ſhalbe performed warde paſſing border thuring wt spāiardes whā came greuetalle ſheweth duke alba ye letter ſaufecōduit aſſuraūce obligatiō ſaith thē perour graūted nothing ye interceſſours perpetual impriſonmēt thā ſaith ye lantgraue meaſure ende may captiuitie haue wtin time ſhal expired although ſaith detein priſoner xiiii yeres lōger yet ſhal thēperour nothing againſt promiſe ye intēt might ſoner recouer libertie lōg paieth al monie defaceth caſtelles deliuereth ordenaūce nomber battering piece emperour gate partely duke saxon partely nōber great gun re takē frō protſt duke wirtemberge city vpper germany great reported nomber fiue hondreth wherof ſent afterwarde diuerſe millan ſome naples ſome spaine reſidue beſtowed ſondry place lowe countreis belongyng houſe burgūdy monumentes token victory lantgraues captiuitie ebleb noble gentlemā meſſenger betwixt toke moſte heuely many men iudge thoughte ebleb dieth ſorowe ſorowe died ſhortly emperour intended warre vpon citie magdeburg riuer albis two dayes iourney benethe wittemberge maner compounde agree ſame time henry frenche kyng toke vp men germany sebaſtian uogelſberge ten enſeignes fotemen matter emperour ſuſpecte wherfore cauſe thought alſo ſuppoſed thei might repreſſed meane departing hale toke iourney hygher partes germany xxvii day iune ſēdeth marque marignaue aide brother ferdinando eight enſeignes almaigne fotemen tyme ferdinando letmerice attending oportunitie tyme worke purpoſe hearing themperours ſucceſſe taking ye lantgraue ye kalēdes iuly wryting letter prage cōmaundeth caſtell prage ſixt day iuly make anſwer came thither force declareth open conſiſtory ferdinando cometh army prage whole doynges paſt howe many wayes haue treſpaſſed againſt ſaieth howe haue cōmitted offence treaſon commaundeth anſwere vnto euery pointe moſt humble wyſe ſubmit ſelues pleaſure deſire trie matter thē neither lawe otherwyſe wherupō king whan ferdinādo ſonne auguſt brother duke maurice certen others ſuters x daie iuly propoundeth theſe cōditions next aſſemblie ſhal vtterly aboliſhe ye league made pluck euery mās ſeale deliuer vnto al charter writing bohemers ſubdued ferd fredom priuileges thintēt may correct ſome ſuch ſhal like graunt vnto confirme thē deliuer alſo al ye writinges cōcerning fraternity fellowſhips yt diuerſe thē haue miniſtred occaſiō trou moreouer deliuer vp caſtelles fortreſſes iuriſdictions cuſtomes againe wrytinges ye league haue made others alſo iohn fridericke ſame exciſe bere promyſed thre yeares payed henceforth continually bryng munition warlike furniture caſtell priuate armure towne houſe ſhall thus doe ſayeth wil ſpare multitude except diuerſe whiche wyl reſerue vnto ſuch puniſhement haue deſerued deteyne pryſoners commoditie common wealth whan matter reported common releaſed fifty pryſoners cōcluded certen nobilitie beyng ſent appere daye preſcribed ſentence pronounced againſt loſe life goodes certen city noble men followyng example prage ſubmitte ſelues without condition caſpar pfluge whome confederate ſaid made generall condempned treaſon proclamation made ſo could bring quick dead ſhuld haue fiue thouſand crownes rewarde next conuention whan diſanulled league brokē ſeales obteined thē maner demaūded whileſt emperour triumpheth germany ther aroſe sedition naples yt spaniſh inquiſition ſore ſeditiō naples cauſe wherof peter toletane uiceroye would spaniſh maner inquire euery man faith religion citezens toke vnpaciently whiche lothed spanyardes gouernmēt alſo muche ſlaughter partes within cytie spanyardes length preuailed reaſon kept fortes caſtell wherfore ſome put death reſidue banyſhed spaniſhe inquiſition whiche ſo vniuerſall day firſt ordeined thoſe party king ferdinando quene elizabeth againſt iewes whiche baptiſme kept ſtill lawes ceremony nowe ſince name luther publiſhed broade practiſed againſt men generall neuer ſo little ſuſpected ſharply ſodainly theſe ſelfe ſame dayes ſeuen cardinalles fraunce cardinal fraū ce ſene rome kynges commaundement go rome commaunded remain till thei receiue aduertiſemēt ſame thought done intēt meanes byſhop might wholy inclined kynges frendſhip ſhould fortune dye already foure ſcore yeare olde myght choſen fauoured kyng fraunce howbeit ſome ſaide wrought thorowe policie coneſtable get way might rule king alone maner wold kinges heles whetherſoeuer went byſhop litle ſent legate fraunce hierome romane moſte large commiſſion graūt many thynges whiche forbidden alſo lawes decree counſell created alſo cardinall ſame tyme charles guiſe ſonne duke claudie archebyſhop rain knew kyng delighted much ye frēche king purchaſe amitie offreth mariage baſtarde doughter ix yeres age orace farneſe biſhops granchilde ſonne emperour remouing hale cometh bamberge ſo nere might greater terrour bohemers ſtrengthe vnto brother whileſt third daye iuly calleth aſſemblie empire cōmaundeth mete auſpurg aſſemble auſpurg firſt day septembre prince ſelues perſone reſidues ambaſſadours full authoritie ſaieth letted warres helde cōuention kalendes february laſt paſt determined regenſpurge hath authours trouble cuſtody would longer differ corrupt member commō wealth may healed conſultaciō ſhalbe ſuche matter ſhould haue bene treated vpon wormes yeare ſynce regenſpurge conuention ſhould haue bene ulme infectiō plage place chaunged alſo mentioned bamberge goeth norinberge receiueth fauour certen city saxony xvi daye iuly publiſheth wryting wherin declareth hath bene done lantgraue vpon condition hath pardoned becauſe carefull leſte many ſhould haply ignoraunce worke violence landes ſubiectes therfore requeſt doth ſtraightly charge commaunde men abſteyne haue matter againſt trie ye lawe ſelf ſame duke maurice intreateth liberally diuines wittemberge tyme duke maurice ſendeth melanchthon pomerane cruciger diuines wittemberge receiueth ryght gently lipſia ſpeaking muche zeale towardes religion committeth vnto order church scoole alſo requiring procede wonted maner appointeth ſtipendes ſelues wryte ſendeth thē away without great rewardes pomerane litle boke ſet forth commendeth highly liberalitie gentlenes frenche kyng ſucceded father kalendys aprill xxv day iuly cometh rain crowned coronation french king maner therof receiued cathedral churche thr 〈…〉 cardinalles led hyghe aultar kiſſed relickes ſaintes encloſed gold ſaid prayer goeth ſupper ſupper retourning making prayer againe whan confeſſed ſynnes prieſt departeth goeth bedde next day ſendeth certe • nobilitie intreate abbot ſaint remige would bring boxe holy oyle whiche ſay came heauen reſorte churche thoſe called douzeperes fraunce twelue nomber byſhop rain landune langres beauuois noion twelue peres fraunce challon kyng nauarre duke uandome guiſe niuerne mompenſer anmalle theſe repreſented duke burgundie normandie guienne moreouer erles tolouſe flaunders champaine byſhoppes choſen two langres beauuois alſo two cardinalles go fetche kyng churche whan came chamber certen prayer ſayde lift vp kyng liyng bedde ceremony accompanied multitude prieſtes leade church coneſtable beareth ſworde drawen king tyme prayed ye aultar led byſhoppes ſeate meane whyle tyl boxe cometh archebyſhop rain finiſhed prayer conteyned boke ceremony ſprinkleth holy water kyng reſte whan worde brought boxe coming whiche abſence ye holy box ſent heauē may ſure abbot prior monkes brought ſitting vpon white hambling palfrey accompanied monkes hys order noble mē king ſent ſayd archebyſhop byſhops goeth mete churche dore croſſe borne ther receiued boxe deliuering hym gage reſtore againe whan came agayn aultar king ryſing ſeate doeth reuerence archebyſhop goeth reueſtrie ſolemnely decked pontificalibus cometh forth taketh othe fidelitie whiche auncient cuſtome kynges bounde churche king led aultar two byſhops putting garmētes kneleth downe girded ſworde thei terme hath conſecrated many prayer archebyſhop prepareth oyle redines whyleſt prieſts ſynge ſeruice prayeth ſoftly kyng lying gruſſelyng groūd annointeth kinges head breſte ſhoulders elbowes either arme ſaying accuſtomed prayer done kyng hath put new garmentes like miniſter church annointed palmes handes layeth king appa • eled like deach handes breſte putteth hallowed gloues call archebiſhop putteth rynge vpon fynger deliuereth sceptre ryght hande ſelfe ſame moment chauncelour calleth forth douzeperes preſence archebyſhop taketh frō aultar crown charles great whan peres haue touched ſetteth kinges head bringeth king roiall throne whiche made higher place whole company noble followyng hauing ended prayer kiſſeth likewyſe peres noble making great ſhoute acclamation pray god ſaue kyng reioyce men harte trompettes blowe gold ſyluer throwen amonges common people goeth archebyſhop maſſe goſpell done king carieth ye aultar certen piece gold bread wyne whā maſſe ended receiueth lordes ſupper maner go al dyner vſe purpoſe intēt nothing ſhould diſquiet coronation kyng would ſeme haue hired almaigue fotemē conduite uogelſberge afore mentioned meane tyme emperour demaundeth reſidue ſtates imperiall money charge warres whiche ſayeth chiefly attempted ſakes welth germany moreouer nobilitie ſuche ſerue proteſtantes put fine throughout germany ſomme money emperour empe▪ e • acieth money germany leuied prince city aſwell catholikes proteſtauntes amounteth aboue xvi hondreth thouſande crownes appereth accomptes made ſome alſo perour refuſed rebelles vtterly denied fauour amonges others doctor george wittemberge albert erle manſfelde iohn hedecke erle lewys counte oeting father ſonne puniſhed ſuch ſort gaue landes clerely ſonnes friderick wuolfange whome fidelitie ſeruice done hym fauoured erle oeting exiled wyfe reſt child tourned euer came straſburge wandered vp downe many yeares ſondry place vntil alteratiō time came emperour forgaue ſhal ſpoken hereafter furthermore emperour letter publyſhed outlaweth maydenburg alſo king ferdinando maydēburg outlawed warre attempted againſt countreis doth exact money ye proteſtauntes eſpecially city fleſeth auſpurg ulme great ſome money commenceth proceſſe againſt duke wirtemberge whole dukedom though broken fidelitie conuenaūtes made four mer yeares neither auaile thing ſo lately redemed peace emperour vpon moſt ſtrayte condicions lykewyſe cardinall auſpurg doth extorte alſo citie great quantitie gold moreouer cardinall trent aſketh money ſaying howe ayded kinge ferdinando men recouer paſſage alpes taken ſayde scherteline themperour alſo moueth swiſſes vnto newe league yet doeth exempte baſill zuricke schafuſe certen others ſayd apperteined emperour moueth swiſſes league emperour one aſſent make aūſwere haue league alredy houſe auſlrich burgundie wherunto cleaue ſurely confederacie none make ſame loke agayne alſo end iuly emperour cōmeth auſpurge duke saxon pryſoner lantgraue left donauerde garded spaniardes whiche dyd many thynges dayly contempt mockery armed aſſemblie ga 〈…〉 iſon citie armed aſſemble x enſeignes ſotemen countrey round force sparnyardes italian whome voyde free meming payde thirty thouſand kemptem twenty thouſand crownes beſydes came nether germany ſyx hondreth horſemen whome emperour beſtowed coūtrie nere vnto citie twelue enſeignes spaniardes whan wyntered whyle bibrach led thoſe party border lake brigantine wiſſeburg town norgouie wyntered ſeuen hondreth horſemen naples gerarde uelthuiche went turke ſayd xvii boke retourneth emperour xii daye auguſte hauing made truce fyue yeares emperour came auſpurg taketh head churche certen others ſelf leaueth reſt senate people chaplaines wold ſaye ſeruice church pourged hallowed church new halowed againe many ceremony ſuſpended polluted lutheraniſme emperour appointed preacher cathedral churche michell sidonie suffragan ſorte come preſent ſeruice aſſemblie maruelous great prince electours amongeſt adolphe archebyſhop collon duke maurice thither came alſo kyng ferdinā cardinall trent henry duke brunſwick duke cleaue lady mary emperours ſyſter niece ducheſſe lorayne wydowe kalēdes september began ſytte whan maximilian auſtriche emperours name made ſhort preface emperours secretary declared wryting thinges ſhould decided whiche chiefly two religion might accorded controuerſies ſame appeaſed chamber ſhould eſtabliſhed lawe miniſtred wherin requireth geue theyr faithful aduiſe counſel tenth day moneth peter aloiſe byſhop rome ſonne paule thirde ſlayne placence home houſe ſhortly peter alois pope ſonne ſlayne ferdinando gonzage emperous lieftenaunt lumbardie taketh citie newes hereof within fewe dayes came auſpurge matter reported emperour ſame ſtory ſayd communicated alſo prince deliuered vnto wryting whole diſcourſe redoundeth infamie diſprayſe peter aloiſe thus caſe ſtandeth ſame wrytyng ſpecifieth whan exchaunge made peter aloiſe created duke placence parma many thinges cōtrary lawe equitie rigour offended ſortes men amonges others depriued hierome palauicine hierome palauicine landes poſſeſſions eſchewe daunger fled creme towne belonging state ueniſe caſte wyfe chyldren pryſon ſame matter like growe ſome great cō motion cardinall trent bare good wyl ye houſe farneſe letter wrytten intreateth matter ye duke aunſwered frowardly ſonne octauius came trent retourning emperours campe homeward unto whome cardinall declareth whole matter deſyring peticioner father ſame promiſeth ſo letteth vnderſtande hierome may receiued againe fauour ſo wyll come hym ſelfe humblie require pardon feared leſte contrary faith promyſe ſome greater miſchief ſhould wrought againſt cardinall ſmall trayne goeth creme ſendeth hierome come ſpeake fearyng treaſon came knewe aſſuredly cardinall whan thei talked conferred together cardinall promyſed largely trauell cauſe take iourney together cardinall ſent one two company aduertiſe duke comming doth cōtrary octauius ſignified ſende playne worde howe reſtore albeit meſſengers ſent men graue witty ſpake many thing mitigate fury yet perſeuered ſtyl ſame wherfore ye cardinal whan brought palauicine agayne creme retourneth trent nowe certen nobilitie whiche hated hym alſo conſpired death hiring certen deſperate murtherers wayte occaſion many tymes ſeuerally come abroade conſpiracie againſt ye pope ſon ſame garde eche pretende priuate enemy meane ſeaſon euery demaunde men priuely whether thei wilfaith fully take parte reuenging wrong done vnto ſayd duke stewarde promyſe ſeruice alſo kyll lorde himſelf ſame tyme father paule third wryteth vnto ſhould take hede ſelfe tenth daye december ſtarres prognoſticate vnto hym ſome great miſfortune ſame day byſhop much geuen aſtrologie alſo negromancie certenly affirmed pope negromancier whan duke receiued father letter feare carefulnes whan day come goeth caſtell horſe litter great company view fortification towne begone conſpiratours alſo whan coulde accompliſhe thing deſired ſtaye whan retourned home wayte vpon bene duty goe nombre xxxvi whan come horſelitter caſtell plucke vp drawe bridge immediatlye mo ſhoulde followe approche ſwordes drawen calling bitterly tyraunt ſleye within horſelitter murther ſame tyme chaplayne maiſter horſe fiue almaines garde runne vp downe caſtell ſpoyle altogether finding great treaſure ſommes mony whiche appointed fortificatiō citie meane time great concourſe people caſtel inquiring matter ment heard ſuche noyſe cry within make aunſwer aboue haue kylled tyraunt recouered aunciēt libertie citie could hardly make beleue thing whan citezens warraunted liues aſſured pardon hange dead body chaine ouer walle ſwynged whyle fro let fall ditche people came running iobbed hatred citezens towardes peter dagger ſpurned fete great mortal hatred bare cōſulting y• matter aduertiſe ferdinādo gōzage letter ſent poſt chaū ced geue thē ſelues wholy thēperour tuitiō deſire haue ayde ſent thē al ſpede ſending thither garriſon haſt taketh citie ſweareth thē true themperour writeth al thing themperour deſiring know pleaſure herein parma wer alſo moued ſubmit thēſelues vnto themperour ſending letter ye byſhop rome ſay wyll ſtil remaine vnder obeyſaunce refuſe father ſlayne doe homage ſonne octauius acknowledge prince ſomme newes reported ſent vnto emperour wherof ſtates made partaker others declare y• matter far otherwyſe ſaye pourpoſly done fewe howres y• murther cōmitted gōzage ye gate citie wt garriſon affirme nothing ſoeuer matter al mē confeſſe yt peter aloiſe wicked miſcheuous fellow bokes italiā recite vngracious deteſtable luſtes amonges whiche one others moſte notable wherby ſaide haue enforced buggered monſtrous luſtes hym coſmus cherie byſhop fanen ayde ſeruaūtes helde whiche filthie acte ſo inwardly greued caytif ſhortly died ſorow ſhame thing ſome ſuppoſe gaue poiſon ſhould vtter wretched dede themperour biſhop notwithſtanding loued ſonne derely applied whole ſtudy auaunce honour oftentimes heard lewde prankes toke greuouſly reported wold ſay learned theſe vice ſhewed father counſell leauing trent remoued bononie ſame emperour take high diſpleaſure cōming auſpurge coūſell trent two partes cauſed senate prince wryte byſhop herein wherfore xiiii day ianuary ſending letter declare perillous ſtate germany whiche ſaye might haue bene eſchewed remedy bene founde diſeaſe time wite general counſel themperour hath oftener one ben ſuter might haue procured ye ſame within precincte germany intent byſhops ſame countrey chiefly cōcerned might preſent iuriſdictiō gret expedient yt ſhuld eſpecially tyme far charge lēgth themperours induſtrie whan man wold come mantua uicēce coū ſell dede called begonne trent without border germany rather belōgeth italy ye cauſe alſo germanes came neither could eſpecially time war whan al wayes paſſages ſtopped cloſed vp tempeſt blowen ouer ſhippe hauons mouth men brought good hope beſides al expectaciō counſel ſhuld thus remoued rather diuided wherin preſeruatiō cō mon wealth conſiſteth greueth litle becauſe ye daūger like enſue therby theſe xxvii yeres hath germany ben tormoyled newe pernicious ſectes opinion byſhops maner beare authoritie diſſolute oultrage cōfuſion thing innumerable thouſandes daunger ſaluation briefly ſame peſtilent euill infected corrupted whatſoeuer clere ſtates thempire plucked ſonder obſerue frendſhip amōges ſelues theſe ſo many great euils refuge apoſtolicall churche wherfore hartely pray euen wealth germany would reſtore counſell whiche would nothing myght loke hādes cā ſee whence ſhould ſeke remedy ſtormes tempeſtes arriſe euery ſyde whiche repulſe god hath ordained holy churche rome certen bulwarke rocke moſte ſtrong let haue therfore conſideration requeſtes thinke leſſe may except prouide contrary ſome meanes deuiſes may founde diſpatche matter reſt pray take theſe thinges good parte duty ſtate tyme compelleth ſo wryte theſe dayes alſo englyſhmen vanquiſh scottes maigne battell ſlewe thē many thouſandes muſkelborough field conduict duke somerſet kinges vncle cauſe warre ſame lyfe kyng henry witte scottes would geue quene wyfe vnto king edward promiſe victory engliſhe nation wan great part scotlande enlarged limites farre concerninge emperours demaundes men one opinion electours clergie vrge counſell trent without conditiō ambaſſadours ye paulſgraue duke maurice marque brandenburg refuſed ſame ſobeit fre godly wherin byſhop ſhould iudge ſhould releaſe byſhops othe diuines alſo might haue licence reaſon decree already made retracted prince ſtates deſirous counſell might continued proteſtauntes going thether ſaufeconduict may heard conſtrained obey decree counſell themperour hearing al mindes xviii day octob anſwereth deſireth al ſubmit ſelues coū ſell treateth paulſgraue duke maurice ſeuerally ſhuld geue aſſent paulſgraue dede put feare vnleſſe conſented reaſon proteſtauntes intiſed feared late offence yeare ſore throughly healed duke maurice coueted yt lantgraue father lawe ſhuld deliuered alſo muche auaunced late ye emperour ſawe wel muſt nedes ſome thing wherfore whā themperour meſſengers ſēt betwixt promiſed largely good wil towards thē deſired inſtauntly would committe thing fidelitie laſt xxiiii day october conſente therto reſt city whiche ſawe daungerous matter ſubmitte ſelues decree coūſell without exception granuellan haſie intreate longe muche meane whyle bruted throughout citie howe franticke wyttes refuſed thyng whiche prince approued heard moreouer threatnynges ſhould ſcourged worſe late fine meane founde emperour ſatiſfied alſo aſſured called emperour ſaye parte correcte aunſwers prince delyuer hym wryting wherin teſtifie vpon condition doe admitte counſell emperour hearynge tale aunſwereth seldie howe verey glad ioyfull example others referre matter vnto hym geue cō ſent reſte attribute vnto deſyred aſſente reſide auoyde diſpleaſure woulde finde faulte ſentence prince yet leſte thyng ſhould preiudiciall hereafter declared wryting ſort lyked counſell tyme come myght remayne teſtimony myndes ende october ſame tyme came thyther kyng ferdinando alſo electour brandenburge emperour therfore immediatly beginnyng nouember ſent cardinall trente rome poſte moue byſhop call agayne synode trente moneth nouember chriſtine wyfe lantgraue ſonnes certen choiſe counſellours letter letter ye lantgraue themper wrytten prince state empyre declare meanes taken hale commyng thyther vnder ſaufe conduite muche condicions ye emperour preſcribed could ought perfourmed accompliſhed monie payd duke brunſwick ſon ſet libertie al letter confederate exhibited oth ye nobilitie aſſuraſice ye ſuerties made al munition deliuered fortes raſed moreouer much thei ready neither refuſe thei pledge thēſelues vntil ſuch time ye reſt fulfilled alſo wout gret grief vexatiō mind ſe miſerable caſe went hale ſuche caſe might haue kept caſtelles honeſt tyme againſt force ennemy alſo emperours commiſſioners whiche ſawe thinges afterwarde teſtife compaſſion people choſe peace war wherfore moſte hartely praye intreate emperour behalfe fynde meanes ſhortly reſtored libertie may retourne home caſe ſhould longer • teined would doubtles vtter decaye health haue better ſucceſſe ſute lantgraues wyfe came ſelfe auſpurg ſelfe alſo duke maurice electour brandenburg ſolliciteth prince ſue whiche thing knowen emperour interceſſion made xxv day nouē ber declareth ye ſtates heareth report made empe aunſwer ſtates vnto thē much talke men diuerſe wil declare vnto plain truthe matter ſo reciteth beginning ofte whome lantgraue bene ſued howe aunſwered thē al ſhuld yelde ſubmitte himſelf without condicion raſe caſtels deliuer munition tolde duke maurice marque brandenburg ſhould neither ſuffer toe condition wherby lantgraue ſubmitted hymſelfe bodyly puniſhement deteined perpetual priſon puniſhed goodes compoſition peace preſcribed thing none hope put beare witneſſe declareth howe came hale 〈…〉 ſubmitted hym ſelfe vnto hym howe hath bene ſynce intreated nothyng againſt promeſſe tale emperour ſame daye ſtates reporte duke maurice marque next daye make ſuche aunſwer neither blame themperour anſwer du maurice marque greatly herein neither wyll much contende whether fault counſellours matter miſtakē ſomeuer matter common quiet peace germany perſwade lātgraue whan ſuſpected nothing impriſonment captiuitie come vnto hale deſyre pardon refuſe condition peace hath loſt libertie kepte priſoner hitherto without ye great peril health much yt againſt honour eſtimatiō euery mā ſeeth wel enough therfore require thē petitioner thē intreate themperour yt would rather haue conſideration thē haue done faithful ſeruice empire lantgraues offence ſuffer runne obloquie ſclaunder reſtore vnto libertie eſpecially ſynce conditiōs maner fulfylled emperour put ryght good aſſuraunce reſt thus therfore one voyce aſſente made interceſſion lantgraues wyfe intreated lady regent emperours ſiſter meane auailed nothing becauſe duke maurice marque brandenburg ſayd bound lantgraues ſonnes dede obligatorie ſo longe deteined emperour ſendeth iohn lirane lātgraue norling whether ye spaniardes caried willeth deliuer wrytinges aſſuraſice dedes obligatory ſaieth cuſtody emperour requireth w • itinges lantgraue kept ſonnes counſellours albeit ſhuld write yet vain thei told came away would departe vnleſſe firſt deliuered neuertheleſſe might knowe emperour certen tyme deliueraunce would coulde ſhould deliuered emperour contented aunſwer taketh ſeruauntes except one two moſte ende nouember peter martyr florētine leauing straſburg taught fiue yeares great commendation hauing leaue senate peter martyr goeth england goeth englande ſent archebyſhop canturbury kinges commaundement appointed reade diuinitie lectour oxforde compaignion iourney barnardine ochine sene beyng great eſtimation amonges italian eloquence vertue forſaking monaſticall kinde lyfe gaue ſelue doctrine goſpell coming firſt geneua auſpurge ſet forth certen sermon print muche ſame tyme ſyxe article made life king henry ſayd xii boke diſanulled reformation religion englande acte parliament image picture remoued church beginning reformation ix day december cardinall trent preſence byſhop great senate cardinalles propoundeth matter commaunded oratiō cardinall trēt many weighty wordes declareth peril paynes emperour hath taken counſell matter brought vnto paſſe ſayeth induſtrie authoritie ſtates wyll obeye counſell wherfore requireth goddes loue name emperour kyng ferdinando whole empire cōmaunde father bononie retourne trent finiſh vp worli begon ryght neceſſary cōmon wealth ouer ſend ambaſſadour two germany aduiſe ſome meane howe lyue well may eſtablyſhed till ende counſell may reformation olergie finally let conſider alſo decree byſhop chaunce departe tyme counſell whether authoritie election ſhalbe father counſell cardinalles leſte happely matter ſhall ſo come paſſe may ſtyre vp newe commotiōs fift day cardinall trent thus playd oratour iames mendoza emperours commaūdement ſame audience ſpeaketh lyke effect ſayeth byſhop make delay excuſe hath commaundement calling hym ambaſſadours kynges prynces ſhuld openly proteſte counſell corrupted ſame daye xiiii daie december oratiō biſhop rain pope archbyſhop rain made cardinall ſōmer ſent frenche kyng rome made long flattering oration byſhop cardinalles prayſe kyng fraunces kynges fraūce chiefly commendation henry newe kyng ſayeth nothing degenerating moſte noble progenitours beareth ſuch zelous affection churche rome maketh ſubmiſſion moſt louing frēche king contendeth ye emperour elderſhip obedient childe offereth hym ſelfe boſome ſame alſo firſt begotten ſonne churche chief captaine chriſtian nation promiſeth defence maintenaūce dignitie hereof imploye al force power realme owne treaſure perſon roialle many ſuche thinges full great aſſentation frenche kyng vnderſtāding well rancour malice byſhop bare mynde ſlaughter peter aloiſe ſaw remouing counſell trent diſpleaſure increaſed iudged tyme cōuenient wherin might frame thinges commoditie purpoſe wherfore ſending oftentimes ambaſſadours byſhop promiſed aſſiſtaūce incouraged ſtrengthened mynde whan byſhop heard requeſtes cardinall trente mendoza ſayeth wyl conſult father boloigne alſo make relation thing vnto chriſten prince wherfore whan cardinall trente could get none aunſwere retourneth home leauing mendoza whome emperour commaunded finiſhe vp reſt xvi day december byſhop wryting chief legate counſell iohn pope letter legate mary mountane cardinal ſignifieth cardinal trent alſo iames mendoza demaunded emperours name conference cardinalles thought mete conferre alſo father counſell leſte thyng ſhould done raſhely intent decree already made aſwell remouing counſell alſo reſte myght wholy remayne therfore ſayeth ſo muche carefull welth germany emperours ſake would haue long delay commaunde calling aſſiſtaunce holy ghoſte declare whole matter father anſwere ſhalbe made emperour wryte hither ſpede cardinall montane commaunded bryngeth matter counſell wryteth agayne byſhop albeit counſell lawfully remoued frō trent bononie albeit ſeſſion father ſame daie decree made remouing synode al mē openly warned repare boloigne although father wryting letter trent admoniſhed thē louingly take iourney yet ſome remaine vntyll daye whiche thing verely aperteineth contemt counſell offendeth many therfore father ſee howe ſhould ſauing dignitie eſtimation synode conſulte retourne vnleſſe ſuche trent firſt come bononie ioyne thē ſelues reſidue acknowledge authoritie ye counſel againe nedefull father put aſſuraūce germany ſubmitte ſelfe counſell allowe decree therof either made already heafter ſhalbe ſuch ſort retracted man moreouer muche brute goeth ſhalbe counſell people agreable father deſyre alſo haue aſſuraunce behalfe ſhould take place order maner counſelles ſynce apoſtles tyme vnto day ſhuld chaū ged deſyre alſo know ſhalbe aſſured yt may ſafely frely remayne whan ſhall thinke good departe thence man let finally aſſuraunce alſo requiſite whan certen cauſes ſemeth good moſte part may lawfull father go ſome el remoue counſell furthermore whan ſhall appeare thoſe matter ſufficiently aunſwered whiche counſell called father may libertie ſurceaſe make ende theſe thinges whiche father great deliberation whan called grace holy ſpirite haue anſwered vnto requeſtes praiyng holines take good worth whan theſe letter deliuered byſhop xxvii daye decēber maſſe ſendeth emperours ambaſſadour mendoza ſenate cardinalles ſheweth synode boloigne hath anſwered whoſe opinion pope mendoza emperours ambaſſad ſaieth miſliked either cardinalles conſonant right reaſon part nothing would wyſhe germany emperour witneſſe nothing concerned dutie good paſtour moſte louing father hath bene omitted perceiueth dede emperour king ferdinādo state empire require ſuppoſeth howe deſire ſuche wyſe may ſtande peace commoditie nation libertie churche whan mendoza ſawe howe biſhop toke company boloigne counſell fully mynded haue proteſted contrary immediatly interceſſion certen cardinalles deane college content aduertiſe emperour aunſwere awayte letter differre proteſtation vntill xx day whan therfore mendoza ſignified whole matter emperour byſhop alſo made aunſwere former letter germane byſhops kalendes ianuary wherein commendeth vertue interlaſeth owne prayſes amonges 1548 pope letter byſhops germany ſheweth deſyrous hath bene euer counſell firſt called ſame mantua uicence laſt trente whither came many biſhoppes nation fewe none germany moreouer holſome decres made proftable commō wealth departed thence without knowledge yet doeth defende doinges lawefull defende doinges lawfull furthermore diſcourſeth pope ignoraunt thinges large cardinall trent mendoza demaunded emperours name whoſe requeſtes aſmuche agreable would anſwere aunſwered emperour finally ſay feared leſt ſlacke meanes wyl found moue muche hath omitted part duty whome god hath placed ſeate dignitie hyge watche toure haue charge whole ſlocke eſpecially thoſe go aſtraye reſt againe may newe deuiſes ſhalbe attempted againſt pope watchman authoritie sea rome chriſt ſelfe architectour therof tyme layd foūdation ye church rome prognoſticate great ſtormes enterpryſe ſhould haue lucky ſucceſſe feareth chriſte hath buylded ſame vpon moſte ſtrong rocke diuers haue heretofore attempted lyke thinge whome god conſtā cie romiſh church hath made example men beholde day whiche affrayde plage puniſhment others ſet eye ſore lamēteth caſe deſtruction enſue howbeit exhorteth chiefly remayne perſeuer ſtill faith vertue conſtancie haue perfourmed hetherto ſuffer counſelles take place cōuentions againſt dignitie churche whan therfore byſhop synod aſſembled boloigne dwelt ſtil opinion emperours emp ambaſſad ſent boloigne le graſſe ambaſſadours ſame cauſe ſent bononie fraū ce uargas martin uelaſcus xvi daye ianuary whā deſyred senate come cōſiſtory preſent cardinall mountane xliiii biſhops prelate churche uargas reciteth commiſſion wherin emperour geuen fellowe authoritie pleade whiche alſo exhibited lately beginning ſpeake interrupted cardinal montane preſident counſell commiſſion wrytyng emperour calleth counſell conuention bononie wherfore ſayeth cardinal mountane albeit aſſemble bounde heare oration foraſmuch pope legate ye emperours ambaſſad commiſſion exhibited doth concerne holy synode yet leſt man ſhould haue cauſe complayne refuſe heare yet vpon condition pleading neither hinder v profite ſhalbe free v neuertheleſſe continew procede counſell appointe ſuche puniſhment againſt al diſobedient rebelles holy lawes conſtitutions determined emperours ambaſſadour uargas deſyreth haue recorded empe ambaſſad ye father common recordes impeched letted could ſpeake firſt afterwarde much ſaith haue already ſene emperours letter credit wyll declare commiſſion appeare treat matter moſt weighty alſo whole common wealth chriſtendome earneſt prayer beſeche would ſhew equitie ſame men iudge certenly caſe wyll obſtinatly perſeuer opinion whiche vncircumſpectly haue one embraced wyll tourne maruelous calamitie common wealth ſurcea • e ordered themperour thinges ſhal luckely ſuccede thing men better may vnderſtande ſhall repete whole matter depely ſo ſhal appeare fowly ſhall erre vnleſſe alter pourpoſe gret good wil ye emperour beareth commō wealth herein wil adde word wil treade foteſteps commaundement haue receiued agayne cardinall mountane alſo ſayeth preſident malapertnes ye legate ſacred counſell deputed legate paule third biſhop rome ſucceſſour peter uicar chriſt earth alſo theſe moſt reuerende father procede coū ſell lawfully remoued trent vnto god glory ſaluation mankynde wherfore deſire emperour alter ſentence aſſiſte v matter commaunde diſturbers counſell vnto ſilence ignoraunt ſo euer let impediment holy counſelles deſerue moſte greuouſe puniſhemēt preſcript lawes ſo euer matter falleth terrours ſo euer threatened yet wyll cleaue faſt libertie dignite churche counſel alſo whan uargas openly recited letter commiſſion fellowe uelaſcus readeth proteſtation beginning raccomted oftentymes letter proteſtatiō counſell emperour hath deſired counſell leo adriane clement laſt paule third time germaines erneſte ſuters ſame paule third firſt mantua uicence finally whan could kepte thoſe place appointed ſame trent aſſent emperour ſtates ſo muche ſame place commodious italian spaniardes french men germaines wanted thinges nedefull therfore time ſeate choſen synode byſhop ſent thether cardinal pariſe morone poole emperours name alſo came byſhop arras father granuellan iames mendoza tyme ſemed byſhop conuenient enough matter differred againe came newe legate rome mountane crucei poole cardinalles emperour theſame mendoza fraunces toletane ambaſſadours prince came alſo others partes repared trent great nōber ſame time emperour warre germany chiefly defence maintenaunce religion ſuche could rule reaſon might compelle force armes time hauing lucky ſucceſſe warres maner vāquiſhed called way againe ſuch contemned counſell tyme beholde whiche vſurpe vnto name legate see rome ſodenly without making byſhop priuie ſay ſelues faining cauſe tell propounde remouing counſell geuing ſcarſely tyme conſulte departe trent great haſte many worthy vertuous father aſſent ſayd cauſe flitting reaſonable proteſted would remaine trent meane ſeaſon emperour going saxony vanquiſheth ennemy albis taketh captaines warre battell ſubmiſſion neuertheleſſe warre finiſhed deſired byſhop oft letter meſſengers ſent woulde commaunde father retourne boloigne trent otherwyſe would matter daungerous called conuention auſpurge wherin emperours requeſt prynces ſtates whole cōſent approue coū ſell trent promiſed wold obeie ſame condition whan obtained ſent forth cardinall trent rome whiche might declare theſe thinges byſhop senate cardinalles name whole empyre myght require continuaunce counſel trent commaunded ſame thing alſo iames mendoza ambaſſadour byſhop toke delay aunſweryng thought mete firſt conſulte receiued anſwer ful craftie ſubtile captious eftſones aunſwer emperour vnſittingly ſtarting hole backſteppes declareth well enough little careth common wealth proue cauſe remouing ther neded witneſſes worthy credite emperour kyng ferdinando prynces ſending letter moſte honorable ambaſſadour declared opinion state cōcerning coū ſell omitting teſtimony byſhop would rather geue credit vile abiecte perſones howe many tedious painful iourneis hath emperour taken counſell emp carefulnes counſell coſtes charge hath bene ſhall theſe thinges loſt upon moſte weightie neceſſarie cauſes requeſt ye emperour ſuite germaines aſſent chriſtian prince counſell called alſo cōmenced trent wherfore publique authoritie al ſtates cōſented therto may holden el cauſe remouynge ſame ſome thing inuented excuſe uerely certe • ague infection ayre herein followed aduiſe certen phiſiciōs chiefly maydes authours remouing counſell cooke howe trifelyng vaine cauſe thinge ſelfe ende declared ſaye departed making byſhop priuie letter wrytten vnto aunſwer ſent emperour teſtifie farre another thing certenly ought haue remoued chaū ged place without conſent emperour vnto whō committed charge tuition counſelles went ſo haſtely away reiected ſuche ſayd ought firſt aſke aduiſe emperour byſhop muſt nedes haue remoued leſt ſhould haue obſerued decree holy counſelles haue remayned within border germany intent germaines whoſe cauſe chiefly hande myght come counſell ſafely nowe haue ye choſen bononie citie middes italy ſubiect churche rome whether aſſured germaines come therfore haue choſen ſame decaye reproche vniuerſall weale counſel myght either doſſolued handled vſed pleaſure emperour therfore requireth moſte earneſtly wold retourne ſame place whiche contented men eſpecially ſynce thinges ſafe quiet neither remaineth cauſe feare whiche thyng ſhall refuſe doe name commaundemēt emperour proteſte remouing counſell vayne vnlawful whole doyng voyde none effect alſo teſtifie ye anſwer fond full lie ye cōmodities yt hereafter ſhal inſue cōmon wealth ar aſcribed thē vnto affirme moreouer haue authoritie remoue counſell aſmuch haue neglected publique health men emperour protectour churche wyll take charge therof ſo far forth may lawes decree holy father whan red theſe thinges deliuereth copie proteſtation written requireth maye recorded matter recorde cardinall mountane conſent father ſpeakyng grauely declareth well vſed mountane ſtriken fury taketh god witneſſe ſaieth howe ready dye rather ſuffer ſuche example brought churche euer ciuile magiſtrate ſhould wyll pleaſure comptrolle counſell emperour dede eldeſt ſonne church neyther lord maiſter college legate see apoſtolicke refuſe preſently rēder accompt firſt vnto god alſo byſhop ambaſſade within fewe dayes proteſtation ſhalbe aunſwered maner ſame effect ſame tyme mendoza whan letter come emperour wherby commaū ded procede proteſte rome byſhop cardinalles callyng therunto cemmaunded ambaſſadours foreine kynges prince ✚ twenty booke sleidanes commentaryes concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument twenty booke treaty controuerſie whether lande pruſſe belong kyng poole empyre pope maketh ample aunſwere proteſtation made mendoza wherof emperour aduertiſed leauing hope counſell begynneth ſet forth interim protectour englande wryting scottes ample wyſe demaundeth quene uogelſberge beheaded emperour campe wittemberge gaue duke maurice ryght electourſhyp nowe createth ſolemnities bucer refuſeth ſubſcribe interim pope himſelfe cō demneth interim lykewyſe ſome electours prynces certen alſo refuſe al though emperour cauſed proclaimed duke saxon pryſoner great magnanimitie refuſeth lantgraue letter ſet forth name maketh ſemblant conſent therunto deliuered whileſt maſſeis aboliſhed england city townes germany ſollicited accept interim aboue others straſborough yea threatchynges fourmer bokes declared howe albert houſe brandenburge homage kynge polle howe altered ſtate cōmon welth pruſſe therfore outlawed chāber againe howe kyng polle commō aſſemblies empyre oftentymes ſued emperour state muche cliente would reuerſe outlawerie nothynge obtayned vnto daye great victory emperour feared leſt matter ſhould haue come daunger kynge polle vnto aſſemblie ſendeth ambaſſade chief wherof staniſlaus laſcus moneth ianuary deliuereth emperour senate prince oration wrytten effect wherof howe cauſe pruſſe bene oftentymes debated oration kyng pol ambaſſadour muche hath bene alwayes differred vntyll aſſemblies nowe cōmaunded agayne declare ſame kinges truſte yt inaſmuch haue al time made gētle anſwers ye cauſe ſelf rightful haue ſome conſideration mynde hym yet iudges prynces worthy honour reuerence firſt ſayeth wyll ſpeake diuerſe thynges order pruſſe intent thyng may manifeſt time pait kynges polle gaue great part pruſſeland order knighthode dutche land vpon cōdicion beginning thorder knight duchland might haue ſeruice againſt enemy chriſtendome vnthankefull breakyng conuenauntes tourned force againſt ther owne lordes oftentymes warre oftentymes conuenauntes renewed reaſō antiquitie requiſite rehearſe whiche maner chaunced memory ſhall recite kyng caſimire father vnto sigiſmunde ſubde wyng great battell brought condition peace victory king caſimire amonges thinges accorded henceforth ſhould acknowledge kynges polle magiſtrate geuyng thē fidelitie othe afterwardes certen maiſters order brake conuenauntes geuynge ſelues tuition others whiche albert brandenburge one bounde conuenaunt doe homage vnto kyng uncle within half yeare wold wherfore kyng albeit loued peace yet neceſſitie conſtrayned attempte warre albeit neuer ioyned battell whole force yet roades made fyryng ſpoyling eſcharmouſhing much harme done ſo muche alberte weake came vnto kyng take truce ſelfe ſame tyme came force germaines ayde hym whiche cauſe departed without concludyng ſame began renewe warre long beyng forſaken dyd diſſemble conſtrayned ſadues intreat peace whiche one concluded mediation certen conditioned ſhould geue fayth kyng othe doe thynges becommeth faythful truſty cliente certen therfore lande pruſſe hath euer ſynce memory mā tyme fyrſt receiued albert receyued tuitiō king pol chriſten religion lawe armes alſo ſondry conuenauntes aparteyned realme polle others haue made title claime ſame hath ben arrogancie wrong ye maiſters thorder y• kinges permiſſiō germains borne haue oftentimes intitle others ryght pruſſe whiche thing aſſuredly hath bred muche diſtention betwixte germaines polonians cauſed alſo ſame decree wherin duke albert outlawed ryght haue outlaw man cliente yt came iudgemēt ſited iudges ded kynges commaundement vnto whome faulte imputed caſe ſhould outlawed cauſe acknowlegeth king magiſtrat vnreaſonable man ſhould ſuffer puniſhemēt duty wherfore moſt triumphāt emperour ſtates moſt noble king doeth hartly requyre vniuſt vnlawfull decree outlawery preſcription may repreſſed neither cauſe man ſhould thynke ye kyng would ambition deſyre enlarge kyngdome bryng pruſſe vnder ſubiection hath refuſed moſt goodly prouinces haue bene frely offred ſhould come ſuſpicion matter certenly coūtrey ſo much worth vnto hym myght honour coulde content forgoe ſith doth properly belong vnto dominion wyſe doe cauſe oftentimes trouble cōtētion hath riſē euer pruſſe belō geth pole faulte maiſters order ſhewed god dede hath often plaged bolde enterpryſes theſe thinges knew ryght well moſt noble emperour king ferdinādo grandfather maximilian remembring iniuries father friderick receiued made faithfull promyſe kyng sigiſmunde tyme met uienne promiſed well owne name alſo woulde geue maner ayde vnto order dyd maximilian newe example followyng trade aunceſtours emperour sigiſmunde metyng wt kyng ladiſlaus grādfather king maiſter much alſo promiſed aide againſt ye emperour friderick great grādfather war emperours kynges pole againſt order knightes ioyned force power caſimire father king sigiſmund againſt matthie kyng hongary foreſayd order one cōfederacie although kyng caſimire let impeched ye warres ordre could ſende themperour fridericke time ayde men yet ayde wt monie ſo much couenāt wherby euident order hath always ben enemy ye hous whiche hath euer bene linked polle bondes league affinity wherof king sigiſmūde requireth haue ſome conſideration caſe ſame order thinke ſelues bounde fight chriſtian faith religion nothing pruſſe round doe profeſſe chriſtiane religiō therfore muſt ſeke vnto place may exerciſe ſelues many yeares hieruſalem poſſeſſed barbarous ennemy defence whiche place ſaid order time paſt inſtituted conſtantinople alſo kept ſame nation lieth worke buſines thought ouer olde far many ſtrong city chriſtendome wonne lately theſe worthy knyghtes go thether thei might either recouer loſte defende reſt frō ennemy delight ciuile warre euery man may iudge howe vnworthy name thus caſe ſtandeth order hath bene alwayes without order whiche diſordred order knightes cauſe alſo expulſed pruſſie boheme lyke wyſe well nexe hondreth fiftie yeares paſt yet hath man hetherto deſyred ſame place whiche expulſed common vacant geuen polle ſement fit moleſted herein whiche ought moſte fauoured albeit order hath offended many yet hath done moſte hurt realme polle ſauing firſt ſcarſly maiſters order duty contrariwyſe moſte part leauing barbarous ennemies haue tourned weapon againſt magiſtrate kynges poolle yt haue brought confederacie alſo tartarians cruell kynde people mortall ennemies chriſtians wrytten michell cochmeſter wherfore man would make rekening cōſider ye paine perilles charge warres tumultes battails ſlaughters deſolations wherof order hath chiefly bene cauſe ſhal find yt hardly ſo much worth ye kinges deſire myght one ende theſe euils man ſhould attempte warre againſt albert duke pruſſe kyng wyll altogether ſit ſtyll ſee hym take wrong muche uncle hym patrone threateninges menace brought kynges eares whiche doubtles ſory heare loueth peace quietnes chiefly concorde chriſtendome howe caſe man ſhall attempte violence wyll dede vnwillyngly put armure yet wyll doe defende deſyreth frendſhyp prynces chiefly moſte mighty emperour kyng ferdinā wyſheth ſame continue euer hath often time heretofore intreated letter meſſengers preſcription decreed againſt duke albert might abolyſhed ſame done hetherto doeth ſo muche impute vnto aduerſitie tyme nowe alwayes made playne lettes taken awaye ſuppoſeth haue occaſion perfourme thyng whiche haue right franckely promyſed whan one lettre two haue ſignified ready wyll power gratifie hym caſe order wyll ceaſe ſteare vp warre trouble truſteth example progenitours kepe aſſuredly conuenauntes maximilian fridericke empeperours thing haue commiſſion apperteineth city danſke elunige theſe albeit vnder dominion polle yet called aſſemblies empyre wherfore kyng requireth ſo vſed hereafter ſynce man beſydes hath doe may henceforth ſuffered vſe owne lawes whan emperour heard demaundes made relation therof ſtates empire geueth copie oration wuolfange marque pruſſe xxiii daye ianuary maketh aunſwere vulgar tongue certen preface ſaith reſteth oratiō marque pruſe whole controuerſie matter whether pruſſe vnder dominion polle empire ſhall proue later true matter ſhalbe eaſy determine thus ſtandeth caſe moſte triumphant emperour moſte mighty kyng moſte noble prince ſtates ſhall declare foure hondreth yeares paſt whan publique war attempted againſt barbarian whiche vexed ſore men religion throughout al aſie affricke order wherof ſpeake inſtituted whiche emperours haue liberally originall order knighthode auaūced high byſhops alſo confirmed knyghtes ſame ordre ſpace certen yeares kept great warres thoſe party vniuerſall chriſten weale fine hauing great ouerthrowe diſcomfited diſperſed ſondry place ſame time duke muſcouia fortuned conrade duke moſcouia greuouſly aſſayled pruſſians ennemies chriſten religion whan longer hable mainteine warres defende ſelfe againſt ſued firſt byſhop rome ſetting forth celeſtiall immortall rewarde maner would incourage men warre adioyned order gaue countrey culmen borderyng vpon pruſſe rather encourage gaue al land pruſſe holde euer dede gift emperour friderick ſecond confirmed permitted herman salcie maiſter order moue warre againſt pruſſians ſubdue inioye lande euer yeare lorde cc xxvi thus verely order ayde emperour byſhoppes rome prince empyre continewing warre ſpace liii yeares laſt conquer lande pruſſe bring chriſtian religion beautified certen college byſhoprikes builded therin alſo caſtels city might thoſe party walle fortreſſe empire refuge nobilitie germany ſo hath parte ſame region remained gouernement vnto yeare ſaluation cccc l parte therof tyll albert brandenburg tyme lituanes tartarians together made warre againſt polonians moſcouites knightes remembring profeſſion order toke armure cleane diſconfited lituanians inuading far within limites cauſe long time peace amitie polonians vntill ſuche time certen prince lituania created king polle auenge loſſe ſhame nation moued prince lituania made king pole warre againſt v ſodenly ayded barbarian muche hurte men repulſed put beſides great part realme ioyfull ende warre ſo muche made complaint counſel conſtance came forth decree ſuche part polle men helde lawe armes ſhould reſtored thus beyng againe reuiued forgot benefit receiued renewed warre contended certen prouinces order belonged dominiō polle albeit interceſſion two kynges hongary boheme matter taken vp yet ſore brake agayne laſt caſe referred emperour sigiſmunde approued fourmer compoſition kynges made howebeit king polle could reſte thus attempted warre agayne whiche xxiiii yeare accorded compoſition peace tournie whan ladiſtaus king whiche compoſition peace forſaketh ſuite ſtrife neither calleth ſelfe lord inheritour pruſſie byndeth ſucceſſours within one yeres ſpace come crowne ſhall ſweare accepte ratifie ſame peace compelle byſhoppes ſtates realme take ſame othe euery tenth yeare othe ſhould renewed alſo cōdicioned ſame tyme king polle ſhall hereafter moue warre vpon maiſter pruſſie people bounde obeye aſſiſte hym peace continually kept either partie compoſition confirmed two hondreth seales ſhewed yet ye peace indure aboue xiiii yeares yeare lorde mcccci people making people rebell rebellion conſpired againſt maiſter albeit byſhop rome emperour fridericke thirde outlawe albeit maiſter deſired ye matter might heard yet ſo litle regarde lxx townes caſtels revelled one daye unto conſpiracie ioyned ſelfe kyng polle caſinure father sigiſmunde brought v vnto ſuche perplexitie lewys erlinſuſie maiſter order conſtrayned feare preſent daunger moſte conſtant man might doe ſuch caſe intent might hepe ſtill prouince alſo ſaue ſelfe ſame accorded vpon condition moſte vnreaſonable without authoritie either byſhop emperour yet ſtates empyre cōditions peace amonges thinges theſe maiſters pruſſie frō hence forth ſhal within ſixe monethes choſen magiſtrate come condition peace betwixt ye king polle knightes vnto king polle othe acknowledge hym souraigne ſhall ayde hym againſt men ſhal alſo receaue order aſwell polonians germaines ſhall admitte beare office ſuche landes ſhall wynne hereafter homage kynges polle whiche condition verely cōcerne priuate loſſe rebuke order alſo publique domage reproche empire nobilitie germany wherefore ſince time haue bene maiſters conſidering vnreaſonablenes thing haue made greuous complaintes hereof byſhops rome emperours yet haue bene conſtrained ſweare certenly pruſſie remained tuition empyre till friderich saxon albert brandenburg maiſters order would homage kynges polle neither byſhop emperour confirmed cōpoſition king caſimire yeare ccccc emperout maximilian aſſemble auſpurge made decree wherin commaunded geue fayth empyre appeaſe controuerſie maximilian appointed daye paſſawe yeare x ſending thether ambaſſadours could nothing concluded
