wherupō enſued laſt warre moreouer albert ſelfe xxiiii yeares paſt conuention norinberge prince empyre place amonges others ſigned decree made wherfore euident king polle hath right pruſſe lawfull pruſſe belōgeth yere albert withdrawe ſelf vnto tuition protection nowe ambaſſadour reproueth ordre vnthankefulnes breakyng conuenauntes herein doeth v wrong proued olde wrytinges ſcarſely haue kinges polle kepte touche promeſſe v euer wryting ſene confirmed mo seales ye ſame wherby accorded king ladiſlaus might aſſuraunce made yet breaking ſeales wryting warre renewed againſt v recompence reſtoryng vnto sarmatie great part lituania named certen emperours fourmer tyme ſayeth offended order truthe farre otherwyſe sigiſmunde ſequeſtre ſtrife geue ſentence v mē tioned alſo gaue v ayde againſt enemie againe emperour fridericke tyme people rebelled ſaid ſhewed v fauour might banyſhed cōſpiratours ſame cauſe helde aſſemble ye empyre norinberge conuention decree made ayde v lyke good wyll fauour maximilian ſhe v neither would ſhould ſweare kyng polle therfore owne name alſo whole empyre wrote ſondry letter kyng sigiſmunde made decree v right honorable oratour procedeth waye mockery demaundeth v recouer hieruſalem ſuch like place ſurely ſo cleane without experience could taunte againe neuertheleſſe reaſon honorable audience wyll refrayne wil aſke queſtion firſt ye kyng polle doth recouer thoſe place prince moſcouia hath taken frō within theſe fewe yeares whiche compariſon muche pruſſie againe ſo great fortune doeth defende owne limites dayly inuaſions tartarians uerely theſe plage breaking fidelitie ſayeth order tymes paſt expulſed boheme ſhould thus ſaye knowe vnleſſe example would ſhewe myght alſo lawfully ſpoyle v goodes tourne v landes poſſeſſions diſtruction ye tyme touched order pearſed alſo lande boheme extended vpon thē chiefly commotion boheme doctrine john huſſe followed olde religion tyme great tumultes reyſed doctrine john huſſe dur order hath warred kinges polle confeſſe euer gaue occaſiō warre denie vtterly neuer attempted warre either defende right el recouer owne ſayeth haue made league cartarians may well verefied manifeſt haue vſed ayde againſt men profeſſe chriſten religion againe ſituation countrey declareth eaſely whether tartarians lie commodious nerer v whiche ſpake laſte city danſke eluinge grounded vpon reaſon eyther citie dominion belongeth germane empyre neither hath kyng polle title whiche hath obtayned rebellion treaſon citezens may proued ſondry reaſons ſeyng theſe matter thus moſte redoubted emperour moſt mighty kyng state moſt honorable beſech ye ſentēce already geuē may put executiō obtein handes ought equitie cauſe dignitie empyre state religion honour ſo cōmoditie nobilitie germany ambaſſadour polle prepared contrary wryting exhibit ſame whan reaſons heard partes certen choſen whole nōbre examine matter whoſe determination ſentence pronounced againſt albert ſhould maynteined yet conſideryng great difficultie would execution ſame referre emperour ſhortly kyng sigil munde departed pure age whan reigned xlii yeres ſonne vnto king caſimire ſayde death sigiſmſid king pole thre brother wherof ladiſlaus kyng hōgary boheme father kyng lewys anne iohn albert alexander whan reigned order father caſimire leauing behinde child paſſed ouer gouernment yongeſt brother sigiſmunde unto whome nowe ſucceded ſonne ſame name maried ye daughter ferdinando kyng romaynes ſhewed mendoza fourmer boke proteſted rome concerning counſell wherunto halendes february followyng byſhop calling senate cardinalles made aunſwere tyme mendoza thou pope aunſwer mendoza ſaideſt emperour commaunded thee make proteſtation againſt counſell thou madeſt v right ſorowfull diligently wayed letter thy commiſſion comforted agayne firſt wyll ſpeake cauſe grief heuines maner proteſting euill example chiefly vſed ſuche either reuolted wholy dewe obedience haue begon wauer therin therfore greue exceadingly whiche haue alwayes borne fatherly loue emperour becommeth paſtour church haue euer deſyred concord greued senate cardinalles ſo much muche time loked nothing leſſe emperour hath made warre aduerſaries ennemies churche hath done ayde myne armie albeit mendoza thou ſemeſt eſteme thys lyghtly yet ought accepted great benefite warre finiſhed ye pope army ayde exceading great ſente ſo muche far ſurmounted abilitie power holy treaſure came moſte ſeaſon thing therfore could leſſe loked victory obtained ſo lately emperour ſhould rendre vnto ſuche fruicte godly zeale beneuolence uerely ende ſame warre ſhould beginning proteſting againſt certes hath chaunced vnto prophet complayneth lokyng gather grape ſhould fynde wylde beries haue euer ſynce tyme firſt called dignitie paſtorall earneſt ſtudy tilled cheriſhed themperour moſte noble plante myght haue plentifull vintage enterpryſe hath almoſte taken away frō al hope fruicte thou haſt heard cauſe grief heare alſo relieued ſame thou though thou hadſt authoritie geuen thee proteſte againſt ſacret ſenate haſt ſo vſed ſame neither vnto v honorable mete condigne emperour letter cōmiſſion one worde ſheweth themperours wil thou ſhouldeſt thus procede ſay one worde intent thou mayeſt better vnderſtand geueth authoritie thus emperour cōmaūdeth deputy boloigne ſhould proteſte thus legate whiche haue chaunged place counſel thou didſt perceiue done thou woldeſt vſe ſame maner proteſting alſo preſēce herein haſt thou paſſed bondes thy cōmiſſion thou haſt perceiued mendoza acknowledge laſt hauing warning themperour cōmaūdeth yt proteſt againſt v preſence againſt legate yt autours remouing wherfore thēperour hath done herein duty tēperate prince hath ſtayed within thoſe bondes limites wold ye proteſtation ſhuld made knoweth lawfull iudge al ſuche cauſes refuſed haue heard matter ſhuld haue iuſt cauſe proteſtation thou mē doza taking way yt thou ſhuldeſt haue done didſt deſire examine matter requireſt yt ſhuld diſanul ye decree made remouing counſel cōmaunde greateſt part father geue place ye remained trēt thing deminiſh thauthoritie whole coūſel ben much reaſonable yt thoſe trent thei cauſe cōplaint father boloigne ſhuld haue made ſame vnto certenly wold neither haue refuſed requeſtes thā yet wold preſēt therfore certen yt themperours minde cōſonāt agreable fact haue cauſe giue god thankes ruleth minde thys ſort may reioyce ſelues thou thy ſelf mayſt glad thy prince ſake albeit yt ſame ſaide already foūdatiō pleade ſo fallen yt nede anſwere thy proteſtation yet leſt ye ſilence might appeare acknowledge thine accuſatiōs ſame thing ſend many eſpecially ſuch ignoraūt cōfute thē firſt time yu haſt ſet marke rhine eies yt thou mighteſt declare negligent draw backward ſeke delayes yu coūſel ſhuld holdē thēperour carefull common wealth uigilaunt induſtrious wholy addicte kepyng counſel thou procedeſt ſpeakyng thy pleaſure aſſuredly doe nother ought enuie emperours prayſes thou haddeſt ſtayed empe prayſes ſet ye pope fyre nothinge aunſwere muche thou doeſt extolle hym depraue ſo laude commende hym thou myghteſt bryng contempte whyleſt thou ſayeſt hath deſyred counſell alſo prodeceſſours byſhoppes rome thing ſelfe requyreth ſhould aunſwere thee ſame thys alwayes emperours mynde deſyre counſell myght holden ſame mynde haue bene euer well agayne elder yeares ſo haue deſired thyng moſte honorable cardinalles tell whiche ſame nomber tyme whan choſen byſhop continued ſame mynde ſtyll hauing leſte occaſion world called coū ſell firſt mantua uicence thether came none hether fewe legate ſent taried halfe yeare lokyng biſhops whiche ſummoned ſending broad letter meſſengers partes howbeit thou ſayſt theſe city commodious nation repare trēt fit pourpoſe al men knowe trent compared vnto theſe neyther quantitie plentie thynges therfore incommoditie place let warres prynces nowe conſyder whether feruent behalfe emperour whiche letted counſell warlyke tumultes byſhop whiche euer peace maker neuer ayded prynce warre ſauing emperour ſame warre whiche ſemed open way vnto counſell whether emperour conſtrayned warre brought vnto againſt wyll diſpute certen counſell let warres come vnwillingly vnto compariſon becauſe contention prayſe vertu al dewe vnto god alone thou mendoza haſt geuen occaſion tedious warne thee cōſider euery yeare byſhoprike marke wel care ſtudy haue taken verely theſe two thinges haue bene euer eye make peace amongeſt prince kepe coūſel herein haue ſpared neyther coſte payne myne olde age neyther doeſt thou reproue thyng counſel blameſt legate remoued boloigne without knowledge moreouer doeth offende thee call congregation father boloigne counſell thynkeſt ſuſteyne iniurie therby remayne trente euill thus men ſpeake howe counſell remoued trent bononie wherfore ſhould doe dutie vpryght iudge ought ſo call tyll knowe otherwiſe contrary probation eſpecially ſythe moſte parte byſhops gone legate thether leſſe parte thou affirmeſt greater ought preuayle doubtfull matter euident counſell hath power remoue el whether lawfully remoued wherin al cōtrouerſie reſerue vnto ſelf iudgement ſo cōmaund thyng whiche offered meane tyme doe attribute vnto congregation name counſell thou affirmeſt thoſe cauſers remouing vnto addicted thynkeſt thou thynge worthy reprehenſion thou prayſeſt ſuche remayned trente bycauſe fauour conſider daunger herein thing wonte arryſe diſſentions ſciſmes vnto churche moſte perillouſe tyme byſhoppes withdrawe ſelues obedience hygh prelate vnderſtande addicted ſuche factiouſe wyll take parte whether right wrong verely knowe none ſuche haue none partakyng part father towardes child paſtour ward flocke neither hath chaunced yet ſuche controuerſie counſell neded ſuche addicted vowed men requyre byſhoppes chifly prouide libertie conſcience gaue eſpeciall charge legate whan went vnto counſel thei ſhuld ſe wyſe byſhops ſhuld haue cauſe cōplain taking away libertie geuing voice finde much fault alſo perſwaded requeſtes thēperour king ferdinādo al ye ſtates thēpyre gathereſt hereby ye take care germany eſpecially whan thēperour hath great labour pain brought paſſe ſuche lately ſwarued church refuſe decree ye coūſel ſo might continued trent certes neuer refuſed determinate wordes myght retourne trente ſo ſame may lawfully done without offence nation deſirous health germany hereof euident twyſe haue called counſel thither twiſe counſell called trent twiſe ſent legate whiche firſt tyme ſpace ſeuen monethes loked chiefly commynge germanes pariſe morone poole cardinalles thou knoweſt thy ſelfe howe came none tyme thither came emperours name granuellan byſhop arras ſelfe mendoza witnes great patience men abyding reſt ende therof ſo muche ſelues would tary albeit legate intreated laſt one thre myght remayne example others yet alledging certen excuſe departed many dayes agayne two yeares tyme commodious thei met againe ſent legate thither mountane crucei poole cardinalles thyther came alſo fraunces toletane remembre howe longe expectation many monthes conſumed vaine tofore could begynne come matter many holſome decree made know fewe came ther chiefly neded remedy byſhoppes came none al fewe ſent proctours briefly appeared ſignes token would come amendement whan many reſorted thether spayne fraunce italy prouinces germany whiche next others hardely came one nowe ſaye ſtate germany otherwyſe emperour whoſe power authoritie nowe augmented doth vndertake caſe retourne trente germaines wyll followe decres counſell beleue mendoza true thou ſayeſt germaynes mynde doe playnely ſubmitte ſelues counſell ſo euer yet woulde ſhould ſo taken though paſſed greatly place synode holden ſo ſticke vnto trente vnleſſe finiſhed firſte began wyll ſaye germany vndonne take hede doe whyleſt bynde v walles one citie doe iniurie holy ghoſte olde tyme god ordeined hieruſalem peculiar place wherin wold worſhipped pleaſed thā whā ceremony ſhaddowes lawe abolyſhed ſauiour chriſt ſunne rightuouſnes ſhone forth would ſerued place therfore bryng newe bondage whan would compell v place ſeyng germany ſhould cured nedefull counſell kept dane gothians britans vexed lyke diſeaſes ſhould euery haue generall counſell kept owne countreys ſo aſſembling counſelles ſo much conſideration lawes made thoſe whiche doe make preſcribe ſame byſhoppes father whoſe commodity chiefly reſpected father muſt prouided forwel proued ſondry example counſels haue oftentymes bene holden countreis hereſies ſprange vp whether vnreaſonable thing 〈◊〉 germaynes ſhould take vpon appointe place counſell election libertie taken away nation declare bitter proteſtation neded nowe reſt ſame ſaye howe auſwere made vnto emperour vnſitting full lye grounded neither vppon ryght reaſon theſe thynges vnreuerently ſpoken herein thou doeſt v wrong becauſe thou bryngeſt reaſon aunſwere thee diſtinctely howe ſuppoſe greueth deſyre decree may ratified well aſſured ſhall repare counſel ſame maner order pleading ſtyll reteyned whiche hath remayned churche apoſtles tyme vnto daye finally ſaufe conduicte ready theſe demaū de nothing ſtraunge vnreaſonable wont prouided wel lawes byſhops alſo emperours nowe ſaye whatſoeuer incommoditie ſhall arryſe tyme come emperour wyll aſcribe vnto alſo negligence wyll take vpon hym charge church uerely ſo far forth god wyll geue grace wyll ſo demeane ſelfe wyll geue iuſt pope may weake negligēt cauſe thought negligent matter cōcerning churche neuertheleſſe ſo fortune imbecillitie man nature ſhall offended negligence maye ſtyre vp ſharpen emperours dilligence ſuccour churche ſo ſtaye hym ſelfe within precincte limittes preſcrybed followe herein rule ryght lawes holy father finally concerning chiefe point proteſtation contende remouing counſell vnlawfull muche effecte controuerſie theron dependeth take vnto ſelf examination therof vertue power authoritie committe hearing ſame moſte worthy cardinalles pariſe burges poole creſcent commaunde meane tyme whyleſt examine thing man ſo euer attempte thynge contrary alſo charge father aſwell bo nonie alſo trent haue thing ſaye alledge matter within moneth leſt ſhould ſeme point hinder commoditie germany wyll refuſe ſende myne ambaſſadours thether ſuche may cure infirmitie people ſhal vnder ſtande ſame vnthankeful emperour beſydes whan iudgement ended caſe ſhall appere wel remoue vnto boloigne deuiſe meanes synode may cōtinued trent fewe wordes fine auncient religion may agayne reſtored germany cardinall trent retourned auſpurge ſaid whan emperour hearing talke alſo receiuing letter frō mendoza dated rome ende december ſawe ſmall hope counſell xiiii daye ianuary declareth matter ye ſtates caſe ſtandeth hath ſignified ambaſſadour mendoza ſhould make proteſtation rome concerning remouing counſel ſame ſhal done wyll gette copie wryte albeit hope counſell vtterly neglected yet reaſon ye long delay whiche like come betwixt thinketh requiſite neceſſary meane tyme ſome meane founde conſerue peace germany haue dede committed vnto hym charge matter thinketh expedient whole nombre choſen fewe good well learned men haue hereof wyll alſo appoint certen conſult wherfore requireth wylling hereunto al affectiōs layde aſyde cōſider commoditie cōmon wealth euery thē alſo reconcilement made let call remembraunce howe diſſention germany moſte floriſhyng region others mirrour ſpectacle al nation beholde let thē conſider moreouer toke ſo muche trauel pain counſell might continued trent ded ſame duty ſinguler zeale cōmon coūtrey therfore dyuers choſen treat matter coulde agre whole matter referred themperour wherfore appointed certen penne article doctrine ceremony reformation clergie thoſe auctours interim iuly pflugie byſhop numburge michaell sidonie iohn iſlebie agricola xviii yeares paſt defended doctrine proteſtauntes melanchton brentius wrytten ſeuenth booke theſe therfore wryte ihon iſleby reuolte boke article ſecretly whan bene lōg printed ſondry tymes length exhibite ſame emperour wyl ſhewe hereafter ioachim electour brandenburg whiche laboured ſore reconcilement deuiſing firſt iames sturmius intreated senate straſburg letter cauſe religion would ſende vnto bucer aſmuche byſhop withdrawen coūſell emperour taken way great hope reformation whereupon bucer ſent taking iurney priuely ende ianuary whan came almoſte auſpurg bucer ſet ſtayed tyll prince ſent hym former boke declared englyſhemen ouercame scottes mighty battell scottes would relent chaunge pourpoſe truſted frenche kynges promeſſes duke somerſet protectour england reſt counſell firſt day february wryte vnto thē long exhortation vnto peace albeit ſay requiſite coūcell england wryte scottes beginning ſhould procede whiche cauſe inferiours goe worſe albeit poſſeſſe great part dominion yet admoniſhe wealth preſeruatiō laſt yeare battel prouoked peace amitie declared mynde yt wryting ſuppreſſed captaines gouernour realme ſuffered come handes ſo may wel ſelues care full litle chaunceth vnto wherfore ſhall alſo vſe ſame diſceiptfulnes ſuffer vnderſtande part wyll counſell wryting openly proteſte haue omitted part dutie englande hath oftentymes kepte warre scotlande exceading great doubt ciuille war betwene englande scotland ſhall reade hiſtories heare feates done would maruell muche people one countrie langage ſhuld ſo great diſſention amonges themſelues woulde accompt thing chiefly wyſhed whoale ilande might ſome meane agree one ruled one gouernement al men confeſſe redier waye unto mariage way god hauing compaſſion vpon hath ſhewed offered moſte goodly occaſion boſome kyng whan broken promeſſe ouerthrow battell died ſhortly whether ſorowe ſome cauſe thre child two ſonnes daughter indede might haue ben let ſo yt ther ſhuld haue ben made attonemēt betwixt v god toke thē away maner one day whan thei infantes left one inheriter daughter borne litle ye death father vnto v hath geuē king great exſpectatiō edward ſonne heire vnto hery ye eight ſe bond prepared perpetual euer laſting amitie betwene v hath bene oftētimes wiſhed theſe eight hondreth yeares paſt chaūced neuer ſo good opportunitie deny hinder peace amongeſt meane ſay wold procure ſelues lordſhip bondage ye haue letter ſent ye laſt yeare paſt ſufficiently cōfuted take god witneſſe ye king minded ioyne moſte aſſured frendſhyp ſhal refuſe prouoke v againe warre frowardnes vnto whome ſhall faulte common euilles aſcribed haue promiſed daughter heyre realm mariage king common aſſent parliamēt writinges made ſame confirmed common ſeale realme many daughter scotlande aſſiaū ced yt king england great aſſuraunces deuiſed cōtented put pledge till came lawfull age theſe wrytinges cuſtody perpetuall witnes againſte whiche thinges hamelton erle arraine gouernour realme preſent preſident alſo chief doer ſame cardinal saint andrewes certē prelate clergie put gouernour scotlanda leage breaker feare terrour ſhewed hym agayne great hope waye broke faith conuenauntes whome aſſuredly ſo euer euils chaunceth meane tyme whole blame imputed haue loſt ſo many fortes caſtelles battell foughten wanted ſo many thouſandes men haue ſo farre inuaded realme chiefly aſcrybed vnto hym ende length doe loke obſtinacy vuloyaultie hauyng victory offer peace poſſeſſe great part kyngdome yet make england common ſame men vanquyſhed wont ſuffer great ignomie tyme vnited people haue victorye ſhould forſake loſe name owne nation doe frely graunte vnto refuſe receiue yt auncient name britaines common nation thing loue god v performed aſ men iudge haue iuſt cauſe warre whan ſhall knowe ſo liberall ſo reaſonable honeſt condicions could take place ſet open always come vnto frendſhip neither expulſe quene realme wil alſo eſtabliſh daughter england intende abrogate lawes englande fraunce emperours countreyes alſo vſe ſondry lawes ſeke hinder peace doe put ſuche feare prouide owne commoditie pleaſure care wealth tourne awaye eye mynde conſider ſtate common wealth haue mayde inheritour realme ſhe muſt doubtles mary length therfore ſhe ſhall eyther maryed one owne nation ſome foreine prince ſhe mary home ryght title remayneth yet neuertheleſſe vnto v whole thinge wyll ſtyre vp ciuile tumultes diſſention ſhe take ſtraunger ye ſhal haue v continual ennemies miſerable ye quene mary ſtraunger moſte miſerable bondage ſhall ye ſerue foreine nation muſt ſeke ayde farre force ſhall ſent ſpoken hurt wyll howe prowdely arrogauntly wyll deale thus wyl perſwaded ayde defence conſiſteth whole preſeruation wyll take quene prince trāſport whether lyſte ſhall haue warre ſyde may ſhall wyll wholly addicte defende care leaue vnto v pray fortune ſende ſoldiours cap ſhall preſcribe commaunde thynge ſhall well done wyll haue prayſe therof miſfortune chaūce whole ſtorme ſhall lyght neckes loſe lyfe bloud daunger alſo daūger vſe forain aydes vſe foreyne aydes domeſticall example may teache brytaines people ſame ilande ſente saxon tymes paſte ayde thē ſame expulſed countrie dryuen mountanes britanes expulſed yt saxon fennes tyme dwelte betwyxt englande scotlande pictes fierſe warlyke people whome scottes defended ennemy pictes yt scot length ſo oppreſſed name remayneth daye ſame happen frenche men thē frankonie grekes longe ſynce hongarians memory whan vſed ayde turkes c gothians tyme paſte ſame meane wynne italy lumbardes whole countrie nowe called lumbardie longe ye wyſe proue inſolent pryde arrogancie foreyne soldiour compare infinitie rable euylles mariage infinitie honourable peace herein ſet eye maner example nation nere coūtryes vnited maryage vnto v emperour charles fyft meane poſſeſſeth spayne burgundy frenche kynge ſame meane hath annexed litle brytain vnto crowne fraūce lyke alſo doe nation two wayes whereby warres finiſhed either force victory two way finiſh war el mariage hate force doe admit whiche offered whiche conuenaunted graunted ignoraunte diſwade holſome counſel uerely certen clergie gouernour realme alſo take hede leſt whiche ſo ofte haue broken fidelitie loſe whole libertie leſte beyng corrupte brybes hyre rewarde treaſon delyuer vp caſtelles fortes straungers whiche thyng whan ſhall doe wyl fayne wordes doe intent ſhall defende v dede thei aſſured ayde may ſelues brydle lyſte ſeeth caſe realme ſhall ſtande miſerable wretched frowardnes incloſed euery ſide dccean sea walles ditch moſt ſtrong agrement mindes amongeſt v wanted nothynge hyghe felicitie myght eſtablyſhe moſte floriſhyng monarchie thys waye moue nothynge leſte wyſe let calamitie lately receyued myſery nowe hanging ouer headdes perſwade let feare goddes vengeaunce alſo moue god reuenger faith conuenauntes brokē deteſteth al deſire warre plageth ſame greuous puniſhementes deſire quene conuenaunted waye peace whiche god infinitie goodnes hath ſhewed ſame followe wyſhe alſo wold walke ſame ſteppes obtain nothing proteſt neceſſitie muſt attempt warre god conduite whoſe worde voice contemne wyll proſecute right ſword fire wherfore good men amōgſt ſory calamitie countrey whiche thinke faith promyſe kepte obſerued may come vnto v ſafely whoſoeuer ſhall ſhewe loue fauour trafficke alſo marchaūdiſe may frely vſed amongſt v kyng hath lately prouided ſet forth proclamation intent might token beneuolence towardes ſhall perceiue benefite wel imployed intendeth beſtowe vpon greater hath cōmaunded theſe thinges ſignified name ye former boke ſhewed sebaſtian uogelſberg brought french kyng germany ten enſeignes fotemē autumne retourned home diſcharged bandes ſerued ye frenche kyng emperour toke greuouſly diſpleaſaūtly ſeking occaſion commaunded lazarus schuendie ſe could apprehende commyng wiſſeburg hous toke brought auſburge uogelſberg apprehēded streight way put vpon racke examined torture diuerſe others ſuſpicion though fauoured frenche partie although valeaunt ſtoutnes body mynde vttered nothing tourment yet reported haue bene ſocietie rebelles haue broken emperours proclamation deuiſed crafty counſelles condemned die two cēturions iames mantel wuolf thomas wherfore ye ſeuēth day february brought forth marketh place foure day came thether certen enſeignes fotemen ar mure great reſort people whan come higher place executiō loking bold ſtoute conſtācy death courage aſmuch nobleman degree loked wyndowes houſes euery ſide ſaluteth thē great reuerence ſpeaking kinde life declareth hath heretofore ſerued emperour warres ſayth cauſe death yt laſt yere brought frenche king force men time crowned rain uogelſberg goodly comely perſonage ſhewed toke al terrour feare death allured men beholde heheaded cēturions named two iudges gaue ſentence whiche followe emperours court campe alwayes one biruieſca spaniarde germane niclas zinner lawyer blamed schuendie though bene circumuented thei ſetforth wryting declare wherfore executed excuſe schuendie affirme nothing emperours cōmaundement proteſte accuſation falſe tyme fraunce chiefly paris burning perſecution perſecution fraunce renewed lutheraniſme contrariwyſe englande conſulted vtterly aboliſhe popiſh maſſe themperour ſayd geuē duke maurice dignitie electourſhip greateſt part duke saxon coū trie campe wittemberge conuentiō publique ſolemne ceremonie putteth inpoſſeſſion receiueth tuition empire thing promiſed thā done xxiiii day february thēperours birth day cerimony ſorte market place buylded pauilion bordes great breadth wherūto ceremonie wherby duke maurice created elect went vp ſteps thither came themperour thre clock none accōpanied ye prince electours goeth frō hence houſe putteth ſolemne robe prince electours thence cometh forth ſitteth vnder cloth eſtate likewiſe euery man place backſide ouer themperour vpon ſtage placed trompetters cometh forth ye firſt band duke maurice runne horſes themperours pauilion maner ye meane ſeaſon duke maurice wt band ſtaieth right ouer againſt accompanied nōber prince next xii trompetters immediatly iſſued y• ſame band hēry ye duke brūſwick wuolfāge prince bipoūt brother ye elector palatine albert ye yōg duke bauer whē thei courſed horſes ye place ſaid alight go vp thē per 〈…〉 hūbly require hi yt wold auāce duke moris ye commō benefit thempire ye digniti electorſhip themperor cōſultīg wt thelectors maketh anſwer tharchbiſhop 〈…〉 ētz yt cōtēt ſo caſe wil cōe hī ſelf demād ye ſame whē receiued yt anſwer duke moris cōmeth riding forth wt hole troupe wer born x enſeignes wt armes many regiōs wherin deſired inueſted whā come vp themperor kneled vpō knee deſireth y• ſame hoier earl māſfeld ſent brother auguſt make ye like requeſt wherfor themperor anſwereth tharchbiſhop mētz chāceler thempire foraſmuch haue hī faithful ſeruice wil geue vnto duke moris heires male none brother auguſtus heir body thelectorſhip ſaxonie al ye lāds ihō friderick ſo much excepted alredy grā ted childrē afterward tharchbiſhop mētz readeth ye oth wherwt thelectors boūdē whā duke moris reciting ſworn themperor deliuereth vnto ſworde wt ceremony putteth wer full poſſeſſion geueth thākes promiſeth al fidelity obeiſāce thoſe bāuērs armes mētioned whē duke moris receiued thē themperor wer thrown amōgs people accuſtomed al theſe thing might duke ihō friderick behold houſe lodged ſo wtout fail ſame market place bucer ſēt auſpurge came laſt thelector brādēburge boke finiſhed ſhewed cōpiled religiō marque deliuereth bucer marque brā denburge fended wyth bucer deſireth ſubſcribe whē red ouer yt ſaw biſhop rome doctrine therein eſtabliſhed ſaid could allow ſame thelector toke diſpleſātly much fēded wt iudged wryting moderat ſo iſlebie perſwaded hī granuellā alſo vrged bucer meſſēgers wold ſubſcribe promiſed hī ample reward whē might preuail bucer daunger large promiſes begā threatē ſo returned home wtout dāger ſor throughout al lād wirtemberge bāds spaniardes ſaid month aprill tharchbiſhop collō lately made prieſt ſāg firſt maſſe term wherat themperor king ferdinādo prince great nōbre maketh moſte ſumpteous dinner time alſo came auſpurge muleaſſes king tūnes muleaſſes kinge tunnes whome emperour xiii yeres paſte reſtored kingedome expulſed barbarous ſhewed ninth boke eldeſt ſon put eies vſurped crown wherfore like miſerable exile came hither themperor barbarie lōg came thither alſo ſecōd ſōne boke cōpiled religiō treateth firſt ye ſtate mā cōtents interim fal redēptiō chriſt charity good work ye cōfidēce ye remiſſi • ſinnes church vowes authoriti ye miniſters ye church ye high biſhop ſacramēts ſacrifice maſſe memorial inuocatiō interceſſiō ſaintes memorial ſuch haue died godly cōmunion annexed ſacrifice ceremony vſe ſacraments theſe thing amongs others taught yt thoſe workes beſides cōmaūdemēt god godly honeſtly wrought cōmōly called ye work ſuperogatiō cōmēded y• mā worckes ſuperogatiō cānot wtout diſtruſt imbecillity beleue yt ſins forgeuē ye church hath autority interprete ye ſcriptures oute ſame together ſetforth doctrins power miniſter ye law iudge doutful matter general coūſel make lawes yt ther one high biſhop aboue al y• reſidue prerogatiue graūted peter vnto whō gouernment vniuerſall church committed chriſt yet ſo biſhops alſo haue part cure euery mā church yt cōfirmatiō chriſme receiued y• holy goſt ſo yt may reſiſt deceit ye deuil fleſh world biſhop miniſter ſacramēt ſins muſt reherſed prieſt ſuch come memory ſatiſfactiō cōſiſteth frutes repētāce eſpecially faſting praying almoſgeuing cut ye cauſes ſinnes temporal puniſhment ether taken away mitigated holy vnctiō hath bene church ſince time apoſtles yt ether might help body mind ſelf againſt firy dart deuil wherfor muſt vſed time hour death apeareth draw nere mariage contracted wtout cōſēt parēts ought ratified yet childrē admoniſhed ſermons yt folow thaduiſe parēts chriſt laſt ſupper inſtitute ye ſacramēt body blud firſt ſame might receiued faithful holſom meat ſoul ſecondli yt might offred vp memorial death ther al ii ſacrifices chriſt one blody vpō croſſe thother wherin vnder ye form bread wine ſelf two ſacrifices chriſt theſe terimiſtes offred vp vnto father body blud deliuered y• ſame apoſtles ſucceſſers ye memorial vnto world end ye firſt mākind reconciled god father ſame yt blody chriſt repreſēted father yt ſhuld agaī deſerue yt remiſſiō ſins yt might apply vnto ſelues y• recōcilemēt prepared ye death chriſt yt ſacrifice wherin celebrate ye death chriſt ye morial ſaints muſt renued yt may make interceſſiō v god father help v merit muſt alſo remēber dead cōmend thē almightye god preſcribed yt old ceremony accuſtomably vſed baptiſme ſtil obſerued xorſiſme renouncing cōfeſſion faith chriſme moreouer yt ceremony maſſe ther nothing chaūged al town great church ther ſaide daily ii maſſes leaſt country village one eſpecially holy day yt canō inaſſe nothing altered al reſt obſerued thold vſage yet thing crept yt may geue occaſiō ſuperſtitiō let takē away let veſtments ornament veſſels croſſes altar cādels image kept ſtil certein monumēts let thoſe ordinari praiers godly ſinging pſalmes abrogated wher takē away let thē reſtored let obit dead kept maner thold church alſo ſainctes holy day yea let thē worſhipped alſo vnto whō decreed yt ſupplicatiō ſhuld made day eaſter witſontide let water fōtſtone hallowed ſolēne maner let riot refrained thintent ſtir vp mind godly exerciſes certen daie • let mē faſt abſtain frō fleſh finally though wer wiſhed yt ther diuers many miniſters church foūd yt would liue chaſt yet yt many haue wiues euery wher whiche forſake nether altred without great tumult therfore muſt tary herein decre generall counſel likewiſe interi permitteth prieſtes kepe wiues ſtil cōtēted bear thē yt receiue lord ſupper vnder kindes yet ſo ſhal reproue others yt contrary vnder ether kind body bloud chriſt conteined wholy ſort boke ſetforth laſt ſhal heare ſo pēned beginninge oft corrected euil cōpiled boke ofte corrected copy yt bucer ſaw ſomwhat purer wherfore ben toſt lōg much among ſtates thempire ſēt alſo rome albeit yt al papiſtry maner therin eſtabliſhed yet aſmuch certē thing wer permitted contrary part thought firſt expediēt make biſhop priuy openet 〈…〉 themperor cardinal stoudrate theſe note inaduerſiōs prieſt hath takē ordres ſhuld mary execute note interim bi ye biſhoppe rome ſtil y• holy miniſtry neuer hard yt vſe receiuing ye lord ſupper vnder kind abrogated nether hath mā autority permit yt liberty ſauing ye biſhop rome ſinode yt folowers ye old religiō boūdē vnto theſe doctrins lutheranes wil forſake opinion thei refuſed ii maſſes ought vnderſtād ye lutheranes yt ſinging pſalmes ought reſtored al place yt holy day muſt celebrate ye memoriall patrone church ſuche prieſtes already hereafter ſhalbe muſte abſtayne frō mariage ſpedy reſtitution church goodes iuriſdictiō muſt made robbery manifeſt nether muſt folow herein thordinary proces law determin y• thing euidēt execute matter regal power whē cēſure inferred tharchbiſhops mētz treuers collen vnto whō deliuered anſwer thēperor directly ſame ſort eſpecially vrge reſtitutiō declaring ſame right neceſſary chriſtē religiō ſhuld maintained place wher aboliſhed ſhuld reſtored moreouer cōmon peace cā otherwiſe eſtabliſhed wherfore chiefli prouided yt religious houſes wholy reſtored much ſpoil extortiō manifeſt muſt go ſpedeli work yt god ſeruice may withal ſpede recouered finally deſire take theſe thing good part protectiō defēd mēbers church iii elector wer ſame opiniō eſpecially thelectors dary opiniō ye paulſgraue duke moris yet ether thē cauſes ſhuld gainſai themperor reſt prince whiche wer moſt part biſhops anſwer like maner iii archbiſhops city ther great accompt made thē themperour therfore ides maye calleth state preface ſpeaking zeale towardes germany ſaieth perceiue manifeſt argument thing ſelf ye neither peace eſtabliſhed law iuſtice miniſtred vnleſſe cōtrouerſie religiō firſt appeaſed hath many peares ſturred vp thempire muche grudge dyſſention hatred diſcorde ciuile warres hath bene verely cauſe many cōuētions cōferēces haue often ſought remedy meane time germany alſo natiōs people chriſtēdome hath ſame cōtageous infection pearſed ſo much ther appereth preſent remedy general coūſel lēgth requeſt procured holdē trēt moued alſo ye beginning conuentiō ſubmit ſelues thauthoritie y• ſame y• charge might cōmitted vnto v ye meane ſeaſō deuiſe ſome godly meanes wherby might liue quietly ye meane germany cōtētatiō cōfydēce youres vnto v thā alſo right acceptable time therfore gaue ſelues wholy vnto carefulnes demaūded opinion perceiued without great grief mynde diſagrement religion thoccaſion former euils vnleſſe foreſene hereafter wylbe wherefore thought good leaue matter troubleſome ſtate vntyll decree counſell oughte broughte ſome moderation eſpecially ſith yt oftentimes new ſectes ariſe whileſt pōdering theſe thing certain high degre nobility deſirous peace louers cōmon weale exhibite v wryting theyr opiniō cōcerning religiō promiſe due obeiſāce receiuing y• wryting deliuered ſame certaine good learned deuines yt ſhuld among thē ſelues conſider al thing diligētly peruſed made report y• ſame wel vnderſtand impugne catholike religion doctrine ye lawes cōſtitutions church two opinion excepted wherof thone mariage prieſtes thother lordes ſupper ſaid wel deuiſed eſtabliſh concord germany thing douſles vnto v ſhuld moſt acceptable ioyful thing could happē thē ſe al ſtates mindes agreable follow one ſame forme religion ſeing euē ſo require ſuch haue obſerued hitherto ye lawes cuſtome ye catholike church great cōmendation perſeuer ye ſame alter nothing haue promiſed v heretofore thoſe alſo haue chaūged religiō deſire moſt earneſtly paſſe wt thother ſtates profeſſe ſame religion yt el cōfyrme doctrine order boke euery poynt follow ſteps hereof beſides ordaine nothing ſtay within theſe boundes limites neither wryting preaching attempt thing contrary obediētly attēd decre general coūcel ſame may ſhortly poſſible wil indeuor wt al diligēce ar occupied thing wholy cōceaue forme reformatiō clergie whā ſpokē thus ſecretary accuſtomed cōmaūded boke red ther tharch craft tharchbiſhop mentz prouing y• interim biſhop mētz occupieth ye chiefeſt place amōg thelectors ſeking thopiniō ſtats ſhold ariſeth vp wer name al ye reſt geueth vnto thēperor ſo much trauel pain care diligēce loue y• coūtrey imortal thāks aſmuch thei haue already cōmitted thing fidelitie paine hath bē takē therin ſaith reaſon yt ſhould wt moſt willing mind acknowledg theſame obey decre thāks geuing thē peror take cōmon aſſent cōfirmatiō wold admit none excuſe ſhall herafter declare cōmaundeth boke ſet forth print latin duch alſo iiii day declareth ſtats wt much labor coſt hath reſtored peace vn germany becauſe thing ſelf requireth yt alſo prouided time come ſuppoſeth veri mete neceſſari ſome great treaſure money beleuied certeine place kept common treaſurie fortune time anye commotion arriſe within empire without ſame may alwaies readineſſe fewe day paſſed betwene kynge ferdinando raccompteth waightie cauſes whiche king fernā requireth monet ſtates ſelues vnderſtand wel inough nede recited ſendinge ambaſſade made truſe turke fiue yeares wherof one paſt albeit hath commaunded men nothing contrary yet requireth neuertheleſſe geue aid haue already promiſed intent breake couenauntes may eaſely reſiſted inaſmuch doth fortifye frontier townes ſtronge garriſons alſo negligent behalf therfore purpoſed fortifye place kepe garriſons intollerable charge warres theſe former yeares hable ſuſtaine ſo greate burthen wherfore requireth whileſt truſe ſhal indure would pay mony yerely imploid vnto theſe vſes concerneth quiet preſeruation meane time maximilian eldeſt ſonne king ferdinando departinge auſpurge goeth spaine maximilian marieth hys coſen take mariage lady mary emperours eldeſt daughter coſin germane cardinall trent ſente wyth fewe monethes duke alba ende maye horſmen nalpes norgouia come contrie neare vnto strauſburge remaine ſpace three monethes hardly expreſſed arrogantly vſed ſelues many time woulde come citie neither wanted thinge great ſuſpicion duke moris long emperours decree ſetforth departeth thēce marque ihon brandenburge brother ioachim electoure goeth emperour kinge ferdinando ſtandinge iohn mark brand refuſeth interim beſecheth fauor matter ſpeakinge ſomewhat ſeruice towardes ſaieth vppon affiaunce chiefly ſerued laſt warre aſſured touchinge religion emperoure ſheweth howe conſente ſtates imperiall ſaieth man oughte ſwarue ſame replied againe aſſented aunſwered plainly could good conſcience praiſe ſame decree ſtill vrged promeſſe couenaunt whan emperour might preuaile commaundeth departe whiche men ſuppoſe done cauſe leaſt ſhould example talke cōfirme mindes others wherfore ſame day towardes euening taketh iourney homewardes dominion altered nothing prince electoure brother indeuoured alwaies pleaſe themperoure made aſſiſtaunce yet paulſgraue hauing emperoure ſame time good lorde ambaſſadoures city ſuche confeſſion auſpurge vrged intreate mighte firſte aduertiſe senate intent might anſwer according vnto mindes thing permitted emperoure commaunded wuolfgange prince bipount cōſtāce duke swebrig houſe palatine ambaſſadours come ſelfe whan came doth inſtaunt confirme decre ſaieth knoweth none religion ſaue borne brought vp vnto day wherfore requireth haue ſome conſideration ſaieth wil herein whatſoeuer maye ſafe conſcience emperoure time letteth ſo departe afterwarde vrged ſharply letter meſſagers ſhall rerited place whileſt senate auſpurge conſulted emperoure placeth ſouldiours throughe citie righte famous miniſter church wuolfgange muſculus ſeinge muſculus departeth berne godlineſſe go wracke senate tunorouſe could approue booke departeth thence berne swiſſerland hale sweuia ihon brentius greate daunger two yeres paſt time proteſtantes retourned labor perill brē tiu home emperour came vnto hale much daunger little emperour came thither beginning decembre certain spaniſh ſouldioures comming towne went ſtraightwaies vnto houſe require let el threaten much cruelty beinge receiued many thinges fierſelye arrogantlye wherefore biddeth wife family hauing none place repare get hoſpitall houſe city little followeth ſelfe leauinge one home geue vitailes thinges neceſſary next daye commeth noble man spaine cleargy thruſting oute dores kepeth whole houſe ſelf going ſtudie ſearcheth thinges whan founde certaine letter wrytten brentius frendes concerninge trouble time ſeketh procure much diſpleaſure whan vttred ſame countrye men wherefore followinge aduiſe frendes cold ſharpe winter nighte conueieth ſelf country leaſt preſence ſhould hinder citezens emperoure come thither ſhewed clemency ſemed nothing offended anye kinde doctrine taught brentius laſt retourned thither executed ſrunction vnto time emperoure woulde haue men receiue decree made concerning religion beyng commaunded many learned men thorowout germany declare thought boke albeit vnderſtode pleannes god line brē tiu owne daunger yet thintent might perfourme hys duetie cōgregation pronoūceth ſame contrary scripture ſo declareth writing yt came biſhops handes granuellan themperours name cōmā ded thambaſſadours hale ſhould finde meanes might brought bounden auſpurge beinge admoniſhed freindes ſteppeth ſide countrey longe commeth hale bande spanierdes captaine wherof goeth immediatly houſe brentius ſeketh euery diligently might find pray cary away moſt part ſtuffe conueied frendes alies vnto another place thus therfore whiche taught xxvi yeares exiled wife alſo thoughe ſhe greuous ſicknes whereof ſhe died ſhortly baniſhed withall family wherefore ſhe wife childrē baniſhed pore wretch wandred vp downe vi child knewe become haue refuge men ſo ſore afraid spaniardes thing augmented diſeaſe ſorow ſhe knewe meane become huſband whan ulrich duke wirtemberge hard miſery brentius ſelfe great daunger yet gaue relief ſecreatly family furthermore city sweuia following moſte parte emperoures authority promiſed accompliſh commaundement wherfore preacher euery remoued diuers place leaſt ſhould commit thing vnworthy profeſſion andreas oſiander godlie preacher flee cauſe leauinge norinberge wente lande pruſſe spire woormez ether one fled alſo ſaue ſelues william earle naſſowe ſuffred eraſmus sarcerius depart ye ſame cauſe moreouer duke fearfulnes yt duke wyrtemberge wirtemberge whoſe country garriſons spaniardes euery hath bene ſaied whan commaundement came emperour cauſed boke ſetforthe recited pulpit commaundeth man thing contrary man wil ſay maſſe geueth liberty chargeth ſubiectes diſturbe prieſt putteth awaye thoſe miniſters church would allow boke amonges whome erardus schueffius emperoure conſtancy duke saxonie granuellane biſhop arras moued duke saxon captiue obey decree followe doctrine boke ſetforth albeit aſſaid fair promiſes ſhewed ſome hope deliueraunce yet perſeuered conſtante opinion laſte yere ſaithe amōges condicions whiche emperoure propounded wrytten alſo ſhoulde approue decree ſhoulde made counſell concerning religion whan perceiued coulde induced terroure feare pearill aſſent releaſed ſame condicion neuer moued thing concerning religion whiche certenlye toke ſteade great benefite caſed hereof moſt waighty burthē al condition emperoure pleaſure determined parſon goodes ſuffered eaſelye better wil truſting henceforth ſhoulde permitted kepe religion free ſo muche vrgeth againe commaundeth ſubſcribe heare proteſt yt ſo brought vp youth reading holye ſcripture ſo confyrmed beleue doctrine agree throughly wrytinges prophetes apoſtles neyther conuicted erroure whiche cauſe verelye bothe father certaine prince exhibited time paſt confeſſion ſame doctrine compriſed wrytinge referred lawful counſel conſidering therfore god hathe illuminated knowledge word lawfull forſake truthe knowne vnleſſe woulde purchaſe ſelf euerlaſting dampnation wherfore ſhould nowe admit thys decree foraſmuch ſame dothe manye moſte waightye doth agaiſt coſcience procureth himſelf hell fyre place diſſent holy ſcripture ſhould condempne doctrine ieſu chriſt haue profeſſed hitherto word ſpeach ſhould allowe know naughte wicked thinge el painted gloſynge wordes delude deuine maieſty emperoure alſo thing wickednes committed ſame ſinne againſt holy ghoſt wherof chriſte sinne agaiſt holy goſt hath ſo diligently warned v ſhall neuer time forgeuen ſeinge ſo conſcience tied theſe bondes moſt earneſtly mercy god gaue vnto mankinde oblation ſōne pray beſeche emperoure would take diſpleaſure refuſal reteine doctrine profeſſed auſpurge ſoules health ſetting thinges parte imagine howe miſerable life may made partaker life ioy euerlaſting heare ſay moreouer howe reported emperour diuers though nothing regarded religion ſought vaine glory thing el know beſeche thing coulde happen worlde wiſhed eſpecially thus groſe bodye liberty retourne wife child quiet reſt home take god witnes alſo time ſhall take accompt v doinges reſpected duke godly mind nothinge el throughe true worſhippinge god might enioy inheritance heauenly kingdōe thing hartely deſire emperour would certainly beleue fully perſwaded thinges hath bene alwaies ready gratify euer ſhalbe infidelity promeſſe haue made kepe becommeth iuſte man borne noble parentage furthermore beſeche remit diſpleaſure lengthe deliuer continuall captiuity reported firſt prince ſhould lead life priſoner perſeuered thus conſtant immouable began hādle ſomwhat hardly toke bokes scripture cruelty ſhewed sax priſoner commaunded day forbidden abſtaine fleſhe ſame preacher alſo whome emperours licence kept vntil time whan ſawe preſent daunger hanginge ouer head chaunged apparel conueied ſelf awaye priuely ſame time came abrode emperoures court letter lantzgraue ſaide haue wrytten emperoure thoſe ſaieth hath commaunded wife coū ſelloures ſhould fulfil reaſt condition ſatiſfy ſuch complaine warre paſt againe ſaieth hathe boke wrytten religion albeit manye thinges doth wel vnderſtand cānot affirme ſcriptures yet ſomuch ground thinges antiquitie authoritye holy father make ſelf wiſer doth allow wryting wil deuiſe alſo ſubiectes ſhall obſerue ſame offereth faith ſeruice whether ſhall warre turke biſhop rome forain kinges swiſhes el wil vſe germany beſecheth loue chriſt ſaintes would lay awaye diſpleafure ſet liberty hath bene deteyned priſoner whole yeare ſuffred puniſhmente inoughe brought extreme miſery moreouer aſſuraunce geue two ſonnes pledge vntill fullye ſatiſfied whatſoeuer way ſhall preſcribe ready accompliſhe preuailed nothing theſe praiers oftē time kepers spaniardes remoued frō place place firſt donauerde norling hailbrune whileſt maſſe ſet vp germanye put englande thobſtinat mind wincheſter hale sweuia whileſt emperoure attempteth theſe thinges germany maſſe abrogated englande acte parlaiment longe apprehended stephen biſhop wincheſter contended lawes whiche made kinges noonage none effect commaū ded yere kepe houſe come abrode newlye enlarged whan thoughte haue thaimged opinion made sermon king counſell whan declared minde committed warde emperoure xiiii day iune commaundeth red vnto cleargy fourme reformation call eccleſiaſtical reformatiō emperour contained theſe chapiter following ordeininge office eccleſiaſticall ſtate monaſteries ſcholes hoſpital houſes miniſtration god word miniſtration sacramentes ceremony maſſe ceremony churche diſcipline cleargye laietie pluralitie benefice viſitations saintes excommunication amonges thinges theſe ſetfor chiefly ſuch come take holy order diligentlye examined belief maners learning eſpeciallye hereſies ſpread abrode chiefly time whether beleue ſame catholicke apoſtolicke church rome doth beleue inquiſition manner commaunded made ſ paule preſcribeth thirde chapter firſte epiſtle timothe ſame paule amonges thinges admoniſheth miniſter church ſhoulde huſbande one wife could well gouerne houſe obediēt faithfull child cleane omitted man admitted office biſhop except firſt prieſt promiſe receiue reaſt order ſo ſhortly poſſible biſhops take cure ſhepe fede doctrine ſacramentes alſo viſite ofte church ouerſee miniſters theyr dutye wolues wortye flocke monaſticall life inſtituted againe place left ſcholes nothing taughte excepte agreable catholike church sacramentes ceremony churche miniſtred latin tounge leaſt people vnderſtand ſhould come contempte canon maſſe remaine whole ſpoken ſoftlye intente thoſe tremblable miſteries maye retaine theyr aunciēt dignitye accuſtomed ceremony nothinge aultered trēblable miſteries ye maſſe salte water hearbes paſchall lambe newe frutes alſo temple church chappels chalice aultares coopes ueſtmentes ueſſels belonginge churche hallowed throughe prayer againſte deceites deuill inchantmentes taper ſhall burne churche incenſe ſacrificed moreouer ſupplications made church dedicated sainctes let cleargye liue temperatelye ſobrely eſchue whoredome let put awaye concubine el puniſhed ciuile magiſtrate ſhall aſſiſte byſhoppes reformation made manner diſcipline eccleſiaſticall liberty may wholye mainteined let saintes euerye dioceſſe put vre againe kepte twiſe euerye yeare wherein ſhall inquiſition made euerye mannes manner vice ſuche may otherwiſe reformed excōmunication ſhall excommunicated let al men flee theyr ſpeach companye receiued againe communion humbly deſire forgeueneſſe promeſſe amendment reformation red day ſaide biſhoppes little deliberation confirme ſaye ſhortlye come home kepe saines howe diuers thinges deſire biſhoppe rome maye moued geue aſſente boke alſo put forthe printe ſhewed ambaſſadoures city howe ſignified matter home whereas strauſburge whiche chiefeſt longe euer aunſwered emperoure calleth vppon granuellan xxviii day iune ſendeth ambaſſadoures whereof iames sturmie menes made strauſburge ſhulde receiue thinterim principall henry haſy interpretoure ſaieth howe knowe ſorte ſtates requeſted emperoure put truſte deuiſe ſome meane mighte obſerued till counſell whiche thinge hathe done accordinglye hathe cauſed learned men compile booke al prince fewe excepted chiefeſt city haue approued wheras certaine others intreated themperoure might aduertiſe theyr senate home graū ted hathe loked euer ſence aunſwere hath heard nothinge hitherto ſomewhat offended therefore hathe commaunded knowe theyr meaning whan declared cauſe longe ſcilence exhibite theyr aunſweare letter addreſſed emperoure senate howe wiſhed nothing might gratify thinges theyr citezens perſwaded caſe ſhould throughly admit decre ſhuld bothe hurt owne conſcience alſo oſfēd god moſt greuouſly ſeing wiſedome conſider terrible thing deſire chriſtes ſake ſo waightye matter whiche concerneth landes goodes ſaluation ſoules life euerlaſting would haue ſome conſideration thē hathe done others contrary parte ſo woulde permit alſo mighte vſe religion confeſſed auſpurge vntill decree generall counſel ofte time aſſembles hathe bene determined compell profeſſe otherwiſe mouth theyr heart thincketh wil againe foreſee city nothing done vnreuerently againſt religion euill opinion take place cauſe complaint geuen neighboures whan granuellā heard theſe letter ſaieth emperour hath alwais good opinion citie muche moſte parte haue commended ratified decree made let thincke exempted commaunded admitte ſuche kinde aunſwer therefore supplication vaiue wherefore let aunſwere plainely minde senate hereunto ſaye matter committed emperoure ambaſſadours vnderſtand euermore politike matter religion ſuppoſed alwaies referred counſell partes heard determination might made boke determined manner article religion whithe ſhould admit without due examination learned men part heard ſpeake ſhould longer controuerſy neither neade authority counſell wher diuers prince ſtates haue allowed decree made maruel ſame commoditye thoſe haue al thing permitted ſafe whole haue uyolence vſed religion reaſō truthe fourme religion preſcribed commaunded forſake thoſe opinion haue bene euer controuerſy matter neuer heard notwithſtanding aſſemblies yt whole cauſe hathe bene referred generall counſell certainlye compel man ſhould thing againſt conſcience heauy matter yea though errour detected ſuppoſe ther many good men party yet notwithſtanding may differ opinion iudgement againſt force vſed matter decided reaſon truthe argumentes wherefore conſideringe thinges whiche concerne religion commit vnto emperoure whatſoeuer haue deſire woulde preferre vnto one ſuite senate know howe greate emperoures power daunger take vp caſe attempt try matter force wherefore vnleſſe parſwaded god woulde greuouſlye offended confirmation decree ſtarke madnes ſhould obey herein granuellan whan repeted former ſayinges affirmeth time reconciled emperoure promiſed obſerue ſuch thinges ſhould enacte wealth empire ſort decre made aduiſe learned men moſte parte approued therefore maye refuſed forſo muche agreeth conſenteth churche wyll take ſo much vppon ſhould thincke ſe whole church doeth ſhoulde make departure reaſt ought haue altered religion common conſent whole world wherefore haue none commiſſion let know senate whether wil obey ſay vnderſtode politike gouernement whan cauſe committed emperoure ſkilleth vnderſtode howe moſte part ſtates toke thing againe ſaye howe ſuche like ambaſſadours eſtranged excluded manner conſultation neither called counſell thā time cauſe referred emperoure wherefore otherwiſe take ſayed yea certain prince alſo toke ſame ſort time made peace wyth emperoure toke vpon obſeruaunce feared leaſt ſame ſhould fine applied vnto religion thing vnknowen ſonne biſhop arras alſo emperoures name promiſed whole cauſe religion ſhoulde referred lawfull counſell wher ſaieth decree muſt receiued common act empire refuſe burthen common wealth preſente mā ought cōpelled faith cauſe concerne theyr ſoules health life euerlaſting againe whole burthen decre ſhould reaſt vpon godly people multitude whiche contempne religion careth nothing ordeined man oughte conſtrained imbrace faithe put doubte emperoure loueth peace concorde yet neuertheleſſe waye taken men ſhall compelled againſte conſcience ſpeake muche feared leaſte ſo ſodaine aulteration raiſe vp greate commotion boke dede compiled certen learned men whome ſome knowledge truthe ſame dothe well appeare certaine others haue intermixed many thinges conſonante ſcriptures doctrine father proued place permitted ſpeake haue made ſeparation others chiefeſt article agree true churche wherfore deſire againe letter mighte deliuered emperoure intent might ſo aduertiſe senate thing haue commiſſion ſay began ſpeake angerly vrged decree made digreſſion thinges ſaide howe noble fraunce made theyr boaſte strauſburge would admit decre thinge reported emperoure raiſed ſome ſuſpicion concluſion ſaid emperoure required plaine direct aunſwere man dede inforced vnto faith vnderſtand ſuch chriſtians thoſe denye faithe whiche profeſſed may compelled fire wherevnto ambaſſadoures aunſwere brute frenchman haue raiſed know certaine senate hath yet made decree anye thing el done ſame ſollicite ſeing therefore refuſe deliuer letter emperoure intreat make reporte senate fire may man taken life compelled thereby beleue otherwiſe thus ended theyr talke treated ambaſſadours city ſeuerallye ſort much like menaced threatninges aſſigned day ſhoulde make anſwere commaunded tarye till aunſwere broughte home ſuch thinge preſcribed ambaſſadoures strauſburge touching monye emperoure required leuied chaunces come ſtates thoughe muche againſte willes approued promiſed alſo kinge fernando euery yeare duringe truſe hondreth thouſand crownes deſire emperoure againe woulde take awaye hys garriſons diſcharge souldiours placed ouer germanye much hurt towne country releue pore complained much thereof eſpecially ſince thing quiet peaceable emperoure ſaieth vrgent cauſes wherfore time diſcharge force concerning hurt done emperour wil diſcharg hy • ſouldioures none knowledge ſeing doth paye aagainſte reaſon alſo ſhoulde anye man wronge ſuche lyke thinge hathe bene reported heretofore whan inquiſition made coulde nothinge manner founde neuertheleſſe knowe certaintye man ſhall eſcape vnpuniſhed hathe oughte offended time alſo ſtates graunte emperor maye pleaſure conſtitute iudgemente chamber ioyne vnto iudges aſſiſtaunce ſelues promiſe beare charge ſame treatye begonne concerninge league ſaide winedinge vp emperoures prouinces whiche hathe germanye lowe dutchlande belonge houſe burgundy ſhould vnder tuition defence empire contributaries vnto publicke affaire yet ſo maye vſe owne lawes iuriſdiction germanye ſhall againe looke like aide defence emperoures prouinces ✚ xxi booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles ſyfte ❧ argument xxi booke authoures interim rewarded neuertheleſſe many impugned whereof duke saxon accuſed conſtance ſo vrged admit interim ambuſhes fotemen laied ſurpriſe citie whiche laſte receweth interim strauſboroughe make theyr purgation emperoure commotion chaunſeth bourdeux diſpaire spiera recited conuerſion uergerius scottiſhe quene tranſported fraunce maydenbourge ſetforth praye admirall englande beheaded strauſboroughe contention byſhop wittemberge accuſed adiphoriſtes wit indifferent newters diſputation englande touchinge lordes supper ueruine beheaded fraunce purſute againſt maidenburge death pope paule horrible actes ſame deſcription place election rome maner chuſinge pope maſſe againe strauſborough proclamation fraunce againſt lutheranes pope iulius little cardinall laſt day iune conuention diſſolued xix boke ſhewed howe emperor perſwaded men ſubmit ſelues counſell warrantiſe wold ſe thaction ſhuld lawfull nowe therefore decre made counſel ſhuld continued trēt emperour ſaith deuiſe recommēced ſo ſhortly may thing whā ſhalbe brought paſſe requireth eſpecially clergy religion proteſtants come thither vnder ſaufeconduit wil take order 〈…〉 promes 〈…〉 ſawefull counſel repeted whole matter ſhalbe godly chriſtenly decided determined according holy ſcriptures doctrine father affection laid apart thē ſelues alſo ſhalbe hard ſpeak ſo much ſhalbe thoughte requiſite decree red accuſtomed eſpecially religion ſtrait charge geuē al men obey ſame alſo declared ides may iii author boke named whō ihō iſlebie receiued paine taken liberal reward bothe iſlebi rewarded themperoure emperour alſo king ferdinando michel sidonie afterward made biſhop merſeburge saxony wherof aroſe ieſt defended biſhop rome oyle chreſme holy thing neceſſary ſaluation intent ſelues might therby better greſed auoynted long emperour ſent letter prince abſent eſpecially vnto thoſe thought moſt nede commandeth immediatly obey decre tēth day iuly wryteth eraſmus biſhop strauſburge ſee thinge brought paſſe great trauel put execution wanted conueniēt miniſters take el wher report decree incontinentlye ſpread abrode farre wide uenetians make proclamation xix daye decre uenetians iuly whoſoeuer haue bokes wherin thing wrytten againſt catholicke faith bringe vnto certen men within viii day ſhall inquiſition made ſuche haue deſerued ſhalbe puniſhed promotours promiſe reward kepe counſel biſhop rome hath ambaſſadours continually kinges courtes alſo eies eares many ſe heare muche oftentimes cauſes ſuch decree made yet senate ueniſe vſeth prouiſion ſuffer biſhops inquiſitors wiſdōe uenetians matter religion rome geue ſentence iudgemente ioyne alwaies officer lawyer ſhall heare examination ſe nothing done malitiouſlye cruellye againſt man within iuriſdiction law made yere lord mdxxi time thoſe inquiſitours vſed great cruelty againſt pore men countrye aboute brixia though bene inchauntors medled deuil ſence luther doctrine depely roted ſpred abrode ſame law force ſtil though biſhops gnaſhe tethe wold neuer ſo fain haue aboliſhed time french king ſend aid scotland againſt engliſh men amonges others ringraue force germaines emperoure baniſheth earle bichlinge huberte sebaſtiane scherteline al one wryting ſhortly lawed emperor ringraue counte hedecke recrode riſeberge alſo deſireth foreine prince would maintaine gratify herein biddeth whan occaſion ſhal ſerue loke like hand ladye iane daughter king nauerre affianced maried vii yeres daughter nauarre maried duke uā dome duke cleaue haue ſpecified ioyned mariage duke uandome prince bloud royal elenor french quene ſiſter emperor leauing fraūce goeth flaunders duke de ammalle ſonne duke guyſe whan bene longe ſuter emperoures nece ducheſſe lorayne marieth daughter hercules duke farrare time lewes auila spaniard ſetforth print hiſtory germane warre done emperoure wrytten ſtory lewes auila germains war vulgare tonge ſpeaketh takyng marque alberte rochlice ſayeth ſo intangled wantouneſſe woman coulde proſper ſame booke came forthe afterwardes italian latin frenche althoughe emperoure moſte ſtraightlye commaunded man ſhould wiſe impugne boke ſet forth concerning impugned interim religion yet diuers wrytinges publiſhed whiche condempne whole doctrine thereof warned meune beware eſchewe ſame mooſte preſente peſtilence one theſe caſpar aquila chiefe miniſter church saluelde thuringie thoccaſion wrote iſlebie retourning home auſpurge gloried muche boke way ſaid golden world toward aquila alſo aſſented hearde anſwereth moſte vehementlye reproueth liynge affirmeth boke ful erroneous opinion fraunce alſo robert biſhop abrincen wrote againſt robert abrincē wrote againſt thiuterim contrary ſort chieflye diſpiſeth boke ſo much permitteth prieſtes marrye common people receiue whole supper lord ſo taketh occaſion inuey againſt bucer moſt opprobrious word maryinge ſeconde wife moreouer one romeus generall auſten frier rome wrote againſte ſame purpoſe thus doth boke incurre reprehenſion euerye ſide themperour ſent ambaſſadour norinberge certain others perſwade vnto decre whan came way godly conſtancie duke saxon child duke saxon ſonnes moued hereunto conſtantly denied wherfore returne themperour declareth whole matter wherupon themperour ſolliciteth againe duke theyr father priſoner complaineth ſōnes contemne decre lately made ſuffer men ſpeake againſt theyr preaching wrytinges requireth therfore would treat content ether thing wherunto maketh anſwer howe lately declared cauſe whye hym ſelf could allow doctrin boke ſetforthe granuellan biſhop arras wherfore perſwade hys ſonnes thyng whych hym ſelfe quiet conſcience beſecheth take good part defēd childrē cōſtancie magnanimiti ſo great aduerſity duke saxon beloloued almen got great loue euery wher amōgs al men like saxony breme maidenburge ſo alſo high germanye onlye conſtance borderynge vppon swiſſes yet reconciled themperor laſt obtaining ſaufcōduit ſend ambaſſadors auſpurge treat peace themperor propoundeth cō ſtance wryte emperoure right hard condition amōgs thing alſo ſhuld admit boke ſetforth frame religion thambaſſadors require haue cōditions mitigated vain commaunded make anſwere certen day knowen senate wryting humble letter ye xiii day iuly beſeche yt conſtrained thing againſt ſoules health conſcience ſe theyr owne daunger greate parplexitie vnleſſe obey ſtand pearill loſe life good ſhuld follow appetite muſt abide vengaunce iudgement god wherfore let ſpare put pore wretch ſo great extremity eſpecially ſeinge haue offēded others haue thempire houſe auſtrich ſuffred time paſt exceding great miſery refuſe charge cā ought performed although treaſure ſmal ſubſtance great yet wil geue amendes viii crownes iiii greate peces ordenaunce beſeche permit ſame religion whiche haue kept theſe xx yeres vntil decre lawful coū ſel unpoſe heauier burthen citye hable beare biſhop ihon weſel alſo called archbiſhop londen mentioned xii boke threatned thē ſore auſpurge emperor boke ſetforthe within day died ſame diſeaſe praied might fal vpō yt ſodē palſy ſay haue ſuſtained great domage loue houſe auſtrich thus ſtādeth emperoure maximilian aid sweuical league wherof haue ſpoken fourthe boke made warre maximilian warred againſte swiſſes swiſſes wherfore citye conſtance ſame league lieth nexte receiued much diſpleſure swiſſes aided rhoetia seon sāmaurice whiche lately made felowes alſo frenche kynge lewes xii length interceſſion lewes sfortia duke millan matter pacified aboute yeare oure lord thouſand fiue hundreth maximilian mariage mary blancke ſiſter sfortia themperor third day auguſt calleth conſuls senate auſpurge diuers others ye chiefeſt citezens seldus ciuilian ſpeaking muche good wil zele progenitor haue borne ſaith common welth hath theſe many yeres bene euill ſeditiouſly gouerned cauſe wherof hath bene men none experiēce craft mē nothing le mete thē haue gouernmēt haue bene choſen ſenators wherfore beareth good city thintent euil may remedied diſplaceth al reproche vnto common welthes ſake cōmaundeth name red whō hath apoynted emperour maketh newe senatoures ſenators nōbre welſers relingers būtgarners fuggers pētingers whō bindeth oth aſſigneth vnto euery thē office function cōmandeth thē ſtraitly yt loue cōmon welth obei decre religion vnto obedient doth alſo abrogate al fraternity cōmaundeth vnder pain death yt henceforth ther conuēticles aſſēbles abrogateth fraternity made cōmaundeth yt al wrytings gildes fraternity priuileges fredō immediatly deliuered new senate cōmaundeth ſtate publike weale proclaimed officer armes geueth charge vnder pain death yt man impugne ſame senate geueth thankes promiſeth al due obeiſāce meane yt theſe thing al gate ſhut ſouldiours ſet warde bene lōg ſute many yeres betwene lantzgraue william erle naſſow lordſhip chat length themperor theſe day decided geuing ſentence againſte lantzgraue v day month themperour anſwereth thambaſſadours city conſtance biſhop arras ſendeth away withoute purpoſe becauſe ſeeth ſo little careful peace ſaith wil deuiſe way ſame day spaniardes ſaid went spanyardes go cōſtāce thoſe party nombre thre thouſand fotemen go ſtraite conſtance departing uberlinge parte paſſe woodes intent ſpringe daye time knewe people churche sermone might inuade city part againe remained woodes lokinge oportunity time fortuned iii watchman towne hearing noyſe wode went ſee matter chaunced theyr handes whome spaniardes toke manacing deathe made anye ſigne token leade awaye couche ſelues pece grounde lake ſide verye cloſelye yet eſpied watche men suburbes beyond rhine geue knowledge captaine ſome ambuſh laid immediatly ſignifieth ſame conſul ii clocke midnight conſul calleth senate commaundeth al mē arme ſelues though man knew matter breake day spaniard little little appere yet fewe know nombre watchman ther againe captain watch ſignifieth conſul prouide time whē ther dāger hand wherfore yt matter debated four clocke ſent oute citye aboute two hondreth citezens suburbes come forth found manner nothing begin ſomewhat ſlack beholde whan nowe daye lighte spaniardes theyr ordenaunce beate downe timber walle deuided theyr ditche middes ſame ditch almoſt dry aſſaulte thicke fierſly watchman towne ſtraightway alſo thoſe whiche ſaied remained woodes ſhewed conſtance aſſalted ſelues like caſe great force violence breake open one gate citezens fought moſt valeauntly ſhoting theyr ordenaunce ſlewe captaine alphōſe uiues firſt incountre whan ſcarſely able ſtand force ſo great multitude little little retire bridge ouer rhine foughte longe time hardlye laſte receiued againe city ennemies battered gate ſore diſcharged great piece walles ouer gate ſlue many whome tomble bridge rhine whan ſawe theyr laboure vaine recule back suburbes ſet bridge ende fire ende townes men ſhoulde make ſalt whan fulfilled theyr filthy luſte gather heape dead carcaſes felowes burne ſuburbes together man ſhould vnderſtand many ſlaine townes men killed aboute hondreth whan alarme geuen conſtance manner swiſſes neare neighboures came theyr armure healpe gouernour theyr country time lucerna called back vnder greate penaltye hatred bare religion howe ambaſſadoures strauſburge reaſoned matter granuellan declared retourne home thaſſēble report whole matter senate deliberation senate wryting letter themperor frenche emperor delited frenche tonge moſt deliteth tong ambaſſadours ſay retourning lately frō cōuentiō haue declared vnto v hath ben done ſent v boke wrytten religion lōg deſire moſt puiſſant emperor departed auſpurge haue exhibited highnes ſupplicatiō wryting ſame wold granuellan receiue cauſe wryte vnto preſent firſt certēly deſire nothing letter ſtrauſburg emperoure world thē gratify thing touching decre religion thus ſtādeth calling vnto v deuines city haue peruſed ouer righte diligentlye albeit thing vtterly diſſent frō holy ſcriptures yet much ſo written yt many thing furcher declaratiō required ſhuld hard v troubleſome ſo receiue thē moſt throughly perſwaded doctrine ceremony agreable vnto god word nether cā without god diſpleſure hurt conſcience forſake alter ye ſame duely examined men alſo heard hath bene cuſtome ſince beginning primitiue church ſuch doutful matter cōtrouerſy ſhuld alwaies diſcuſſed lawful coūſels way alſo ſemed euermore beſt al conuentious empire whole matter ſhoulde permitted godlye counſell wherefore beſeche loues bloude chriſte ſhedde v decree thēpire may take place thinge may kepe religion vntil thing determined thautority lawful counſel ther better way foūd profitable eſtabliſh peace lōger indure caſe ſhal refuſe requeſt require v obedience herein deſire moſte earneſtly yt deuines may firſt hard thintent may declare place iudge ye ſame decre ſwarue holy ſcripture thei mai permitted truſt aſſuredly yt ſhal vnderſtād thequity cauſe mitigate ye ſame decre certenly nothing frowardly obſtinatly yt feare god conſideration ſouls helth moueth v thus intreat al thinges ſhal ſo demene ſelues yt may rightwel vnderſtand howe greate eſtimation haue moſt excellent maieſty theſe letter cōmiſſiō lewes grempie ciuilian ſent themperour maketh ſuch like anſwer doth others ſaith none thing determined nether time ſtād queſtiō coūſel ſhalbe hard ſufficiētly wherfore geueth cōmaundement yt within month ſhew plainly mindes way mentioned toke place themperor letter publiſhed doth outlaw conſtance ther began much buſines city remembrance late daunger thexpectation miſery come troubled thē excedingly eſpecially ſith ther appered man helpe ſuccour ther diuers alſo citizen leud talcke heape theſe matter senate therfore cōſtrained oportunity intreateth certaine prince alſo swiſſes letter meanes emperoure swiſſes therfore immediatlye call aſſembles agree thoſe romiſh religion promiſe vnder condicion ſhall receiue decree empire lately made concerning religion admit againe cleargy citye wherefore whan citezens ſore vrge senate doth publiſh ſame decre go voyces preuailed ſaid receiued cried oute vtterlye vndone caſe ſhuld longer remain ſtate themperors power exceading great almoſte infinite neuer hable reſiſte whan ordinaunce made people senate aduertiſeth swiſſes done ſende ambaſſadours emperoure fele minde whether coulde conte ſuffer interceſſion alſo intreate vſe mercye emperoure made ſuche aunſwere mighte eaſelye perceiue liked ſute ſaide maruailed greatly would thing ſuche outlawed wherefore many within city miſliked alteration religion got vnto place amonges whiche ambroſe blaurer chiefeſt miniſter church ther lindauians whiche dwell ouer againſte conſtance ambroſe blaurer ſide lake aunſwered emperour righte ſtoutly afraid example theyr neighbour receiue decree alſo whan ambaſſadoure strauſburge retourned home auſpurge informed senate themperors commaundement ther called great court terme neuer wont done matter great difficulty moſt waighty importaunce numbre iii c xx euery tribe whan gaue ſuffrages yt moſt part thought mete ſtand ſtoutly receiue decre day conſult theyr voice ſomewhat abated permitted certen choſen senatours strauſburge cōſult interim ſhuld deuiſe beſt way common welth horſmē naples far city ſaid wher themperor ſame time departed frō auſpurge thought verely yt wold haue come strauſburge terror many men yt chanced lately conſtance wherefore many gentleman marchauntes diuers others fearinge loſe ſubſtance loth diſpleaſe themperor whē ye senate houſe renoūced fredome citie wēt dwell el without reprehenſion many emperour remouing auſpurge leauing garriſon alteration religion ſtate cōmon wealth marched reſt force ulme whan come thither diſplaceth senatours ordeyneth new cō maundeth miniſters churche priſon amongeſt whiche martin frecht refuſed decree religion senate wholy addicted themperour receiueth decree conuentiō auſpurg requeſt granuellan deſired frecht repare auſpurg helpe forwarde cauſe religion either plugius sidonie iſlebie ſuſpected ye matter mā city ther vocatiō refuſed cōmaūded declare minde thought decre made cōpriſed theſame writing whē themperour come ulme ye senate calleth thother miniſters ye churche aſketh theyr opinion anſwer ſhewe thing decree conſtā cie miniſters like miſlike demaunded preacher auſpurge haue receiued ſame othe yet neuertheleſſe preache goſpell likewyſe ſaye neither knowe haue done neither part render accompt mēs doinges verely firſt tyme admitted vocation promyſe fidelitie preache doctrine goſpell purely ſyncerely without tradition men senate nowe miſlyke waye requyre releaſe thē othe commaū ded go home none called againe certen choſen men senate ſay vnto emperour day doeth arreſte priſoners ſhal forthwith caried pallace god ſtrengthē ſpirite muche pleaſeth god ſo ſaye wyll refuſe peryll pray agayne thus departing senate houſe led sergeauntes courte thynkyng ſhould haue come emperour long expectation great reſort people thei caried senatours houſe called george beſſer granuellan byſhop arras lodged laſt beyng let long debate whan granuellan inſtaunte obey ye emperours decree declared myght ſo doe thei taken vp wt ſharp rebuke reſidue cō maūded go litle aſide thā thei aſſay frecht wt gētle perſeuered ſtill opinion treate alſo reſt ſeuerally whiche foure remained conſtāt two reuolted granuellan byſhop arras alſo paſius seldus immediatly thei fettered chaines caried cōmon geale spaniardes germaine ſoldiours ouer whome iohn erle naſſow captain paſſed freight houſe brother george chaū ced loke wyndowe deſired loke freight caried pryſō others well wife familie praieth god ſtrengthē fellowes biddeth good cōforte ſaying alſo caried priſon xvi daye auguſt thus deteined four day fift day whā thē perour went thence faſt bonde chaynes caried carte kirchene garded wt cc spaniardes whan remained ſpace eight day vnder alteſtege captaine germaines cōmitted ye cuſtody madronio captayne spaniardes ulme came thēperour spire thend moneth auguſt whileſt came one frō straſburg fetche away yt xii great piece promyſed geue yt yeare day kalendes septēber byſhop rome requeſt thēperour ſendeth germany thre byſhops fane uerone ferento cōmiſſiō ſhalbe declared place themperour making long abode spire whan came mentz went ryuer rhine lowe ducheland leadeth away captiue duke saxon lātgraue lately brought thither frō hale sueuia whā wife eftſones ben hū ble duke saxon lātgraue led away pryſoners ſuter hym put ſuerall boates ryuer rhine towne lantgraues called sanguner caſtell ſet vpon toppe ſtepe hyl whan emperour came hither benighted rode ancker ſetting lande watchemen commaundeth al reſte remaine within borde senathe straſburge commaunded ſayd aunſwere within moneth whan themperour therfore come spire ambaſſadours ſent vnto ſecond day september iames sturmius matthew giger lewys grempe finding spire followed vnto mentz time thei geuē knowledge thēperour cōming ye germain coūſellours way ſerued thēpe thoſe affaire thei byd follow collō yt mean time yt biſhop straſburg ſēding letter yt clergie wtin citie yt september willeth obey decree thempyre ordeyne thyng fourme preſcribed al ſendeth themperours letter touching ſame matter ſayde writtē tenth day iuly moreouer writeth senate alſo would impeche thambaſſadours straſburg thei come collon ye viii day september exhibite themperour senate epiſtle wrytten frenche importaunce al letter straſburgh themp moſte triumphant emperour time recōciled vnto made promiſe obſerue ſuch thing ſhuld decreed albeit neuer aſſented cauſe religion ſhould handled wyſe yet al thinges yt poſſible may ready gratifie maieſtie ciuile alſo diuine matter perceiue wel enough highnes reſt prince haue conſideration doinges reaſon ſhuld folow foteſteppes yet notwithſtanding beſeche eftſones conſider ſo muche euery mā muſt render vnto god accōpt haue iuſt cauſe careful ſaluation forſee yt nothing tyme againſt conſcience cauſe alſo good hope heard diuines would haue mitigated decree conſidering referre v counſel ſay matter ſhall debated according vnto holy ſcripture thus contented leaſt ſhuld ſeme contentious obſtinate refuſe byſhop straſburge recitueth yt interim citie may ſet forth order certen church wt v men facultie ſhal deuiſe hym church neither wil diſturbe thing neither bid citezens repare thither yt may fre euery man followe ſuche religion ſhal thinke good hym ſelf yet vnder condicion yt may haue church ye god worde may purely taught ſacramēts miniſtred decēt ye vulgare tongue wil prouide alſo yt people ſhalbe kept order nothing otherwiſe done ſemely againe ſhal cōmaund yt holy day faſting day kept wil ſuffer nothing done either ſermōs place yt may offēce vnto others ſo much doctrine hath theſe many yeares ben ſo depely roted men mindes without yt hurt cōſcience taken away ſo ſodenly againe ſo much meane haue ſhewed highnes decre may take place amōgſt v beſech ye hartieſt maner yt graunt requeſtes ſuffer v religiō vntil tyme counſel ſhalbe moſt thākeful duty vnto god make chiefly yt peace citie whole prouince themperour heard letter beſides ſuch thinges iames sturmius great eloquence declared large made anſwer seldie ſpeaking many thinges zeale towards germany long debating yt length ſendeth thē away ſorte ſhould go biſhop yet vpon condition agre ſhould ſtande arbitrement whan themperour come brabant pleaſure haue duke saxon lantgraue ſent audenarde towne flaūders border brabāt diſchargeth thoſe force brought auſpurg haue ſpoken iudgemēt chāber imperial ſtates permitted themperour yt ſhuld eſtabliſh ſame firſt day therfore october reformatiō chamber enacted renewed thre aduocates diſplaced ſuſpicion lutheraniſme al reſt amongeſt thinges cōmaūded ſhuld perſeuer ye doctrine ye catholike church el remoued frō place began henry duke brūſwicke cōmence ſuite againſt proteſtātes ye former war time expulſed dede conditioned whā deliuered priſon othe alſo yt would attempt nothing went conuenaunt alſo tharchbyſhop mentz maiſter pruſſia erle naſſow reuart counte solmen others moued ſuit againſt yt lātgraue mē cōſtānce lately outlawed wher great perplexitie ſawe way ſaue thē ſelues flee cō ſtance geue thēſelues howſe auſtrich vnto yt laſt refuge geue thē ſelues houſe auſtriche euer wherupon kyng ferdinando receiueth tuition ſendeth thither immediatly noble man gouernour middes october propoūdeth vnto theſe condition ſhall acknowledge ferdinando child heyres lordes hence forth ſhewe vnto al faith dew obedience ſhall reuolte tyme neyther make league confederacie suche lawes ſtatutes ferdinando deputes ſhall make concerning religion matter ſhal throwly obeye warre affaire thei ſhall ready tymes ayde ſerue kyng ferdinando child heyres obediently reſt ſubiectes ſame condition afterwarde receiue othe two day gouernour calleth senate demaūdeth ſomme cōmon treaſure gunnes al fourniture brought accompt cōmaundeth alſo townes man weare longe ſworde man preſume come fortification watche name whiche ye war admonyſhed citie daunger reuealed inuentory goodes taken whiche abſent flit thence ſame deteined delyuer vp publique writinges ſome man expert therin declare whereunto euery aperteineth cō maundeth miniſters churche depart citie within eight day moneth auguſtus brother vnto maurice duke saxony taketh wyfe lady anne auguſtus maried wyfe daughter chriſtian king dēmarke cōuenaūts mariage condicioned duke maurice ſhould aſſigne portion lādes iohn fridericke owne inheritaunce ſame time great cō motion guienne ſaltpits cuſtomes
