head citie countrie burdewx great towne much welth lieth open sea time paſt vnder dominion englād alſo chiefly rebelled ſlaine ye king cōmotion burdeux lieftenaunt wherfore whan ſo ſhrewed example ſhewed thing tended daunger french king ſent thither coneſtable fraunce duke danmal power xxxi enſeignes fotemē wherof xi almaignes force horſemen thing knowen burdeux make meanes ye coneſtable ſay yt cōtented ſhal enter frenchmē armed beſeche ſuffer germanes come within citie made anſwer yt thei ſhuld preſcribe germains ſerue king aſwell reſt therfore wil doe herein ſhall thinke good albeit ſet open gate citie yet hath keyes wherwith vnlock yt ſame wherfore thus entred xix day october whā placed men due order alſo planted ordenaunce place conuenient firſt cōmaundeth citezēs bring forth al armure weapon ſame caried caſtel ſo ſpent two day third daye began make inquiſitiō houſe houſe great nōber ſlaughter burdeux ſedicious perſones apprehēded came horrible ſlaughter wer executed wt one kind death alſo brought forth xiiii gentlemē haulters neckes wherof one two executed almaine captaines made interceſſion reſt begged pardon conſtable ſoroufull bluddy ſpectacle laſted xii day beſides thoſe put death tyme many alſo condempned galees moreouer wrytinges wherin fredomes priuileges cōmon wealth conteined burnt themſelues making fyre becauſe murthered kynges lieftenaunt conſtable driueth ſcrape vp earth wherwith couered buried without toole euen nayles finger whan thus ſcraped ye dead coarſe graue ſame buried againe great ſolemne pompe freers prieſtes citezens folowe nomber fiue thouſande euery man candell hande came coneſtables lodging bere ſet downe ſtayed betwene time doe fall downe vpon knee lamentable crie beſeche mercie deteſte owne offence geue thankes vnto kyng hath punyſhed ſame extremely whan theſe thinges finiſhed ix daye nouember departe thence leauing behinde garniſon tyme chaunced maruelous thing italy beſydes padwey towne belonging ſtate ueniſe called citadella herein dwelte citezen named fraū ce spiera experte man lawe great pleader fraunces spier lawier cauſes wonderfull feruent zeale began imbrace doctrine goſpel whan profited therin dayly declared home amonges frendes thought euery article alſo abroad amonges men whereſoeuer came thnig could long hidde length reported boſhop rome legate whiche ueniſe iohn caſe archbyſhop beneuento whan spier vnderſtode perceyued eaſely daunger ſtode whan therfore taken long deliberation cōſulted euery way beſt done laſt reſolued ſent goe ſpeake legate wherfore going ueniſe confeſſing errour thought el ſaid feare craueth pardon promiſeth obebience henceforth legate although glad voluntary cōfeſſion yet example others commaundeth retourning home openly ſuche thinges hath ſpoken cōtent albeit began euen repent yet recantation inſtigation frendes affirming ye whole hope alſo wyfe child ſubſtaunce conſiſted herein obeye ſhortly fell ſickenes body minde began diſpayre god mercy therfore aduiſe frendes caried citadella padwey might haue ready hand helpe good phiſitions cōfort learned men phiſitions iohn paulus craſſus bellacata friſimelega ſone ſawe iudged diſaſe come vehement thought better remedy cōſolation mynd wherfore many learned men reſorted daily teſtimonies holy ſcripture whiche declare vnto v great mercy god endeuoured cure mynde ſayd could dede denye theſe thynges howbeit concerned nothing muche abiured truthe knowen feare perill affirmed appointed euerlaſting tourmentes minde felte ſawe already neither could loue god hate exceadingly perſeuered neither would nowe eate meate spier wold receiue comforte whan crommed violence oftentymes would ſpitte againe long recite thinges whiche eyther ſelfe ſpake men alledged holy ſcriptures bryng deſperatiō tyme therfore counſelles ſpent vaine infirmitie body alſo anguyſh mynde increaſed daily caried home againe dieth diſpaire died miſerably ſame ſtate deſperatiō lay ſicke padwey came often comfort hym amongeſt many others peter paule uerger byſhop inſtinople whiche hiſtria towne vnder dominion ſtate ueniſe hath bene declared fourmer bokes howe byſhoppes rome clement paule haue vſed ſeruice uergerius germany certes hygh fauour king ferdinando whileſt hongary ſo much whan daughter catharine borne uergerius george marque brandenburge iohn archebyſhop lunden godfather founteſtone reuolted byſhop rome wonderfull occaſion wōderfull conuerſiō uergerius whan ſent rome conference wormez whiche beginning yeare ccccc xli ſaid byſhop going make newe cardinalles appointed alſo amongeſt others ſome priuely whiſpered eare yt muche familiaritie germains become lutherane uergerius heard cardinall ginucius vnto whome byſhop tolde maruelouſly aſtonied intent myght pourge hym ſelfe goeth home countrey begynneth boke whiche intituled againſt apoſtatas germany whyleſt confute argumentes tourneth ouer diligently bookes aduerſaries pondering depely reaſons feleth hym ſelfe taken vanquiſhed caſting away hope cardinalſhyp goeth brother iohn baptiſt uergerius vanquiſſhed force truth byſhop citie pole reciting whole matter aſketh counſell brother afrayde ye beginning lamenteth caſe much perſwaded hym applie hym ſelfe ſearching scripture conſidered diligently article iuſtification comparinge ſentences together geueth place iudgeth biſhop rome doctrine falſe wherupon reioyſed one duty byſhops began inſtruct people iſtria preache diligently benefite chriſte imployde vpon mankynde declare workes god requireth v intent myght call men againe true religion ſprang vp many aduerſaries eſpecially freers ſuche called obſeruauntes reported thing inquiſitours chief wherof anniball gryſon ioyned commiſſiō hierome mutius inquiſitours agaiſt uergerus whiche wrote inuectiue againſt uergerius ſet forth boke alſo wherin hatred religion diffameth germany moſte ſclaunderous rayling wordes whan griſon come pole iuſtinople ruſheth men houſes ſearched bokes prohibited whan ſpokē many thynges sermon curſed thoſe wold preſente ſuch ſuſpected lutheraniſme yet promyſed leſſe puniſhment vnto ſuche would come amendement owne fre wyll aſke hym pardon thoſe would wyllyngly cōfeſſe crime accuſed others ſayde would auenged fyre entringe euery houſe feared men wherfore founde diuerſe accuſed ſelues feare refuſed nothyng nomber rycher ſorte pryuely poorer openly conſtrayned confeſſe errour suche confeſſed red newe teſtament vulgare tongue diſſwaded moſte earneſtly abſtayne hereafter common multitude whoſe myndes ſtryken feare accuſed one full buſely without reſpect eyther kynred frendſhyp benefites ſonne ſpared father wyfe huſbande cliente lorde patrone complaintes moſte parte triflyng matter ſuche one reprehended ſuperſtitiō hereunto added preachinges againſt doctrine uergerius certen daie whan great audience people aſſembled head churche iuſtinople inquiſitour griſon whiche ſayed maſſe pourpoſly getteth vp pulpet rych veſtiment amongs thing intent might thruſt ſting time ſaith theſe certen yeares paſt haue many ſtormes much vnſeaſonable weather deſtroyeth one whyle oliues otherwhyle corne nowe marreth uines eftſones cattell good cauſe theſe euilles commeth byſhop ſort heretikes neuer loke better vnleſſe firſt reſtrayned therfore next way ſet vpon ſtone violence uergerius conſtreined uergerius repareth mantua repaire mantua vnto cardinall hercules gunſage whome familiarly acquainted bothe diuerſe rome alſo iohn caſe ye byſhops legate uenetians admonyſhed cardinall letter meſſengers ſhould longer mainteine ſuche man goeth trent coūſel holden ſame time make pourgation whan byſhop rome knewe therof albeit rather haue hym deteyned priſoner yet leaſt ſuſpicion ſhould aryſe namely germany though counſell free wryteth agayne legate permitte hym haue place ſeſſion commaunde hym departe thence ſorte repulſed wēt ueniſe isputont yt counſell biſhops legate named exhorteth al meanes would go rome whiche vnderſtode daū ger refuſed fewe day cōmaunded byſhops name retourne iuſtinople therfore went padwey whyleſt behelde miſerable example rehearſed wherewith wehemently moued whan ſene preſently wrath god wherwith wretched man ſtryken began confirmed determined plainly forſake contrie euer go volū tary exile rather place might frely profeſſe chriſte whiche within fewe monethes taking iourney countrey bergome came rhetia bordering vpont ſame whan preached goſpel alſo vale tely ioyneth uergerius preacheth yt goſpell rhetia next vnto italy certen yeares chriſtopher duke wirtemberge ſent hym cubinga departed italy byſhop polle brother dead ſuſpected poyſoned moreouer many notable mē beſides uergerius ſawe spiera ſame ſtate amongeſt others matthewe gribalde ciuilian padwey compry ſing wryting whole matter whiche preſently ſaw heard ſet forth printe uergerius alſo sigiſmunde gelowe polonian henry scotte archbyſhop beneuento mentioned compyled booke abhominable filthynes archebyſhop buggery ſo filthy nothyng deuiſed nothing aſhamed extolle prayſe moſte deteſtable vice others yet commonly vſed grece italy meane tyme archebyſhoppes germany eſpecially mentz collon treuers euery man owne dioceſe holde conuocations thintent refourme church order preſcribed emperour promiſed prouince collon bucer taught xv boke ſpecified diuerſe miniſters churche maried wyues although emperours decree permitte mariage prieſtes tyl counſell ſhould determine ſame yet ſayed biſhop collon appertained lutherians ſuche folowed churche rome wherfore decree made diſanulleth matrimony contracted declareth maried prieſtes pluct frō wyues inceſtuouſe commaundeth child gotten ſuche baſtardes archebyſhop treuers hath ſmall prouince conteining thre byſhoprykes metz tully uerdon neded ſuche lawe prieſtes theſe place rather haue cōcubines thā wyues archebyſhopryke ſelfe appered daunger decreed fellowes iuriſdiction mentz moſte large vnder hym xii byſhops almoſt heſſe alſo win prouince therfore began inſtaunt vrge obey ye emperours decree like wyſe archebyſhop treuers alſo ſome iuriſdictiō lantgraues ſonnes ruler counſellours heard theſe thinges deafe eares archbyſhop mentz ſent alſo frāckfurth ſuffragan michel sidonie firſt hallowyng church preacheth teacheth maner byſhop auſpurge compelled certen prieſtes conſtante abiure religiō doctrine ſpake frenchman ſommer went ayde scottes laſt bryng away fraunce mary yonge quene daughter heire kyng dead beyng thā ſyx yeares age might inheritour scotland led fraunce thus take away englyſhemen hope optaynyng yeare yt byſhop rome created charles uandome frencheman cardinal maximilian auſtrich arryued spayne maried lady mary themperours daughter phylippe emperours ſonne younge prince xxi yeares age ſent father prepareth ſelfe take iourney leauing behinde hym coſin germane ſame brother lawe gouerne empe ſonne commeth flaunders common wealth abſence whan imbarked ſet vp ſayle xxv daye nouember arriueth gene fiftie galeis many ſhyppes burthen conduite androwe daurie tranſported maximilian accompanied great nomber noble amongeſt others duke alba cardinall trente fewe dayes arriuall remaineth wout walles houſe androwe daurie admirall meane tyme yt shippes vnlading preparation made citie ſecond daye december entred receiued moſte ſumptuouſly furnyſhed aſwell money thinges mete requiſite trauell lande departeth thence eight daye paſſing alexandria pauie goeth millan pauie great battering peces emperour taken iohn fridericke duke saxon ſent thither ſayde millan arriued xix daye december ſet vp euery place triumphant arkes pageōs image honorable poſies written entring ready receiue receyued millā duke sauoye ambaſſadours ueniſe florence ferrare seine tyme bruiſſelles died maximilian erle bure diſeaſe throte called quinancie whan phiſition tolde hym ſaye houre death ſone ſawe whoſe name andrew weſſel ſhewed duke manrice decree religiō red departed auſpurg whan come home aſſembleth nobilitie ſtates propoundeth whole matter miſene declaring vnto emperours mynde vrge emperours promeſſe alſo requyre inſtauntly may ſuffered kepe ſtyll religion profeſſed auſpurge agreed diuines wittemberge lipſia ſhould called counſell wherfore met firſt begge celle laſt iuterbock thither came alſo iohn iſlebie ſent frō marque brā denburg decre made thinges indifferent ſuche meting diuines saxony called adiaphora laſt conuention lipſia fourme religion written whiche men ſhould obſerue vnder dominion duke maurice boke afterwardes bred much contention ſhalbe declared place meane tyme emperours ſonne procedeth iourney paſſing mantua trent cōmeth auſpurge ſo spire paſſeth lād 1549 luke emperour father accompanied amongeſt others cardinall trent emperour ſente mete hym germany goodly nomber horſemen conduite duke areſcot duke maurice goyng forth mete farre trent rode forth ſmall cōpany ſee mantua ueniſe moſte honorably interteyned senate intreated diligētly prince spain would meane emperour lantgraue father lawe whiche alſo ſignified vnto muche promyſed right gently byddeth hym good comfort yet neuertheleſſe admonyſhynge hym diſſemble matter acknowen therof tyme muche trouble partes barbarie affrica one zeriphius ſay arriſing ſmal beginning ciuile warres affrica atteyning kingdome erpulſed feſanus kyng hym realme came emperour auſpurge complayning miſfortune deſyryng ayde nicolas byſhop metz ſon anthony duke lorayne tutour duke nephew ſhewed xvi boke forſaking eccleſiaſticall order maried one houſe eckmount whiche inheritour brabant biſhoprike returned cardinal loraine ſorte ambaſſadours straſburge treated emperour collon declared whan retourned home ſhortly began conferte byſhop callyng hym nobilitie ſheweth emperours pleaſure haue done commaundeth obey chargeth alſo ſtraightly clergie straſburg followe ſame propounded ouer harde thinges senate xii daye february ſending henry cope ambaſſadour letter emperour ſaie howe haue treated diligently biſhop straſburgs wryteth letter emperour propoundeth ſuche condition ſhould admit retayne thoſe thinges whiche decree lately made auſpurge doeth permitte graunt muche debating haue ſayeth declared vnto ſhall geue commaundement citezens ſhall obſerue holy dayes abſteyne certen dayes fleſhe moreouer haue bene hande miniſters church certen thē ſuppoſe wil owne accorde leaue office preaching wherfore ſhalbe lawfull free hym v eſtablyſhe religion according order preſcribed auſpurge ſhalbe let vnto wil alſo commaunde citezens doe nothing contrary ſeing thus beſeche moſte victorious emperour would permitte v miniſters churche euē ſuch maried amongeſt v put v extremitie eſpecially conſidering wyll ſhewe moderation geue none occaſion offence ſhewed magdenburg emperour outlawed refuſed decree religion lately publiſhed diſpleaſure augmented vpon emperour ſetteth forth againſt new proclamation maketh praye vnto men earneſtly thei maidenburg made pray god line admoniſheth prince ſtates neighbour make warre againſt annoye meanes poſſible hath bene tolde howe emperour cauſed ye preacher ulme apprehēded thei length ſeuenth moneth enlarged third day marche ſet libertie whā payd charge time yt ſtate england waxed troubleſome edwarde trouble england duke somerſet yt king vncle protectour realme brother lord admiral cōceiued ſuſpiciō leaſt cōtent ſo perſwaded though aſpire yt crown wold bring yt king vnder cuſtody admi england b headed wherfore cōmaūdeth apprehēded examination condēned die yt xx day marche maried quene catherine laſte wyfe kyng henry eight ſame alſo increaſed ſuſpicion muche emulation enuie woman thought haue bene greateſt occaſion miſauenture biſhop straſburge agayne warneth clergie obeye emperours decree churche ſainct thomas annual reuenewes wherof cōſent senate imployed vpon preacher learned men whiche teache bryng vp yougth thē traueled chiefly deſired know tyme would obeye emperours decree ſatiſfie expectation moreouer mete men purpoſe ornamentes churche yet remaining thei take time deliberation thomas cranmer archebyſhop canturbury primate englande thomas cranmer furtherer learning godlines man excellent learning wholy geuē good learnyng auaunce godly religiō ſeing ſtate germany daunger learned men ſollicited ſondry letter bucher chiefly paulus fagius moſte expert hebrew tongue come england promiſing loue frendſhip wherfore conſent senate firſt aprill take iurney might ſowe ſede pure doctrine comming moſte acceptable yt kyng ſelf bucer fagius cominto englād maner whole nobilitie people tyme ſtaied whyle lorde canturbury ſent vnto cambridge reader firſt day aprill philippe auſtriche entreth bruſſels wonderfull pompe father tyme ambaſſadours duke maurice electours brandenburg ſent ſollicite ſuite vnto prynce philippe cardinall trent great frende duke maurice albeit put lantgraue audenarde good hope yet nothynge brought paſſe lyttle whyle whan lātgraue ſickely would haue eaten fleſhe certen daye forbidden captaine garded hym commyng way turneth vp diſhe botome caſteth meat ground ſame tyme byſhop straſburge eight byſhop straſb ſingeth firſt maſſe yeare leaſt taketh holy order thei terme ſaith maſſe calleth conuocation clergie taberne maketh decree commodious theyr pourpoſe thys ſendeth meſſengers senate straſburge requiring reedifie aultars geue libertie appointe myniſters churche woulde releaſe clergie othe reſtoore priuileges rendre agayn ornamentes church commaundeth thomiſtes aunſwer directly whether wyll obeye emperours decree ſpeaking firſt reuerence beare emperour duty vocation large declare vnto hym euery man teacheth doeth wytte diuines phyloſophers logician rhetorician ſuche lyke whiche al profitable scole youth alſo neceſſary ſhewe admitted college conſente senate long declaration deſyre hym lowely louingly woulde diſturbe order ſo well eſtablyſhed wyll occupied thinges leſſe nedefull contrarywyſe ambaſſadours alledge howe college founded ſuche exerciſes scolars neyther ought olde order chaunged amongeſt whiche finde themſelues greued obeye good conſcience byſhop ſurely wyl perſwade thyng againſt wylles ſhalbe lawfull geue place common ſaying let either drynke departe caſe senate wyl haue profeſſours artes learning within citie reaſon fynde ſame beare charge abbey landes aunciently appointed vſe common treaſure byſhop predeceſſour haue nowe bene many yeares impeched iuriſdictiō may longer ſuffered thus whan much contended wordes departed without thynge concluded senate whan knew therof make interceſſion byſhop moſte gentle letter deſyre praye hym would leaſt haue ſome conſideration yought taketh great profit rypenes wyt ſame schole thus matter letter meſſengers ſent betwyxt long muche debated tyll laſte taken vp arbitrement heafter ſhalbe ſayde biſhop whiche euer accompted mylde quiet nature thought haue done ſo muche owne accorde inſtigation others hym whiche affirmed occaſion recoueryng iuriſdictiō neglected ſayd moreouer vnleſſe earneſt yt matter might feare thēperours diſplea vſed chief doer theſe caſes chriſtofer welſinger ciuilian ſometime ſtudent vniuerſitie wittemberge againe clergie head church straſburg aduocate iohn tiſchel doctour yt ciuile lawe laſt boke mention made wuolfgange prince bipounte decre religiō enacted duke swaybrig moleſted religion ſent auſpurg whome emperour preſſed ſō dry letter ſhould obeye decree ſo muche referred matter byſhoppes emperour demaundeth hym whether wyll ratifie decree whether wyll diſplace miniſters churche wil obeye ſame wherupon writing letter themperour frenche repeteth fewe wordes done ſomer auſpurg ſaieth howe retourne home ſet forth vnto people part decree concerned holy day faſting day cōmaunding ſame obſerued howe hath alſo red ouer diligently oftener decree religiō graunteth therin many thinges conſonant faith loketh eternal ſaluation ther many thing alſo differ much ſame neuertheleſſe hath charged preacher miniſters churche way euery thing diligently declare vnto ſuppoſe thing may inſtituted al one voice affirme allowe ſame al thinges quiet conſcience thought part compell worke againſt conſcience wherfore required byſhops yt ſelues wold take ſome order thing haue aunſwered hath certified heretofore good hope nothing ſhuld required ſaith much wil haue direct anſwer moſt mightie emperour wyl ſay myne opiniō firſt playne trouth concerning religiō rite ceremony haue bene certen yeres obſerued within dominiō verely borne brought vp fame haue alſo ſhewed ceſar euē vntil day neuer heard kind doctrine moreouer haue beſtowed ſtudy paine therin ſo farre forth wyt able cōceaue appereth plainly agreable vnto god worde muſt nedes confeſſe ſeing aſked queſtion leaſt ſhould hurt myne cō ſcience litle regarde ſaluatiō cōſideratiō alſo approue y• decre otherwiſe moſt willing ready yt maner exāple mine aunceſtours thing howebeit highnes whiche ſupreme magiſtrate maye determine herein ſhall ſeme good vnto wholy pleaſure beſeche conſtrayned doe againſt myne owne iudgement yet people vnder dominion touching miniſters churche deſyred laſt letter might tary licence chriſtening chyldren viſityng ſicke chiefly tyll others ſubſtitute place notwithſtanding ſhall commaunde departe immediatly abydyng tyll others come albeit theſame ſhalbe great grief hynderaunce people yet ſhal done accordingly many gone already thoſe thinges may ought perfourmed know loialtie obeyſaunce muſt ſhewed time dominion duke maurice great apparence inter confuted lubeck others religion ſhould altered miniſters preacher lubeck luneburge hamburge compiled boke wherin confuted full booke decree auſpurge wherof chief authour iohn epine moreouer doctours maydenburg nicolas amſtorfe eſpecially matthie flacie borne citie albone slauonie nicolas ganles bende ſelues earneſtly againſt diuines wittemberge lipſia many little bookes ſet forth reprehende though ſhould deale diſſemblyngly ſhoulde indifferent meane thynges ſet open waye romiſh religion finally adiaphora place generall rule rite ceremony al though owne nature indifferent longer meane thynges whan force opinion holines neceſſitie byndeth men whan occaſion wickednes therby geuen flacie bene certen yeares phillippe melanchthon ſchollar contentiō went magdēburg ſetting forth boke afterwarde wherin declareth cauſe ſo furthermore hamburge addreſſinge letter wittemberge eſpecially melanchthon doe recite call indifferent meane thynges declare caſes ought admitted deſyryng alſo wryte thynge would haue compryſed vnder name intente men maye haue ſome certen thynge followe wauer theyr myndes leaſt name indifferent thynges geue occaſion ſondrye errours whiche may crepe lyttle lyttle unto ye epiſtle melanchthō maketh anſwer amōgſt thinges ſayeth ſome bōdage borne withall ſo annexed wickednes archebyſhop mentz melanchton defendeth yt adiaphoriſt beginning may holdeth counſell prouinciall decree wherof ſetteth forth boke afterward lykewyſe archebyſhoppes treuers collon hath alſo large prouince booke amonges thynges eſtablyſheth confeſſion mā admitted lordes ſupper vnleſſe firſt confeſſed hallowyng salt water thynges exorciſmes praiers prepared ſay vſe faithful men reliques inuocation adoration saincts pilgrimage prayer dead pourgatory faſting choyſe meates canonical houres terme tremblable miſteries maſſe unto synode came maurice byſhop eiſtet reſidue ſente ambaſſadours ordynaunce hallowyng conſecratyng aparteineth many matter euery ſeuenth daye whiche called sonday whan many people churche prieſt exorciſeth terme firſt salte water whan hath mixed ſalte water together force holy water ſprincleth people withall ſprinklyng thought geue health body ſoule dryue awaye diſceiptes deuyll clenſe men alſo thing without lyfe caſt vpon grounde vpon ſtones throwen dead men graues prieſt praieth god geue vertue ſtrength ſame ſorte alſo ſalte handled chriſtening chyldren whan conſecrate prieſt putteth chyldes mouth cō maundeth deuil come thriſe ducketh infant water oyle wherin dippeth thombe annointeth breſt ſhoulders childe woman alſo childebed whā come churched firſt entring churche dore purified water finally ſerueth many vſes chiefly whan haue ſpirites nyght practiſe coniuryng hallowe certen prayer whatſoeuer apperteyneth apparell prieſtes moreouer water fountſtone taper candels palmes paſchall lambe terme made waxe egges fleſhe cheſe bakō flowres herbes fruictes tree vpon theſe thynges caſt forſayd water churche muſt buylded byſhop ſuffragan layeth firſt ſtone foundation hallowyng church throweth ſalt water edified goeth thriſe firſt ſprinkleth vpper walles middle loweſt croſiers ſtaffe maketh ſigne croſſe vpon higheſt walles deuill approche entring churche whan certen ſonges ended prieſt ſtroweth aſhes ſimilitude croſſe done biſhop ſtaffe wryteth greke letter aſhes left ſyde croſſe latin letter ryght afterwarde caſteth water mixed ſalte wyne aſhes wherwith ſprincleth churche agayne exhorteth people bountefulnes liberalitie lyke ſorte belle vſed firſt forſouth muſt hange ſo byſhop may goe round hallowyng belle whiche hath ſayde certen pſalmes conſecrateth water ſalte mingleth together wherwith waſheth belle diligētly within without wypeth drie holy oyle draweth ſigne croſſe prayeth god whan ſhall rynge ſounde bell diſceiptes deuyll may vanyſhe away hayle thōdryng lightening wyndes tempeſtes vntemperate weather may aſwaged whan hath wipte croſſe oyle wyth linen cloth maketh ſeuē croſſes ſame within one ſaying certen pſalmes taketh payre ſenſours ſenſeth belwithin prayeth god ſende good lucke many place make great dyner kepe feaſt ſolemne wedding hallowe aultars thus take oyle creſme pounde frankēſenſe panne hote hallowyng aultars coales ſalt water wyne aſhes hyſſope one canuas clothe wipe finer ſofter couer fiue croſſes waxe chalice morter two taper finally whatſoeaperteineth furniture aultar meane ſeaſon byſhop prieſtes ſaye certen pſalmes prayer doeth ſprinkle altar fiue ſondry place ſo beſtowyng water repreſenteth ye ſigne croſſe goeth ſeuē tymes aultar caſteth theron water tempered wyne hyſſope aſſhes moreouer tempereth morter water powreth aboute aultar streight wayes brought forth ſolemnely reliques sainctes whiche ſenſed agayn ſayde vp place byſhop ſwingeth aultar thryſe ſenſours deliuereth yt prieſt ſenſeth continually til hallowyng al finiſhed whan hath drawen vpon aultar thre croſſes oyle ſeuerall place powreth oyle ſuppleth takyng fyue ſmall piece frankenſence many croſſes made waxe placeth ſetteth fyre aſſhes gathered therof kept holy thinges finally anoynteth foure corner edge alſo forefront aultar ſingeth maſſe oyle chreſme call made euery wheare maundy thurſday paſſion weke next eaſter theſe tymes paſt great reuerence eſtimation men whan luther hym others taught howe al creature cōſecrated mouth luther brought cōtempt popyſh ceremony god tyme created whole worlde gere came contempt mockery full iugglyng trompery nowe therfore byſhoppes germany hauynge wynde wyll reſtore ſame bryng home agayne death lyfe touchyng makyng holy water terme decree biſhop rome lawe whiche aſcribe alexander fifte byſhop saint peter intent thyng may credite authoritie reaſon antiquitie therof howe pope legate yt emperour byſhop rome ſent thre byſhoppes germany ſpoken whan came themperour bruſſelles xxv daye may declare firſt commiſſion beginning biſhop rome reciteth ful care haue torne lordes cote howbeit two thynges comforte hym chiefly firſt chriſt ſelfe prophecie sathan ſhould aſſault churche yet vayne secondarely generall counſell may taken away al ſuche thinges wickedly crept ſo much ye fruict coūſel come already natiōs amōgs germains yet nothing done reaſon diuers diſſentiōs religiō ther therfore hath partly mere motion office paſtoral partly alſo themperours requeſt conſent senate cardinalles ſent forth certen byſhops whiche haue authoritie receiue vnto grace ſuch ar willing retourne boſom churche promeſſe al ioyful thinges clemencie great benignitie ſo content receiue lawes preſcribe benefite verely graūteth al men general degre al alſo crime ſort excepted though haue continued neuer ſo many yeares yet ſo yt ſuch offendours confeſſe errours ſinnes ſome catholike prieſt ſuche penaunce ſhal therfore inioyne open confeſſion abiuring ſatiſfaction lawes preſcribed doeth vtterly remitte forgeue hath geuen alſo byſhoppes ambaſſadours full power authoritie vnloſe ſuche bounden lutherians conuenaſit promeſſe othe thoſe bondes abſolue monkes fallē hereſie haue forſaken houſes permitte chaunging coates ſerue vocation churche moreouer geue pardon eate milke butter cheſe egges fleſhe hauing pope graunteth licence eate fleſhe reſpect place perſone finally permit thē receiue whole supper lorde laying aſyde errours ſhall allowe decree counſel conſtance whiche openly confeſſe muche receiued vnder one kynde vnder churche erred making decre one kynde may graunted certen tyme ſhalbe thought mete yet ſo ſelues doe ſeuerally tyme place ſame tyme whan others doe receiue vnder one kynde laſtly haue authoritie compounde poſſeſſioners churche landes fruictes receiued ſpent ſo wyll departe poſſeſſion henceſorth furthermore puniſhe obſtinate perſones cenſure churche herein craue aſſiſtaunce magiſtrates lykewyſe chouſe ſubſtitute byſhoppes throughout germany whiche ſhall put thing execution theſe ambaſſadours rome followynge commiſſion ſuch place thought moſte nedefull ſubſtitute byſhops wherof byſhop straſburg one whome commaunded execute thinges reherſed ſo finally receiue fauour eccleſiaſtical perſons firſt would forſake put away wyues mē ſaye howe went emperour haue cōference hym touchyng meaſure maner execution vnderſtode poſſible go vnto al place whiche nede remedy neceſſitie ſuborned others graunte indulgence terme byſhoppe rome emperour ſendeth immediatly byſhoppes germany warneth thē ſeuerally handle matter gently peaſeably firſt trye archbyſhop meiz councelloure yt lantgraue aſſay al wayes fayre ſpeach exhortation praiers come excommunication curſyng wherfore archebyſhop mētz addreſſing letter diuerſe others alſo gouernours counſellours yt lātgraue ſpeakyng many thynges cure charge paſtorall emperours fayth dilygence requyreth exhibite order ſent byſhop rome miniſters churche commaunding obeye ſame preacher moued herein ſaye doctrine conſonant doctrine prophetes apoſtles godly anſwer yt preacher lyfe ſelfe dede doeth aunwere profeſſion yet thei acknowledge errour doctrine wherfore thei haue nede byſhops indulgence haue preferred mariage filthie ſengle lyfe accordinge vnto god worde neither forſake child wyues whome chriſt ſelf commaundeth embrace loue fidelitie beneuolence ther church receyue lordes ſupper wholy ſame done commaundement chriſte cuſtome primatiue churche wyll admit alteration herein moneth may open diſputatiō oxforde betwene peter martyr open diſputation oxforde diuines ſame vniuerſitie cōcerning lordes ſupper preſence chriſt body theſe concluſions dyd martyr ſet vp defende ſubſtaunce bread wyne chaunged body bloud chriſte carnally corporally bread wyne vnited ſacramentally afterwarde ſet forthe boke ſame wherin preſidentes diſputation appointed kynges commaundemēt ſufficiently declare martyr maiſtrie contention tenth day moneth iune quene fraūce crowned sainct denis accuſtomed cardinalles bolon gwiſe chattilion uandome bourbon al reſt rome vi daye kyng maruelous goodly trayne richely apparrelled entreth paris king receiued paris head citie realme bene yet ſene opēly ſynce death father two day quene whyles ſoiourned diuers put executiō lutheraniſme whiche ſayde behelde ſelfe erecution done ſight king cō maundeth go proceſſion fourth day iuly cōmaundeth go proceſſion euery church next day publiſheth wryting prynte declaring cauſe therof might geue god thankes manifold benefites imployed vpō might praye god preſeruation hym ſelfe wyfe child whole realme commō wealth cōmende vnto ſoules godly mē chiefly kinges fraūce progenitours father lately departed whoſe example fully prefixed vndertake defence tuition catholique fayth religion authoritie liberty see apoſtolique miniſters churche amōgeſt cauſes alſo one principall mygh openly knowen howe muche abhorreth whiche contrary chriſtes commaundement contrary tradition apoſtles conſent al antiquitie denie preſence body bloude chriſte whiche take away vertue ſtrength baptiſme penaunce good workes sacramentes whiche vtterly cō temne authoritie churche order archepreiſtſhip whiche reiecte praying adoration reliques ſaintes moreouer deuoute ſupplication might teſtifie opinion mynde verely example progenitours certen imitation inheritaūce doeth ſo thinke beleue opinion doeth catholique churche crede apoſtles firſt counſell nice many counſelles holy father fully determined banniſh realme dominion hereſies long ſince condemned tyme partely reuined partly inuented luther caroloſtadius zwinglius oecolampadius melanchthon bucer caluine ſuche archeheretikes monſtrouſe peſtiferous perſones puniſhe moſte extremely ſuche ſhall offende herein wryting ſetforth vulgare tōgue ſendeth abroade partes fraunce commaunding thē go proceſſion place declare ſame vnto people long beheaded monſour ueruine rendring ueruine beheaded towne caſtel boloigne king englād ſpoken xv boke father lawe mounſ dubees aged mā gouernour al boloignois one foure mreſchalles fraunce cōdemneth perpetuall priſon diuerſe monethes paſt ſollicited swiſſes renewe league whiche made father although emperour letter intermeſſē gers greatly diſſwade yet neuertheleſſe thought expedient pourpoſe aſſente ther unto firſt dede thoſe romiſhe religion lepontians ualeſians alſo baſill schafuſians wherat many men marueled greatly reaſon thoſe forſayd proclamation execution moſte men ſuppoſed ought enter league ſocietie whiche ſo cruelly perſecuted true religiō cōdemned church doctours name berne zurick followyng counſel zwinglius haue ſhewed third ſixt boke abſtained frō league conuocation lipſia mentioned cōuocatiō lipſia many ſayd complained romiſh religion litle litle reſtored duke maurice fourth day iuly addreſſing letter lieftenauntes ſayeth heareth ther many partly ouermuch carefulnes partly ſo perſwaded others feare leaſt olde errours ſhould one reſtored certen miniſters churche buſy braines troubleſome perſones fre ſclaūder hath verely ſōdry time heretofore declared opē wryting minde purpoſe thoſe ſclaunders doth repete ſame againe intent may ſhewe teſtifie hath eſpecial care religion wherfore deſireth thoſe either lightnes belief perſwaſiō others feare alteration lay al feare aparte geue credit wryting teſtimonie cōcerning bring vp ſuche reportes let thinke eſcape vnpuniſhed ſo continue howbeit decree lately made lipſia gathered certen chapter commaundement ſhould taught preached let inquire therfore learne vnderſtand whether miniſters churche followe fourme whether reprehend ſame ſermons ſo euer commaūdeth thē aduertyſe doubtes ſhall aryſe repare yt diuines wittemberge lipſia theſe thinges declared vnto people theſe day departed ye lātgraues wyfe mother lawe duke maurice whiche pined awaye care ſorow huſbandes impriſonment time people rebelled england two cauſes one landes cōmons encloſed people complayned rebellion englande nobilitie taken much groūd whiche lay cōmon incloſed imparked ſame dere priuate vſes others deuonſhire demaūded theſame alſo chiefly offēded thalteratiō religion wold haue ſyx article wherof mētioned xii boke reſtored tyme therfore flocked together armure matter ful daunger neither would admonition take place kyng coūſel though moſte vnwilling ſende forth force againſt diſconfite thē ſondry place certen thouſandes ſlayne french king eſpiyng occaſion gaped bolain loſt prepareth army ſpedely partly force partly french king ſtealeth fortes ſurrendrie taketh certain caſtels fortes ſea coaſte betwixt bolain caleis meanes putteth ſoldiors bolain extremity lordes england toke miſfortune moſt greuouſly becauſe lorde protector ye kinges vncle gouernmente whole faulte imputed time furniſhed place thing neceſſary blame enuy increaſing daily protector beginning octobre common aſſent noble appreheded windſore king ſame time brought towre london priſoner lord afterward declare vnto people cauſes charge euil gouernement common wealth ſetforth proclamation ſame print wherunto teſtimony euery mā ſubſcribeth name amonges ihon earle warwicke principal meane french king attempteth theſe thinges againſt engliſhmen themperour leadeth ſōne throughe king philip inueſted flaunders flaunders henault artois ſweareth people true loyall vnto retourne andwarp viii daye septembre themperors ſonne receiued pageauntes ſhowes moſt ſumptuous townes men alſo marchaunts ſtraungers spaniardes italian germanes engliſh men accōpanied aunt regent goeth alſo thother prouinces receiue theyr fidelity oth tolde senate senate strauſburge cō pounde biſhop strauſburge ſent ambaſſadour emperour abate controuerſy theyr biſhop wherefore themperors permiſſion choſen certain arbitrers bothe party whan met monthe october long diſceptation senate permitteth biſhop iii church may eſtabliſh therin religion according decree lately made moreouer receiueth cleargye faithe tuition biſhop againe couenaunteth graunteth senate colledge saint thomas maintenaunce ſchole reſt church cleargy alſo payeth senate yerely tribute ſome mony thinges obtain immunity fredome emperour ſetforthe proclamation pearil fear mayden burge againſt maydenburge haue declared called ſtates saxonye aid many refuſed ſo yt thother ſtates saxony alſo thempire would ſame menne lubecke luneburge conſente themperors deputy going maidenburge aſſaied make reconcilemente vaine tune man impugne openly ſo much outlawed euermore daunger nether might withoute pearill life good depart yt city lawful euery man trye fortune againſt therfore senate cōplaind thiniuries neighbor publicke letter ſetforth another wryting vnto al men general chiefly next neighbor ſay ſelanderouſly reported theyr purgation though ſhould arrogantly proudly demeane thē ſelues againſt themperor thempire ſhould forſake peace wryte many contumelious thing herein ſuſtain great wrong acknowledge charles themperor theyr ſupreme magiſtrate haue opēly proclaimed nothing ſaid miſſe againſt ſtate nether anye cauſe diſpleaſure ſay profeſſe goſpell word cā get pardon god thother ſlaunders deuiſed forged theyr enuemies howe deſyrous peace vnknowen haue bene laſt conuentions vnderſtand alſo know experiēce ſwete ye name peace comfortable thing againe euils warre bryngeth moreouer ſhuld greuous diſpleſaunt theyr neighbour ſhould theyr ſake daunger receiue domage furthermore confeſſe neyther lawfull neyther theyr power obſtinately reſiſt themperour thempire beyng dryuen neceſſitye defende ſelues theyrs iniury haue beaten downe certayne buildinges haue taken certen hold ſmal townes village time warre minding kepe ſelues ſhuld come hand foraine nation neyther refuſe rendre ſame ſo theyr neighbor attempt nothing two cauſes chieflye wherefore obteyne peace fyrſte retain doctrin goſpell refuſe romyſhe idoll secondlye condicions peace propounded greuous alſo intollerable altogether ſuch cannot performed ſhuld betray theyr liberty geuen thē themperor great otto firſt name haue receiued theyr elder maintained vnto day reaſō defended excuſed time come nowe alſo appeareth manifeſtly ſene thing authoures booke made auſpurge intended went indeuonred plucke awaye men chief article doctrine iuſtification force ſaluation called doubte alſo lordes ſupper marriage prieſtes moreouer teach inuocation deade men ſo euer dependeth ſame furthermore go reſtore papiſtry hath bene declared many excellent learned men certainly ſo great wickednes woulde winked paſſed ouer ſilence yea god called continuall praier ſuffer glory name thus polluted aſſuredly heauye ſorowful ſight men ſhould violently inforced falſe religion idolatry miniſters churche caſt priſon wyth theyr wiues chyldren dryuen exile ſome alſo myſeſerablye ſlaine much lamented albeit theſe thinges openly ſene eſpeciallye vpper partes germanye yet ſhould men dare affirme religion impugned howe newes euer ſynce worlde began ſtate good godly menne hathe bene alwaies ſuffer affliction againe many example old newe teſtamente declare conſtancy holy men vſed whan kinges prince ſetforth theyr proclamation contrary god word ſuche caſes alwaies force wrytten holy ſcriptures howe oughte rather obeye god men hathe chriſoſtome auſten ambroſe holy men taught alſo perfourmed dede whan emperoures commaunded thinge againſte commaundementes god like caſe preſent ſe dā ger yet may otherwiſe muſt ſoner abide pearill praiſe receiue manifeſt error wrytten gordius martir beinge requeſted ſayinge gordiꝰ martyr frendes whan caried execution ſauinge life woulde forſake opinion aunſweared tonge ought ſpeake thinge reproche made thing aſwel apperteineth vnto al mē opiniō bothe aunciente churche alſo certaine fyrſte betray truthe yt hold ſylence biſhoppes rome betray truth whiche teache falſe doctrine alſo ſuche dare profeſſe openlye defende truthe knowen wherefore whole caſe muſte cōmitted god nether ought ether yt pleſure mā fearce peril forſake profeſſiō yt ueritie ſet eies thexample daniel cōtrary yt proclamatiō king darius worſhipped god wt windowes ſet open euerye ſide certes mighte haue done ſame priuatelye cloſelye withoute daunger much ſame thing concerned profeſſion faith glory god holy name great conſtant courage called vpon god openlye reſpect daunger procured aduerſaries lighted theyr owne heades wherefore beſeche men attempte force warre againſte whiche member true churche woulde followe herein ſteppes chriſtiane souldioures former time whych dede would obey whan themperoures warres required theyr ſeruice againſte chriſtians proued example saincte moris martir howe greuouſlye alſo god offended iſraelites afraid multitude ennemies healpe theyr weake felowes expreſſed boke iudges mighte doctrine al men forſake neceſſitye brother fellowes religion alſo ayde ſuccoure doubte nothing yt good men moued theſe thinges god liueth immortall hath full oft time paſt ſhewed mighty power right hande nowe alſo declare ſame deſyre alſo hartely would cauſe theſe letter exhibited emperor king ferdinando prince ſtates alſo make interceſſion extremity wrought againſt wil refuſe nothing may godly honeſtly performed require moreouer would commend vnto god praiers thend verely yt xample niniuites may bottom harte bewail ſinnes hartely ſigh vnto god may boldly profeſſe doctrine goſpel whiche hathe nowe theſe xxx yeares bene preached may ſet forth godlines life may ſhew worckes loue vnto men chiefly miniſters church baniſhed exiled theyr child wiues ſuche miſerable people may kepe holſome doctrine pure ſafe deceites vnder pretence reſtoringe ceremony bryng againe whole rabble romiſhe doctrin month octobre fraunces duke mātua ſonne duke fridericke marieth lady katherine daughter ferdinando kinge romaine tenth day nouē bre departeth life biſhop rome paule thirde deathe pope paul third whan liued lxxxii yeres daye died releaſed cuſtomes impoſed vpon saltpits diuers thinges without ſighing people certaine monethes treated emperoure reſtitution placence vaine liued longer thought verely woulde haue taken french kinges part euer ſence murther ſonne peter aloiſe imagined reuenged bodye caried chappell biſhop sixtus remained iii day many people reſorted thither kiſſe fete put boke italiā againſt pope iron grate manner lefte life came forthe italian booke againſte ſore vehemente vnder title barnardinus ochinus compiled thoughte others preface aſchanius colomnois baniſhed boke amonges thinges ouer longe recite adreſſinge talcke towardes callinge antichriſte time innocentius biſhop rome thou waſt ſaieth committed priſon prelate moſte abhominable two deteſtable murthers committing paracidie wit poyſoninge thy mother nephew thine whole inheritaunce might deſcend vnto bēing ſet liberty nothinge aſhamed ſue purple siſter whore made cardinal hat man ſo greate wickednes thriſe repulſed colledge cardinal owne natural ſiſter iulia farneſia length obteined ſute ſhe threatned high biſhop ſhe wold longer commaundement biſhop alexander ſixt fearing anger diſpleſure choſe fellowſhip cardinal alſo poyſoned ſiſter youres halfe whoriſhe cuſtome familye whan ambaſſador prouince aucona time iulye ſeconde biſhop rome full naughtely begiled maid ſame citye diſſemblinge making beleue wer gentleman attending vpon ambaſſadour defloured ſhameful acte maides vncle cardinall aucona charged moſt earneſtly cleinent ſeueth pryſoner citye taken nicholas quercey toke wife laura farneſia monſtrus lechery pope thy nece gaue iobbe hys dagger ſcarre thereof remaineth daye ſhoulde ſpeake thy daughter cuſtaunce wyth whome thou haſte ſo ofte offended end thou mighteſt haue frelye thy pleaſure thou diddeſt poyſone huſbande boſius sfortia perceiuing wickednes toke ſuch inward thoughte neuer ſene mery filthy luſt aſſuredlye paſſe farre emperours commodus heliogabalus may well proued ſo many baſtardes haue lot lay daughter ignorauntly whan made droncke thou ſobre haſt medled thy nece alſo thy siſter daughter nowe ſame whiche thine vngratious ſonne peter aloiſe biſhop fane ſhameful ſpoken horrible crime biſhop clemente deteined priſoner caſtell aungele ſente ambaſſadour emperor recouering liberty thou wouldeſt take thy iourney geuen biſhoppricke parma thy nephew farneſius ten yeres old done diſceiued neuertheleſſe whan came gene fained ſelfe ſicke marchaundiſe haſte thou made church goodes cardinall ſince thou waſte pope rauening made biſhop liuing god filthelye haſte thou conſumed goodes church rome art thou aſhamed haue beſtowed high office gouernemente vppon thine vngratious sonne forty thouſande ducat yearely muche manner thy nephew octauius ſpeake vnreaſonable ſubſtaunce thou haſt waſted vpon wemen thy houſe vppon thy neces sanflorians thou dareſt make mention turkes like inuade pore italy thou doeſt intente thou mighteſt haue ſome occaſion polle people whiche vnder thy gouernmente ſuſtaine mooſte heauy intollerable burthen thou diddeſt ſell duke farrare mutina reſo thou haſt aliened city parma placence church rome whiche neuer begotten biſhop clemente verely aſhamed thintent thou mighteſt enrich thine houſe family thou haſt handled others contrary righte equity ſuch could refuſed beare burthen bondage thou haſt perſecuted warre peruſines declare amongs others aſcanius columnois taketh yerely ſubiectes ordinarye iii c ducates oft impoſeth new cuſtomes one salt thinges exacteth tenthes nowe moytie fruites ought verely taken enemye chriſten bloud turkiſh nauy biſhoppricke ſailed coſtes church rome without damage long ſence time barbarous entred ſeas wherfore ſecreat trafficke thou haſte infidel cutteth occaſion thou canſt hereafter pretend yt name turkiſhe warre yet meane ſeaſon dare bold taunt kinge fraunce kepinge frendſhip proteſtantes emperoure king england great ſhame thou ſhouldeſt wholy depend vpon aſtrology paule geuen aſtrology coniuratiō necromantie thing denied expert mē theſe ſciences thou haſt auaunced honor giftes promotiōs ceſius marcellus gauricus portugal others thing vndoubtedly doth manifeſtly reproue vngodlines miſbeliefe cauſe ſufficiente enoughe whyche thou oughteſt depoſed thy ſeate many ſuche like thinges contained foreſaid boke hadde printe let v retourne dead coarſe ix day began buriall made nine day together meane aſſemble cardinal chuſe newe pope ſeaſon cardinal abſent repare citye ſpede trent mantua cibo montane auſpurge auria urbine theſe buriall firſte came thither cardinall trent mantua marriage mentioned whan word broughte biſhops death funerall charge amount ſome fifty thouſand crownes xviii day nouembre maſſe done went conclaue call chuſe new biſhop fourth day december cardinal pacieco spaniard came thither trent xii day came cardinall bellay uandome chaſtilion guiſe tournon thend yt ſame moneth bolon ambois lorayne alſo bourbon man great yeres frenchman many rome whome king ſent thither two yeres paſt ſhewed xix boke ſo muche come place ſhall miſſe declare certain thing ther palace rome mount uaticane ioyning church saint peter wherein dwell high biſhops whan occaſion ſerueth call senate cardinal palace amonges buildinges fiue halle galary thre ſcore ten paſes longe two chappels theſe together make ſame called yt conclaue one chappell appoyn • e • ſaye maſſe take theyr voyces foreſaid haulles cardinal haue theyr manſion time deathe paule much cardinal nombre fifty four ſo many chamber prepared conclaue tymes paſt many dores nowe ſhut vp ſauinge one dore moreouer glaſe windowes chappels ſuch height man reach wherfore nether ayre lighte pearſeth thither burne waxe lightes day night nowe haue theyr chamber builded xiiii fote wide xvi fote long xii fote depe nether brick ſtone timber cloth ether uiolet grene becauſe ſome commodious others draw lotte auoid diſpleaſure enuy euery hall hath ii rowes chamber ſpace within theſe limites muſt cardinal kepe ſelues family houſhold ſtuffe euery cardinal alowed iiii seruauntes lie chamber alwaies wait vpon whileſt reaſt make bed thinges neceſſarye againe xii appoynted generall whiche make cleane chamber conuey filthe ordure place aſſigned thoſe within compelled remain vnleſſe fall ſicke whan gone receiued except cardinal whan come conclaue election ſtraightwaies choſen iii iiii cardinalles ſhall prouide thinges neceſſary anſwer ambaſſadours kinges prince haue one key ſame gate ſpake nobility rome hath third haue biſhops fourth maſters ceremony gate vnlocked comen conclaue vnleſſe comming ſome cardinal maſters ceremonis ſame gate little wicket wherof maſters ceremony haue kay time dinner ſupper opened meat brought ſame kitchins without ready certain biſhops apoynted ſame purpoſe ſearch diligently euery piece meat letter conueied therin priuely thē doth maſters ceremony receiue diſhes deliuer thē cardinal ſeruaunts ſame wicket man el may ſuffred approche neare meat ſerued earthen platter wine flagēs glaſſe daily brought new loke veſſels ſerued ſame old cuſtom fee maſters ceremony gather thē vp right diligentlye fine bothe ſtuffe workmanſhip ſold deare time watched without farre palace gate v c fotemen italian leadinge county cuſtody yt cōclaue petilia againe garde swiſſes ſerued paule thyrd light horſmen gentleman rome ambaſſadors kinges prince laſt next gate biſhops mentioned ſearchers meate defence city placed iiii ſouldiours cōduit oracius farneſius beſides priuate houſes cardinal noble men alſo certain bondes ſouldiors wil ſpeake thelection albeit wonte olde time enter conclaue x day biſhoppes departure yet death paule thirde matter differed vntil xix day xxix day nouembre ſaid day cardinal entring conclaue litle euening binde vnto othe nobility rome capitaines centurion appoynted defence city reſort euery man family owne chamber commaund others depart conclaue cardinal biſhops ſome prieſtes ſome deacōs went election certain lawes recited thē ſelues vſe make according yt ſtate time concerne fredomes priuileges cardinal firſt therfore othes cardinal ſworne chaunce choſen byſhop obſerue thoſe thinges exactly moreouer wyll chuſe whome ſhal thincke moſt comfortable commune weale go matter ſecond day december maſters ceremony ringing maner chuſe pope little bell conclaue calleth al maſſe finiſhed brought vnto euery cardinall chaire therin pece paper conteining name cardinal aultar chappel ſet table couered purple cloth vppon ſet chalice ſiluer bell table ſixe ſtoles euery cardinall wryteth voyce little paper afterward foldeth vp ſigneth ſuch ſort name choſen doth appeare euerye man ariſinge order goeth kneleth downe aultare haue prayed put paper chalice ſit downe againe theyr place done two biſhops ſo many prieſtes many deacon ſit downe vpon thoſe ſixe ſtoles fyrſt biſhop taketh chalice paper ordre ſo deliuereth firſt deacon vnfoldeth ſame loud voyce readeth name elected alſo thelectaure cardinal haue euery one thē paper wherin theyr name wrytten ſaid adde vnto euery name red pronounced nombre voyces geuen ſame accompt thus made firſte prieſt hath alſo paper conteining name cardinal doth pronounce many voyces euerye man hathe nombre ſuch required paper caſt againe chalice doth deacon ring ſiluer bel ſtraightwais commeth maſters ceremony tarieth without bringing fire panne cole burneth thoſe little paper euery cardinall maye one time geue foure ſeuerall voyces didiuers men chaunceth ſeldome verelye manner theyr election nowe let v retourne purpoſe cardinal thus incloſed ſecond day septēbre ſaid begin matter wēt ſlowly heard ſay cardinal fraunce cō ming many men ſuppoſed ſhould haue ſene newe biſhop rome chriſtmas expectation vaine cardinalles deuided thre partes faction thre factiōs cardinal whereof one emperoure another frenche king third farneſians frenchman wold haue choſen cardinall traues saluiate rodulphe lorayne theatine imperialles pole burges carpes crucey moron sfoudrate poole saluiate great brute raiſed city would thing ſhould kept cloſely haue ſaid yet much oft time diuers went oute conclaue eyther cauſe faining ſome ſicknes could kept ſecreate ſo much ſaid emperoure frenche kinge aduertiſed done cauſe cardinall poole obteined place throughe meanes cauſe pole pope cardinall theatine ſaid reported ſmelled lutheraniſme many italy others alſo bear witnes right iudgemente concerninge true doctrine ſaid tenth boke ſame time manye pilgrimes rome whyche come thyther oute diuers country nation thentent might beginning new yere commonly called yere iubeley receiue cleane remiſſion forgeuenes theyr ſinnes upon chriſtmas euen reſorted porche peter church hoping wel ſame called golden gate ſhould haue bene opened newe biſhop albeit long delay diſpleaſaunte yet thoughte good depart election paſte matter yeare iubiley ſtandeth thus bonifacius viii biſhop rome yere oure lorde cc xcv ordeined yeare iubiley firſte men commaunded ſhould renued euery c yere promiſed vnto ſuch ſhuld come rome ther make deuoute prayer sepulchre peter paule ful remiſſion al theyr ſinnes death whan thys diſtance time ſerued ouer long clemēt ſixt reduced ſame vnto fifty yeres whoſe decre alſo remaineth wherin commaundeth angel ſhould carry vp heauenly kingdome ſuch died time pilgrimage sixtus fourth decreed benefite ſhould graunted men euery xxv yere whan therfore yere incarnation chriſt md l hand paule third fewe monethes ſente abrode letter vnto nation moſt earneſtly exhortinge let paſſe ſo goodly occaſion vnburtheninge thē theyr ſinnes obteining kingdome heauen ſelf alſo reioyſed much liued vnto time ſayd day wold moſt delectable wherin ſhould deſerue ſo wel mankinde ioy effectuall fewe wekes paules ioye vain ſame day ſo greatly deſired departed ſpecified paulus fagius went bucer englād end nouembre died cambridge feuer quartane matter taken vp arbitrement betwixt biſhop strauſburge senate haue ſhewed biſhop intended begin thing church chriſtmaſſe preſcribed cleargye ordre whiche ſhould followe fully furniſhed differred till firſt february thoſe thre temple senate compoſition graunted prieſtes begin 1550 againe fyrſt ſing theyr euenſong next day maſſe ſpace xxi yeares hadde bene omitted great concourſe eſpecially yong people vnto ſtrāge ſtraunge ſight neuer hard ſight neuer heard ſee ſo manye ſhauen crownes new kind apparel whiche ſange man could vnderſtand taper lampes burning noone dayes ſmoking perfuming ſenſours ſe prieſt miniſters ſtanding aultare pronouncing al thinges ſtrāge language vſing manye curteſies ſondrye geſtures bowynge downe handes faſt cloſed one caſtinge abrode hys armes bringing ſame ſomtime turning ſelf cry loud muttering ſomething great ſecreatnes ſomtime loking vp loft ſomtime ground cannot ſtand ſtil place remouinge right hand left hand aultare croſſe bleſſe finger breethe chalice lifte vp highe ſet downe againe certaine place name one quicke dead break hoſt call put chalice knocke breaſte wyth fiſt ſigh wincke thoughe ſlepe wake againe eat one part bread ſuppe reaſte wyth wine leaſt drop ſhould remaine waſhe handes croſſe bleſſe gilt patent put ſame foreheade breaſt kiſſe one aultare another image incloſed timbre metall theſe thinges ſay ſuch like yong people beheld without great maruel wonder certainly without laughter could hardly kept vnder none certain prieſt procured thither place maketh sermon head church wher great audience yet diuers reſorted wōt new thing certaine yonge man make noyſe know trouble thurch strauſburg whome one sergeaunts rebuked made buſines though would haue caried pryſon youth came al flocking ſuche caſe commonly ſene aroſe vprore tumult euery man inquireth matter ſtirre vp churche wherupon preacher thought verely bene ſedition raiſed ſore afraid owne part went downe ſodenly pulpit fellowes let chauncel fēſed dores iron al prieſtes amongs certain prebendary ſame church borne noble houſes ſitting neare pulpit heare conueied thē ſelues alſo quickly knowing would come therof whole matter immediatly declared conſul pretour reaſte senate hearinge sermones church came haſte appeaſs tumulte came quieted beſides fewe younge men man ſtirred wherefore senate amonges others ſent iames sturmius declareth principal clargy ſaid senate ſorye diſturbaunce ſheweth thoccaſion therof affirmeth citezen found ſame muche done withoute theyr knowledge prayeth take diſpleaſauntly promiſeth wil ſe time forward ſuch like thing happen woulde thus ſatiſfied ſaye plainly wil henceforthe put theyr line ſuch daunger next day depart great diſpleaſure leauing work begon reparing biſhop tabernes complaine theyr miſfortune thus therefore matter diſcontinued fewe monethes meane time complained emperoure whole matter ſhall declared hereafter many men ſuppoſe reioyſed inwardly theyr mindes ſo good occaſion leaue ſo lōg maſſe aboliſhed decre senate liued moſt liberty receiued theyr whole reuenewes withoute paine taking bounden daily ſeruice although laboure great yet occaſion thoughte vnto right acceptable wherby might ſhake yoke bondage eſpecially ſeinge theyr doinges derided contempned common people ſelues poynted finger hated moſt men senate inquiſition made could perceiue fault anye townes man aboute beginning february ambaſſadors england fraūce mete treat peace engliſhmen hauing loſt thoſe fortes ſaid driuen narrow iſſue aboute time alſo protector englād protectoure kinges vncle deliuered towre wheras counſel perceiued ſame ſhould pleaſe king wel ſo much earl warwick chief occaſiō apprehenſion meane found theyr frendſhippe ſhould renued affinitie wherefore earle warwickes ſonne marieth duke somerſets daughter afterward kinge gaue vnto earle warwicke dukedome northumberland frendſhip laſted longe ſhalbe declared hereafter meane ſeaſon rome full faction partakinges eſpeciallye farneſians earneſt one theyr ſide might choſen firſt dede alexander nephewe paulus certatne cardinal client ioyned ſelues cardinalles imperial frenche cardinal gaue theyr voyces cardinall saluiate florentine alexander fearing leaſt next ſeſſion saluiate ſhoulde pronounced biſhop reuolted french part taking firſte othe reported certaintie ſhoulde chuſe saluiate meane lengthe ihon mary mountane whome ſaide high preſident counſel trent bononie vii day february created biſhop euer accompted moſte earneſt fauourer french partie alſo ferneſians cauſe farneſius bare good saluiate reported feared leaſt ſhould obtain dignity would cut ſhort brother kinſfolkes much rich heaped together right wrong would auenge iniury done houſe paulus farneſiaus ſaid cardinall farneſius woulde promeſſe good mountane whome paule third made cardinall till aſſured fidelitie would frely permit parma brother octauianus biſhop old cuſtome chaungeth name called iuly third name ſame time frenche king ſetforth proclamation againſte luthexanes penalty alſo appoynted iudges ſlacke negligent executing ſame biſhop elected departed life two cardinal uerulan rodulphe therfore french kynges proclamation againſt lutheranes remained conclaue lii wherof xiiii frenchman ii germains iiii spaniard ii portugal one engliſhe man al reſidue italian xi romains xxii daye february iuly conſecrated biſhop cardinall cibon two day openeth golden gate cal wheras iuly yt third infinite nombre people obtain remiſſion theyr ſinnes ſaid biſhop ſtriketh gate golden mallet thopenyng golden gate ſo ſtandeth ceremony afterward wont geue way ſome man token honour ſome yt thinck ſelues happy men may get time cardinal auſpurge obteined much intreaty caried germany whileſt biſhop beateth gate mallet worcke men breake open crowes iron people ſtriue may firſt thronge gather vp full buſely morter rubbiſhe falleth ruine ſame kepe precious iewels many men ieſted vpon fact cardinal auſpurge whan heard therof ſaying ieſt cardinall auſpurge intended yt ſame mallet knock lutheranes head came rome ſalute biſhop theyr duty duke urbin duke farrare ambaſſadors ueniſe sauoy duke florence gene sene scotland fraunce alſo themperors biſhop reſtore parma octauius farneſius alſo gaue made high gouernor whome call confalonier reſtored alſo aſcanius colunnois whome paule third exiled new biſhop auncient cuſtome geueth cardinal hat ganimede nouryſhed poope iuly whome liſt biſhop iuly time legate boloigne loued yong man innocentius meaſure although reaſt miſlike yea ſpake againſt choſe nombre cardinal receiued daily familiarity geuing vnto ſurname armes alſo bruted rome libel ſetforth ſame iuppiter kept ganymede although old deforme yea biſhop ſelfe would let tel cardinal ſaid would recite mery mode wanton lad howe importune whileſt occupied conclaue letter dute conclaue came moſt fil thye letter takē camillus olius one cardinal mā tua reported haue wrytten certain louer anniball contine xxvi ianuary verſes wrytten vulgare tounge ſpeaketh affection loue hym abſent vſeth ſuch deteſtable ſhameful wordes without offence ſpoken againe wherupon roſe ieſt ſaid ſome filthy biſhop ſignified come conclaue yelded ſuch kinde letter xiii day emperours letter • ate thempyre march themperour addreſſeth leters ſtates empire howe conuention auſpurge retourned flaunders might binde people dominion ſonne ſent spaine ſame purpoſe hys intent thing finiſhed retourne ſtraightwaies germany becauſe winde ſerueth ſaile al time diſtaunce place farre ſondre therfore long ſonne came spaine arriuall hole sommer great part harueſt ſpent aboute neceſſaries affaire albeit winter hand yet fully prefixed haue gone germany ſelfe ſame time chaunced diſeaſe gout long word brought death biſhop paul wherſore chaunged purpoſe tarying thelection new biſhop iuly third aduertiſed election alſo promiſed franckly largely good wil zele cōmon wealth religion thing known thought mete let ſlip ſo great occaſion longe wiſhed accompliſhing thing deſired eſpecially cōſidering whole wealth germany conſiſteth herein therfore ſome way muſte deuiſed ſuch thinges laſt aſſembly decreed commenced may accompliſhed muſt foreſeue yt cauſes diſſention taken away certaine obſtinat parſons rebel ſtraitly puniſhed theſe cauſes verelye intendeth hold counſel ſtates unperiall wherfore commaūdeth againſt xxv day iune readye attende vpon auſpurge finde manner let come ſelues vnleſſe ſicknes thinge withſtanding ſhall bounden iuſtify othe ſend theyr ambaſſadours large full commiſſion thinges concerninge common wealth thintent conſultation found let delay ✚ xxij booke sleidanes commentary concerning ſtate religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte ❧ argument xxii booke peace concluded betwixt england fraunce maidenburge make purgation wryting emperours proclamation againſt lutheranes aſtonied manye marchauntes hys countryes whileſt aſſemble holden auſpurge continue counſell trent granuellan diſceaſeth george duke megelburge perſecuteth maidenbourge going worſe haue alſo duke moris enconues pope iuly publiſheth bull ſtraunge ſorte duke moris made chieftaine againſte maidenburge propoundeth condition peace againſte whome alſo cleargy publiſh letter charge wherunto aunſwer fully purge ſelues oſiander inuenteth new doctrine man iuſtification decree aſſemble geue ſaufconduit go counſell bucer dieth england thre sunnes thre mones ſene pope citeth octaulan farneſe prince parma againſte whome alſo themperoure publiſheth letter patentes upon french king maketh hys excuſe pope duke saxon priſoner healpeth comforteth miniſters church baniſhed emperoure beginninge counſell trent order ſeſſions ſame counſel meane deuiſe frame article faith beginning warre parma time thambaſſadours englād peace concinded betwixt frāce englande fraunce whan longe debated matter laſt conclude peace ſo much eaſy brynge paſſe ſaw ſome vnto whome contention theyrs ſhould time come profitable gainful wherfore engliſhmen reſtore frenchman boloigne kepte nowe ſixe whole yeares without greate maruell many frenchman pay mony peace alſo scottes compriſed ſending ambaſſadors bothe party two kinges confirme peace new amity ye french king made knight garter england kinge england againe french order whiche verelye amonges great prince cogniſaunce moſte aſſured frendſhip maidenburge defaced ſondry proclamation themperour xxiiii day march publiſhe wryting chiefly next inhabiters firſt proue neither god lawe man law conuicted rebellion declare ſuch put armure againſt make warre againſt chriſt ſelfe thirdly confute crime obiected ſhewe ſclaunders ſurmiſed theyr aduerſaries albeit ſaye theyr prouocation emperour hathe exiled v yet may truely affirme haue yet refuſed reaſonable condition ſo might inioy ſtil doctrine profeſſed auſpurge liberty oure elder haue lefte v ſame minde alſo neither refuſe anye kinde dutye ought done emperoure empire take god witnes haue geuen none occaſion warre trouble couet chiefly obſerue peace men ye meane true religion doctrine attaine life euerlaſtinge doubtles cauſe hatred rayſed againſt v deuiſed law inferioure magiſtrate ſhall impeche right ſuperioure moreouer ſo fortune magiſtrate paſſe boūdes authoritye commaund thing wicked ſhould obeyed alſo attempte force reſiſted man thincke denye rule gouernement dependeth god againſte whome anye proclamation come forthe decree made matter clearely doubt ſame oughte reiected refuſed ſort decre made auſpurge concerning religion therfore obey woulde make v receiue ſame mauger heades take v lighte goſpel ſetforth romiſh idoll might draw v euerlaſting damnation ſeinge caſe ſtandeth thus ther rebellion right obiected vnto v euery mā may eaſely perceiue vnlawful worke anye violence againſt v yt aſſaied thing wrought thend profeſſors true doctrine might vtterlye extinguiſhed ſide mighte wounded chriſte ſelf al godly people al member chriſte wherfore ſuch defile ſelues ſo wicked facte thing el may loke god vengaunce touchinge fortes village taken haue ſpoken laſt former wryting neither neadefull repeate ſame ſo ſone ſhalbe aſſured peace reſtore right owner alſo enemy haue raiſed brute though vſed amonges v intermixed vncerten lechery moſt impudēt lie therfore beſeche honor god yt ye defile ſelues innocent blud pray god would confound bloudy coūſels wicked fortune war yt wold deny aid month aprill miniſters church ſetforth wryting wherein recite confeſſion faith ye miniſters churche confeſſion doctrin declare lawful inferior magiſtrate defend ſelf againſt ſuperior compelling forſake truth ſpeke vnto beſeche themperor wold geue credit ſuche incenſe practiſe vniuſt wicked cruelty wold firſt truly duely examine ye whole matter finally make earneſt requeſt may haue war thinge come ſo paſſe deſire aid alſo inhabiters next trouble ſaid fortuned head church strauſburge biſhop made complaint themperor senate ambaſſadour ſent declareth ther fault wherfore themperour adreſſing letter biſhop commaundeth renue hys worke omitted procede therin biſhop taketh firſte aſſurance othe senate ther ſhuld violence ſhewed diſturbance theyr thus length clargy feaſt pentecoſt xxiiii may began cleargy strauſburge renueth miſteries matter day firſt conſuls certen senator wer ther thother ſide cathedrall church leaſt tumult ſhuld raiſed clargy ſaid church incloſed part chauncel go reueſtry grate yron yt man could come nere thend may themperor departeth bruſſels ſonne phillip goeth thaſſembly auſpurge leading duke saxon priſoner leauing lantzgraue machlin long proclamation againſte lutheranes departing thence ther ſetforth proclamation againſt ye lutheranes written french flemiſh ye xxix day april ſort albeit ſaith themperor haue alwaies indeuored thauncient true religion might within al dominion obſerued albeit haue bene euermore wholly bent therrors ſectes hereſies haue theſe many yeres benſowen ouer al chriſtendom might vtterly aboliſhed albeit ſame cauſe haue ſetforth ſōdry proclamation wt moſt extreme penalty yet hearing ſaye without great grief mind men dominiō alſo ſtrāgers dwel within prouinces occupy trade marchandiſe haue ſpread abrode thinfection miſchief far nere ſuch ſort doutles requiſite lay diſeaſe ſome corraſine ſharp medicine make diligent inquiſitiō offender ſame plage maye plucked vp rote laſt aſſemblies prouincial admoniſhed ſtates gouernors yt euery man part ſhuld diligētly apply ſelf hereunto ſtil remain thold catholick religiō eſpecially cōſidering openly ſene al men tumultes commotiōs infection hath ſtirred vp ſpeake nothing meane time loſſe ſaluation ſoules wherfore thaduiſe moſt derely beloued ſiſter aſſent oure noble make new law ſtraitly charge commaund man whatſoeuer haue bie diſtribute bokes luther oecolāpadius zwinglius bucer caluine bokes ſet forth xxx yeres paſt without name author regiſter deuines louaine regiſtre deuines louain furthermore conteined moreouer man kepe image picture made contempt mockery lady ſaincts nether caſt breake image painted pourtraied honor ſaint man open houſe vnto priuy conuenticles wherin bothe erroures wont ſowen men wemen rebaptiſed alſo conſpiracies made againſt church common wealth man either priuely apartly diſpute holy ſcripture eſpecially hard doubtfull matter take vpon thinter pretation ſame vnleſſe deuine aucthoriſed ſome commendable vniuerſity ſhall otherwiſe ſhalbe puniſhed ſeditious perſons diſturbers common tranquility men ſhal die ſword womē ſhal buried ground quick caſe wil forſake theyr error obſtinate ſhall burnt theyr goodes confiſcated whether puniſhment ſo euer ſuffer againe ſhall haue none authority make whatſoeuer ſhall herein ſince time firſt began infringe thys oure law ſhalbe fruſtrate take place furthermore charge cōmaund man receiue houſe aid thing ſuch knoweth ſuſpected hereſy aduertiſe immediatly thinquiſitour gouernour place ſhal ſuffer puniſhment obſtinate malice throughe infirmitye haue fallen errour hereſies yet haue tranſgreſſed thys talcke faith bidden law haue done nothing ſeditiouſlye owne accord haue retourned amendement haue abiured receiued grace ſhal yt haue conference amongs ſelues matter appertaining faith religion haue ſuffer thoſe returned vomit conuicted vehemently ſuſpected hereſy ſhalbe condē ned ether tabiure open penance ye ſame man ſhalbe accuſed hereſye ſhal ſuffer one reuolted unto ſuch ſpotted hereſy ſtained like crime ſhalbe geuen none honor dignity nether ſhall beare anye office common wealth unleſſe man bring teſtimoniall curate church dwelt laſt let ſuffered haue habitation dwelling ſuche ought ſuſpected gouernors peace oure client euery man prouince inquire diligently ſuch ſhall breake law aſſiſt inquiſitoures eccleſiaſticall iudges ſo thoſe whiche founde culpable maye ſuffer according che fourme preſcribed excepte ſo ſhall ſuffer oure pleaſure let common proctoure alſo know whether duetie ſhalbe found negligent let commaund come iudgement ſhall appeare haue offended let either depriued theyr office otherwiſe puniſhed ſhalbe thought expedient beſides let biſhops archdeacon abbot ſuch like prelate ſearch diligence cleargy infect diſeaſe puniſhe extremely know man defiled peſtilence place heretickes lurcke frequent let preſente immediatly vnleſſe ſo ſuffer ſame puniſhment others ſhould promotour accuſation falſe ſhal haue reward promotours one half goodes goodes dede ſhall exceade ſumme vi c crownes whatſoeuer ſhalbe aboue ſōme tenth part therof ſhalbe alotted vnto ſhal detect thinquiſitour priuy conticles although theyr counſell ſhall puniſhed ſo thinke well religion henceforth refraine theyr company ſhall preſent followſhip ſhalbe rewarded ſaid let puniſhments yt haue appoynted ſo executed accordingly nether ſhall lie man power alter mitigate ſame perceiue oftentimes done iudges offende herein ſhal eſcape vnpuniſhed accuſed hereſy cited appere haue fled haue bene outlawed whan haue heard cōpanions offence dead wont make ſute may ſuffred make purgation ſo much ſuppoſe crime proued meanes chaunceth retourning ſow abrode falſe doctrin error ſame wiſe done cōmon profit wherfore cōmaund yt ther place geuen requeſts yt al ſuch wer cited haue appered ſought ſaue thē ſelues fleing ſhalbe accōted conuictes perſons condemned ſhal make ſute ſuſpected fled baniſhed anabaptiſtes let taken ſupporters heretikes iudges gouernors receiue none ſuch fauor vnles ether permiſſiō v ye quenes ſiſter thoſe yt ſhal otherwiſe ſhalbe depriued theyr proclamation printer gouernmēt printer bokeſellers print ſel vtter thing cōcerning ſcripture theyr aduiſe conſent vnto whō charge cōmitted ſo much regiſter bokes thuniuerſity louain hath reiected let ye ſtationers haue ye ſame hāged vp ſhops opē ſight leaſt either thē ſelues bier plead ignorance yt haue another regiſter al theyr bokes yt wil obey ſhal loſe c crown finally yt man take child teach vnles ye permiſſion magiſtrat chief miniſter church authoriſed teach inſtruct youth nothing according form preſcribed deuines louaine decre proclamed many ſore aſtonied eſpecially high duch engliſh marchants occupy traffick marchandiſe themperors townes country eſpecially andwarpe great nōbre wherfore wer mind yt vnles decre wer mitigated thei wold remoue another place yea mani thē ſhutting vp ſhops purpoſed depart thauoyding ye dāger senate andwarp alſo thother citezens ther ſaw wōderful loſſe wold thē wer great perplexity andwarp aſtonied emperor proclamatiō whē thinquiſitors came thither wtſtode thē withal theyr indeuor riding lady regēt declare vnto loſſe ſhuld thē alſo whole region decre take place wherfore matter ſame city ye decre chiefly made reaſō ſōdry natiōs people appeſed yt time decre trāſlated highe duch tōg matthie flacie whō mētiō made ye former boke ſetteth forth moſt ſharply tāteth iſelebie adiaphoriſtes termeth thē aſſay perſwade people though religiō wer impugned form inquiſition cal inſtructiō conteineth moſt ample authority lawfull cal thē al priuate perſons magiſtrates thē ſelues alſo compel oth anſwere interrogatory vtter know queſtions cō cerning religion nombre xxxviii wherin ſuch ar preſented ſuſpected examined amōgs others whether beleue ſacrifice maſſe auailable dead ſo yt may deliuered hereby pain purgatory whether beleue yt peter prince thapoſtles uicar chriſt high biſhop church rome yt thoſe alſo accōpted lawfully ſuccede chaire whether beleue lawful forſake thobedience high biſhop nether heriticke sciſmatick whether beleue matrimony priuely cōtracted lawful whether beleue lutheran buceranes ſuche others churche cardinal fraunce remaind rome certain ſpace iuly elected death cardinall lorayne return home howbeit way whē come fraunce ſene kinge died ihon cardinall lorayne bene life time moſt pleaſaunt geſt companion king fraunces occaſion robert lenoncourt cardinall obtained biſhopprycke mentz afterward ſuppoſed haue holpen greatly towne metz city thempire came hand hēry french king hereafter ſhalbe declared laſt ſeſſion trent decreed amōgs thing ſuch mo biſhopprickes one ſhould kepe liſt forgoe reſt xix boke ſpecified neuertheles ſo long paul liued thing put executiō whē mā made biſhop cardinal fraūce obeyed dede aparence loſſe theyrs wheras diuers thē ii iii biſhoppricks many others aſpired yt dignity exchāge made permitted ſome inioye one ſteade one biſhoppricke left many abbotſhips ſuch like promoitōs month iuly adolphe biſhop colon making compoſition senate entreth archbyſhop collon entreth city pompe city colon exceading great pomp train hauing gotten together client kinred alies yt might honor theyr preſence ſame day accompanied report ii horſe aboue duke cleue verely brought notable bād horſmē lately daughter born wife mary daughter king ferdinando godmother fount ſtone emperor ſiſters elenore french quene mary quene hongary tharchbiſhop colon godfather long ther aroſe great diſſention betwene duke archbiſhop theccleſiaſticall iuriſdiction xxvi day iuly emperor beginneth counſel imperial auſpurge wherin propoundeth followynge generall counſel obſeruing decre religion lately made auſpurge puniſhinge rebelles reſtoryng iuriſdiction goodes church aſſēbly armed alſo albeit yt ſtate thing ſōwhat quiet prince mentz treuers preſente reaſt thelectours ſent ambaſſadours moreouer preſente wuolfgāge maſter pruſſe biſhop wirciburge eiſtet coſtintz auſpurge trent cambray merſeburge none thother prince beſides duke bauier length alſo hē ry duke brūſwick matter debated moſt part proteſtation moris agaīſt counſell content yt counſel ſhould followed duke moris deputy declareth yt allow ſame none otherwiſe vnleſſe whole matter beginninge may retracted deuines proteſtants heard yt may alſo haue power decide matter yt biſhop rome ſubmit ſelf counſel occupy place iudge releaſe biſhops othe thintēt may ſpeke mind frely proteſtation red opēly deputy wold haue recorded manner cuſtom ſame denied ye whole ſuch matter power tharch biſhop mentz chauncelour thempire themperor afterward moued biſhop counſel ſeuenth day auguſt cardinall auſpurge sermonne inueighed ſoore againſte knauery spanyardes lutheranes dayes certain spanyardes mockery contempt citezens hearing ye goſpell preached plaied certain partes church ſuch ſort yt matter like haue tourned ſome great tumult comming conſull thing goodly meane appeaſed quieted thend month auguſt granuellan death granuellan came lately bezonſe towne high burgundie auſpurge leaueth life withoute themperoures greate heauines reported ſucceded marcurine caſtinarie cardinal ſhewed vii boke ſpace xx yeares ben chief authority priuy manner alone themperours ſecreat counſels working whoſe place function ſucceded ſonne anthony biſhop arras man great learning thabſēce father wōt anſwer matter ye common welth familier themperor mene ſeaſō henry duke brunſwick laieth duke henry beſiegeth citye brunſwick ſiege ye city brunſwick born great hatred theſe many yeres religiō thing whan theyr coūtry much harm firing ſpoiling yet could win city mediatiō certen themperor cōmādeth partes leue theyr war pleade theyr cauſe thys month septembre emperours army beſieged affrick towne barbarie ſome men ſuppoſe leptis howbeit liuie maketh alſo mentiō ye city affricanes city kept dracutus notable archpirate lately ioyned hī dracutus archpirate ſelf turke themperor cōmitted chiefe gouernenient uiceroy sicilie beaten town wyth ordenaunce certain time certified dragutus comming newe army ſaw nede make haſte wherfore tenth day septembre geueth aſſault bothe ſea land within fewe houres ſpace taketh force knightes rhodes vpon ſea themperor day good ſeruice spaniard fought lād taking city africa excelled nombre whan city taken mooſte part ſpoyle nombre pryſoners great aboute viii thouſand put shippes led awaye captiue sicilie sardinie place ſituation city ſaid pleaſant reaſon grene medowes goodlye ſituatiō ſame hilles ſet oliues palme tree fair ſpringes water far thence reported goodlye corne country moſt ample increſe yeldeth plowmē hath receiued coſmus duke florence ſent themperor men war vnder conduit iordane urſine alaſtor balion becauſe winter hand vitaile coulde prouided uiceroy leauing garriſon spaniard retourneth army sicilie dragutus fled turke traueling conſtantinople thing thoccaſion new warre turke attempted afterward againſte ye emperour alſo againſt king fardinando whan themperour commaunded duke henry senate
