although inſtituted whole yet olde churche alſo diſtributed vnder one kynde may declared large therfore altered firſt ye time counſell conſtaūce cuſtome laſted many age wherfore may eaſely thinke lawful priuate authoritie chaunge aboliſh lawe receiued approued generall counſelles eſpecially tyme lately peace geuen religiō next aſſemblee muſt treate reconcilement treatie doubtles wil ſeke vttermoſte power diſſention may vtterly takē away done thā wil take ſuch away may profit wealth ſoules health alſo ye intent may vnderſtand good wil clemencie towardes wil dede ſtaye reſtreine part proclamatiō cōcerneth lordes ſupper yet vnder conditiō ſectes forſaken alter nothing lawes ceremony churche tary decree aſſemble empire next cōming miniſters churche ſcholem aiſters ſo followe order alſo ſhal moleſted alſo time ſuffered man againſt right iniuried seing therfore beare good wil truſte deſire nothing furthermore muche publique neceſſitie vrgeth ſhall become conſult common wealth geue behoueth wherunto make aunſwer xii daye february ambaſſadours anſwer ferdinando cauſe moſte weightie whiche conteineth perpetuall felicitie eſpecially apperteineth ſaluation child obteyne nothing thei ſhe moſte hartely ſory ſay moſte mightie kyng ſay wonted diſtributing lordes ſupper oulde tyme receiued churche ſame may aboundantly cōfuted holy ſcripture alſo errour detected haue perſwaded highnes herein ſay meaning late decree made auſpurg people ſhould applie ſelues religion prince uerely much fewe yeares paſte longe decree haue common conſent exhibited highnes ſupplications concerninge religion lawfull v alſo caſe would dwel ſame aunſwer ſell good flitte wyues child ſome place diſcōmoditie herein agayne heuie ſorowfull newes would people ſeeth verely ſhal heare whiche cuſtome elder haue bene euer ready ſpende bloud lyfe preſeruation dignitie houſe auſtriche muſt nowe forſake moſte ſwete natiue countrie ſo many yeares inhabited inriched fore father therfore admit ratifie ſame aunſwer behalf haue done oft heretofore honour god beſeche woulde permitte v haue incōparable treaſure god worde ſuffer v haue let matter condition cauſe ſuche whole blame ſhould aſcribed doubtles could cōtent lyke thinges ſo caſe alſo obey willingly ſince euery man muſt render accompt owne dedes ſince difference perſones god bycauſe ende lyfe euery moment hande neither thing vncerten life earneſt ſuite labour requyre thinge wherfore beſeche may haue ſufficient warrauntiſe herein hereunto kyng fourth daye ſuppoſe ſayeth anſwer king ferdinando iuſt cauſe wherfore ſhould ſatiſfied fourmer anſwer permit apoſtels haue ſet forth martirs father approued churche haue taught expounded ſcripture nowe taught alſo pray require herein ſince god hath promyſed churche holy ghoſte ſaluation ſought el ſaye defiled ſecte whiche ſorte many adayes anabaptiſtes sacramentaries zwinglians schnemfeldians ſuch lyke dede well doctrine ſet libertie included within certen limites ſayde howe long ſuppoſe wil continue pure euery man hym ſelfe wyll bragge goddes woorde ſaye ſubiect creature god alone admitte iudgement man ſee happen many place ful trouble whyleſt euery mā doeth ſtifly mainteine owne opinion authoritie churche vtterly contemned much fourmer wryting recite laſte decree empire ſomewhat otherwyſe apperteineth therfore haue declared taken would haue go dwell el againe take frō carefulnes haue ſuppreſſed ye parte proclamation touching lordes ſupper promyſing hereafter diligence reconcilement may cauſes reuolte lawes ceremony churche haue ſhewed chriſt ſayeth church muſt heard alſo thing ſelfe teacheth fourmer age whiche renewyng nothing abode religion forefather haue bene muche quiet fortunate thinges nowe thinges tourmoyled ſectes diſſentions many men rauiſhed toſte hither thither euery wynde doctrine wherby would rather haue thought would haue anſwered ſorte nowe albeit aunſwere may throughly confuted yet much muſt treate contribution ſubſidies therof ſhortly determine vnleſſe determined ſuffer extreme miſerie wyll ouer longe truſting alſo wyl doe matter ſelfe alſo conſideration dutie requyreth agayne ſolicite ſame thing ſaye howe leaue caſe obteyne nothinge ſaye wyll cauſe ſame conſultation geuing ayde wyl ſurely hindered letted haue commiſſion promyſe thing herein vnleſſe haue firſt good aſſuraunce religion miniſters churche scholemaiſters may authoriſed teache frely moneth february henry duke brunſwick taketh wyfe ſiſter sigiſmunde king poole duke hēry brūſwick marieth wyfe byſhop treuers dieth fredericke counte palatine dieth tyme dieth iohn iſemburg byſhop treuers hath iohn ley ſucceſſour xxvi daye alſo ſame moneth departeth alzeme fredericke pauſgraue prince electour man great yeares whome otto henrick brother ſonne ſuccedeth lōg ſince receiued doctrine goſpell daunger therfore haue loſt al poſſeſſions taking othe people commaundeth man within dominion ſhould ſay maſſe vſe ceremony trouble oſiander ſtyred vp pruſſe brought newe doctrine iuſtificatiō ſpoken xxii boke moſte part learned men reprehended opinion albert duke pruſſe open wryting profeſſeth duke pruſe profeſſeth cō feſſion auſpurge wyll followe doctrine confeſſion auſpurg commaundeth therfore miniſters churche teache according ſame promyſeth ſaue harmeles caſe obeye ende matter might throughly appeaſed iohn albert duke megelburge ſonne lawe duke pruſe prince excellently learned going thither hauing learned men hym brought iohn funccius chief ſecte oſiander poinct acknowledged errour affirmed would confeſſe openly would hereafter teache confeſſion auſpurg others would ſame agreed diuines ſtate churche appeaſed fourth daye marche began ſhine blaſing ſtarre ſene ſpace twelue dayes moneth camete ſene ambaſſadours prince city mete regēſpurge treate cauſe marque albert brandenburge aduerſaries counſell laſt yeare againe required ayde prince againſt mediatiō frendes matter ſhould heard interceſſours therfore moneth february yere came fraūce germany matter heard cauſes thempire differred till moneth aprill archebiſhop cantorbury already condēned tharchebyſhop cantorbu burnt religion death ryddley latimer retourned priſon ſaid ye xxi moneth burnt oxforde certen day put ſome hope life perſwaſion certen reuoked diuerſe article doctrine neither ſhewed conſtancie ſawe muſt die made oration people ſpeaking many thinges amendement life maners ende might haue audience attētiue lēgth ſheweth greuouſly offended god denying truthe reciting chief article doctrine declareth briefly thought confirmeth papiſtrie kingdome antichriſte ſo ner ſaid ſo thence without moſte bitter railyng wordes place execution came thither ſtretching forth right hand hād ſaith hath wickedly offended ſubſcribing ye wicked opinion ennemies truthe propounded wherfore ſhall firſt ſuffer puniſhment thus tied ye ſtake ſo ſone fire began burne ſtretched forth hande far coulde reache might firſt fele torment ſo burnt primate englande man greateſt learning authoritie time popiſhe marke taken call degrading whiche wont done many cerimonies put vpon moſt vile garmēt ſo brought forth amonges people laughed many hauing cōpaſſion vnworthy chaūce could kepe thē frō ſheding teares although thei doubted nothing ſhould flitte miſerable lyfe heauenly countrie life euerlaſting promotion got cardinall poole made archebyſhop maſſed bauarians ſollicite prince forreligiō like auſtriche ſo alſo bauariās ſollicited albert duke cōcerning religiō maner ye ſame time duke ſeing kyng ferdinando father lawe permitted ſome thing ſubiectes alſo exacted mony graunted ſome thing time might receiue lordes ſupper whole day prohibited neceſſitie requireth eate fleſh howbeit proſeſſeth many wordes wyll departe religion aunceſters alter thing ceremony ſuch thinges ſame lawfull doe without conſent ſupreme magiſtrate ſpirituall temporall permitteth theſe two tyme tyll ſome thing eſtabliſhed publique authoritie reconcilement made wyll proclamation fourmer tyme concerning religion exactely ſtryghtly kept theſe two thinges excepted wyll procure alſo muche lieth metropolitane byſhops ſhall confirme graunte ſhall cauſe ſeke moleſte man proclamation written daye kalendes aprill metropolitan whome ſpeaketh archebyſhop saliſburg time certen noble men tranſiluania reuolte kinge ferdinand ferdinando alſo prorogeth counſel empire time vncerten leuieth army whiche ſendeth downe riuer danubius hōgary town alſatia called obereyne thre leages straſburg certen citezen towne labourer vine penury want wyfe abſent tenth daye aprill ſleeth father killeth thre child thre child daughter ſeuē yeares ſonne foure yeares olde ſucking babe cradell fully halfe yeare olde tyme brute reporte went ſecret conſpiracie pope adherentes againſt proteſtauntes increaſed opinion doubte pope toke moſte diſpleaſauntly decre pope toke diſpleaſauntly peace geuen religion laſt yeare made auſpurge wherby peace libertie graunted religiō thought alſo ſollicited emperour make fruſtrate ſawe many reuolted daily kingdome vnderſtande auſtriche bauarians went moreouer archebyſhops mentz treuers collon occaſion bathe met tyme together whiche thought done without cauſe king ferdinando breaking vp aſſemblees auſtriche goeth boheme calling country kyng ferd goeth boheme prage againſt iminent daunger demaundeth mony hath graunted ſending letter whiche bene certen monethes regenſpurg excuſeth abſence bicauſe muſt retourne uienna appointeth aſſemblee empire firſt iune departure king ferdinando lantgraue came meiſſen certen tyme auguſte duke saxony tenth duke areſcot brake pryſon day may duke areſcot priſoner caſtel uincent far paris eſcaped came home ſafe cardinall auſpurge taried whole yeare rome lately retourned frō thence heard ſiniſtrally many euill men ſpake thought though ſhould practiſe pope priuie perniciouſe counſelles germany pourgeth open wryting ſet forth vulgar tongue thende may laſt yeare ſayth death iulius third went rome dutie preſent cardinall auſpurg pourgeth himſelf wryting election ruleth pourpoſed doubtles haue retourned home germany expedition deteined pope went reformation churche choſing certen excellent men nation ſame purpoſe choſe alſo although vnmete ſo weightie matter bycauſe germane nomber charge byſhoprike required preſence aſkyng leaue byſhop day ides aprill retourned home neuertheleſſe although haue ſo vſed ſelf alwayes alſo came kynde lyfe whiche wold ſhould ſpoken without boaſting ſhamefull matter truly obiected although haue bene oft coū ſellour authour peace without great loſſe hinderaunce although welth dignitie countrie hath bene alwayes dere yet ſo ſone came againe germany heard great mē worthy credit frendes myne abſence certen wrytynges caſte abroade whiche ſounded diſhonour though ſhould rome ye pope alſo euery italy ſecret diuiſes practiſe germany namely league fellowes confeſſion auſpurg ſhuld againe vexed moſte greuous warre ſame wrytinges alledged cauſe enterpriſe ſiniſire ſuſpicious ſpred card auſpurg fecret working pope greatly miſlike decre made laſt yeare auſpurg cōcerning religion ſo much perſwaded emperour woulde aboliſhe ſame diſpenſed faith promeſſe herein promyſed ayde power could make ſubdue germany ſo themperour againe would fayle hym recouering eccleſiaſticall iuriſdiction germany therfore made truce betwixt emperour frenche kynge bothe army might conuerted vſe thei added moreouer written ſame libelle foreyne soldiours ſhould leuied germaynes thing might better hidde moreouer kyng england wold hire eight thouſande horſemen gouernour whole warre mounſters ſhoulde take ſondry place briefly whole matter ſhoulde handled ſo circumſpectly theſe power ſhould ſet forwarde together one tyme ſhould inuade proteſtauntes vppon ſoden many ſhall home counſel regenſpurge furthermore pope kyng englande ſending ambaſſadours certen prynces germany doe promyſe largely pope dede prepareth greate army horſemen fotemen ſende ayde furthermore ſhould ſclaunder otto henrick paulſgraue chriſtopher duke wirtemberge albert marque brandenburge heretickes ſeditiouſe worthie driuen countrie ſhould hyghly commende lantgraue senate cardinalles forſaken religion titell man one miniſters churche reuoked doctrine rome worde wryting muche ſclaunder toucheth pourgation yt cardinall auſpurg againſt ſuſpicious certen pope emperour hurteth alſo name eſtimation bycauſe part honeſt man defende owne alſo honour innocencie magiſtrate muſt nedes aunſwere ſame begynne ſurely greuous paynefull heare yet remayning founde whiche contrary auncient vertue germany faythe conſtancie doe geue myndes ſuche ſclaundering applie ſelues moſte wicked libelles lewde talke myght ſtyre vp prynces empyre againſt hyghe magiſtrate ſet prynces together eares wycked warre cruel troubleſome full perill ſclaunder diuiſed xxviii yeares paſt ſuppoſe full many doe remember ſclaunder deuiſed againſt certi prince kyng ferdinando byſhoppes mentz saliſburg bamberge wirſeburge prynce electour brandenburge lewys william brother duke bauier george duke saxony ſayd haue conſpired againſt iohn duke electour saxony lantgraue matter brought poinct al thinges tended moſte cruell ciuile warre doubtles prince ought ſet eye remember ſame tyme bothe wyckednes deuiſer detected euery prynce parte denied thing open wryting ſclaunderer afterwarde loſte head deſerued whiche truſte ſhall nowe come paſſe alſo euen god beyng reuenger authours ſo wycked deuiſe may diſcloſed parte praye god ſende better mynde confounde theyr counſelles redounde diſtruction countrie ſeinge thys lyke ſclaunder furmer may eaſely perceiued authours haue forged ſelfe ſame mynde dyd imitation hym haue attempted intente verely myght nowe bringe paſſe thynge whiche coulde finiſhe muche intente sclaunderer myght perſwade pope emperoure woulde force armes breake decree made peace religion kyng englande byſhoppes germany would alſo ayde herein proteſte wyckedly forged inuented intent verely men myndes beyng exaſperated diſpleaſures increaſed place myght ſwymme full ciuyle bloud although doe doubte emperoure prince iniurie ſeditiouſe famouſe libelle apperteineth wyll ſelues defende theyr cauſe yet duty ſake omitte muſt alſo pourge highe magiſtrate unfaynedly tyme remained rome preſence knowledge ther one worde ſpoken rome ſame peace religion falſely therfore aſcribed pope though ſhould applie hys counſell force violence though went perſwade hereunto emperoure kynges falſely ſaye imputed neither proued ſeing ſo like wyſe falſe wrytten emperour ſince cōference treatie betwene matter howe coulde pope conference yt emperour againſt religion libertie germany determine vpon warre make compacte betwene recoueryng eccleſiaſticall iuriſdiction ſubduinge germany defamer ſayth truce made betwyxt emperour frenche kyng intent ſoldiours either diſcharged might led warre cauſe truce copie ſame declareth againe thoſe ſoldiours reteined prynce ſo many kyng ferdinando commaunded taken vp ſent thē hongary againſt turke thoſe alſo excepted whome auſpurge norinberge byſhoppes bamberge wirtemberge hired leaſt haply ſhould oppreſſed vpon ſoden part therfore deuyſe falleth touchyng pope emperour byſhoppes nowe concerning ſelfe haue verely hitherto followed olde trewe catholique religion becommeth cardinall anſpurg addict olde religion germayne borne treade footeſteppes elder perſeuer ſame communion churche brought vp alſo laſt counſel imperiall declared letter counſellours mynde pourpoſe god grace perſeuer neither mynded doe thynge may ſtriue honeſtie conſideration dutie yet neuertheleſſe couet peace men ſayde haue ſecret conference pope emperour kyng englande state empire certen priuate men framyng war agayne ſame paulſgraue duke wirtemberge marque brandenburge moſte falſe neyther proued man yea bringe vp ſuche tale whether done woorde wrytinge ſaye ſclaunderers ennemies common countrie touching counte palatine thus ſtandeth matter maner dignitie vocation requyreth ſhould maynteyne ryght byſhoprike kepe people committed charge olde catholique religion beynge aduertyſed otto henry prince electour went aboute make certen townes byſhopryke religion placed preacher toke doubtles euyll parte cauſe ſhould defende lawes therfore counſellours abſence howbeit yet commaundement brought matter chāber imperiall matter dependeth yet ſo otherwyſe ſo much worde neuer hurte name eſtimation muche leſſe haue attempted thyng againſt countrie coulde doe thyng might tourne commoditie hym ſelfe countrie people would omitte nothing ſuppoſe people coūtrie beare witnes thing knowe haue done tymes paſte great aduerſitie moreouer haue euermore loued houſe palatine readye gratifie ſoeuer meanes myght ſame wil neuer whit chaū ged ſemblable wyſe affected towardes chriſtopher duke wirtemberge good man wyſe ſkylfull louer peacei haue euer ſynce tyme fyrſt acquaynted good cardinall anſpurg towardes duke wirtemberg borne hym great good haue ſtudied alſo perfourme ſame dede eyther paulſgraue ſhould dryuen theyr countrie ſame came neuer mynde alſo caſe knowen ſuche matter myght haue tended loſſe eſtimation goodes would haue bene ryght hartely ſory ſame woulde haue letted alſo vttermoſte power ſuche thinge ſhould haue chaunced hitherto dede haue ſo demeaned ſelfe alwayes ſuppoſe haue founde nothyng ſo ſhal alſo vſe ſelfe henceforth ſhall geue occaſion ſo thynke vpon hope verely muche haue geuen cauſe offended wyll beare lyke good wyll howe muche lamented chaunce marque albert ignoraunt hym ſelfe haue aſſayed haue proued diſcorde myght bee taken awaye quietnes reſtored empire doubtles trauell thyng hath bene ſo muche induſtrie ſo great although regarded herein common wealth yet came ſuſpition many tendered commodity ouermuche ſought hynder others howe vpryghtly handled matter letter wrytten hym ſhewe seyng therfore mynde towardes thē neyther duty wantyng truſte vertue true nobilitie wyll ſooner geue credit ſo muche ſaying doyng whiche manifeſtly appereth ſheweth ſelfe theſe ſediciouſe perſones certen bellouſe ſeke reyſe vp flame intier loue alſo good abſent imbraced al germaines remembraunce moſte ſwete countrie loue yt cardinall auſpurge towardes yt germaines ambaſſadours many prince many alſo nobilitie declare whiche rome mentz treuers collon saxon brandenburg maydenburge bauarians brunſwicke paſſawe oſenburg minden baſill theſe repared certen hauen faythfully holpen affayres certen alſo labour commendation haue aſcheued office great promotion ſame lantgraue one titelman fonde diuiſe neyther euer talke lantgraue ſonnes matter neyther remember ſpake one worde either rome italy much leſſe tell miniſters dominion teache reuoke dede able ſaye knowledge ſuche recantation made rome therfore doubte lantgraue matter ſhall ſo requyre wyll eaſely confute ſame alſo commendation conſidering therfore artificer ſo perniciouſe libelles haue ſhamefully forged thynges ende ſame fyre whiche many yeares ſince layde together myght nowe length burne breake one nedefull prince magiſtrates take dilligent hede laſte ſhall detected ſet ſuche example may make others afrayde finally caſe haue conceaued euyll opinion reaſon theſe ſclaunders earneſtly praye laye awaye thynke aſſuredly ſynce bothe germayne borne come noble houſe wyll doe nothinge vnworthy vertue nobilitie aunceſters publiſhed wrytinge fifte kalendes iune ſayde wrote alſo priuatly diuerſe prince ſame effecte went againe italy tyme bona mother sigiſmunde kyng poole retourned home goyng naples meane ſeaſon commotiōs england many commotiōs england ſuſpicion conſpiracie gentle men ſuſpicion conſpiracie ſayde caſt priſon wherof ſome executed ſome fled fraunce amonges sir androwe dudley brother duke northumberland two alſo taken lady elizabeth houſe ides may sir peter sir peter carrowe syr iohn cheke takē priſoners carrowe inſurrectiō fled certen monethes reconciled king philip sir iohn cheke whiche king edwardes ſcholemaiſter retourning germany brabant fetche wyfe going bruſſelles andwarpe cōmaundement king philip apprehendetd caried london aboute ende iune far london xiii burnt together xiii burnt stretford bewe marq baben receiueth goſpell one ſtake religion meane tyme charles marque baden receiueth doctrine goſpel neighbour borroweth miniſters refourme order church alſo senate spire taken preacher two goſpell maximilian eldeſt ſonne king ferdinando wife emperours daughter departing frō uienne xvii day iuly came bruſſelles bene long much deſirous take iourney peter martyr florentine whome haue ſpoken tyme diſſention lordes ſupper kindled againe certen bokes touched name wēt straſburg zurick might handle matter frely teaching writing time conrade pellicane died zurick peter martyr goeth zurick therfore senate requeſted miniſters churche wryting letter senate straſburg praye earneſtly might ſent departeth third ides iuly without ſighing grief many whiche loued incomparable learning moſte exacte iudgement great gentlenes modeſtie vertues ſame time archebyſhop piſe cardinall borne sicilie paſſing baſil went themperour bruſſelles cardinalles ſent yt pope emper frenche kyng ſent frō pope litle cardinal caraffa pope coſin come kyng fraunce reporte bene written moſte heinous diſpleaſure betwixt pope themperour ye matter tended vtterly war amonges thinges pope taken houſe columnois al poſſeſſions italy whiche thing dede ſemed apperteine iniury ye emperour ſaid would inueſte kyng philip ſonne poſſeſſion sicilie naples propounding ouer hard condicions thoſe kingdomes paye tribute byſhop rome depende vpon benefite ides iuly albert duke bauier name king ferdinando beginneth counſel regenſburg declareth counſell begon regenſpurg occupied holding aſſemblees auſtriche boheme ſo could come hither hym ſelfe time appointed ſheweth preſent yet neither meanes peter petrouice ye kynges cliente deſired ayde turke coūtrie tranſyluania neceſſitie vrged iuſt cauſe reuolted king ſonne iohn uayuode fraunces beuecke george ſonne making rebellion hongary haue helpe aide walachiās taken certen townes caſtels againe turke hath lately ſent gouernour offen alſo time treated truce beſeged towne caſtell buda latin zegeſte xi day iune began batter ſore moreouer ſignified letter meſſages many gouernour boſnia leuieth exceading great army inuade slauonia alſo preſident grene gathereth ſmall power citie sophie intending marche forward emperour turkes ſelfe wyll harueſt next come hongary wynter defer next ſpring wil come ſtrong army wyn uienne ſege theſe cauſes therfore ye kyng time leaue country wholy buſied occupied making preparation reſiſte much profit cōmon wealth differ coū ſel lōger therfore hath appointed begin treaty procede till may come ſelfe dede thre yeares ſince king ſent noble ambaſſade turke peace truce yet deteined cōſtantinople albeit truce taken betwene thē till thambaſſadours retourned home yet turkes meane ſeaſon hauing broken faith haue takē many townes caſtels vpō frontier ſeing alſo zegeſt beſeged appereth peace dede loked handes firme tollerable whiche thing ſeing ſo muche great daunger hangeth ouer remnaunt hongary auſtriche alſo ouer germany firſt nede conſulte imediatly ſending ayde cō tribution mony ſhould kept certen place warre nede defrayed publique treaſurers kynges prince alſo ſollicited kyng ayde neither wyl ſelfe ſpare coſte perill either ſelfe ſonnes alſo ſince country ſore inpoueriſhed warres ſo many yeares able reſiſte ſo great ennemy requiſite contribute thereunto ſpedely moreouer much laſt aſſemblee decreed alſo aſſemblee wayes ſhould ſought appeaſe religion kyng erneſtly exhorteth would ſearche diligently whether reconcilement myght made whiche waye muſte alſo treate mony eſtablyſhyng peace empire conſultation turkiſhe warre ſet behinde chiefly conſidered ende preſent iminent calamitie may repulſed xv day september emperour hauing empe goeth spain ſiſters fayre wynde nauie readines taketh ſhipping ſayle ſpayne taketh ſiſters quene mary elenor companion iourney departed ſet kyng philip ſonne poſſeſſion lowe country brother kyng ferdinando committed common wealth germany ſending letter electours empyre wherby requireth would acknowledge ſame emperour romaine obey accordingly laſt day october iohn sleidane authour worke man iohn sleydane dieth ſingular giftes mynde excellent learnynge prayſe worthy departeth life straſburg honorably buried finis ✚ apologie iohn sleidane muche heare diuerſe men ſpeake nothing frendly hiſtory haue ſmall thanke requited exceading great paine conſtreined ſet forth wryting defence nowe cauſes moued write ſtory proceded yt ſame howe wrote diſpleaſure fauour man couched thinges order declared preface worke added moreouer deſirous truthe therin ſo affected knewe thing wrytten vntruely would ſcrape admoniſhe reader myne owne accorde geue credit doubtles would haue thought men would haue bene ſatiſfied eſpecially ſince reading ſhould proue true ſaid muche reported far otherwyſe whiche lothſome greuous driuen neceſſitie adde ſome thinges preface firſt dede euer ſince beginning worlde hath bene accuſtomed matter wel eccleſiaſticall ciuile ſhould cōmitted wryting thing dede bookes teſtifie ſame cuſtome hath alwayes floriſhed chiefly amonges noble free nation eſpecially grekes romaine chief precept ornament kinde wryting right trewe therfore tully calleth hiſtory witnes tymes light veritie lyfe memory maiſtres lyfe whiche wordes verely doth commende exceadingly alſo ſheweth ſort ought nowe muche tyme hath chaunced ſo great alteration religion ſince tyme apoſtles like hath bene ſmal ſturre ciuile policie hath inſued alſo vpon ſame cō monly wont verely although meteſt man al requeſte certen good men toke vpon kynd wrytinge ſetting forth god glory great fidelitie diligence haue brought tyme haue herein geuen nothing affectiōs haue vſed ſelfe ſo moderatly argument peraduēture none hath done ſame truſte • l indifferent iudges wil confeſſe although gladly prufeſſe doctrine goſpel benefite god reſtored reioyce exceadingly nomber fellowſhip yet abſteyne al bitternes wordes declare ſimply whole matter done god alſo take witnes myne intent hath ben falſly hurte man ſhameles impudencie thoſe thinges wherof memorie yet freſhe ſet forth thyng contrary truthe know throughly haue perceiued truſte ſuch vanitie notwithſtanding caſe haue erred pointe acknowledge willingly admoniſhed alſo ſaide preface wil proteſte openly reader abuſed concerning paynes ſuppoſe verely ſearching truthe man dilligence could haue bene myne hath bene like many able teſtifie ſo doubte thing alſo ſelfe ſhall declare deſcribing matter religion might omitte polytique cauſes ſayde came maner alwayes together eſpecially tyme could ſeparated come together ſure reaſon grounded vppon ſcripture witte ſo ſone amonges people religion chaunged arriſe offence diſſentions debate vprores faction warres euen cauſe chriſt ſaith ſonne plucked father daughter frō mother alſo doctrine bryngeth peace ſworde ſayeth ſhall ſtyre vp fyre alſo amonges nere bloud hath bene euer ſtate thinges ſince worlde made neither denied thing ſelf ſpeaketh ſo ſone time god benefite geuen mā goſpell began preached againſt pope pardon tradition men worlde began reiſe tumultes chiefly clergie upon occaſion matter brought common aſſemblee empire certen prince city receiued alſo doctrine fire went abroade matter handled diuerſe meanes tyll laſte ended warre ſame deſcription man may ſee care diligence emperour toke diſſentiō might takē vp ſene alſo proteſtan̄tes ſtates haue aunſwered maner condition haue oftentimes offered matter fel warre handling variable diuerſe emperour dede may bryng many example one ſending letter diuerſe prince city alſo ſetting forth publike wryting declared cauſe enterpriſe wrytinge wherin foundation themperours cauſe conſiſteth aunſwere contrary part might omitted praye maner ſtory thought whiche raccompteth doinges one part yet howe haue demeaned ſelfe herein howe haue moderated tempered ſtyle may ſene conferring dutche latin wherunto referre ſelfe alſo warre driuen tyll wynter emperour vpper hande ennemies gone euery man home theſe victory triumphes alſo firſte highe germany saxonie recite faithfully order kept euery neither take awaye attribute man thing ſelfe requireth permitteth whiche thing fewe men haue perfourmed euident many narration put alſo iudgement well touching perſones thinges ſpeake nothing olde wryters knowen howe platine hath deſcribed pope liues litle dayes worthye knyght sir philip commines ſet forth notable hiſtorie tyme amonges thinges ſheweth howe ye death charles duke burgundy ſlayne battell little naunce lewys xii king fraunce toke away daughter heire duke charles either burgundy alſo countrie artois albeit commynes bounde fraunce othe although one kinges counſell yet ſaieth weldone xxiiii yeares paſt senate ueniſe appointed peter bembus deſcribe warres made emperour maximilian lewys frenche kyng pope iuly ſeconde others compriſing matter xii bokes amongeſt matter reporteth howe lewys xii kynge fraunce denounced warre uenetians ſayeth howe herault armes came duke whole senate ſpake theſe wordes thee lawredane duke ueniſe citezens ſame lewys kyng fraunce commaunded denounce warre mē vnfaithfull poſſeſſing townes byſhoppes rome kynges gotten force wronge ſekyng catche bryng al thinges al men diſceiptfully vnder gouernement ſelfe cometh armed recouer ſame theſe wordes would ſome man ſaye much heinouſe againſt uenetians bembus ſhoulde haue omitted would ſo wrote cōmon recordes boke added aunſwer made herault leſſe byting workes printed ueniſe priuilege senate paulus iouius beſides wrytinges wherin compriſeth force certen noble mē hath lōg ſince ſet forth alſo two tome thinges done tyme howe frankely wryteth thoſe haue red teſtifie withſtanding certen place doth germanes wrong yet ſame worke came forth authoriſed ſondry priuileges ſo wyll may ſeke ninth leafe ſeconde tome alſo life leo x leafe xciii xciiii lyfe alphonſe duke farrare leafe xlii bokes good authours full example comines cauſe chiefly commended wrote ſo indifferently kepeth maner ſayde alſo diſcribeth thinges alſo addeth iudgement pronounceth euery man hath done right wrong albeit ſo yet vſed many whatſoeuer done either part ſhould recited ſame reaſonable frequented time nedefull alſo otherwyſe hiſtory compiled ſo euer faction war ſedition doubtles al thinges full complaintes accuſations defenſions cōtrary wrytings reciteth theſe thinges ſuche order done doeth iniurie neither part followeth ye lawe ſtory thoſe brawlinges complaintes euery thing true one obiecteth grudge hatred malice amonges knowē tried howe matter vſed either ſyde euill wordes pope byſhops ſuche lyke haue powred againſt proteſtauntes xxxvi yeares paſt true thinge could imagined wicked paule thirde pope ſent nephewe ſonne cardinall farneſe ambaſſadour emperour bruſſels yeare lorde mcccccxl gaue counſell againſt proteſtauntes whiche long ſet forth printe recited xiii boke hiſtory many contumeliouſe wordes amonges ſayth proteſtauntes reſiſte chriſt leſſe rather thā turkes theſe ſleye body leade ſoules alſo euerlaſting pardition pray heynouſe horrible thing ſpoken caſe theſe thinges ſhuld haue bene recited might proteſtauntes haue hed iuſt cauſe complaint againſt matter farre otherwiſe neither thinges true becauſe ſaid ſo ſhould haue omitted might iuſtly haue commen ſuſpition though handled matter vprightly would gratify one part thus haue plainly declared doubt reaſonable men iudge haue done nothing contrary law hiſtory ſo much rather moſte thinges taken common recordes ben ſetforth print therfore nothinge frendly plaine wronge thus ſclaunder worcke ſo much wronge vnderſtand thorder compiling hiſtory knowe would ſhould learne ſuch thinges haue nowe declared others wryte ſtories ſpeake hiſtoriographers meane thoſe time ſtudy extoll highly commend part liſt ouerwhelme thother contumelious railynge wordes ſuch ſort worthy ſo calleth doctrine renewed germany turkiſhe ſeede ſuche lyke wordes al theyr bokes full like thing found woorke haue verely wrytten wonderfull benefite god geuen eo thys time orderly truely could poſſible ſame purpoſe gathered xvi yeares ſince ſoeuer belonged herunto neither haue wrytten raſhlye ſure iudgemente proceaded labour paine worke hath coſt nexte liuing god know glory haue chiefly regarded leauing practiſe law haue applied maner ſtudy herevnto verely muſt confeſſe throughe god motion haue ben ſort drawen vnto labour nowe diuers requite ſo vnworthye thanckes ſo greate trauell paine wil cōmit whoſe cauſe chiefly toke hād know vndoubtedly yt haue offred vp vnto moſt acceptable ſacrifice ſame verely good conſcience comfort ſuſtain ſelf eſpecially ſeing labor commended
